text:
Booked our hotel way last minute
Total came out to be 140$ for two nights Killer deal!!! If you split the cost with 4 girls I feel like it's an awesome deal
Plus they have an after hour club inside the hotel that doesn't close till 12:00 noon! Definitely coming back!!!

We only stayed a couple days for the weekend in one of the suites. The lady who checked us in was very nice and accommodating. It was really nice I loved the giant tub in the bathroom area. Although we did ask for a view and was told we'd get one, but actually did not, it's ok no big deal. The walls were very thick and quite sound proof which I loved, other than the sound of music we could hear faintly from the strip, we rather enjoyed it. 

The bell hops and valet are also super nice here, unlike most hotels. The only disappointment was that valet costed $18 per night. Most hotels only charge once for the whole stay, but again, not a big deal. 

One thing that was pretty annoying is the morning of our check out, some girl opened our door without warning and stuck her head in our room. She said she was doing a "room check" which was pretty inappropriate, because we could have been naked when she did so. Especially since it was only 8am and obviously not check out time yet, she really had no business sticking her head in our room.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. I DO NOT recommend this hotel at all. I absolutely hated this place. 

The only positive about this hotel is the location. It's conveniently located right in the center of the strip, making most of the other hotels within a comfortable walking distance.  Other than that, Ballys fucking sucks. 

The customer service here was terrible. My party arrived early, was told the suites were not ready, so we can pay the fee, or come back anytime after 3pm, and we'll be set. 
That is not what happened. We came back about a quarter to 5, and Ballys gave our suite away!!! The manager had to figure out where to put us, because the newer tower was overbooked. Finally we get placed into two FILTHY rooms. God forbid, if you have asthma, are allergic to dust, or dust mite, walking into those rooms. They looked like they weren't cleaned for the last decade. One of the rooms had mold on the carpet. Wtf!? 

We expressed our dissatisfaction with the situation, and then was placed in another FILTHY room. This one now reeking of smoke. The hotel was booked until the morning, so the party had to endure it. However, the manager allowed us to change rooms again. This time on two separate floors. The knee slapper about that, one of the two rooms wasn't ready, and it became the first situation all over again. We left for the day, and came back with our room given away. After 2 days of dealing with this nonsense, everything finally got settled. 

Seriously speaking, this hotel needs to get it together. It's too dated, the casino included to have such shitty customer service. 

However, after this experience, a lesson was learned. Never ever ever again. Save yourself the headache, and book elsewhere!

We really enjoyed the poker room here which unlike several casinos has an "all day" poker room. The rest of the hotel could stand for a bit of a makeover, but since it is attached to Paris and a stop on the Monorail, it gets a lot of traffic. 

The other table games were tough, but I did end up winning a few dollars over all. The food court area and shops are less than desirable, but considering some of the other dumps we strolled through, we were happy to spend time here.

Location is great.
Staff was great and upgraded us.
Price was alright.
Resort fees are ridiculous considering no pool in the winter and problems with Internet.

Affordable. Centrally Located. Lots of Options.

If you are a Harrah's property loyalist like me, you know that Bally's is definitely not on the high end of the company's charts, that is not to say, however, that Bally's is a dump.

I had a quick weekend in town last month and wanted to be central to all of the properties, and figured I would give Bally's a try. 

Once I sprinted out of the airport Friday night in hopes of beating the cab-line rush, I had little wait and began the short ride to the strip. While I am not usually a huge fan of arriving late at night, it was nice to have no one in front of me at the check-in desk. The whole process of checking-in took maybe 5 minutes, and I was on my way to luck!

The room was an upgraded room in the south tower, so a bit bigger than the standard, but nothing crazy impressive. 

My stay was problem-free, with my only complaint being the cost of wifi ($13.95 per day), but that is not a Bally's specific issue...

The food on property was good, especially with Paris being connected. I strongly recommend getting the Buffet of Buffets if you go, it is 7 buffets across Harrah's properties for $44.. for 24 hours of unlimited access. My belt is reminding me that I definitely got my money's worth right now, actually...

I would stay again if I was looking in a cheaper price range.

Room 1610 Indigo tower.  Air was either 60' or hell hot.  Had to jiggle toilet handle to stop running.  Room service tray in hall at check in at 2pm.  Next afternoon, TWO room service trays-why wasn't first one removed when second was delivered?  Had to ask for the beverage supervisor to get drink service, this ticked off the server who avoided us after the first drink even tho we tipped.  Moved to a different section where we has EXCELLENT service (thanks, Allie).  Wednesday the two room service trays STILL in hallway for day 3.  Decided to check out early and go to Orleans.  Comped rooms, still had to pay $22\/night resort fee.  FOR WHAT?  Internet is $16 a night I did not get, did not use pool, spa, shuttle, etc.  so my free nights ended up being costly!  
NEVER AGAIN!  Go elsewhere.  Orleans waives resort fees on comped rooms.

I really liked this hotel when we were there the first night. Beds were comfy, blankets were soft and clean. The bad part was  during our last day, the toilet was clogged and water was spilling out. Yuck. I couldn't stop the water til I had to open the tank. Good thing it was our last day and we were about to check out.

I've stayed at seven different hotels on the strip and Bally's was hands-down the worst. And by worst I mean it wasn't even close. 

Here's the deal: If you are going to operate a hotel\/casino as the property that time forgot, and do basically nothing to upgrade\/modernize, then fine. But at LEAST either loosen up your gaming OR offer a killer, cheap buffet. Bally's really doesn't do ANYTHING. 

Going to Vegas once in your life and staying at Bally's and then writing an amazing review on it is like going to McDonald's once in your life and then writing a review about how it has the best cheeseburgers, ever, when you've never even had another cheeseburger. 

Seriously - read the reviews. People don't enjoy Bally's. They enjoy the proximity to everything ELSE. 

Of all the stuff to complain about (I could go on, even with the comped room), I thought at least the game floor would be fun. But it's terrible. Everything is from 20 years ago, including the band. We'll never stay here again, even on a comp.

I was in town for a conference at this hotel.  Stayed here for 5 days in September\/2008 in the South Tower.   Room was adequate and the view was excellent (Paris Tower and the Bellagio fountains).

The location is excellent.....as all other reviewers stated, they are located next to Paris, Bellagio, and Caesars.  You are right in the center of the strip.

Didn't spend much time in the room...hey, you are in Vegas....

The room cost was very economical (paid an average of $79 per night) and it was worth it.   We just needed a decent place to crash for a few hours before going back into the jungle.   I would return again.

Vegas! Do you REALLY need a 5 star hotel to stay in? Do you REALLY need to pay oodles of cash to lay your head considering you'll be spending most of your time not in your room, but out and about and probably getting yourself into some sort of  "mischief". 

Bally's is one of the "older" hotels that's located in the middle of strip. So, if you're the type to hoof it, this hotel's location will suit you just fine. 

Considering the room was comped (thanks D-Block), I don't know how much we paid, but for the price of free, ninety free, it was perfect. The basic rooms are just that, basic. It reminded me a lot like Best Western's or Motel 6's I've stayed at before. So, if you don't mind that kind of decor, then I don't see a problem staying here. If you're more for the modern decor, glitzier bathrooms, the other, more modern hotels would be a wiser choice.

Overall, the rooms were good for what they were (considering we probably we only in them for 10 hours of the entire weekend). This is the kind of hotel I would go with my friends and not worry about trying to "wow" them. So if you want to have more of a blast spending your money on gambling, clubs, and alcohol, book here and save yourself some change and use it towards fun!

Ballys is cheap and in a pinch, it'll do. typical vegas shit.  I like the retro-ness and 80s vibe of the inside of the casino, hopefully they don't change a thing. Didn't really get to use any of the facilities as I went to other hotels....but its cheap and central on the strip..that's a good thing.

Last time I will be staying at Ballys. Have stayed here a few times, but this was the worst stay by far. First off the room rate is reasonable, but when you add the $35 "resort" fee, and now incredibly a $10 per day parking fee for even guests staying at the hotel, then I am done with these gougers! Room was really tired and outdated, rough, poor quality towels, no coffee in the room, basically a motel 6 in a hotel setting. Wifi was also very spotty and front desk seemed amazed that it was and offered no solution. $35 bucks well spent. NOT! Also a real hike from the Paris parking lot which Ballys uses. Will be staying at La Quinta or Marriott courtyard like places from now on. When all said and done works out cheaper with better, cleaner rooms, and more amenities.No deals at the restaurants anymore either, everything very expensive and average quality.

This is the worst hotel I've stayed at. It should not even be called a hotel. It didn't provide free self parking (charges you hourly, or daily), didn't provide free wifi (charges you per phone), and didn't even provide a toothpaste. Besides the location being in the middle of the Vegas strip, it's quality of stay was worse than a motel.

We loved this hotel for our night at vegas. Very cheap room and an awesome view of the strip. Rooms were clean and the casino down stairs is a blast. Would have been 5 stars but we had to wait a half hour in a long line just to check in which was kind of a bummer. But other than that, it was a fine choice and we would stay here again!

The last few times i went to Vegas, i stayed here.  as of right now this is my go to place.  Location is perfect, walking distance to all the major spots on the strip.  Very nice sports parlor.  Rooms are big.  will visit and stay here again.

We have visited Bally's many times over the last 40 years.  It is definitely time to tear this one down and start over.  Other than a perfect location there is nothing to recommend it.  Rooms are old and run down, breakfast buffet for 11.95 did not include coffee of juice and consisted of one very short line of nothing really special.  So $32.00 later I would recommend just getting a bagel.  The on line check out did not work so I could not view my bill without standing in line again with all the people who were checking in when I am checking out.  I am having to call and fight to get one because my charges don't look right at all.  They charge $3.00 per day for use of the in-room safe of you can believe it.  Was told the daily resort fee included the Internet connection but the instructions were so bad I had to go to the front desk for an explanation.  By that time I didn't really need it I just waited until I got outside to use my phone.  The resort fee is a joke because the Spa is so far away from the South Tower who on earth would want to wander through the Casino to get there.  I know everyone charges one so why don't they just include it as part of the cost of the room I ask?  The dealers were mostly friendly but blackjack games were somewhat limited and the show was good but there are much, much better hotels there for not so much more money.  My husband and I really stayed for the tennis courts but next time we will stay at Caesars and walk across the street.  Unless you are just young kids out to drink with your buddies and don't care I recommend you pass on this one.

We stayed here for one night. Check in took about 15 minutes, which wasn't that great. The room looked pretty nice and everything worked properly. The view was great. I would definitely te come it, at least for a night.

This place is overpriced and dirty. We found some old bra under the couch. They charge you for everything. The valet was $18 and the self parking was $10. I would never recommend recommend anyone to come here. Never again will I ever come back. They don't even have a microwave in the room what the heck even Motel 6 has a microwave. For an average of $200 a night I expected more bang for my buck.

You really can't beat the value for such a great location on the strip.  Reserve at the north tower and you will get the newly renovated rooms with ample space, clean sheets, and a nice cheap casino to boot.

Wow so unexpected! I never knew this hotel can be so bomdiggity! I didn't want to book this hotel be sue it is old but because im so happy I did. Three days and two nights for $130 total.. Split among ten girls..$13 person. I was afraid that the room might be small, but it wasnt... 450 square feet of awesomeness.

I got a deluxe room with two queen size beds (non smoking). We got a view of flamingo and a bit of mirage and caesars palace. We fitted ten girls in this room with extra spaces for clothes, purses, shoes, and bags.  So there you have it.. It's very spacious. 

Pros: 
Spacious
Comes with a bar area and fridge
Restroom is nice and big: I like this type of restroom because it is split into two rooms. One is for vanity and the other one is for showering and doing number one and two. 
Mirrors: mostly good for girls cuz we all need to get ready for clubbing and we can all have own area
Price
Ask for as many blankets, shampoos, lotions, conditioners, soap and pillows without the people getting annoyed

Cons:
Cheap toilet papers make my ass hurts a bit. I'm used to charmin double quilted
No free toothbrush ( my friend wants me to say that cuz she forgot hers

Casino: quite small, but seems like a lot of people are having fun. All I'm looking for is the craps and pai gow table and also craps machine but I don't see it.

I feel like I'm at Disneyland going through that horizontal escalator. Kinda cool... If you run on that escalator, you'll feel like a cheetah.

Location is awesome. Smack dab in the middle between marquee and xs. And of course diagonally across the street from serendipity 3!!

Please read!!! This was hands down the worst hotel experience I have ever had! The check in lines were outrageous. Our room was paid for by the organization we were attending a conference for but the resort fee was tacked on at the end causing us to pay out of pocket. Which is not the worst thing in the world except for the room was horrible. It wreaked of cigarette smoke and it made me very worried about the cleanliness of the room so I slept on top of the comforter. It gets worse... there was a cockroach running around the ice machine and for the grand finally literal poop water came up from the sink!!! Causing the entire room to smell like sewer\/ fish tank! Bottom line that is disturbing!!! When I called the front desk they sent someone to fix the problem but did not offer to relocate us or anything! Then it happened again as we were leaving! Overall just a horrible experience! Ruined Vegas for me, I will definitely need time to recover before returning haha...

I've stayed here several times and it's always been ok but my most recent stay was horrible. I was there for a Delegates meeting, my room was 5639 in the Jubilee tower. It was across frpm the club at the base of the tower at The Paris, needless to say the bass and loud screeming made it impossible to sleep till like 3am. The next morning my Fiancé called the front desk and asked to switch rooms, the manager was very accomodating and directed us to grab our luggage and come down to the front desk but when my Fiancé arrived the girl named Lena at the front desk was extremely rude and did not want to switch our room so we asked to see a Manager. Lena walked to the back, after 18 minutes of waiting Lena finally came back with an attitude and keys to a different room.

Large rooms with all the essentials. No frills but better than the other cheap and decent hotels on the strip (i.e. Luxor). I like the open layout of the casino and the fact that it's connected to other places (Paris\/Silvery Legacy I believe). There's also a nice little connecting walkway with places to grab something quick to eat if you get hungry on your way to Paris or Silver Legacy.

We stayed here since the location is right in the middle of the strip. The front if the hotel is under construction so you had to walk around it and go along barriers to get out to the strip. When we came to check in for early check in like a ton of other people they told us the rooms weren't ready yet in our tower (we stayed in the jubilee tower which is recently remodeled) and they took our bags and told us to come back in a couple hours and then the lady gave us a coupon book and said we have an 'excellent' view. Well when we check in later to the room it's a view of the construction which was horrible. When the bell person delivered our stuff I asked why the view was so shitty. They told me to request to be moved to an odd number room since those face the paris pool, Eiffel Tower and the strip. I called and they finally transferred us and the view was great. Oh the coupon book they have us was 2 months expired btw. So the room was nice but there was dirty underwear in the corner and some weird marks above the bed which I don't even want to know about. The casino is ok, has keno and waitresses are good at bringing drinks if you play table games. Not fancy though, pretty old. Planet Hollywood is a couple casinos down and it's WAY prettier. Also some casinos must use a scented filter or something because they smell so good and ballys does not have that. It's was a decent stay all in all though.

3.5 stars.

Nice spacious suite room on the 21st floor. Bathrooms could've been nicer, you can tell they are getting a bit old.  The people in the hotel were okay.... people by the pool were super friendly and provided great service.  Drink prices were a bit steep.  Unfortunately, even on non-smoking floors, they smell like smoke.

Ballys is my personal favorite place to stay when in Las Vegas. Its location is very convenient to everything. The check in line is sometimes very long, there is about a 30 minute wait. I suggest arriving early and pay the early check in fee if you dont like waiting. 

The staff is great. Sometimes too great... housekeeping comes by a few times a day to see if you need anything. That can be a bit annoying if you have the do not disturb sign up. =\/ 

The rooms are nice and very, very clean. I always get an awesome view of either the strip or the paris. If you want total quiet I dont suggest these views. You can hear music playing all night. The Indigo Towers arent newly remodeled like the Jubilee Tower is, therefore, the Indigo Towers cost less, but the rooms are still clean. 

There is always covered parking available, and its free. They dont have cable really... but you can purchase new movies for $11.99. =] 

The Ballys Casino is my ultimate fave casino in LV. I recommend this hotel and casino.

It's not as fancy as The Wynn or Venetian, but it's not cheap and nasty as some other Vegas hotels.

Have been staying at Bally's for the past few years and have had pleasant stays each time and highly recommend it.

It's affordable and on the strip - the total rewards prices make it a better deal!

Kudos to Terry, who was on duty Wednesday evening, June 3rd.  He was most helpful and exceeded my expectations during check in.  I asked if he could get me and my other family members on the same floor with rooms near by; even though they were arriving several hours later.  Terry made it happen.  When my family arrived, their rooms had been assigned.  And yes, we were all on the same floor!

Thank you, Terry for your willingness to help and your pleasant demeanor.
Was in town for my friend's 40th birthday and stayed at Bally's. Dirty room. Found toe nail clippings throughout the room including a massive big toe toenail clipping.

What a fantastic Hotel! Its so well connected to the Paris that I myself felt like I was staying at the Paris! The rooms were very clean and check in was decent. Some of the staff looked a touch overworked and one got a touch cranky with my 15+ person group (ok yes i understand there's a lot of us so  forgive)  Your smack dab on the strip and in the middle of everything. I loved my stay here because for the value your smack dab in the middle of all the action of the strip. Its very conveniently located

My husband and I just returned from our quick weekend spent at Bally's in Las Vegas. We are both Total Rewards members and were able to get great room prices over the weekend. TIP: Next time you are in Vegas, sign up for Total Rewards! It's FREE and you get discounted prices on pretty much everything and earn points for freebies and discounts...use your card with every in-hotel purchase! Anywho, we are a younger couple and Bally's gives us the ability to stay on the strip without breaking our budget. We got a room in the North Tower and our room was very nice, newer, clean and the bed was very comfortable. No view (in our room), but who cares. We went to Paris for their pool, which is pretty nice. The casino is nice and the hotel connects with Paris, and basically Planet Hollywood smack dab in the middle of the strip. If you are thrifty but want to stay on the strip and don't necessarily care about having the hippest or most trendy room, Bally's is your place. Close enough to walk to all the cool things and great food. I will definitely return.
Kinda old and dirty hotel\/casino. Receptionists were less than helpful. Room was nice and large though.

I don't know if they outsource their phone calls overseas or what but two separate phone calls got me the rudest and most daft people I have ever encountered!

I wouldn't bother with a stay.

We arrived in Las Vegas straight into what seems like a maze of casinos. A 24hr circus of lights and games for freaks like me to play in. Bally's was located in a great location. 

I walked up to the check-inn desk where I was greeted by a black guy named Elvis. I gave him whatever he wanted; id, credit card, name. He began violently flicking the keyboard for awhile. And after awhile I started to wonder wtf is going on? "Don't lean over the desk" he said. Then continuing to move at crack speed he walked into a back room then came back. Minutes later of waiting patiently I got the keys to my room. I think Elvis upgraded us to the north tower. Thanks buddy. 

The rooms aren't bad BUT THERE ARE NO FRICKIN REFRIGERATORS!! That is a huge pain in the ass. Not to mention no free wifi, no local or toll free calls, but then there are no resort fees either. So would I stay at Bally's again? For the price, quality of rooms, and the location yes. But if you choose Bally's be prepared to give up some amenities you may or may not be able to live with.

Not bad at all. Liked that we had Paris next door and we were able to go from one hotel to another. Just about smack in the middle of the strip. 
We'd stay there again.

Las Vegas, Nevada is my second home. I frequent this city several times a year. I can never get enough! Ive stayed at multiple hotels on the strip & Bally's has been good to me! No complaints. I usually stay at Planet Hollywood for its convenience and location. However, the past few trips to Vegas I've stayed at Bally's. My friends and I took a chance, and I'm glad we did!

It's center to the strip, cheap, with decent hotel rooms. Its walking distance to Elis Island Casino where you'll find the best prime rib and steak for under $15. You can find the cheapest deals online for Bally's, and I usually slip the staff a $20 at check in (between my ID & CC) for an upgraded room. 

The food court isn't open 24 hours. That's a bummer. The closest option for food would be Paris. If you have the drunkies and crave tacos or burgers, you'll find no such luck. Theres a 24 hour Johnny Rockets in the Flamingo Casino. 

If you happen to find the cheapest deal online, & slip a $20; you'll find yourself in the newly renovated jubilee towers. It's upgraded with a mini fridge, a view of the Linq Ferris wheel, but located so far from the elevators & ice machine. We stayed in room 6636.

Although, there isn't a 24 hour food court available at Bally's; it's not a deal breaker. The money I save on the hotel, is extra spending money to do everything else in Vegas aside from sleeping. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap, centrally located, decent place to stay on the strip.

Was here for a gaming tournament and used a lot of the different banquet rooms. The staff was all very helpful even though it was quite busy since more than 500 people were in our event space. We had the breakfast buffet Sunday morning and it was delicious! Would definitely come again.

Worst tennis courts I've ever played on - like playing on a mogul field skiing.  Cracks all over the court and a washed up tennis pro running the place.  Put us on the worst court because we brought our own rackets and balls.  Put some old geriatric couple on the "nice resurfaced" court without cracks and bumps - they struggled to actually hit the ball so it made little difference.

Pretty nasty place overall. I would strongly advise against staying here. The rooms are dirty, casino is outdated and old, and the location is horrible. 

Stay somewhere else.

Stayed for a conference; extended trip for personal vacation.  When checking in, last night of stay was quoted $9.99; when returned home, learned that I was charged $179.  Managements excuse was "someone mis-entered your rate when making the reservation, we reserve the right to increase your rate to correct the error.")  I was expecting no more than $139\/night, so was shocked to pay that much to stay at this hotel!  There are better hotels on the strip for that amount (or lower), so in retrospect I would have switched hotels had I known the true rate!
The pros:  smaller hotel, so easy to navigate the casino\/lobby, good cocktail service on the gaming floor, centrally located.
The cons:  long check-in, check-out lines, billing errors not resolved to my satisfaction, rude customer service at the management level.

The hotel is dated. However, I was excited to have a king suite to enjoy.  I asked the front desk, when I checked in, to have A roll away bed sent to my room, as I had a friend that lived in Vegas that was staying with me for the night. The front desk told me they would set up the bed while we were out visiting Las Vegas..  When I went to the room, I was blown away by the size and the luxury of the room. My view was AMAZING! The bed was firm but comfortable and the feeling of being a high-roller was there! When got back to the room, no bed. I called trying to find out about the bed. They stated they are going charge me for a roll away bed. I told them there was no mention of that when I checked on and requested it and then the front desk begin to argue with me. I asked to speak to a manger. They put me on hold and then hung up on me. I was mad! Called back and asked for a manger, was told I needed to explain myself, again . They also told me to come down to the check in to explain myself. Really???!Is that what you call service?!?? Holy crap! Finally got a manger and they fixed it, and stated it would be at no cost.
I thought that was the only issue, then the reality of a dated hotel set in. I went to take a shower in the separate shower from the tub and discovered mold in the corner of the shower. I recieved a call about 2:30 from the housekeeping supervisor, Roberta, asking when I wanted my room cleaned. I told her 3:00 will work for me, as I was heading out. I requested someone to "bleach" the shower to get rid of the mold. She informed me to call her should I have anymore requests or problems. I headed out for the day and came back to the the smell of bleach in my room. Yeah!, I thought super clean shower. Not so much. It was a half ass job, that there was still mold there. I called to speak with Roberta and the front desk answered. I asked for Roberta the Housekeeping Manager.  They asked "is that a manager?" WHAT?!? Do you not know who are the managers on call for dept? The front desk asked if they could help. I told her the issue and at least could you also send me an extra blanket and refrigerator. ( side note, what kind of a suite, does not have a fridge) I was informed it would cost $15.00 EXTRA a day. WHAT? I'm in a suite?!?! I was so tired of the petty crap that was going on, I agreed. Somehow, they got a fridge that I was charged for, right up. But, I had to argue for a extra bed I was promised. I had asked if they could put food that I got from one of the restaurants in the fridge when it arrived. I was informed. No one could touch my stuff, to do so. Really??!!!?? Housekeeping was touching my stuff everyday, ( supposedly, when they clean). FINE! WHATEVER?!??
Then next day, I realized how much, they really do not clean. When I came back after room service, there was rings from glasses that were sitting in areas, I never put a glass. There were other items, but I will leave it there.

Finally, there was a gorgeous tub in the middle of my room. ( please see pictures). I actually was excited to take a long bath my last day. Needless to say, that did not happen. When so started to fill the tub with water, there was hair and not just long hair, but hair, like someone had shaved...a lot!!! Grosser than gross. Really loved the room and the idea of it, but won't stay here again.

Never again! First of all check in time is now 4pm. They may as well make it 6pm! Check out time is 11am and no longer noon. The resort fees are ridiculous. The woman at the counter was rude to us (Lidia) and even threatened to call security because we were asking questions about various rooms and prices. It was ridiculous! Finally we got our rooms and they were very dated and they smelled like smoke! Part of the drama at registration was that we wanted NON-smoking but somehow the booking site put us down for smoking. We had to pay EXTRA for non smoking and it smelled!!! We asked for a different room already irritated with all the issues. We got a handicapped room (as she called it) and had no bathtub! We were looking forward to a nice relaxing bath but now we were screwed! We had no view and our overall experience just wasn't great. What was worse is we went with a couple that had NEVER been to Las Vegas and was celebrating an Anniversary. I would NEVER recommend this hotel nor would I be crazy to stay there again. *The extra star is only for room service!  They were attentive to our needs and were great!

I came to Bally's with my girlfriend and we had a great time. It's right in the heart of the strip and they offer great deals during the off season. We even got a free upgrade to a suite by the desk clerk - which was awesome because the room had a Jacuzzi in it. Bally's also had easy access to the monorail which will take you anywhere from the MGM all the way down to the Stratosphere.

Bally's has done some serious upgrading. The elevators, casino, check-in area, etc. still certainly show their wear, but the rooms in the Jubilee tower are super nice. They're new and modern. Comfy beds. Roomy bathroom. Good linens, furniture, TV, etc. And the view is fabulous. Our room overlooked the Strip with great views of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. It was awesome sitting by the window and watching the fountain show. The check-in process was easy and the staff were super friendly. Sure, it's not the best or fanciest casino on the Strip, but the rooms are fab and the location is great.

Although I made reservations a month in advance, they tried to give me a single king bed and would roll up a cot to us. Had to go to mgmt to resolve. Requested a fridge for an rx that needed refrigeration, they sent it up 1 1\/2 hrs later after I called. It froze all contents. Keycard failed at 2 in the morning and had to call security to get into the room. Pool is shared with the Paris hotel and is quite a hike. The jacuzzi is not heated nor did it have working jets. Handicap parking is available but is very far away which defeats the purpose. Other hotels comp valet but it was not offered by Bally's. Overall, the property is in dire need of a facelift. Built in 1973, it looks it. Food court is in a rundown area with the floor peeling up and has long lines for mall food. Elevators are very slow. Other casino\/hotels recirculate the air much better and this location smells like stale cigarettes wherever you go.

I was out here for four days for a tradeshow.  The hotel is located in the middle of the strip, which is a plus but besides that it doesn't have much going for it.  

The hotel is dated with its decor and amenities.  It was nice enough to exhibit at but the hotel room was old and smelly.  

They have a good amount of restaurants and table games, also a plus. 

Overall, I would check out some of the newer hotels and city center before staying here again.

Being my first trip to Vegas choosing a hotel was extremely difficult. As far as being in the middle of the action this hotel is definitely right where you want to be, you go up one escalator and you're in the bazaar area straight across from the Bellagio fountains next to the "hot spots " so to speak. Another advantage is location is once you go up the escalator and you're in the bazaar area there are tons of people handing out drink coupons for buy one get one free which will save you a ton of money overall, you're also in the immediate area of all the escalators that will take you up to the Bridges since in Vegas in the Georgia Street will not let you cross at street level so that step alone will save you quite a bit of walking and detours. As for the hotel itself it is definitely a solid three. When we checked in we had booked a standard room and they said "oh you get a free upgrade to a suite". That sure sounded exciting but once we got to our room if it was not exciting at all. There was a gorgeous balcony with a view of the parking garage, we were not able to open the balcony doors or go out which is very common for Vegas. But at least at night it was kind of a nice view rather than nothing I guess. Our suite upgrade also included his and her closets and there was a very large in room Jacuzzi that neither of us were willing to use because it look like it had not been cleaned since being originally installed in the 70's. The Jacuzzi liner was peeling and there was green around all the water sources. The room itself was frozen in time, it had this really weird wallpaper that looked like faded circus stripes, it was covering a lot of water damage that had been poorly repaired years ago, there was no vent in the shower or toilet area which just makes romance almost impossible. The shower light also did not work, you had to flip the switch several times to make it actually turn on so you could see in the shower. They do offer room service, at first the prices seemed extremely high until we actually ate out on the strip and realize room service probably would save you a small fortune here and their menu seem quite expensive but we did not take advantage of this. The hotel staff as far as checking in and the housekeeping was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. The floor staff in the casino area was another story, everybody knows you drink for "free" in Vegas but the servers were incredibly snobby and rude and even downright sarcastic towards you if you did not tip every single time. My work around this is to order two drinks from one server don't tip if they are being snotty and move to the next section so you don't have to constantly put up with their attitude while you're losing hundreds possibly thousands of dollars. We had one nice server on the casino floor that we did tip well, we all are Service workers and we all get what we give and to expect anything without actually working for it it's kind of insulting since we are there spending money we worked incredibly hard for. 
There is a pretty significant resort fee charged here that is not included in your booking, we stayed three nights and a resort fee was over $100 and we actually did not use any of the resort facilities such as swimming, spa or gym. Make sure if you are a booking a hotel and not planning on using resort offerings be sure to book somewhere with less amenities or you just want your money away.
Overall for this hotel seeing what else the strip offers this is not a location we ourselves would return to.

terrible experience....I am a local first of all...booked a room doe new years...was supposed to get 2 queen beds....they said they didn't have anymore when we arrived....only had king.....refused to honor our booking....said its not a guarantee the number of beds... they gave us 2 roll away beds.... completely uncomfortable..... then the room has damage to all furniture...can't use balcony because it's bolted shut....and they out us near night club and music blasting until 5am so loud you can't even sleep with ear plugs....waste of money and will never recommend this place to anyone and will refuse to come here again.
Absolutely love this place. The hospitality here is awesome! Boyfriend and I stay here all the time and can't compare it to anywhere else! Thank you for the fresh fruit basket and amazing service!
Decent place to stay at. The rooms are spacious. Staff is friendly. Overall its good.

Bally's is the place I've stayed at during my last couple of Vegas trips. I will admit that I can be a degenerate gambler at times and lose more than I care to mention so I have always stayed comped here. This is a nice, no frills hotel. Mostly people stay here because it is one of the cheaper options when it comes to casinos on the Strip. I find it laughable however when people openly state they come here because it's the cheapest place available but then complain that the amenities aren't on par when compared to Aria or Bellagio. This is a friendly reminder that you get what you pay for. 

The entrance here is a little tricky because you enter from the Strip and everyone knows that pedestrians here aren't considerate to cars. However, once you valet, the check in desk is an easy walk from the entrance. The line can look long sometimes but the wait is really short since both times I've been here the desk clerks have been really efficient.

The one good tip I can give here is to slip a $20 bill between your credit card and ID and ask about any available upgrades. Both times I went from a standard room in the south tower (older tower) to the north tower (refurbished tower) in whatever suite they have available. This trip our upgraded room was a junior suite.

The casino floor here is on the smaller side. Not as small as Imperial Palace but not set up in a maze like Caesar's Palace is. If you want a bigger casino, Bally's in connected via inside walkway to Paris. However, since the hotel is basically in the center to the strip, you won't have too far of a walk to any other casino you wish to go to.

If you aren't a fan of walking, there is a monorail station in the back of the casino. You have to go down the escalator and make the hike there. It's right next to the pool entrance. 

There is a 24 hour Sbarro downstairs and a tequila bar in the casino that stays open late. I don't know much about other food options because those are the only two I've tried.

Although I was not a guest here at Ballys, I did visit because a friend of mine was staying here and we came for a pre party here in the roombefore we went to Drais. The hotel itself is nice, the room was nice too, smaller than I expected but decorated nicely. It must have been a basic room cause I saw the photos of the other rooms. 

My reason for posting this is because of the elevators which are the worse I've ever encountered. Long wait, cramped and hordes of people trying to rush in. I think at least 50 people were waiting for the elevator. It took us a good 20 minutes to get from lobby to room.

Still a very nice hotel with great restaurants.

Bally's will do in a pinch but you can do much better in Las Vegas. Our recent two-night stay at Bally's included a bout with food poisoning from the their in-casino "deli". Apparently - a chicken-salad sandwich on a hot day\/night was not a good idea. We think it was the chicken or mayo or both. 

Our room was nothing special. The carpet was old and wifey said the whole place smelled like "old cigarette smoke". 

The Valet guy was rude when I went into the wrong lane. They have construction going on and I was confused. 

The wait at check-in was lengthy. : ((

What did we like? The view across the way of The Cromwell, and High Roller.

I checked into the hotel around 4pm. I'm not sure if house cleaning even cleaned the room. I went into my room and it was messy. A rolling bed, a blow dryer and there was a pill on the nightstand near the bed. I went down to registration and let them know. You would think when house keep came into the room to put away the rolling bed that they would clean the room. Nope they only put away the rolling bed. No, my room was not cleaned. The dust on the nightstand proofs it.

I had comps in Jan. 2013 room looked nice, and clean then I started to see roaches in the bath room. told my boyfriend he killed a few then more came. I told supervisor of house keeping nothing done said will report it for spraying; I emailed staff at Bally's the lady said should have told manager. I told several people about the problem what should I have done screamed.

Three days of roaches one even reached the wall over the bed.one lady at Bally's said 7 people stayed in this room the week before. I said don't care this is not honeymoon in vegas hotel anymore.
Well, I've been here since 2:30 pm, waiting in long line for check-in.  Only 2 receptionist  working,   been over half hour and line is not moving much. So far, has not been a good experience.

As any other older hotel on the strip, at least this place is NOT circus circus.  At times even the rates are cheaper here than Motel 8...scary I know right?

The location is right in the center of the strip and right across from Caesar's...so definitely with the walkways and avoiding taxis and the inevitable traffic is great!  

I would have given the hotel at least 3 stars but for a busy holiday weekend and to have a long check-in line and then to get to the room to find out that there were holes in clean pillow sheets and one of the beds smelling like smoke, I waited a total of 2 hours just to get housekeeping to come back upstairs to redo the bedding.  Don't forget to check the pillows for double pillowcases (trust me, you will thank me later).  From now on, that will be something else I'll have to do when I stay at any hotels in vegas (or elsewhere for that matter).

The casino sadly smelled like smoke everywhere so no matter how hard we tried to avoid the smokiness....as soon as you left the "smoke free" room....might as well consider yourself a chain smoker.  Luckily I wasn't in the hotel long enough for my lungs to fill up with 2nd hand smoke!

Do not stay here!!!  Drais across the street BUMPS all night like someone is pounding on the window.  Even The managers recommendation was to stay somewhere else when I called to complain.  At least he was honest.

Im kind of indifferent about how i feel about Ballys just because of our room situation.

My husband planned a trip last minute since we werent sure if we could go since I had Jury Duty the week before. Since I was able to be excused and my husbands birthday is on st. Pattys day with my mother in law in town to watch the girls.. we decided to drive out to vegas for two nights and booked our rooms two days before our stay.

We booked for two nights and a king sized bed for our stay. Cost came out to about 125 a night + the site we used gave us a 25 dollar voucher for food or drinks. Arrived at around midnight but the guy at check in told us all the king sized bedrooms were taken. I asked if theres anything special they do for birthdays because my husbands birthday was that day since its midnight. The guy said since he can only get us a queen sized bed for the night, he told us we will be doing a room change in the afternoon to get our king sized bed the next night. Because of the inconvience he upgraded us to the jacuzzi suite. So that night we had a jr suite and the night after we got a jacuzzi suite.

We were a bit excited for the room upgrade but in the end it didnt really make a big difference. The first night in our jr. Suite.. i loved how spacious the room was.. but that bed was not a queen sized bed. Let a lone a standard queen sized bed. Our bed was more like a FULL sized bed if anything...

Room change was between 12-1pm. So after having brunch we headed back to the hotel to do the change. Super inconvienent since it takes up our day to come back and move rooms before heading out again. The jacuzzi suite on the 14th floor looked very nice. Sweet upgrade for the moment of walking in. No view btw but a jacuzzi is sweet enough. Very spacious and luxurious but probably would have been unsafe for my kids to run around since the jacuzzi had some sharp corners on that thing.

After our long venture out..  i had went to Lush and bought some bath bombs for the jacuzzi. After turning on the water.. there was a ton of bubbles coming up in the water. Im guessing its bubbles are from the previous use and it wasnt cleaned by the house keeper. So obviously a bit disgusted.. i filled it with water and rinsed it out before using it. After that... i couldnt find the button to turn on the jacuzzi so i called house keeping for help. They werent any help at all. Sounded like they didnt give a crap about it and told me to just press the black button and that was that....

Well.. first off.. house keeping stated its a button with a P on it. Its not btw... thats just the logo of the brand of the tub. I eventually figured out where this black button was... its on the side. But its jammed in and doesnt work. So i pretty much just had a big tub to lay in after throwing in my bath bomb. I have one of these at home so im not missing out just i expected better from a hotel in vegas u know.

Overall i wasnt happy about the inconvience and the broken jacuzzi... but i liked the location. It made it very easy to walk around on either ends of the strip since we were right in the middle. Also they are opening a nice looking cvs soon which would have been more convienent if it was opened sooner.

Just spent last week at Bally's.  On the bang for the buck scale it's 4 stars.

Pluses:
- Location, location, location
- BIG rooms
- Price

Minuses:
- Not much of a pool
- A bit old

Pictures on my website ... see profile

Hotel staff lies to their guests. We were told we were being given an upgraded room and the concierge made a big fuss about it, got us all excited, and then gave us a standard room. Went down to ask if there was a mistake and the concierge is gone. Wish we had not given her a tip.

Positive: The location was pretty much direct center of the strip. We were able to walk out be near everything. A lot of the time, we didnt even have to drive if we wanted to go to any of the other casinos.

Negative: Like previously stated, no wifi and if you want it it's 14 bucks a day, no coffee, bad service, old cocktail waitresses and guests. The parking was also really far from the rooms. It was such a bitch to have to walk back and forth everyday.

 I have to say, the customer service here was pretty fucking HORRIBLE. We came at almost 12pm for check in, but we couldn't get into our room until after 4pm, so we had to wait around for 4 hours. During check in, we were trying to see if we could get into the newer tower instead of the old one, since we heard bad things about the old one. We probably asked the woman about 5 times which tower we would be in, but she completely ignored us every time, it seemed like she was in so much of a rush to get us out of there, that she didnt even bother listening to what we were saying, and I know we were asking her loud and clear. So we pretty much had to find out what tower we were  when we got into the room.  

At 4pm, when we went to pick up our room key, we decided to report the issue to management. We went up to the check in counter to another person and explained the problem to him. He pretty much got offensive right off the bat, completely ignoring what we were even saying. Then he called the woman we had a problem with up to the desk and told us to tell her the problem ourselves. Who the fuck does that!? We just asked him to get the manager out so we can explain it to him, but he wasn't much help either. It's like, all we were trying to tell them is that they should have their employees listen to the customers more and ask them if they have any questions. No wonder non of them do that! The manager sets a horrible example himself. They were making it seem like we had a huge problem with our room and what they gave us, but that wasn't it at all. So they kept saying "you got what you want, so what's the problem" and we'd try to tell them and they'd just cut us off. This had to be the WORST EXPERIENCE at a Vegas hotel that I've ever had, and I've lived here for the past 10 years!

If customer service means anything to you, DO NOT STAY HERE!

Won't be back.  You know how when you arrive by plane in Mexico and the time share people will not let you alone.  Oh wait it is a total rewards property.  The time share people get in your face and will not go away.  Room was nice no coffee maker, wifi was not free.  could not check out on the television.  Just really disappointing

I was pleasantly surprised at Bally's in a positive way! After staying at Cosmo\/Aria\/Caesars\/higher end hotels, we decided to save money and stay at Bally's instead. My parents love this place and I always wonder why, since it looks so outdated on the outside. Now I know why: you get a huge bang for your buck and its a great place to gamble for non high rollers. I heard they're renovating? Upon entering it looked like a regular casino. The reception area was very clean, it looked new and shiny. Our double queen bed room was SPACIOUS. Probably the most spacious double bed room I've seen on the strip thus far. And it was super cheap! With total rewards, it came to less than $100 on a weekend night. Such a steal for such a huge room.

The rooms were clean and we were very impressed at the pretty beds. Very clean and well kept room. The bathroom was very clean. I have no complaints AT ALL. The room was actually better than Planet Hollywood\/Palazzo because nothing fell apart or looked run down (yes things fell apart on me at other hotels, so bad)! 

A great place to gamble! My bf and parents love gambling here because its just affordable. The servers are VERY friendly. Not the prettiest in Vegas but they are very quick with the free drinks and friendly. I sat at the slot machine for at least an hour, and usually only 1 waitress would pass by me during that amount of time in other hotels. However at bally's, a server passed by me several times asking me if I needed anything. 

We will definitely stay here since it's cheap and we don't spend that much time in the rooms anyways, always out and about. I love how they have 24 hours food joints open up for all the drunk munchies we had. Nosh got the job done and their chicken noodle soup was very good.

Worst experience ever by far staying at a hotel in Vegas..... I thought my last stay and review topped it so I actually paid a higher price to stay at Bally's this trip. What a mistake! Arrived Saturday 1-2-16 and checked in totally the normal and nothing out of the ordinary. However, upon walking in the room I was surprised to find a guy in there who was unpacking his belongings. After nearly avoiding a fist fight we both went down stairs to complain. I calmly advised the the lady at reception what happened and was treated like I inconvenienced her. That combined with the naked man who was in my room it was time for a manager. He was decent and at least apologized. I was switched to a new room which was nice except the 3 wet spots on the floor the size of basketballs. I get it though it was the New Years weekend so back downstairs I went wet socks and all.... I was surprised however that after all this and 3 hours later there was no comp. no offer of a discount meal.... No nothing just lots of words of regret. So New Years 2016 weekend at Bally's was expensive, shocking, wet, and totally a bust, even lost 2k at the tables. 1 STAR treatment from Bally's gets a 1 STAR review from me.

I have not been to Bally's in over 10 years. So far so good. Rooms are clean and updated. People are welcoming and nice. I cannot complain as our rooms are comp'd for NFR. I normally stay at the Encore but I cannot turn away four nights free! Thank you Bally's for the Comp'd Room!!!!!!
Lived at the Bally's last week and got bed bugs' bites on legs and foot. Foot swells until now. Won't choose there any more.

I came to Vegas and stayed at Bally's for my 30th birthday.  The room was all right; I've had better but they are centrally located on the strip so we were pretty much in walking distance to everything.  They have a small cafe\/diner right next to their registration desk so that was a plus.
Nice room but worst bathroom. Near Bellagio, Ceaser, Paris and Planet Hollywood. Almost the center of the strip.

Seriously, this hotel is just OK.  The best part, and probably the only part of Bally's is the location on the Strip.  Since it's right in the middle, next to Paris, and across from Caesar's and Bellagio, it can make getting around Vegas pretty easy, especially if you're there during the Summer.

The hotel room we got was pretty bare bones.  2 beds, bathroom, TV, that's it.  I was hoping to get a fridge, but guess not.  Since I'm not in Vegas to sleep, it really didn't make a big difference.  Since it was a free room due to a gambling habit, I really don't have much to complain about. LOL.  We did get a great view of the strip and Vegas as usual, is a blast.  The Casino itself is pretty mediocre, nothing really that stands out except for the cheap blinds at the Hold 'em tables if I wanted to waste a few hours at the Poker table.  The room prices here are pretty cheap from what I've seen, so if you care about location on the strip and the cost compared to the Bellagio or Wynn, you could do a lot worse than Bally's.
Staff who work at Bally's are friendly! Rooms are very spacious however the lobby and the casino area are VERY VERY VERY smokey. I wouldn't return due to the poor air quality.

This place is a bit old school, its still a pretty place, but with a few upgrades it would be sexy! The food wasn't great tho, so i would def eat somewhere else. But this is a good place to stay to save some money.
The rooms are clean and big so its money well spent.

Spent our ONE NIGHTER here for NYE 2011 and it was AMAZING!

My friend had a free night and when we got there and checked in they said they were completely booked on regular rooms and hooked us up with an EXECUTIVE SUITE!! I thought my friend was just kidding as we were walking into our rooms. I was like yeah whatever...

Once the door opened the four of us we're like on the first episode of the Real World when they first see their house! We were running around screamin no way, this is awesome!!! I've never stayed in such a huge room. Even tho it's an older hotel we still had like 5 couches, two bathrooms, a tub, his and her sink & closet, king size bed, a bar [which we were standing on hahaha] and did i mention it was all for FREE?!?!

It was the best way to ring in the new year! I wish we could get that room all the time :[ Prob theee best one nighter yet!!!

The rooms are big and clean which is the biggest plus. The elevators are fast, also a plus. 

I have been to Bally's three times and this last one will be my last one. The check-in was completely chaotic. The line was huge, the check-in machines were not working, and there were only two or three check-in counters open at any given time. The employees were rude, very rude, and would simply stop checking people into the hotel and gather in a corner and talk and laugh. They made several mistakes on our reservations and had no interest in fixing them and gave us a phone number to call. Maintenance is hit-and-miss. The soda machine on our floor and the floor above did not work. I had to go two floors to get some water. Room service would show up at about 830 am; not good, way too early. Make sure you have your DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door. We also got a service call at 230 am from somebody coming to fix our toilet. Wrong room. 

Expensive parking. I also find the resort fee very irritating and expensive.
 
Won't be back.
Rooms seem old, outdated, curtains had multiple holes, and carpet worn and dirty.Also dust on the inside doors of the elevators a disappointment considering it's location

I've dealt with three "supervisors" in regards to getting my room. Though I have a confirmation number with my name, and a reservation in the system, Bally's won't give me the room we purchased. A friend and I booked through Expedia and due to some mix up, they are now leaving us with the option paying for a second room. No refund is being offered by Expedia for the mix up.

Bally's in room WiFi is extremely insecure. 
Want Free Wifi in your room at Bally's? 

All you need is the last name and room number of someone else. Use that as your WiFi login and Voila, you get free WiFi, they will get a $14.99 a day charge that Bally's will not even look into and will pretty much tell them to get bent.

Combine this incredible security with the worlds largest Hacker Convention and I wonder how many other poor suckers like me got screwed over by Bally's.

Decent place to hang out.  I had the experience waiting for a shuttle bus and all the tour buses that use this as a pickup point.  I would not say it is the most modern and fancy Casino in Vegas and it shows.  I would not have a problem staying here if the price was right.

I asked lady at the lobby for three rooms with a view at hotel Bellagio. She said we have them but they cost almost three times more than a regular room. I agreed to pay extra money, however when we got to our rooms, only one had a right view. Two of them were looking everywhere but at the Bellagio. Also, your room i separated from other guests room only by the door, so if you have kids, I would not recommend to bring them to Bally's with you

Kind of the -Days Inn- of the strip. If I were to suddenly polka dot, nay, spray can paint you with random epithets, I'd say this place is family oriented, underwhelming in the gaming area department, corporate-feeling, astonishingly affordable for the location and unmemorable compared to what you can possibly spoil yourself with on other parts of the strip.

Parking here kind of blows. They make you feel second rate from the get-go. You can self-park and when you get to the elevator, you have to walk through Paris (not a bad thing really, but time consuming) to get to the Bally's registration area, which always seems to have long queues. 

We stayed in the newly renovated North Tower, deluxe room. Averaging $77 a night for Monday and Tuesday nights, I feel like the hotel could have averaged $30 a night had we stayed longer. The luck I had in Vegas made me rue the day a bit.

That said, the deluxe room just seemed to lack the amenities I had taken for granted as a guest at Mandalay Bay and the Palms in the past. No refrigerator, big boxy television, a tub for a bath and not even a couch to lay down on. The beds DO make up for it and are rather comfortable and spic 'n' span clean.

Stay here if you'll need more gambling money. But gamble elsewhere. Anywhere elsewhere.

Hospedagem em abril\/14.
Hotel antigo, cheiro de mofo, ar condicionado fraco e barulhento. Mas o visual e a localização são incríveis. Ah, o preço também é baixo! 
Na outra vez em que estivemos, ficamos hospedados no Trump... Só de lembrar do conforto e luxo, ficamos bastante arrependidos. :(

Bally's is located in the heart of the strip, across from the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. There is a long walkway to the front entrance of the hotel but the shops in Paris lead you right near a stage\/ bar inside the Bally's casino. I noticed there are more gambling tables here than there are coin machines. I thought the girl dancers in the casino were very fun and lively; they added some flavor to the seemingly old and stale crowd.

It was about 11pm and one of the dealers was having trouble adding the cards on the black jack table so I'm not sure if she was playing everyone fairly or if she was just having trouble doing late night math.

I have been standing in the express check in line for nearly an hour. Bally's thinks so little of paying guests that they only have two clerks on to check people into their hotel. I will never be back. This is the poorest service on the strip.

Overdue review: I booked a hotel last minute so prices were ridiculous. So I had to go with Bally's out of convenience. When I booked the reservation, I asked for 2 beds. My flight was delayed and I checked in around 11pm on Thursday night. I was offered an upgrade yet I was given a room with 1 bed. Not 2 like I had originally asked for. Apparently it was the only non-smoking room available. Fine. When we walked in, it was like a blast from the past. Weird wallpaper, old furniture, and really really really old bed. I did a 30 minute bed bug check around the bed and room and found the following:

1. They do not clean\/vacuum under the beds or around the headboard. It was extremely dusty and dirty. 
2. Travelers should put their luggage in the bathroom to avoid getting bed bugs. When I entered the bathroom, there was hair on the floor. Not mine. 
3. Not the best soaps\/toiletries provided. Soap felt so rough and hard it was like washing with a bar of clay. 
4. The room reaked of old. I can't explain it but it just smelled really old. The curtains were old and had holes in it. The TV was old. Everything was old. 

You pay for what you get. I'm not going to lie. I am so glad I did not get bed bugs after staying in the room. I did check the bed bug registry and there have been quite a number of reports. All in all, I got really lucky during my stay.
I just stayed here for CES 2010.  I found bed bugs in my room.  I will not be staying here ever again.

I came here recently and was pleased by my overall experience.  We got a sweet deal (2 cents Tuesdays) and were able to check-out through the TV so it saved us from waiting in line.  The staff is also very courteous (they wished us a safe trip to Los Angeles afterward!).  Despite the fact that the hotel may look a bit older, their rooms are still nice.  Nice bathrooms, 2 queen sized beds, and a sofa too.  No microwave or coffee maker though.  I love the location though and how it is right in the Strip!

This is the 2nd time I stayed in Bally's and was extremely disappointed.
We booked 2 rooms each with double queen beds in February. When we arrived in June, we were told double queen rooms are not available and we can only get rooms with one queen bed. The front desk offered a hall-away bed, but kept saying they are busy and refuse to give an estimated time of delivery. As a result, we called multiple times and still waited until 1 am to get the hall away bed delivered and slept late.
The next day, one of the room's lock was malfunctioning and we waited 2 hours to get it fixed. This interrupted our schedule and we missed some important stuff. Again, the front desk won't give an estimate on the arrival time of the locksmith, so we end up have to wait and wait. At the same time, the room need maintenance, the towel hanger in one of the room simply fell off. The worst part is, after all these drama, after we checked out, I got a bill charging the "roll away bed" for two nights! This is extremely ridiculous, we booked the room 4 month in advance, and got downgraded from 2 queen bed to 1 queen bed, you offered a roll away bed which arrived so late that we didn't sleep enough, and now you are charging me for the roll away bed. All the excuses you are using is "we are extremely busy". If Bally cannot provide satisfying service to all the customers, then please reduce your room number or hire more people! As a famous hotel in Vegas, it is a shame to provide such low quality service to guests. I won't come back to Bally's in the future and won't recommend Bally's to any of my friends.

Painfully disappointing experience at Bally's Las Vegas. You could not even pay me to return. 

Room was refurbished and nicely decorated as well as clean. It was poorly situated with an outside night club at Paris blaring music into room until 3:00 am so that I couldn't sleep. 

Extreme difficulties getting connected, and staying connected to wifi so that I could not work. I spent hours and 6 calls on the phone with their IT Vendor, front desk\/management and a visit from internal IT to resolve. Extremely poor customer service and lack of ownership in resolving problem. No internet instruction in room. 

Elevators were not working properly in tower. Waited 3-5 minutes for an elevator regularly. Was stuck once in elevator with another guest-call button did not work. 

Up charges and excessive fees to check in early\/late, use phone, etc. 

Vending machine costs $3 for a drink-dispensed wrong drink. 

Lobby extremely smoky-lacking good ventilation. 

Charged $122 deposit upon booking. Did not provide a receipt so that I could expense to my company. Called hotel to obtain a receipt. After extremely long hold times, was told that I would be emailed a receipt-it was never provided. Asked for a receipt at check-in, Bally's could not produce a receipt of the expense reflecting the date that I was charged. 

Overall, extremely poor customer service and lack of ownership of problems\/concerns. I will not be frequenting Bally's again.

Thank you to Bally's for a SUPERB VIP dinner at BLK Steakhouse to honor Veterans before the Veterans Day Parade tomorrow. The staff was AMAZING! The accommodations are AWESOME!  You must try their signature popovers. A BIG THANK YOU to Caesars Entertainment for your sponsorship of this event and giving my husband Bruce and all the Veterans the respect they earned.

This is my "go to Hotel" whenever I come to Vegas.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and affordable.  The hotel is adjacent to the Paris Hotel and has an aircon walkway with shops, bars and restaurants which line the walkway.  The Bally's is right across from Bellagio and Ceasars.   The Cromwell is also across the street.  Just 2 hotels north, you are at the LINQ where the Bolt Bus stop is located.  This place places you in the center of everything.  Theres construction right now in front of the hotel, but don't let that discourage you from checking in here.  It doesn't affect your stay at all.

Booked Ballys for our 3 night getaway and we were disappointed. Went to check in at the hotel and the staff was great. Eventually made it to our room which was outdated by far. The bed was low and rock hard. The couch in our room was falling apart. We booked a room on the strip and received a room looking out over the roof.Very disappointing. Overall the room was clean but I dout we will be returning. **We did attend the Jubilee show in the hotel and it was WONDERFUL! Worth your time! :)

Despite all the bad reviews I went ahead and booked this hotel through Groupon. Upon checking in I was given a non smoking 2 queens in the Jubilee tower. Which to my knowledge is the "newer renovated" rooms. I stayed here for 3 nights with some friends to celebrate my birthday & we had a GREAT experience. Our room was directly facing the strip, you could see and hear Drais nightclub. If you're drunk and going to sleep pretty late after the clubs the noise is not a big deal, we barely heard anything from the strip when it came time to sleep. One of my friends had a junior suite in the indigo tower, and you could tell how old the room was... (Also the AC did not work) If you're young and in Vegas to party I suggest staying here in the Jubliee tower if you can. It's affordable and right in the middle of the strip. Only thing my friends & I found ourselves wishing for is a microwave lol.

PROs:
convenient location, middle of the strip
great, nice staff
walkway to Paris
live bands playing pretty cool music
escalator out to the strip

CONs:
usually known for having more older people there
casino could be bigger, but i'm not a huge gambler anyways

Stayed at Bally's last time we went to Vegas because we got a really good deal. Yes Bally's needs a remodel because it's one of the older hotels on the strip... but it has one of the best locations! Right across from the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. If you get a room in the south tower you can see the Bellagio Fountain show. The service at the front desk, cleaning ladies, and bell hops were all really friendly to us. The rooms are simple... they aren't fancy like the Aria or Venetian but for the price you can't really complain.

Beds are VERY uncomfortable and cheap(I can literally feel all the mattress springs poking me) as well as the pillows. Calling the front desk gets you strait to a very long hold line regardless of the hour. Terrible room service that ends at 1pm and it's an outdated hotel. The worst hotel I've stayed at on the strip by far. Avoid

While an effort is being made by Bally's to modernize and update the property they fall short still when it comes to their rooms still.  The added shops near the Boulevard on the former wasted space in front is very impressive and the upgrades in the food court area downstairs is coming along. Hard to find or even be aware of unless you are heading to the monorail but open 24hrs if you get any late night cravings.

Now the room. They are clean, bathroom has nice fixtures and tiling. Furniture is modern minus the bedding and love seat. In my room you can feel every spring in the mattress which the label says was manufactured in 2001.

For value, weekday value is reasonable but don't expect the same for the weekend.  You may be disappointed. Check in a bit slow but average for Las Vegas. Expect a line almost any time of the day. 

I will be back in another month so for now I will give the benefit of a doubt that perhaps this room is the exception more than the rule and a work in progress.

During my stay on a Monday night:

Cons:
- Poor communication. I got an attempted charge of $15 early check-in fee without an explanation. I got one bed after I specified two. No clear explanation of the mandatory resort fee of $18 which is also taxed to a total of $20.16. Was told I would be charged at check-in, when actually the charge was at check out so I spent a lot of time trying to clear all of this up.
- This new mandatory resort fee of $20.16 includes everything that you were offered before with the exception of free wifi for one device. You can't refuse this fee.
- Broken elevator
- Many many broken slot machines, including the huge one exiting the casino to Paris
- Escalators were off the entire stay
- The entrance outside was dirty with a lot of old cigarette butts on the floor
- Generally unhappy looking staff the majority of my stay

Pros:
- Clean room


I would have rated this hotel 5 stars for my multiple stays three years ago. It doesn't seem reasonable to slide in extra charges when the quality and service is declining.

Affordable clean and location location location 
If you want to stay in the strip and don't want to waste too much money on hotel room this is the place to be

Ok, for an old classic, Bally's is not doing so bad. The room was pretty good, spacious and clean, the view spectacular although we had Trump Towers in our gaze, the bathroom was updated, and it was quiet. The worst part of Bally's is the unevenness in the service. Some personnel are terrific, like the folks that work at the pool, very skilled in customer service with patience and a super friendly attitude. Then there are others, like the ladies at the desk of the spa which is the gateway to the workout room. Rude doesn't begin to describe it. Since it connects to the spa, Bally's requires a photo ID for everybody and charges $22 for additions people over two from each room. Ok, but how about telling us that before we get there and don't have our wallets? Then, how about saying "sorry". It's kinda that way all across the experience, and the bad exchanges ruin what great employees do well. So we are ok that we chose to go classic with Bally's this time, but not sure we will come back. For us, we may just pay the extra to get a great all around experience like you get at the Bellagio and others.

I loved my stay at Bally's.

Its not as cool as the other hotels or as new but for the price, it was great.
I love the locations, Practically in the middle of the strip. You're right across from Caesars and Bellagio. The pool area could be a little fancier like other Vegas pools but it gets the job done. The Bar by the pool makes really great drinks. The rooms were clean and we did get a decent upgrade. The staff was great. My friend got really drunk and threw up all over the carpet and they did a great job cleaning it, poor ladies. The bathroom was pretty nice. Our room was spacious. I would definitely stay here again but there's so many hotels in Vegas that I wanna try them all! I would recommend this place for someone who was looking for a great location on the strip  and looking to stay within their budget.

Solid stay for cheap. On a holiday weekend we had to pay $20\/night to get upgraded to the north tower. Check-in was quick, and we were in 2 hours early too.  Beds were comfy, place was quiet, room was spacious enough.  

Location was awesome, on a chilly night we still had our choice of gambling between Bally's & Paris since they're connected and I never had to go outside and freeze.  Caesar's, Planet Hollywood, and Bill's, all high on my list of favorite places to gamble were within 5-10 minutes walking. Considering it takes like 10 minutes just to get from room to lobby in the Bellagio, I was quite pleased not to waste time. The side exit makes the trip to Ellis Island even faster!

Minor complaint is that the shower head sucked, it was all misty (whaa!) and you can't really control the temperature of the room. Either all rooms have heat on or all have cold on, and of course they had already turned the heat off for the spring but it was still like 50 degrees outside at night. :(

OMG. A third-world experience.  Refuge camps are cleaner and more attractive. Dirt, stains, ding everywhere.  Old analog TV with a rat's nest of wires mounted on a scratched up table.  No blankets -- kinda like a hospital room, only filthy.  Hookers won't go to the South Tower -- too low rent.  Heard the North Tower is a lttle better, but do yourself a favor and go to a real hotel.

4 Stars.  Yay!  I'm a fan.

I have stayed at Bally's around 5 times.  Never had a bad experience.  I believe I've always stayed in a 2 queen bed standard room.  Very nice rooms and of course because this is Vegas it's a nicer room than other standard rooms.  Never had any issues.  Casino isn't the newest on the strip, but, has everything you need.  Plus, if you are in Vegas, you will be walking around everywhere.  Rooms are good priced.  I usually fly and get a deal from one of those travel sites.  I don't think I ever paid more than $100 a night (probably less) with flight\/hotel deal.  Nice price and just fine hotel.  

They allow pets also!  On a roadtrip cross country from Chicago to San Diego my friend, cousin, 2 dogs & a cat stopped in Vegas.  Now, we aren't planners.  We knew our end point (San Diego, then back to Chicago area), but, we didn't plan hotels in advance.  We stayed mostly at La Quinta's due to their free pet policy.  In Vegas we had some issues finding a pet friendly hotel.  There wasn't a La Quinta close by so I think it was the middle of the night, maybe around 4am and we were calling around to find a pet friendly hotel on the strip.  Bally's had a pet friendly room available.  Now, it was a bit costly last minute.  Just a normal 2 queen bed room and it was multiple hundred (I forget the exact price, but it was up there.  I want to say like $700 for 2 nights if I remember correctly).  We went in late August 2014, so I don't think it was like a huge tourist time.  We needed a place to stay and we had been on the road for over 15 hours so we split the cost and stayed here.  I docked one star because I feel the price was a bit on the high side.  But, overall, still a great room and great time!  To get to the outside dog area we had to take an elevator and walk through some shops and food court.  Nobody bothered us with our dogs.  If you need a pet friendly hotel, give them a call; but, be sure to book earlier to hopefully get a better price!

Another great thing in this hotel is the Sterling Brunch!  WOW.  I wish I still had pictures of this.  It was again a bit pricey, but, well worth it.  I think around $80 a person.  But, you got unlimited champagne and food.  They had a buffet of high quality meats and seafoods, but, you could also order select items such as eggs benedict, caviar, and some other choices made to order.  Tons of dessert options as well.  Well worth it if you have some extra cash to spend on an amazing brunch and you have some time to spend as well (so you can make use of the free champagne)!  We got so many different food options, champagne, and like 4 dishes of caviar; I think we got our moneys worth!

OOOO, not a fan.  Outdated, smelly and tacky.  The only redeeming factor is their huge sportsbook and decent Thai restaurant.  

I was actually offended when I went into one of their bathrooms.  It was just straight nasty.  I've seen better bathrooms at highway rest stops.

(HEARTLESS HOTEL) Been coming to Las Vegas over 30 years & this is the first time Bally's was going to charge the Early Check in fee of $22.00 (before 2:00) I arrived there at 1:15! Oh well, they now have to pay the price of loosing a future customer & a bad review.

This place has got to step up it's game to compete with the big boys. First off, fix your damn entrance because the elevator was broken and it was 100+ degrees in the shade. Second, I am hoping you go the way of The Frontier and renovate. Survival of the fittest.
