Well... after booking a room  on "getaroom.com" at Paris in their "older" red rooms, (upscale, excellent bedding, squeaky clean...a small amount of cracked and peeling paint did not bother me in the least ) and seeing the difference here at Bally in the Indigo tower was really, really disappointing. Just think: tall, dirty, cheap motel.    Yuck.     I even paid 20. to check in early for placing our bags in the room and it just got worse and worse.   Scratchy sheets, old furniture, filthy stained ironing board, no conditioner and a travel sized hairdryer.    Turned my hairstyling from 5 min into 20 with only 1200 watts. Will I stay here again?   No way.  Even the hotel seems smokier than most and it stinks out by the pool.

I've stayed at Bally's twice now, once in newer rooms and once in the cheapest room. The newer rooms are comfortable, on par with any mid-scale nice hotel chain. The older rooms are...old and worn. But if you need to stay on a budget and want to be in the middle of the Strip, there are few better choices. It's true, the location is really hard to beat. This is especially true when using the monorail since there's a station attached. "Who uses the monorail in Vegas?!" I do - it works.

I also like the table games at Bally's. They're usually cheaper and don't have hardcore players at them. I found a $5 Texas Hold'em table that was a blast, especially for those who aren't serious poker players but want to play (the tournament rooms on the other hand are too intense). There's also sports betting and cheap food options in-house.

So not the nicest place to stay, but if you're on a budget or can go with an upgraded room, Bally's is just fine. Plus you're in Vegas, you shouldn't be in your room much anyway, right?

Stayed 2 nights at this hotel for a convention. The beds were hard and you could feel the wire that wraps around inside the mattress. The pillows were like rocks. My husband & I had the worst 2 nights of sleep in any hotel we have ever stayed at. The patrons were load, yelling, and slamming doors with their music on so loud. No one came to quite the situation down. We left there so tired and exhausted from no sleep. There were 2 other sets of people we meet in the elevator that said the exact same thing. wiped out in Bally's and it wasn't the money.

The.Worst.Vegas.hotel.ever. Here for a convention. Check in took about 45 minutes on arrival. Unlike nearly every hotel in Vegas You have to pay to park. When I checked in the front desk said I could call the business center to have my "hold for arrival" packages delivered to my room but when I called the business center they said I had to call the bell stand to deliver from the package room and when I called the package room they didn't answer so I left a message and called the bell stand. When I called the bell stand to have them delivered they said they don't deliver packages since they are "teamsters" and they don't do that. When I told them they should tell the front desk that this is the case so that future people don't have to go through this same exercise they said they are not going to tell them anything and hung up on me. 
Nice customer service. Another 45
Minutes of my life I'll never get back. Ghetto as ghetto can be. Do not stay her no matter how cheap it might seem by comparison.

Centrally located on the Strip, so it's very convenient especially for the price. However, the hotel is pretty old and not as well maintained as some of the adjacent properties. Valet was friendly and quick. We used them several times.

Room was in the South tower (floor 64 which is really like the 6th floor?) and overlooked Paris's pool and Eiffel Tower. Accommodations were about the same as as you'd expect from a Choice Hotels property (Quality Inn, Comfort Suites, Econo Lodge, etc.)
Meh. Slightly less expensive than some of the other hotels, dated pool, wasn't offered any drinks while in the casino, nice room, good location and close to other casinos.

We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. We had an indigo tower queen (not a renovated room) and the room was great. Quiet floor, clean and roomy. Room had a safe (an old safe, but none the less a safe). Toilet was kinda slow, and the water pressure of the shower could be a bit better. The beds were firmer than I prefer, but the sheets were nice. TV doesn't have many choices of local tv or even movies to buy, and I could be wrong, but it appeared that room service is only served until 1 pm or so. Casino is kinda busy- lots of foot traffic and a bit of an older crowd. Check in and out was easy... there was a convention in town so he check in line was super long. But what looked like a 40 minute wait turned out to be less than 15. Staff was professional, friendly and very efficient. The hotel has a great location (took 15 minutes to walk to the Aria). We did self parking and it was a pretty simple walk if you are staying in the indigo tower. Would definitely consider staying here again (paid $67 a night+ $28 daily resort fee) if the price is right.

This place was not expensive and the location is perfect.

BUT....

The rooms were pretty dirty though. There were stains on the bed that made it really hard to feel comfortable. The floor needed a good shampoo. I feel the bathrooms could have been cleaned a bit more. But honestly, for 40 dollars a night in Vegas it was not that bad at all!! I would come back here if I was broke and couldn't find another hotel. 

Also, if we checked in early they charge your account an additional 17 bucks. I didn't mind because I went during EDC weekend and I wanted to make sure that we got a nice room.

Had a girls weekend withone night comped room an a partial comped room on saturday. When we arrived the room smeled like an ashtray an was a nonsmoking room. The strup view was of tropicana an a parking lot. No fridge, coffie maker or microwave. We where moved to another room on the same floor with a strip view. Not the best view but it was the strip kinda. They brought us a fridge an asked for more pillows they brought us two blankets, they didnt have any more pillows. The room smeled less of smoke. This room was the indigo. I have had better rooms at LaQuinta inn. When we asked for a discount on the one night we where declined. We will not be staying at this property again. Very disapointed.

We were in town over the past weekend for a softball tournament.
Everything was great. 
Got to the hotel, gave the keys to the valet guy, and we went about our way.
Hotel room was amazing.
Enjoyed the stay with our friends.
The next morning, we went downstairs to get our car as we had to make our way back home to Los Angeles, we gave our ticket to the valet guy at the cashier window and he had a confused look on his face.
He proceeded to ask me if we had checked our car out at any time last night.
We made it clear we did not, we brought it in around 730p the night before and it wasn't until now we are showing up to get the car.
He had us wait for over 20 min and nor he or the other guy they called for had any idea where my car was.
Turns out, the guy that "checked" in my car the night before never really checked in the vehicle in the system, used the same ticket number for another vehicle, registered that vehicle and it showed in the system that my car was gone.
I was livid.
Finally, after another 10 min wait, they realized there were some tickets on the ledge of the window that had gone unregistered and of course my ticket was there.
I'm standing there thinking, "you looked at these tickets a couple of times, I described my vehicle to you, as well as spelled my last name to you like 5 times and you're gonna tell me you didn't see it in front of your face?!?! C'mon!!"
To top it off, they still had the nerve to charge me $18 for the parking.
If it wasn't for my fiancé that was there with me, I probably would've went off on them about having to pay for something they screwed up.
My fiancé paid, we got the car and he didn't tip.
The guy gave us a dirty look because we didn't tip.
I'm sorry but you had us panicking someone else had taken my car.
Be glad we still paid for the parking.

All i have to say is they have the best pillows! Lol. People complain bc its outdated. My room seemed newly remodeled. But even if it wasnt, i was just there to sleep, i mean its Vegas! Theres no time to be in the hotel room. Check in was quick. I got an email on y last day and was able to check out through there so i disnt have to wait in line. Oh! And the britney spears slot machine..... the best!

Terrible staff. I bought a overpriced burger at Johnny Rockets IN THE HOTEL and then wasn't allowed to bring in my food to certain PARTS OF THE HOTEL so I could not see my daughters dance awards in that area.

Ok so first off this Hotel is NOT meant for anyone under the age of 40... At all.  The rooms were not that bad but the whole crowd was not fun... at all.  As our group of 6 girls walked through the hotel to go out  in our dresses we could sense the sneers and snarwls from the old ppl who didn't realize that we where wearing 5x as much clothing as most girls at that time of the night.  Get over it. Its vegas.  

Only real food option was that stupid Tequilla grill which Im sorry but EVERY time we ate there, regardless of whether it was slow or busy the service plain sucked.  A manager even came out to our table, asked how we were doing ( only because we where 6 girls in our dresses) and as we told him that service was horrendous, merely told us to come back tomorrow and he'd take care of us.  Thats not customer service buddy.  Staff ur damn restaurant accordingly, train your employees and don't pretend to be a manager if you aren't committed to making sure your patrons are enjoying themselves

Only reason this hotel gets 2 stars is because it won me money... well then took it.  But Brian, the really cute, tall dealer at the Roulette table made us laugh and definitely made the gambling aspect of my trip a whole lot more fun!  Was up a couple hundred until (typical me) decides to double my $ at 5am when Im trashed.  Note to self: NO MORE 100$ BETS ON BLACK, and when a dealer tells you to put 25$ on a number... you should probably do it.  Cus i would have been a WHOLE lot happier if i had only listened.

My heart is broken.  After an almost ten year relationship of love, excitement, and blackjack, Bally's has betrayed me and there is nothing more bitter than a blackjack player scorned.

Here is why, my dear players: did you notice that delightful party pit with the shiny lights and pop music?  Hard to miss, right?  

All that glitz has a dark secret.....6 to 5 blackjack payout on a six deck shoe.  Okay, I admit I'm dramatic, and that Bally's does post the odds.  But, the only payout acceptable in blackjack with a shoe are 3 to 2.  6 to 5 are reserved for single deck only.  They are hoping you don't notice and\/or don't care.

Okay, on to the more hurtful part.  These BAD odds are reserved for the lower level (10 dollar) tables.  If you'd like to bet more than that, you are buying the better odds.  Is this the gambling equivalent to "trickle down economics"?

So, in the tradition of all things grass roots - please demand tables with the fair odds.  You do have a choice, so vote with your dollar.

And to Bally's (and the whole Harrah's group), get rid of this greedy trend or we will take our 2-3 visits to Vegas a year to one of your competitors.

Would have put 3.5 stars if possible.   The property is definitely lacking when compared to its neighbors Paris and Planet Hollywood.  However, the price was pretty good $30 weekday and $100 weekend nights.  The room (North tower deluxe) was spacious, nice, and clean, but requires some maintenance to hide its age.

The casino is very small, food and shops are lacking, but there are some fun slots and cheap tables available.  

If you're on a budget, this is a good place to stay.  If you can afford more, Planet Hollywood is a better buy.  We've stayed at both.

This place is great. The rates are pretty reasonable, the rooms are nice and clean, the restaurants are good and the gambling is fantastic. I stayed here last year from July 13th through July 16th and I really enjoyed my stay. I also won a good amount of money, so that was nice, too.

The only issue I had with the place was the check-in time. I waited in line to check in for around a half hour or 45 minutes. I usually don't mind waiting, but they should have had more staff on hand. That said, my luggage WAS delivered to my room so that was nice not having to lug that big suitcase around.

Anyway, the place is great and is within walking distance of so many great places. I really recommend staying here!

If you're doing Vegas on any kind of budget, you need to stay at Bally's and avoid everywhere else.  Your money will go further here than at any of the cheaper hotels.

The North tower standard rooms are newer and among the roomiest on the strip for what you pay for.  The South tower rooms are older, and you might consider an upgrade.  It's generally worth it.  

The layout of the casino floor is pretty intuitive and clean.  Bally's rests in the center of the strip with relatively easy access to the monorail.  They have a soft poker room (which is little more than a cordoned-off area of the pit), and some cheaper table games than you'll find elsewhere.  At night, they have a great cover band at the Indigo lounge.  

Bally's also has an underground mall area with inexpensive fast-food type restaurants and shops.  Their sports book is also located down there, and although it feels like you're walking through a mall in 1986 with the reflective silver surface motif they have.

There's plenty of parking in the lot that's shared with Bally's sister property Paris.  It can be a little tricky to find at first, but I've never had a problem parking there in my five or six visits.  Bally's is my home casino when I'm not travelling with the fiancee.

There is no resort fee, but that also means no internet access.  If you really need it, they have a few kiosks, and you can buy time in five minute increments. I've never tried the pool, as I usually like to come off-season to avoid the famous Vegas heat (which is what kills you, not the humidity).  

A budget-tier hotel is never going to get five stars from me.  But as far as your options are concerned, steer clear of the Luxors and Imperial Palaces of the world and stay in the heart of everything.

We had a suite with a king sized bed at Bally's for NYE. It was pretty dirty. The shower was absolutely gross and the bathtub in the middle of the room was totally visible to other hotels facing your room. The shower is also surrounded by mirrors so if more than 2 people stay in your room, they'll see you showering or coming out of the shower.

The casino is pretty old and run-down. There aren't many amenities nor is there any good food. The best thing about the casino is that they comp'ed us so we got the room for free. I would personally choose the Venetian\/Palazzo\/Wynn over this hotel. 

If you need to stay within budget, imperial palace is just as dirty, but the location is much better. MGM\/Mandalay are similar in price also, but farther away from all the action.

Great experience! Clean room and WOW huge! Housekeeper was fantastic!  No problems whatsoever! 

We loved the Tequila Bar! Bartenders were super friendly and fast! And you couldn't beat the $2 Tacos and Margaritas!

this casino is of the old downtown las vegas casino feel..it is dated but centrally located. you will find good rates most of the time. the perimeter needs a serious power washing..not to bore you with the usually reviews, i will talk about slot machine gambling..very tight here.  doesnt matter if your playing pennies thru high limit..noyone was hitting nothing requiring a handpay..

go off the strip or just play at ca Indian casinos

I was there just this weekend. A\/C went bad and I called for maintenance at about 3pm for service. Left the room and got back in around 1:30am. Still no A\/C. Called again and waited untill around 3:30am for someone to come and change the filter. Still wasn't great. Also, on two occasions I came in and attempted to park valet. I remind you I'm a guest. Guy says "you gotta go park at Paris and walk over, unless you are a VIP or 7 Diamond member". I says, "I'm a paying guest".  No go so I park and walk. That sucks! At least at Mandalay they will valet all registered guests. No more Bally's for me.

Older Hotel.
Uncomfortable bed.
Floor\/ceiling above very noisy when people are walking.
Very loud toilet.  
Internet not free.

This is my second time staying at this hotel.
First time was 2 years ago and it sucked. I have to say the hotel upgraded a lot and cleaned up well.

Room- room was compt from my friends Player's comps. We got the jubilee tower suite which was a big room I would say about 950 square feet. More then enough space to hold a party or a room of drinks.
My only issue with the room was the AC. The room was to big for the AC to keep the room cool. Bathroom was kind of small for a suite. But decor was nice, and close to elevators, and a view of the north strip. The elevators were a nightmare. Only 3 elevators for the top 12 floors. One of the elevators was out of order so leaving 2 elevators in service. Sometimes we waiting as long as ten mins to get to the room, and cramed in the elevator. 

Casino-is nice and cleaned up well from the last time I stayed. Hotel doesn't smell old. Casino is not as big as the other hotels but it's also not crowded which makes it pleasant to gamble. 

Downstairs 24hr daily deli was awesome. 

Hotel-staff is extra nice and attentive and polite. They don't have sticks up their asses like some of the higher end hotels. Maid turn down service was fast and I honestly didn't notice she was in the room cleaning. She even brought us more water and ice and towels. Extra tip to her 

Over all this hotel was good. Only the elevators being slow and crappy is why this did not get 5 star.

Terrible stay. Came here through total rewards promotion.checked in and went to bingo promotion in ballroom only to be told I wasn't registered, yet I had booked online through total rewards? Took me an hour to get straightened out. First was told I could not participate even though I booked 2 weeks prior. Ordered chicken wings at tequila bar got chicken fingers?  Terrible stay ,1 lamp didn't have a bulb in it ?

Offended
(-)(-)(-) shady business
(+) helpful security and janitorial staff

I am walking through Bally's, and am looking for a specific shop for souvenir purposes. I am twice stopped by professional looking ladies, who never answered my questions of how to get to my store, and just ignored me once They realize I wasn't interested in what they were selling. Do they even work for the hotel? Bally's what were you thinking when you decided to allow this confusion to exist in your hotel? These ladies sit behind a booth in the center of the walkway labeled "INFORMATION", how more misleading can you be?
The only redeeming grace is the that after the 2nd instance, a janitor and an elderly security guard came up and helped direct us. A janitor. With his janitor cart. 

Plus points for awesome janitorial staff. 
Minus points for retarded hotel management.

I stayed here Monday-Wednesday night for a large conference for work. The check in was simple, the hotel room was clean and the amenities were fine. I do wish they had a fridge in the room but I understand the business aspect of not having one. 

The food court was fine, pizza, burgers, Asian food etc. 
The shops were all the normal stuff. 
The Spa or fitness section was used once, nice but not outlandish. 
The pool was closed but you could use Paris if you needed to. 

No shows or activities, most of the night was spent outside of Bally's. They did have some good cover bands on one stage. 

I would go again considering it was only $40 a night.

You get what you pay for..... crappy comforter and springy bed.. stained curtains, cheap shower and towels. 
For the price, you can't really complain... 

One major advantage is the location on the stip.... and right beside the mile mall where you can find loads of cheap eats..........
The location is mid strip which I'd ideal for staying on the strip.  The room was just decent nothing horrible nothing great.. The casino has nothing special pretty below average actually.

pretty great hotel as far as rooms, location, gaming is concerned but resort fees added to comp rooms is mandatory now. If the Internet speed were acceptable I wouldn't care so much but at one half a mbps !!! soo lame. stick with 4G folks
Bally's is a great hotel if you want to stay on the strip and on a budget  .. just don't do what we did .. fit 7 girls in one room.
Great clean rooms....very quiet on the  room levels...great friendly staff... Can't go wrong everything close to u.....

Had a rude female pit boss snap at me telling me that kids are not allowed in the casino. No duh.. I was merely telling my wife that our 2 year old child had issues sleeping. This occurred on 11\/27\/2016 around 4am. Things can be communicated professionally and non-professionally -- I experienced the latter.

If hardly anyone is in the casino, it's probably best to not shit on those actually staying in your rooms and playing your games.

I remember the first time I stepped into and stayed in Bally's was in '93 when I accompanied my Mom during a convention she was attending.  Granted I was only a teenager at the time, I had a buddy along so we walked up and down the strip to Circus Circus everyday.  Through the years, the Strip has changed but the hotel hasn't.

I've stayed at Bally's a few times after that and the rooms have had minor upgrades here and there, nothing major.  The rooms are spacious and every room we were in always had a sofa, which was nice.  The beds are dated and sagging but I've slept on far worse beds.  They still have tube TV's but hopefully that'll change.  One thing that I hope will change are their popcorn ceilings.  The bathroom was spacious but when the toilet flushed, it was loud, you know, that public restroom SWOOSH kind of loud.  Also, the shower head was some type of water saver so the stream of water wasn't quite strong for my taste.  There are no resort fees, which the hotel really touts but, they charge $13.95 for internet access, what a rip!

The casino has remained the same over the years and their little shopping area has slowly deteriorated.  I remember the pool was always fun, but it's been a few years since I've been there.

Several family members have told us to try out the Sterling Brunch on Sundays but warned us on this trip to probably skip it as the quality has gone down.  Well for $85 per, I'll take their word for it.

Overall, Bally's is an okay place to stay, it's in the center of the Strip so you don't have to drive out, it's connected to Paris and within a short walking distance to the other casinos.  Honestly, you can get one hell of a deal on your stay here!  It's not my first choice to stay when in Vegas but it's not the last!

Bally's was better than I expected.

We were in the older tower, but since we were also celebrating our anniversary, they gave us a free upgrade to a suite on one of the top floors, and it was really nice, with a great view!

The room was large, the bed was huge, the bathroom was really nice and all new with marble counter tops , etc. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

The pool was closed in winter, but Bally's guests could use the Paris pool and jacuzzis. which was beautiful and open in winter! The 2 hotels are owned by the same company, and also share the same parking garage.

The main thing I didn't like, which is what brings my review down to 3 stars instead of 4, is that the casino and lobby area were incredibly smokey. You just walk through and you end up smelling like smoke. I could not imagine working in that area, it would be like smoking 5 packs a day. It was just awful. It's probably because it's an old building and old ventilation systems, and has the old-school low ceilings in the casino. That ruined it for me and my wife, we could not sit in that casino and gamble, we had to go to Paris because the smoke was no where near as bad there. (Though I should add, everything at the Paris is way overpriced!) 

What I did love about Bally's is that it is connected to the Paris. I was attending a convention at the Paris and it was just a hop skip and a jump down a hallway from our room to the Paris convention hall. Bally's is also cheaper than Paris, and they say the rooms are bigger.
The front desk lady named Carrie very disrespectful. Stay away from this place. Sad way to start your check in.

Hot damn! They put me in a high roller suite! Free upgrade for the win!

Last month I stayed here for the first time while on a business trip. Bally's is one of the older casino hotels in Vegas but has a prime location on the strip, is attached to the Paris, and also is a monorail stop location. Think of it as a no-frills hotel going in and you will be fine, as it does offer some of the most affordable room rates around.

The casino floor and rooms are decent but showing it's age. Yeah, it can use a renovation and brought into the modern era. Overall clean, and the casino floor is laid out so it is easy to maneuver. A nice mix of old and new games. Low limits can be found on table games. You still get that feel of the old Las Vegas vibe here. More than enough spots to eat but nothing to rave about. Their Blu Pool is actually quite nice and a great spot to hang out at during the day. They have a terrific gym that is well stocked with free weights and machines. All the staff I came in contact with were fairly nice.

The downstairs level houses the shopping area which has a nice little selection of stores, a terrific sports book, and a small food court. You also have to pass through here to get to the monorail. Feels like a mall out of the '80's.

Now, I must have said the right thing to the front desk attendant as she hooked me up royally! I was joking around with her about getting the Presidential suite and she actually did put me in a high roller suite! Even funnier is that this was the kind of suite that you could imagine Sinatra and the Rat Pack hanging out in. It was old school cool. It was huge. Full bar, old style tv's and furniture, sunk-in Jacuzzi tub, large step up open bathroom and dual vanity area, floor to ceiling windows with an amazing view at night, and even a bidet! This room must have been the bomb back in the day. Well kept but a little worn round the edges from age and use. I could not believe I was staying here for about $40 a night. Crazy.

As with most casinos you have to pay a daily fee for internet access which sucks. Also, it's close to In-N-Out Burger with a few minutes cab ride! 

Bally's might not have all the bells and whistles of the newer mega-casinos on the strip, but if you're crashing in Vegas on a budget it's a solid choice.

From the check in to the Check out, this is one of our favorite hotels.
Now this is not the Nobu or Cromwell but you can't beat the value!

This is centrally located in the middle of everything. We love that it is connected to the Paris. we find ourselves wondering through both casinos and you can find lots of really good restaurants!

The employees are great from April to Vonn, this is why we keep coming back. The Valet is quick and easy, we see Mike there all the time and he is quick to get us going to our vacation :)

We love that there are refrigerators that you can actually use! Neighbors can be so so but it's Vegas baby! We will see you soon!

Although I do like to gamble at Bally's, staying there was terrible.  First, I realize that my room was comped; however, wouldn't that give them more of a reason to not put me and my friends in the worst room in the building?  I mean, I certainly won't be staying here again, so that baffles me.  Anyway, the room was disgusting.  Our room at the Travel Inn in the middle of nowhere the night before was even better than this.  I won't complain about everything being overpriced, since that's inherent in Vegas; however, simply based on the room, I will never stay at Bally's Las Vegas again.  I would much rather pay a bit more and stay elsewhere.
Bally's is my go to spot in Vegas.  I like Bally's because it's a great location, it's cheap, and it isn't a dump.  Got a free upgrade to the North Tower, which is nicer than the rest of Bally's.

Closer to a 3.5 stars.

Bally is located pretty much in the middle of the strip which was nice because it gives you access to both ends. Price is decent compared to the surrounding hotels such as Aria, Venetian, or even Paris.

Hotel room was not so fantastic but not so dingy. The hotel\/casino is one of the older ones so it reeks of smoke throughout the casino. However, they managed to keep the hotel rooms smelling pretty smoke-free! Pillows are weirdly soft...like marshmallows...your heads just sink right in. They did not have a War table in the casino and would send you to the neighboring Paris's casino instead. Parking lot was also shared between the two hotels. Overall, an average stay.
We were gambling here for an hour and it took 50 mins to get a drink. Such a bummer cuz it was close to midnight. You would think it would be sooner for a drink in Vegas.

Let me first say I'm not a gambler and the only reason I usually visit Vegas is for business. So my review is based on a business traveler's perspective, not a gambler here on vacation. 

I stayed at Bally's and the customer service was outstanding so kudos to the front desk people and all other staff - I was impressed.  I stayed in the North Tower where the rooms have been updated but I believe the less expensive South Tower rooms have yet to be updated. Either way, the rooms are large and so affordable compared to most cities that it is hard to complain - great value!

So why the 2 star rating? Three things. 

One, no free wireless. Come on! This is 2009. Worse, they charge you $14 PER DAY!!!!!  Highway robbery and it might sound petty but for this single reason I would not come to Bally's again. It's principle. 

Secondly, no coffee in the room. Again, come on. Go ahead and charge me an extra few bucks a day but please don't make me have to go to the lobby or call room service just for a cup of coffee. That's nuts.

Finally, the Spa and swimming pool, aside from being like a mile walk from the rooms, close at 6pm!  Again, what's up? After a full day of meetings I like to work out and take a leisurely swim. When I called the desk asking why they closed so early they told me it was the off season. Off season? We're in a desert. Is swimming ever not in season? When I pressed him he told me  they probably wanted people to go to the casinos. OK - at least he was honest :-)

I won't be back.

https:\/\/www.google.com\/amp\/amp.timeinc.net\/fortune\/2015\/11\/04\/fcc-hotels-wifi-blocking\/%3fsource=dam

I'm just going to post that article right there. I am a pretty avid Pokémon player, morning Facebook\/Instagram\/Snapchat user. It helps me wake up and allow my boyfriend and others to sleep in. I had noticed quickly I did not get great cell phone service inside the hotel. Not until I got completely away from the hotel. Meaning, not even under the side entrance roof. My uber map was a block away. Thankfully I called my uber driver before any problems happened. I'm fully believing this hotel blocks your cell service, so you get so impatient on waiting for things to load (correctly) that you end up buying the WiFi here. It's free within 24 hours for TWO devices. So if you have 4 people\/guests in one room, you have to draw sticks to figure out who gets internet. 

FYI Bally's. I wouldn't be surprised if someone came and served you with documents soon. 

Cons: No bathroom fan, or broken?
AC isn't as cold is should be. May be broken. It was about 70 outside, AC at 60 degrees and the room was still hot. The beds were worn, comforter was flat. Extra comforter thankfully in closet. Pillows good but worn. Towels were obviously worn out. Only 3 towels provided in a 2 bed room. Housekeeping took forever to answer their phone. 

Pros:
Early checkin if available. Cheap. In the center of Vegas Strip.

beware of bedbugs!! stayed there just for a night, next day recognized bedbug bites all over my body and face. Don't waste your money on this creepy hotel especially if you are allergic to insects or don't wanna give bedbugs a ride to your place! Im just disgusted!

Found the staff to be rather rude, maybe they are just used to dealing with unsavory people when it comes to complimentary drinks and gaming at the bar. Maybe they are burnt out and need young blood and energy behind their bars. We moved to a little bar across the street next to a liquor store that had some cheap drinks and good bartenders. A real dive, but if you like dives this one is a great find considering the location.   Then made out way to the Cromwell.

Suppose to be a pet friendly place but OMG, the designated place for dogs is like a dumpster. Only gravel and artificial turf. The turf is full of cigarette butts. Seems like no one ever cleaned it for years. I am never never coming back to this place.

Again not the best place on the strip but not the worst, by far. Ballys is a classic, one of the last remaining properties from the second wave of the Las Vegas Strip development. The rooms are a nice size, and clean. A tip, if you check in on Foursquare, you unlock two for one drinks at any casino bar (It unlocks every time you check in)! Now you have no excuse not to stop in and have a drink or three! Enjoy!

I will never be coming back here again. Not only were there a lot of inconveniences, this place is so unsanitary, I don't understand how this hotel is still in business. 

We booked a two-bed room and when we checked in, we were told that all two-bed rooms were filled. Uh, a little unprofessional but I'll let it slide, it's a convention and I'm sure they were very busy so whatever- it's only for one night and we dealt with it so as long as we had a roll out bed. We get to our room and discover it's a smoking room. We weren't informed that we would get a room like that either, THEN MY BOYFRIEND DISCOVERS SNOT ALL OVER A PILLOW. Disgusting, not okay. We call room service and ask for new pillowcases, some air freshener, and the roll out bed. The house keeper came with the pillowcases, but the spray and roll out bed never came.

Next day we get into our new room and discover blood on one of the comforters (I already posted the picture). I am so disgusted.... I don't understand how and why this is acceptable or unnoticed by the housekeepers.

Ambiance: Average
Room: Average
Service\/Concierge: N\/A (not used) 
Parking: free 
Location: Excellent

I was being comped for rooms here so I can't really complain in terms of value. The location is dead center so no complaints there. It is also connected to Paris hotel via the casino lobby and I happen to like the night life in Paris. The Sterling Brunch is a good attraction and you do get a discount if you stay here unfortunately I was leaving on Sunday and didn't get to try it. The room I stayed in was clean and didn't smell. The lobby is nothing spectacular and is functional. The Staff is can be hit or miss typical of casinos in this price range. I didn't go to the pool here so can't really comment on that.

We had a great view of the strip! 
Really enjoyed the room ;-)

Was a bit baffled though when I ask the hotel crew for a toothbrush as I brought my past but not the brush...and they said they ran out and that was it???

Anyway. Didn't eat here just stayed in the room which was nice.
great fridge! we definitely used it.

The pillows were so small and uncomfortable. The beds were overslept. Lots of tossing and turning until i found one spot where I try not to move too much. 

Taking a shower was such a challenge. Yes, we're in a draught so water conservation should be taken considerately but this is Vegas, a getaway, and we need to feel pamper. There wasn't enough water pressure from the shower head and I'm sure all the others ladies had to take thrice a long of a shower like me to wash off all the shampoo and conditioner. Did we actually saved much water in the end?

Caveat: this review is only for the Valet. With that said on to the case of theft at hand. Tip: do not use the self tendering machines at Bally's Valet.

The Story: when I left Bally's after seeing one of the funniest and entertaining shows on the strip (Miss Behave #MBGS- more on that in that review) we went to the Valet to pick up our car. If you park for more than four hours you are charged $18. Under four hours you are charged $13. FYI- No local is happy with this new parking regime and things need to change as this mechanic \/ cash grab is not the way to garner additional business. We arrived at 7:35pm for an 8pm show time and we left at 10:15pm. We went to the kiosk to read the ticket to "call for the car and pay". The kiosk read $18 and I didn't think anything of it as it's a computer and way smarter than me so I paid using my CC. After I received my receipt and was standing in front of the sign that states $13!!!!! the bells starting going off (or it could have been my mother yelling "what did you just pay for parking!!!"). I approached the booth and asked how long the machines have been stealing from locals and other customers and in turn got a supervisor to come by and discuss the situation. He agreed the machine was at fault for charging $18 vs $13 but said they have no ability to refund the over charge as they are maintained by a third party (as an IC). I was informed to call the Valet Supervisor and will do so tomorrow. Just wanted to give everyone the heads up that the kiosk are no bueno. You always hear people use the old adage "if I had a penny for every time...." well looks like Bally Valet's third party vendor has plenty of other people's pennies.

Pros: Bally's has a GREAT location. It's very central and easy to get to major attractions. 

Cons: Checking in took us just over an hour of standing in a very long line. That's ridiculous. We got to our room and it wasn't in great condition. There was a hole in the bathroom wall, many marks on other walls, odd (and gross) stains throughout the room, torn curtains, and they hadn't vacuumed underneath the tv stand in at least 6 months (it was off the ground and easy to access). All of this is forgivable if they make it right.  Called the front desk. No other rooms available. Not able to offer any compensation. Have to go to the front desk (where we had just waited for over an hour) to speak to the desk manager. Went there. Waited another hour. He never showed up. 

Upon checkout, I expressed our frustration in the nicest possible way to the person checking us out. She said sorry, but you didn't talk to the manager so nothing can be done. 

Spend the money. Stay at The Bellagio. Avoid Ceasar's products (Ceaser's owns Bally's and many others). They treat their customers poorly.

This hotel is old, yes. But honestly, you don't stay too long in your hotel rooms so who cares? I won $40 in the casino at the fireball slot machine in the penny slots section off of $5! As soon as i pushed 40 credits, i won! not too shabby. The rooms and bathrooms are very outdated. They could use some help on that one but for the price you pay, and the location, you can't go wrong. As far as inexpensive fare goes, there's a sbarro, nathans, japanese restaurant, a candy store, and a few souvenirs shops which exceeded my expectations. They also have a steak house and a really good thai restaurant (which i loved, please read more of my reviews). I enjoyed my stay and would come back. You seriously can't beat the location. If you don't like it, leave the room and explore the Vegas strip, you're right smack in the middle of it all!

Considering the location of Bally's on the strip, it's pretty decent for the price you pay. This hotel is located right in the smack middle of the strip and is a short walking distance to most hotels. Back during the partying-on-a-budget days, my girlfriends and I would walk from Bally's all the way to Wynn\/Encore in our FM heels with our classy red solo cups in hand no problem .

This hotel needs a renovation though! Some of the rooms still haven't even been upgraded to a flat-screen TV and the furniture is outdated.

The casino floor is chill and I love playing Wheel of Fortune in the "high limit slots" section. Let the dyke security guard strike up a conversation with you and she'll give you drink tickets for the bar :)

Drove to Vegas in the heat having made my reservation months in advanced. Requested early check in but instead they didn't have my room ready until two after the normal time.  I think the worst part was the crappy attitude the assistant manager had when I asked about it.  Plus they now change hotel guests for parking.  And while the pillow case had been washed, you could still see the trace of a blood stain.

Four dudes decided to go to Vegas. If you know the workings of Vegas, you'll also know that four dudes in Vegas equals a whole lot of spending.

That's why we decided to book the cheapest rooms in a classy hotel--kind of a cheap but great value combo deal. 

Bally's was the perfect choice. We paid around $80 for a couple of nights, but we booked early. It is a fantastic hotel that is decked out with everything Vegas,i.e. lots of shiny things, a casino, respectable rooms, a giant slot machine, etc...

Best of all, it is directly linked to "Paris" and thus offers tons of choices for dinner, shopping, and excessive gambling. It also served as a great home-base in the middle of the strip to visit the best bars, clubs, casinos, and the like.

I'd go here again for sure.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Best price\/value combo in Vegas. Four-star hotel that could not be better placed in the strip. Did I mention they have a giant 10-foot slot machine?

I was sadly disappointed with Ballys. The first staff member we encountered was great, a gentleman on the front desk, after dodging the salesman right in the front door. 
He upgraded us to a room that was on the 23rd floor, and sadly, it was terrible. We stayed 4 days and were so glad to leave. 
The smoking in the foyer nearly killed us every time we went down there, so much so that we would take the elevator to the basement and go out to the street the back way. 

The room was spacious, and the tv was decent sized. The sliding door did not open (it had been screwed shut), and there was no windows, making fresh air impossible. 
The walls seem paper thin and we were woken up at 3am every night by party goers in the next room. 

The buffet breakfast we had downstairs was TERRIBLE. Scrambled eggs was all I managed to force down and I left. 
Limited range of food, staff rude and it was $16.95! 

I went for a massage at the Ballys Spa and again, the front counter staff were quite rude. I had a coupon that I had received in my room and I handed it over but was still charged full price. When I queried them, it was like I had just stolen their last dollar. Eventually though, they did give a refund. 

My masseur was good with his technique but the constant coughing and sniffling was horrible. He was clearly quite sick with a cold or flu and should not have been at work. 
The massage went for 10 minutes shorter than what it should have. 

The food in the food court is terrible, although not Ballys fault. 
I would try and find somewhere else to stay in Vegas.

Maybe one of the worst hotels on the strip. Everything about the hotel is old, carpets stained, stains on the popcorn ceilings,  tile floors clean in the middle but dirty at all the edges, etc. I stay almost exclusively at Caesars properties (Bally's is one of them) and this is really an embarrassment. To make matters worse, I arrived befor the 4pm scheduled check in time and was told a room was ready for me, but I had to pay $15 to check in early. I argued that the roomm WAS READY and it didnt cost them anything to let me drop my luggage in the room, but they didnt seem to care. So I pay the $15 and later find out another person was told the same thing, but it was only $10 for her. So good job Bally's, you made $15 extra on me but I decided to gable at another hotel. That is what is called stepping over $20 bills to pick up a nickle.

We only stayed here because we won a free room.  We paid to upgrade to a suite hoping that would mean it would be nice...wrong!  

There were stains on the carpet, walls, and furniture.  Everywhere you looked there was something that made you cringe.  The sheets on the bed actually did appear to be clean so we were thankful for that.  

Our suite consisted of two massive rooms with floor to ceiling windows in each room.  It really had the potential to be amazing but it was impossible to ignore the lack of cleanliness everywhere.

The suite was so massive that my first thought was that it'd be perfect for a big group of friends.  Unfortunately, even if you could ignore the stains on the couches, they weren't exactly sleepable.  All three of the couches were rounded and wouldn't be comfortable to sleep on at all.  There was plenty of floor space, probably enough to fit 10 or more air mattresses so that's an option but I'm not sure I'd ever want to stay here again, even for free.

It basically seemed like they weren't really trying.  There were large stains on the carpet which made walking around barefoot an adventure.  You could tell that the corners hadn't been vacuumed in a long time.  The cleaning person actually left a dirty rag on one of our counters and there were chunks of something (use your imagination) in the sink behind the bar.  The couches and armchairs were the worst.  I have never seen anything like this before and I've stayed at some questionable places.  There were stains everywhere - these were large vomit or spilled drink stains and it was so bad that we never once sat down anywhere other than the bed.

This room was disgusting.  I could go on and on about a number of other issues but I'd rather not think about it.  I don't recommend Ballys to anyone.  There is the possibility that they have nicer\/newer rooms but I wouldn't chance it.  I understand that the larger suites like this are usually used by groups of party-animals so stains are more likely but this was extreme.  The carpet and upholstered furniture is past the point of cleaning and needs to be replaced.  I don't even think Good Will would accept some of the pieces.

Review #124 - 2017

May 24-26, 2017:

My 1-year old daughter and I stayed here for a few days while we met up with our family who flew in from Hawaii.  Most of them stayed at Bally's so they suggested that it would be better that we all stayed at the same hotel.  My hotel of choice when staying in Vegas is The Stratosphere because it is farthest from The Strip, yet still close enough.

The king size bed was just ok.  It was getting worn down and should've been replaced by now, I'd say.  The room appears clean to the eyes, that is, until my daughter started crawling around the room and found a piece of dirty toenail, picked it up and put it in her mouth.  I asked her what she was chewing on and I almost died when she showed it to me.

I don't know if they even vacuum these floors every time a guest checks out.  I don't even want to know what else they don't clean.  Never staying at Bally's again...

My friend got a deal and tipped the attendant checking us in $20 and he upgraded us to a suite.. nice!

Our suite was pretty nice but I for one have always hated how hotels smell. Reminds me of stale hospitals.. Bally's actually wasn't too bad and the smell quickly went away after I turned the AC on a little higher. The AC was already on.. tsk tsk for wasting! 

Room service did a great job knocking three times and carefully entering the room. We were too tired to get up until she came up. After she saw me, she apologized even though it was our fault for not making a peep to let her know we were still in our room.

We ordered room service the first night. I got the turkey club sandwich and my friend got the fish and chips. Fish was  okay.. it usually is to me. The chips aka fries were better. My turkey club was off the hook. The bread was well toasted, filled with good quality turkey, clean iceberg lettuce, sliced tomatoes, a smear of mayo and avocado! Loved!! Also came with a pickle which was great. Wish they gave two because I was rationing it out for the entire sandwich which btw was quite a pleasant stomach full!

I would stay here again since the location is good but not the best. It's definitely a walk or a cab fare that adds up to get to the newer casino\/hotels other than Caesars and the Bellagio.

Spent two nights here May 2016 with the family.   My  wife checked in online from Hoover Dam and picked up the room keys quickly at the front desk.  They have WiFi and the room was clean, but with a terrible view of the roof.  The remote was missing its battery cover.  

The Players Club really doesn't offer any good freebies.  There is a nice sports book by the pool with lots of tvs.  This casino does have keno, which we played for several hours but lost.  They have four craps tables, although the minimum bet is a little high, $10.  I was happy with the vibe at the craps table and was able to win $153 in a few hours with my wife.  By the way, the casino waitresses are awesome, tip them well.  I swear they were coming by every five minutes while we were playing craps and keno.

This hotel does have a small pool and they do give out free towels.  No diving.  Get there early for a deck chair in the shade.  

If you get a chance, visit Tequila Taquiria, on the casino floor.  This little gem has $2 càrnita  tacos (which are delicious) and a $20 pitcher of margaritas (from scratch, no bottle mixers) for happy  hour.  Sit at the bar, the service is great and the bartenders friendly.  

The location of this hotel casino is one of the best.  It is centrally located and right across the street from the Bellagio Fountains.  Also, it is one of the stops of the monorail.  Just in front of Bally's are the Bazaar Shops, which include Starbucks and Half Price Show tickets vendor.

Quick check in ,stayed in the Jubilee tower,rooms were very nice. Room cleanliness was good,not perfect Elevators super quick. Everything was good,Price was OK not cheap but it was 4th of July weekend.

This is a good place to stay when you visit Vegas. It's located towards the middle of the strip, so it's easy to get anywhere on the strip.  Another benefit is they also have decent prices, so if your on a budget give this place a try. If you get a room with the view, the view of the strip it's amazing. There is great shopping near by at planet Hollywood or even fashion show mall.

We usually just valet since it's quicker to enter right through the front, especially if you have a lot to lug around. Check in was quick, easy & the front desk clerk was nice & informative. We are locals but she gave us a variety of coupons & things to do in the hotel\/casino. We stayed here a Weds, days before Christmas, so the rooms were very cheap. Our room was the Indigo Tower Suite which was amazing because it is huge! At over 650 sq feet, it had a large sitting area, a king bed, with a huge view of the Linq's High Roller & Flamingo Rd. side of the Strip. The whirlpool was 2 steps above & center room which had 2 large closets on both sides, 2 large vanities, a separate bathroom, separate shower & even a bidet in another separate room. This suite was an amazing nights stay as we slept comfortably through out the night. We were the last room on the floor away from everything really so we never heard noise. We look forward to getting away for the night again.

Given the central location (connected to Paris, walkable to Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Planet Hollywood, and many other hotels) with extremely reasonable prices, it is a pretty functional place to stay if you're not looking to spend a lot of time inside your hotel while vacationing in Vegas.  Here are the basics:

Pros:
- Rooms are clean, spacious enough with good sized closet space, desk workspace and vanity. Bathrooms were clean and functional as well. 
- Room service is prompt and comes by often so that whenever we came back from breakfast or an AM outing, we always found our rooms cleaned. Room service also responds quickly to calls about needing extra towels, light bulbs, etc. 
- Blu Pool has plenty of seating and nice little ledges to sit on while you chill. Half of the pool is 3-5ft and the other side is 11ft+ for people who want to really swim. Tasty drinks and PBJ sandwiches were also on the menu.
- Online check out was quick and easy!
- Low betting minimums (compared to other hotels on the strip) for gambling.
- Ramen-ya  (located in their Grand Bazaar -- misleading name as it is not that huge) had some seriously yummy ramen!

Cons:
- No coffeemaker in the room. Really? It's 2015. Even the not-so-nice hotels back home have a coffeemaker.
- Check-in line was the slowest line I've stood in for a while. 
- Not much to do within the hotel. Not a lot to see. Paris has some stuff, but it's not super amazing either. What do you expect for the price?
- Tequila Taqueria. So bad it deserved its own review.
- Their salon. Jesus Christ. My friend had a question about whether they had experience doing black hair. Waited forever and a day for a staff member to finally come out and answer her question. And for those who are curious, she never directly answered, she just said "it's okay, it's just flat ironing." A red flag for anyone who knows and takes hair seriously.

I'm certainly a fan of this place. Nice, clean rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. We stayed in a room that was quite a hike from the elevators, but I suppose this may have been why we rarely heard any noise from the hallway. Like many others, we took a taxi from the airport, checked in, and explored the strip. Never once did we wander more than 1\/2 a mile from the hotel, so there was no need for a rent car, and therefore no need for the garage. Some of the outdoor moving walkways, escalators, and elevators were not working while we were there, which was really not a big deal. 
In all, not the fanciest hotel ever, but certainly a lot better than many, and quite reasonable in price.

Bally's hotel are not accommodating. Reserving a king size bed, non smoking room and paying extra to make sure this happens....sadly it did not happen. At check in, we were told they no longer have any king size bed, non smoking rooms so we ended up in a queen size bed, non smoking room at the end of a hallway. No complimentary upgrades and despite my fiancé's ankle issues, they did not care to see what they could do. In addition, the bed was uncomfortable and hard and the shower water didn't get very hot, it felt like we took cold showers. Our getaway that was initially planned to be fun and enjoyable ended up stressful and a headache whenever we returned to our room. Never staying there again.

We stayed in the non-renovated tower, and it showed. The place was clean, but the decor was ratty and tired. But, if this was the next tower to be renovated, then it kind of makes sense. One nice thing about the rooms is that they are huge compared to other hotels in Vegas.

The casino smelled of cigarette smoke, much more so that other casinos. I felt like my clothes smelled of it from simply walking through on my way to Paris.

Most of the people that I came in contact with were wonderful, helpful, and well trained. The only negative was the room service experience. Not only do they NOT serve dinner, but the lunch that I ordered arrived well past the promised delivery time and the telephone person was rude.

In the end, you get what you pay for. This stay was well worth what we paid, which was much less than other places nearby.

Next time, I will try the newly renovated tower.

Quick check-in, great rate, friendly and quick bell hops.  Perfect location on the strip (inside connector to Paris, next to Cromwell, across from Bellagio\/Caesars).  First stop on the double-decker tour bus.  Nice pool, jacuzzi (in spa). Great wifi access.  Comfortable, clean & spacious room with a great bed.  Never had time for TV!  Fast elevators.  Part of Total Rewards system of discounts. Came with a group who had rooms on 6, 15 and 23.  Easy meet-ups in lobby.
      Down sides--no in-room coffee or fridge, annoying face cream solicitors at elevator areas, one of THE smokiest casinos, few (delicious) food options within this hotel, concierge desk always had a line. Breakfast bakery stand always had a line.   Would be hard for me to stay elsewhere next time--was so comfortable here!

Stayed in the Jubilee rooms! Room was fantastic! The hotel itself definitely very smoky I wish they would put in some sort of filtration system. Make sure really tired. But overall definitely one of my normal places to stay. Will probably stay again.

El Bally's es un muy lindo hotel en Las Vegas en la zona de The Strip. Es un lugar realmente enorme, gigante, lleno de habitaciones y una entrada tan grande que hasta te perdes. Un espacio muy lindo que -obviamente- cuanta con un gran casino lleno de maquinitas y todo tipo de juegos de azar.

Pero si se preguntan por el hotel en sí, debo decir que las habitaciones son hermosas y mega cómodas, son súper grandes, la cama es enorme y genial, lo mismo el baño y el espacio físico en sí. En nuestro caso tuvimos una genial vista de The Strip desde el enorme ventanal, hasta se podían observar las Fuentes del Bellagio.

Puede que el Bally's les resulte un tanto caótico por toda la gente que transita por el lugar y lo enorme que es, pero Las Vegas y los casinos son así, al rato te acostumbras y ya te pones en sintonía con tal limado y genial universo.

El hotel en sí está muy bien ubicado, sobre The Strip y a pocos minutos en auto del Aeropuerto y cerca de todas las grandes atracciones de Las Vegas. El wi-fi funciona perfecto y te dan 9 dólares por día de crédito para el desayuno en alguna de las cafeterías del lugar. Los precios son correctos para lo que es el hotel, en tanto que algo que me resulto genial es que tienen expendedoras gratuitas de hielo. Sí, ideal para tomar unos tragos en la habitación. En fin, recomiendo mucho el Bally's, un muy buen hotel en el que vale la pena hospedarse.

OK they have an 'eclectic' group of people that come and go, and the kiosks are more for decoration (cool idea but they don't work).

We were upset since the kiosk was a bust (we came in at midnight but were told the room wasn't 'ready'), so we waited in line to talk to someone. After a pretty long wait, we were given our key cards quickly and went up to the 8th floor. OH MY GOD... we were given the (smallest) of the suites - we had reserved a run of the house room!!!! 

It was such a beautiful and huge space! So, I'm giving them 5 stars because that wow'ed me!

2.5 First time here. Not impressed with the service or the hidden parking lot (Google took me the wrong way)  - this review is only for the hotel thus far. Did an online check-in only to be in a line with no people besides 2 people at the counter that took a good 10 minutes to get to me. On the upside our comp room is much cleaner than I have had in other similar hotels, still pretty dim and old through the clean though. Wont be in the room much. I guess I need to gamble some more for a better room!  :)

4 stars for the cleanliness, location and price of the hotel but 1 star for customer service :\/ 
We arrived at the hotel around 4 pm and got in line for check-in (a long 30 minute line). After driving from LA to Vegas and sitting in traffic for 6 hours, we were so relieved to finally get our room number and key so that we could take a long nap before hitting the night clubs ;) However, once we found our room, we spent a good 15 minutes trying to get into our room with our 4 room keys. None of them worked... (you swipe your room key through a card reader). So we headed down to the lobby (we were on the 16th floor) and proceeded to wait in line for an additional 15 minutes to get the problem fixed. The man at the front desk was nice and told us to make sure that none of our phones were nearby when we were swiping to get into our room, because that would mess up the magnetic settings of the room key. We went back upstairs to our room and made sure all of our phones were far away and yet, none of the keys worked properly still :( (some of the keys would work after swiping it ten, twelve times). So we decided to go down AGAIN and see what they could do about our keys. We waited in line, they gave us new keys, the manager apologized and offered us complimentary water bottles (although idk how water would make us feel better after we'd spent 2 hours on this key problem and were super frustrated), and told us he'd send a locksmith to our room if it still did not work. We went back up to our room and the keys did not work until we swiped multiple times and by this point, we just decided to deal with sucky hotel keys .... We were all  just super annoyed because we had just wanted to get to our hotel room and rest for the night, but instead spent so long getting the situation fixed :\/ 
Another problem we encountered was when we called the front lobby from our room and requested extra blankets. We waited for a while and no one came, so we called again to check on the status of our blankets. The lady at the front desk said that we had a "do not disturb" sign on our door and for that reason, they did not knock to give us the blankets. However, we checked our door and there was definitely no sign on it so we told the lady. She then continued to say "Well, if you would like your blankets, please take down your 'do not disturb' sign so we can make sure you get them", even after we told her it was certain we did not have that sign up..... 
For these reasons, I'm not sure whether I would stay at this hotel again.

Room: Clean and spacious. Nothing grand or luxurious but when you're only paying $40 a night, you can't complain. Towels and toiletries were a aplenty.

Room Service: A bit pricier than what I remember, but hey, drag your lazy behind out to the mini-strip mall they have or to strip if you want to pay less.

Casino: They have a good amount of games but I feel that the clientele at this establishment tend to be a bit more geriatric; definitely not a place to mack on the lay-days.

Location:  Location is good, it's surrounded by tons of good eateries and other hotels (paris is connected) and it has a free shuttle to the Rio that runs every half-hour.

Overall: If you're just going to be here for a weekend or you're hardly going to be in your room, this is the place for you.Bally's rates are also ridiculously cheap for being a hotel in the middle of the strip so you can't really lose here (unless you're looking for luxury).

Recommended for: People on a budget, College kids or Older folk.

I am never EVER staying at Bally's again.

I've stayed here once before and had a decent experience, but this last one (which happens to also be my bachelorette wkend) was definitely my last. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS. I was looking for a hotel that had adjoining rooms in Vegas. I knew we were going to book about 4 rooms and I wanted all the girls to be together. I spoke with a couple of hotel reps and the ones who worked for Bally's said they had ALL adjoining rooms (meaning all connecting) - OK, let's go with Bally's then. They said they charge extra for adjoining rooms and I said fine. It's worth it. The charge was going to be $165 extra for 4 rooms, 3 nights. Cool, done. My OCD took over and a month before our trip. I decided to call in just to make sure the rooms were the way I wanted them to be. They said they were not completely adjoined, that they dont have rooms designed that way, but two sets would be adjoined. WHAT???? Why did I chose you over other nicer hotels then?!?!?!?!? I was FUMING ... but everything was already paid for so I accepted it and moved on.

The day we get there, it was super busy (it was Memorial day wkend). We waited in line for half an hour and the lady took about 45 minutes to process our rooms because it was a "complicated" one. I asked her if the rooms were adjoining, meaning two sets connected and she said yes. Guess what? We go all the way up to our rooms and they ARE NOT adjoining. There were no doors to connect them!!!! OKAY, pretty angry at this point. We go all the way back downstairs and spoke with the same lady who helped us. What was her explanation? She said she ASSUMED the rooms were connected. Well, you know what happens when we assume right?  It took her something like two hours to try to figure this out, and in the end, I couldn't get the connected rooms because they were all full. Who's fault is that? I CALLED months ahead of time to ensure the room structure, I PAID months ahead of time to make sure things go as planned and this is what I get? By this time, our girls were hungry and we had plans at 5pm that night, so they were getting ready and doing their makeup in the hallway. How inconvenient is that??? The rooms we ended up getting were in the same hallway, they were not connected, not even right next to each other. They didnt end up charging me for the adjoining rooms (better!) and also gave us $50 for room service. Still didn't think that was enough. 

It's been two weeks since this happened and thinking back on it still makes me angry.

Location Location Location!  We spent very little time in the rooms, so I don't have much to complain about as we were there for March Madness.  You can easily access other casinos which have a better vibe if you are looking for that.  Paris and Planet Hollywood are within 10 minutes.  The sportsbook could use a makeover and there is no buffet in the hotel.  The ceilings are low and my friend referred to the hotel as "Smoke Ballys" but to tell you the truth, I think they all stink the same.  Fast checkin and housekeeping was good.  The showers lacked a lot of pressure but I got over that pretty quickly.  The pool leaves something to be desired, but the Cabanas are HUGE if you want to rent one.  Overall not a bad place for the value, it just lacks the SHINE of the newer properties.

Two stars because the hotel room was dirty and smelled. It is a really old hotel and is not kept clean specially the carpet inside the room. 
We had to call the front desk for a fridge multiple times until we got one. And the room service was not responsive to the calls at all. They did not give us a later check out. 
The only good thing about the hotel is the location and the two stars are for location. I will not go back again

Considering I only paid $16.80 for 1 night (Monday, November 19th) I got a room in the south tower with an amazing view of Eiffel Tower and city center and partial view of Bellagio fountains. Room itself wasn't that impressive, but it served the purpose. Would stay here again, but finding the parking garage is hard!!

The location is the redeeming factor of this hotel. Upon check-in, we were told that our large party would have adjoining rooms. We happily went upstairs to our rooms only to find out that they're actually not adjoining but instead a few doors apart. Not the worst thing in the world, but still a hassle and required a trip down to the front desk where we were told they simply goofed and said the word adjoining but they don't actually have any adjoining rooms available then they simply brushed us off. 

We go back upstairs and our keys don't work to get into one of the rooms. Finally, after a lot of attempts, we get into the room to find that we only have 3 towels for our 4 people. So back to the hotel lobby for towels. The next day, we tried to use the keys in the afternoon and they didn't work. So we went back down to the front desk for new keys then back upstairs only to have the keys not work yet again. We had to call security to let us in and sometime today engineering will fix our door lock, but no time estimate and if we leave our room we won't be able to get back in. 

It's been a LOT of hassle with logistics of this place and a lot of trips down to the front desk without any sort of apologizing on their part. It almost seems this is routine for them. I would never recommend staying here and to us, the cheaper cost hasn't been worth the hassle we've gone through and tons of trips to the front desk.

Room is decent, spacious, clean.
I came here with my wife for our 5 year anniversary. We had a good time seeing Brittany Spears. 

No ironing board, for me I was pissed to find they charge for just about everything, gym yes you have to pay, safe yes please pay, WIFI should be WTF really I have to pay,
Oh and you gotta be joking me, room service stops at mid afternoon 1:00 PM.
Deal breaker will never stay here again.
The Orleans is off the strip but hell it's nicer, and easy to get comps for rooms.
Older hotel, but clean and cheap for a night when you don't want to drive home. Good service overall.

My husband and I recently stayed in the jubilee tower; room was overall nice. I wouldn't stay here again because it wasn't as clean and I hoped it to be. Furniture kinda dusty, bathroom wasn't top notch clean (found a hairs in the sink and floor), had a fridge but was not really working. Front desk check in took forever to check in, friendliness was lacking. I requested a non smoking room but it reaked  of ciggarettes. Went to the outdated pool, overpriced drinks and old sun chairs.The only good part about balleys is that the monorail is directly in the hotel. I think I've had better in the downtown hotels on Fremont street.

75% of the time I'm in Vegas, I come here. It's sort of like a second home I guess. I know where everything is located and I hardly ever get lost here. We did a conference here and used their catering service as well. Everything was exactly what I've been expecting. This is Vegas, it has to meet or pass your expectations. I sat at a blackjack table for a bit and came up a lot then I've decided I just wanted to play for fun so I started throwing benjamins away like free sample!

I really, really liked this place!  I didn't expect much, because it was almost a hundred dollars cheaper than hotels around it (Caesar's and Bellagio are right across the street), but I was pleasantly surprised!  The room was clean and big, and was very nice for a standard room.  The beds were very, very soft.  I ordered room service for breakfast and it came quickly and they catered to my special requests.  I loved the casino, my boyfriend and I kept hitting on the slot machines and we were making so much money on the crap tables!  Bally's is connected to the Paris so if you get bored of Bally's you can just walk over to the Paris.  There was tons of places to eat.  We only left Bally's\/Paris once to go watch the celebrities at the Palms because we went the weekend of the MTV Video awards.  Other than that, we loved Bally's!
Not a clean room. If we would've checked in earlier. I would've changed hotels. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone else.

I stayed here June 30-July 3, during some serious heat. The nights averaged 82 degrees!!!! During the day its was well over 100.
I stayed in the North Tower and the prices were decent, though I waited 5 minutes too long to book my room online a few weeks before and the prices went up by 25 dollars.
I recommend staying in the North Tower, apparently it has been renovated while the South Tower supposedly needs an overhaul.
The rooms were clean, spacious and the housecleaning was great. There were plenty of extra towers and toiletries available.
The location is key, it is right in the middle of the strip.
The only problem is that the pool is a long walk from the rooms, and the crowd is certainly far from beautiful
I will spring the extra 50 bucks for the Paris Pool or 100 for a pool with eye candy :-)
But if Eye candy is not your goal, you should stay here, the location and price is good.

The slots are not that great though and missing a few of my favorite games.

Haven't been in Vegas for over 14 years was looking forward to staying again for the 4th of July weekend. Was able to get a room at Ballys. Big mistake. The room was advertised at a fair price but when it was time to actually check out and finalized the reservation the price went up like 30% I could have stayed at a much nicer hotel for the same price.

My initial reaction is it is a dirty old hotel worh mold amd cracking decaying ceiling in the bathroom.  

The staff and customer service was mean to my family and I and was a poor representation of what a nice hotel on the strip should be. Not sure why the staff seemed so miserable but the service suffered heavily. We ordered and extra roll away bed and did not show up until 2:30 am after checking in earlier that day. 

Ate at a restaurant in the hotel, it was medicare and again way overpriced compared to other similar restaurants. Usually I give alot of slack for businesses and always give good reviews but this one seem to screw up every contact with customers. Not just small stuff like a grumpy staff member but real major issues like mold and no beds, 20th floor even looks like the building has shifted and the floor is leaning. 


My overall assessment is this place is over priced garbage. Pass and find something else. This will be a 4th of July to remember that will remind me to avoid anything with the brand name Ballys forever.

Definitely went in thinking the worst since we usually stay at the nicer casinos BUT decided to go with Bally's since I was able to get 3 Free nights. It turned out to be pretty decent. They even upgraded us to a Jacuzzi suite which had a king bed, couch, 2 closets, 2 sinks, separate bathroom, a whole separate room for the jacuzzi and even a baday.  Great location and dead center to everything on the strip. 

The pool was actually pretty entertaining. Because of previous reviews, we thought there were going to be just old, wrinkled people but there was a younger crowd. They even had a DJ and contests which include baby got back, kissed a girl, and bikini. 

I even forgot my board shorts in the room so I called back and they're mailing it back to me. Apparently I left my pj's and boxers there too. Sucks for the person who had to mail em but thanks!

Stayed 2 nights at Ballys.  Got a good deal on a jubilee tower room with a strip view.  Checkout took along time and it seemed like they didn't have the ac on so by the time we got up to the room we had to take a shower lol.  There was a convention in for the piercing association so that's why the line was so long.  I had gotten an email about being able to skip the lines & check in online but was unable to figure out how to do that once logged into the website.  Check in went smoothly & quickly once we got up to the desk.  The pool closes early at 8 pm, so we weren't able to check it out the first night, and the second night we spent 15 minutes walking from our room to the pool only to find out it closed 2 hours early that night because all the piercers apparently had it reserved.  This was a big bummer for me because the pool was actually nice and heated, and we spent all the time walking over to it only to have to get up and leave after 10 minutes to walk over to Paris where they do not have a heated pool.  It is nice you can use the pool at Paris, and planet Hollywood as well but I think the one at Ballys was nice since it was heated, it felt cold in the other pool because of it being so hot outside.  Other than that we had a good experience and everyone was nice and ready to assist you if you had questions.  One thing is that the toilet paper could have been nicer for us staying in a nicer upgraded room.  I stayed at encore & Tropicana during this trip and both places had considerably nicer toilet paper.  The room was quiet and ac worked well in the room, it even got a bit cold at night.

I'm not really impressed, at all.  My deal with these Harrah's properties is they offer you "comp" rooms, but charge you $25.00 per day plus tax resort fees.  Ummmm that's not "comp" in my book.  I'll stick with Station Casinos and Boyd Properties from now on,  "comp" means just what it means!

Check in at Bally's was a ridiculous wait, we asked for a room specifically so we could view the rooftop of Drais, Maya the front desk agent said ok, we wound up in a room no where near where we asked to be.   The room reeked of bleach, I mean eye burning fumes!  We called front desk who gave all kinds of excuses of why we did not get the room location we asked for, no apologies for the bleached out room and then no effort to have someone bring us a new room key for the new room they w were moving us too, same floor.  We had to lug our things back downstairs from the 23rd floor, across the casino to the front desk to get the new keys and then back across the casino to the elevator to the 23rd floor.  By this time were tired and irritated and we've been here what 30 minutes!   Did I mention that agent who checked us in is no where to be found, to apologize for not getting or simple request right!  I'm a hotel General Manager myself, I know customer service is key to guests,  I didn't have that experience with Bally's at all.

I was a little worried when I read the reviews of this place because we had already booked a non-refundable room.

We are in the Indigo tower and it's really quite nice. I will say it's a little outdated, but the room is HUGE and even has a vanity area outside of the bathroom which is a great perk. No steamy mirrors for makeup application!

I was mostly concerned about the smoke smell people mentioned. Maybe it's true in other towers, but I am extremely sensitive to smoke and this room was fine. The casino is just like all the other casinos here in Vegas, there are smokers. But I wouldn't call it any worse than the others.

The check in was fine, but the kiosks available for speedy check in wouldn't work for us. We still got checked in easily, so whatever.

For the location and the price you truly can't beat this place. Let's just hope it doesn't suffer the same fate as Wild Bills Gamblin' Hall and become a victim of the strips extreme commercialization.
We were there for a conference in April 14. Our room was filthy. Trash behind furniture was from St. Patrick's Day. Rug was in need of replacement. Wouldn't stay there again.

I am pretty disappointed with our stay here this past weekend.  The rooms service was clean but they need to wipe down the walls and change the stained shower curtain.  Also this was the most digesting part... We were trying to make sure we had everything of ours and we found someone's old clothes stuffed behind the chair.  It wasn't easy to see but it was still visible from the floor. Who knows what stuff could have been on those clothes since it is Vegas.  I went to let the front desk know how grossed out we were by the clothes and she said oh you should have let us know before check out so we could fix the problem. I just found out at checkout that there was some problems. I feel like there shouldn't be a problem in the first place when I am paying all that money to just stay there. It shouldn't be filthy when I have all these other choices to stay.  I will be staying someplace else from now on and I wouldn't recommend the hotel to most.
