Then, I look across and see the same guys that were playing with me the day before.  Awesome.... I won $35 and would have played more if my mom hadn't lost confidence and suggested we leave immediately.  

I have so many more stories but I'll leave it at one.  Bally's is the bomb diggs.

Just came back from a Sun-Tue stay and it was pretty decent!  
Checked in around 3:00pm Sunday and the front desk lady Sooso was super patient getting all our family members' 6 rooms on the same floor with 4 of them adjoining. 
Rooms (North Tower Deluxe room) weren't fancy at all, but were very spacious.  
The parking wasn't a crazy far walk from the room like some other LV hotels. 
The pool was a bit of a walk, but it was a good size for swimming laps.
Conveniently connected to the Paris Hotel, so you can easitly walk to it without going outside.

Only 2 minor complaint were:
1) that even though we were on a non-smoking floor (8th), parts of the hallway smelled like someone was smoking
2) the free hotel shuttle to the associated Rio Hotel only runs every 30 minutes and may not fit all those waiting in line, so you may end up waiting close to an hour in the summer heat [not worth it -- just drive!]

I stayed here last weekend, and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of our room. Spacious, well appointed and clean. Make sure to request the North Tower versus the South Tower. The location can't be beat, and I love the coffee cart across from the registration desk. I wasn't blown away by the pool area and our cabana, but that's a minor complaint. Great value!

Okay to be fair this isn't some high class casino with rooms filled with Doves.
Although,  I did a 5 night $200 deal with Bally's where I have to use the room before the end of this year. Can't beat that, especially since it includes weekends. I went to the counter, did my $20 tip trick and got upgraded from South to North Tower, w\/ view of the strip and fountain. Huge room for my GF and I, not that we really spent too much time there. The pool was actually alot of fun, one of the cabana renters gave us two beers and a half bottle of absolute vodka that the previous party left. 

That's why I love VEGAS, about $45 avg a night for an on strip hotel with a nice pool.

Travel DISASTER: This hotel does not even deserve one star. Ballys maintenance personnel ruined my personal property. They decided to unclog my sink without moving any of my makeup, makeup brushes, hair straightener, etc. The sink exploded all over the bathroom DESTROYING everything with black, thick liquid that flooded the floor and sink countertop. When I came back to my room after spending time on the strip they were in my bathroom cleaning it up almost trying to cover it up and pretend that it did not happen. It cost $809 to replace the makeup and hair straightener and they only reimbursed $431 and refused to refund any cost of room charge. AND it took 3 months to even obtain this partial refund after months of them ignoring calls and emails. WORST hotel experience I have ever had in my entire life. I would have rather stayed in a motel and got better customer service. Avoid staying here there are MUCH MUCH better options if you want to enjoy your trip in Vegas. Horrible...zero star experience.

Poor customer service for check in. Lines 45 minutes long- no joke.  Then get told my room I paid for early checkin for wasn't ready but the would give me a better view if I came back at 2. Ha! Nicer view room not ready. The room I ended up with is VERY worn and outdated. All outlets near the floor. No easy way to charge electronics. No outlets by the beds unless you want to unplug a lamp or cheap alarm clock. 
Revolting stain on carpet.
There have to be nicer places for the money!

VIVA LAS VEGAS!!!!!

Disclaimer - I've never stayed here.  However, I did, ahem, take a room for a test drive.  Ahem.

Anywhoooo!  The layout of the public areas can be a bit confusing, but I think that's on purpose.  The beds are nice and comfy, and the bathrooms have that posh - we're not in Kansas anymore feel.  They have excellent black out curtains for mid day napping.

We saw the most HILARIOUS thing while waiting for a cab.  A guy on his bachelor party fell out of a cab.  At first we thought he had been hit by something because the sound was so loud.  He was loudly thanking all his boys for coming to Vegas with him.  Gravity was his enemy.  At one point, one of the less drunk pals tossed the groom over his shoulder like a sack of potatoes to try to get him into the hotel. 

I am knocking them down a star because they did not have enough cabs 24\/7.  When this Diva decides it's time to leave and she's been wearing sexy heels, she needs a cab....faster than a prom dress comes off in a limo.
Stayed here for a week for a convention.  The room was decent and clean,  but the pillows smelled like sweat.  Kinda gross. Cheap and in the middle of the strip tho....

Girls weekend in Vegas was a success ! Myself and my 2 best friends stayed here from the 21st until the 24th and we definitely enjoyed ourselves. 

The staff was friendly, the location was great and the room was clean! 

Things that I not appreciate however were that when attempting to check in early they said the room was ready but it would be an additional charge of $25. Why ? If the room is ready it's ready! Talk about a money grab.

I was also disappointed when we got to our room that their was NO FRIDGE. We specifically booked at Bally's which was more expensive than Harrah's where we were also considering because we were under the impression there would be a fridge. We called the front desk and she stated they only have fridges in the jubilee tower. NOT COOL. We then asked if we could get a fridge and she stated it would be $15 per day ridiculous !

Decent but it'd try somewhere else next time or specify the jubilee tower.

Stayed in Bally's for my Bachelor party and it was FUN!!! the pit boss at the craps table knew me and all my friends there after 2 days. His customer service was great. He took care of us and didnt let anyone else come and bother us while we were shooting dice. He also made sure the waitresses got us drinks whenever we needed it. 

I've stayed in Bally's before and its pretty much the same customer service level as always. Nice and friendly. Had the best time of my life on that weekend.

Excellent front desk service
Clean casino
Jubilee is a MUST SEE before the original shows disappear from the strip
Starbucks right across their driveway
Don't pay for an upgraded room! Indigo jacuzzi suite used and abused. Great view... But trashed. See pics. Next time I will take my lazy self back to the front desk and downgrade. 
OUCH!

I've stayed at most of the hotels on the strip, but Bally's has been one of the worst hotels I've been in.

- It's the oldest looking with air bubble filled wall paper and crusty chipped paint. 
- They try to charge you $16 if you checkin before 4pm.
- All the other hotels always had toothpaste and other amenities, Bally's doesn't
- Furniture is from the 80's

The regular room at Palms Place makes the Suites at Bally's look like a joke.

Stayed here over the weekend for the first time and it will definitely be the last. First, on the way up we gave them a call and were told that the resort fee would be waived, and upon arrival we found out it was not even noted in the account. Next, our toilette was making noise the whole weekend and they did not do anything to fix this. You would think they would at least send someone up to fix this. All they said was there were no other rooms to move us in. The rooms and hotel are very outdated. You can find a better place to stay at these prices.

Great location, OLD sucky rooms.

Paper thin walls, sleepless nights as party people and tacky couples who yell at 4am broke my slumber.  

PASS.... vacation is suppose to be fun for all, NO fun if one cannot sleep.

BEWARE. They hire thieves!!! My cell phone (new iPhone 5) was turned-in to Security\/lost and found, by a staff member(he told me himself). When I went to pick-it-up, I was only given the case.
  The young security guy at the desk was suspiciously eager to find-out who my cell provider was. The security girl talking to him, when I arrived, was acting weird too. She hurried to the back, as soon as she heard me ask for the phone, and never came back. 
 If someone else had stolen my phone, they wouldn't  sit there and waste time removing the (hard-to-come-of) case. They would've just put it in their pocket or something. 
 This happened in January of this year. There was an ongoing investigation, and I therefore refrained from writing a review, until now. NOTHING was solved. The incompetent investigator couldn't discern anything based on the tape! I'm still irate by the whole issue (this was a special Xmas gift I got from my boyfriend). 
 
They have lost a great customer; I visit Vegas at least 7 Times a year and always with a big group. Only stayed at Ballys or Paris. We normally book 5 or more rooms! NOT ANYMORE!! MONTE CARLO it is, from now on. 
My cousin's friend had booked 10 rooms for a bachelorette get-away in April, but quickly cancelled after I told her about this incident. They got rooms at Caesars Palace, instead.

Got shafted by the cocktail waitress in the Wayne Newton Show.  Got two drinks before show started and she charged me $40, no receipt and then kept my change from a $50 until I ran her down after the show and demanded it back.  Found out later that the drinks are $15 each.  She and the bartender must have a good scam going on.  Complained to "Kate" the beverage manager and never heard anything from corporate as promised.  
Second part of a bad night at Bally's was the Wayne Newton Show.....it's time for him to retire.

Be careful!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Someone might be already in your room!!

They made same card keys for two groups. 
When I opened my room, someone was already in there. 

!!!!!!!!!!!

That means your baggage might be stolen anytime  by someone who has same card key as yours or someone might come in your room when you are taking shower!!! That's not safe at all!!!!!

They didn't take this serious,didn't even show sincere apologize , just said"I can give you a free upgrade."

We asked for manager, but they said manager was not at front desk. I asked them to tell their manager to come to out room to explain this situation, but he never showed up. 

That was my worst experience in Vegas.

Fucking bullshit
Paid for a king. Got to our room and it was a nasty old queen murphy bed room. The lady who checked us in didnt even bother to tell us they downgraded us cause they ran out of king bed rooms. 

Will never ever ever be back.  Fuck you Ballys.

Nothing like coming back to your room after a 16 hour day and finding out that room service is only for breakfast so you have to go downstairs and wait two hours in a smoke filled room for a to go order.  Then finally getting to sleep at 1:30am with a 4:00am wake up call.  It costs $25 to use the gym and it closes at 6:00pm.  Room is outdated.  We were constantly bombarded by kiosk sales reps everytime we walked from the elevators or to the monorail.  After spending $4000 at the tables, spa and slots and despite being a Diamond Reward mwmber, I couldn't even get a late checkout.  I could list 50 other issues but why bother.   The whole place is a joke.  No wonder the Caesars franchise is in bankruptcy and facing federal charges.  On a positive note, Buca di Beppo is amazing and even serves breakfast.

I rented Bally's from a Priceline secret hotel package. I had gotten a decent price ($160) when hotels in the area were skyrocketing between $350-$700 a night...yeah Rock N' Roll Marathoners. I wasn't sure what to expect from Bally's, all I knew was that it wasn't a dingy 2-star hotel and that it was Center Strip in Las Vegas. 

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Our room was the basic room deluxe, but it was very roomy with a huge bathroom and very comfortable bed and living area. We didn't eat at any of the on-site restaurants, but they did seem to have good food and people frequented them quite a bit while we were there.  We did eat at the food court a few times, nothing amazing but they had their standard fast food fare (burgers, pizza, hot dogs, etc.). 

The casino was smaller but had good slots and tables. The drink service here was probably the best we experienced the whole time we were in Las Vegas. They were very welcoming and not stingy at all with their customers. 

The location of this place was great. Right outside of an outdoor shopping center and center strip. You could easily walk from Bally's to anywhere on the strip. We really appreciated that. It is also linked to the Metro line, we didn't take it, but it was a nice option to have.

Horrible customer service. I reported a broken foot rest, wet floor, and trash on the bed when I checked in, and received no apology or solution from a condescending employee. I asked to have the foot rest fixed and was told it would take 30 minutes. 6 hours and 3 calls later I cancelled the service request. It seems as if the staff doesn't have the guest's interests in mind. I'm extremely disappointed.

I caught and squashed a bedbug in my bed in the Indigo Tower. I called the front desk and they moved us. I thought that was pretty decent until we went to pick up the new keys. The woman was insinuating that we had made up the bug to get a better room. I suppose she thought I had brought the picture I took of it with me. I didn't.
I gave three stars because they did do the right thing in moving us and, until the disgusting bug, the room was decent. 
We also really enjoyed dinner at Buca and the 80s band in the Lounge.

I WOULD RECORD EVERYTHING THE FRONT DESK TELLS U. Apparently none of the employees honor anything they say. At check in, the girl had told us there was no resort fee which was strange to me since I had looked on Ballys website and was ready to pay the mandatory resort fee. I made sure to ask her a couple times but trusted the girl and figured it might be a new year and things might've changed.I refrained from using the internet, the fitness center, and the phone, which is included in the resort fee. A day after checkout, we were charged the resort fee on our credit card.I was appalled since I didn't even use any of their services included in the resort fee and got an overdraft on my card which was why I wanted to use cash. I was hung up on 2 times rudely by the front desk when I called about it, when I was able to reach the supervisor, she was equally as rude and said the employee that helped me was very thorough so pretty much calling me a liar. Not to mention half of the lights were out in our room, there were questionable looking stains on carpets and walls. I especially felt uncomfortable during the night and saw shadow like figures near the windows in our room. My boyfriend thought I was crazy but after looking up the history of Ballys, it turns out this same building had burned down in 1980 that killed 87 people. I'm not a person to believe in ghosts but still am shaken up by what I saw. they participate in illegal charging give them cash deposit at check in so theycantcharge it without authorization .

Pretty decent hotel. Central spot to everything. Cheap and affordable. View could have been better but room was bigger than I thought. Service was quick and easy-going. I suggest to come as early as possible. Check-in begins around 10am. Parking is either self-park or valet. I'd definitely stay here again. 

PS: Don't settle on Standard, unless you're really on a budget. Be smart about it and pay the extra $20 to upgrade to deluxe. You'll thank me later.

Where to start.. 
1. Checking in took sooooooo long. So many people are tired traveling and all we want is a easy check in.
2. The rooms lack so much things such as a microwave or at least a fridge. Also not enough ports where we can plug in things so we had to bring our own.
3. Our lamps weren't even working.... 
4. THE DO NOT DISTURB SIGN IS ON THE DOOR FOR A REASON SO DONT GO INTO THE ROOM BARGING IN EVERYDAY ASKING IF WE ARE THERE. 
A maid just decided to open our door while one of my friends were changing and then while we were all sound asleep!
The room was already dirty and had stains when we checked in.
Oh, but that wasn't really the WORST part of my friends and I's experience at Bally's.
We checked in from 6\/16 and originally supposed to check out at 6\/19. We called to ask them if they can comp us for an extra day and they GLADLY agreed to! So it was Monday and we're all very tired from EDC weekend and we're expecting to just relax in our room for one more night and we get a call asking if we have checked out..
Really? We just double checked with the front desk that we were comped for another day. 
SOOOO long story short they declined our comp to stay another day and so we had to pay $99 to stay one more night when it was clear as day that they agreed to comp us. Then they sent SECURITY to come up to our room and get our payment ASAP when they literally said it was due at CHECKOUT. How are you going to say it's due at check out and then right after we get off the phone and come back from speaking to you guys at the front desk you guys send security to our room to collect payment? 
Then your security has the nerves to just keep the door open when we said we'll be right out. HOW UNPROFESSIONAL IN ALL ASPECTS. 
THEN WE HAD ALL THESE CHARGES ON MY BF'S CARD THAT WASNT EVEN EXPLAINED AT ALL AND THEY DECIDED TO JUST CHARGE IT WITHOUT EXPLAINING ABSOLUTELY ANYTHING!
When we were checking out my friends had called a bell person to bring their stuff down and sent another one to load it in their car. That man did absolutely NOTHING to help them and then had the AUDACITY to ask for TIP?! YOU LITERALLY STOOD THERE AND DID NOTHING AND THEN YOU HAVE THE NERVE TO ASK FOR TIP? 
Get new employees Bally's or close down because your hotel is outdated, dirty and your employees are unprofessional, rude, and just down right a mess. Never ever staying here again.

Bally's is right at the center of the strip. It's right in from of Bellagio and the monorail gets off at Bally's! 
Pros: LOCATION and free parking for guests. Really nice bell hop service. 
Cons: no fridge and microwave. Beds are very springy. Rooms not cleaned thoroughly ( found leftover pretzels on the floor when we got to our room). Only two people can access the pool even though we reserved for 4. Also we were charged for checking in early. You have to pay for wifi! I thought the resort fee covers it, but only two can connect to it. We have data so we used that, but still! People love free wifi.
We stayed for a night, so it wasn't too horrible. It's just the location is really great. The lady in the front was so mean and didn't even really make eye contact and was more interested in talking to her coworkers than assisting us.

We stayed in the secret suites. Essentially, it is two connecting rooms but one of the rooms is a two room suite, so we had 3 rooms. It was a master room with a jacuzzi, king bed and a full bathroom, then a living room with a sofa pull out (and bathroom), and then regular room with two full sized beds (and another bathroom). The rooms weren't updated, but they were nice. They had the sheet comforters (the kind where the blanket that touches your face is washed every time a new guest stays the night). 

Ballys location is perfect too- right in the middle of the strip. I'm not sure how much we paid for our suite, but we comfortably fit 10 people (and that's with only 2 people in the master suite).

The pool was great too. There were plenty of seats and the pool was fun- low key, with small groups of people and not too wild. There was a dj at the pool too. Here are my critiques about the pool though- we had a cabana and reservations were a nightmare. My sister confirmed the cabana multiple times on the phone and in person when she got there on Friday. On Saturday morning, they "lost" the reservation again and we were bumped to another cabana, so definitely get there early. The pool servers include gratuity on their checks- just be aware so you don't double tip. And there are two food menus- don't order off the pool menu- my husband ordered chicken quinoa (because everything else was sold out at 11:30 am), and there was no chicken. However, if you order the room service menu, then you have to pay a $5 delivery fee for the first item (and it goes up depending on what you order) on top of gratuity (which isn't really worth it when you don't order a lot). Instead, grab lunch at Nosh inside the casino.

I gave it two stars because the AC worked well. 

-Carpet is disgusting, feels damp to walk on and it's covered in stains.
-Restroom smells like urine.
-Paint is chipping off the walls. 
-No fridge.
-Beds have a flat sheet as the fitted sheet.

I guess this is what you get when you try to be conservative on the room  I wouldn't stay here again.

My boyfriend reserved a room here for our anniversary this past weekend and I was kind of excited because I'm used to staying at the Cockroach Inn, The Prostitute Resort and Spa, the AIDS Motel, Bedbug and Breakfast, and the Junky Lodge. BUT THIS WAS ON THE STRIP!!! Wowowoeow! We aren't low lives this weekend! 

Anyways, upon checking in they needed some deposit so I covered it. They of course tacked on some "resort" fee. I'm trying not to worry about it because I'm on vacation. We got their total rewards card and the woman told us that since we were new sign ups we qualified for a free buffet. Now I'm fucking stoked. Like I'm looking forward to this buffet more than anything else. More than potentially winning the jackpot, to me this IS the jackpot. Alas, the next day when went to redeem this invaluable gift they informed us that we needed 50 points (equivalent to $200) on our cards. I'm devastated and go indulge in 20 Long Island ice teas to ease the pain. So that sucked. 

I was kind of looking forward to checking out the pool area but it small and crowded.  I mean I'm expecting a pool that turns into a bar, water park, and the Bahamas all at the same time, so yeah I'm disappointed. 

On to our actual room. First off, it was literally 2376448292 miles away from the elevator. I had to take an uber just to get from the fucking elevator to the room. Why would there only be one area of elevators when the rooms are so far away? I'm hungover and don't want to walk!!!! 

The room was really large. I mean like 5000 square feet. The problem with all of this space? Why don't we make the room smaller and put more money into a quality bed. That bed felt like I was sleeping on a bed of nails. I mean I appreciate  the Kings table in our room but I'd much rather have a comfortable bed.  Oh and the balcony door didn't open so I didn't have the option of getting  naked and flailing off the building during a drunken delusion of grandeur. 

Anyways, at the very end we had some confusion with the bill but for 3 days it came out to about $500 and we stayed during the week. Overpriced for what it was. I'll happily return to The Scabies Inn next time, at least I'm not expecting much there!!!

I booked this vacation for 2 nights, 3 days about a week before and secured a d VERY affordable room rate (for on the strip) due to my teacher discount (yes, they give teachers a discount... totally awesome) and a sale they had going on. I booked directly through the hotel, as all of the "discount" websites offered higher prices when you add on the resort fee. 

We got to the hotel about 2pm on a weekday and were greeted by what we thought were concierge workers (wydham timeshare sellers) and they talked us into taking a "tour" the next day... more on that later... anyway, we went to the self check in kiosk and checked in. Now, I have stayed at rooms around the country and practicality is #1 with me, along with cleanliness. This room was great for both of these things. The only thing I wish they had was a coffee maker in the room. I loved that it had a bath tub, a couch and plenty of towels\/toiletries. 

What i didnt like was the fact that they stated that internet was free (lie), they charged me for calling them (1.25 each call), and for parking ($10 a day). One of the suggestions someone had on here was to add parking to your room (totally do it!). 

The biggest issue I had was not being able to add an extra night easily and for the same price. After the Wyndham tour (all 5 hours, not 2 like they said), we decided to stay an extra night since it was our honeymoon. I spent about 2 hours on the phone and we offered to switch rooms, or hotels (apparently Wyndham owns Ballys, Linq, Flamingo, and a whole bunch of other hotels), so we didnt think it would be a problem. We ended up having to pay $40 more than what we paid for 2 nights and we were moved to the Linq. I will post a review about the Linq on their page, but that was um... interesting. 

I guess overall, I was surprised that Wyndham wasnt more accomodating. I know we stayed in the Indigo tower, but our money is just as good as anyone else's. 

I'm glad we were in the middle of the strip because we bought bus passes and took it everywhere, so staying at Ballys was wonderful for that. 

One more thing they offered us and we didnt use (and it states that if you dont use it, they wont charge you, but they did charge us), was for the high roller. The deal was $20 total for 2 people for a daytime ride. "Daytime" is 11:30am-7pm (not daytime in my opinion). I was still charged. 

While gambling in the casino, we had drinks offered to us constantly and a great few cocktail waitreses. I didnt win anything, as it seemed like the machines were tight. 

We checked out pretty good with the app, but my only complaint about the app is that the confirmation number is on the front page and unless you write it down, when you turn to the next page you have to type it in. 

Overall, we had a great time and we would stay at Bally's again, but I would fight the extra\/unnecessary charges (I might still give them a call). It was quiet, clean, and practical. Again, see the continuation of our stay on the Linq page where we had to move to.

Meh.

Alrighty, here goes:

Rooms:

Bally's could've really had waaaaaay more people manning the check-in counter on Saturday night of Labor Day weekend.  They, literally, had 3 people working...while a line of a billion people stared angrily at the employees.  I mean, c'mon...you'd expect crowds, right?

AA Vacations someone effed up our reservations and the Bally's employee taking care of us at  check-in was a complete b*tch.  (However, the other employee who we spoke with after our reservation was cleared up was a total sweetheart who completely hooked my friends up with an awesome, awesome room!  Props to her!)

The rooms are decent - old and had no good airflow, but whatever.  It'd do for two nights. The view of the Strip is nice, though!  

Food Options:
The restaurant\/cafe here is pretty good.  They have a $11 express breakfast buffet lunch (which seems like a good deal).  $5 mimosas available.

The tequila\/Mexican bar next to it offers up $1 margaritas ($2 if you want strawberry) and they are preetttty strong for the price!  Down a couple of those and you're pretty much set.

If you go to the lower level, there's a couple shops, the sports lounge and a food court!  There's a 24 hour Sbarro's for your reference...'cuz we didn't know about it until our second night there.

The sports lounge's bar serves up mimosas for $6 and these were, by far, the best mimosas of the trip!  Our bartender was awesome!

Valet:
Pretty fast!   I was impressed, considering we were there on a holiday weekend.  Nice job!

FYI - Bally's is also connected to Paris and offers a shuttle to Rio.

I was skeptical after reading the reviews. I am sure that your experience here could vary greatly. I met friends here for a girls weekend. I was originally booked into the Indigo Tower at a lower rate. But my friends had rooms in the Jubilee Tower so I upgraded my room. The front desk person was helpful and got me a room as close to my friends as possible. I was told that the normal up charge was $50 per night, but she was only going to charge me $30. My room faced the Paris Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. The view from 6905 could not have been better. My friends had rooms farther from the elevators and they all commented on the loud music from the fountains. I think that it stops at midnight. I use the White Noise app for sleep and I never heard anything from the fountains, people above, to the side or in the hall while using the app. The room was gorgeous, just like the photos.  Plenty of towels, a hairdryer, a small fridge (and not a minibar) and for the first time I have ever experienced in Vegas, a coffee maker!!!!!! I left housekeeping $5 each day and always had the coffee restocked.  Check in lines are lengthy, casino is relatively small and slots are tight. Paris and Bally's share a parking garage and are connected underground which greatly expands dining and gambling options. The sports book is terrible so if that is important to you, realize that you are going to go elsewhere to watch your games. I only ate at one food court place so I cannot comment on their restaurants. They have Lagunitas on tap. I was holding a glass, normally, and it shattered in my hand. The staff was highly attentive. No injuries, but I was told that this was not the first time that had happened. I was able to get my iPhone hooked up to the wifi, but not my iPad. But I didn't bother calling for assistance, either.

Seedy is the best description.

Half hour to check in. No exaggeration. Casino always stinks of tobacco. 

Entire place, from rooms to casino to the restaurants, it needs a MAJOR facelift!

If I was not staying here with this convention I'd run away to somewhere, like almost anywhere else, on the Strip!

Bally's has seen better days and, while the rooms are inexpensive, this casino has gone down, way down, on the 'cool' list.  

Want to be depressed in Las Vegas?  Want to experience a deep, dark depression?  Then come to Bally's!

good location, mediocre service, nice casino, unimpressive rooms.

tried the $20 tip trick and it was still unimpressive...

won't be staying here again.

It was OK, as Vegas hotels go, but it needs some work.

The room was a nice size.  The bathroom had nice lighting and a really good make-up mirror, which is rare in Las Vegas.  It wasn't too noisy, which again is a rarity.  But the air conditioning was terrible and the bed was rock-hard, so it was really hard to sleep. The shower didn't hold the water temperature and varied from warm to hot frequently  The restaurant selection is poor, particularly for breakfast.  The casino reeks of tobacco smoke which wafts into the elevators as soon as they reach the main floor.

It may have been a luxury hotel in its time, but it hasn't aged well.
Bad wait time. It's I think able there's only 1 person checking people in and we'll over 50 plus people in line. Wait time is over hour. Won't do this again after driving forever.

What can you expect when you pay very little for a room?  Well, you get mismatched furniture that looks like it came from Threes Company.  Questionable stains in the carpet in the hallways.  A shower head that was purchased from Harbor Freight in the 70s.  And half a roll of Toilet Paper.

Yet, despite all the shortcoming of the room.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The casino floor had what you needed.  Played $5 craps and roulette to kill some time which is always fun.  

And...a great location to see the Strip.

Stayed a couple of nights in the older Indigo Tower rooms, which turned out to be just fine.  Room was on the 17th floor, clean, comfy bed, plenty of room, and very quiet.  I was quite pleased that the casino was not smoky at all.  I played a whole lot of poker and enjoyed their poker room, which was not super fancy but had nice dealers and was busy enough to get a good game anytime.  

The location is great as well.  You are right in the middle of the strip where it is easy to get to many other resorts.  I've stayed at many other strip properties and while Bally's is nowhere close to the most luxurious, it is a good option at a reasonable price.

This was my first hotel ever in Vegas. Conveniently located in the middle of the strip, so easy access to the shenanigans. When we checked in for spring break they ran out of the rooms we had reserved so they upgraded us to a 2 floor suite which was hella bad ass. Not only did we have an entire bedroom on the 2nd floor, but the downstairs had a full on living room with mini kitchen and an extra bathroom. Unfortunately, we had to move to another room 2 nights later, but it was bitchin while it lasted. Overall, pretty legit hotel that accomodates when they mess up.

This is the worst hotel in Vegas had my car broken in to on ballys parking lot stole go pro and other stuff call security and they didn't do anything fuck this place u have crackheads walking thru parking lots checking every car for goods to steal ....the security is a joke and useless don't come here with ur cars

My expectation was not high for this place; I picked this place because it was in the middle of the Strip, and easy to walk to places in both directions. Plus we got a 4-night package including flight from SFO for $400 for two!

PROS:
- our room was clean and HUGE (twice the size of an average room) with floor to ceiling windows
- bed was decent
- request for a high-floor (above 16) room was granted, no need to upgrade to the Jubilee Tower for extra fee
- half price ticket booth for shows and restaurants was right in front of Bally's
- check out online from the room was fast and easy
- fast wifi included with daily resort fee

CONS:
- casino 1st floor was dark and dreary.
- garage is a long walk from the hotel lobby.
- restaurants too pricey (and empty)
- service for reasonably priced Mexican taqueria was REAL slow.
- beware there's a resort fee ($32\/day) attached to your total room cost.
- do not drink the water! Get ice from the filtered ice machine and let it melt.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Le Cafe in Paris Hotel (through the tunnel connection from Bally's) was reasonably priced and served large portions.
- Bakery in Paris was great for a danish and coffee in the morning.
- Shake Shack (like In-N-Out, but better) was delicious, especially the frozen custard.
- Wicked Spoon for brunch (buffet for dinner would put us in a food coma for the shows).
- Bouchon Brasserie - gotta order the burger, skip their beignets - too cakey & dense.
- Serendipity 3 was good for desserts (pricey), but skip the food - very salty. The frozen hot chocolate was overrated.
- Shows: Michael Jackson One, Mat Franco (illusionist), Terry Fator (ventriloquist). I liked the last two the best, both were winners of America's Got Talent.

OK

I'll start with our room. It should really be a 2 star review.

I didn't see much of it. I was upset that it wasn't in the remodeled tower.

F*** it. Only thing I used was the shower and I slept once for about 4 hours. 

I'm awarding 3 stars because it was across the street from Drais and my walk of shame was only a few minutes. HAHAH!

Great location with easy access to monorail, express bus, and bridges to cross busy streets. Good staff and lobby experience. Hotel rooms are very large but the reason for three stars: out-dated tube tvs that have poor reception on half the channels, and a bathtub-shower door combination that is ancient. But I loved the value and the access to Paris Las Vegas and its delectable restaurants. Nice pool.

Unfortunately we had a bad experience there.  We went with another couple, and got up sold rooms right next to each other for $34 a piece.  Our understanding the whole time was that they were connecting rooms, but they turned out to be 2 doors apart - wasn't worth the $68 in damages.  Called and told them this wasn't what we expected, they asked us to do walk downstairs to talk to the front desk about refunding the upsell.  The front desk person told us they would only do that if we went back up, packed everything and moved to the other rooms.  Classic and a shitty customer service. 

The sink was clogged in one of the rooms.  We asked them to fix it, headed out for about 4 hours, and it wasn't fixed.  Couldn't use it as we were getting ready for dinner without it overflowing.  Horrible experience.

This hotel clearly doesn't care and we won't be staying there ever again.
My husband and I stayed here when we went out to Vegas. Rooms are ok, games are nothing special. But it's a good location on the strip. You do have to try the frozen drink bar the have inside.

First the good. It's on the strip, nice room. The bad. Check in at 2pm, room service ends at 1pm. After a long flight I want a shower and food in my room. My view was.  of the back streets. Smokey. Food court limited. This was my first and last time staying here.

Do not ever stay here! It stinks the front desk people are rude and the managers do not help their customers! If you don't book through the hotel themselves they treat you terrible! Worst guest service ever! And the non smoking rooms smell of smoke! So disappointed! And after all that just happened here you would think the hotels would make you feel better about having to be in Vegas because I do not have an option!

Stayed at Ballys based on price and location.   We had tickets for a show at Ceasars, but their room prices were more than double that of Ballys.  Turns out that it was a prime example of you get what you pay for.   Normally,  we wouldn't care so much since we don't spend a lot of time in the room,  but the pillows are small,  the bed incredibly uncomfortable,  and the bathroom.... well,  just nasty (see pictures).  May come back again,  but it will require the hotel doing some renovations.   But,  again,  the location is awesome!

In Vegas and needed a hotel room.  Not here to spend much time in my hotel.  What I wanted, location, clean and safe.   I got all that from this hotel.   The room was great.  I had book a discounted rate though them and when I arrived my room was ready and it was the size of about 4 hotel rooms.  It was wonderful.  I had a balcony overlooking part of the strip and mind you this is all in a discounted room rate.  

Staff was great.  The check in line was a bit longer then I would have liked but I could tell they would were working with guests that had some issues not of the hotel doing.   

Leaving the room was a quick walk through the casino and outside we were.   

I was vet happy with my stay and would stay again.

Wow... and I mean WOW!!! We booked at Bally's because we got a deal and I don't think this review will express how fantastic our room was! We stayed in room 7206 in the newly renovated Jubilee tower and our suite was GIGANTIC. They say size doesn't matter, but those folks aren't staying in a suite! 

Our room had two queen sized beds, a living room, giant TV, two desks and a rather large area in the corner that puzzled us for a bit. I finally realized that the space is left vacant so guests can request roll away beds via housekeeping. Genius! You spend little time in your hotel room in Vegas so this totally makes sense if you've got a big group of people. In addition to a great view, our room came with mini fridge and fully stocked coffee maker. Right outside our room was the ice machine and 

The location is perfect as it's right across from Cromwell's \/ Drai's Beach Club, Caesars and Bellagio. A few minutes walk away from great shopping and my favorite pizza at the Cosmo. Although the casino isn't fancy, that's totally okay with me because that means the tables are much cheaper to play at than it's nearby counterparts. Even the pool was wonderful in that it was super chill and great for taking a dip before a night out on the town. The only negative we had during our weekend getaway was the elevators do take awhile sometimes but man, were we entertained by all the characters! 

If you're looking for a sweet deal and perfect location, Bally's is the place for you and your party posse! It's a 1950s relic that's finally stepping into the now. Make sure you get upgraded to the new tower because it'll make all the difference!!!

I have been waiting in line to check in for 60 minutes (still haven't checked in) in a line of 30 some people. There is only one staff person working with us, while 3 other people are helping the "platinum" line of 5 people. The lady "serving" our line keeps going to help the "platinum" line as well. I'm disappointed with how this trip has started. There has to be a way to more efficiently greet and check in guests at 1am.

Stayed here quite a bit over the past few years.

Bally's is an older hotel on the strip, but location, location, location. It's right at the center and everything you want to go to is walkable. 

The Indigo Tower is the older tower, hence the cheaper price. It is a little more outdated compared to the Jubilee Tower. Definitely prefer this hotel over Harrah's. 

The Jubilee Tower is updated - furniture and all. Basic rooms come with a refrigerator and nice shower. Last time I stayed here, I got a great view of the Eiffel Tower next door at Paris, plus a semi-view of the water show at Bellagio. Perfect!

Check in and check out are easy. Late check-out is at 12pm. Parking is a shared structure with Paris hotel.

Recommend for cheap stays in Vegas!

Bally's layout is extremely weird. My grandparents used to stay here when it was the MGM and the various additions make navigating its hotel floors really impossible. The location is the prime reason for staying here--right in the middle of everything. 

It's not super fancy, but it's not trying to be. Hotel rooms are for sleeping and storing your things, and with a location like this and decent accommodations, Bally's hits it right on the mark. 

I would probably choose staying at Bally's over staying at other places on the Strip, due to its price and location, but trying to navigate those hallways while inebriated would be a nightmare, so I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 4.

Booked my reservations through Southwest.com. Upon arrival found that if I wanted a nonsmoking room that was not by the elevator it was going to cost $20.00 more a night.  The only reason I booked Bally's was because we had stayed there years ago & it was totally different. No refrigerator or coffee maker.  The sheets were scratchy. The room was old but clean. At checkout the lady at the desk was yelling at the customer in front of me & almost came across the counter at him. I won't be back because there are other hotels.

Great location!   We upgraded to the Jubilee room with a strip view and we are impressed.  For the price, we got everything we wanted and more!  We are right in the middle of the strip.  Everything is about a mile (walking distance) from the hotel.  The room is redone with cool, hip wallpaper and the view is awesome!    We can see the lit up Eiffle tower, the Paris pool, and even the Bellagio water dancing.  I would definitely suggest staying here during the week days for the cheap prices and the great stay! 

Just be aware of the resort fees of about $30 a day and the parking is $10 a day. Also, the check-in line took a while due to only one person working behind the desk at 5:00pm. Other than those two things, it was wonderful!

Beware of the shady valet service. I've stayed here a couple times and i would normally give this place 3 stars but this last experience made me not want to ever come back.

I used their valet service this past weekend and I didn't notice the huge dents and scratches that the valet attendant left on my car until I got home. What's even worse is that they tried to color over the dents and scratches with a black sharpie... That's just super shafy and totally unethical. I would not recommend ever using their valet service unless you want your car returned to you all banged up.

Stay away from this hotel and definitely do not use their valet. I'd give me 0 stars if I could.

Was hesitant about our stay here after reading reviews. However, our room was just fine. Updated, flat screen tv. Not the outdated 80s decor as shown in other photos.
Has a little strip mall on it's basement level - good to get your souveniers at. 
Breakfast buffet is well worth it's price! Get there early, the line to get in gets long, as well as the line at the buffet. Also, the mimosas are NOT bottomless - you pay for each one. Boo!
Pool is outdoor, so it's closed during the winter.
Good size casino floor - it was always fairly busy.
Connected to Paris, which is super convenient especially if you have part of your group staying there.

The biggest downside: the casino floor was very smoky compared to other casinos.
Upside: amazing location on the strip. 

Will stay here again.

So let me start by saying that I've stayed in a myriad of hotels in Las Vegas. From Caesars, to the former Las Vegas Hilton, I've stayed almost everywhere. 
I have stayed at crappy places like Hooters, and amazing and suites in New York New York. That being said, Bally's is the best value for the money.
If you are expecting exorbitant glamour, this is not the place. If you are looking for a great place to stay in the middle of everything, but can still be quiet and relaxing, then this is your place.
We stayed in a Jubilee king room. The side we were on, was next to Paris, so it was just a little loud on the weekend evenings. Not a big deal, just closed the drapes, and was able to go away in a nice slumber.

The room was huge. I like the decor and vibe of the design. It was upbeat and fun, but not Austin-Tacious or austere. The only downside to the room  that I could find was that it didn't have a bathtub and only had a large shower. However, the shower was very nice. Sort of a rainfall style shower head. And the bathroom, that was really big once again.
The king bed was comfortable and the pillows were great. Four pillows to the bed, each one of us had a chance to use one and hold one so we could sleep comfortably. The room was able to be temperature gage on our own as well. Which was great, when it got cold at night we could turn the heat up a little, and in the day when it was much warmer, turn it down.
The staff that we encountered at the hotel, from the front desk to the chambermaids, where pleasant and accommodating. Much more than I have found in some of the other hotels. They all seemed like they really enjoyed the job that they had. Everyone said hello and was generally interested in what we had to say. Or so it seemed.

We didn't have a chance to play anything in the casino, although it seems a little small, I'm okay with that. I don't really go to Las Vegas to gamble. 
The valet out front was easy to use, and your car would arrive in about two minutes. Even on the weekend evenings.

All in all, I would come here again and have decided to make this our home hotel when we stay in Las Vegas moving forward.

I was expecting old kinda grossness.. I was pleasantly surprised!!

This is the perfect location. Right in the middle of everything.. Connected to Paris. So I live in Vegas, so I wasn't really trying to spend a lot of money when my friends came in to visit. They didn't see the point either since we would just be sleeping and getting ready there. Seriously, there is NO reason to spend $300 a night in Vegas. This place is nice! Be nice to guest services and maybe they will give you a free upgrade like I got :)

The room was nice.. clean.. no complaints! For two nights we only spent $260.. I don't think that is bad at all.. Cabs to clubs and restaurants were ok prices.. Don't spend a ton of money.. being centrally location is all you really should care about

It's old. Casino smells like smoke. The line to check in at 1:30am was super long. We wanted to find another hotel. Paris was sold out so we were given an upgrade. The elevators didn't have a security guard. Therefore, anyone can go up to the rooms. Didn't have a chance to really walk around the casino. The room was big and clean. Oh! No one cleaned our room while we were out and I could hear our neighbors next door. Very thin walls.

This place has really gone downhill in the last decade compared to what else is out there.  The hotel hallways and rooms are no different than your typical Holiday Inn on an interstate in the middle of nowhere in the U.S.   Casino is in good shape but when you stroll through Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian, etc. it's just not the same here.  Even the walkway to Paris lets you know how "dated" Bally's is.

Only plus is the pool is decent and maybe the Sbarro breakfast downstairs is fast.

Stayed here a few times - the rooms are nothing special but they are clean and comfortable. The casino offers any of the games you will find at the other casinos with decent minimums. Nothing flashly about Bally's but it gets the job done. There's a nice sportsbooks and a food court in the basement for those of you who don't want to splurge at the pricey restaurants (however it's definitely not your regular normal food court prices). The clientele is probably your average middle-aged folks or your businessmen\/convention goers (there's always been a convention going on here when iIve been here).

Just checked in & already regret choosing this hotel. The decor & the popcorn patched up ceilings are not at all what we expected from Ballys. I know it's an old hotel\/casino but this room hasn't been touched for probably 20 plus years.  Note in room saying no water in room from midnight-5am through-out our stay. Are you kidding me?  Can't brush teeth. Can't shower when coming in late & let's be honest it is Vegas so we may come to room after midnight. I would rate it 0 if that was an option. Never again & I would suggest you choose somewhere else to stay when visiting Vegas.

A few things I loved about my stay here was the way it was located perfectly next to everything amazing in Las Vegas :)!! The hotel was also joined with hotel "Paris" which I always went to for my breakfast buffet. The atmosphere is great and theres a really good thai restaurant. The rooms are clean but just average and the decor is a bit boring. Just be careful with your belongings as some of my family had jewelery stolen from a maid! The management was very helpful but. The fastfood restaurants down by the pool have a huge selection. Theres a hairdressers, beauty salon and a great clothes shop for young babies and kids. The pool is big and the cocktails are great. I would definatley return again :)

The check in is so bull takes an hour with just like a few  people in line hate this place!! It's super run down and the lights flicker. Seems so sketchy. Do not book here! Stay away and spend the extra to stay somewhere nice you will be so happy you did!!!! I'll never come back here again. F you Brenda you suck

I HATE THIS PLACE.  Seriously, its run down and everytime I see it Im amazed it hasnt been torn down.  Id rather not go to Vegas then to stay here.

Run for the hills if someone suggests you stay here.

Stayed here shortly after staying at MGM. Now wish we had stayed at Ballys the entire time!

Yes, you'll see a few signs of wear and tear in the rooms, but who cares? Very reasonable rates, a perfect location, and a staff that actually gives a damn about you are way more important in my book. 

Self\/ mobile check in highly recommend and is simple and quick.

During our recent stay here at Bally's for my wife's birthday, we couldn't be happier with the service we received from Josie Luna.  She took care of everything, made sure our stay was beyond exceptional and made our entire experience spectacular.  Kudos to Bally's for having such an outstanding employee

I was on the property for a convention during the cold snap. The Guest room thermostats LIE ,  I am a new englander and had to put on extra blankets. The meeting rooms wee so cold that most of the attendees had winter coats and heavy sweat shirts on during presentations. 
The hotels and its managements response was " we are doing renovations under the convention area. Odd because the heating units are on the roof of the building not the basement. 1,000 thoroughly Pissed people has got to be a record .

Bally's is 3 1\/2 star place in my book.
The room was clean, but due for a renovation.  
Check in and checkout went smoothly.
The casino is casino themed.
Location is great.  It's about as close to the center of the strip as possible.
It's nice home base for LV Strip vacation.

Stayed at Ballys for the first time and loved it. We are total rewards members so we stay at a variety of the total rewards resorts. We decided to try Ballys because our guest were staying at the Cromwell which was conveniently across the street. Though their was not a big variety of food places, the best customer service. Which to me customer service is the most important. The lady at guest check in was so nice and helpful! She was able to get us checked into our room early! Our room was nice and viewed the Linq! Definately would stay here again..

We just returned from our vacation in Las Vegas last night. Expensive is the best way to describe it and poor customer service. The "resort" fee which includes the use of the VERY slow Wifi and the gym is just not worth the money. We literally had better service using our phones Internet. The room was clean and ok for price. The fact that we got married and they did zero upgrades for us was a serious fail to us. They wouldn't let us use a glass for champs the day of our wedding (one of the ours that we brought broke). They wanted to charge us to check in early (1.5 hours) $22. We opted to just wait. Late check out is noon.... Which seems early. At the top of our list of disappointment was the fact that we had to pay to use the internet so we could preprint our boarding passes. Maybe that could be included in the "resort" fee! Most likely won't stay here again.
Tired and run down room, tired and run down casino. The place needs a total makeover given what other casinos are offering

Last time in Vegas we stayed at Luxor (for sure we will NEVER return). Room was pretty decent and clean - great price - perfect location on Strip - very decent amenities around shared with Paris. The only thing is the vent at bathroom wasn't working - for those who like shaving after shower this is very annoying - at checkout they told me to ask for South Tower next time... I will.

Perfect size room for being standard... But there is no mini fridge.. And room service is Not 24\/7..
Hell this city never sleeps! Least you can do is stay open until 3am. Next time Aria hotel for me

We stayed for an event. We had an upgraded room and it was lovely. I do wish there was a mini fridge, but everything in the else was nice. We had a view of the Bellagio and caesar's Palace. The strip view is definitely worth it. There is a burger restaurant in the hotel that is absolutely amazing(expensive) but amazing. The downfall is they double charged us almost $100 for dinner. The hotel charges your card every night you're there. (Double hotel fees) that seems to be the running theme. I called and they said they like to make sure you have funds for damage.. I've never been to a hotel that needs first and last months rent so to speak, but I'm still giving them 4 stars as long as our money is refunded. Other than that I'd give it 5 stars we had a great experience.
Nice clean room (updated North Tower) right in the middle of everything. Hard to beat.

I arrived at Bally's around 2:00 with check in not until 3:00. I waited in line anyway to see if I could check in early. When I got to the counter and provided my ID I was told I was platinum and next time didn't need to wait in line, that I would be helped right away. Awesome, good to know! From then on I was treated excellent. I was able to check in right away, my room was upgraded, she even game me some ice cold water while waiting to complete the check in process. I have been truly impressed with my visit to Bally's and will definitely stay here again.

Thank goodness the rooms are decent, because it took over an hour to check in. Not enough employees at the front desk, there is no sence of urgency to get the line moving, and no help from anyone. Kinda felt like a snowed in airport.
What might help, is to have 2 separate lines for check-in and check-out.
This and the fact the whole casino smells like cigarettes, makes my review for Bally's oly 2 stars.

I've stayed at the North Tower rooms a few times.  I heard it's better than the South Tower.  

The room is good size (450 sq. ft).  Bathroom has granite counter top and flooring.  It's only got 1 sink, but good counter space and roomy enough for 2 people to move around.  

There is no fancy flat screen TV to brag about.  The decor is dated and the bed is HARD!  It's got a nice loveseat sofa, but I doubt it you'd be sitting there to 'enjoy' watching the small TV.  

There is no diamond lounge here.  You have to walk over to Paris.  But Harrah's has really cut back on its players incentive\/promo, the diamond lounges everywhere now are only good for a few bites of snacks (chips, nuts, cookies) and drinks.  I hardly go anymore.  

The ONLY thing I like about Bally's is its Poker room.  For some reason I like the small poker room they have here.  Maybe because it feels less intimidating.  I absolutely HATE their slots because I almost never win here!  

This is not the best among Harrah's chain, but it's not the worst, either.  Between paying or free, I'd pick free room at Bally's anytime.

Event: April 2014

I was so excited to stay at the Bally's Hotel in Vegas for a huge birthday celebration but trying to contact the hotel was a disaster. They outsource their reservation staff so they know absolutely nothing about the hotel. I booked a huge penthouse for the weekend and I wanted to know the specific amenities included with the room. They had no idea. They said there should be iPod hookups and a fridge. But they kept me waiting on the phone while they called the hotel to check. They were still unclear. 

When we showed up the room was huge and gorgeous but hadn't been updated in years. It was still all 70's looking with the old white leather couches and mirrored roll up tables. The bar area was old and small and had a HUGE tape recorder\/CD sound system. No iPod hookups or anything and then the hotel had nothing to offer us to play music for all of our guests in this huge suite. 

A ceiling access door was also open and I called to have it shut twice and no one ever showed. There was also no ice machine on our floor...no idea why, but we had to go down a floor to get ice each time. 

We paid so much for this room for a huge birthday and it seemed like they hadn't really taken the time to update the rooms that need to be updated the most. 

Their pool also hasn't been updated in years. They have icky blue umbrella shades with white trimming and dirty blue carpet by the bar. A simple way to update it would be to definitely change those two things.

Stayed here for a couple of times because it was a last minute 2 day trip and very conveniently located on the strip. We also attended a mini lounge type show. We enjoyed it as they mocked the group. "Temptation." My husband and I have an old soul so that type of music we very much enjoy.

Other than the great show, they could use some updating. Price was great compared to other hotels I've stayed on the strip. You just need a place to crash at vegas anyway. Whose there to enjoy the sleep?

Best value for hotel on the strip.  Smack dab in the middle of everything so hold on to your taxi money.  Some rooms have prime viewing of Bellagio fountains.  Seems nicer than similarly priced hotels and doesnt attract as many trashy people as them too.

Decent place to stay in Vegas. I booked the room via HotelTonight thinking I got a great deal, but then learnt during check in that there is a $35 resort fee. Bummer. There is also a $10 self parking fee. The room itself was okay, though I was surprised that there is no fridge. When it comes to wifi, u can only connect two devices to it for free. Any additional devices would cost $14.95.

I travel to Vegas quite often and Bally's is always my #1 choice because it is right in the middle of strip and the price is relatively low compared to surrounding hotels. That's including the ridiculous resort fees that all the hotels like to charge us for. The last visit I had here was for Halloween weekend 2015.  I arrived around 9:30pm and checked in with a very friendly front desk agent (I can't remember her name!). She was very informative and told us about the entertainers performing that weekend at Drais and Tao. I booked in the Indigo 2 queens and it's pretty standard. My room was clean and the housekeeping was great too. There's not many outlets to use to charge your phone in the room but I've come prepared for that by bringing an extension cord for all of our phones. The major complaint I have is the draining pipes in the bathroom. Every time one of us would wash our hands it sounded as if someone was knocking against the sink; that's the only way I can describe it. Otherwise, I always enjoy my stay here. You can try out the restaurants in Bally's or Paris but if that's too expensive there is an elevator that takes you downstairs to the food court. In the food court there's Johnny rockets, Subway, Sbarros and other places that I can't think of at the moment. There is self checkout so all you have to do is leave your keys and the room and they will email you to check out. This is not the Cosmos or Venetian but the customer service  I received from them made me feel special and they know I'll be back for more this year for sure!

You can't beat this location. Nice hotel, quaint casino (by new Vegas standards), good shopping and a big pool.
My one complaint would be attention to detail on the hotel floors. I understand Harrah's resorts haven't been doing great in the last few years but the level of neglect with poorly maintained hallways (peeling\/cracked painted over wallpaper), ice machines not working on our floor or the floor above us...
The real gag moment was the pool area. The floater barrier has the most disgusting ring of filth around each floatie thing and the tile border is crumbling, also with its layer of scum and filth. There are hundreds of lounge chairs, a huge pool and ONE SHOWER. If they at least advertised the ONE SHOWER or installed more I'm sure people could rinse off their tanning oil before making the pool worse. On that note, I did enjoy the pool (even with the floating cockroach in it), didn't mind the loud constant passing monorail, and got my tan on.

Also, don't eat at the breakfast buffet, go to Paris and pay a bit extra, and don't go to the Mexican place bleh

We had high hopes for this hotel as it has been around forever and most of the older hotels have been renovated. Our hopes were crushed as soon as we walked in. The stench of cigarette\/cigar smoke filled the air and became part of our wardrobe the rest of our stay. 

The rooms were disgusting... Smelled musty\/smokey and there were cigarette burns\/holes in the furniture (this was a non-smoking room). The paint was peeing everywhere, and the wall that held the closet doors was not even connected to the floor or ceiling. Our bathroom did not have a ventilation fan which cause it to smell moldy, and the shower curtain was old, and I believe it never had been washed ever. 

Yes... In Vegas you are paying for a place to sleep and that is pretty much it - but I would rather not sleep in an ashtray every night and bathe in a scum shower. Every other hotel\/casino figured out the concept of ventilation and we never really smelled any smoke.

It has a great location on the strip (dead center) but I would rather spend $10-20 more and stay at the Luxor, Flamingo, or anywhere else for that matter. Even though the ideal location in in the middle of the strip, there are monorails, trams, and buses for very cheap that will take you everywhere you need to go if you don't want to walk.

Save your money - do yourself a favor and go for a better hotel. Next time we will definitely stay in a different one.

Bally's really exceeded our expectations! We have been coming to Vegas for a long time and this was our first chance to stay at Bally's. We were very excited to finally try it as it is one of our favorite casinos. We had an absolute blast! The location was perfect, enabling us to spend a lot of time not only there, but at Caesar's, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, and Paris, all within easy walking distance. When we arrived in town we were fortunate to find only a short line at check-in, and we had the nicest person waiting on us, who not only gave us a free upgrade since it was our first time, she waived the early check-in fee so we could get our room, unpack, and hit the Strip! Our room was a very pleasant surprise, very roomy, with a comfy king bed and a large bathroom with plenty of towels. We had a construction view, but that was OK with us, as we've been staring at that empty lot for years and are excited to see something being built there. We could still see plenty of lights and mountains too. We love to watch them change color with the sunrise! The room was always cleaned for us when we were out, no hassles there. Sad to see Sbarro's was closed, but it looks like it will be great when it's all remodeled! Thanks Bally's for providing us a great home base for our latest trip, it was one of our favorites and we'll definitely be back! Thanks for NOT charging those resort fees!

I booked a north tower room and it was still too dated in my opinion. 
Peeling wallpaper, dirty carpets, stains on the shower curtain and bedsheets. I stayed in this hotel 6 years ago and it was great. Unfortunately I cannot recommend this one again.

I had a conference here and had to pay 25\/day to use internet in the conference room and my room. So my company

I stayed here memorial day weekend and had a great time. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The staff at check-in even upgraded our room and were great at finding us the best room with a nice view. 
  The deluxe room that we stayed in had great ammenities and everything was super clean. I would definitely stay here again and the location on the strip is killer!

We just ended our stay at Bally's and it was enjoyable! Out of all the casinos we visited, this one had the strongest smell of cigarette smoke, but we didn't hit all of the casinos on the strip and it could have been that during our stay there were a lot of smokers.

I was a little apprehensive about staying here based on the reviews, but I would stay here again! 
I'm writing a review on the hotel itself from the perspective of someone who wanted to stay at a more affordable location. We also didn't gamble for more than one night. 

Location: unbeatable! There's a CVS a block away, and so many great hotels are close by for Vegas. Everything is a bit further away because the hotels are so huge, but Bally's was right next to Bellagio, The LINQ, Caesars palace, etc. 

Room: our stay was in a room in the Jubilee Tower. The 20 dollar trick worked for us to get us from the Indigo Tower to jubilee, and the room was great! Clean, didn't smell like smoke, decent view. 

Service: waiting at the front desk took 15 minutes ish each time, but we could have used the electronic kiosks if we had wanted to. Front desk was pretty unhelpful when we called late at night, but we weren't too picky because our requests were trivial.
We chose not to get our room cleaned during our stay just to be safe! Some comments said they had gotten their things stolen, so we chose to tidy after ourselves to reduce that risk. 

That sums up our stay I think. I would do it again! PS we also did the Take A Break thing if anyone has any questions about that.

Update after reading another review: our room did have a mini fridge as well as a coffee maker.

Our room was $229 and we were upgraded to a king size on the 15th floor. Beautiful view of the strip and the Farris wheel. Plenty of room. The bath tub was my favorite part. It was a huge jacuzzi tub. You are able to stretch out and you can look out the window at the strip from the tub. Perfect after a long night in heels.

Terrible.  Just terrible.

- Our "suite" was old, outdated, and dirty.  Carpet faded, stained, pulling up in the middle.  Popcorn ceiling falling down in places.  Shower head and knob falling out of the wall.  Worn and frayed chairs.  Furniture at least 25 years old.
- Found a used tampon applicator in the bathroom upon check-in.  Took an hour and two phone calls to maintenance\/housekeeping for a housekeeping manager and housekeeper to come check out the situation.  Had to explicitly ask them to sanitize all surfaces (some of which had water stains that would have obviously come up had they been cleaned properly the first time).  Had to ask a second time when the housekeeper tried to leave after removing the tampon and sanitizing the bathroom
- SMOKY casino.  My allergies and asthma were terrible!  (I know casinos are smoky, but this is like the inside of a cigarette.)
- Valet will sometimes turn you away at night and tell you to go park under the Paris if you aren't "Platinum" status.  
- Long lines at front desk.

Location is fantastic and gym is nice.  Pool is fine.

I should have stayed off the strip...  Flew into Vegas relatively late on Thanksgiving Day to go see The Grand Canyon with the family, so needed a quick inexpensive hotel.  Bally's had online rates of $40 per night, so I thought I'd get 2 rooms.  Ok, that's where the good ended.
The bad:
   - They charge $30 extra per person, per night, for occupants more than 2 per room.
   - They add $35 per night, per room, on as a "resort fee" which gives you high speed internet, access to the pool and gym
   - The high speed internet isn't very high speed, but they are happy to charge you more for "higher speed" internet
   - There were food crumbs on the floor when we checked into the room, so not the greatest at keeping the rooms clean
   - The beds SUCKED, they we old and hard
   - You can't get the room dark - the lights on the hotel are like the sun, and the curtains don't close all the way
   -  The alarm clock was set to go off in the middle of the night
   - The self parking is a million miles away from check-in (you should consider dropping bags off at hotel entrance before parking the distance is so long)
   - Probably, like other Vegas casinos, you have to walk through the smoke-filled casino to get from the check-in desk to the elevators up to the rooms.
   - quick food was outrageously priced, poor service and quality.  The lady who made the steak subs could not have moved any slower.

I wanted the family to see what Vegas looked like.  I'm pretty sure none of them will ever want to come again.  I've been before to other hotels and it's been much better.  I should have just stayed off Strip...

Bally's is just a basic hotel but in a very good location and the price is very cheap.  If you are price conscience, stay here, but just expect to always walk to nearby hotels for beautiful scenery, shopping, etc.  If it were a special occasion or I'm showing someone Vegas, I would not go to Ballys.  If it was for myself, I'd stay here.

Pros
- Location - right in the middle of the strip, across from Bellagio, walkable to forum shops, walkable to anywhere, it's in the middle.
- Price - Sign up for a Total Rewards card and you can get free nights during weekdays and cheap rates for weekends (~$70)
- Lower limits - Relatively lower limits, it's $5 usually until about 8pm then it goes to $10-15
- Free Shuttle to Rio - Feeling a Seafood Buffet? There is a free shuttle to Rio
- Hotel Staff - Extremely Extremely friendly front desk.  Ashlyn at the front desk made every statement like a slot machine win

Cons
- Security - There is no guard to make sure you have a room key to get up to your room.  I had prostitutes approach me in my hotel room hallway and I also saw a guy trying a room key on every door.  I guess he must've found it on the floor.  Good luck trying every room in the hotel.  I got at least two pizza togo flyers shoved under the door.  Again, if there was security, this wouldn't have happened.
- Phone Connectivity - My AT&T LTE suffered a lot here.  It just didn't work.  I couldn't check email or chat in the casino.  In the hotel room, it worked.
- Internet Speed - You pay $13.99\/day and the internet is HORRIBLE.  We're talking pages that don't load and youtube video that stops loading.  Speedtest shows 2.68mbps download \/ 0.36 upload (at least when it's working)
- Hotel Noise - Yes, you can hear loud people walking through the hall and you can hear people in their rooms, but I didn't have problems with people waking me up in the morning
- Homeless People - Yes, there are homeless people on the side of the entry.
- Patrons - These are people staying in Vegas at a budget.  People are usually dressed in polo shirts or regular sweaters and it kind of takes away from the Vegas image
- Bar - Usually you play a card game at the bar and they give you the drinks on tip.  Ballys does not.  You pay for your drinks.  Some guy was confused when he gave $1 and the worker said "we don't accept tips."  It's because they want you to pay $6 for the beers.
- Front Desk is unavailable - I'm being picky here, but I called twice to front desk from my room, once on a Tuesday and once on a Saturday morning, both times I had to wait for someone to become available.

Other Notes
- Rooms - You can't compare these to Wynn or Venetian or Cosmo, etc.  The rooms work just fine.  Yes, you can hear loud people in the hallway and they can hear you "talking" if you know what I mean

Tip
- Try asking for an upgrade for the room.  I just asked nicely and they bumped me up to North Towers

If you're going to Vegas to stay in your hotel room a lot then don't come here. 
The rooms at Bally's are large but dated.
The views are nice and can face the strip or Bill's gambling hall.

Service was fair.
Wanting to charge me $25\/night to go to the "new tower"...uh, no.

Yes, everything about this place is outdated (except the pool area). 
Yes, the casino could use a bit of a face lift.

Who cares though? I can be glitzed anywhere on the strip. 
The drinks were affordable, the beds were comfortable enough and the casino helped me from losing all of my money!

You come here for its location on the middle of the strip and the price not for the view or ambiance. True, it smells like smoke but so does every hotel in Vegas. Stay here, save some money and go explore. It's more fun that way.

I gotta say they are really rude here. Found pubic hair on the toilet seat three months ago (forgot to leave my review sooner) and they said oh well you just have to wait until we send someone up there to clean. The room was big but overpriced for the pubic hair that was waiting for us!!!! No thanks.

This review update to Bally's is a little bit overdue (Jan '11) but I thought it'd be nice to share because my last stay was awesome!  Awesome because I scored a North Tower Deluxe Room for $47 night on Orbitz, and the fact that it was an actual mini-suite instead of the usual room.  Take a look at how cozy it was (http:\/\/bit.ly\/1HAT4kU).  What you don't see on the pic is the rest of the table with 3 more chairs, a sink and small fridge next to my bed, and a sectioned bathroom. That fridge was a huge bonus since I had a lot drinks I bought from Walgreens and ABC Stores and it kept them nice and cold.  

And though it wasn't a Strip view out my window, it was still pretty nice to look at at night (http:\/\/bit.ly\/1AqdUkd).  This was very pleasing to the eye when I took my occasional time-out from the Strip. 

Once again, Bally's delivers on a great room with an awesome rate.  You can never go wrong with their North Tower.

My husband and I stayed here because it is right in the middle of strip, close to our restaurant reservations, and the price is fair ($150 per night during May).

We love the online check in and out. You get check in around 3 pm instead of 4 pm and pick up the key at mail clerk. When you check out, you can check out 1 hour later and drop the keys inside of your hotel room. We all need an extra hour to get over the hangover, right? 

When we checked into Bally's, we were automatically upgraded to junior suite. One spacious suite with california king size bed, pretty big bathroom, a vanity room with a sink, and walk-out balcony. One weird thing is that it doesn't have a fridge. I guess you can't keep your drinks nice and cold. I can't imagine it during the summer time. 

Overall, the stay at the Bally's was relaxing and the quality of room is decent and clean. I would come back and stay at Bally's again.

INDIGO LOUNGE EXPERIENCE:
-There is just one lounge in the casino (a bar without machines at the bar, a non-gambling bar), the Indigo Lounge.
-This lounge charges for WATER!!! Even if you are a paying customer having drinks there, they charge for water.

CASINO BAR EXPERIENCE:
-The bars in the casino, the ones with slots at the bar -- warning! Their wine is the lowest quality alcohol ever...so awful. Amazing. Stick to spirits if you are there. wow...

ROOM EXPERIENCE (we had a standard size room):
-Numerous room lights did not work.
-Cheapo lamps are really tacky
-No vent in bathroom so it's a real steam room after a shower, unless door is left completely open.
-Towels need replacing - getting Motel. 6-thin!
-No fridge or micro
-Comfortable bed
-Cute mini couch in room
-Hairdryer in bathroom was super tiny and had a short cord, real piece of junk

OTHER:
-Easy walk to Paris and Bellagio
-They have a monorail to go to some other casinos
-Room Service- (1) You cannot order alcoholic drinks to the room, only whole bottles. Be ready to pay 3-4 times more than what you'll pay in a liquor store for any bottle. TIP: We bought liquor in the liquor store in the lobby (about twice the cost of a regular liquor store) and made cocktails in our room. (2) Pot of coffee and two breakfast rolls $16 (quite reasonable for Vegas)

more like 2.5\/5 stars.  nothing unique here that makes me want to come back. 

this casino\/hotel is very meh... its only selling point is the location.. its smack dab in the middle of the strip.  if you wanted to hit up mgm or wynn, it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes to get to either location.

the weird this about this place is the parking lot for sure!!! you share it with the paris' parking lot and you have to walk a good distance to your rooms. 

I was kicking it with friends, and i think they got the smoking room... and that specific room was dirty.  i was afraid to touch the carpet with my bare feet.  you must wear shoes\/slippers.  the room is older and feels slimy.

i feel like the only way for me to appreciate bally's into a 5 star resort is to get plastered drunk 24\/7.  that way, i don't know what the fuck i'm doing and would probably think i'm in aria and not bally...  haha

Stayed there during one of my vegas trip since it had the best deals on the strip. After I made the reservation, I called to make sure that they put me in north tower. South tower is just yucky. Upon arriving at the hotel, the front desk informed me that I had to pay 20 dollars extra to stay at the north tower.
