Of course I immediately resorted to bitchiness and told them I called to confirm bla bla bla. And to my surprise, they conformed and gave me the north tower right away. 

Hotel was okay. Room was okay. Casino is so so. I like that it's connected to Paris so we can at least had some crepes over there because the restaurants at Bally's suck. Wouldn't stay there again unless there's a great deal going on.

New rooms are very nice and clean. 
Windows are not at all sound proof or even resistant, so you can hear everything going on outside.... 

Manager Daryl was very rude and unhelpful when we had a complaint. He was not hospitable at all and his customer service skills were severely lacking (I've worked in customer service and management for years and know he's doing it wrong.) He also blatantly lied about rooms being available just because he didn't feel like having someone switch us (we were even ok with a downgrade or paying for an upgrade but he pretended no rooms were available even though the front desk agent clearly said there were some prior to having Daryl join the conversation). Overall, he made me question if I'm willing to continue staying at Ballys in the future. (He gave no solution to rectify the situation and did not apologize once. Seemed like he couldn't care less.)

Rooms are good, management leaves something to be desired.

Our stay was great. Comfortable room, nothing too fancy. 
Only complaint is that they took forever to clear away room service trays.

Loved this hotel. It was decent for the price! I enjoyed the staff and the hotel in general. If you enjoy smoking this is the perfect place to stay! The hotel is super close Drai's night club. Perfect if your going to a concert.


Be sure you visit the gift shops so nice and convenient. They had really nice things down stairs.

For non smokers this is not the hotel for you. As soon as you walk in it smells like smoke.


Drinks just kept coming! I had a amazing time!!!

First trip to vegas and paid for 2 nights at the north tower deluxe. Room was big and restroom was just as roomy! Clean and worth the price! I love the fact that they had white sheets\/beddings because nothing bugs me more than dark flowery covers (can't see stains or creatures!). Room service was great. Trip from self-parking however...is quite the walk. Very quiet atmosphere(in room) and staff was friendly. I read someone saying there are coffee makers....no there wasn't any in our room. Internet and cable came with a fee. No fridge. However down the hall by the lounge\/ vending machines, there is an ice machine which was very convenient since we did bring a cooler.

We booked a room for $80.00 dollars on hotels.com. When we went to Bally's front counter on July 4th the person at the counter gave us an upgrade without reason. Our room had a giant hot tub, 2 bathrooms, a living room, and a California king bed. Bally's even provided us with a free meal due to the inconvenience of maintenance in our room that only took 15 minutes. My stay here was great and the Blu Pool was amazing.
Crappy front desk.  Check into a room and was hit with a very strong ammonium smell.  As if someone just pissed all over the place.  Sorry we made the choice to come here :(

Bally's was my home away from home when I spent five days in Sin City. Though it is one of the older hotels on the strip, I didn't mind cause our room was in the newer north tower. Upon checking in, we pulled some strings (think $) and got upgraded to a suite on the Diamond floor, which is for their Diamond members. I'm not quite sure why they call it a suite because it is just a bigger room. I didn't complain because there was plenty of room for the four of us. They even gave us extra room keys and rolled in a fridge for us. Not bad for $185.

I don't recommend gambling at this casino. My luck was terrible at Bally's; take the short walk over to Paris instead. Newer machines and nicer dealers. 

Last but not least, don't forget to check out the Tequila Bar downstairs!! You won't be disappointed, especially after a long night. Trust me :)

Honestly, I don't know why this place hasn't gotten all 5 stars. I went for my little cousins 21st birthday. Let me tell you , out of all the places on the strip, this place is CLEAN and most reasonably priced. The location is GREAT. I mean honestly that's really all you need. If you were looking for something crazy upscale try the Venetian, Palazzo, or Cosmopolitan. This place does the trick: a place for me to get ready before i go out and place for me to recover from the night before. Completely worth it. If you want to enjoy the 'ambiance' of where the high rollers go, just stroll over to that casino\/hotel... This place is great for a location on the strip without the crazy price tag. Will definitely be back.

Please remodel... please add receptacles to rooms... please install ventilation so I don't have to smell like an ashtray just from walking through the lobby... please tell the lotion sales people to stop harassing people when they say NO. I  will not be back.

So many positive things-

Rooms LARGE like 2 queen beds, and ottoman at the end of each of them, walkway then the tv and desk! And as for length there were two desks in the room so much room it was great!

Centrally located on the strip! Smack in the middle it's awesome! 

Monorail connected to hotel!

The hotel has a promenade so there's food and shopping downstairs. 

Ate at the Mexican place in the hotel it was good!

No nightclub that I saw but I was pleasantly impressed for it being an older hotel on the strip! 

Prices were great!

As for the cons-

I'd say the only bummer is the parking structure is shared with Paris so it's a small walk through Paris through the casino then to check in but Paris and ballys are connected\/sister hotels so you're all inside once you leave the structure.

I also did online check in at the kiosks and it worked perfectly. Actually never talked to a single employee there during my stay and everything worked out!

My partner and I booked a Vegas trip through expedia and got a great deal for Ballys. After reading a lot of reviews I was a little worried about the room quality since I booked a room in the indigo tower. However, I have to say that we were VERY impressed with the service we received. When we got to the hotel, we were greeted by Gloria who works at the front desk and she was the nicest and friendliest person we have ever encountered at a hotel. If anyone deserves special recognition at this hotel, she is the one! We asked about room upgrades and for $50 a night we upgraded to the newer renovated jubilee tower which was lovely. Our room had a view of the strip and was nice, new and clean. 

The reason I am giving 3 stars is because right outside our room there was some construction going on which isn't a big deal for us. However, when a jack hammer starts going off at 4:15 am it is frustrating and not pleasant. I know these workers like to get an early start and even 7am is acceptable considering a lot of people are ok with getting up a little earlier. However I found it kinda crazy that they would get going at 4am, they MUST know they would wake up half the hotel. 

Aside from this, our stay was quite pleasant and we were happy with the room and service we received.

Staying at Ballys is always convenient since it's in the middle of the strip and close to everything, but it's definitely nothing special. There are much better options to stay on the strip that are just as convenient. 

We stayed for two night and the room was a fairly good size. The room was clean and we had a pretty good view from our room which was cool. The major issues we had was when it came to customer service.  The first issue was in regards to the wifi. We were only given 2 devices that would be allowed to be connected for the wifi and then we would have to pay for the additional devices.  The issue was that the process was the same for devices that would be paid for and the ones that are included in the room. You had to accept the charges no matter what. When I spoke with someone on the phone they said that we should see a different screen and that was never the case.  

The second issue was when we were asking about check out. We had asked for a late check out and they told us that they couldn't let us know if we could get a late check out until the day of...I had never heard of that before.  The woman on the phone just sounded annoyed that we were even asking for a late check out. We were able to be accommodated which was nice but the process to get it done was a pain in the ass.

I will always have a soft spot for Bally's.  I stayed in their penthouse after it was redone and it was absolutely beautiful.  We got treated like kings and queens and the staff was very nice.  Even better than the room was the location of this hotel.  I think that this and Planet Hollywood are arguably the best hotel location wise on the strip.  You really are in the middle of everything.  I even stayed in their regular rooms, they are ok, a little outdated but it's also not the most expensive hotel ever.  I will definitely be back.  Negatives are how long the check in line is and if you are staying in one of their regular rooms, they still just seem a little outdated.

Bally's is what it is. It's an OK hotel in a GREAT location on the strip. The rooms in the North tower are nice, but not spectacular. Staff is very friendly and the casino is clean and easy to navigate. The Sports Book is oddly placed downstairs and difficult to find, but it's nice once you get there. 

They've added a lot of life to the casino recently with the scantily clad dancers in seemingly every pit ... scenery was tremendous. If you need a decent place to stay in a great location (mid-strip), Bally's is your place. If you want a place to brag to your friends about, you're probably going to look elsewhere.

For the price and location, it's all good. I've stayed here 2-3 times. But what I hate is the escalator that leads to the hotel. 75% it works, the other 25% it doesn't. If you want a 5 star hotel, this will not be your hotel. If you want a good place to sleep and shower, this is the place. Plus it's a better location than Harrah's and Imperial Place. Not to be mention, much better place to stay.

Never stay at Bally's.
*Long check in lines
*rude receptionist 
*rude housekeeping
*gross beddings
*outdated furnitures
*poor ventillation

Bally's is Vegas worst nightmare! Be warned! This place should be shut down!

Old-school Vegas place.  

Originally, I was apprehensive as it was an older place on the strip.  But I was impressed in person...

I remember the rooms were huge, and great for the prices...Two queen-sized beds in one bedroom\/one bath for a very reasonable price.   Decent view of the strip too.  The place was really clean too.

The people\/service was quite friendly and helpful.  

The amenities were okay...but we had a decent package with coupons for food and discounts on their topless show.  It was a great time for us just-turned-21-year-olds then.    The show was okay...and the food was interesting...some of it was a bit over-priced and plenty of it was dirt-cheap.  We were all semi-broke...so...this place was pretty awesome for us!

Location is great though...pretty much in the middle of everything... It was nice to walk through the casinos...;-) especially as it was 90+ degrees out at the time!

I've stayed here and they are alright, but also a bit sleazy.  For example, I just made a reservation and they print what looks like a total amount in big colored text on the right side of the screen.  Then suddenly, after I input all of my information and then after the separate credit card screen, they added $84 in "taxes and fees".  And of course that doesn't even include the rip-off resort fees they will charge me later.  Bally's should be honest about the full amount up front.  Instead they intentionally try to hide the first round of hidden "taxes and fees" until after you put in your credit card number, and then the next round of bad news comes when you check in.

Mattress in room was really uncomfortable - very saggy.  Sink kept making this extremely loud gurgling sound - on it's own.  It woke us up several times.  And the extra charge to use the safe seemed really cheap.  Not impressed.  We'll stay elsewhere next time.

I spent one night here with my girlfriend, one of our first overnight vacations. This was a nice enough hotel, though checking in did take forever. I don't blame the hotel staff though, they had a tour bus of non-natives trying to check in, so there was some confusion.

After getting through that, we checked out our hotel room. It was nice and clean, though admittedly a bit dated. Still, enough for us to work as a resting point when we weren't in the casinos or walking the boardwalk.

I haven't stayed here, but I have visited on a couple of occasions, including my most recent trip as this was the closest Strip hotel to my hotel.  Being able to duck into a\/c after a hot block-long walk (more intense than it sounds, given the size of a Vegas block), would make Bally's A-OK on its own.

There are a few useful or noteworthy things here.  First, is the free shuttle out to the Rio Hotel.  Use this.  Do not make the mistake I did of thinking you can walk to the Rio because you're a good walker.  Second, there's an internal connecting passage to one of my favorite hotels, Paris.  Third, there is a monorail stop, and a pedestrian bridge across to either Bill's or Bellagio.  Fourth, there is a stand just past the connecting walkway to Paris which sells slushy booze drinks.

Gambling here, I've had moderate success, but I don't find the casino particularly compelling, and there are no worthy restaurant options that I know of.  Mostly, I seem to stop by when I'm on my way to somewhere else.

Bally's is an oldie but an goodie because the rooms are fairly big and cheap.  However, they got rid of their buffet so you have to walk over to Paris and eat there, or wander around down the Strip to find some good eats.  The gaming area is stuck in a time-warp from the 1980's, especially with the Party Pit tables but it's still not bad although everything was starting to look a little shabby.  They might need to revamp some of the chairs and tables to update them, but other than that, it's a great location to lay your head down in Vegas.
I was kicked out for winning!! Yes. I hit a jackpot on a video poker machine and was told I "I look like someone" and I was 86ed. WTF??!!???! Don't go here.

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #2:
Bally's = well, I thought I would hate this place, but you know, it's alright; I think it defines "average" and "mid-scale" as far as Las Vegas goes, but it would be a pretty nice place in a smaller town; it's literally attached to Paris, which is a solid step upwards vs. Bally's; a decided lack of good dining options - other than the steakhouse, everything is lower-end; the dealer women (not hot chicks) have to wear god-awful uniforms or ugly Hawaiian-style shirts; there's a gay nightclub here, which seems strange in such a non-hip casino; the 26th floor has some mostly empty big conference rooms with good views of The Strip; best craft brew bet = um, not good...maybe get a Rogue Dead Guy ale from the casino sundries shop.

Do NOT stay in the south tower!  Rooms 6008-6016 were admitted to us by the FACILITY ENGINEER to be "problem rooms" We were knowingly room that sounds like it has a thunderstorm going on 24\/7.  Plus a foghorn type sound was going off in our room throughout the night and the AC was was dripping water throughout the night. Nobody got any sleep.  The only reason we gave it a two instead of a one star review is because we wound up getting both rooms we booked comped.  Mind you, this happened after nearly an hour of arguing with the manager on duty, Melissa, who was extremely rude to us.  She only comped us after we asked her to write her name and extension number underneath HER managers name and extension number so we could further complain the following day (when her manager would be on duty).

We recently tried Bally's hotel and casino. We have been going to Vegas constantly and are trying different hotels. We checked in here on 11-4 and checked out 11-6.

As we arrived in the hotel, we went to the front desk and they gave us our room. I won't mention the room number here.  When we went up to our room, we noticed 2 queen beds and a very strong cigarette smell. We wanted a king bed and a non-smoking room.  It is a non-smoking room but i smelled like cigarette.

We called the front desk and asked if we could be transferred to a room with a king size bed. They been told us that there were no other rooms available. So we decided to settle in. As we were checking out the room we noticed that the air conditioner does not turn on. The actual thermostat control has no power at all. It was hot inside the room. We also noticed that the smoke alarm was dangling on the ceiling. We called the front desk again and told them about the non-working things and they said they were going to send someone to our room. We decided to wait but after an hour we called the front desk again and told them that no one came to our room to fix the air conditioner and the smoke detector. They told us someone was going to come.

After two hours we called the front desk again and they said the maintenance person will come to our room next. We arrived the hotel at around 8 o'clock and went up to our room around 830. At this time it was already 1030 and we have not eaten dinner yet. We called the front desk again and told them that we are so hungry and cannot wait any longer for the maintenance person to just come in a room and repair the air-conditioner and return the dangling smoke detector.

We left our room and had dinner then came back and everything was working. That night, I took a shower and noticed that the water wasn't going down the drain. It went up and up and up. Basically the shower was not working.

Considering that this hotel was recently renovated, this room where we were was very crappy and people at the front desk did not seem to care about our needs. Will I go back to this hotel? No.

This is probably sorta a 3.5 averaged out between my family's first visit last summer (for which I was not present) and the 3-night stay we just had this week. The highlight of the first visit was that my folks got their two separate rooms upgraded to a suite because they mentioned it was a family reunion (and also insisted on non-smoking), so that would've been 4 stars easily.

As for this visit, we got a 2-bed place on the 18th floor, which apparently was a free upgrade of some sort for us as we had already paid for the room beforehand and were insistent on having a non-smoking room. It was reasonable, I guess - better than my previous recent stays and Stratosphere and Circus Circus, respectively - but the TV size location in the recessed armoire was kinda crappy because I couldn't see it clearly from all around the room. And before you laugh at me for watching so much TV, well, if you don't choose to gamble much and you're tired after walking around the Strip all day, you might be in your room watching TV as well. Oh, and the room was as far from the elevators as you can get - yay, sore feet!

Still, the location was quite awesome, as we were within easy walking distance of all the good casinos - Bellagio, Paris, Planet Hollywood, the City Center hotels, etc. Since you can get a reasonable rate here compared to those other places, I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a reasonable deal at the heart of the Strip.
The people were rude. The room smelled and the wifi did not work at all.  What a joke

I was at Bally's Hotel & Casino this past October for a set of business meetings and had a mixed experience.

I have had the opportunity to stay at most of the hotels on The Vegas Strip, and Ballys at first glance looks like a tired old man at a rave.  It was "renovated" in 1981, but it honestly looks like it hasn't been touched since it opened in 1967.

The location itself of Bally's Hotel & Casino is fabulous.  It is mere minutes walking distance from all the new big attractions on the strip.

The staff at the registration desk were quite nice, and apologetic for the 20 minute line I had the joyous opportunity to wait in.

My booking was thankfully for the newly renovated Jubilee! Tower, which I was able to upgrade to a suite for a mere $20 more.  Since the hotel "convenience charge" was $16 a day, it was really only $4 a night to upgrade.

The Jubliee! Rooms are brand new.  I mean, literally they were opened formally a few days before my arrival.  The rooms were pristine, everything was brand new, and I couldn't possibly come up with a problem if there was a gun pointed to my head.

Some of my colleagues were not so lucky.  One in particular was originally put in the old tower and upon entering his room immediately had an allergy attack because of the mold levels.  His quick search found mold deposits throughout the bathroom from leaking pipes that appeared to be at least a year left untouched.  After calling to the front desk he was immediately upgraded to a suite in the Jubilee! Tower at no additional cost.

I spent the majority of my time in the convention center upstairs.  I must admit, it was a welcome change to be on the top floor for meetings rather than in the basement (most hotels everywhere).  This is where the 70's was very apparent.  The long hallway to the meeting rooms was encased with large patio doors that were welded shut and clad in window coverings that reminded me of staying at my grandmother's house.  According to a staff member they had to weld the doors to the multitude of tiny patios shut due to overwhelming suicides in the 80's.  Charming.

The décor was straight out of American Hustle.  Tired design, old carpets, fading paint, and wall sconces right out of Elvis' Graceland.  The meeting rooms themselves were no different.

The Casino at Bally's Hotel & Casino was average.  It wasn't as updated as Aria, but it was nowhere near Eliis Island.  There are only two bars (technically 1.5) and they are extremely hard to find.  The styling of the casino floor needs an interior decorator under the age of 49, as everything has this old uncle style going on.

The gym was decent.  If it wasn't for the fiasco of what was required for entry I wouldn't have had a problem.  I called the front desk before I departed, and they advised I only needed my key card for entry.  After walking the 15 minutes to the gym, I was advised differently and had to walk 15 minutes back to my room, only to walk 15 minutes back to the gym.  Yes, it actually is a loooong walk.  By the time I got into the gym, I had no time for a workout.

All in all, if you arte able to get into the Jubilee! Rooms it's a cheap way to get yourself in the center of The Strip so you can enjoy yourself outside of Ballys.

The only reason this place gets more than one star is because the front desk staff was amazingly helpful and gave accurate accounts to what time rooms would be ready. 


This place looks nice in the lobby, then you get to the floor your room is on and it starts to look a bit sketchy and then the room looks like it's from the 50s. My room was very dirty, hairs in the sink...on the toilet and in the shower, mirrors were covered in certain dried up fluids... 
I have worked in hotels before and don't expect a perfect room but this was just gross.

Stayed here Thursday night through Saturday morning. Second or third time staying here. 

Positives:
1. Cheap - you can probably get rates from $40 on weekdays to as cheap as $100-150 for weekends

2. Location - smack dab in the middle of the strip, right across from Caesars \/ Bellagio 

3. New recent add ons - I have not been to ballys in about two years but they added a food court and sports book at the back and all these shops out front. 

4. Table mins - if you aren't a big gambler this is probably a good place to start. Table mins are as low as $5 during the day and $10 at night

Negatives:
1. Room felt smoky \/ dirty. Ceiling was stained. Potential leaks from the floor? 

2. Dealers - most seem to hate life. One poker dealer got in an altercation with a player. Expect tips on every win or they hate you. 

3. Smaller casino \/ only about 1 or 2 poker tables going on. Not that much action, so this might be your place if you like that. I guess this was a positive for me since I had a positive couple poker sessions. 

I would definitely come and stay again, I tend to win here, but I don't expect much.

I stayed at Ballys during my first visit to the strip and location wise it was perfect! It's connected to Paris so you get two casinos and double the restaurants and shops without every having to step foot outdoors. Then when you do go outside you have an outdoor strip right at the door step! It's just a few steps from the Bellagio (which I could see the fountains from my room) and all the other hotel\/casinos in that area. We were able to walk a few mins to shows in Planet Hollywood and have drinks at the Cosmo. For a first timer on a budget I chose right! The actual restaurants in the hotel we didn't try as they seemed pretty mediocre but with everything so close it didn't matter. The staff was very nice and accommodating while we were there though we didn't need them much. The rooms are spacious and clean and that's all that really matters for me when I stay in a hotel. Your not going to be wow'd by the decor but your sleeping in a clean soft bed.
Can't beat the price, clean, modern comfortable rooms in the Jubilee Tower. It's my go to spot in Vegas. Definitely recommend.

Pretty dated hotel...$2.00 margarita, will give it a try!

No No No!!!  Do not waste your money on the the $2.00 margarita.  It gave me an allergic reaction to my throat.  I started off with Margaritaville margarita and it was great.  When I was done I bought the 2.00 and my throat was getting scratchy and felt like a sore throat.  My nurse friend said it might be the bad tequila as that can tend to happen.  

This was the start of the Vegas trip.  I had to start drinking water to relieve the pain and disgusting taste!  ugh :P
It was a decent hotel, room was kept pretty clean. However I did not like the resort fee but the wifi did come in handy...for only 2 devices. Probably won't be coming here again.

I don't have a princess complex, nor am I high maintenance. To be truly honest, this hotel needs some upgrading.

My family and I come to Vegas every Christmas. This time, he had a business trip and wanted to take us. He chose Bally's because of its location and the prices was reasonable. This is the first time we have stayed here so here I go....

The walk from the garage to the check-in desk, don't care. It can be far for other people but we didn't mind. The check-in was hassle free. My husband asked for an upgrade. The front desk agent said, if we didn't like the room, to come down and he can upgrade us. Cool! Finding the elevators was a bit confusing but we found it. I noticed right away, the elevators were dirty. Just trash inside of them and fingerprints and marks all over the mirrors. Not a good sign. And I was right.

We found our room. Right next to our hotel room door was a bag full of trash. I guess the cleaning service set it there and forgot? That was sign #2. We went inside the hotel room and I didn't want to say anything to my husband but when he finally mentioned it was filthy....thank God it wasn't just me. There was tape on the ceilings, it looked like no one ever dusted the place, there was trash inside the dressers, the toilet was bubbling with foam (no joke!) ...I felt like I was catching a disease just standing there. I could go on but I attached pictures instead.

My husband went down to the front desk and asked for a different room. He tried showing the front desk agent the pictures of the room and he didn't want to see them. We did get a bigger and "cleaner" room. 

I know Bally's has been around forever but if what we stayed in was an upgraded room, they need to upgrade again. Maybe do some serious training on cleanliness. 

Sorry.

I like the location of in the middle of the strip..!
And they have Buca di Peppo..!
They had Starbuck down stair by the Grand Bazzar shops, It is only Starbuck not franchised by the hotel, like other ones so price is not that bad...!
There is 24 Hour CVS right on end of the Grand Bazzar shops...! 
The shops are fun and there are few bars on a row..!

Despite the bad reviews on this hotel...I took a gamble...it seems like a hit or miss.

We got a great deal $109 per night total including taxes, and $28 resort fee during Super bowl weekend.  Got no complaints.  We got a king size non smoking room clean!  Booked with booking.com

Checked in room was available at 2 pm.  Got an email to confirm and updated us when our room as ready.

Free wifi super slow but enough juice  to check email.

Across the street is a super cheap mama papa shop to get bottles if you run out.

I booked with Luxor last time and it was so far from everything.  I have no complaints on the price and the location.  

Maid service was working morning and also saw them cleaning out rooms at 11 p.m.  They really kept our room 1793 super clean!  

Hair dryer
iron board
shampoo
soap
(BYO toothpaste\/brush)
Clean room but scary hallways. The hallways are so long and tons of mirrors I just had an  eery feeling. Glad my husband was with me but I didn't feel safe. I would check into another hotel.

Sunday, August 6, 2017 - Attending a Convention
Duration: 5 Nights (8\/1-8\/6)
Room Type: 2 Queen Beds, Indigo Tower

For this being my very first visit to Las Vegas ever (outside of a 3 hour lay over I had when I was a kid), Bally's Hotel made a terrible impression on me. Thankfully the convention and events I partook in helped to reverse my feelings!

CHECK-IN:
Checking in was an absolute nightmare, until I got to the counter. I flew in from the Bay Area where the weather was in the 70's, so when I stepped off the plane, and it was 106, I wasn't the happiest guy, but I still kept an open mind.

Now when I got to the hotel, thankfully there was AC blasting, but I had to wait in line for 30-40 minutes just to get checked in. There were only 2 people checking guests in, with 1 person down at the Mail & Keys line (which was empty), and 2 people at the Platinum Member Registration check-in (which was also empty). I got to the Hotel and into the line at 2:40PM , however I didn't get checked in until 3:15PM - 3:20PM. I could have done the Kiosk Express check-in but I have heard bad stories regarding the express check-in.

Thankfully the lady at the counter was super nice and funny, and was able to put a smile on my face.


STAY \/ DURATION:
I was the first of my party to check-in and was tired from both the heat, which I'm not used to, and traveling in general. So I wanted to relax in my room, where I could blast the AC, and maybe get some room service as all I had for food that day was a small lunch before my flight (a bagel sandwich). Now here's where I really got irritated. Bally's does not have Room Service past 1PM. They have a breakfast service from 6AM - 11AM and then a lunch service from 11AM - 1PM. That's right, absolutely no dinner service. I understand the idea of being in Vegas is for you to explore the strip, but I still think it's crap they don't provide a dinner or late night service.

Next was the Wifi. There is only one option available from what I saw and that was the "Basic Plan." If you pay the resort fee \/ have the resort package, which I did, it's included in said fee. If you don't have a package or pay said fee, it's $14.99 per 24 hours. Now, that's not too bad, but the service absolutely sucked! Not only did it take an average of 5 minutes for my device to connect, when it did, the download speed was horrid! Most of the time I couldn't do anything on my phone. More so, my reception sucked, even when I had 4\/5 bars. As a guy who works in IT, seemed like they have some type of "net" that disrupts your data usage when you're not on their wifi, but I can't be 100% sure.

The one positive thing, however, was the housekeeping. They were always on time, and I mean extremely prompt, and wonderful when we exchanged pleasantries. Additionally, I love pillows and I needed more than 3. The guy I talked to at housekeeping was able to get my room 4 extra pillows when supposedly the extra limit is only 2. THANK YOU HOUSEKEEPING!


CHECK-OUT:
Check was probably the easiest out of everything my party and I went through. Had payed all fees up front, so all we had to do was hand in our keys, get a paper saying everything had already been paid in full, and we were out.


CONCLUSION:
For my first time being in Vegas, outside of the airport at least, I was severely disappointed. My friend and I have already decided on a few other places we would much rather stay, even if we have to pay 2-4 times what we did at Bally's. Won't be coming back.

The price wasn't bad and the location on the strip was great.  My girlfriend and I stayed in the North Tower, which was nice and it's a decent sized room.  I didn't care for their customer service.  I went to the trouble of calling to make my reservation and asking about the amenities.  I was told that they had a gym and they left out the part where it was an extra $22 a day.:P  When I inquired at the front desk about it, the manager was not helpful and impatient.
I would definitely choose a different hotel next time.

There's a real mix of reviews on this page, but we couldn't have been more happy with our recent stay at Bally's. Our personal experience was wonderful!

First, we stayed in the Jubilee Tower, in a Jubilee King Non-Smoking room. It was fantastic!

Our room measured more than 430 square feet with a desk, lounge furniture, and very comfortable pillow-top king size bed. The décor was very modern and everything was very clean. The bathroom was awesome too. Our room featured an upgraded marble bathroom with a huge shower. Everything seemed like-new and the staff kept everything very clean. 

The room also came equipped with a refrigerator, iDevice docking station, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, clock radio, wireless internet access (which is included in the resort fee), USB charging ports, a flat-screen TV with cable, and in-room movies.

Our room had a Las Vegas Strip view, looking right out onto the Paris Eiffel Tower and we could just see the Bellagio fountains as well. The view really made the experience so amazing! We kept our curtains open almost the entire time. It was so beautiful day or night. 

In addition to loving our room at Bally's we also enjoyed the casino. Plus, Bally's is so conveniently located. It's connected to Paris, so you can walk through the tunnel\/hall from Bally's casino straight into Paris, which was awesome! Plus, it's in the middle of the strip, so you can *very* easily walk to The Linq, The Flamingo, Paris, Planet Hollywood, The Bellagio, etc. On top of all of that, there are tons of shops around! Bally's actually has its own shopping plaza, which was awesome, and the Miracle Mile shops are also within walking distance. There are also plenty of cheap food spots around and a Walgreens that's easily within walkable distance, in case you need to pick up cheap travel supplies or alcohol. 

I honestly couldn't recommend Bally's more. This was our first Vegas trip, so the next time we go we may end up staying somewhere else, just for the experience. But, I can tell you now, if the next place we stay doesn't beat Bally's then we'll be back for the following visit, because we loved it!
Nice Hotel. Great Rates and perfect location. Right in the center of everything. You don't have to walk very far for anything.

Ah, the benefits of being a poker player.  Comped room?  Gracias.  Comped room with a BIDET?!  What the?!

I peeked.  I giggled.  I never used it.  Mainly because the thing was so old the water pressure fluctuated between a mere trickle to full-on geyser mode.

Sorry, butthole.  Thanks, but no thanks.

The absolute worst hotel experience that I have ever had.  I would give it no stars if it was possible.  IT IS UNSAFE!!!!! 

I was staying at this property for a conference and educational series so I didn't have much choice about where to stay - it was part of the package.  Anyway, it was a forced upgrade into the Jubilee Tower which was fine since the rooms were supposed to be renovated. The first issue was the elevators - I found out that there were problems with the elevators and only one was working.  It took forever (literally 10-15 minutes) every time we wanted to go up or down, stopping at every single floor and it was always packed.  Then I walked into the room, and that was the first negative.  I don't know what was supposed to have been upgraded, but it felt and smelled old and cheap.  Whatever, it is what it is and I settled in.  

Then came the the bad part.  

Halfway through my stay, I came back to my room to find that the door had been left unlatched and it swung open easily.  I had only been out for about an hour and housekeeping had been in to clean in the meantime so I assumed it was them.  I immediately contacted the front desk who called housekeeping, who then referred me to security.  No one wanted to take responsibility for assisting me and I kept getting transferred.  Well, finally someone an EMT came up to fill out the report.  In addition to being scared that my room was not secured, I also saw that my belongings had been tampered with and $370 in cash vouchers had been stolen.  My room was changed - no one offered to come and help me carry the 3 suitcases that I was dragging across the hotel.   I was also given a paper for Risk Management and was told that someone would contact me regarding the stolen items. 

No one did contact me and I left several messages over several days before finally calling the Paris office and having someone direct transfer me.  This was after I had just called the same number and no one picked up.  Seems like they only answer their own calls.  Anyway, the woman who answered was rude and said that they have an insurance company reviewing it.  

I spoke to the insurance company and they told me that my claim was denied because housekeeping filled out a statement saying she didn't take the money, it was confirmed that the locks were working, that the door had not been tampered with and there were no security cameras in that area.  Um, ok, so a couple things here.  What person admits to stealing money??  What casino\/hotel does not have cameras everywhere?  Isn't Bally's liable even if the housekeeper left the door open for someone else to steal from my room?? 

I asked for a lock report as to what keys has been used to enter if the locks were working.  They confirmed that they had a report, but refused to answer that one and told me to get a subpoena.  Yeah, so you can answer all the questions that make you look like you investigated, but can't answer the one that would definitely say whether I used my key (or if the room was open)  to get back into the room to call security?  

They told me that as far as they were concerned the case was closed, Bally's was not liable and to sue them if I thought I had a case.  

All in all a horrible experience.  As a woman traveling alone for work, I would NEVER stay here again, even if were offered free.  It is UNSAFE, UNCLEAN and the WORST customer service I have ever received.  I ended up leaving a day early because I just could not take it anymore - it was that bad.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

Yes, Bally's is an older hotel. But.... My family and I enjoyed our stay there this past weekend. It was our first time staying here. The reason we chose Bally's was it was less expensive. Don't know why this particular weekend was so expensive but this fell in our budget. 

We drove from Los Angeles straight to the hotel. Got there on a Friday at 4pm (check in time) Valet was a breeze. The attendant was helpful and quick. Check in process was quick and smooth. They have kiosks to electronically retrieve your room info and keys. We got up to the room and surprisingly it was very spacious! The most modern? No... But spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable as could be!

Casino floor isn't huge but not small by any means. My wife and I enjoyed the casino and the prompt service of the waitresses that you don't receive at the "fancier" hotels. Even though we had our vehicle. I didn't even get it from valet until we checked out. Because of it's central location, we were in quick easy walking distance to everything! Caesar's and Bellagio right across the street. Paris was literally next door and has a connection walkway. 

Highly recommend this place and will definitely return!

With so many choices on the strip, how does a proper review come to be? What are the determining factors of what creates a quality accomidation experience over a disappointing one? 

I think the answer has so many facets, all need to be touched upon even if only for a sentance or quicker mention.  The Room: well appointed with a refrigerator, internet if you pay an additional hotel fee, (free or less costly would be a welcome implimentation) a nice view of the Bellagio fountain, not enough water pressure in the modern, glass enclosed shower.
 The Gaming: Great Bloody Mary's at the sports book, projectors for big screens are looking grainy, may need updating soon. Beaten up floor in the main casino, pit bosses and dealers were polished and helpful.
 The Restaurants: SEA was atrocious, the breakfast joint by the escalator is worth stopping in for a meal or two. Nosh is also good for a quick breakfadt bite.
  Shopping: The downstairs mall is not good for gamblers that want to get to the sports book as merchants are constantly badgering you to sell their wares.  
 Staff: Hit and miss, the "free show" lobby pitch was really getting under my skin as it was a constant in my day, everyday, multiple times a day with poor attitudes to boot.
 Valet were chock full of information, bartenders lacked in personality and appearance, housekeeping was top shelf with personality and work eithic. Great location, sitting centrally in the middle of the strip, but for meals, gaming, music and an overall more visually pleasing experience, go next door to Paris. It's owned by the same corporation.

It's old and run down. It's dirty and smelly. Our room on the 6th floor was freezing and had stains all over it. They put us in a room with a pull out of the wall bed. Paris is much nicer. Don't stay here.

This hotel offers very good rates and a very good location. The rooms are in pretty decent shape and without me having to play the 'tip front desk' game I've always gotten a nice room (even though my status with Total Rewards is 'Dirt(tm)').  A lot of rooms also have a view of the Bellagio fountains without the Bellagio price. 

It's unfortunate that they now started charging a resort fee, which does include Internet, but just for one device. Who know only has one device for Internet? I know i don't. A prop tip, if you have a laptop you can download an app called Connectify for free, plug your laptop into the wired connection into the room, and then share out the internet to all your other devices. Internet speeds were decent. 

Maybe I got lucky the few times I've been there but the rooms have had flat TVs and comfortable beds both times I've been there, and for the net of around $60 per night and being able to walk to everything on the strip, I will stay here again.
Service sucks. Book couple room suppose to b all the same but it's not. One room was 3 and a half larger than out other room. Customer service was no help. This place is gonna lose costumes.

We were impressed with the size of the room, we had a nice view and it was an awesome experience!.
My girlfriend visiting from Russia said this was the nicest hotel she stayed at so far, until I took her to the next one the next night, lol

Nice settings but room service and front desk need a lot of improvement. Dinner was cold and credit card mix up at front desk took forever to resolve. Would expect more next time but over all nice stay.

Check In Disaster-45 minute wait in line with 3 clerks and 50 people waiting in line to check in.  While waiting we saw countless reservation clerks peeking out from the back room looking at the line, but not offering to help. The three clerks that were there either took their time or never told people to advance to be helped.   Finally, the people in line demanded to see the manager and told him off.  This pathetic person offered no apologies or explanations as to his "out to lunch" staff.  Room so-so, initial check in was such a disaster we will never return.  Too many other places to choose from who truly want our business.

Came here today and visited my Aunt who had a suite here. 
There was a really great guy at the front desk. 
My aunt raved about him, we went down there to get a key, and he was there, Dennis. 
So nice, and helpful. She said that he's been recommending the best restaurants to her, he reminded me that there was a Wahlburgers nearby and me and my girlfriend actually went there for lunch an hour later. 
He also told me that the new Britney Spears show was great. I said I saw it 2 years ago, and he mentioned that it changed. 

My aunt purchased me tickets for tomorrow night. 
For me and my friends
It was so cool. He enhanced my aunt Darcy's hotel experience and derailed my plans for the day. 
Dennis was great. Lost $20 on the slot machine waiting for my aunt to come down

* I haven't stayed in this hotel for almost 10 yrs 
As a guest

Early check-in fee was 25% of the daily cost of the room. Desk staff is unfriendly and surly. Room service: The continental breakfast was terrible, the turkey and avocado sandwich was huge and quite good.  The hotel amenities are just okay, nothing special, particularly when paying a $20\/day resort fee. The only good service I received over my entire trip was from the bell staff. They were friendly and helpful throughout my stay. Fast forward to check out. I was overbilled at checkout for an upgrade for which I never agreed. After 20 minutes, yes I timed it, he comes back and says that the person who checked me in isn't there and they can't find my check-in record (sorry, but isn't this the digital age) but that they go through a very detailed check in procedure and he doesn't understand what happened. I believe I was just called a liar. Then, instead of apologizing for their mistake, he says "Sorry this is taking so long, but we're very careful when we're giving away money." Wow. Giving away money? How about rectifying YOUR mistake? Fortunately, I had a good cushion before my plane left. And fortunately I was too tired to make a scene, Needless to say, Bally's is off my list of future Vegas stays. This people is what happens when you cheap out. Actually, that's not true. I've had better service from a Motel 6.

Great location but hotel is not worth it. I slept in but took my do not disturb sign off my door when I left for the day. Two housekeepers were on my floor when I left and when I came back at 2am my room was not serviced!!  I called front desk and someone bought clean towels but I had  food from the night before and trash filled to the brim and no coffee for the morning! Pool is a 15 minute walk from my room and casino smells like an ashtray! Not only will I never stay here again I will tell anyone and everyone I know how awful this place is. Stay elsewhere!!

Stayed here fourth of july weekend 2015. Found a groupon for $99 saturday night 7\/4 and the rest of the nights were $37. Thought the price was great! Stayed at encore, caesars, flamingo, monte carlo before. I would rate this hotel alongside the flamingo. Nothing to go crazy about like encore and caesars since they are more "luxury", but still a GREAT hotel.
Left NYC at 6am so by the time we landing in LV it was very early. We did early check in for $20. Thought that was great because it wouldve been so long to wait for checkin.
Location is awesome, you are right in the middle of everything. They have a food court with lots of food options. The hotel is connected to the Paris, which has a yummy buffet and good food options. 
No problems with the room. It was spacious and the bathroom spacious nice and clean!
Pool was big & i remember any ladies walking around doing drink service. The monorail runs above and right next to the pool, no biggie but might bother some
People. Never had a problem getting a chair at the pool , they do allow kids in the pool.
One thing that did bother me: they did not check if you were a hotel guest to go into the pool & this happened on more then one day i was there. Also, late at night and at all times for that matter, they never checked if you were a hotel guests when going upstairs into the elevators. This can potentially be dangerous.

Bally's is one of my favorite hotels to stay at. I decided to stay here for my birthday weekend since it in the middle of the strip (walking distance to Planet Hollywood, Caesar's, Drai's). There's also a free shuttle to Rio.  When I checked in, Nilo was very friendly and patient. I was upgraded from a classic suite to a Jubilee Celebrity suite for a discounted rate. The upgrade suite was beautiful and spacious! 

Besides from the hotel, I felt the slot machines were pretty limited. The restaurants here are also limited. The food court is hidden at the back of the hotel. But because Bally's is conveniently located in the middle, it's very close to walk to nearby hotels with more restaurant choices. 

Overall, Bally's is an affordable and convenient hotel to stay at.

They can't even give us actual comforters for the bed and instead we got thin sheets as blankets. 

And then when I called asking for comforters, they sent over thin fleece blankets. What the fuck

I never want to stay here again.

I got an offer through Total Rewards for comp nights and chose to stay at Bally's for its location and newly renovated North Tower. Upon check in, the agent was soft spoken and I had to try hard to listen over all the casino noise but it was a very smooth process. I was glad to be able to check in early around noon but there were maybe only 3 agents working. Since it was a comp stay, a credit card was not required for incidentals unless I was going to use the internet or make phone calls. I am glad the agent gave us that option rather than requiring a credit card. The room was nice and clean and so was the bathroom. It went through renovations, but the TV was still old school. Nothing spectacular to report about but no complaints either.

I absolutely love the perks of being in a convenient location that Bally's offers. Located smack dab on the middle of the strip. I love that Bally's is connected to Paris and you instantly feel like you are in another country walking through the shops and making that transition. I also like how they have a complimentary shuttle to the Rio which is their sister property. The strip is easily accessible as well with the escalators and moving sidewalks.  

Catching a cab from Bally's was not a great experience. Standing in a line in the Las Vegas heat is never fun, but hey, what else can you do, right?! The line was not too long but cabs do not frequent Bally's so there is no flow of vehicles. The doorman openly chews gum and holds his tips in a nice open stack in his hand. He asks where you are going but does not tell the cab driver. Tip for nothing! This guy needs a lesson on service!

One night, I was stuck in traffic in a taxi and asked to get dropped off at Paris instead of Bally's since I could just walk through the casino and the cab driver made a joke: "You realized that it's gonna charge you a million dollars plus an arm and a leg to get dropped off at Ballys in this traffic, but then you'd have to pay for your French visas and all that to enter Paris!" Hahahaha... Good one. Overall, good experience!

So a few years ago I was looking for a place to stay on the strip and someone mentioned Ballys and my reaction alternated between repulsion and laughter. Like "we should go to Jollibee" kinda laughter.  If you don't know about Jollibee check out my review of the since closed Mira Mesa location. 

I digress

We saw that Ballys had rooms for $29 plus report fee and decided to give it a try, especially since all the M-Life hotels have decided to tack on a parking fee in addition to all of their ridiculousness that they already charge for. Ballys does not so they got the nod!

I seriously couldn't believe what a good week we had at Ballys. The rooms are not going to be like Mandalay Bay or whatever. There is not going to be a high end club and the rest of it is pretty average. But it was definitely solid. The rooms are in good shape and have the basics. The pool is nice. If you're looking for a pool with party style music wtc this is not the scene for you. There was music but it wasn't overpowering the scene. The vibe in the pool was pretty chill. Perfect scene for day drinking and relaxing. 

The best part?  Location!  You're literally in the center of the strip. You can't beat it. Whatever you want to do its right there.

To be clear, Ballys is not the heart of the party scene. It's conveniently located to get you to the party scene. Plus for $29 it can't be beat. 

I took one star off because everyday while we were at the pool the lifeguards decided that when cleaning up the pool chairs they would try throwing them on top of each other and needless to say my passed out self did not appreciate being woken up to the sound of crashing chairs. Seriously?!? Wtf is the point of smashing the chairs into each other? Simmer down there Mr Hulkamaniac. This isn't Wrestlemania 247 or something.

If you can't judge a book by it's cover, you certainly can't judge a casino by it's fascade.  That's my take on Bally's--it ain't pretty on the outside, but you'll be surprised by the rooms on the inside.

The first thing you'll notice when you walk in is how much the lobby does not match the outside.  It's almost as if you're transported to another casino.  Granted, it's no Bellagio, but I would say that it's on par with other casinos such as Paris or New York, New York but without the themepark feel.  Plus, if you like to gamble, there are plenty of tables and slots to play at.

I can't really comment on the food here.  The truth is, you don't have to.  Paris is right next door, you don't even have to step outside to get there, Caesars and Bellagio are right across the street, and the monorail can get you to othe casinos (although if you're with friends, it'll probably be cheaper to split a cab).

The rooms were nice.  We paid $99 a night for a full-sized bathroom, a bed, a sofa bed, and a sad excuse for a minibar with a small fridge that comes in handy when you actually have a doggy bag worth revisiting and an extra sink.  You'll notice just a touch of wear along the edges of the furniture, but in all honesty, that's a little nitpicky considering the fact that you're in the middle of the Strip.

When all's said and done, Bally's is a great deal for the money.  But the reason I have to give it three stars are the comps: I've been offered free rooms at more upscale casinos.  With that option available every now and then, do you really want to stay here?

We decided to stay at Bally's due to the convenient central location on the strip. Check in was pretty rough as the first two rooms had issues. The first room looked as though it had not been vacuumed and there was some staining on the sheets in addition to a substance on one of the chairs. The second room had a nice view, so I was disappointed to see dirt particles in the sheets. This was very surprising as the Jubilee tower has been renovated, so we assumed it would be clean. We were finally comped to a suite for our third and final room.  The suite was spacious and clean with a very comfortable bed. If you are going to stay at this hotel, spring for the suite as they are better kept and there are two sinks. The shower was large, however the water pressure here is poor. The casino itself is average. If you need a reasonably priced room centrally located on the strip, you should consider this hotel, but spring for the suite to avoid a stressful check in process.

I had a great stay at Bally's. The staff were super helpful with any questions I had and very friendly. We stayed in the North tower and though we had a view of some construction going on (which won't be forever) I had no problem with my room and I really loved the marble bathroom.

The food court was convenient, if you happen ask Paris if they have a food court, they'll direct you to Bally's food court since they only have restaurants. I ate at Bally's Ichiban sushi restaurant which is a little hidden on the way to the pool but if you find it its tasty and not too expensive. Overall great location on the strip and very helpful staff.

I'm really right down the middle with this place, I'd probably realistically give it 2.5 stars and not choose to stay here again. I'm pretty easy going and let a lot of things slide others might complain about. Usually we stay at NY NY and I've always been happy there. 

First off, our check in with Elvis, was as simple and friendly as can be. Good start. We did notice the next day on Monday the check in line was excruciatingly long, I couldn't imagine having to have wait in that. The casino is clean, decent and semi busy, no complaints there. The Evening Call slushy bar employees were all friendly and patient and the alcoholic slushies were good. 

The room, was alright, great view of the Ferris wheel in Indigo Tower. BUT.... The white comforter has noticeable stains on it, the pillows and sheets were clean. The mattress is probably the hardest mattress I've ever slept on. The bathroom fan doesn't work [edit: retract fan doesn't work, Indigo tower bathrooms have vents no fans, Only Jubilee tower bathrooms have fans so far.]. The remote for the TV doesn't work. The AC works well but it never ever shuts off, so if white noise or freezing bother you from sleeping, then it's not the room for you. Also the toilet flusher broke on our second flush but we didn't call the front desk, my husband just reattached the chain so the water would stop running. The walls are decently thick, we only hear neighbors next door if we are standing by the door that joints the rooms. We can hear loud noises from upstairs and the hallways rather. 

So all in all, like I said, about 2.5. Not the worst dump I've stayed in, not a full 3 star place though either. Still waiting for that remote for the TV though...[edit: got a working remote.]

I've stayed here a few times now, and I've always enjoyed my stay. The check-in staff has always been fast and friendly (even this last weekend being Halloween weekend, it took us less than 15 minutes to get checked into two rooms). The rooms are really big compared to most hotel rooms on the strip that are the standard 2 queen rooms. The TVs are also a good size compared to others (I'm talking about you, Harrah's. Love you, but your TVs are tiny). They have safes in the room as well, which is really nice. The bathrooms are pretty roomy, and my friend and I were more than comfortable having both of us getting ready for Halloween adventures on The Strip all weekend. I like that the hotel is pet friendly, and they don't put up a stink about it like some other Strip hotels have in the past (not Harrah's, they are also great with pets). The pool at Bally's is also pretty nice.
I mostly love that Bally's is always pretty affordable, and has a prime, mid-Strip location. It's almost in the very middle of the nearly 2-mile stretch of where the action all happens on the Strip. The Grand Bazaar outside of Bally's is pretty cool too. They have some great little food and boutique shops set up there. Parking here is free, which is nice. Getting up into parking can be scary-ish, because the drive up to parking is steep, and you've got people going down the ramp on your left, and pedestrians on the right. 
All in all, Bally's is a great, budget-friendly Strip hotel!

Bally's is one of the cheaper hotels on the strip and you get what you pay for. The location of this hotel is awesome but the rooms need some serious updating. I felt kind of dirty staying here. Look at all your options before booking a room here.

We paid exactly $100 for a nice king bed room AND we brought our two dogs (12 and18 lbs). You have to check in w ur dog and you dont need to bring a cage. Recommended though.
Over 50lbs dogs might be an issue. Check before hand. There is a dog are on the pool\/street level. That doggie area is not the cleanest and my dogs did not always do their biz right there. But if you walk down to the opposite side of that doggie are (by the employment center) there is a secluded (loose gravel\/stone) area that work. Precious serviced our room and she did a fantastic job. Clean and professional. The pool area wasnt clearly described, therefore 4 stars only. Enjoy!

I stayed here for a 4 day trip to Vegas. On the plus side, this place has a great location in the middle of the strip. They have also renovated the north tower so the rooms over there are decent for the rate, although cleanliness is questionable given that we found some stains on our sheets (!)

A major negative is the overwhelming stench of cigarette smoke that overpowers your senses as soon as you step into the lobby. The casino at this hotel must have the worst ventilation system because I did not encounter this issue at any of the other major hotels on the strip despite there being a similar number of smokers present. 

Also, none of the moving belts were ever functioning. 

The water here is heavy chlorinated and disgusting. Do not drink! 

The pool is also very mediocre and atmosphere slightly creepy. We ended up visiting a friend at another hotel and had a much better time lounging by that pool. 

I did not bother with any of the shows or restaurants here since there were much better options elsewhere. 

Overall, Bally's is a decent place to sleep on a budget but that is about it.

I had the worst customer service from the time I checked in to the time I checked out. The staff made me feel like an inconvenience when requesting standard serivices. Upon check in, the bell hop was less than willing get to help me with my bags to my room. Went downstairs for a 10 dollar ice cream sunday. Asked to hold the cherry and when I got my Sunday it was ice cream and choc syrup. When I asked why there weren't the nuts and whip cream like the pic, she said sh assumed I didn't want it because I didn't want the cherry.  When I told her I did, she went back and had to make a new batch of whipped cream. Makes me think she just said that because she was too lazy to make it the first time. And they were out of nuts. Cleaning staff were ok. Not very thourough. The Italian restaurant was new but they at least tried.  upon checkout the bell hop were essential than friend and the lady at the counter had an attitude with me. Pretty much any staff I talked to didn't have the time of day. I would not recommend ballys.

If you are a fan of the movie National Lampoons Vegas Vacation, the movie or the time period, you can recreate the movie here. 

This place is old school, heads or tail Vegas.

Where lifer cocktail waitress reside. 

Hey,some people like that vibe, don't judge. You ain't the G man.

2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 93\/365

We stayed here for Cinco De Mayo weekend and I have to say that It was just a whatever experience. The second we walked in, we were hounded by two ladies asking if my friend and I want to get married this weekend. This happened to us 3 more times walking through the hotel this weekend. So annoying and weird. The room was not too bad. Very spacious and lots of chairs, tables, mirrors. The bed and pillows were so uncomfortable but the bathroom was pretty nice. The casino was so so very sad. First of all, from the farthest side of the casino, I can see the other end. This casino is smaller than my gym! And it really wasn't that busy. We didn't gamble here, we didn't eat here. We got some goodies form the cafe in the lobby and of course she packed my back with the wrong dessert. -_- Overall, this was a cheap weekend away, so I guess you get what you pay for.

I stayed in the jubilee tower, and it was absolutely beautiful! I was thrilled that the room didn't reek of cigarette smoke, the bathroom was spotless, the towels were soft, and my room didn't look like some of the unflattering photos I saw on yelp. The floors, however, were questionable.They were pretty sticky, and I stepped on a few hard\/crusty spots.  It's definitely nothing a pair of flip flops can't handle, but the tactile memory of crusty\/sticky floors is forever engrained in the trauma center of my brain---so I had to take off a star for that. Just make sure to bring a pair of flip flops with you if you plan to stay at Balley's, and this won't be a problem you have to face :)  I also visited Vegas during the hottest time of the year and it just so happened to be 115 degrees outside when I arrived. To say I was extremely excited to cool down at the pool was an under-statement; however, my excitement quickly dissipated when I approached a murky pool that felt more like a jacuzzi. So because it felt hotter to be in the pool than it was to be out of the pool, I had to take away another star.  They did have a few outdoor showers that helped me beat the heat, but don't count on the pool to do the trick. The great thing about this place is that it is centrally located on the strip, and you can easily walk to day clubs and night clubs.

Stayed here back in August with the fam! It's relatively affordable and right on the strip which is FANTASTIC!!!! but the casino itself is very small and they do have a small outdoor pool with a standard bar but not much more to offer beyond that. The rooms were pretty good-furnished with a few couches, tables and standing lamps with a nice spacious bedroom area equipped with a good view of The Linq and strip below. We stayed on the 23rd floor and the patio doors are locked shut permanently. I slept nearby the windows with the curtains opened so I could see the view of the city lights below; it was a beautiful view to fall asleep to. Also, this may be random and weird but we kept hearing knocking (like knuckle knocking) from the patio windows at night (a couple of knocks every 15-30 mins or so); but who knows it's probably just some strong wind!! Moreover, I LOVE that the Paris casino & resort is literally right down the hall, so worry not! beautiful and breathless views and delicious food is only a few footsteps away!!  ;)  From Balley's, you can access the skyway directly to the Bellagio and there's a TON of stores right outside of the Balleys hotel itself, including Walgreens, LUSH, ramen\/food\/clothing shops, bar stands, etc! It's also not too far from Planet Hollywood (GO BSB!!!) But it is quite a walk from The Cosmopolitan, Luxor, etc! Probably won't stay at Balley's next time since there are so many other hotels to try but if needed I wouldn't mind coming back here since it's relatively affordable & so close to all the awesome things to do!! ;)

My boys and I planned a spur of the moment Vegas trip. It looked like it was a great time for us to go during fight weekend and Mexican independence day.

After browsing through many hotels to fit in our budget of 5 guys, Bally's came out a victor! It was conveniently located within walking distance to places where we wanted to eat and gamble.

Since we had a late check in time, we took our sweet time driving down from the Bay Area. The room was nicely prepared upon our walk-in. It was spacious to and had a nice view over looking a partial part of the Vegas strip.

As for the casino area, well what would you expect to happen during a couple of major events happening over this weekend? Table limits are up and celebrity sightings are bound to happen. While walking back to my room at 3am, I spotted Bay Area Legend rapper Too $hort with his body guard talking with some groupies. Too bad my phone battery died.

The room service was prompt on accommodating our room needs. Thank you Bally's for giving a great place to stay for the weekend!

I can't really complain about this hotel - especially since it's such a great deal. I think split between 2 gfs and I, it came out to about 50\/60 a person? We left Friday morning and came home on Sunday, and if we wanted to stay, we could have had Monday comp'ed. So I really can't complain.

It's pretty clean, even if the decor and furnishings are a bit outdated, and this with somewhat a renovation. Glad that there's not really a bad ciggie smell that's associated with some of the more budget friendly hotels. 

Bally's is right next to Paris, across from the Bellagio, right in the heart of Las Vegas. Valet - free as usual, wherever you stay. Just don't forget to tip!!! hehe.

There's a casino, filled with smoke (sigh). I just want them to have a ciggie free casino. Please? :) But the good thing is that the tables are pretty decent - some at $5, some at $10 minimum - as compared to some of the other premium hotels that start at $15. 

I'd come back for a budget friendly Vegas trip!

Giving this hotel 3 stars is a bit generous. Overall, Bally's has a great location, decent amenities and a fun pool, but the service is disappointing. The employees we interacted with didn't seem to want to help us and made us feel more like a burden to them. We asked to have our room serviced because we found some trash that was left behind from the previous guests and when they serviced our room they didn't even touch the trash we wanted them to take out! It was still in there the next day. I won't say what the trash is but it was not something I would consider touching without gloves on. I figured they would try to make up for this but all I got was a rude employee who didn't care about our comfort.

Whenever my grandparents returned home from one of their many journeys to Atlantic City they would bring me piles of presents, among which were my absolute favorites: soaps, shampoos and trial-sized conditioners from Bally's.  In my 5-year-old brain, I imagined Bally's to be a regal, gold-plated home for the rich and famous on vacation, be-decked in disco balls and cash that floated down from mirrored ceiling tiles trimmed in diamonds.  

As it turns out, the Atlantic City Bally's of my 1980s mind and the Bally's of Las Vegas reality, circa 2015 are not exactly the same. SHOCKING, I know. That being said, what I thought (as a charmingly cynical 35-year-old) would be the scum of the Strip, ended up being quite nice.  Actually, I have zero complaints.  Okay - not ZERO; but relative to the price, my complaints are basically nil.  And about that price - man, is it cheap.  Not that Vegas hotels are THAT expensive, but still - for central-Strip over Valentine's Day weekend, Bally's is probably as low as they go.  At just over $400 for four nights, I'll take it!  The casino is decent enough, the rooms are better than Hooters and it's connectivity to Paris offers you any other amenity you may need well within reach. The gym and foodcourt are scary and reminiscent of Pittsburgh's finest Parkway Center Mall, but who goes to Vegas for the gym and foodcourt anyway?  Give it a try. And when you come back, can you bring me some soaps and shampoos? K, thanks, bye.

We just made our first stay at Bally's, and were very pleased.  The room was one of the largest I have ever had, that was not a suite. The pool was still open, albeit a little chilly. The pool is large, with lots of palm trees around. The location is great for us, as we like that section of the strip. There is a direct connection to the Paris hotel, which is a place we like for the buffets. This made it almost like staying at Paris, while being less expensive. The casino is one of the older ones. We will definitely consider a repeat visit.

Bally's is a solid hotel and casino. No theme or bells and whistles (except on the slots) but it has decent rooms and a great location adjacent and connected to the Paris. Their rates are affordable so it it a great value.
Probably the best of the dirt-cheap options in Vegas and great location right in the middle of the strip.

Ok, lines were a little long to Check in but I guess it also depends on the arrival time! Was easy once we got up to the counter and staff was very nice and personable! Got our room we stayed in an "Indigo King Room" on the 25 the floor! View was amazing from our room. Beds was pretty comfortable and staff was super polite on every encounter! No fridge, coffee pot, ect but when I bought my groupon I read up on the reviews and was aware of this so we brought our ice chest made it perfect! 2 devices receive free WIFI your entire stay and I enjoyed this hotel especially the location. It's right in the middle of the strip! I'd definitely stay here again! Take me back!!!!

I had an exceptional room thanks to my host. But the exceptional stops there. Unless you plan on spending your entire time in your room a Vegas Hotel needs to be more. Understandable services all over being downsized but NO ROOM SERVICE!!!. Excuse me Room Service from 7:00-1:00 in the AFTERNOON... Well who gets up @7:00 am in VEGAS?
The best part of Vegas has been EVERYTHING IS AVAILABLE. So just say you DON'T have room service  if after playing all night (as that's what you're supposed to do) IT'S VEGAS. You look forward to ordering that Yummy for the Tummy Steak Lobster\/Steak & Eggs\/ Hamburger & Fries... Well, you better not be @ Bally's Las Vegas!!! 

Not to mention did it mess up my traditional I'm exhausted I'm going to stay in tonight enjoy a movie because I've been on the go & playing all day... The MOVIE & MEAL didn't work because the IN ROOM MOVIE DIDN'T work.. So starving had to dress go downstairs get something in cardboard bring it back up and NO MOVIE (even after Tech Guy came up) Gheez Louise!!!

the room was not bad but it wasnt great. maybe need to upgrade those tvs and throw some nickalodeon on there too. The food for the room service was actually VERY GOOD! if you stay here and order room service i do suggest you getting the fish and chips or the steak and shrimp! DELICIOUS!

Nice large room, good location on the strip. Nice that you can use Paris and planet Hollywood pool as ballys is the worst pool area. Great price and $20\/day food credit on my reservation sealed the deal

I found this hotel on the app Hotels Tonight. I was cheap, it had a huge tub, it was on the strip, it has free parking and close to the airport. My bed did not disappoint. The shower was cold and the furniture looked like it was from 1970 something. The room smelled of cigarette smoke, but it worked.

Bally's is in a perfect spot on the strip. It's a few minutes walked to Caesars Palace (where half my clan was), Paris, Bellagio, etc and a free shuttle drive away from Rio as well. 

We stayed in the older part of the hotel. It was still nice (who really stays in their room in Las Vegas) lol. 

House keeping was spot on with the cleaning of our room.

Bally's has a food court (Johnny Rockets, Nathan's Hotdog, Subway, a Chinese fast food and more). They also had a few in house restaurants on the premises.

I like that Bally's was connected to Paris Hotel through a tunnel. We were able to go back and forth and Paris' buffet is on the tunnel as well.

It's not like the newer, bigger, mega casino resort sprouting out all over Vegas, but for a simple, very affordable and conveniently located hotel, you can't do any better =)
Terrible guest service. When the employee's at the front desk are the first faces you see I would anticipate friendly and kind, I am giving you my money after all.

I started coming here years ago.
The location, value, and clean rooms keep me coming back.
The mattresses are as good as a 5star hotel. The rooms are quiet and the elevators are incredibly fast. No waiting!!

Hotel was decent, not sure if i come back. WiFi never worked. Thermostat was inconsistent,  Melissa the "supervisor" refused to resolve the situation. She gave us $25 food coupon but wasn't enough for the inconvenience. She was also rude and didn't seem to care much about our complete satisfaction.

Easily the worst experience I've had at a Vegas Hotel! Had trouble checking in at a kiosk, was told to wait as they found out the problem and they had to talk to a supervisor..... they come back to tell me someone checked into my room already but tell me they have sorted it out and all is good to go.... I mention that a family member with the same last name is staying in the hotel but a separate room maybe that could be the problem?? They tell me everything should be good and not to worry..... Fast Forward to about 10pm that same night my family member that was checked in a separate room that day is locked out of his room because his key card doesn't work. He goes down to the front to find out they have cancelled his room and reservation and his bags are with security!! They question him as if he might be criminal!....... They look into the problem and find out its just because we have the same last name!! They cancelled his room automatically earlier when they checked me in.....When they realize their mistake and admit it was all their fault they offer to let him stay but charge him full price!! They won't allow him to use the discounted price from an online travel site that he already paid for earlier! Absolutely the WORST most incompetent front desk staff ever!! And on top of all that they double charged me for parking and charged me for WiFi that is supposed to be free with the resort fee.

So yeah...we are Vegas veterans and have stayed at nearly every property on the strip...and when we had a comp offer for Bally's I admit that we were a bit "oh well" with expectations...and will also be the first to admit that this stay was outstanding!

We booked a room in the newly renovated Jubilee Tower.  Check in was smooth and painless and we quickly found our way to the elevators.  NOTE:  We stayed before and had to walk on past the front desk, through the casino and back to the rear tower elevators...the Jubilee towers are in the front, meaning the elevators are just to the right of the front doors when you walk in, SUPER convenient.

Upon entering the room we were shocked with a TON of space, a nice king bed, huge HDTV, 2 lounge chair things (sorry, not a decor kind of person), nice open fridge, separate sink serving as a 'kitchenette', huge bathroom which included a nice sitting area for doing the whole make up thing (with make up mirror), and big shower with big sized shower head...and...a full view of the Eiffel Tower and partial view of the Bellagio fountains.  On top of everything else...it was super clean!
