I'd say the only drawback to staying in the Jubilee tower is the fact that if you go to the pool, you have to walk through the ENTIRE casino to get to the stairs, which take you down past the shops and food court to get to the pool.  Fine for us guys but if you are female, make sure you take a cover up or you might feel a bit awkward.

As far as the casino itself, the table minimums are great (we had $5 minimums our whole stay), the drink service was spot on, the dealers were very nice and the overall vibe was awesome.  Couple that with a great location on the strip (right in the middle) and you really have a fantastic place to stay.

Yes, you can get a 900 sq. ft. suite with sunken couch, but do you really need it?  If you are looking for a super clean and comfortable place to stay that is centrally located on the strip..I'd definitely recommend Bally's.

I'm a (recent) local and am just now venturing into frequent stay-cations.  Bally's appears to be on its way out.  The elevator to the hotel\/casino from the parking garage smelled of urine.  We asked to switch the method of payment (from one card to another) from when we reserved online and the kid behind the desk said it was no problem.  Only...he didn't change the method of payment at all, only charged the $28 resort fee to the new payment method.  Well, ok then.  Rooms weren't spectacular and my view was of a parking garage.  This was during the Mayweather\/Pacquiao fight so I'm trying to look past the guy who was flipping chairs over in the casino and the heavy weed smoke in the elevators but its hard to do.  All that being said the price was reasonable and it really is center strip.  I'll probably put out a few more bucks and stay somewhere else though...
Room were nice. Price is reasonable.  Wish they have more black jack machines, so that we don't have to walk all the way to bellagio

What a dump! Here for a convention so I did not pick it.
Stinky room  with semi-broken AC, buzzing loudly.  Poorly cleaned carpeting in hallway, flashing broken overhead lighting in hallway sitting area.
Vendng machines out of order on five sequential floors (deliberately or due to neglect?)
Not a huge fan of Ballys. The Casino is old and needs to be redone, but it is in a good location for walking. The Rooms Are not that great, and the restaurants can be better.

We stayed at Ballys for 3 nights. The express check-in was wonderful, didn't have to wait in a long line to get a room key. The room was very clean and nice. Everyone at the hotel and casino was very nice and accommodating. The only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars was because we had a very late flight (11:00pm) home and could have really used a late check out, we were offered 12pm. They did hold our luggage for us until we left for the airport. I have to mention Dana who held our luggage was awesome, very engaging individual and a fellow buckeye, OH...IO!

Awful experience. Booked and ore-paid for a room in updated Jubilee tower. Upon check in was told no rooms were available in that tower, only the older not renovated tower. Get to my room and besides being run down there is a constant and very loud noise coming rim outside the window. They tell me I can move into Jubilee tower the next day. I attend my all day work conference, return to my room and call the front desk to change rooms, first I'm on hold for 10 minutes, then they tell me room changes can only be done between 1:00 and 2:00pm, I complain about not being told this and he says he will see what he can do. He comes back to the phone and tells me there are no rooms available in Jubilee. I ask to please move me to another room in this older tower and he tells me all the rooms available are along the same side of the hall and will be just as noisy. 

Bottom line, worst hotel experience of my life. Old and run down room, super noisy and rude and unhelpful staff.

Probably the best hotel option in Vegas for the price and location. That statement doesn't come likely and you really won't be too disappointed by staying here. There are better options that are way more expensive which you probably know about already. If those are in your price range then you should definitely stay at those. There are also cheaper options that are just too far away or don't have the same amenities or atmosphere as Ballys so you kind of pay for what you get with those situations. 

There is a resort fee as with any hotel in Vegas but you do feel like you are getting you money's worth thanks to the quality gambling, nightlife and food in the area. We stayed toward the back of ballys so we were a little off the strip but it was an easy walk to the strip and we were able to get to anywhere we wanted to go quickly. The staff was great and the place was always clean and felt upscale despite not having to pay the cost of that. 

Really if there is too much of a story with a hotel then it probably was awful or really good. I think that sort of says everything about Ballys. It was a great time but nothing stood out as terrible or exceptional. Its perfect for a Vegas trip where you really don't care about the hotel but more the location. You also want to feel happy about where you sleep and like you got your money's worth which you won't have a problem with if you stay here. Go ahead and give it a shot and save some money for more clubbing and gambling which is what you are really here for right?
Hideously ugly rooms. Horrible furniture. Not worth even $80 a night much less $150 they usually charge.

A NIGHTMARE WITH KIDS!

I went back and forth between a 1 star and the 2 star. We parked here last night as we were hitting the strip with the kids. The issue is not the hotel itself, rather the security staff. We had two people from our party go to the bathroom, and since we had kids, we didn't want to stand on the floor. So, what did we do? We took the kids off the carpet, into a side area, off the carpet, behind a big fountain, next to a lady selling kids toys. Safe right? We are a solid 30 feet from the closest table and a good 15 feet off the carpeted gambling floor! WRONG! This guy comes over, tells us to move back another 20 feet up and over these stairs. My wife explains that we have 2 people in the bathroom and he says, "they will have to find you, you need to move now." I asked him if he would be requiring the other 3 families with kids to do the same, which I did not get a response. Instead, we were escorted out of the area by this individual. I was sure to let him know that their policies were not appreciated, and to be honest, they lost my business over this. 

We are planning a big bash next year, and were looking to stay here, but I am not giving my business to a place that encourages employees to go about and mean-mug people. I know that my one not staying here will change nothing, but nonetheless, if you have kids and are looking for a hotel, this is probably not the place, with rude staff and unequal policies.

I'm not a real negative person and will roll with almost anything and move on. However, I feel like I need to set expectations for others that are considering Bally's. I stayed in a Penthouse Suite, it was fairly beat up and outdated. It has an 90's AM\/FM radio with a CD player and RCA auxiliary cords, so bring your own bluetooth speaker. 

The absolute "never again" for me, was that they don't have room service at night, it ends at 1pm. 

It did have a great view, some fun blackjack dealers, and the people at their Mexican restaurant were very helpful.

Won't be staying here again unless they renovate. The rooms are in terrible condition. The casino floor is in better condition than the rooms. Seems like Erica M. and I have had similar experiences. 

When we first got there, the check in line was insane. I was glad they had kiosks for us to check in. It saved a lot of time and as a bonus they allowed us to check in about an hour early. From this point the rest of the experience went downhill.

When we entered the room, it initially looked fine. We walked around the room and were pretty happy so we put our stuff down and kicked on the ac and took off our shoes to kick back. At one point we walked over to the bathroom and the carpet was soaked. It wasn't just damp, there was a puddle and as I leaned down to see what it was the smell of mold hit me hard. The ac seemed to be leaking which was the only thing I can think was the reason why there was a puddle in our room. So we packed our stuff back up and headed downstairs to talk to the staff.

While we did get a room credit for the inconvenience, it still wasn't enough to offset how terrible the new room was. The new room didn't have the wet carpet and the bathroom didn't smell funky but man the room was destroyed. The bathroom cabinets had paint chipped off, the tiles were cracked and not holding together, and the ceiling in the shower was cracked and sagging. It did look like someone patched it at one point and thought it was fine.

As we stayed in the room for the weekend, every time we came back to the room from something, it always had a funky sewage smell. If we kicked on the AC for long enough, the smell would eventually go away. 

With that being said, I would not come back to Ballys unless it was renovated.

Not kid friendly!! No DVD player, only basic TV, no cable, no complimentary WiFi, no microwave. Horrible stay, we paid so much for the extra spacious room in the penthouse but our kids were miserable.
Had a great stay here with a perfect view. It is located right in the middle of all the action and easy to navigate to all the fun on the strip.

The hallway to our smoke free room was full of smoke. The airconditioner was set on 90  but about 50 degrees in here. We're exhausted and engineering won't be up for about 3 hours. We fell asleep anyway. Kept waking up all night because it was so cold. All the advertising about the nice new rooms are not the case in our unit. The rugs worn,  looks like a number of wild parties were in here by the patterns of the stains. Can smell the smoke on the bedding. The furniture is scratched and chipped. Found trash under desk and chair.  The beds are uncomfortably hard although they were advertised as pillow top. Really not the quality I'd expect of something owned by Caesar's. .

Great location on the Strip. Why? Good cheap, I'd come back here. The accommodations, nice. Service, friendly and understanding. They moved our first room to bigger room because our first room was not completely clean.

HUGE ROOMS!! ABLE TO FIT 7 GIRLS in one room for two queen size beds...affordable. bathroom, hard to use with 7 girls.

It was central to the best hotels off the strip & i must add there is an indoor passageway to Paris and a short walking distance to Bellagio and Caesar's. Free shuttle to Rio and Paris.

Bally's is a simple, reasonable, no nonsense place to stay.

Stopped in Vegas again just for a night as we were making our way back home to L.A. Because our last visit was so outstanding, we did Bally's again... Truly disappointing from our first visit, and maybe our expectations were too high, but overall it wasn't TERRIBLE. The room we got was clean, but a used bar of soap was still in the shower from the previous guests. We got a nice view of the Venetian and the new "high roller" ferris wheel which was nice. No real complaints, but we won't be staying here for our next visit. It's just not as nice as the other hotels on the strip although it is in a GREAT location.

If you want to have a good time in Vegas, please DO NOT stay at Bally's. Its crappy, dinghy, old and horrible place. Rooms smell moist and bad, the interior is crappy and old. It's better to spend money in staying in hotels like Venetian etc or stay at any newer hotel like Palms or Linq. I loved my stay at Palms and then spent 1 night at Bally's for the strip experience and hated it.
Karen was the best! I called because our group had some last minute questions and she was so patient with us. She provided the best customer service. I'm looking forward to our stay.

You can't beat Bally's for the price. One of the cheaper hotels on the strip that isn't nasty. I'm going to break this into 2 reviews, the hotel and the casino.

Ok the hotel gets 4\/5 stars. It was very nice. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was great. We had a jr. suite, which was clean and very roomy. Had a large bathroom and a separate vanity area, so my girlfriend and I could get ready at the same time with out getting in each other's way. We ordered room service a few times when we were too tired or drunk to go downstairs. It was reasonably priced (for room service) and was there pretty quick. The steak and shrimp special was just as good as the steakhouse downstairs but about 1\/4 of the price. All the staff was very nice, without being overly nice or fake. The only complaint I had (and it's barely a complaint) was that we didn't have a "do not disturb" sign. I asked a maid on the first day we were there and she said she would get one for us, but we never got one. I didn't ask again because it really wasn't important. The funny thing was that when we left to check-out, there was a sign on our door. It just made me laugh, and in no way affected our stay. It was nice having the walkway to Paris, and the monorail station downstairs. 

Now for the casino, I'd give it about 2-3 stars. It's not one of the fancier casinos, but they at least try. Table games were nice, and 2 or 3 of the dealers were very nice and funny, but the rest didn't seem to care. The slots were ok, many of them were broken though. They are also kinda scattered around. You have to kinda search for the ones you want. My biggest complaint here was the drinks. I mean the best part of gambling is the free drinks, but the waitresses were no where to be found! I had to wait a long time for anyone to come by, and a long time to get my drink after I ordered it. I can understand when it's busy, but even during the day service was slow. When playing the tables immediately adjacent to the bar, we got plenty of service, but the waitress was very old and couldn't here well. She constantly brought us the wrong drinks. My girlfriend would order a mudslide and she'd get either a bud light or a mai tahi. Very annoying. 

In conclusion, if you are looking for a cheap place to stay on the strip without the hotel being sketchy, go to Bally's. Just gamble somewhere else. Paris is next door and a great casino.

Just checked in to room and very disappointed. The furnishings were all cheap, ugly and old. The television was a 27" tube not flat screen and they wanted to charge $14\/day for internet access.

The entire place seemed just a little shabby. As if they couldn't be bothered to put in the extra effort. Probably stay here again, with so many other places that are a better value or more interesting.

I booked a room here for a friends birthday in January for a planned trip in July.  So, booking early I got a GREAT deal for the room.  Needless to say this was the ONLY positive I got out of this trip.  I get there early about 10am before the stated check in time, and notice there was a line for early check in.  I come to Vegas at least once a year, so I know there is an extra charge for early check in at some if not most hotels.  So, no problem.  I'm in my 30's, so I'm no obnoxious 21 year old who stumbles in looking to check in early.  I approach the counter and the lady instantly tells me "There is an early check in fee."  No "Welcome To Bally's" No "Good Morning" nothing. I had an excellent flight that morning and was with a friend, so I shrugged it off no big deal, but in my mind it definitely rubbed me the wrong way.  I end up using my Debit card for incidentals and the lady made it a point "Are you sure you have enough funds, because you're not going to be refunded for 7-10 days?"  I wanted to say to her, "Are you kidding me?" But, I didn't.  I was not rude at one moment with her, but really didn't understand why she made it like I was cheap or something.  So, customer service at the start of my stay EXTREMELY POOR.

I get to my room and instantly check out the view.  Nice view of the new ferris wheel and Drais, so I liked it until I looked at the seal and the windows.  The paint was chipping and the seal was rusted.  Again, no big deal to me, but I know some clean freaks that would've been urked at the sight.  

Began to get ready and jumped in the shower.  Bathroom was comfortable, amenities were fully stocked, but halfway through my shower, the drain wouldn't drain so I'm knee deep in soap water.  Call the front desk and they tell me they're going to send someone up.  Maintenance guy comes and explains to me he can snake the drain and its going to take 15 minutes he needs to get his equipment.  While I'm waiting, 5 minutes later front desk calls my room and rudely says to me "You need to open your door, the maintenance guy is waiting" I opened the door and see a completely different maintenance guy asking "What's the problem?"  Utterly confused I call the front desk and ask for a new room.  As I get off the phone, now there's two more maintenance guys trying to drain 1 tub.  This entire time, from the front desk to now this situation I attempted to remain calm, but now it just got ridiculous.  So, my grade for the room...EXTREMELY POOR (and by the way they did NOT give me another room after my request for one).

My trip was Sat-Mon and all of this happened on a Saturday morning.  I wanted to stay away as much as I could from the hotel which I did, some of the good things about this hotel were the buffet was decent, the elevators were fast and the beds did provide a good sleep.  Taxis and shuttles just like any other hotel were a little tough to get a hold of, but another tip spend an extra couple bucks and get one of those SUV\/shuttles that aren't taxis but charge a flat rate rather than a timed rate.  

My last comment on why I'm rating this a terrible experience, when I checked out Monday morning I am pleasantly greeted by the lady at the front desk (ironic right?) asks for the card I paid for incidentals.  She swipes my card and says "You should see your refund in the next day or two" I couldn't believe it, but by the time I got back home Monday afternoon, I see the refund waiting in my account.  So, what was the first lady talking about I had to wait 7-10 days, then this lady tells me 24-48 hours?  Very poor overall experience.  I will NEVER stay at Bally's Las Vegas ever again.

This review is for the LA comedy club.  Got VIP tix, meant all you can drink...cheap beer or wine for 29 minutes before they opened the doors to the general public...uh, can we upgrade to the wine that you open with a cork screw or better beer that doesn't start with bud or coors...good thing I like coors...but prefer imports or blue moon...too bad we only pounded two rounds...oh, how we have matured since college.  Good comedians and great security, can I get back to my seat, my wrist band doesn't mean anything...overall good experience and good comedians

Awful. Yes the rooms were spacious. But just filthy as we walked in. There were hair, on the ceiling in the bathroom. Dust and (hopefully it was chocolate) in the mini fridge. A diaper! Was found in one of the tables. Just filthy. I would mostly not come back to stay here. This place is far from the epitome of cleanliness. And needless to say, this will never become a doppelgänger to other luxurious hotels.

As I arrived at a parking garage and entered the elevator 2 employees greeted me and had big smiles, I was wearing pool attire. It was 111*, a small conversation about I wish I could be deess like that but I am working. I entered the casino looking for the front desk, found a cute security guard named Judy 39+ who not only helped me find the desk, but walked me over. About 300 feet, she was very pleasant and had a lovely disposition. I love name tags, because I wouldn't have known her name otherwise, she made my day. Thanks Judy, you were a warm welcome for a weary traveler

I was highly disappointed in my stay this last time at Ballys I usually always choose you guys as my hotel. The check in was a 20 minute wait , it was like at being at Walmart only 2 check-ins were available, the line was ridiculous I knew that this was going to be a bad visit. The second thing we arrived in my room it had a musky moldy smell so I had to call down to the front desk they offered to give us a different room or have the room refreshed I opted to have the room refresh since I have already paid the bell man to bring my stuff to that room nobody offered to have him move it for free I'm not going to double pay so we just stayed in that room and they sent someone up to refresh the room it still stank after that because they did not change the musty moldy old shower curtain so they sent up another person to bring a shower curtain this person had an attitude and was like I'm getting off of work I'm not going to put it up I was like no you're going to change it he changed it , it should have been done properly the first time. We had a very rude valet person older gentleman with gray hair I did not catch his name but he was really rude and I was just like I don't know what's going on with the hiring but the quality that I started off with when I began to stay at Ballys has really gone down you guys need to be more thorough with who you hire more thorough with room maintenance. All the little details matter because you're going to lose business and I am NOT happy with this visit I stayed between August 14th and the 16th and it's just very disappointing to see a good hotel go downhill

I was attending and part of a family wedding that was taking place at The Chateau in Paris, so many guests stayed at Bally's since both facilities are connected to each other. I never go to Vegas on the idea that I will be spending lots of time in the hotel as there is so much to do, and I did not spend a lot of time in my room as I had a wedding to be prepared for. And even then, I managed to get the worst of Bally's. 

All of ridiculousness took place at the registration line. The first time checking in, the staff member that was helping me had a "hate my job" type attitude. I didn't get a smile or any enthusiasm or a welcome, while the guest next to me received complementary water bottles. Keep in mind, I booked 5 rooms with Bally's. 

The next time I had to check in (for a guest that came a day later), I was told that the room was not ready, even though I received an email reminder to check-in. It wouldn't had been so bad, except I waited 15 minutes in line. There were only two other guests in front of me, but we all waited 15 minutes because only three staff members were present to check-in guests. I basically wasted 15 minutes standing in line with a bunch of other angry guests, just to have to come back a few hours later. 

So the third time that I had to go to the registration line to pick up that key, I was on the phone with the wedding planner talking details because the wedding was in an hour. I approached the registration desk and gave the gentleman my ID and credit card and told him I was checking in and picking up my key. I figure that this should be straightforward. The gentleman kept asking me for a room number and while I was on the phone, I told him that I didn't know the room number to a room in which I don't have the key for. Ummmm? Then he had the nerve to turn me away and tell me to come back when I'm off the phone. At that point, I had to hang up on the wedding planner to school this gentleman on how to do his job. I had to explain to him that the computer system shows which rooms I already checked in to, so the key that I need would be the only room that shows up as not checked-in. 

Yikes. as a school teacher I have tons of patience and always exercise calm and cool, but I totally just schooled him because Bally's service is pathetic. I will never stay at Bally's ever again. There are tons of hotels and resorts to choose from!

Second time staying at ballys which is a good thing right? We stayed in the jubilee rooms with a strip view, this time we faced the Eiffel Tower and had partial view to the bellagio water fountain. The rooms are reasonable, we booked through Travelocity. I really have nothing else to say besides that in content with my stay, perfect location, right in the middle of the strip and rooms were clean.
Sitting here still waiting for our room blow dryer to be fixed, something that should be working when we ck. in its been an hour very disappointed

I had stayed here for my 21st birthday a few years back. My friend gave me a trip to vegas for my birthday. 

My dear friend got us a suite in the north tower. I didnt have a view..but I didnt care. I loved my room. It had a huge tub in the middle of the room. and his and hers closets and vanity area. Also had a mini living room area. I loved my room, the hubby and I enjoyed it to the max. if you know what I mean. haha..

Im not sure about the price since I didnt pay for the room. 

The location is awesome since its in the middle of the strip. Its connected with Paris hotel and right in front of the Bellagio and ceasars palace...

LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION....THIS IS THE BEST!

I stayed here for 4 nights. The whole time I wished I had stayed anywhere else. The hotel is just old. It needs major updating. We stayed in the upgraded Jubilee Room. The room itself was nice and our view was good BUT we were on floor 55 which is really floor 5. The noise was insane. From 7am, we heard garbage trucks, construction, trucks loading...and until 4am, we heard the music from the nightclub in the Paris like I was sleeping in the nightclub. I could literally hear everything the DJ said from inside my room. When I asked to be moved, the guy at the desk said that the music noise would be worse higher up and that he can give me earplugs. I have stayed at Planet Hollywood, Paris, Caesar's, the Cosmopolitan and have never had this issue before. I think they need to invest in new, sound blocking windows...having a hotel with literally 2-3 hours of quiet to sleep is ridiculous. Also, the pool was closed even though it was 80° so we had to go use the pool at Paris. Honestly, I would recommend you stay ANYWHERE except for Bally's. I wish someone had told me this before I booked my trip.
The Casino itself is Meh, so so- nothing special. They have some interesting shops here, but the walkway to the Monorail is so long! They could have done a better job at placing it!

The best part of this hotel was the location! It's right in the middle of everything you wanna be in the middle of! It's right across the street from the Bellagio fountains. The restaurants and bars in Ballys were all great and there was lots of variety! The room was amazing! I'm not sure if I've ever slept in a bed so comfortable! The room and hotel in general was really clean! Go see the Jubilee showgirls show! It was so much fun and exciting to watch!
The downsides were that the elevators took forever! 5 min plus waits for the elevators were common. There were also booking issues and the room keys didn't work right away but these issues were resolved quickly. The pool hours were dumb! The pool closed at 8 and you can't bring your own drinks into the pool area. All cocktails are a minimum $15! 
I'm not really a gambler but they seem to have a good selection of slot machines and card tables!
I was pretty pleased with my stay at Ballys!

This place is a total dump!  One of the hotels that needs to be blown up and torn down and replaced with something brand spanking new! Outfront they used to have moving sidewalks with waterfalls and that has all been replaced with a junky looking bazaar area Full of tiny shops and restaurants. Looks terrible!!

WORST HOTEL EVER!!! 
I don't know where to begin. First, the service sucks with rude front desk people and second, just because they overbook, if you ask for extra pillows, apparently there is a limit and housekeeping doesn't exist last 430pm. They don't carry any band aids which is dumb since all places should have a first aid kit with bandaids! Ugh..three words, BAD BAD BAD!!

Decent size lobby with a casino floor. The room was a good size and a king size spring mattress with large windows. The bathroom has a large sink space. Overall for the most part the room is spacious and comfortable. Certain things minor things could be fixed but mainly the toilet as it is very slow to flush.

This place sucks to deal with. 

We got our car back from the valet and they came back with a flat tire. When we got in the car we noticed a tire sensor was on has we were pulling away so we checked it and it was down to the rim. We called them to let them know that they give us a car back with a flat tire and there's no where we can go. 

They then told us that it's not their responsibility to know whether a tire is flat from valet, and are not liable for giving us a flat tire when they had the car.  

 If u ever have something that goes wrong at this place, they are the worst to deal with and they will not give a shit.

Stayed with a group so room was very cheap per night. The rooms were nice and large with a couch that could sleep another person. The room was nice and modern looking. Our view was of the Paris hotel right next door and could see the Bellagio water show. It was a non-smoking floor which was great. All in all I would stay there again for sure.

Free hotel rooms brought me here. I thought I could deal with that long, long automated walkway that never works. I thought I could deal with the extremely poor floor plans with the ridiculous up escalator to bring you inside the hotel, then another ridiculous down escalator to bring you to the hotel lobby. It's definitely a pain to leave the hotel, I was too discouraged to return to my room other than to sleep a few hours. 

They do have a lot of table games in terms of variety, not just blackjack and more blackjack. I must say they didn't have as many cocktail waitresses on shift as other casinos. Not too bad on the slots either, I just wish they have more than just 4 of the motion activated chair ones. 

Their rooms remind me of Best Western with the ugly patterned bedding. I guess not a lot of people pay for the safe, so it has a $3 charge per day unless you're a higher tier player then it's comped like everything else you do in Vegas. Luckily more electrical outlets than Planet Hollywood rooms. Somewhat overly normal looking bathroom that doesn't give off the extravagance of Vegas but quite practical with the number of shelves available for storage of toiletries especially for a girl. Their pillows are terrible, so flat and small, I felt like I'm not sleeping on much. Other than all of the above, the room is safe to sleep in.
Another crappy casino along with Paris. Doesn't pay enough to give you time to have a beer. Slots don't pay crap, even when you play minimum. Don't waste your time or money there.

When and if you go to Vegas, this is how you do it. Ballys was Vegas strip centralized with the atmosphere of an elegant and flashy Vegas styled hotel. Parking is located for free in the garage next door. It shares the same garage as another hotel so just make sure you're parking in the correct area. After that, you make your way to some elevators that will take you to this main shopping area\/casino. Make your way through the casino and the front desk is located right there. The lobby really set that first impression bar high, til we saw the check in line with at least 10 families waiting. This was about 4 hours after normal check in time, which was at 4pm. Like what? All these people are trying to check in at 8pm too?

We felt relived after finally being called to the front desk after about 20 minutes or so. This really put a damper on our stay because we only had that night in Vegas and waiting in line for our hotel room was not something we really planned for or got excited about. 

The front desk associate was very friendly and did some crazy trick flips with his pen while he was checking us in. I felt like a cat starring at a fuzzy toy watching him shoot this pen around. Wasn't expecting that but I was totally impressed, haha. After a few jokes and questions later we were on our way up to our room feeling a-whole-lot better then we were 20 min prior. We also had no idea about the surprise that we were about to step into when we finally found our room door. 

I don't remember our room door number but I do remember that there were 2 of the same, except one of the room numbers had the letter A after it. An example would be 145 and 145A. I can't remember if ours had the A on it or not but I believe that's the one I tried to open, we entered the key in the slot and the light turned green. We opened the door and bam, long hallway. No sight of a thing else in the room. This made me instantly nervous, right then and there I knew this wasn't an ordinary room. Then I thought back to how the front desk associate Asked us about our "one night" stay in Vegas and realized we were from NY, not just down the street either.

Continuing on down the hallway the room suddenly opened up and we were greeted by an enormous hotel room complete with a king sized bed, mini living room area, huge whirlpool, his and her sinks including a make up chair\/table, endless amounts of closet space....Jeez. I was blown away. We also had wall to wall Windows so we could actually see a majority of the street and strip. 

That front desk clerk really hooked us up. I later did some research and found out these types of rooms can only be requested and that there were only a couple on every floor. We felt lucky. We also wish we could stay for more than just one night. 

The whirlpool is big enough for 2 but if you don't want to use it, there's a shower located right behind the wall next to the toilet room. I loved the make up table and chair, it was perfect to use while getting ready. The bed was super comfortable along with the couches in the living room area. We really couldn't get enough of this room. It was amazing. Apparently there was a pool but we didn't have time to use it. 

Check out the next morning was very easy, we just called the front desk and then we were good to go. 

In a nutshell... I highly recommend this hotel because of location, comfort and cleanliness. We had no issues, were upgraded for free, and we're just steps away from the Vegas strip snd Caesars Palace was across the street! Parking was included for free too! Ah !

I enjoy gambling on the Ballys floor because it's very big, have a lot of variety of table games and slots, and is a lot easier to breathe in there. 

I've also stayed there once, and the room was so basic that it reminded me of Imperial Palace. Eep! 

All in all, Ballys has a lot of other cool amenities that make it a definite stop on any Vegas trip:
-EveningCall frozen daquiri bar at the end of the casino
-Central location
-Low table limits
-Shuttle to Rio (which sometimes takes forever)
-Bar
    -Oh, this bar is the best!!! $3 for a 20oz draft beer. And if you're playing at one of the video poker machines at the bar, your beer is absolutely free! What a great deal!

Bally's is haunted by more than the restless souls of its former guests. 

First off, we were welcomed by a $28 a night resort fee in addition to the 4 nights we had already pre-paid for when we checked in.

I know this is a fee that's getting more and more common but we were not in Vegas to use the gym or hang out by the pool with temperatures around 70 degrees. So we basically paid $112 for the "free" WiFi that only works on two devices at a time.

We stayed on the 12th floor and for some reason it was significantly colder than the rest of the hotel so I'm sure there were some ghosts or possibly a broken thermostat present. 

Although spacious, our room felt dirty with suspicious stains on the furniture and what looked like a blood stain that someone had tried to burn off on the carpet. 

At night we could smell cigarette smoke in our room despite staying on a non-smoking floor and according to the Internet that is how you can tell you're sharing a room with a chain smoking guest that checked out but never left. 
 
Bally's is apparently one of the most haunted places in Las Vegas which could explain why the casino floor too is really smoky compared to other casinos on the strip... or it could be due to poor ventilation but what do I know?

We tried to call front desk about the smell and the stain but gave up after listening to the same recorded message while on hold for 25 minutes. 

When nobody from front desk is answering when you call about smoking ghosts it leaves you wondering: who you gonna call?

We tried to take a shower to feel somewhat clean before bed but with water pressure like an eerie dripping faucet we felt neither clean nor satisfied so we just went to bed.

The next few days we did get to enjoy some of the positive aspects of Bally's; like the central location on the strip, the nicest housekeeping staff we've ever encountered and we did win some money in the casino.

When we checked out we tried to tell front desk about the problems during our stay after standing in line for 15 minutes but the lady cut us off, handed us the receipt and called for the next guest in line.

Bally's might be an old casino in what used to be MGM Grand Hotel & Casino's facilities but I think they might be better off laying both this haunted building and the lost souls of its former residents to rest.

Rooms are large, even for the older rooms, and fairly clean. Bathroom is pretty large also with a good oversized mirror. Its connected to Paris which is pretty convenient. Pool is small, kinda on the boring side but you can also use the Paris hotel pool for free. Overall, nothing spectacular, but a great budget hotel.

I am in shock right now! Called to make reservations for 2 rooms ended up getting them and they over charged me $34 because I called to make the reservations! They charge a $16 fee to make a reservation over the phone!! Are you kidding me!! I've have never heard of a hotel doing this, that's just insane! Called back since I noticed I got a different quote on line and the manager Daniel was super irritated that I was questioning him about it, so I went ahead and cancelled the 2 rooms we reserved Never again will I go to this Casino!

I just came back from a 4-day trip to Vegas and I am so glad I booked Bally's!! The hotel is right in the middle of the trip and everything is within walking distance. I had a room in the Indigo Tower and had a great view of the High Roller without upgrading. The room was spacious and well kept, unlike other hotels that just seem dirty as soon as you walk in. I was so pleased with housekeeping, even though I left all my belongings scattered all over the room, they still managed to clean it! I'll definitely be staying here for future Vegas trips!

I didn't stay at Bally's so I can't comment on the rooms but I did spend a good deal of time in their casino.

My favorite casino on the strip.  Why?  Because they are who they are and they're not trying to be something they're not.  They're not shiny or new.  The Cosmopolitan this is not.  The waitresses are a bit rough around the edges and look like they probably work a second shift at some seedy dive bar off the strip.  They can't pull off the tight revealing uniforms that you see the much younger girls wearing at the newer casinos.  And that's ok, well at least for me it is.  I don't care what you look like as long as you keep the (free) drinks coming.  I went here early one day, maybe around 11am and our waitress was so on the ball.  She'd plomp a drink down in front of me and be back in less than 5 minutes to ask if I needed another one.  My drink was as full as when she left it but gotta love that initiative!

Another biggie is that they're one of the few casinos that do $10 minimums as opposed to $15.  This can make a huge difference.

Also, wut up to Michelle at the roulette table.  She was awesome and I had the quintessential beginner's luck gambling experience at her table.  I think I had at least a 20+ win streak going on and it was the best time ever.  My first time ever gambling in Vegas and I walked with $240 that night.  Not bad for a rookie.

Great hotel for the price. Much more affordable than other hotels, but you sacrifice some of the glamour.

We arrived to Vegas at 9am. Check-in isn't until 4pm, but they will hold your bags for you for free if you arrive early. Watch for timeshare solicitors right when you walk in. If you want some free tickets, have 3-4 hours to spare, and can give a firm no, you could talk to them. If not, avoid wasting your time.

You can get a mini-fridge for the room if you ask when checking in. We upgraded our room for $50\/night, but we didn't really need it considering we never really spent time in our room. In retrospect, it was a waste (though might be something others would want). Room was clean and spacious. Safe was included (someone else wrote that they had to pay extra?)

Good central location on the strip. Drinks ARE a little expensive, but if you are gambling, they are generous with their comps. All in all, it balanced out. I wish night time room service was an option.

We got a good deal where our average rate was ~$50 including the resort fee. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of the strip so very convenient if you are planning to walk\/take the bus to various locations in the area. The hotel is on the older and dirtier side and there was some residual smoke in the halls but a very good value I would say.

Called months ago to book reservation and called again today to confirm my late check in, room type, etc. All is well. Checking in tonight after a long drive only to be told that they don't have our king room oh and our room is on the noisy side but they can give us ear plugs. Special. Get to room and there's not even a bottle of water in it. Even the Luxor greets you with a cold bottle of water. It's a handicap room with queen beds. Nothing near what I booked. Oh yes, we can change tomorrow in the middle of our stay during our lunch break at our convention. Not happy. Read about the warm washcloth hotel experience Bally's. You're missing it.

Its Super Bowl Sunday..We checked into Bally's just to find out that we will have no water at all from 11 p.m. Till 6 a.m.! Really and you're going to charge me double for this night! That means no flushing the toilet no water in the sink no bathtub nothing! They offered me a free bottle water!!! This place really sucks!
not a bad spot to stay, but they make you pay for wifi, so they get a 3.

I've stayed here many times as a child and as an adult.  My parents frequented this hotel because they love it and I have stayed here as an adult to reminisce and have fun.

I love this hotel!  The rooms are spacious, they're neat and I've always had a great view whenever I've stayed here.  The room is not out of date, they always keep up with the times and the hotel staff likes to make sure that their guests are properly taken care of.

We had the opportunity to stay at the new wing recently and wowza!!!  The rooms are even more spacious and grand than they have been in the past!  

The pool wasn't as nice as I remembered it being.  They have 3 separate pools, which I think is now open to the public (for a price - but free for hotel guests).  It looked a little out-dated and not as nice as some of the other Vegas hotel pools that I've stayed at.
The neat thing about the pool grounds is that the place has tennis courts and little shops that surround that area.  They made it into a recreational are where you can play tennis and take a dip in the pool at your own leisure!  Pretty sweet!  They have a bar where they serve all sorts of drinks and snacks, and they have cabanas that surround the pools.

One of the things that I enjoy the most is getting room service and relaxing in the room.  The room service at this hotel is great because I believe it's 24 hour dining!  They have a wide variety of items to choose from on the menu - some of them have time constraints, but the items on the 24 hour menu are still good.  They have a pretty healthy wine list to add to their menu as well!

They have a bunch of stores where you can buy things from chips to something exquisite like a diamond ring.  The thing that irritated me the most was that none of the stores sold cotton balls!  Not one!  I thought that was kind of odd.

Overall, I would give this place a 4 star rating.  There's more to say, but I'll probably run out of room soon, so I'll just leave it at the fact that I will definitely stay here again someday!

Stayed here free thanks to comps!

The best thing I remember about this place is that I discovered a really good drink!! They make it best here

COLORADO BULLDOG.  it's kinda like coffee\/milk  they just baileys!

ORDER IT when you are gambling!

A last minute reservation proved to be difficult in Vegas since iheart radio was in town. Many of my usual places were sold out! The strip casinos that weren't sold out, were in the $1,000.00 range for 4 nights. A super high price since customarily, I get some comp pkg. with perks of cheap nights or free chips at the "nicer" casinos. Soooo...enter Bally's....weighing price vs. availability vs. style\/comfort\/cleanliness I must say, Bally's wasn't such a bad choice. Know, I usually stay at Caesars, Mandalay, Cosmo, Venetian, Aria, etc. and they are (without hesitation) more updated and stylish with fun crowds but due to the date popularity and no perks available I just didn't feel paying the additional $500.00 was worthy. Back to Bally's, check in was quick, host was pleasant, I didn't have to walk  2 miles to my room and a beautiful strip view awaited me. Bottom line, I'd rather gamble the 500. I saved and perfectly happy with my room.

I am presently staying at Bally's for a conference and having a very subpar experience with the staff. My check-in was easy but every other experience with the staff has been frustrating and poor.
I had a wake-up call set for my conference (at which I also am sitting for an exam for certification) that was never made this morning, so I definitely do not recommend relying on the wake-up call. I was late for my exam and the whole purpose of my (very expensive) trip could have been ruined. When I called this afternoon to ask why I didn't receive the call, I was told that the call was made, even though it definitely was not. After my conference this afternoon I wanted to go to the gym, but there are no signs or maps in the hotel room to show where it is. So I called the front desk and sat on hold for over 10 minutes for someone to simply pick up so that I could ask where the gym is. I was so annoyed with the wait time and with my wake-up call experience this morning that I asked to speak with a manager. A manager named Sunquat (not sure of spelling) answered and I explained my experiences. He quickly apologized and gave me directions to the gym, thanked me, and hung up. I dressed for the gym and walked down to the area that he described and saw no signs for a gym. I asked an employee at the spa where the gym is and she said it is within the spa but it was closed, it closes at 6pm! The manager made no note of this on the phone! I went (in person) to the front desk and requested the manager. Sunquat came to speak with me and said, "you just asked where the gym was, I didn't know you were going now." I expressed my frustration, he apologized but seemed less than sympathetic. He also told me that he spoke with the wake-up call dept who told him that any unanswered wake up call gets a knock on the door from security (that definitely did not happen, either). "For my troubles", he gave me a $25 food and beverage credit to my room (which will cover about a ham sandwich and a diet coke in this place). I have also learned by reading the other reviews on yelp here that the gym is not free\/included!? This was also definitely not mentioned by the manager!!
I will be discussing these issues with the administrators of my conference and highly recommending that they find a new location for our conference next year, otherwise I will not be attending.
I cannot help but think that if I were a man in an expensive suit, instead of a young woman in workout clothes, that I would have been taken more seriously. 
I am giving 1 star for the size of the room (in the north tower), although the wallpaper is peeling off the walls, and there are no outlets near the bed to charge my electronics.

This place is going down hill, I love Ballys but this takes the cake this trip..

1. I still will complain about the people movers being down again.  We stay there because of our feet.  I have broken my feet a few times and after walking around the convention for 3 days straight the movers are just the right thing for the end of a long day. 
2. We were upgraded to a suite, we always get this suite and I won't post why but we do.  Anyways we found dirty diapers in the suite by the windows.  $30 dining credit was issues hmmmmmmmm if I was a hotel Manager id be giving a few free nights for that. 
3. Roulette dealer was a gem A +++ there 
4. Valet driver Regina is the best ever!!!!   You have to love that after a year she still remembers my name, my wife and my son's name
5. FIX ur people movers, yes I said it again, I know its not broken, everyone on the strip turns them off before the entrance, in the hopes their legs die and you sit at a machine.

PROs: On the strip, close to everything, cheap (relative) 

CONs: Terrible service. 

This place is alright to store your stuff. Service here could be better.

Upgrade you
Can I up?
Let me upgrade you!
Partner, Let me Upgrade you!
- Beyonce Knowles

I'm a fan of Bally's because they upgraded my room to a more spacious suite for only $25 extra per night facing the strip.  Bally's offer a good Vegas experience becuase it has a good location on the strip.  Most mid to low price Vegas casinos offer a lame experience, but Bally's is good for a good price.

I have always been a fan of Bally's hotel room prices. They are pretty reasonable for their accommodations. In my recent visit, I stayed in their new Jubilee Tower which allows you to see the North and South sides of the strip. On the North side, you've got a view of Caesar's and Cromwell corner as well as the beautiful lit rooftop display of their Bally's new shopping area below. On the South side, you are literally have a perfect view of Paris' Eiffel Tower and somewhat of a view of the Cosmo. Also on this side, you have a peak of the Bellagio fountains and if you leave the window open you'll be able to hear it going off! Staying at the Jubilee Tower you are furthest away from the parking structure on the back side of Bally's but it does give you the convenience of walking out onto the strip straight away. 

A few things haven't changed with Bally's though. The upstairs entrance room above the valet is still unusually hot as it has always been all year round. They really need to get that changed before summer rolls around if they are on a renovating trend. The older towers are still the same, they have that outdated Vegas feel to them. I hope Bally's considers remodeling these in the near future too.

They let us check into our hotel early for $22, that was about the only good thing they did. When I walked into our room we realized there is no fridge and it did not have a view, but it was affordable. When going to shower, I unfolded my towel after getting out only to realize there was a pad inside the towel. I was not on my period and I did not bring any female menstrual pads. This was absolutely disgusting. I called front desk and they got us new towels so that's why they get two stars

It was decent but don't think I would choose to stay here again. The blankets were thin linen and the comforter wasn't soft. Rough toilet paper in the bathroom, I would've liked better quality. I requested a refrigerator and they said someone would be up shortly...about 30 mins later no one came. I called a second time and they said someone would bring one in 10-15 mins, nobody showed up that night. I called one last time the next morning, said they'd put in a request for a fridge for me and see if one was available, finally someone brought one within 20 minutes. The cleaning service ladies were super friendly and nice when they came in. Positive thing is it's right in the middle of the strip. However I think there are better hotels to stay at if you're looking for a quality room.

I love staying at Bally's the rooms are priced fairly for what you get if you stay in the North tower. That just happens to be the tower I prefer. I have honestly never stayed in the other tower. The employees are nice as well only thing I do not like is they now charge to check in early. :(

This was our first and last experience at Bally's. The room was dirty when we checked in. Housekeeping didn't do a thorough job cleaning the room. There were items left on the floor from previous quest. House keeping was rude. The whole 4 days and 3 nights luxury experience was the worst experience ever. We've stayed at other hotels. There's always been a refrigerator and a coffeemaker. It seemed odd that you didn't have either. We wouldn't recommend anyone to stay at your hotel. On a positive note, the air conditioner worked great.

Good value.
We waited too long to book our room for a convention and gave Bally's a try. It would be a pretty nice hotel anywhere else. Our room in the Jubilee Tower was very dusty, which is not something I ordinarily notice. The casino works on a points system, so don't expect to have a casino host. It's the little things such as manually operated doors at the front, bell men who clearly don't get tipped regularly and do not put in the extra effort.

Just got back from 3 days at Ballys. The rooms are adequate but generally dated decor. This is the second time we have been offered the jacuzzi room.  They are larger but they also smell like sewage.  I tried running water in the tub thinking the trap was dry, didn't help.  If you are offered that room type, check it before you move in, you will smell it as soon as you go through the door.
In addition don't take a room on the Flamingo Rd. side of the building. Police\/fire sirens will keep you up.  Construction noise from former O'Sheas will probably be there for the next couple years.

This place is actually okay. I like how it's on the strip and super close to the Cosmo. 

The rooms are newly renovated. The bathrooms are okay. For the price of the room and what you get you can't really complain.

So it's my first time staying at this hotel. My room was absolutely amazing! Was not how I thought it would be. Beyond impressed. The bed was extremely comfortable. In 4'11 and had this king size bed all to myself! Definitely would recommend trying to book this room. Room #761 .. I loved it! Good service, can be better, but had a great time overall.

I enjoyed this place, it's not ultra deluxe top of the line, but it'll do for being on the strip and being close to all the other casinos.  It really pays to be nice and courteous to the folks who check you in, joke with them, because I think if they like you, they'll hook you up with a nice room.  I felt like they took care of us, gave us a decent suite.  It was fine, didn't hear any neighbors screaming or partying, no dogs barking at night, nothing too rough and we were able to sleep well.  The pool was decent, finding out what all you can get when you book a room in Vegas.  Think this and The Flamingo are the budget casinos for this area of the strip.  Room was in good condition, a little hanging wallpaper, but big whoop on that.  Some of the things I didn't like, I can't blame on Bally's, it's just the fact that Vegas is going to nickel and dime you to death and gauge you at every possible opportunity.  Vegas reminded me of kinda being trapped in a large airport lounge.  Expect everything to be marked up out the wazoo.  Then of course, that old "resort fee" which is an additional charge or tax, call it what you will but I'm sure all the casinos colluded to bring this about.  I didn't like not being able to have an internet connection without paying 20 bucks. Printing out boarding passes cost five bucks for like 11 minutes.  I think we were in room 2376, the view was looking straight over at the Hilton.  Location was nice as others have mentioned, walk across to the Bellagio, The Cosmopolitan, Aria, Paris, The Flamingo is right next door.  There was a decent little bar downstairs that sold small margaritas and 16 oz. beers for two bucks, not bad.  The Casino was nothing to write home about, seemed small and rather pedestrian to me.  All in all, pretty pleased with the room and the price and the experience.  Didn't have any problems at all, would certainly consider staying here again.

We stay here all of the time because it's free.  Yep, free!! Get a players card and start using it and you don't have to gamble much, they will give you free rooms.  Shhhh - it's a secret!!  We even get free rooms at Paris, Rio, and the rest of the chain sometimes.  If it's not free at those places it's highly discounted.  What is better than a free stay in Vegas?!

Bally's is in a prime location, it's across from Ceasar's and connected to Paris.  You can go downstairs and have Crepe's!!  It isn't the same feel as like the Palazzo or The Hotel, but if there's a nice occasion we will splurge and go there but otherwise, Bally's has been great to us.  The staff is great, payout isn't bad, $10 blackjack, good stuff.

Not fancy, just nice.  Probably fancy compared to places outside of Vegas but in Vegas it's just a normal hotel.

It's a decent hotel.  Really dislike the front desk staff. Kept holding me back when I just arrived. Wasted like 10 minutes before I could leave to check into my room even though I kept saying I don't want their new promotion deal.  The room was okay.  Didn't have a mini fridge so we couldn't store anything really.  The cups provided were used and still had water in them so we had to buy our own cups instead.  

They did make our bed every morning, but we did leave a tip every morning too.  Pool is nice. Not many people will be swimming so you almost always have the pool to yourself and maybe just a few others.  

Very close to the strip and without the noises. Lots of food places around to enjoy as well as bars.  
I probably wouldn't stay in the indigo tower again.  Maybe something better, or just a better hotel?

Use to be the MGM Grand until a disastrous fire killed some 80 people some years ago, then it was repaired and rebranded as Bally's. The hotel is sort of long in the tooth with wear showing thru-out the facility. It's sort of the bastard stepchild of the Caesars Corp which now owns it. Most of the clients are on bus package tours which the hotel caters to. Many years ago a friend of mine who was in Vegas during the MGM fire told me he never stays above the 8th floor which is the reach of the tallest fire department ladder.

What I liked:

The room- plush
The view- amazing
The bar- pre-prohibition Old Fashion anyone? Beautiful barware and knowledgeable barman.
The women- All seemed to be beautiful
The temperature- absolutely perfect since I flew here to get away from the snow
The location- right near the most popular club in Vegas and walking distance from all of the Vegas top 5 hits!

What I did not like:

Psst! What's not to like! This place was awesome! Check in was short and smooth. Check out was even smoother. Price was fair and there were no real complaints. I really enjoyed myself.

Not so humbly submitted,
Michael C.

weeekend of 17-19 we were heading to vegas to celebrate  my exroomy's bday !

because hannah s & i did not want to shove into a ROOM with 6 other grls at ceasars palace we decided to look for another room on the strip that wouldnt break our wallets. 

so after lookin & weeding out the good (ceasars, wynn, mandalay ..to $$$$ for the weekend!!) the bad ( stratosphere, planet hollywood) the ugly (circus circus, rio) on lasvegas.com we ended up with either monte carlo or ballys...then since ballys was closer to ceasars (the other girls) it was cheaper, & they were giving 2 free tickets to jubilee,thehumanshow, or ??? we took ballys for $430 (wtf !) for 17-19th 2 bed, nonsmoking..

so we ended up in the regular ol' room in the South Tower. the reviews made the s.tower sound super grungy!! i was scared to be honest...but luckily satisfied 

wen i went to check in 
the lady said:"ONE BED SMOKING?!" 
mia: wtheck??? noo...... 
the lady said: "ONE BED nonsmoking? or SMOKING with 2 BEDS"
mia: uhm..neither...i requested 2 beds NON smoking
the lady said : "OOH OKAY! we got non smoking 2 bed but its next to an elevator and ur room will shake and u will hear LOUD rumbling"
mia: "wtf??????? "
the lady said: "OOOOOH wait i got one!! here ya go! theres no bathtub but a shower
mia: thats fine..

okay so hannah s, dee h, & i go up the elevator and we get to our floor... and we enter the first room to our right...(is this the elevator room?!?!) 
 the room is nice & big. the beds are clean no dirty stains like the gross blood stains i found at Paris....the room has a view of buffalo bills & i can see the people goin down the escalator to the street towards ceasars.

we got a big tv no plasma buts its alright and a nice table we use to eat all our late nite meals...

but um yes...so this "SHOWER" i thought she meant no seperate bathtub i wasnt expecting a HANDICAP bathroom with a seat in the shower area & where there is not actual SHOWER space but just a curtain seperating the shower from the toilet & sink so wen we shower the water flows throughout the entire bathroom with their lil drain holes throughout....we ended up having to lay out multiple towels to try to keep it from overflowing everywhere...it was gross...waking up groggy in the mornin runnin to the toilet and stepping on a LOVELY extra moist towel that squished water out all over ur calves....ICK!!!!!

however....the room was good all in all i just like big space & clean beds....nice views are great but we went for cheap this trip...

whats lame is that they dont have their own 24 hour cafe or nething just the one in paris so we ended up there twice haha...

balllys ur alright!

Room rate is super cheap. 

The view is good too- we got to see Bellagio's water show from 7027.

I do not trust the slots here. I lost $20 in less than three minutes. Cry.

The casino has a "basement" food court, which is nice. I got crazy food poisoning though(Nathan's Famous), which is not so nice. I am also pretty sure that the food court has a Krispy Kreme location in the morning that turns into a fried chicken place(Nathan's Famous) at night. Also no five dollar foot long Subway... but yes ten dollar foot long Subway. Cry two.

The hotel cleaning staff were very attentive. I slept on the "chaise" in the room and used both of the queen beds' linens (I don't really know the bed sheet terminology, but the beds had three layers of blanket\/sheets and I stripped the beds' outer layer sheets) as blankets. The next day, the staff neatly folded the make shift blankets and left them on the "chaise" and replaced two new sheets for the queen beds themselves. That was really appreciated.

We rented a suite at Bally's for an annual party for our business. We arrived to find the room very nice and spacious, but no refrigerator to cool drinks or food. We called twice for ice buckets to be brought up to cool beer and they brought us a little ice cup. We called room service to ask for serving platters, utensils and bowls, no room service at this time. We called to have pizza delivered instead of trying to provide our own food- no delivery services with food are allowed on the premises. 

I would not recommend this hotel if you need any extra amenities. They are not accommodating at all. We have hosted parties all over this city and we won't host again here.

Center strip, easy walk to other casinos. 

I wanted a quiet, non-strip-facing, non-road-facing room because I'm here on business. I got that in room 1786...BUT...my king bed was as hard as a rock! So, I got moved to 1780..2 queen beds...both with softer mattresses. (I realize mattress preferences vary, but 1786 was way rock hard.) the front desk clerk actually let me go test out the new room before I moved to see if it was better, which was greatly appreciated.

It is so so at best.I stayed there again with a friend who likes it there.I tried not to eat there at all. THe music lounge has June groups listed in July .It seems kind of old even though Im old too.I still greatly prefer Bellagio

This place deserves MINUS STARS so I'm being generous. 

Several family members and friends were here over the past weekend to attend my son's wedding.  I will NEVER EVER recommend this place nor will I EVER step foot in the casino because of the experience my daughter in law and son had even before they checked in. 

The so-called wedding coordinator was pretty much non-existent. Why should a bride have to make calls (that go unanswered for days) to insure that everything is falling in to place? The suite which was pre-paid MONTHS AGO became mysteriously "unavailable " so they were stuck with a standard room on Thursday until very late the NEXT NIGHT! Then, staff who helped with the room change misplaced two tuxedos  (one belonging to my son. THE GROOM) and the room key the night before the wedding! That's not the end of the debacle folks. ...

On the morning of the wedding, the bridesmaids discovered on their way to check out the reception venue that NOTHING was set up!!!  So consequently,  they ran late before they were due to appear for wedding pictures because they had to decorate nine tables along with decorating the rest of the venue and purchase the seating cards AND have printed out in the business office!

I'm quite sure there are other stories I'm unaware of.   So, needless to say without ANY apologies from ANY ONE or compensation from Caesars Entertainment management the experience that was supposed to be a relatively stress-free event was nothing but STRESS AND FRUSTRATION!  Fortunately,  the ceremony at the Paris Hotel proceeded with no glitches and was very beautiful.  I'm for certain going to make a call to express my feelings known about this. So if you plan to purchase a wedding package that involves Bally's BUYER BEWARE!

For the price, this is truly a great hotel. I mean, the rooms are spacious, the hotel and casino seems safe (no lurkers), the price is right, what more can you ask for?

We have stayed here a hand full of times, and have even gotten free upgrades to "suite" status at least two times. The suite was pretty nice, it had two of everything in it (bathrooms, tubs, sinks). and lots of space. We also get good deals, because of the Rewards Card. No complaints, really.

Stayed in a standard room in September 2016, and what a disappointment. Clearly, the only reason they can charge their prices is because they are in the middle of the Strip! The only thing going for this place is location. The room had peeling wallpaper (likely from 1980's), cigarette burns in carpet, a persons handprint, likely oily, impeded on the wallpaper, the bathroom mirror had stains that couldn't be wiped off, and the ceiling had damage and they tried to paint over it and failed. There were little to no available power outlets for phone chargers, we had to crawl under desks and behind chairs and tv cabinet (where we found an earring and a random playing card) to find available outlets. The wifi (paid through the resort fee) kicked you off anytime your device was not in active use. 
The bed was comfortable, thankfully.
Very disappointing and do not recommend it you care about hotel accommodations.

I wouldn't even know where to begin on how horrible this hotel is. I understand it isn't a high end hotel, so I shouldn't be expecting TOO much.. but seriously. 

Our room had an issue with the jacuzzi and toilet constantly. We had the engineer come up twice. There was hair in the shower and wasn't thoroughly clean. 

We asked to speak to the manager and she was probably the rudest "manager" I have ever encountered with. She was the front desk manager. In my opinion, if you work in GUEST services, you should maybe empathize with your guests if they're having issues. 

Housekeeping? They only made the bed and laid out towels, didn't bother to throw out the trash for the full FIVE days we were there. FIVE! Not one, not 2... 5. 

We also waited 45 minutes to get another room key. There was actually a real racist and rude lady working at the front desk, yawning and acting like there wasn't a long line for mail and keys line. Seriously, people along with us had a wtf mood too. We spoke to the manager ok duty because it was ridiculous, 45 minutes for AJ exit room key? We stood at the front of the line for at least 30 of it while they just kept attending to diamond\/platinum guests.. which actually they're supposed to alternate 

I would choose Paris over this property. Probably even a motel 6. Lol. Don't waste your money or time here.
Big suite with lots of space but old and tired furnishings that would be more in keeping in a garage sale from the 70s
I was a little harsh on my earlier review.  SOLID hotel.  But I still have a hang up when I cant get room service for lunch or dinner
45 mins to check in... keys didn't work. Clerks could care less. Worse service of any hotel I've been to in Vegas. Sorry.

First off. Ballys as a place to stay is decent. its centralized position on the north strip makes it ideal and bang for the buck. I've stayed in both the south and north towers. The south towers is more old fashion but if youre staying at this place, I hope decor isnt your number 1 priority. The north tower is more updated and pretty roomy. We got a room with two queens, it came with a 1 person sofa as well as a desk chair with a table. Heres what I hate about Ballys: On august 14th at 6am before I was going to go back to my room, my friends and I were going to chip in money and play one hand in roulette. Lose or win we were going to sleep afterward. Personally I have a habit of each time before leaving vegas, I play one last hand at roulette at which ever casino I'm at..I would just put cash on which ever color I was feeling and its never been a problem. Anyways, what I did was I waited for the dealer to drop the ball and then I put $200 on top of black and just stared at it the entire time. When the ball stopped, it stopped on black and my friends high fived each other. Then when I looked back at the table, the dealer took his hand and hit my money off the black and was like "cash dont play." I was like, what do you mean? He looked at me with a rude ass tone of voice and was like..."I said cash dont play!". I was pretty mad. I asked him, why didnt you tell me when I put my money down, why did you wait for the ball to fall on black and have that end before you said anything. He told me that he did hit my money out and he did say something but thats complete BS. Even everyone at the table was in awe by it. I called the pit boss over and he basically tol me the same thing but thats complete BULLSHIT! This is the first time anyone has ever said that to me and even if it was true, he had all the time in the world to exchange the cash that I put down for chips. I hate to think that if it did fall on red, that the dealer would have taken my money. So....lesson learned.

Old and run down.  The room's carpet was very dirty and gross.  Bad enough that you don't even want to walk on it in your socks.  I was on a non-smoking floor, but the people in the room next to me would smoke in their room anyway and the hotel didn't do much about it.  The filter in the AC unit had not been changed in a very long time.

Lastly, the taxi stand guy was a real jerk.

Don't bother staying here.
This place is not too bad, especially when it's free! Also got upgraded to a suite cause the regular room wasn't ready, for free!  It's also prime location.  Another simple review for a simple place.

Pound for pound this is the best bang for buck on the strip!  I stay here often because it is centrally located to everything I want to do, and there are shuttles running to Rio where I play a lot of poker.  The Casino itself is pretty nice, but feels small to me for some reason.  I haven't really had the chance to gamble too much here, but I hope to later down the road.  

The Rooms:
They aren't the newest on the block.  The rooms I have had were ok, but showed serious signs of age.  The bathrooms were especially non-elegant.  One time I had an ok view from my room, and the other times the views were pretty terrible.  I have stayed in both the smoking and non-smoking rooms.  I like that getting to the rooms is relatively easy, and that you don't have to go through a maze to get to the elevators like in other casinos.  

The Food:
The local food vendors are not that great.  I have tried a few of them, and they are just "ok."  The Tequila bar is a place I frequent often due to their late hours of operation--very useful!

Will I return?  Absolutely!  I hope you check them out too.  Enjoy!

Seriously ??? My firm paid $140 for
Leaking roof
Queen bed that is less comfortable than my coach
Wall paper falling apart
Then you call front desk....10  min later ... No one is picking up
Then you pack your stuff 
You talk to the manager : I am sorry it is not my dept
I am upgrading you to our newest rooms
You go to your new room ... And it is just average (3 stars)
Truly disappointing

This review applies only to the hotel; I generally don't gamble in TR casinos because their points system doesn't favor tables too well. 

I stayed at Ballys because my infrequent TR play in Baltimore accrued enough points to comp my room for a Mon-Thurs stay in winter - which is totally fair because that's the off of the off-season. I still had to pay the resort fee of $85 total, but for 3 days, that's a steal. 

The customer service was on point: I got an email the morning before I flew out that offered me a self check-in so that my keys would be ready when I arrived. Sure enough, we marched up to the concierge who not only had our keys ready, but even moved me to a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains upon request. I forget the gentleman's name, but he was awesome. 

The room was clearly renovated and fairly swanky. Nice beds and nice decor when compared to older Strip hotels that haven't renovated since the 90s. The only problem with the room was that the water pressure was pretty bad - the shower was very weak - but other than that I really can't complain for what was basically a FREE room. Even if I were paying the regular going rate of I think $50\/night or so, I'd still be pleased with the value here.

My general consensus is, while sadly TR does not compensate table players very well when compared to MGM, TR has the better hotel value. MGM has cheap hotels like Excalibur but they're in more remote locations and drop the ball in several places, or they have great hotels like Aria and Bellagio right across from Ballys, but you'll pay handsomely for them unless you come in on a Learjet with your name on it. TR casinos aren't bad, but I didn't play at Ballys due to the points system. Anyway, I'd recommend this place for people loyal to either company.

I'm sharing my personal experience because I appreciate reviews, good or bad. 
My boyfriend and I stayed here because of a work conference. His name is "Tom" but he goes by "Tommy". The manager "Shaw" was very rude because the name in his ID didn't match the reservation. He almost dont let us check in. I understand they have to follow policy,  but there is no reason to be rude.
The room was nice,  clean and spacious. It doesn't have a coffee maker or anything like that. Overall the hotel is nice, affordable and I would stay there again as long as we don't have to deal with the same manager.

The hotel is exactly what you would expect for $60 a night including tax and fees. Very basic, no fine dining options other than BLT steak (they over salt their meats), spacious\/quiet rooms over the 64th floor. Sort walk over to Paris hotel, which is a little better.

I booked the suite at the Ballys,but when i got there,they told me to wait for couple hours. I wait 8 hours for the room. But then they told me its not gonna be ready for more 8 hours,because someone is there...manager even didn't show up. Just canceled my vacation. Horrible customer service. I'll never go to the Ballys again

Hawkers are soo annoying, every single time you leave or return their in your face trying to get you to go to an off site time share presentation for free show tickets. Arrived early (noon) and was going to get charged for showing up before the 3 p.m. check-in. I booked the room by picture and the guy says that's not how the rooms look. Beware of the rooms with a toilet between two walls, not for the larger folk.

We chose to stay at Ballys because of its price and location on the strip. Sure, its no four or five star hotel and it is showing its age and needs to be spruced up in some areas, but overall our room was very clean and the staff were very friendly. We didn't gamble here much since the crowd was a bit strange, but I would definitely stay here again. The $20 trick worked on the front desk attendant when checking in and we were able to get a newer room higher up in the newer tower, so that is worth a try if you go.

I booked 3 nights for my niece and her friends so they could celebrate her 25th birthday.  The customer service was absolutely great.  I got a great deal on the internet right after Thanksgiving, but was having some difficulty booking 2 rooms in my niece's name.  I called and spoke to Yessennia who was able to assist me with this.  She also noted that the girls wanted 2 connecting rooms with 2 double beds in each room.  This was exactly what they got when they checked in !  They had a problem with one of the toilets and someone came up and fixed it right away.  My niece and her friends said that everything about the hotel was perfect.  It is nice to know that Bally's played a major role in my niece's celebration of her 25th birthday !

You know, Bally's isn't really all that bad.  I know that there are a ton of fancier hotels on the strip, but for being on the strip, Bally's is a great alternative if you don't wanna pay up the wazoo for a couple nights in Vegas.

I was surprised at how spacious the rooms were.  We had two large beds, an ample seating area with another table, a vanity area, and of course the restroom.  The colors were very warm, which was nice and inviting as well.

Every person we interacted with was super friendly and helpful.  When we were leaving, they asked us if we needed help with directions.  The valet guy also suggested Pho Kim Long for us to go eat at, which was pretty dang tasty.

On our way out, we were asking about where to get gas so we could drive back to LA.  The valet guy told us not to go to the gas station right around the corner, but instead head on the 15 and get off at Blue Mountain Road (right after Bass Fishing Shops).  He said that Mobile Gas Station had the cheapest gas in all of Vegas.

The only thing I wish were that it had more food affordable food options with some sort of food court.
