CROWD: It's mixed. There are single guests, couples, larger families, smokers, and non-smokers of all age groups among others. I didn't have any problem with loud and rowdy guests on my floor, but that is based on my recent experience. 

ROOMS: My room was in the Jubilee Tower. Unlike other hotels I've stayed at, it was actually pretty quiet. My room was clean (enough), came with a fridge (not all rooms have one), complementary toiletries, iron\/ironing board, towels, and coffee among others. Housekeeping does a pretty solid job. Keep in mind they don't clean rooms after 5pm. If they skip your room and it's not 5pm yet, just head to the Hotel Services room on your floor and request for it. The shower's water pressure is weak, while the "hot" water is more on the "moderately warm" side. You could order room service, but you might as well eat outside; you *are* in Vegas, after all. There is also a food court at the basement level of the hotel; take the stairs\/escalator located near the last row of slot machines in the back. The "Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner" sign on the wall is your landmark.

CASINO\/GRAND BAZAAR: The first thing you see when you enter the hotel is the check-in counter (left side) and the casino (right\/middle). High stakes poker tables are next to Nosh\/near the path leading to the Jubilee Towers, while the regular poker tables are in the middle; the slot machines go past them. The Grand Bazaar is home to small shops and eateries accessible by taking the escalator on your left (near the entrance). It is also a shorter way to access the bridge leading to the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace.

There is always a line of taxis (cars, vans, and MPVs) parked near the entrance, so no need to call for one. If you want an attractive hotel "with a name," I can't blame you; I personally like the Bellagio. However, Bally's is a very solid option on The Strip.

My goal whenever I visit Vegas is to stay at a different hotel each time, and this time it was Bally's (actually, this is the hotel my cousin chose for our weekend trip). I was pleasantly surprised...the establishment itself may be outdated but the rooms were HUGE and ROOMY! The room worked out really well for us since it was 4 of us girls sharing the room. The rest of our group occupied a suite that also accomodated a big number of people.

If you're not planning on spending too much time in your room while in Vegas, I would recommend staying at Bally's for a reasonable price, roomy accomodations, and a centralized location on the strip.

Service just about, 20min wait on wed check in, room is nice but bathroom door doesnt lock, moldy cabinet under the sink, no coffee machine,  luke warm water when it's 104 degree outside, maids come around 8:30am opening doors with their key then knocked every door, free wireless acess for one device with poor instruction and doesn't even work.  They should treat every customer as their first visit if they want returning  patronage.

Thanks to our great friend, we were able to stay here for a really affordable price for 3 nights.

The first night (thurs) we were upgraded to a resort-like suite; it was two stories - personally, I was really excited for this because I've never stayed in a hotel room with STAIRS. If we ever get this again, I'd love to bring one of those two story-long beer bongs that starts from the second floor so u can chug from the first. Yeah buddy.
Second and third nights we stayed in the diamond room, two large beds and we were able to ask for 2 more rolling beds. 

I'll just jot down some quick Cliff Notes:
1) Not super glamorous like the Wynn\/encore\/ph\/cosmo, but definitely not shabby\/rundown. Just simple and clean-cut, which I'm more than happy with.
2) Great location - pretty much middle of the strip.
3) Right across the street (flamingo) there's a liquor store. So if you run out of your pre-gaming equipment like we did, you can just walk on over and buy a few bottles\/chasers at affordable prices, no problemo. 
4) About a 5 minute walk from Ellis Island - an offshore dated casino that has awesome $4.99 steak & eggs and amazing beers (read my review on Ellis Island).
5) Only negative I can think of: the TV's were very, very outdated. But uh, who watches TV in Vegas?

VEGAS BABY!
 
Bally's would definitely not be my first choice of hotels in vegas, but when someone is paying for your lodging, you shut up and be thankful!

After cracking open a couple of beers in the lobby, my group waited for about 45 minutes for the front counter to check us in. It was a ridiculous amount of party time lost, and frankly unacceptable. They had two chicks working the counter and none of them were at all working in a fast pace. Luckily we had beers to hold us down during the excruciating wait.

Rooms: 

They were pretty standard, two queen size beds, a tv, bathroom with tons of mirrors. It was a comfortable size, but the stench of musk, inconsistent flow of hot water, and very persistent housekeeping turned me off very quickly. 

One of the guys in our group got the executive suite, which was a lot nicer! It housed two large and very comfortable seating area not including the bar! The bedroom was huge with a even larger size bathroom with jacuzzi, shower, 2 1\/2 bathrooms. Surely, this is the pre-game\/party room!

Pool:

Thank god for the dessert weather! San Francisco spring weather will never compete with vegas'. The pool was nothing spectacular, but it accommodated a good amount of people , had really loud top 40 music and yes, guittos and guidette - it wasn't a pool party without them! There is also a bar within the vicinity which serves HUGE & STRONG margaritas for 18 dollars a pop.

Service:

Aside, from the persistent housekeepers and slow front desk peeps, everyone else was really helpful. The security guards encouraged our heavy drinking (they gave us 2 or 1 drink coupons!!!) and belligerent dancing. very cool! 

Location:

The thing about Bally's is their easy access location right smack center of the strip. It's very convenient to head over to Caesar's, the Bellagio or even any other hotel on the strip . This makes taking the cab virtually useless saving you some bucks for alcohol!   

Overall I had a good experience @ Bally's. Hopefully they'll start upgrading their customer service soon. But thank you for the blur of a weekend I had!

This hotel is one of the oldest ones in Las Vegas.  Unlike the Palace Station, which is old as well, Bally's has not been maintained and cared for.  Starting with front desk people.  Not welcoming- no friendly greetings.  The rooms are really worn and dirty.  One of those rooms where you do not walk in the room in your bare feet.  Beds sup par along with bedding.  Old furniture.  Towels threadbare.  Food even splattered on the walls in our room.  Pool is a joke and watch out for the extra hotel fees.  Do not stay here unless you are desperate.

Have stayed here a couple of times over the years.  At the time, I thought Bally's was quite nice.  Nowadays, I do not.  For the price of the rooms, I would not recommend staying here.  There are much nicer places on the Las Vegas Strip to spend the night at for the same price or lower.

What I do like about Bally's is the location.  Their location on the Strip is walking distance to all the major hotels and casinos.  Will still drop by here, if we are taking a stroll of the Las Vegas Strip.

Omg! Don't underestimate this hotel! My new favorite hotel on the strip! Perfectly central location, nice concierge\/staff, amazing renovated rooms\/suite! Home away from home for a nice, relaxing time to rest from the craziness of the outside!  So quiet in the rooms! Ac works great! Fluffy pillows and comfy beds! Plentiful towels and soaps! Flat screen tv! I love this place! Love love love my room!  Huge rooms! Modern and clean! 5 star quality at 3-4 star prices! I've stayed at other 4-5 star hotels on the strip and have to say I was impressed with this visit my 7th time to Vegas!  This is one of my new favorites! Can't wait to try the in room jacuzzi! Walk-in stone double head rain showers are awesome! Hugs to The front desk! You are awesome!

Do not stay at Bally's if you have kids. 11 o'clock on a Sunday and a security guard knocks on my door because my kids are having a pillow fight. He said if he had to come back with the hotel manager I might be kicked out. What kind of hotel security tells 3 kids to stop having a pillow fight and then threatens to have the family kicked out? This has to be one of the worst Vegas experiences I've ever had. This is a horrible place to be and I wish I could leave but I'm stuck here for 2 more days. If nowhere else in the world then in a hotel room in Vegas my kids should be able to have allowed pillow fight no matter the hour. This hotel is horrible.

Bally's property itself is okay, but beware.

The North side of this tower overlooks a new (and obnoxiously LOUD) dayclub \/ nightclub called Drai's at The Cromwell. It's a nightmare. Fist-pumping music until 5am! Even with quality earplugs, the noise could not be muffled. And it's making all kinds of noise even in the afternoon so the rooms are unusable from afternoon until 5am! 

Calling the front desk, they tell me that the South side of the Jubilee Tower is "even worse" -- something about a club at The Paris.

While the Indigo Tower is probably further away but they haven't been refreshed for 10 years. 

Cheap single pane windows aren't helping, but even double pane windows would not keep out the noise. If you like club music in your room, this is the hotel for you!

If only they could do something about the nightclub -- which is on top of one of their other Total Rewards properties. 

The hotel isn't all that bad but when you can't sleep or rest, it does get annoying.

Is this the worst hotel ever?

No, definitely not. 

Is it the best? Well, maybe. If you're from Shawnee, Oklahoma and are a chain smoking alcoholic 78 year-old, you will probably find nirvana within the confines of this place. 

We stayed here for part of our trip because we pretty much stayed for free during March Madness, a very busy time in Vegas. 

The good:

1. location - it's dead center of the strip. If you like to casino hop, this is great for you. I've been to Vegas many times and always rent a car. I rarely, if ever, walk to other casinos nearby. But just in case you do...you're in luck. 

2. There are hot bitches everywhere. Like 88 year-old hot bitches with a cig strapped on their acrylic nails. 

3. The rooms are very, very quiet and this is coming from a noise sensitive person. 

4. The housekeeping staff was extremely nice and very efficient. 

the bad:

1. smoke. everywhere. Our floor was non-smoking, yet it always smelled like a chimney. 

2. Tube televisions. Even my broke ass has had a flat screen for five years. A billion dollar corporation can't upgrade? 

3. no restaurants at which I would dine within the hotel. yuk. 

4. While the room was clean and bathroom was surprisingly nice, the entire hotel just felt dated and dirty. If I were the owners, I'd tear it down. It so reminds me of the dumps where I stayed in Daytona Beach at spring break in 1992. 

5. The crowd\/scene just wasn't my thing. I don't know how to phrase it nicely, so I won't. 

My traveling companion and I had a good time despite the poor quality of the hotel, however I would not stay here again, even for free.

Writing about the poker table. The dealers here are rude and sometimes split the pot wrong. For example, it was heads-up and me and the other guy had ace king. When the pot was split, he got an extra $5 chip and I got a white $1 chip. When I corrected him, he said the next hand was dealt. Little ass.

If you are looking for cheap and accessible. This is it. Don't expect a whole lot. It's a hotel for cheapsters, so you will get what you expect. It isn't terrible, but it isn't wonderful either. The pool was descent and we went 2 times. The location is great- right on the strip, monorail station inside.

Here for a staycation and also attended as an audience member for Who Wants To Be A Millionaire.  If it wasn't part of the Paris I don't think I would ever have considered staying or visiting this hotel\/casino.  

There really isn't much to do here but take advantage of it's location and decent hotel room pricing. When we went to eat. But it's central location makes it a nice and affordable place to stay.  

I also don't know how long Millionaire will be filming here but if you get a chance, do attend!  It's free, but the taping is about 3-4 hours long but you get a chance to be a participant.

If you're looking for a place to sleep in the middle\/south end of the strip, Bally's is good option. As 20somethings, we've stayed here twice, and it's completely fine. You have to understand that you are staying at Bally's. "Stay Classic", not "Staying at the Bellagio". You're going to get standard services, stand in lines for check in, and get a decent looking and sized room. What do you expect for $40\/night? It definitely fit our needs at the time.

Rooms and bathrooms were clean. Beds weren't anything to write home about but they weren't rocks. Plenty of pillows. Somewhat confusing hallways.

You're right across the street from the Bellagio and a short walk away from some of my favorite stops along the strip. Use your legs...walk a little and sleep at Bally's!

Clean, well decorated, and affordable rooms, especially on the week days...can't beat the quality for such a low price. Central to everything on the strip. Great pool and hot tub, connected to Paris Hotel. Everything a hotel and casino on the strip in Vegas should be.

stayed here last weekend with my honey. we liked our room, it was nice & simple. much bigger than i thought it would be! we absolutely LOVED the window shades & how dark it got the room! it definitely helped us with sleeping in lol. love the location, casino was also nice. would stay here again for sure!

I just stayed at Bally's for the first time and my feelings are mixed. The hotel is older, but very nice. The Murphy Parlor Suite was very large and the room was set up nicely. The gentleman who brought our luggage up was very nice and helpful. The downfalls were that the hotel self parking lot is under construction and the set up is very confusing and rather disorganized. They have guest parking in the parking lot next door which is actually rather far and inconvenient for guest of the hotel. Guest services sent us blindly looking for our room and provided directions that made zero sense. Funny to say, but the toilet paper and towels were extremely rough which you don't expect in a hotel. Also, the dining chairs and curtains were a bit dirty and stained and there was hair in the bath tub. I don't want to make it seem that we hated the hotel, because we didn't. I just think they could handle things better.

I have never been to a hotel that issued EAR PLUGS along with our key card, explaining that our srtip view room could be "a little noisy".   What she should have warned us was that the noise from the DJ and music from the rooftop club at Drais is non-stop thump until the club closes.  There is simply no escaping this very loud noise while you are trying to sleep.  We strongly recommend you stay away from this property.

Pretty reasonable price! Great location, across from the real Caesar's Palace! Nothing too fancy. The lady offered us an upgrade to a suite for $25 a night, passed on the offer because we knew we'd hardly be in the room. Friendly staff and fast checkout service! I'd def stay here again...

I was a little nervouse about staying here after reading some of the reviews on here.  My check in was no more than 5 min but I did come in at 10:30am no complaints in this area

I did stay in the south tower and it was not bad. the hotel is in the middle of the strip which is convient. It also connects to the paris hotel. the monorail staion is also inside the hotel as well. I had a view of the Eiffel tower from my room 5813. I had a king bed and the room was really spacious the bed was comfortable as well. The bathroom was typical nothing special but very large shower and tub. housekeeping was also on top of keeping room clean they called twice to ask if I wanted my room cleaned becuase I was late getting up.

The only thing negative I would have to say is the windows do need some washing on the outside and the furniture in the room is a little dated.

Overall good value for the price I paid my motto as long as it is clean and the bed is comfortable Im good to go. Its VEGAS you are not going to be spending great amounts of time in your room anyway.

Review is for the Casino.

Bally's is one of the older Vegas casinos that is conveniently located near the middle of the strip.  Its an easy walk to Paris and Bellagio for starters, and they also have a monorail station if you need to go farther. I had fond memories of Bally's since I used to stay here when I was a tournament chess player in the mid 90's.  My last hotel stay was in 2012 I believe for a technical conference for work.  Funny thing was they had the National Tattoo and Body Piercing Convention at the same time.

Fast forward today.  I took my parents for a gaming run to Bally's since they are one of the very few casinos on the Strip that have half-dozen or so Ultimate Hold'em tables for $5.  Most casinos have just one table and usually have $10 limits.  The Blackjack is also decent here but you'll need to spot for a 3:2 shoe game for $10.  They have the dreaded 6:5 games too.  Another downside is during the evenings, they often bump the Blackjack table limits from $10 to $15.  

Conclusion: Play here if you love Ultimate Hold'em.

Of all of the Vegas hotels I've stayed in Ballys has to be one of the most mediocre. The rooms are clean and spacious and the rates are exactly what you would expect.

The poker room is a decent size and there are a wide variety of table games and slots. 

Overall Ballys is a great pit stop but don't stay to long, there are a lot of more exciting places on the strip!

My bf and I came here from Jan 1-3rd for a quick getaway trip.  I love Bally's for it's location and cheap rate.  I originally book it for $87 a night, then a few days before leaving I was able to only pay $66 a night..  Since we booked a rate for the cheapest room, when we checked in, slipped the front desk guy $20 and asked if he could upgrade us, and he did.  The room didn't disappoint, it was a king room in the north tower, which is a bit newer.  He also gave us a bunch of coupons for the neighboring Harrah's properties, lots of 2 for 1 drink deals.  I would not hesitate staying here again, especially if I can get a cheap rate.

Booked here after seeing great reviews for a Friday and Saturday night.  Mattresses were below par, Room 2038, I could feel the springs in my back all night.  I mentioned to reception desk, didn't care.  

The floor general area and room carpet and furnishings were old and needs replacement.  


I will not stay here again.

Bally's is exactly what you expect it to be. It's not fabulous but it's a clean (for the most part) place to sleep and it's located in the center of the Strip (super convenient). We stayed in the North Tower after all the reviews said it was the more upgraded one. I really don't wanna know what the South Tower looks like if what we got was the upgraded version. One good thing though is that it's pretty quiet at night (I don't see how it could be at 99% capacity because I never saw a single person on my floor the entire weekend). No groups of people walking by your room all drunk and loud. 

Also, Bally's is connected to Paris so if you're headed toward Planet Hollywood\/Cosmo, you can cut through there and avoid the heat outside. We ended up walking through Paris hotel more than Bally's itself ha. 

It's definitely one of the cheaper options on the Strip so if you don't really care for the swanky hotels, just stay here. You can spend that extra money gambling it away at the craps table.

Seems lower end  then some of the casinos and hotels on the strip. But, it is very nice if you were looking for a more affordable hotel that is directly on the strip where you don't have to drive far to reach anything. Very sizable rooms, great bathroom, plenty closet space. My favorite part is the very good bar downstairs, along with the casino and slot machines. Groupon has very great deals on this place. I would highly recommend you book through Groupon, and get yourself a good room has a very nice fun in Vegas. If you are a room dweller, then maybe you would want to go to MGM Grand, the Venetian, or Caesar's Palace. If you intend to stay out of the room for a while, and have some fun on the strip. This is the route for you. I hope I don't make this sound like it's a bad room to book, because it surely is not. Daily maid service, without having to ask for it like I did last time I stayed here at the Holiday Inn. But for $29 on Groupon you cannot beat it. Even sitting through timeshare presentation, and other components, cannot beat this with a stick.

Overall the experience at Bally's was great! Check-in was fast and staff was friendly! Room was clean, bed was comfortable, pillows were the perfect stiff to soft ratio, had plenty of towels, and very spacious! Bally's is going through some renovation right now so you do have to go around all of the construction in order to get to the strip. This was a little inconvenient but hey, they are just trying to make it a better place so it's understandable! The decor inside is a little dated but the comfortable bed and spacious room made up for it! This is definitely not Bellagio or Aria kind of nice but it is also at half the price! I barely stay in my hotel anyways. The location is also the selling point of this hotel! You are at the middle of the strip which is so convenient!

I first stayed here 20 years ago and I thought the room was incredible...that was 20 years ago. 

When I checked in here the woman at the front desk encouraged me to pay 20 bucks to upgrade my room to the newly remodeled tower. I was not going to do it but she then said, "Everyone in your group did the upgrade and you want to be near them!" Nothing like a little peer pressure at the front desk. So I took the upgrade. 

I could not believe that my room had been recently remodeled...it still seemed old. I probably got suckered into the upgrade so the hotel could make more money. The room is very big...there was also a powder room and a large bathroom. I could have probably lived in the bathroom, if I wanted too. I really did not need the powder room but if my wife was with me she would have definitely enjoyed this. 

My iron was complete broken...it looked like someone cracked the metal and the water was leaking out of it. I called down to housekeeping and received a brand new iron...that made me feel special. 

Also someone Australian Guy left his money, air travel documents and passport in my safe. The hotel had to send up two security guards to remove the items...it felt like one of those movies where I get whacked because I knew too much...I called my co-worker when they arrived and told them if they lost contact with me to run for there life and call the police. 

There are so many hotels in Vegas...I would only stay here in the future if I had to stay with my group or if the rooms were free.

If you're looking to do Vegas on the cheap with 4-5 people, this is THE hotel to stay at. For the price you pay (my friend had a free room, but I remember the rates being maybe around $60 a night? Def cheaper than $100), the room is really big for what you get. The beds aren't that comfortable but who goes to Vegas to sleep? The bathroom is clean and there is plenty of space for multiple suitcases lying out without tripping over them. The room is clean and the inside of the hotel is a bit outdated, but not nasty or janky :)

Also, the location of Bally's is great! It's connected to Paris and is in a pretty central location on the strip.

Very fancy when you come in but they literally give you nothing. No robes. No coffee maker. No fridge. No microwave. I guess I got used to all the other hotels I've been staying at. Considering this is a smoke free room, there's a smell of cigarettes. Grrrr. 
The weirdest part was after checking into the room, I was in the bathroom when the maid knocked. She then just let herself in to ask if we needed anything. My husband had stopped away because one of our keys didn't work so I was shocked it wasn't him and she just let herself in with the key. 
Leaving a do not disturb sign outside the door when stepping away. Then double locking and will put a chair in front of it as a preventative. Scary.
It is clean looking otherwise.

I love me some Bally's.  It's in the heart of the strip and convenient to everything.  You can walk across the street to the Linq or check out the new outdoor bazaar in front on the strip which features little outdoor shops and boutiques.  It's connected to Paris so you can walk back and forth between the 2 casinos and avoid the 110 degree heat.  The rooms are a little outdated depending on which tower you stay in but they are big and clean which is the most important.  Beds are super comfy and they give you enough towels (always a plus especially for women!).  The Jubilee tower has the newest rooms and they are great.  Just make sure your room isn't next to the elevators or you will hear that all night.  Seriously for the value and location you can't beat staying here.  Dealers are friendly and called me by my name the next day (hey I know it's not much but little things like that make a person feel appreciated).  There's so many choices on where to stay in Vegas but Bally's consistently hits the mark and "gets it".

My wife and I recently stayed at Bally's and we will definitely stay again. Yes, the hotel is definitely outdated and needs an upgrade, but overall, my wife and I were very happy. 

The employees were very nice and helpful. Even the maid staff said, "hello" or "good morning" almost every time we walked by them. 

The parking situation was pretty good and there was plenty of parking,  however, the parking is shared with the Paris Hotel. The garage elevators stink, they're dirty and rather questionable, but they take you down to the casino floor. Once downstairs, go right for Bally's, go left for Paris. CAREFUL: there are sales folk that will push you to buy stuff, offer "deals" and many WILL follow you two steps too long. If you're into that thing, go ahead and enjoy the waste of time and your new best friend, other than that...RUN!! 

Once you go right, keep going straight to the tiled\/main floor, turn left, walk a bit and the registration is on your right. We arrived mid-afternoon and there was a long line. Although, it only took us 20 minutes to see someone (this may vary though). You have paperwork in order, it shouldn't take long. Turn to the right, get on the carpet, follow the "runway" and depending on what tower you're in, the elevators will be on your left. Plenty of elevators (8 per tower) and they were overall decent. 

We stayed in the Indigo Tower and although it needs a major facelift, we were happy with the spacious "smoking" King bed room. Bed was a little firm, but not cement like. Nice little work station table, a couch, coffee table, a couple of chairs, and another small table and plenty of room.,You get four small pillows and a refrigerator is an extra $15\/day charge (no thank you). The water pressure in he shower could be a little better, but definitely doable. Oh, no fan in the bathroom. It wasn't too noisy, but you may hear occasional voices as people walk by. Another thing, there is one of those doors that lead into the adjoining room. It's locked, keep it locked, put an extra chair against the door and you're good. 

In order to get out to the main strip area (remember where you registered?). Turn left from where you registered, go up the escalators. Just follow through and beyond the covered walkway, down the escalators and your down in your bazaar area. Check out the little bar to your left. Haven't checked it out, but the sign they have displayed outside seems enticing with good deal drinks.There are plenty of outlet type of shops out front and again, many sales folk trying to entice you to try this, or try that (meet new best friends). A few little eatery places and your bus stop is to the left, street side, out in front of Paris. There is construction  going on at this time, so be careful. 

Bally's is a great location and the rooms are reasonably priced, which is why we chose here. We've always stayed at New York and we're done with New York. If you're into gambling, the slots here were definitely more "friendly" than at New York. I just didn't like the fact they continued to keep the crap tables at $10 minimum (yes, I'm a cheap ass, but I prefer the $5 minimum. They DID have the five bucks, but not that often). 

Plenty of shops that take you out from Bally's into Paris. My wife liked the, "The Strip" shop. She bought a couple of hats that, believe it of not, were hell of a lot cheaper than Freemont. We didn't stop at any other shops or eateries between the Bally's and Paris connection, but I wish we would've. Seems like great places to stop and eat. Prices seems reasonable considering where you're at. Although, may be a "fine print" that I missed.

Check Bally's out. If you're in your room to sleep, gather your things, and take a little break, you won't be disappointed. If you're into flash, bling, and a "suite" like room, go somewhere else. If you're a simple ass like I am, you'll do just fine. Enjoy and good luck!!

Wow. Three and a half stars. That surprises even me.

I spent 2 nights here last week on a business trip (read: trade show,) and had a pretty mediocre or less experience.  

We were in a huge group and all staying at Ballys, and were even renting two gigantic suites in which to conduct meetings throughout the show.  One of the women I was traveling with went in to check everything out in one of the suites before the CEO arrived and realized that they were completely re-tiling the bathroom, even though they'd promised this suite to the company the following night. The entire ceiling had been demolished and was sitting in the tub when she went in to check everything out. Ooops.

Another one of my colleagues had a plumber on the floor under her sink when she checked into her room, and my room had literally no shower head; just a pipe coming out of the wall blowing 90-mile-an-hour water all over the tub\/shower area.  Nice wake-up call anyway.

The restaurant selection is also really limited, and none of their "signature" restaurants is open for lunch. There's an Italian place, a steakhouse and a Japanese\/sushi place plus a coffee shop. I think that the sushi place does serve lunch and the coffee shop is pretty much open around the clock. Unlike even Planet Hollywood, there are no branded restaurants to speak of. Even PH has PF Chang's and a Starbucks.

The sad thing is that I know none of this is limited or particular to Ballys.  With the gazillions of hotel rooms in the city to attract and "accommodate" the gazillions of visitors, there is no such thing as personalized service or one-on-one experiences. You're just another person in their hotel\/casino, walking around with a drink in the elevators, running up and down the hallways screaming in the middle of the night, 18 of you to a room and because they've lost the personal touch, the hotel and its management couldn't give even a tiny shit.

The experience in Vegas is bleak, and I found nothing calming or oasis-like about Ballys. I think I'd like Bellagio or Mandalay Bay better, even though I've never stayed there.  Ballys is a step up from Flamingo and the likes, and it's on the monorail route (not that it won't take you forever to walk out there from your room,) but I'm thinking that's not quite cutting it anymore. It's centrally located across from Bellagio and connected to Paris (which was where we ended up to eat mostly,) and by comparison I imagine, on the lower side for pricing.

You get what you pay for. Pretty cheap hotel for the weekend, but we had a lot of issues. Toilet broke down and overflowed at 4:00am, the bathtub didn't drain - and there is no fridge or microwave in this hotel. (Odd, usually the hotels I stay at have a mini fridge.)

They have a good mini food court downstairs, hotel is huge like the rest of them on the strip.. and its across the street from the DRAIS pool party\/nightclub.

It worked for us only because we are young and pretty much came here to party. If you don't care about staying in a luxury hotel and just want to be on the strip then this is a good choice. Rooms are outdated but a pretty good size. (We had 4 girls with two double beds and it was more than enough room.)

Overall I like Bally's.....I'd say it is a 3 to 3.5 star hotel.  It is a little older, at least the tower that I was staying in ...the South Tower.    But my room was comped, and I got an upgrade to the bigger suite with a mini bar, multiple couches, and 1.5 ba plus a jacuzzi, so I am not complaining.  Slip the check in clerk a 20 for the upgrade.  Comps are the best part of the Harrah's hotels.....get good room deals (often times free) and food comps are good.  The location is on the strip, and you pretty much can walk to anything on the strip from here. I think bally is a great value play when you are in vegas!

A pretty good value for Vegas.  The rooms and location are both decent.  Despite the big crowds it draws, the lobby always has a fresh, clean feel to it.  That is not easy to pull off in this town!  Despite being past its prime, the place retains a certain class to it.  You may remember the hotel from "Honeymoon in Vegas".  Not sure if the Bally Steakhouse is still there but I ate there several years back.  Cool, clubby place to have a nice meal.  The lobster tail was succulent.  My friend loved his porterhouse too.

The room was fantastic. Let's get that out of the way right now. I really liked our hotel room. It could have used a fridge, as we had to throw out delicious left overs, but I think that's more our fault for not asking for one.  So, yes, we spent our resting time on the twenty-third floor in plush setting, slept in a nice King's sized bed, and I was able to do some quick work at the desk.  Room. Was. Great.

The casino attendants could use some work. Now, I value myself as a person who has worked every single job in the service industry. From night floor waxer to dishwasher all the way up to General Manager of a restaurant (and I've managed in other industries.) So, I don't know what floor staffing a casino entails, but I do know that what we experienced was well below what you feel standards should be. 

I ventured to Vegas with a friend who is a Diamond Club member. The girl loves to gamble. Loves the slots (where I value cards). She spends all day on the slots, and two days ago, she lost $1,000 over two hours. Not once, in that $1,000 spending spree, was she approached for a customary drink. I ventured over to her with my winnings (I'm a fairly lucky individual) and when she told me she hadn't seen a drink person, I ventured off to find one for her. I ran into a girl who scoffed at me with a "That's not my section." And when I asked- "Well, can you point me to who's it is?" She decided to walk away instead.

I retreated to my friend telling her I had no luck, and when she spotted a girl, she took off and her girl said- "I don't take drink orders from there." My friend came back to let me know that's what she was told, and I told her I was told the same thing. We eventually found our drink girl, doing her hair, checking her phone, laughing with server friends- behind the bar. She came out, empty-trayed, and we flagged her down.

So, I'd say- the first two girls need to be properly trained on situation-handling. The third girl needs to be properly scolded for valuing her social life over her job when she is on the clock. Management needs to be told of these problems so they can better train their staff.  Really let us down, as we were staying there- we'd like to gamble there. But, we found better staff elsewhere.

Big mistake staying here.

Thought they took care of the toilet after I called I'm still very upset over the fact this place is not clean. 

From the seat being soiled to the bloody curtains.... what can I say. Maybe next time I'll leave my cologne home and bring a bottle of Clorox with me.

I stayed at Bally Sunday for a convention, when we got to the room we noticed how nasty the walls and carpet were given the fact that it has not been renovated since 1973 I assumed it was on the list to be renovating like the other tower the next morning I got up to make hot water for tea and realize there's no coffee pot the night before we came in the safe did not work and there's no refrigerator In the room I did explain to the front Desk how bad the room looked so they waived the $15 cost of the refrigerator the refrigerator kept us up all night because the compressor was bad and loud. Monday night I went down to get the car seats for my kids and was charged $18 by valet to just bring the car down to take the seats out I was shocked to find out that there was a shooting at night that's why the casino was empty because the police shut the strip down the restaurants were all late and they were lines around the corner so we decided to order room service and a pop of $80 for two breakfasts I do understand because of the nature of the event that happened why no one was allowed on the strip but the overage charge of everything in the nastiness of the room has compel me not to go to next year's convention if it's held at valleys I remember in the old days when you can go to a buffet for $20 now you spend five times that just to eat Vegas Vegas Vegas I am disappointed with you and hope not to return. I'm sure the CEO of Cesar entertainment won't even look at this and will give it to Some lower level manager to reply. Viva no Vegas.

I want to leave one star, but it's really not THAT bad. 

After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous to stay here, but we were staying for free so I couldn't really complain. The room was actually surprisingly nice! I think we had an upgraded room, but it was HUGE!! Decently clean too. 

Two people. Two nights. One bath towel... Uhhhhh that's definitely not going to work. Even after calling down 3 times for extra towels, still never got them. 

My boyfriend made the reservation for the room, so naturally my name wasn't on the reservation. He left for the day to play in a tournament which left me to fend for myself. Upon arriving back at the room, my key didn't work!! The lady only made them for one night, even after we specifically asked to make sure they were made for both nights. So I went down to the desk to have them remade, and she wouldn't make them for me! She wrote down all my information, had security meet me upstairs (after I sat in the hallway waiting for 35 minutes) so they could let me in the room to "prove I was staying there." I mean, I get it. I could be some random person. But it's still annoying. 

My boyfriend and I met for dinner, and he called to have me put on the reservation so I could get a stupid key made for myself. When I went to have the key remade, my name wasn't on there! She was really rude about it too, and acted like I was such an inconvenience which made me even more annoyed.  So being the brat I am, I threw a fit. Didn't work lol. She said security would be happy to let me in the room again, but they couldn't make me a key... So I'm writing this review as I've been sitting in the hallway for over a hour waiting for them again. Hopefully I don't have to pee otherwise I'm going in the hallway!

Bally's is actually a pretty decent place to stay, as long as you dont set your expectations too high. As long as you have everybody's name on the reservation you'll be fine!

Second visit to Bally's. The first was terrific but this time... awful. The bed was so uncomfortable... that ended up needing to see a Chiropractor. When I complained I was told that the beds were all the same unless I wanted to pay more. REALLY??? In this day and age, I thought all hotels had good quality beds. Probably better at a Motel 6. VERY DISAPPOINTED!

I have been a loyal costumer to Bally;s for many years. I have enjoyed staying at Ballys in the past because the prices are reasonable and the great location on the strip. 

This trip I picked up my car from the valet and drove to my next destination. When I got out of my car I noticed that the cover on my passenger side mirror was missing.
I drove back to Ballys valet to find out what happen. The valet boy told me that it probably "fell off" when I was driving and urged me not to make a report. I drive a BMW and am sure it did not just fall off. 

It took an hour to make a report and had to follow up with several phone calls as well. I was annoyed with what happen but not too upset because I was sure Ballys would pay for what they had done.

I just received a letter in the mail today that informed me Ballys will not be taking responsibility for damaging my car. I am not the type of person to blame valet for something they did not do and would not have even made a report if i was not 100% sure it was them.

I am very disappointed in Ballys they would have better off paying for the damage they caused than losing my business and the business of anyone I know. If you do decide to stay there I suggest self parking!!! If you do valet make sure to inspect your car before leaving!!

It was great. . The room. . The service. .I really enjoyed myself here. .everyone was attentive. . Only drawback was the amount of people trying to sell you discount tickets with a catch. . Other than that. . Great stay. .

So here is the deal!

I booked a room after reading a lot of the sketchy reviews from YELP...some good some horrible. I had to see for myself, because after visiting Vegas many time I never stayed at Bally's.

THE READ DEAL (read on)

Location on the strip TOP NOTCH...worth it on it's own merit.

I stayed from 12-10-2013  to 12-13-2013
I had a room in the South Tower.  I asked for North Tower but they were booked. I don't "live in the room" while in Las Vegas so no big deal. If you visit Las Vegas and stay in the room more than you are out then shame on you anyway. You can do that at home!

I entered my room on floor 17 South Tower  and I was immediately thrilled by how big it was.  I mean double the size of what I expected.     The bathroom was pretty good. It was rehabbed but good enough for my use.  I mean if you are looking for a TV in the mirror and a butler you wipe your butt that is not what you are going to get here. It was adequate, clean and fine by any normal human beings standards.   
The room itself was large (king size bed)  huge chair, 2 desks, cabinet\/ dresser with 48" flat screen and nightstands.   It was a fine room and for the price location and you can not beat it.

I can not say what the other rooms look like but I know the South Tower was pretty decent.  The few was fair, but the view is OUTSIDE not inside. The room itself was everything you could ask for for a normal person.  You'll be happy you chose Bally's.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!  GOOD DEAL

I'm intrigued by some of the very positive ratings on here. Unfortunately, we did not have a very good experience while staying at Bally's. 

I will start with the pros since it's a short list. The hotel itself is in a great central strip location, which is one of the reasons we decided to give it a try. I also enjoyed gambling in the casino and the pool was pretty decent. As for the room, the bed was comfortable enough. 

Now for the cons:  We were asked if we would like to upgrade to a suite for an additional $50 per night. I figured, 'why not?' We were only staying two nights anyway. After seeing the suite, I regretted paying that much. It is very outdated. Yes, we had a Jacuzzi, but it was quite old. I got in anyway to help justify my $50 upgrade fee (which was actually $56 with tax). The jets worked well, but I noticed scum floating in the water once I turned these on so I quickly got out. The water pressure in the shower was horrible - very hard for me to wash my hair. The carpet was dingy and the wall paper may have been the original. I think the room has potential once it is upgraded. I liked the overall layout. 

The BIGGEST CON:  We had an iPad mini taken from our room. Housekeeping had already come for the day so we didn't expect anyone else to come into the room. We went to gamble for a while and when we returned the iPad was no longer on the table, and the bed had been made again. However, we do not think housekeeping had anything to do with the missing iPad. While we were gone, an air spa was delivered (we did not request it, nor were we told it would be delivered). We should have left the 'do not disturb' door hanger on our door, but like I said, housekeeping had already been there. So, we didn't expect the additional person. We filed a report with security and are awaiting Bally's reply. I am not that optimistic anything will come of it. It would have been a nice gesture for a hotel manager to at least contact us and acknowledge our complaint, but that did not happen. We only spoke with the security guard.

BOTTOM LINE:  Stick to at least 4-star hotels on the Vegas strip. Many of these hotels tend to be very reasonably priced and are well worth a few extra dollars. If you opt to stay at Bally's, definitely don't pay for an upgrade and leave laptops and other electronics at home or lock them in your suitcase when you leave. We were lax on this last travel tip, and it resulted in a roughly $400 reminder of why you should always lock away your valuables even when you are only gone for a short time.

Situé sur le strip, avenue principale de Vegas, à coté du Paris et en face le Bellagio,
Un spectacle grandiose continuel, 
On peut manger pour pas cher, la principale attraction étant le casino, 
Ce qui m'a épatée lors de notre premier passage , la chambre nous ne convenait pas, nous avons pu avoir une autre sans soucis, alors que les hôtels affichent complet, et que la réservation était faite depuis 6 moi, chapeau.

RESTAURANT***Very Disappointed in this New Mexican Restaurant called Three Tequilas in this Hotel.  No service in the late hour, my friend and I went and were greeted by the buss boy, who brought us water.  Waited for the waitress for 10 min and nothing.  Buss boy came back and we asked for waitress and he said he can take our order.  I ordered Steak and Eggs cause there was a advertisement on the table.  He then tells me oh we don't have steak.  I said but you are advertising it her as I pointed to the plastic thing on the table and what does he do? He pulls it out and says oh we don't have any steak??Really!!!! in Vegas at Bally's... so I chose Eggs and Nopales (catus).  40 minutes later we see a waitress and we say we have been waiting for over 40 min and she said let me get the manager, and we said we don't even have chips and salsa like the other customers.  She said ok I will get that.  Came back and dropped off chips and salsa.  The Manager came out and apologize and said "I'm going to comp your meal don't worry".  We let him know that we had just gotten our chips and again he apologized.  the meal came after 1 hour and 10 minutes.  The tacos were cold, the hot wings were sweet my friend said, but no sign of my meal.  My plate came in 7 minutes later. and OMG.... the eggs were cold, I had asked for over easy eggs and I got sunny side up.  The cactus was not cooked (they turn a dark green when cooked) and they were under a hard tortilla smothered with black beans.  I called the waitress who was useless all she can say I will get the manager.  Manager came and I told him my complain and again he said but I'm comping you the meal., I said but this is not what I ordered, eggs are cold and I asked for over easy not sunny side up.  He said well let me ask the chef, I said if its longer than 5 minutes I don't want it.  He left came back 5 minutes later with no plate on his hands and said, I'm sorry but the Chef said it was not going to be possible.  My friend and I got up and walked out.
ps I added a photo of my breakfast Photo #572

Ballys, listen to me, you need to upgrade that ass.
 My family and I rented 4 rooms in the north tower and were disappointed by a number of things. First off, there was trash in our room when we checked in, our "suite" was equipped with a Murphy bed and stained chairs, the a\/c could not be controlled, there was only wi-fi for one device, and we had to get new keys made 3 times.  
Come on now, Ballys, this is Vegas, the place where regular folk go to feel like they're somebody.  Instead, you had me and my family feeling like we were slumming it at Motel 6.

It's pretty good got a great deal using my friends reward points for 8 days in the indigo king room for 458. It great cause it was close to everything else I was doing with my friends who stayed in the MGM which is also pretty nice got to see 3 different room set up cause of my friend and it was pretty amazing. My room had a modern classic look it's spacious(seriously) nothing to fancy but Homie. Easy on the eyes. I'm sure if you YouTube it you can see for your self I loved it.

Total vegas chintz that we are well enjoying. No eye candy at the pool, but they serve LARGE cocktails. Not the most fabulous of hotels, but centrally located and fun. And the rooms are pretty ok too...People here are old, but then again, who was planning on pulling in vegas anyways??

This front desk person, lex, should be fired. I have never in my life dealt with someone so rude, incompetent, and down right disrespectful. She gave us a dirty look, told us to back up from the front desk, told us we were wrong, said she was going to call security on us for saying shit because other people don't cuss. Well guess what LEX, I don't like your SHIT attitude! She is the reason I will never stay at this hotel, which is a shame because I actually really liked this hotel. I've never experienced someone who works in the customer service industry to have HORRIBLE customer service. Cesar's should send their employees to a customer service training before they start working in these hotels. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. I'm a total rewards member and I frequent Vegas. Unfortunately for ballys, myself and everyone I know will never waste our money on this hotel again.

The five-star reviews, even the 3-star reviews on this site are HIGHLY suspect.  We stayed here for a convention, two rooms, and I don't even know where to begin.  From the incompetent RUDE idiot "Christine" at check-in, whom the manager repeated was "new", it started off VERY BADLY.  Never mind the details on that issue, it was just the beginning of our hell stay....

From the GHETTO-filthy paint-chipped room, with the bathroom faucet literally falling off, to the carpet\/chairs\/walls, etc, that were STAINED with questionable GAG-stains, this has to be the filthiest, smokiest, nastiest hotel we have EVER stayed in.

All 3 of us have traveled the world, and this was just a nightmare experience.

We would not stay here again if it were free.  One of our rooms FLOODED on the last day of the convention, which was really kind of funny after everything else we experienced.

The manager "Jose" did move us to another room after we informed him how broken-down and nasty the first room was, but with the ignorant tacky comment, "We normally charge people MORE to stay in the nicer tower......"  Are you kidding me?  It costs MORE to stay in a clean room in the same hotel?  We are not talking a move to a fancy suite, just a cleaner newer room costs MORE?????????

These people are incompetent idiots.  I was in the hotel industry, and they have run this baby into the ground.  It is all about numbers.  ZERO QUALITY OR CLASS.  And we were not looking for fancy.  We came to Vegas to work a convention, not to party.  We were not expecting luxury, far from it.  Motel 6, where I stayed many many years ago at the age of 19, was MUCH MUCH MUCH nicer than Bulllys.

Indeed, the manager "Jose", moved us to a nicer room, but it was down the longest hallway ever (think the movie The Shining), and he put us at the VERY end.  It was SMOKEY (on a non-smoking floor), and there was INCESSANTLY LOUD CONSTRUCTION EVERY MORNING STARTING AT 6 AM.  Do NOT plan to sleep if you are here for a convention or a vacation.  I left exhausted, but without the great party stories to support it.

Staying at this problematic dump caused me to be like a zombie while working the trade show.  No joke, I was just dead.  Again, I did not party while here.  I just got little to no sleep due to the noise factor.  And the walls were so thin our coworker could not sleep due to partiers in the next room.  At the trade show, the man in the booth next to us could literally hear people having sex in the room next to him........  paper thin walls.

What has happened to the old Vegas?  I used to live here and the "class" is gone.  Bully's is a pig-sty.  It is old and dingy in the casino area and SMOKEY.

Again, Jose put us at the furthest end of a VERY long-hall-vortex when we changed rooms.  We were literally ON Las Vegas Blvd, so ALL night we got to hear the music show at the Bellagio which accompanies the outdoor water show, water that is propelled by massive horse power that sounds like machine guns.  NO SLEEP.  Thanks Jose?

Jose HAD to know he was moving us to a loud loud room (prior complaints...).  When we called to complain they were going to move us AGAIN, but by the third day of the convention we were just too busy and worn out (lack of sleep) to take the 2 hours to pack up, wait for the bellman, and go to another room and unpack for the THIRD time.

And with the luck we had, we did not trust that the third room would be any better.  Our co-worker had a mattress in his room that was so worn he literally rolled to the side of his bed.  And his room had NO coffee maker and plenty of questionable stains.

The place is a disgrace.  We did encounter a few REALLY great employees.  Charles, the black bellman who has been there almost 30-years, was a delight.  Von, at front desk, who said she had been there for 15 or so years was also a delight.  The rest was just crap.

The security guards were as fat as cows (gee, what were they guarding, the buffet?)   We checked out five other casinos and Bally's was the ONLY casino that wreaked of THICK smoke.  SINUSES...  bad bad bad.

As other reviewers wrote, the casino is TINY.  ALL slots, and mostly penny slots, and nickel or quarters.  WOW.  ONLY TWO crap tables, TWO roulette tables, the poker room was DEAD, and there was only a small circle of blackjack tables.  Slot machine city...

There were also no good restaurants or shops.  None.  Our co-worker had breakfast in the restaurant and said it was BAD.  How does one screw up eggs?  Anyway, I could go on, but I wanted to make a point to write this review and warn others.

If you stay here and have a good experience, you either have ZERO expectations in life, ZERO taste, or you got REAL FREAKING LUCKY.  Again, the LOUD CONSTRUCTION UNDER THE WINDOWS IN THE WEE HOURS (6 a.m.) IS JUST PLAIN CRUEL.  WE CAME HERE FOR WORK, AND IT REALLY WAS HARD TO DO SALES AT THE SHOW WITH ALMOST NO SLEEP...........

I left out a lot as I ran out of room.  Awful experience.  ZERO stars.

My wife and I had our wedding in Paris Las Vegas and as part of the All-inclusive package, there was 2 nights in the Bally's Penthouse included for Reception and stay and we also added another 2 nights for addtl cost=4 nights total. So my review is on the Penthouse only which by the way was amazing. There are 6 Penthouses on the 26th floor. We had the opportunity view 2 of them. One being the biggest one which was all carpet and the other which is all white and marble floors. We knew we wanted the all white one in case of spilled drinks and plus for dancing. It was huge and we fit 35ppl with no problem for our Reception! Had a sound system with speakers in the ceiling. Small refrigerator, microwave, bar counter with 4 stools, glass dining table that seats 8, 3 couches & 2 chairs n the living room. There were 2 bedrooms and a bathroom in each bedroom, as well as a half bathroom in the hallway when you walk into the Penthouse for guests to use during a party.  Beautiful windows in the living room area with a great view of the strip and Bellagio fountain show. 

For those using this for Reception purposes, it was perfect. We had catered finger foods from Bally's room service such as beef wellingtons, chicken skewers, shrimp, etc. The food was delivered in large food tins with warmers underneath. Croissant sandwiches, salads, & fruits in large trays. All plates and silverware supplied. The cake was 2 tier and was way more than enough. Served 35 ppl and still had half the bottom tier left. We did not choose a beverage package as they didn't have anything that we all drank, but they do provided about 10 water bottles-16.9oz and some small Pepsi bottles- 8oz. 

Overall experience was great and would do again.

Room service ends at 1pm? Wait what? I almost thought we were in Vegas! I didn't even think that was possible! It's such a pain in the neck! Will NEVER willingly stay here again! Clearly service Sucks and when you try to talk to someone about it they don't give a rats ass!

My buddy was able to get a solid discount at Bally's from 7\/8-7\/10 through a rewards membership. We were a little iffy about it because Bally's is an older hotel. Couldn't have had a better experience. Staff was extremely polite and efficient, and our rooms were clean and spacious (they were renovated somewhat recently).The location is great too, as the hotel is located virtually smack dab in the middle of the strip.

Easter weekend we enjoyed a 4day 3night stay at this joint. 
The first night we checked in late and they only had a king bed for two guys,mmmmm yeah problem. They assured me they would fix the problem the next night and keep me in an upgraded room\/  My fault i didnt call and let them know this would be a late check in. No biggy they were quick to offer a  roll away bed, problem solved. Until my buddies who were suppose to stay at another hotel had issues with the hotel were the hotel ended up canceling there room and still wanted to charge them. Anyways the guys ended up bunking with me one had the cot , one had the couch , and yes I had to share the bed with another guy, but shhhh dont tell anyone.
The second day they kept to there word. I was asked to check out by 5 pm so I could be put into my new room. I didnt the room change with no problems.
They rest of the weekend when on fine without any issues, only the ones the alcohol caused. All in all I can see myself staying there the next time Im in town.

So annoyed with the hotel right now. I booked my room over a month ago. I booked a specific room because of the features it has. I arrive to the hotel at 5am wanting nothing but to settle into my room after my long drive. I get to the counter and the lady tells me I've been upgraded to their "renovated" rooms. I ask her if it still has the same amenities as the room I've been upgraded from and she says no. Usually being upgraded is a good thing but I specifically chose my room for a reason. I'm so irritated that I have to go back and do a room switch. I can't relax knowing I'm going to have to move again. Why don't you ask before you change someone's room next time? Also, my night stand light doesn't work..... so much for an upgrade.

Nail salon seriously is a zero star. Basing my rating on them. A "salon" manicure include them rubbing lotion on your hands and lower arms... For $50.. So not worth it.  Other than that easy access to Paris.

The hotel is on the way down. We have stayed here for several vacations. The filtering system must be on the blink, the smoke was overwhelming. Headache and watery eyes for three days. Our shower door was off the track and the carpet looks like something I put in the cats shelter.

Top it off $11.99 for absolutely the worst breakfast buffet ever at the Sidewalk Cafe. They should be embarrassed to put out food like that.

We will not be staying here again. Plus they charge 14 bux a day for wi-fi although they advertise no resort fees. 

From the looks of things, they must be deferring maintenance for when the tear this place down and put up new which would include Bills and Imperial Palace.

You get what you pay for.

Stayed here 3 nights (Fri.-Sun.).  Rates were under $90 per night.  Stayed in the South Tower.  Rooms are large and outdated.  Yes, the carpet could use some work and the wallpaper was peeling  a little in the bathroom but the room was clean.  Bed was comfortable and we had a very nice view of the fountains and the south strip.  Really, like other have said, the single best thing about Bally's is the location for the price.

The casino is nice enough, dealers were friendly.  Not a whole lot of food choices but what is there was reasonably priced as well.

For the price we would stay here again.

Ballys needs an upgrade. Or if you're going to book, consider passing up the basic room for one of their jubilee rooms.

Indigo deluxe are just so standard. It's outdated. Harrahs, Flamingo or Ballys all offer VERY basic lackluster rooms if you're getting the cheapest.

Ballys has a perfect location for it's price. That's what always gets me coming back here. Good sized casino, shops and restaurants. It's connected to Paris so you get both hotels to choose from.

The front was recently renovated so it's even nicer now. Good shops and good eats. Night life is dead here though.

In my opinion it's one of the subpar budget hotels but probably the best out of all of them.

First time staying at Bally's and my stay was good. We arrived around 6pm on a Wednesday night and stood in the check in line for about 30 mins. 

Parking: shared parking with Paris hotel, so it was a long walk from the structure to head over to the lobby and to our room. Parking is $10 a day. Make sure when you check in to have them add the parking to your room. It allows you in and out privileges in all the Cesar resorts, without having to pay any more then $10.  

Check in: It was Wednesday night around 6pm. There was three lines; one for diamond members, one for keys and mail and the other one was for regular check ins. We were in the line for the normal check in, but it was unfortunate that they only two front desk agents checking everyone in. There were about 20 people in line and it could have been faster. At one point, the second person walked away and we were only left with one person. The other two lines each had to people checking them in. That was unfortunate. 

Room: We stayed at the Indigo Tower Suite. I liked the huge spa bathtub. There was a stand up shower, which had a glass door, which i thought was a little odd since there was no door for privacy. The room was a pretty good size, we didn't have a view though. Everything was pretty clean, although it seemed a little outdated. I wish I would have stayed at the newer Jubilee tower. One concern I had was that we had left the Do Not Disturb sign on the door as we left for the day, and when we returned at the end of the night, I noticed they had made our bed and cleaned up a bit. A little lack of privacy, but nice gesture I guess. 

For the cheap price, i would stay again. I liked that it is located fairly close to everything, since it is about right in the middle of everything on the strip. 4 out of 5.

Like any other reasonable person that's spent any time in a casino, I don't play with the goal of winning money at the table.  Don't get me wrong - that's obviously the ideal outcome, but it's also about the entertainment.  After all, it's not like the odds are in the player's favor (hellooooo, Hunger Games).  Otherwise, why would casinos even offer the game?  That being said though, I never thought the casinos would screw us out of both our money AND our fun...

Now, while neither of us consider ourselves to be heavy gamblers, my friend and I are more than familiar with the basics of Craps.  Since the table had been really cold, we opted to play the "dark side" (Don't Pass\/Don't Come) the entire time, which meant we were betting that the shooters would roll a "7" before rolling whatever the point was set at.  Initially, things were pretty uneventful - lots of people crapping out early, no hot streaks.

On this particular turn though, the shooter (who was on the opposite end of us) threw a "6\/4" on his opening roll that literally landed right in front of us.  This set the point at "10", which the dealer on our end of the table confirmed verbally, as well as with the placement of the marker on the table.  Given that a roll of "7" was twice as likely to come out as another "10", both of us placed odds on our initial $10 Don't Pass bets with an additional $50.

The next roll was a "6" and the one after that was a "9", which shouldn't have affected us at all.  However, the stick man called it a front line winner, meaning that it matched what he had as the point - "9" instead of "10" (ditto for the dealer on the other end of the table).  Our dealer had a confused reaction, but proceeded to collect our bets.  Seeing that, we immediately protested and asked for clarification\/review.   The stick man then brought over the pit boss, who then called up to the eye in the sky (aka the people monitoring the security cameras).

While they were checking, we were confident we were right.  We individually saw the first roll as a "10", our dealer had called it a "10" at the time, she knew we had been putting odds only on rolls of "4" or "10", the bet\/odds we placed were based on a roll of "10" (if it had been "9", our bet would've been $45 instead of $50), the third player at the table said he was positive it was a "10", and the final player\/shooter (after initially not saying anything) said he thought it was a "10" as well.

So, it makes perfect sense that the call came down as a "9".  And given that the eye in the sky has the final say, we were shit out of luck.

Now, I'm not saying we were lied to (read: cheated), but it seems awfully weird that so many of us apparently saw the dice wrong.  It also seemed convenient that ruling it as a "9" meant the casino won money (our bets were more than enough to cover any payouts), as opposed to calling it a "10", which would've resulted in no action either way.  Is there a chance the rest of us were wrong?  Of course!  Just like how there's a non-zero chance Jennifer Lawrence (hellooooo, Hunger Games) will read this and want to meet up for brunch next Saturday (which is open on my calendar, by the way...).

Too bad neither are very likely...

Bally's location is right in the middle of the strip, which is a huge bonus. I like how they redid their front entrance with a modern street market. The entrance and parking is located on the side of the hotel, facing Cromwell. We were a little disappointed when we arrived at 1PM on a Saturday that the Valet was already full. But the self-park lot was easy to navigate and had plenty of spaces. The casino is relatively small, but it's clean, and I definitely don't mind playing at $10 tables. The line at reception was huge when we arrived. So we grabbed some food, came back in an hour, and voila, the line was completely gone. It took us literally 2 minutes to check-in and we somehow got upgraded to high floor room with a view of the strip. Sweet! We came on a busy weekend, but the cab line was very short, another bonus! We really enjoyed our stay, and for the money, I'm definitely coming back.

Coming off of Rand's suggestion and well, free rooms we get from my father in law for spending (blowing?) a lot of money in this place, we stayed at Bally's. The casino area is crowded but they usually have someone on stage performing and you get to really experience the excitement of the casino atmosphere. Check in can be a nightmare, so slow at times but if you are VIP, they have a checkout\/in for that. 

The rooms are pretty quiet, we stayed in the North Tower for three days if that helps. Prices for rooms seemed reasonable. Although the rooms were free, I can confirm that the LV sandwich trick does work here. Shhh, don't tell them I sent you! Eat a Gordon Ramsey Burger in Paris downstairs!

To start off, I am always up-to-date on all my Vegas deals and news. I gamble 90% of the time at Total Rewards props, stay at Total Rewards props, and even have their credit card. That being said, I usually know what to expect at their Vegas hotel rooms.

It was not my idea to stay in a Jubilee room however my mom (64) wanted to stay in a newer room(still several years old) although I could have stayed a few comped nights in their North tower rooms. Anyways, $528 later (5 nights including Friday and after fees) I think she regretted it. Checking in was simple. Asked for a "high room" and was given room 5625....overlooking somewhat the Paris pool i.e. a lower floor. The young lady who assisted me said they were "booked"....Ballys must be a huge draw on a Monday in June (sarcasm to the 10th power).

Nonetheless, got to our room and were graciously greeted by a huge wet white stain on the carpet 5 feet from the door. It didn't look like what I was orig thinking (wild guess) but it was the size of a child's  hand. No clue what it was. Ok, whatever. Next, turned on the bathroom light, and there were two plastic razor blade covers in the middle of the bathroom floor. No, not in a corner or under the sink but literally right in the middle of the floor. Put Helen Keller in a maids outfit and even she could have spotted them. No excuse for that. Ok whatever. But what's this...my wifi wont connect to my iPhone....but what about that absurd resort fee Im paying daily? So down to the desk I go. Im cool with it, totally laid back and so if Miguel who helped me. Told me he would send someone up immediately to clean the stain (wasn't gone until next afternoon) and also as a courtesy refund a resort fee of $32+. I checked my account today and it was refunded as stated. Wifi the next 4 days was spotty although the casino wifi was usually good. 

And then finally, I come back from the casino the second day checked in and my mom says..."the toilet bubbles." Wait, what? Are you drunk mom? "No, the toilet bubbled when I was on it." What do you mean bubbled? "It literally bubbled." Low and behold the toilet did bubble several times over a 4 day period to the point that one night we left the toilet seat open and the next morning there was water all over the ground....cool Ballys.

Im returning in 4 weeks but this time with my girlfriend. Booked the North Tower and already know its dated and what to expect but its basically free MINUS MY $32 WIFI! 

The few employees I came in contact were just fine. Courteous and friendly. This was from my experiences at NOSH, the casino bar, and cage.

The room is disgusting. The carpet is old and stained. The curtains have holes. The tv barely works. The toilet makes a loud annoying moan that lasts for about a minute as the tank fills up. The room reeks of smoke, even though it's a non smoking room. The mattress is super uncomfortable, I can feel and hear the springs as I move around, and there's a ditch in the middle that slopes downward. I gave it 2 stars because the staff has been really nice.

This hotel has never let me down. It also helps to stay in the new tower as well. My girlfriend and i stayed her a while back for my birthday. It was my birthday and since i had been a players card holder for a while they even gave me a room upgrade. When i got there, the room was huge! They gave us two queen beds which was ok by us cause both beds had these huge ottomans at the foot of each bed a marble desk, and the bathroom was not too shabby. We spent a good deal of time in and out of the room and it worked out perfect for us. The price is never too steep and you get what you pay for.

Just remember to stay in the new tower otherwise i cannot vouch for the old tower! =) cheers.

This hotel is becoming really run down.  Like another person said the carpets are worn and stained and the rooms don't seem very clean.  We stayed there because the price was good and now in see why.  Also there are things missing from the room that most hotels have, like a coffee maker and refrigerator. I know they want you to spend your money in the restaurants but come on.  I'm not going all the way to the casino floor just to get a cup of coffee.  They also charged us $30 to listen to music on the TV but no where did it say there was a charge for this, and of course they would only refund us $10 but only because they charged us three nights and we only stayed two.  Next time we will find a better place to stay.

This is a review based mainly on their Hotel:

First of all, don't expect to be ordering room service once here. The room service is open 6am-1pm. ONE IN THE AFTERNOON! I got here at a later time starving and tired, and I was basically forced to go downstairs to simply get food. Almost everything is overpriced on their menu as well. If 4 guests are eating, you gotta pay an EXTRA $5. If more than 4 guests are eating, it's an addition of $2 per person. Seriously. Once I got to the point of ordering room service the lady claimed some items weren't available until 11am, when clearly on the menu it states 6am. There were other people around me and the lady on the phone for room service was RUDE! She got all grumpy just because there were people talking in the background. 

Secondly, they practically make you pay for everything. The internet is $13.99 per device for 24 hours a day. For people who don't own a hotel room here, it's $9.99 for 2 hours. What a rip off. To work out at the gym, it's $20. Just to exercise. *sigh*

Now to the actual rooms. The rooms itself are pretty gigantic. But, if you take a closer look at things it's EXTREMELY unsanitary\/not cleaned. I found half eaten chocolate strawberries as well as a bag of pie in the fridge. It seemed like they were there for quite a long time... Random areas on the carpet were wet when I walked on it, which was a little awkward especially not knowing what it was. The furniture was covered in hair (not mine) and had stains throughout the sofas.  I sat on one of the chairs and there was crumbs of something on it. Ew! Also, this isn't really a big deal but the bathroom toilet paper and the trash cans weren't even changed on arrival. Ehh..

This IS my first time experiencing Bally's and I'm pretty sure it'll be my last. One star for this. I definitely would recommend any of the hotels around this such as Bellagio though.

We stayed at this hotel in December 2013. The reception line to check in was the slowest ever; it took us two hours to meet the receptionist to start the check-in process and then had to argue for another hour to get a non-smoking room (although we had reserved a non-smoking room in advance).  We had to come back to the reception twice to exchange the keys, because the keys were faulty.
Overall, the room was clean and comfortable but the customer service was horrible and the staff were unhelpful. Also, they charge resort fees for the most useless services!

If it wasn't for the groupon deal I probably would have never stayed at Ballys. I gave this place a shot just because I've never been to this place before and also with the groupon deal you get $30.00 on food even for room service, and two Jubilee tickets. 

First thing was the valet service, I had too many bags to carry up so I really needed valet at the time. The guy was nice and friendly and that was good...As I came into check in I noticed the distance from valet to check in was super close and that was awesome...I had walked a lot previously at the outlets soo I was pretty tired already and waking up at 5:00 AM and driving from LA to Vegas was killer!

Check in took really long just because a few people for some reason were semi arguing with the front desk assistants. As soon as I was the first one coming up I got my ID and my credit card so they could look it up as fast as possible. The lady at the check out counter was super nice and she also upgraded our rooms just because and I thought that was pretty sweet ! 

Rooms were nice I would have to say they were pretty big and everything inside was quite new. Our bed was big with comfortable pillows and nice sheets. I have no complaints about the stay really..only about the $30.00 voucher for food. As we went to try a place out in the lobby area we waited for about 45 minutes and our server still was no where to be found...I had a last straw when she decided to take an order to these people that just barely sat down...Ughhh Nooo....Talked to the manager and just decided not to eat at Ballys ever in my life...EVER!

Besides the horrible experience at one of Ballys food establishments I feel if you get a deal to stay here and its pretty cheap why not. But I wouldn't pay full price from the online website!

So the interior is not the prettiest.. but I've become quite the fan of this hotel. Great location right in the middle of the strip and it's connected to the Paris hotel! It's also a lot cheaper than most hotels with spacious rooms. There's also this little coffee kiosk right by the hotel lobby where you can do espressoooo shots shots shots shots shots shots...everybody.. shots shots shots (get it like the song?). Anyhow they're perfect right in the morning or before heading out for a late night of clubbing. This is the perfect hotel if you aren't looking for any frills and hey it's vegas you aren't supposed to sleep anyways!

I recently stayed at Bally's in Las Vegas for a convention I attended. We (our team) decided this would be the best bet as it was closer to the actual convention in Paris, than staying at Paris itself. Boy was that a mistake. 

Pros: 
The people there are nice, and friendly.
The floor is very easy to navigate.
The prices are very reasonable (there's a reason for that.. read on!)

Cons:
Room came with a hot tub. That was what I was looking for, and would have been great if the jets actually worked. 

The chair in the room actually had something growing on it. Seriously, some green fungus was growing on it. 

The cover on the bed had a 'brown' stain on it that I didn't notice the first night. I can't even begin to explain how long I was in the shower after I found out. After that I slept on the couch for the remaining nights which was surprisingly quite comfortable. 

Room service.. What hotel in Las Vegas has room service only from 6 AM - 1 PM? Not 1 AM, 1 PM as in right after noon. On top of it, they won't allow delivery to the rooms from outside businesses. I was so backed up on work I just decided not to eat that entire day. 

The rooms are seriously dated.

The lights for the elevator (to tell you which one is going up\/down) are burned out on most floors\/elevators. 


In conclusion if you stay here, check your rooms, check your sheets IMMEDIATELY. It's a good price, but I'd be afraid of catching something at this point.

I've stayed here twice, and had very different room experiences.  Only one side of the hotel is renovated and that of course makes a huge difference.
