My boyfriend and I had a room with a king size bed and it was nicely updated and had a great bathroom.  I booked again with the girls and we had rooms with 2 double beds, very dated, worn furniture, old carpet.  If you're going with friends and don't plan on spending much time in the room then it's a good choice based on location and price.  The other negatives is that you have to pay to use the gym and the pool area is VERY crowded...tough to get a lounge chair.  Gambling is OK...but the drink service is a little slow.
I spent a lot of time here because its one of the few places left in Vegas that has Caribbean Stud Poker.

Good:
1: Cheap!
2: Jubilee! Tower rooms have been nicely renovated.
3: Amazing strip views!
4: Huge fun casino.
5: Strategically located: Paris \/ PH \/ Bellagio \/ Cromwell are all within minutes walking distance.
6: Cool shops!
7: My favorite casino bar: Sully's!
8: New addition: Bazar shops!

Bad:
1: Somewhat dated property.
2: Lot of walking.

I'm not sure if I stayed in the north or south tower (I was facing the Eiffel Tower), but my room wasn't nice. It was clean and spacious. Otherwise, the furniture and decor looked like something out of Boogie Nights. The shower light was flickering on and off which was decidedly un-classy. Other things that annoyed me but I won't necessarily hold against them: no room frig and there was a $30 charge for a pull out. There's a bar near the elevator which serves dirt cheap margaritas, but they also taste like dirt cheap margaritas. Overall, I recommend Caesars or MGM over this hotel. Comparable price, better room.

Stayed here during the week before the big Mayweather and McGregor fight! We had great customer service! Very friendly and helpful staff:) The rooms were very nice, super spacious, and smelled amazing!!!

You don't really get the luxury hotel experience with Bally's. It's a little outdated. For our room, some of the lights didn't work and it was overall kind of dark. I was also disappointed that we didn't get conditioner in our shower. 

BUT it has everything you need. It has a TV, limited internet access (they limit 2 devices per room), and a comfortable bed. Save your money for the casino, dining, shopping and other experiences that Vegas has to offer and stay at Bally's! It's cheap, and it's right in the middle of all the action. For that, I am thankful that Bally's is still around!

I went by their pool a few times. Nothing really fancy. They have a separate deep end, and a more shallow pool that most people were walking around in. They also have a jacuzzi, but Vegas is hot enough as it is! They also didn't care that we had people from other hotels come by as well to swim :)

If you're on a budget and you want a place near everything, Bally's is the way to go!

I stayed I'm the jubliee towers on sept15 through the 19. Had bed bugs and bites. Management was rude and not help. Risk management never returned my call. A front desk manager call after I sent an email. Stating they didnt have bed bugs and I would have to get an subpena for documentation. Had to throw my luaggae away and get rid of my clothes and designer bag. Hospitality horrible.

I stayed in a Jubilee Tower Room. My stay in a nutshell is as follows:

Check in- I used the Self check in kiosks, I had my keys in under 2 minutes (Literally) I love the self check in.

The Room: When i stepped into my room the first thing i noticed is it smelled clean. All the furnishings and decorations were in great condition and it was a unique style room. I liked it. The bed was very comfortable and had the right amount of pillows! The bathroom area had ample room to be comfortable using it.

Blu Pool- I really liked this pool.....It is a rarity to find any deep pools in Vegas. Bally's kept their 12 foot pool from the old days and I'm very glad they did. This is a pool you can actually swim in instead of just wade in like the rest of the city's 4 ft pools. Thank you Bally's for having a pool that was worth going to.

The experience was nice and relaxing, I felt the service was where it should be and I didn't encounter any negative situations during my stay. It was a great deal.

We stayed here 3 days. Our room was clean but dated, the carpet can use upgrading. The rooms are spacious. The pool is also a bit dated. The restaurants are good, great food. Overall not a bad place. Might consider coming back.

Location, location, location! Heart of the strip. Rooms in indigo tower are pretty basic - hard bed and pillows and shower pressure so hard it hurt but if you want to be on the strip on a budget can't beat the location and price. You probably won't be In your room much. Pool is pretty basic - we were told we could go over to Paris for pool but didn't have a chance.

This hotel does charge a resort fee - fee  includes wi-fi for 2 devices per room. Free wi-fi in lobby. They have a business center but it charges for Internet and to print boarding passes $1\/pass so we just went online on our phone to check in for flights.

Bally's is truly one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff when you can find one is rude and not customer friendly. No one offerred to help you with bags. The rooms smell of mildew and the decor is Austin Powers vintage- not retro just old. WifFi is too slow to use and $1\/day. Take my advice- NEVER EVER STAY HERE!

You have to come here with your expectations in check. It's no frills. It's cheap. It IS on the strip. That's about it. The maid service could use a refresher course in cleaning. The floor was dirty and had food crumbs and a plastic clothing tag. There were always dishes in the hallway that would be there for nearly 24 hours. Knocking and entering at 8am? Not cool. But with expectations in check... it's the best deal for the location.

Wow what a bummer. I've stayed at this hotel pretty regularly for the last 19 years. I must say I'm very disappointed in the direction this hotel is trending. My check in experience went well, but when I arrived at the room I was very upset at what I saw. There was a large stain on the wall and being in a non smoking room, it was very smokey.  The bed was very hard, and when I lifted up the mattress, there was a large piece of plywood acting as a box spring. No I swear that is the truth. I spent most of my stay at other more modern casinos and had an excellent time. The kicker on this trip is that as I'm checking out the front desk worker says I owe 20 dollars because they didn't collect it at time of check in. When I called bull stuff, she said "do you have your receipt" to which I replied that's why I'm here checking out to get it. I then asked why they let me stay or gave me a room without having full payment and they said it happens. It happens!!! So as not to miss my flight I paid the 20 bucks and they lost a long time customer. Well done Ballys.

Second night of the Bachelor tour de force and we switched hotels to save some $$$ and move closer to the Strip.  While the room was not as big as at Rio but the quality was just as nice.  However I did not appreciate having to "upgrade" my room in order to get early check in.  Especially when I called in advance and they told me that they had my room ready and available when I arrived.

Time to get back in actions!!!

Came here twice once in 2004 and once in 2014. In 2004 at age 22, was carded a few times but overall wasn't constantly harassed. 10 years later at age 32, carded from every blackjack table to three card poker table to bla bla bla even though the new dealer had clearly seen me playing! Then they tried to state some law, and I said the law states under 30 but you have been harassing me all night with this and I don't feel comfortable having to show my personal information to random strangers when im clearly over 21!

Let's just say "you get what you pay for". They can really nickle and dime you to death though. I booked a king bed but a friend ended up sharing a room with me, they charged $20 more per night to move us to a room with 2 beds. Also be aware there is a $28 PER night resort fee! They said it covers internet, gym and pool, (the pool and hot tub were drained). There is no coffee in the room, and it is a long walk to the coffee bar in the lobby, especially for a $4 cup. The room was decent, but the casino was extremely dated, dark and seemed dirty. We gambled and ate elsewhere. The one thing this place has going for it is the location. Be prepared for long lines checking in and getting coffee in the morning. Next time I know better and will take my business elsewhere, somewhere nicer.

Got last minute cheap hotel from orbitz website.  Hotel check in line was super long, wait time was 20-30 minutes.   The room is simple, spacious, and clean.  There was no coffee maker (unless you are a diamond member).  Our neighbor blast music all night and we could hear everything on the other side.  For some odd reason, there were  many questionable looking guests staying at this hotel this week.  So glad we are staying only for 1 night.

One of my favorite hotels to stay in. Right in the center of the strip. If you're younger and looking to stay near the cooler, hip places this is the best spot to do it (reasonably). Food court isn't that good, but you're surrounded by other good options both reasonable and more expensive. They have great deals on their blackjack and crap tables (sometimes 5-10 a hand) as well. We got a jubilee suite overlooking the Paris Hotel with a Jacuzzi tub. I had a great time and will be staying there again.

This hotel made our recent experience in Vegas less than ideal.  We were given the WORST service, treated with disrespect and ultimately left- to stay at a MUCH nicer resort.  The casino is dirty, the dealers are nasty and the management could care less.  We have stayed there before and had a good experience, so I guess we needed to keep our expectations lower.
Lesson learned, thanks Ballys, we won't be giving you anymore of our money.  I hope people read this and it assists in their decision to stay else

In recent years I've stayed at Rio and Flamingo.  Each is good in its own way, each has its drawbacks (the working girls at Rio come to mind).  The past two annual visits have been here at Bally's for several reasons.

First, it's centrally-located on The Strip.  One is within walking distance of Caesar's Palace, Harrah's, Flamingo, Imperial Palace, Bellagio and Planet Hollywood.  If you're tanking at the tables in one place, it's easy to try another.

Second, Bally's is co-located with Paris, meaning you can walk from one to the other without braving the gauntlet of XXX-rated handbill passers outside.  This doubles the number of restaurants and shows available under one roof.

Finally, I cannot say enough about joining the rewards program no matter where you stay.  You can get free stuff for playing the games you enjoy.  A little play will get you a discount at the buffet.  A little more will get you a break on the room.  A lot of play will get you comp rooms.   For couples, have two rewards cards in the same name.  It doubles up the comps.

Back to Bally's.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  There are enough restaurants to satisfy a variety of tastes.  Cocktails are readily available at a host of bars.

Their service is impeccable.  Example: I forgot to check-in for my flight before the Business Center closed.  Nice young ladies at the front desk went out of their way to help me do this and get a printed boarding pass prior to checking out the next morning.  This was at no cost to me and they would not accept a gratuity.  Kudos!  I got a comment card and sang their praises to the management.

I'll be back next May.

Bally's Hotel really has me coming back for more. It is really our go-to place to stay when we visit Las Vegas. 

This is an ideal center Strip hotel if you plan on checking out all the local hotels, casinos, restaurants, and shows. No need for a cab. However, they do have a free shuttle that will taxi you to Rio. With location in mind, it is definitely not one of the newer, luxury hotels. It isn't even modernized with upgrades to this centuries decor or amenities. It is a very plain hotel. BUT!, it is always well maintained and pretty clean for the most part. 

Hotel registration and check-in has always been painless for us. Maybe 15 minute max wait whenever we stay here. Keep in mind, that when everyone decides to check-in all at once, it's going to take a while. Play the numbers right, and don't check in when it's too busy! Go grab a bite. We always plan ahead, always have your ID, credit card ready, and be nice to the front desk clerk! You may even get a nice upgrade. We usually do.

The pool and the atmosphere is also a nice amenity for us. It is a very basic pool  and deck. Mostly sun, some shade. The scene is never obnoxious and usually more mature. A plus for us. Service is usually pretty good. The only negative I must note is that the lounges probably should be replaced or repaired. I'd say about 10% of them had a strap or two busted off or were very worn. The attendants were passive with not checking for room cards and even outside food and drink that so many patrons bring in. I assume they are aware of this practice and really don't enforce the "rule" since the crowd is pretty tame. Another plus for us. Usually a bucket of beers on ice (five, one pint aluminum brews) will throw you back $35.

As I mentioned, we usually have an upgrade to a North Tower Suite. Just like the hotel lobby and grounds, the rooms are also pretty basic, lacking amenities other luxury hotels boast. Not a big deal for us. As long as we have a nice bed and shower for a few nights. Not going to huff over an iPod dock and roman shades with a remote. When we want those things we will stay and pay somewhere else. 

We always enjoy the walkway from Bally's to Paris. Always air conditioned and scenic! Save the heat and traffic from the walk outside for the night time. Always a good crowd outside Bally's on the boulevard during the night. 

Really a good hotel for your buck! Please continue to be nice to us Bally's and please be nice to Bally's!

Numbed...
Thieves....
Complacent....

These are the three words I have to describe the employees of this hotel. 

Frankly let's start with the hotel. You can see the cigarette smoke floating in the air. They spent millions building the jubilee tower, but they should have spent some money on the ventilation system.

The internet isn't working. We kept having to call the Computer services to reconnect our computers to the internet in our room. The tower was having trouble.. The kicker was they still wanted us to pay the 24.00 resort fee. We made an argument out of it and the manager removed the fee from our bill. But since when does a manager have to do that? That should be something automatic. This happened to me at Mandalay Bay a few years ago, they didn't just remove the fee, they gave me a 20$ discount on the room. I didn't even have to ask. 

The final kicker is they stole a stuffed animal I had owned for 30 years. It was on the bed. As per the housekeeper, it got wrapped in the linen. I got in touch with the linen handlers. They didn't have it. As a matter of fact I talked to everyone who would have come into contact with my property and no one had seen it. It isn't small either. It is about a foot and a half high. Half the size of a pillow. From housekeeping to linen to truck to cleaners...that is the order. 

Whenever I try to talk to anyone, they try to blow me off. Frankly it is somewhere, inanimate objects don't just walk off by themselves. No one cares, no one wants to take any responsibility in helping to find it.  Frankly, they could steal anything and the answer is "Talk to Risk Management." That's all they can say for it.  I think the employees are so used to suboptimal quality they accept it. No one wants to have any accountability because they all know how awful the hotel has become. It's sad. 

Don't stay here. It's only going to get worse. Mind you, I wasn't in Vegas for a funtime, I was working. At least if the employees\/managers\/security\/housekeeping helped me look, actually attempted to care, it would make what happened less awful. But they don't. So it doesn't.

Sorely disappointed. 

Took us 1 hour to check in.  Line out the wazoo.  Two people working the front desk, yes two.  One additional working the diamond princess window.

Asked for a view of the Strip.  Maybe I needed to specify, not the strip of crummy parking l
lots to the east of the Strip, which is what we got.

Last time we were there 2 years ago, shabbiness prevailed and everyone said they were right in the middle of a renovation.  Must have not been to my side of the hotel yet then and now.  

We were there for a week, this past July, with hubby and the kids.  

4 of the up\/down elevator indicators were broken on lobby floor and the 21st floor where we stayed.  

Even though there was a sign that indicated that this was a non smoking floor, the many, many burn marks in the carpet, and cigarette smoke that wafted into our room, indicated that was obviously not the case.

Shabby carpets throughout the hotel, some patched with luxurious gray duct tape.  

Rooms show their wear. Especially in the corners and the wet feeling carpet.

Housekeeping missed our rooms a couple of times when we left late, but we told the maid down the hall our room numbers and I called housekeeping to let them know.  They missed out on the tips.

The biggest rip off and the biggest F\/U to customers, and potential customers, is the fact that they charge a $28.00 resort fee, per day for internet service.  wtf?  

Who was the dumbass that failed marketing, 101 that came up with that idea?.
Probably the same one that said you can't get a glass of water for free by the pool unless you buy something.  Yes, let's chase our customers away.

So, I'm not paying a fricken "resort" fee for internet service.  
So we did what I'm sure thousands of others do, we go into town and find a nice Starbucks and spend a few bucks and a couple of hours doing my online thing.  What?  Not paying the $9.00 frappaccino at Bally's?  Nope, spending my money at Starbucks, buddy.  

Pool was deemed good by kids.  Though I hate what seems like the 100 yard hike through underground parking \/psuedo mall.  Some aware lifeguards, some really lazy.
Enough shade for me.  Not as loud as it was last time we were there.  Gets rowdy in the afternoon.

We find the self parking to be fine.  
We eat out every night somewhere in the burbs or sometimes we bring in, Robertos, Pizza Hut, but always eat at BFG's .
  
Found the treasure of Tuscany's cafe.  Try it.

P.S.  No signs of bedbugs.  Thank god.

So I stayed here end of August for a friend's bachelor party. Somehow we managed to squeeze 8 of us into a standard room registered for 2 (maybe 3 cus we got a rollaway bed). The room was plenty big compared to many other casino's standard rooms. I think it was 500 square feet, maybe a little bigger. 
  The room was clean, bed was clean n'comfy enough, bathroom was quite large, marble flooring, and most importantly...the shower had a constant temperature and pressure. Unlike some hotels that SUCK (i.e. Tropicana). The pricing for Ballys is also very good, and dirt cheap given we snuck everyone in the room. I think those of us who stayed 2 nights paid $70 each.  
  The casino itself is pretty small, clean, but lacking that fun atmosphere that many other Vegas Casinos have. But alas..Paris is right next door and connected without having to go outside...(it was 110 outside when I was there...I may be from Guam..but DAMN that's hot).  The location of Ballys is one of the best on the strip without having to pay huge $$$ and not staying in a sh*thole that is Imperial Palace. 
 Anyway 4 stars for overall value for Bally's. It's not the best, it's not horrible...the pool is large, but boring...no waterfall or slide..but if you just want to layout and get drunk...that works. Oh and the monorail has a stop at Ballys...Ballys is definitely a convenient place to stay.
~G
I have been coming here very year for events and for fun. Ballys is one the last of the original hotels on the strip. GREAT prices and nicely appointed rooms. I will be back Ballys.

Husband and I decided to do a spontaneous road trip to Las Vegas.  We were told by some friends about hotels and decided to do Bally's because of the location.  We figured we wouldn't be in the room too much (day hikes, Hoover Dam, Grand Canyon, etc.).  I also knew we weren't booking the Bellagio so the "updated" (aka - we threw some paint and new wallpaper and changed the TV's and bedding) rooms were expected.  After the long drive we were starving so we dropped our stuff in our room and headed out to eat and do a quick check to see what was around and get our bearings for the next few days.  As I mentioned earlier, I knew we weren't staying at the Bellagio, but I was also expecting something a little more "we actually care."  The check in process was a bit confusing as to what to do with our car if we weren't doing Valet.  We followed the signs around to check in and there are multiple rows of Valet and a thru lane.  So I dropped my husband off and was promptly screamed at by a worker.  I told him I was happy to move but my husband was checking in and needed to know where to go.  He didn't give two craps and mumbled something and then yelled that I was blocking traffic.  So around the lot I went again.  Decided to just pull into Valet and pay the 18.00 fee (I'm pretty sure this is their way of forcing Valet vs the 10.00 self park).  Annoying, but I've dealt with worse.  What was unacceptable was the used soap from the previous occupant still in the shower.  As well as some trash left in the bathroom.  Not just a small piece, nope, the trash can still had trash.  We called the front desk and the woman apologized and said, "I will make sure your room gets cleaned tomorrow."  Yep, tomorrow.  She said she understood why I was unhappy (I was very calm when speaking to her as I know it isn't her fault the room was not cleaned properly), but expected something a little better than I will make sure your room is cleaned tomorrow.  I didn't sleep well last night because I couldn't be 100% sure I was sleeping on a clean bed or that our room was actually clean.  I ultimately decided on two stars for location (its is central to everything), but depending on how the rest of the stay goes, aka if our room actually gets cleaned, the stars could change.

Meh.  We stayed here because the price was right.  It wasn't good, but it definitely wasn't bad.  I would stay here again if needed.  However, if you're looking for a more luxurious vegas experience, this is definitely not for you.  The crowd is also much older at this hotel than at others.

Started here in April 2016 for one night before our actual stay at the Aria because we came to Las Vegas a day early. ANYWAY. The room was larger than what someone would normally expect. But that was pretty much the only nice thing. Furniture and wallpaper felt outdated and was even peeling ! When the bellhop brought our bags to our room, he lingered around expecting tip -we did but he looked at the tip like "that's it?" How rude ! Would rather not stay here again in the future. PS- the room doesn't look like those pictures.

Just got back to San Diego after a lovely couple of days in Vegas!
Traveled via "Lux Ground" (see my review on that one- horrible!)
but Bally's was great!  I had booked it on a fantasic deal so, honestly,
wasn't expecting much.  We arrived early and had no problem checking in. The gentleman at the desk offered- unprompted- to upgrade us to a large suite and we happily accepted.  Although the room\/decor is very
dated...the rooms were huge in the suite!  Three "living room" areas, kitchen\/bar, bath and a half etc... Tons of space, everything clean- I would absolutely stay here again.

Last time I went  I stayed at Aria- which is *fantastic* but also paid considerably more.  I'm not much of a critic on most hotel rooms though since I never spend much time in them anyway- mostly a place to stow your bags and sleep.  So, given that info....I'd stay in Bally's next time without hesitation.

Decided last minute to drive to Las Vegas and booked a room on the way here, and accidently booked an older room so when I arrived to the counter I explained to Sosoo that I had booked the incorrect room and asked if I could pay the difference for a Jubilee King since my boyfriend had never been to Vegas I did not want the other rooms to be the impression of Vegas he was left with. She happily moved my reservation over. Kudos to you Sosoo you made my stay at Bally's wonderful and I can't thank you enough. ( I thought it was cute that you thought my daughter looks like Mila Kunis) :)

I was in and out on a business.  We didn't have a reservation, (military, things change), so the six of us had to stand at the desk and speak to a reservationist one-by-one, then get back in line to check in.  The room didn't have a fridge.  As a military flyer, we always carry something that needs to be in a cooler\/fridge.  I ended up getting ice from the ice machine and putting it in a plastic bag then putting my fruit in the bag.  Also, the furniture in the room was old and not clean.  I didn't want to sit in the chairs.  Maybe I expected a little better for Vegas.  At least they honored our government rate.

I hate to give it one star...i booked the Jacuzzi room in the Indigo Tower..

There were no vents in the bathroom... so if you go number 2, everyone will get a breeze for hours...
The sinks were old...old as in black and rusted
The hot water for the showers was inconsistent... you'll get a splash of cold water for about 20 seconds...here and there
There were hair everywhere....
the carpet seem really dirty....
the king size bed was really short in length.... the middle of the bed also sags.... the pillows were very small...
the jacuzzi was okay... i was a bit skeptical since the metal looks old and rusted :(
i can't really name anything new in the room besides the TV

can i have my money back????

Other hotels on the strip may be glitzier with more active casinos, but Bally's is a solid price performer -- rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Excellent central location directly across from Bellagio and all the action on the strip. 

Biggest cons are how inconveniently far you have to go to the outdoor pool and the casino looks and feels "tired" and "blah" relative to others. 

For the price, it is a good value in my book.
Bally's!!! Love your massive rooms! I can roll around on the floor! Totally cool!

My first time staying here with friends who have stayed previously.  Check in was quick and they upgraded (free) our room to a better view.  Immediately walking into our room, we had a beautiful view of the Paris hotel,  the eifel tower, and the Belagio fountains (great night show). Room is very spacious and clean. Only downside to the room... they have a fridge but no microwave available. They have an amazing steak restaurant inside with an amazing staff.  Checkout was just as quick and we were granted an hour later checkout time. The hotel is centrally located on the strip, and affordable.  Only other negative: the casino is poorly ventilated and the scent of cigarettes is very strong.  If you're a smoker, you're at home with the stench, if not,  it can get nauseating as fresh air and or air freshener is not pumped in.

Worst hotel stay in quite a while. While I expected the hotel to be lower quality I did not expect such horrible customer service. Staff is rude and inattentive. After paying extra for a suite, hoping it would give us a better experience, we had a sleepless night on a bed with a large dip o. The middle. Then we rented a cabana at the pool to ensure we received service. Saw our server a total of 3 times over a 6 hour period. So basically we paid $300 for some shade and water. Cut our day at the pool short because they said we had to change our room by 3. We had to wait in line to get our new room keys go up one tower get our bags and go down again and go up in a different tower to our next room. With no bell help offered. This room was 90 degrees when we got in and they would not change our room until engineering checked it out.  Had to get ready for dinner while sweating in a hot room and then cut our evening short to see if they were going to give us a new room or if they were able to fix the air. Nope room still hot then the manager asked if we wanted to change rooms. Are you kidding me. She said we needed to come down and pick up our new keys. Um NO. Took 45 minutes for a bellman to bring them right up lol. Finally got an acceptable room. Vacation ruined and the only resolution offered was to waive the resort fee for one day.  What a joke. Left two messages for the GM Ryan Hammer. No contact in over 24 hours. Cannot wait to get out of this hotel tomorrow. I will never stay in a Caesar Company hotel again. 

This hotel needs to be demolished. It is falling apart. I have had better service at motel 6

You get what you pay for. Finding a decent room rate on center strip is no longer an easy feat. Found a good $89 deal through Groupon. However you have to remember that hotels now play this stupid "Resort Fee" game where they tack on another $30 or $40 a night for allowing the privilege to use their pool, fitness center, and basic slow snail mail free Wi-Fi whether you use any of them or not. Why can't hotels just own it,  include the fees and say that they're going to be charging $129 and night plus tax? It insults our intelligence.

After spending considerable time at one of their check-in kiosks, I made my way through the smoky, somewhat dingy casino that still looks exactly like the set from Honeymoon In Vegas, a movie made there about 25 years ago.

Once I arrived in my room I immediately realized the room hasn't been changed all that much since the '80s, including the carpet. They put a decent counter and tile in the bathroom, however the toilet was old and was continually running. The bed was mediocre at best. 

Here's what really aggravated me. There are literally no plugs anywhere for you to simply plug your cell phone in without having to get on hand and knee behind furniture. I had to call the front desk and they would bring up a power strip for me. That is ridiculous in 2017. The front desk phone receptionist told me that this was not an expensive hotel. As if only the Ritz provide electrical plugs for guests who have those fancy schmancy cell phones. 

So buyer beware, the cheap Groupon coupons for a decent center strip hotel is not really worth it.

The hotel is located right on the strip. 
It's quite a walk from the parking lot to the hotel lobby. 
The staff are friendly and attentive.

The air is awful here, because there are tonnes of smokers walking around and there is not air freshener in side. They should provide stronger air freshener.  

The rooms is big and it's pretty clean. 
The windows are really close to each other, you won't have much privacy. 
The bed is firm and the pillow is flat, I even used three pillows together, but it's just too flat. 
The towels were clean on the first day, but the towel were old, rough, it comes with an unknown stain and a hole on the second day. 
And they don't top up the shower gel\/shampoo. 

I've heard that a few people got stuck inside the elevator for two hours around dinner time and fortunately Mr.Q and I went for an early dinner that night. 
Stuck in the elevator is not funny, especially for 2 hours? really? hmmm...

This was my 1st time to Vegas and found a good price room hotel with nice view too. Everything was ok. The only thing that I didnt expected was the bed, I chose king size but I felt the size smaller than the king size bed I have at home. 
Anyway, I'm sure I'll choose this hotel again when I'm at Vegas.

Was a bit disappointed with my stay here. The suite we were in the AC did not work properly for several days I was not able to sleep properly. When I did bring it up their was nothing they could do. They ended up putting me in a smaller room and refunding the upgrade fee for most of the time. But the customer service from guest services was horrible! Chris and sammie  were not very helpful at all and when we switched rooms they insisted we pack up all of our stuff and carry it to the front desk when I went to the front desk they told me that did not have to happen and they have offered a bell person to help us.

I will not be coming back here to stay or gamble.

After seeing the ultra cheap rate online, I decided to give Bally's a try.  However, it was very a disappointing experience.  


Service:
Upon arrival, I experienced the most unprofessional front desk clerk in Las Vegas.  I booked 4 rooms for the entire group and logically, we all wanted to check-in together.  But, when we walked up to the front desk, the clerk refused to check-in all of the rooms and ask some people to go back in line.  Furthermore, she informed us that we had to pay extra if we wanted all 4 rooms to be on the same floor.  What the heck?  Never heard of that before. 

When the next clerk helped us check-in the second room, she just offered to put us on the same floor, with no EXTRA charge.  So I don't know what the first person was doing, probably going pocket the "extra charges."

Cleanliness:
The room is standard, a bit old.  But the problem I have is how dirty it was.  First, there seemed to appear to be coffee crumbs on the bed.  Weird.  Second, the bathroom was not wiped down.  I could see a lot of dust on where they put the towels.  

Overall:
This hotel is too old for the strip.  Everything seems to be falling apart.  Even the elevator light doesn't work.  

Tips:
Only book this hotel if you want to same some money.  If not, there are many other options in Las Vegas.

This hotel might be one of the worst I have stayed in on the Las Vegas strip. As I write this I have a headache from the stench of cigarette smoke in my room. It smells like an ash tray. The staff has been nice, but the hotel is not up to par with any of the other hotels on the strip. I also took a cold shower and when maintenance came to assist he said we need to run the hot water for a long time before the water will get hot. I thought Nevada was in a drought. I guess Bally's doesn't care. Won't be coming back.

I stayed there this week for a conference. I do not recommend this place. It's only a few dollars cheaper than some of the other resorts, and this place wasn't good. A few highlights:

- The room phones had a loud buzzing on them. It made it difficult to use the concierge \/ order room service.

- The concierge didn't know there was a ski shuttle in town (I found a $20 shuttle to Mt. Charleston online. The concierge said there's no shuttle and I should take a $200 cab ride!)

- The bed is hard as a rock, and the pillows were too gushy. Imagine sleeping on plywood with a folded up towel for a pillow.

- The "updated" room featured a large brown stain on the ceiling.

When the conference ended Friday, I called the bellhop to get my bags. I stayed the rest of the weekend at Encore.

Oh yeah, it took two calls and two hours for the bellhop to get to the room.

With so many choices in Las Vegas, this hotel shouldn't be one of them.

My bf and I stayed here over the weekend for FFXIV fan fest and were able to book a room the night before the event. We asked for a late check-in since we were coming from afar and traveling very late at night. So when we went to the concierge, we were told that we got upgraded to a "suite." 

We originally booked a queen size Indigo room but upon arrival, we got jipped. Instead of the Indigo room as we have originally reserved AND personally spoken to the concierge to confirm our reservation and late-check in, we got a Murphy Parlor room instead. We got a room that DID look like a suite (had small living area, sofa, table, non-working fridge, TV) but the bed was a pull-out bed from the wall (aka Murphy bed) and it wasn't even that comfortable. Furthermore, the feather pillows they had were so dented that it barely had any head\/neck support. I might as well sleep on the bed without a pillow. 

The AC wasn't properly working during the peak afternoon warm hours of the day. At night, it was cool because of course, the weather gets cooler as it gets later at night. What even made me very unsatisfied was the fact that the hot water would only work at various times of the day. We had called concierge to request a different room but they only told us that all Indigo rooms (we wanted the room we had originally RSVPd) are booked. Then we mentioned the AC and they said a technician would come. Hours later, no one came. I called again and they said someone would come up -- not sure if they ever came up because we were out for the day and came back at night, when it was cooler.

Overall, I was not satisfied with my stay here although I had a fun weekend in Vegas. Understandably, if you were booking for a decent\/cheap room in Vegas, these would be probably what you expect. So book a room here at your own risk.

Despite these setbacks, Bally's is right next to Paris and is connected (so you don't need to walk outside in the heat) and there is a shared parking structure. I usually give places the benefit of the doubt, but when you RSVP a room, get a confirmation over the phone regarding a late check-in, you should get the room that you spent money on.

Wow. Worst customer service and hotel experience of my entire life. Stayed here for a bachelorette party June 26-29th 2013. After spending the day at the pool, we came back to our room  to find raw sewage, yes, SEWAGE filling the sink and spilling onto the floor. Ruined all of our makeup, hair supplies, you name it. Obviously this situation was out of our hands so we called the hotel front desk immediately. We were on the phone for about 30 minutes and never got to talk to a manager. A half hour later, they sent up a security guard and a cleaning crew. 

Even though we were upset, we tried our best to be friendly to the security guard and cleaning crew.. what a terrible job to have! One of them said "This happens all the time"..... WHAT? Raw sewage spills into rooms all the time?

We had to claim every single item that was ruined.... meaning that we had to empty our sewage soaked makeup bags onto a towel and touch every single piece.. writing down its brand, description and cost. If we didn't, we woulnd't get any money for our ruined products. Poop EVERYWHERE. OH, I forgot to mention that it was my friends Bachelorette party and that was the night we had planned to go out. How were we going to get ready? We thought the hotel might be a little bit sympathetic to our situation and asked if we could get our makeup\/hair done for the evening....not a chance!! After arguing with people over our situation we decided to call it quits and ask for some toothbrushes.... they agreed and never sent them up!! We ended up having to buy them and get reimbursed. What a joke!!!! 

They moved us to a different room about 2 hours later. When we checked out, we realized that our room wasn't comped!!!! Not even for that last night!

2 months later and we are finally hearing from claims about crediting us for our ruined makeup. We are only getting half of what we claimed!! 

This experience was really disappointing. I plan on posting this on any and every travel review website possible. Apparently raw sewage spills into the rooms all the time... even if you don't see it, doesn't mean it wasn't there!!!!!

The shower was cold and our door wouldn't close properly.  Front desk only suggested we have maintenance come.  It was 11:45 at night and I was putting the kids to bed so I declined.  The next day during check out.  They had the nerve to lie and said they offered us a different room.  After complaining I received a $50 credit.  The pillows are too fluffy and cheap.  Beds are old and the springy.   So dusty I couldn't breath at night when I was sleeping.  I had to make my own pillows out of towels.  This place needs a remodel\/change badly!!  Never going back again.  Doesn't feel like a resort of any sorts.

Stayed at this hotel back in November for my boyfriend's military ball and I can say I was pretty pleased. The view wasn't bad but from my particular room (in the 600s), it wasn't spectacular. It looked best at night when the strip was lit up. 

The rooms: They come with two beds, a desk, a small table and a lounge chair. There is a closet right at entry across from the bathroom, and an entertainment stand with a decent sized television. There isn't an AC unit in the room, and it can get cold at times. The blinds are a bit dull, but nonetheless they do their job well. I didn't have many complaints about the cleanliness of the room. My bed was fresh and they kept the bathroom in good shape. There isn't a mini fridge or microwave so I wouldn't recommend bringing any food you don't plan on immediately consuming into the room. 

The bathroom: Very spacious. The sink is of a decent size and there is plenty of counter space. The shower is also spacious and has a towel rack and storage in it. Hand rails run the length of the wall and underneath the towel rack. There is a full length mirror on the wall across from the door, but can make using the toilet a bit weird due to placement.

In general: Of course, slot machines are everywhere. It's Vegas. Once you enter you're surrounded by slot machines and a few stores. The food court has pretty decent selection, options including American, Asian and Italian. A more upscale restaurant is located inside as well. We weren't able to access the pool, as it was closed at the time. I'm not certain if cigarette smoking is actually allowed in the casino area, but it definitely wasn't discouraged. 

If you want a more reasonably priced hotel for your trip, I suggest looking into this one. It was a comfortable stay, the staff was friendly and things were always lively in the lobby. Access to the strip is quick and easy as well which makes things even more convenient. Caesars Palace is right within walking distance, for those that love a good mall trip.

The few times I have been to Vegas, I like staying at Bally's. It's not very expensive, and mostly because of it's fabulous location!  It is right in the heart of the Las Vegas strip.  With the Bellagio right across the way, Caesar Palace diagonal, The Venetian next door, and the Wynn only a block or so away, it is an awesome location!  

The rooms are standard, nothing to really rage about.  You get what you pay for.  However, just my luck that the times I have been there, I'm been upgraded...not once, not twice, but three times!  Yep, that's right.  I found myself in the Celebrity Suite, which can mean different things, depending on what tower you stay in.  And yes, the North Tower is newer.  I have stayed in both towers and been in the Celebrity Suites in both towers too.  The South tower had a larger room, but the North Tower had newer furniture.  You can't help but love it when you find yourself with a king size bed, a hot tub, a steam room, and a separate living room\/dining room\/wet bar.  I even found a gym in one of my rooms!  Yes - a gym!  

Although the last time I didn't get the Celebrity Suite, I still found a bidet in my room.  I mean, the last time I saw a bidet was in France!  Fancy that! 

The view from my rooms have ranged from the water show at the Bellagio to the Barbary Coast hotel on the other side. It just all depends on what you really want.

And no, I am so not a gambler!  It's just my luck that the front desk wanted to upgrade me!  So, I think the front desk staff is fabulous in my book!  Be extra nice to them, and don't forget to tip when they do help you out!  After all, they are doing YOU a favor.  

Side note: If you're flying in, you can actually check in and get your hotel key at the airport.  They have a section by the baggage claim for you to skip the lines at the hotel and get your keys there.  This can save you tons of time so you can hop on up to your room and get ready to party quicker.  (Then again, the chances of getting upgraded at the airport are less likely in my opinion.  I've always been upgraded when checking in at the actual hotel.)

And remember...what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas!

After arriving from my flight, which was delayed, I arrived at Ballys for my 6 day stay only to find out they had given my room away. Instead of upgrading me they downgraded my room. I was so upset. I was in town to get married and celebrate me and my fiancée's  birthdays. Big events in someones lives but do you think Ballys cared, NO!! Being in that downgraded room really sat me back two days with my wedding arrangements. I did end up getting my room, which was pretty lackluster. It was really in need of some upgrading. The bed was hard and the shower pressure was low. Also, while there we decided to try our luck at the slots. While playing slots a waitress came to me and asked if I wanted a drink, I said yes. I never got my drink and this happened to me twice. Needless to say I will never be staying here again due to their lack of customer service.

Meh.

In full disclosure, I stayed here completely free due to a hotel offer. I really can't complain too much about the place considering I didn't pay them for any of their services. That said, this is Yelp... The only place in the world where someone can complain about something free not being good enough. So here goes.

The rooms are okay in the jubilee tower. Peeling wallpaper notwithstanding, I can't complain too much about the room, though I was secretly sad inside that I didn't get an upgrade at check-in.

Speaking of check-in, the diamond check-in line was closed when I arrived, so I had to wait in the Platinum line. I guess keeping a higher status is only beneficial during banking hours.

Now let me tell you a little story about being almost 30 and not looking like it. I got ID'd SIXTEEN TIMES (No exaggeration in the least) on the casino floor in ONE day. I mean, I get it. Gaming laws are pretty strict. Kids probably try to gamble all the time. But it really cuts me to have to pull out a card, hand it to a person, then hear "Wooow, you look so young!" Sixteen. Times. in. One. Day. I kept swearing I'd tell the next person to say that to me "Wow! You look so old!" One particular cocktail waitress was probably so sure she'd caught an underage gambler at a video poker machine that she walked up to me with a rude, angry-mother tone and literally yelled "I need to see your ID right now!" at me. She actually forced me to stop playing my machine while she looked my ID over and scrutinized it. Then when she realized she was wrong, she threw my ID on the machine and walked off without even taking my drink order.

The next day the air conditioning died on the casino floor for about 8 hours. It wasn't a pretty sight or smell out there.

The pit bosses were pretty nice, but not a single one of them rated my play properly. I earned like 50 reward points after 4 days of decent play.

As a nice added novelty, they have a keno parlor with nice keno attendants (I know it's stupid to play, but I still love it). The best part is they always remembered me, so they didn't check my ID over and over. And as luck would have it, I actually won about $250 at it!

In-all, it's not the best place on the strip by a long shot. But if you're looking for a place with less excitement\/noise\/action on the floor, it's a decent choice.

Also, the hotel charges for Wifi. Even family-owned bed & breakfasts in the middle of nowhere in Italy don't charge their guests for Wifi. Seriously.

-Great for the price, and right in the middle of the strip. 
-$13 All-You-Can-Eat breakfast at the cafe. Long line, though. Very cheap compared to others.
-$2 margaritas, tequila shots, and burritos during happy hour, right next door to the cafe. Great for those on a budget.

I've stayed here, twice, and both times gave me a wonderful experience. I'm not picky when it comes to appearances, but if that's your thing then you might be a bit disappointed; a few vomit stains, cracks in the paint, etc. Nothing new to a hotel that's been around for a while.

My friends and I checked in on a Thursday afternoon and the line was terrible. We waited for almost an hour, and despite the dozens of impatient, rude people, the staff did their best to remain open and helpful.

The smoke in the casino seemed heavier than the other hotels, even when you're just walking through. Very friendly staff working the tables, though. 

There's a smoothie stand called "Evening Call" downstairs in the casino, while on your way to Paris. $12 for a decently-sized cup that you can bring back and refill for $8. I loved it.

All in all, not a bad place to stay.

Great affordable hotel on the strip. Everything is clean. Also, it is connected to the Paris hotel. There are free shuttles to the rio, which is great if you want to go to the buffet. Although, the North tower is MUCH more modern than the south tower.

Well it's Vegas..if you know what your doing, your not only having fun doing it but you'll be getting away w\/ it too!! The room views were great.. front desk mail and key really helped me out.. front desk is great!!lol.. She was a sweet lady don't remember her name as I forgot just like everything else but she was a SWEETHEART!!.. she checked me in, chatted.. asked me what type of work I do..smiled, handed me my cards and said "have fun".. don't get into trouble!!!.. that I do remember. Lol.. 
The only reason I cannot give Bally's a total 5 even though I swear I'm tempted.. is because there are or we're a lot of wear and tear issues in the room ..stayed on the 24th floor, everything clean, in order, chill.. room was hot at first..turned AC on ..
it's Vegas!!
I had 4 small pillows on my bed..? That was weird but meh.. the TV was and older one... ummm wear and tear in restroom for sure.. balcony locked.. ppl can be idiots and fall I guess...Food was great.. Mexican place downstairs had good late night tacos.. the steaks.. you have to try!! Twice..!!Yes!!
Would I recommend .. yes!! Definitely., I mean in the middle of the strip.. Bally's your Great!!
Need to do some upgrades.. but I get it when you don't sleep you don't have time..but, definitely should start in the 2460's side if you do.. ;)
Thanks for a good time guys.. your great!!
Ohhh The gym is cool w\/ the Spa.. pool awesome!
The link to Paris.. even better!!!!!

Stayed for a RV convention in the casino is the prominent attraction inside the resort the pool is really good if you can even find it somewhere inside the building the staff seems pretty nice but the front doorman and keep it totally wrong directions on how to get to Wall burgers and sent us around the corner in the op. cit. direction very clean and nice  resort but you can smell the smoke all over the casino rooms are OK but nothing special. The casino machines seem to be a little bit do you even know they do do nice payout. One of my colleagues was able to win almost $500 on the penny swap machines.

Darryl the night manager. Thank you for all the disrespect. I have called 6 times for an extra bed and have been ignored each time. The first and last time I have will stay at this disrespectful hotel. I HATE this hotel and will never recommend it. I'm glad I am a player club member and paid in advance for them to ignore me. I checked in at 3. Called at 315 when I got to the room. Again at 6. Again at 8. And when I came back from dinner at 11 where I was placed on hold for half an hour. I HATE THIS HOTEL.

I don't know why I really like this place. Is it the location near Paris and even better Caesars. Or maybe it's an understated casino in the middle of the Strip. I like the fact that you can park in the Paris parking lot and walk to Ballys and its all indoors. That's cool that they're adjacent to one another. Another thing that's cool is that there is a Sbarro that's downstairs.

What Ballys doesn't have working for them is that its not a young people's resort. Not super hip bars nor super hip clubs. The pool's not that great either. It's a budget option for a room, then you'll probably hit PLanet Hollywood and Caesars if you want to go out. So it's good in that respects. Ballys is really old school. It's kinda like the Stardust or Riviera on the middle section of the strip.

If you want a cheap or even comped place to play. Get a Harrahs card, play it, get your points and one of the best places to get a comped room is Ballys. It's right there on the strip. Even though it's been passed in features by other resorts close to it, Ballys is still a good bargain.

Our guy friends stayed here since they had it comped. It was exactly what they expected as well as what I expected, room wise. It's very basic and nothing special. Like they say, you go to vegas and you have a room to sleep, shower and s#it. Exactly. The good thing about Bally's is that it is connected to Paris so you can conveniently walk right over.

The room was nice, but getting to and from your room was impossible.  Apparently Def Con was going on, so it took forever to get on an elevator.  There were only a few elevators working for more than 10,000 people (per a Def Con member).
Excellent staff and location, but beds uncomfortable, couldn't sleep, hard mattress. This hotel needs some updating, not all the Heathers work and the fans in the bathrooms don't function at all.

Beautiful hotel on the strips, very comfortable and elegance, we stay here in spring break with some friends on 2015 for our wedding in Vegas, rooms are clean and spacious. 
Two years latter, again for spring break, we came back, we still have the same good experience staying here.

Hey, I'd love to stay at the Wynn, but I am in college. Since you spend like, zero time in your hotel that you aren't sleeping, why shell out all your cash to stay somewhere incredible?

Our room at Bally's was practically free (package deal on PriceLine), plus we got a free upgrade to the nicer tower. The room was pretty huge, and it was really nice. The only thing that bugged me was the 80 year old TV. But like I said, the room wasn't the priority. 

Check-In was easy, riding the people mover was fun and for the same price, we couldn't have even stayed in a Motel 6.

For me, the stay here really depended on my room selection.  I stayed in the older tower the first night and was pretty miserable, it felt like sleeping on a rock with springs.  The room was very outdated, but large.  I switched to the Jubilee tower the second and third nights, and while the bed still wasn't as comfortable as I'd preferred, I was able to sleep and for a hotel bed I'd probably give it 4.5 stars.  The room was pretty awesome looking, very modern.  Certainly worth the extra $30 a night.
Do be warned, you will be charged an extra $23 or so a night for resort fees, which includes wifi access for two devices and gym access for two people.  I never was able to actually find the gym.
Also, in the older tower, my lungs were burning the whole time because it smelled of smoke so badly.
Overall this hotel is in a good location if you want to be on the strip, it's central to everything.  The new tower has very nice rooms.  There are plenty of restaurants (this building is combined with the Paris hotel, so you have easy access to tons of places from both).  It offers two shopping malls, and the casino is quite large.  It also boasts the strips only gay nightclub, which was tiny and didn't seem very popular.
We hate the pool and room.  The only thing we like is the singing bar at the first floor and because it was connected to Paris
Nice hotel close to many hang out places on the strip. Though a little expensive. Make sure of the prices specially if you're taking through Expedia or Orbitz.

The room was large and comfortable and the bathroom was spa-like.  The house staff very friendly and helpful, and the check-in was quick and easy - once I got to the reception desk, which leads to my only complaint which is that when you enter the property you are assailed by staff who ask why you are in LV, are you single, where are you from, etc.  Upon arrival I got about 10 feet in the door when a woman stops me with all these questions, I asked her where I check-in and she took me to a booth where another guy is trying to sell me packages for shows and condos.  I just wanted to check-in.  I'd been on a flight and was tired.  These front-door people are too aggressive!  For this reason, I probably won't stay at Bally's again.  There's too many other hotels to choose from.

I love Ballys.  It's not the newest hotel on the block - but the rooms are always clean, we usually get a deal thru Total Rewards (players card) and it is an optimal central location on the Strip.  The last time my husband and I were here, we were upgraded to a sweet suite.  Also-they usually have new\/fun slot machines (with the best bonus spins) and hands down, warmest bartenders in Vegas.  We always-always visit Steve at the bar and its like visiting an old friend.  I will continue to book at Ballys as long as those deals keep coming my way.

This was surprisingly a great experience. I originally had a standard room with a king bed. Then they upgraded me to a suite with a jacuzzi because they weren't as busy as usual when I stayed at Ballys. The front desk in the lobby was always nice when I asked them questions. Very easy to get around in this casino unlike some of the larger casinos. Overall, a great price for a hotel room on the strip.

I stayed at this hotel for my birthday :D.
11\/20-11\/23
We used the "Preferred Perks" promo code directly from Bally's website which gave us free early check-in and late check out if available as well, as a room upgrade but that last one was a lie -.-. 
Let's be honest that was needed. Since I live on the east coast...check in at 4pm from an early 6am flight was a no bueno. 
So with this, early check-in, free of charge which would normally be $40.00 I was elated. Since this is Vegas, I wanted to save money on the room. I want to spend what I saved shopping. When we arrived, at 11:30am since that's the time that early check in can be done..the line was pretty long. The customer service rep told us how in order to get a room upgrade we needed to pay $15 extra dollars per night. Now, I know what you are thinking that's only $50 dollars more....but it's not about money it's about the principle. In my eyes, that should be considered false advertisement. I didn't like the fact that the casino, which was smoke filled needed to be walked through just to get to your room. The ventilation here sucks on the lobby floor. If you don't believe me, walk through the Bellagio casino....nice clean air. Anywho,  I stayed in the Indigo Tower and it was very basic. Nothing fancy. No iron when I arrived. I had to request one. No biggie! I liked the free valet service. Please be sure to tip! 

Pros: Location ie: on The Strip and price...minus resort fees -.-
Cons: The haggling staff trying to sell you show tickets

Would I stay here again....only if I wanted to save money....next time I'm in town I'm definitely going to splurge and stay at another hotel.

Pros:I Love Bally's cause its located right in the middle of the strip next to Paris and Cromwell. It's a short walking distance to Planet Hollywood, Aria, Bellagio, and Cesar's Palace across the street. Flamingo and The Linq are close by too. Yes, it's and older hotel compared to all the fancy ones in Vegas, But for the location and price you cant beat it! The rooms are a little outdated but they were clean, which is the most important thing to me.

Cons: The check in line for your room reservation is way too long and they usually only have 3 employees helping at a time. (Self Check in is easier and faster) Another thing is, we put the do not disturb sign in front of our door since we were there for memorial day weekend and 2 times house keeping knocked and decided to open our door!??? Really??. Luckily we had the security bolt to the door on. After that happened I had to report it to the front desk to tell them to tell housekeeping NOT TO EVER DO THAT AGAIN! for my privacy! Other then that issue,....

I will continue to stay at Bally's whenever i'm in Vegas.

stayed here twice before and now, this place appears to be deteriorating.  Carpet is dirty and customer service is poor.  This hotel is now "nickeling and diming" their guest by charging resort fees and early check in fees.  I've never heard of an early check in fee before.  If the hotel has a room ready, why can't they just accommodate the guest.  that really put a bad taste in my mouth.  I guess it's time to start looking for a new place to stay when I come here to visit.

On the one hand, this hotel is aging and in need of updates throughout. On the other hand, for as much time as we spent in the room or casino it didn't really matter.

The main things this hotel has going for it are the relatively decent rates and its location on The Strip. It's connected to Paris, which has some good restaurants and a more appealing casino than Bally's (a little newer and less depressed). Plus it's across the street from Caesars and The Bellagio. 

At checkin my husband asked if there were any upgrades available and we got a jacuzzi suite for the price of a king room, but that's where the benefit ended. The room we got was run down, had no view, the A\/C struggled to cool the room, the curtains were broken, one of the lamps was broken, the doors on the entertainment center were broken... It was not a great room, but considering that we spent no more than 15 hours in the hotel over the weekend, it wasn't a big deal.

If you're looking for a luxurious experience, you will not find it at Bally's. If you simply want a (relatively) clean room and a bed to sleep in, this is your spot.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  I'd been to Vegas dozens of times in the past and never gave Bally's a look.  I had already decided that it was one of those "old vegas" hotels and that I wouldn't like it.  So when my husband was put there on a business trip, and I joined him, my mind was completely changed.  The rooms are nice, also really quite large.  The staff was great, very friendly, however some of them were pushy when it came to add on's.
The casino itself was nicely appointed with all the popular table and slot games, although I feel like the air filtration system needed an upgrade, as it was very smokey no matter what time of day.  
The hotel had direct access to Paris and all that casino has to offer without going outside.  
Starbucks in the new outdoor mall directly in front of the hotel.  The rest of the stores seemed filled with a lot of junk, nothing spectacular.  There was a Buca di Beppo attached to the main casino, that offers family-style Italian dining.

Dude... fuck it. Shelter and a place to crash after a crazy ass night of partying sans inhibitions!

What more do you need from a hotel room in Vegas? RIIIIGHT!?

Cheap... spacious... great location... AND THE POOL ISN'T CROWDED like the other crazy ass hotels on the strip. I loved it!! My girlfriend and I were at the pool the moment we awoke everyday... They play great music and serve yard long drinks!!! Getting shitfaced at the pool is the best feeling on the planet.

We got upgraded to a suite on our first night that was bigger than any apartment I've been in. It even had a motha-freakin BAR! 3 toilets! Perfect for yacking as a team. Deep jet bath... couches galore. Only thing was that it was on the super outdated side.

I would definitely stay here again. DEFINITELY. I gots mah monies worth here... fo sho.

Where to begin? We reserved a king nonsmoking room. What do you know, when we check-in there aren't any available but we can upgrade for a cool $40 extra per night. Internet is also an extra $25 per day per device and doesn't work. The room was clean but over priced and still occasionally smelled like smoke. We also had to call multiple times to have our bill corrected. They duplicated the internet fee for one day and tried to charge a local call fee for calling down to the concierge. Also, the front entrance is under construction so there is a lot of debris and it makes walking back from the strip a pain. Tip: eat at the quad or mon ami gabi, use the Paris pool, and get free wifi at a cafe in the Mile. I would not choose Ballys again for either business or vacation.
decent casino here and right on the strip. they have all sorts of table games and slot games. there is a food court area also by the sports book which is really nice

We booked two rooms that were located in the North Tower. Here's a quick summary to help with your decision-making:

PROS:

- Location! Pretty central on the strip. PH, Cosmo, Bellagio in walking distance. 
- Price! I've seen good deals recently for this hotel, which is why we booked it.
- Starbucks is located between North and South tower

CONS:

- Casino floor: compared to others (Cosmo, Aria!!) this casino is pretty rowdy and noisy. Not really a good impression for first timers that need to make their way through the floor to the lobby.
- Rooms: While the room size and bed comfort was okay, some rooms seem dated and the carpet smells like smoke although it's clearly a non-smoking room
- You also might need some patience to get the room keys to work

Nothing fancy, would stay again due to the location.

House keepers threw away my only contact case and solution. Instead of simply replacing it they sent to security to my room to do a report and refused to get me a new case. Oo and all of this happened at 11:30 PM when I had to get up early the next day to work. Highly recommend no one stay here, horrible service and could care less about their customers.

At Bally's and our first experience checking in was with Judy Hagarty. Judy was awesome, fun, accommodating despite the crazy busy crowds, and yet quite efficient. Judy made such a positive first impression that it now defines Bally's service for me.  

Then Ms. Hagarty told us she's been with Bally's for 32 years! That speaks very highly of the management team to retain top talent for that long and have them still excited to welcome their guests. 

We definitely enjoyed our stay. I'd give it a 5 instead of a 4 except for only one reason - the facilities were just a bit overwhelmed by the size of the convention we were at and movement throughout the hotel and casino was a challenge. 

That crowding shouldn't take away from the fact that great people make a great business. If they retain and recruit great employees like Judy, and get better at "crucial conversations" with event planners, then I have no doubt the future will remain bright for Bally's. 

Ps - give Judy a raise, or a vacation, or something. Then ask her to be a part of your training team if she isn't already!

Due to location, value, and HUGE GORGEOUS room, I am giving this 4 very bright stars.

You honestly cannot beat this location. It is in the middle of everything we wanted to see in Las Vegas, on our short 12 hour stay there while waiting for our flights home.

We walked in to the hotel, of course we were engulfed in Casino cigarette smoke, which unfortunately cannot be helped...but welcomed warmly by some hotel staff.
We were told where to check in and joined the other 180 people in line checking in.
Seriously, there were 3 people checking in guests, on a Saturday night. And there might as well have been only 2 by the snail pace the third guy was going. 1 guest for every 4 the other 2 had.
Look, I was not expecting superhuman super speed, but I was also not expecting to waste a full hour of our 12 hour-only stay, standing in this line.
About 30\/40minutes in, I left my bf in line to find us some water to drink.
I spent the typical $7 for a bottle and returned to him in line, we sipped our water and finally made it to the check out.
The counterperson was nice and funny, and he eased our growing tension with his happy personality.
We got our room key and turned just in time to see another hotel staff member handing out free bottled water to those standing in line. Dang it. 
20 minutes and $7 too late, Sir.

We began our long walk to our room. We had booked a king bed, and we found what we thought was our room but it was two queen beds. Nervous that we'd have to stand in the line again, my bf walked out of the room and discovered we were actually next door. (Our key opened the door to a room next door to ours) So yay, and yikes... I hope other keys wont open OUR room door.

Walking into our room any stress we had checking in completely vanished. This room was HUGE, beautiful, Clean and it smelled great. Non-smoking floor. Woohooo!
And it had an in-room hot tub, shower, separate bathrooms (one with a toilet and one with a bidet)

The view was nothing to get excited about, it was the side and top of parking garage, I believe. But I was so pleased with the room I couldn't have cared less for the lack of view.

All in all. My first experience in a Vegas hotel was great enough to definitely come here again, and be happy that I did.....As long as less time is wasted checking in or out of it.

If you want to party with the beautiful people in Vegas, this ain't the place.

If, however, you want to party with the cranky middle aged couple from Ohio that is gambling their kids college tuition on single deck blackjack - then you've hit nirvana my friend!!!!

No big clubs, no hip restaurants and no Grey Goose and red bulls for you. And the sports book? Down the escalator, through the mall next to the deli and donut shop. Zzzzzzzzzzzz....

But, on the bright side the rooms are big enough to squeeze in ten of your best new crap table buddies, several ladies from the local gentleman's establishment and of course that cranky couple from Ohio....

Seriously though, this is Vegas. You're not going to see the room until your head either hits the pillows or the toilet. The hotel is central on the strip, and an affordable cab ride to the nicer casinos. If you can stand the jean shorts crowd, you could stay here and walk across the street to Bellagio and save yourself $200 a night.

this is the first time i've stayed here.  i am a platinum member so there was a separate check in area in the main lobby which is nice.  my room was comped.  i had a queen semi-suite.  if the room number ends with an 'A', it is a suite attatchment.  so it is designed to be joined by rooms on either side.  But the room by itself had a queen bed that apparently is a hide-a-bed.  there was a 6 person dining room table stuffed in the far corner of the room.  there was a couch, coupla chairs and tables, desk, sitting area, standing area, mini fridge\/wet bar area and a tiny balcony.  i don't know if the door even opens, i didn't try.  the room was nice during the short periods i stayed in there.  

i like the casino.  laid out with plenty of space between the gaming areas and large walkways.  the sports bar is big, stadium like but a long ass ways away from the casino.  as is the entrance to the casino from the strip.  a long ass trip just to get in or out.  

i ate at the tequlia bar which is mostly appetizer sized food, but still fresh and tasteful.  room service was quite good, expensive of course.  ordered the samplber platter with wings, ribs and such saturday night and service was fast.  ordered a pot of coffee and some bottled water on sunday morning and it took an hour.  
overall, i like this place and will stay again.

If you're looking for a nice decent hotel that has a fair price and a nice size room than Ballys is the place for you. I have stayed here twice already and have enjoyed my stay. The place has a casino just like any other hotel but doesn't have a good Buffett or a shopping mall like the other hotels. If you want a small shopping center and a nice buffet to attend to than there's always the Paris Hotel that's connected next to Ballys. Paris also has a nice casino environment to gamble rather than Ballys. The reason why I'm giving this hotel 4 stars is because of the price and the size of the room. Here's a tip, if you have a large party you want to cram in one room, may I suggest getting the sine King size bedroom because with that you'll get a larger room.

The room was clean, which is about the best thing I can say. Out of the five nights we were there, we had hot water for our morning showers once. No coffee service in the room. King size bed was hard and pillows were flat. The only benefit to remaining in the room is that it was in the same hotel that the conference we attended was in, so the morning commute was easy. Walking through the smoke-filled lobby is horrible and the smokey smell permeates even the non-smoking rooms. Won't stay at Bally's again.

I stayed here on my last visit to LV, and it's a great hotel for the location. It's right on the Strip and just a short walk away from Bellagio, Caesar's Palace and Paris.

When I visited Bally's it was just before the summer and they hadn't reopened their pool for the season yet, so they gave us access to Paris' pool instead and I wasn't very impressed, and happy I didn't pay Paris' price tag for a night since I was seriously considering staying there. The pool was in a pretty sad shape and paint was peeling in spots. 

The service at Bally's is pretty crappy. There is no other way of putting it. I hope they fix that up, and I'd totally avoid buying anything from their snack bar since the prices are astronomical. (No surprises here, obviously, but I think it's a much better idea to buy snacks from the many drugstores down the strip instead.)

On my next visit, I'm going to rent a car and choose to stay in one of the newer, nicer resorts just off the strip.

I love the room and the view that we had.

But the problem started at check in, 
I originally booked on hotels.com for Bally's, I chose the indigo tower suite for a little over $600 for the weekend (I know, amazing deal)
Once we got there to check in they sent us to a regular king sized bedroom (which by the way was not clean, as if someone just swung out of bed and went to check out)
After I talked to the front desk they had told me they had no suite for me to check in and that's why I was put into a classic room. They sent us to another room, and after that I tried telling them I want to stay in the regular king sized bedroom and forget about the suite, they said they do not refund so I told them to either give me the suite or give me the difference. That's when the manager came out and say "we have a suite ready" which I knew they would have and just saving for someone that would pay the full price. They refund me for one night of hotel fee (I believe it was $35), but at check out they still charged me for that night, nothing but scums and eating your money when you were in the right.

Bally's is conveniently located right in the middle of shops and bars on the strip. Our room in the north tower is great and not too far of a walk from the self-parking lot. My only reason for taking off 2 stars is the poor check-in service and EXTREMELY rude staff member at the counter who goes by the name William. As he began to help us, he walks away without saying why. We wait for 10 minutes before he comes back to finish checking us in. then he tells us there isn't a non-smoking room  available in the tower we originally booked in.  Didn't even offer to find one in the other towers until I asked to speak with a manager. He was rude and condescending the whole entire time, but ending up getting us a non-smoking room so that we wouldn't speak with his manager about his inadequacies in customer service and normal courtesy as a human being.

Bally's is nothing more than a decent place to spend a few nights.  Of all the hotels that I've visited in Las Vegas, Bally's easily had the least personality.  Our room was nice except for the fact that there was no coffee maker and the lineup of cable channels was abysmal.  Come on... Multiple Asian language channels but no HBO?

Do yourself a favor and skip the overpriced sandwich shop located on the far right corner of the casino just as you enter through the front doors.  Other than their tasty and dirt-cheap Nathan's Famous Hot Dogs, their food is kind of gross.  Head into Paris, which is connected to Bally's, and grab a few excellent French pastries at one of the shops inside.  Paris's food prices are cheaper and the quality is ten times better.

Stayed at this hotel for a business trip and had functions at two other hotels. At check-in and at check out especially early in the morning the hotel staff is not enough on-duty. They are very rude and not efficient at all. The hotel ventilation system is the worst I've ever experienced the cigarette smoke is repulsive!  The fitness center is not open 24 hours and the business center closes at 6 PM terribly inconvenient

This is just a start as we just checked in. Called at 1:56am to see what time check in was and the ditzy girl on the phone said 11am. We arrived at 11am with two room reservations. We were rudely greeted by Esther at 11:05am and interacted with her until 11:16am. We were told that check in wasn't until 4pm but she could charge us $22 to check in early. We begrudgingly agreed because she was very rude when we explained that we called and were told 11am. We were then told that one room wasn't available so we were out of luck until 4pm anyways on that room. She proceeded to charge $22 to check in early to the other room. No interactions during the check in process other than forms pushed in our face to sign. Got to room one and smells incredibly old and almost like cigarette smoke. Not even going to bother dealing with these ppl on this issue as it is only one night. More to come...

I was a little skeptical about staying here after reading the reviews.  But this place wasn't bad at all.  Our room was clean and a good size.  It wasn't as fancy as Caesar's Palace of course but it'll definitely do for crashing.  Good place if you're on a budget.

I am so bummed!! This was my second time at this hotel and it will most likely be my last. The first time we stayed, for a very minimal extra cost, we were in the newer tower and had a great experience. This time, even though I actually paid more and tried to get friendly with the check-in staff, we were placed in the Indigo Tower and the room was dismal at best. Stains on the carpet, old cigarette smell, I felt like I was in a Mid-West Motel 6!! 

It does have a great location, and the shops are recently updated out front and the casino is great, but the customer service initially and the older tower are not worth it for me to stay again.

After being placed on a dog floor  (people with dogs can stay here), of which I never was told there were dogs in every room on the 7th level BUT ours. Not knowing this, I woke up with the allergies and rashes. Lovely right? For your first day here to spent literally trying to find some type of ointment or ease to the itching and fucking constant showers I have had to take it hasn't been the best trip so far. I would have rather have lost my money than to have had to deal with this shit! 
The least they could do is inform you at check in that it was a designated animal floor.Right?!? 
This problem will be solved or legal action will ensue.
Love it here, Roomy don't let the outside view fool you its nicer inside.  Enjoyed my stay here!  Maids were nice.
