Bartenders nice and good breakfast in the cafe. For a middle nite snack loved the Tequlia bar for 2 dollar tacos. Friendly manager and nice bartenders. My only comparison is Bellagio where I did not have a good experience. I sent back my omelet because it was cold and the waiter asked me if i wanted it microwaved. I thought I was on candid camera but sadly I was not. Imagine a nuked omelet in a 5 star hotel. But the management was quick to respond and very professional. I think Ballys is the best kept secret. Plan to go back many more times.

Flew there for a conference, that was at the Paris hotel. Since the the hotels are connected, it was not a long walk from my room to the conference site. This is an older hotel(I remember when it was the MGM Grand), it was a bit dingy, and the decor was outdated. I was able to bring my wife along with me, and for the most part, we had a great time. The main problem that we had, was the check in and check out process. My work had made the arrangements and we thought that everything was taken care of, but we were definitely wrong. when you book the hotel itself, they only take out for the first night(When you book through an agency, you pay for everything up front). This was a problem, because, they would not charge the same card without permission from the card holder. I had to place the other two days on my card, or we would have had too give up our room the next day. My work did fax the authorization for the other two days, but they did not fix it, until the day that we left. I had to wait at the check out desk for about 45 minutes, before they got their act together and fixed it. They appeared very put out and even rude. I was determined not to let this experience ruin my time with my wife. We did have a lot of fun while we were there. The room itsels was not bad(We stayed in the Jubilie Tower). The BLT steak house was awesome(Although we did end up spending $300), and the strip is an experience in itself. We also say a show(Donny & Marie, not my choice, but an awesome show non the less). next time that I go to Vegas, that is not business related, I think that I will stay at an off strip hotel.

I thought it was a great idea that you could pre-register for your room online and they would text you when your room was ready.  Your keys would be at the "key and mail" line so you could literally bypass the regular registration line (the line is usually super long).  Only problem is, there are only a few clerks working in this area, so the regular check-in line turns out to be  a lot faster.   I noticed that NONE of the registration clerks smile. They look miserable and unhappy.  After waiting quite a LONG time to get our keys, my husband and I were finally able to go to our room. Room was ok, but the safe in the room was locked.  We called the front desk, waited for 30 minutes, and still no one came to open it. After a few more calls, security finally showed up with the maintenance guy. No apologies for the inconvenience.  Security guy was an a##hole.  Not friendly at all. Does anyone here like their job or ever smile and pretend to look happy doing their job??  Probably won't be back.  Rather pay a little more and see smiling faces around me!

Not bad. Nothing glamorous, but how much are you really in your hotel room when you go to Vegas? We declined the $25 upcharge for the new tower and were fine with that. The room was big, the bed wasn't very comfortable and the shower head was kinda icky and could have been replaced. They did come up right away when we asked them to check out the a\/c. The best part was the location as we were right in the middle of the strip and could get anywhere we wanted pretty easily. I'd recommend to those wanting a decent place to stay for a pretty cheap price.

Best location on the Strip, and easily the best value in Vegas. If you haven't been to Vegas before, just book Ballys - your feet will thank you later.

I cannot say enough good things about our stay at Ballys - it was excellent, and the staff were always helpful. The location is easily the best on the strip, which is why I chose it to begin with.

We came in late on Sunday night, and went straight there. The check-in staff (David) upgraded our room to a suite, and even put us in a fairly low floor (6th floor), but away from any noise from clubs, and with a refrigerator. He figured out exactly what would address our needs perfectly. While the room was not updated with new furnishings, it was very clean and nice, and it did not look worn out. The bed was comfortable, and the curtains allowed me to block out the light completely to be able to have a power nap in the middle of the day. I would happily stay there again (and likely will next trip).

The check-in staff walked us through getting our TR cards, showed us how to get to the taxi stand, suggested the best times and ways to see the attractions that we wanted, etc. All of them were pleasant and helpful.
Our maid (Rosy) was perfect. She kept everything fresh and new, every day. Please tip the maids - they definitely make the stay more enjoyable.

The location sets Ballys apart from all of the others. It was very easy to get back to the room at any time from anywhere on the strip and take a break. With all of the walking in Vegas, being able to use both the buses and the monorail with ease makes all the difference. Additionally, Ballys is on the corner where you need to cross the streets, so the pedestrian bridges are right up front. It makes it easy to get to any location quickly and with minimal walking.
Additionally, there is a huge CVS right in front of Ballys, where you can get anything you can want, including alcohol. With a fridge in the room, it made it a no-brainer to pick up everything we needed right there.

We really enjoyed going to Paris a lot, so being in the Indigo tower was much better for us. The connection between Ballys and Paris was one of our favorite locations, and housed the best breakfast buffet in Vegas in my opinion.

I'm pretty sensitive to smoke, and I did not find the Bally's casino to be smoky at all. I had to physically leave Harrah's one evening, and had to leave El Cortez as well - both in less than an hour just due to the smoking. In contrast, I never felt any issue in the Ballys.

Overall, I highly recommend Ballys for anyone traveling to Vegas for the first time.

No comps or upgrade offered, even after I mentioned I was going to play at their property. The room was nice, and clean, but my view was Flamingo ave and not the strip as I excepted.. The front desk people were not very helpful in reducing my rates even after I gambled allot w\/the TR card. Downtown seemed to have better deals, and also on food. If you are expecting your expectations to be exceeded this is not the place for you.

Good on location. Besides that, nothing entirely special. The rooms were clean and bed comfortable. The hotel itself is a little dated and my friends and I stayed in an Indigo room which I would guess to be the less modern of the two options. Also the views on this side of the hotel aren't very exceptional. We had a view of the parking deck. But for the fact that we weren't in the room much during our visit to Vegas (who really is) it served its purpose for pregaming, showering and sleeping while being budget friendly.

If you need a place to park a moving truck in Vegas, this is your place.

Seriously when I was moving from Utah back to California I did not really feel like doing that whole drive in one day and then have to unload that big ol' truck.  We wanted to stay at one of the Harrah's properties and according to the reservations people this was the best one for our need to park a 16 foot truck with all of our worldly crap in a secure location.  There is a huge parking lot behind Bally's (and to some extent Paris) that doubles as an employee parking lot where we were able to park the truck.  It was a pretty long walk from the back parking lot to the front of the hotel but the truck made it through with no problems.  

The rooms were pretty darn decent and the location on the strip does not get much better.  

:0)
Good customer service. Overpriced facility with old building and equipment. Not coming back for that kind of price.

I was PLEASANTLY surprised at how nice this hotel was for what I was spending.  On Yelp, this hotel only got 3.5 stars, but I think it deserves a solid 4 to 4.5.  We stayed in the north tower, which was everything we needed.   I heard the south tower  was not as nice because it wasn't renovated yet, but the hotel staff immediately checked us into the north tower anyway without us having to ask for an upgrade.  There was NO WAIT to check in at 730pm on a FRIDAY night, and expres checkout was so easy, we didn't have to lift a finger!  
There wasn't even enough cigarette smoke to bother me in the rooms or really in the casino (and I'm pretty sensitive).  The ventilation was awesome. The AC worked GREAT and it was central; not the archaic a\/c box that sits under the window.  They also have 24-hr Sbarro pizza downstairs if you want it.  
Very central to everything; walked everywhere and we never needed to take a cab except we took one on the way back from NY NY... only about 8 bucks.

The only drawback is I wished they had a refrigerator in the room.  That's it!

I stayed in circus circus in June (during EDC 2012), and that place was a DUMP compared to bally's.

HIGHLY Recommend this place for people who are on a budget but don't want to stay in a shit hole because of it!  I will deff be staying here from now on!

The room is not that clean for the price. My mom is a platinum member so the room were free, but you still have to pay for the resort fee which is around 30$ per night. Okay now, I see most people complain about this fee, this fee is for pool, gym, "free WIFI" etc. Which most people don't even use. I think it's reasonable for them to ask the customers when they check in if they wanna get the access for those kind of stuff before they just automatically charge you for NOT USING IT.

Had to pay 20 dollar for 30 minute early check in. Paid over 70 for resort fee which I didn't even have a chance to see their pool and gym. Should be a complimentary for guest buy no. Pay for it even though you are using it or not.  Only reason I give it a 3 is the rooms are really nice. Unlike other hotels that has weird smells and dirty. Ballys is very clean and spacious. Hallway are wide. Rooms big and nice.

I ordered a Pepsi at the bar, it was pure syrup for 3.25$ 
I wanted coffee after that but was worried it would be bad. So i went to three different areas . Cheap location to stay but come on fix t by e soda machine

I'm not a big fan of this casino, but I have come here several times to see Don Arden's Jubilee!  Other than that, I don't find the casino to be very inviting.

There have been some renovations over the past few years but it's not enough to attract me.

I really wanna give Bally a better rating. I really do. The room itself is beautiful. My friend and I stayed at the Jubilee tower for 6 nights. The tower was entirely renovated  and it shows. The rooms were super spacious. The decor was modern and beautiful. The beds were comfortable with tons of extra pillows. There was a standing shower- no dirty tub! The bathroom was spacious and clean. I truly loved the room itself. We had a gorgeous view of the strip- direct view of the Eiffel Tower! 

The casino is attached to the Paris. It's not as dated as I thought it would be considering how old the casino is. There are ton of food options there from the food court to Starbucks to random restaurants. There's a good size gym that's open 6a-6p. There's tons of cardio machines, free weights, arm\/leg machine and even a few resistance training equipments. It's much bigger than I expected! 

The best part of all? Location! The casino is situated in the heart of the strip. You can literally walk to all the big major casinos within 15 minutes. There's tons of restaurants within walking distance outside of Ballys. You really don't need a car at all! You can do all the touristy things you want by waking. There's the Miracle Mile shopping mall next door. There's food everywhere. It's hard to complain. 

So the bad? The noise! Omg the noise from our hotel was terrible. At 11pm, there's some sort of club going on next door, and it plays really really loud music. It was such a nightmare every night trying to sleep! The bass was so loud that i literally felt vibrations from my bed. There's tons of loud people screaming and random fire noise effect. It was bananas! My fiend and I were in town for a week for a medical conference. Our conference started at 7a and ended at 6p. I maybe slept 4 hours every night. I was exhausted every night during my conference. It's 1am right now as I'm writing this review. I've been laying in bed for 4 hours. That's how bad it is! The music comes from Drais night club from 1030p-4am so be prepared! 

I've called the front desk to request a room change. I've asked 3x and each time they said it was fully booked and call back tomorrow at noon. I asked for ear plugs but they didn't have any to offer. I went to the gift shop and they didn't sell any. I mean, cmon! I cannot be the only person complaining of this noise. It is seriously soooo loud! So if you get room 5519, just beware of the late night loud! And bring your own headphones. 

Oh and there's a $10 a day parking fee if you have a car. It's such bullshit. I hate it but whatever! You don't really need a car. You can literally walk every where if you're staying at Ballys. 

I guess it's the price you pay for staying on the strip!

Bally's is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean and surprisingly big. All the employees have been great; willing to help you with all your needs. Great bands in the Indigo. You sit at Sully's Bar and here the music and still be able to have great conversations without screaming.

Our main visit was for their "Price Is Right" show.  A gimmick, but still a fun experience.  The host was David Ruprecht from Super Market Sweet and E! Entertainment Television's personality Todd Newton.  It was fun, but nothing big money at all, just t-shirts and small prizes.

I do not recommend playing their electronic roulette in the casino.  Their machine had a glitch and pretty much screwed all 15 of us sitting there.  The pit boss could have cared less, I tried to make a stink about it and was treated like the tourist gambler I was.  Left with a bad taste in my mouth and my free drink never ever arrived.  I would not play it at all.

Old and outdated!  But classical old Las Vegas.

Upon arrival, had some bad experience on three issues.  Number one was we got the worst room (6th floor) with reddish eyesore view overlooking the rooftop full of vents, etc.  Number 2 was the curtain was not long enough that these water from the shower passed under the curtain and flooded the bathroom floor and is dangerous as its floor is marble.  Number three was no maid service came in and the bathroom continued to be a big mess!

I went to the check in desk manager and complained how awful our arrive has turned  into.  She was totally understandable and felt guilty and the problem that these rooms were all full, so gave us upgraded room which was very generous and I we accepted the stay for the next two nights as planned.  We finally enjoyed our rest of the stay.  Bravo!

Not so good walking through the casino from the main entrance to the elevator to these rooms because smoking were all over and so unpleasant.

Food and drinks are poor and does not have independence owned establishment, so had to walk to other hotels to enjoy coffee and dining.

Rooms price are totally reasonable.  Come during weeknights which is as low as $45, up to $109 or more on weekend nights, rate are higher on upgraded rooms, but still good price.

Three stars is it, could have been more if experience are good from start to finish.  In the near future it will be more stars if its better.  So do the work and make it more flawless!

Such a disappointment!! The desk clerk that signed us in totally lied and said if we got in line at the rewards center we would receive about $700 worth of coupons to be used while we were there! NOT! They we in the packet she handed us!! Waited in long line for nothing!
Told her it was my 50th Birthday and we we staying for a week!
lso our friends we staying there also. 
No View whatsoever!! Blaring bright lights outside our room! Blah!!!
None of us we close! All on different floors!
My sister was upgraded to a suite - we don't know why! Nice for her!!
The bathroom had the paper portion of the shampoo bottles stuck on the shelf - gross!! 
The worst part was the Housekeeping Inspector woman just walked right in our room WITHOUT KNOCKING! We were just walking out. Completely surprised! She said "O' sorry, I'm just holding the door for you"! We made light of it but it was disturbing! 
The very next day we came back from the pool and I was in the shower, with the bathroom door open. My husband stripping out of his wet suit and here she comes AGAIN!! No KNOCK!! And tried to talk her way out of it, my husband yelled "just get out I'm obviously naked-get out"!
We called the manager told him of our situation and he said "she said she knocked"! What the?! That means she ran to him and told him, no I'm Sorry or that won't happen again!! 
My husband then told him he had to go home and my wife (me) was scheduled to stay alone for the next few days, but because of all these actions of Bally's employee's (including him) she's AFRAID to stay!
All the Manager said (very monotone) I'll put you down for check out tomarrow!  WoW!! I was a manager for the Hampton Inn for years and I'm completely Insulted and Appalled by not only his lack of empathy but the Disrespect we felt the whole time by him and Employees!!
My 50th was spent in the Cabana, they were GREAT! They are Separte from Bally's!! 
Expect to be treated better by Motel 6 or Super 8!!
I will be telling anyone and EVERYONE NOT TO STAY AT Bally's!!!

To quote Bette Davis: "What a DUMP!" 
I've seen $20 roadside motor inns that were cleaner, and better shape. I wish i could award negative stars, or better yet, black holes. The carpets are filthy. The paint is scratched and scuffed. The halls and the rooms are dirty. The furniture is battered, scratched, frayed, and worn out. They don't even stock skin lotion or hair conditioner in the bathroom. The light in the shower didn't work. Nobody noticed? Or, more likely, nobody could be bothered fixing it until we complained. The light switch for the entryway is located inside the closet. I had to call housekeeping and ask where it was. 
If anyone ever offers to pay for a stay for you at Bally's, ask why they hate you so much. 
The staff is nice, and helpful, but they don't have much to work with. 
I come to Vegas a lot. I will not be coming back here! This hotel would have to be vastly improved upon before it could qualify as a rat hole. It's a good thing the lighting is so terrible, it means I don't have to look at the room. 
I can't wait to leave.

I just returned from a stay for four nights celebrating my birthday. It had been years since I stayed at Bally's and they are certainly showing their age. First thing I noticed upon arrival is the stench of cigarette smoke from the casino. Yes, I know smoking is allowed but upon entering Caesars and Wynn, it smells like flowers and sunshine. Alas, I know I'm not paying Wynn money to stay here so moving on.

The line to check in was in fact extra long. The front desk staff are in no hurry to get to you. We were given a room in the South Tower with stunning views of Paris and half of the Bellagio fountain. Gorgeous at night. The rooms are larger than average but dated. Terrible scuffs on the furniture, dingy carpet, just extremely dated. Not that we're there for the room ambiance but do better.

I would have overlooked it all had I not had a bed spread (won't call the thin blanket a comforter) with a spot of blood on it. A call to housekeeping had the situation remedied quickly. When our toilet flooded all over the floor, maintenance came right away to fix that as well. Again, we just pushed on. 

In the South Tower, you will also hear every single noise below, to the side and above. At times it was like we had a ghost in our room with all the random noises. One morning we were rudely woken up by repetitive banging like someone was bouncing a basketball. Walls are extremely thin. Bring earplugs!

All that being said, all of the staff I encountered here was very friendly and helpful. We gambled a bit here on the slots and my mother won a modest amount.

We ate in three restaurants (Tequila Bar, Sidewalk Cafe, and Sterling Brunch at Steakhouse). I will review Steakhouse separately because it deserves it. But Tequila and Sidewalk were good options for a quick bite. I had breakfast foods at both places and the food was good and plentiful. Drinks at Tequila Bar was pretty good.

Essentially, Bally's is a decent option for those that are on a budget or would rather spend their money eating or feeding the machines. We personally had the room from hell but I'm sure that wasn't everyone's experience. If I returned, not sure I would stay here. Would likely pony up the money to stay elsewhere.

Update: I posted my review on Twitter and was contacted by customer service and ultimately offered a room upgrade next time I went. Thanks, but no thanks since I have no intention of staying there again!

Tourist when you plan to play poker at Bally's in Vegas, be careful cause you might never win. There's several regular old players in the age of 60+ pretending they don't know each other but sitting next to each other coaching or telling each other to fold because one person has a better hand. It does not stop there because there's a Filipino wife of the older white gentleman who was like coughing to signal her husband to fold when she had the nut flush but her husband didn't fold because he got a full house and she was pissed he didn't fold. Normally the better hands win and you become a sportsmanship and not bicker about it but nope she gave this disappointment look and made comments you should have folded. On top of that, she was speaking Tagalog to a  dealer who I thought i trust but what happened to speaking English only at the table? I know that's the rule in every poker table. Knowing all this, I've requested for a table change but the person in charge said there's no open table when fcuck there's 5 tables with at least 1-2 seats open. So he tells me you need to go back to where you came from because there is no other seats available or cash out and I'm like i will just cash out. I will never gamble at bally's again because I don't really trust how it's being operated. I know that this is not going to stop people from playing there but I just wanted to give my fair share of what is expected if you do play there. Heck you might be the lucky person that even with the conspiracies and teamwork, that you'll leave a winner.

Well i recently decided to go to Vegas for our anniversary, and we were going to stay at circus circus but decided we would get out of our comfort level. We ended up staying at Ballys because it was at the center strip, and it was cheap. On top of cheap it was for the weekday. So the parking was difficult at first, but that wasn't an issue till you get used to how vegas is set up. Upon entering I was awarded a free roll to win "prizes" which I was an all paid cruise. "Bullshit" but whatever. I checked in with ease. I believe I got a deluxe king room in 2429. Upon entering the room I was amazed! The view was towards flamingo street where you see flaming casino and high roller. It was amazing! The windows and doors to the balcony were bolted because obvious reasons! The windows were huge by the way. They had a desk, a couch and the tv was average. The bed was comfy, the pillows weren't all that amazing. As for the restroom it was amazing! The only other negatives was that there was no fridge in the room and the water pressure was low. Aside from that we didn't eat at Ballys casino, although I highly recommend this casino, next time around I'll probably get a suit because it's a great deal.

Whenever I go to vegas, I usually stay at this hotel because of course for the location and cheap rooms.  
So when arriving, everything was the same.  Our view wasnt great but found out that if we looked to the right of us, we had a decent view of the Bellagio Fountain show.  And at night, it was great.  

When I first got to bally's back in 2002, the hotel was just a basic Casino hotel, it houses lots of viejo's (old people).  But now that is changing or they are trying to change their image.  
When playing craps on a Friday afternoon, they had reggaeton playing over the card tables.  And my first impression was "what is this about? bally's trying to be hip?".  It just didnt mix well.  

Then they had a pool party where they had a dj and games going on.  I dont know... it just didnt seem to go together....It wasnt the bally's that i knew back then!! LOL

Dont get me wrong, I love to party but I want to go to the party, not live in the party.  I just hope that not every hotel is changing into a Jerry Springer show on Spring break.
Great location on strip. Okay everything else. A bit dated and under maintained.

I just stayed at ballys for the first time this weekend sept 19-21 2014 I was a brand new customer of theirs who was given a free stay there so I have no reason to complain... but I wanted to gamble to get a good rating with them so I did and 3 times they did not rate my   
play when I asked the pit boss why that was? he said it did not happen in his section and I said it absolutely did I checked after 24 hours to give them plenty of time to enter the information, he became so irate with me questioning his section and I was treated so bad  I went to the front desk and asked for the general manager who was not in so  after writing a letter to the g.m. and turning it in, I was heading out of the hotel and  the pit boss came up to me as I was leaving to make me so mad by saying he reviewed the tape and all I did was sit down at his table nothing else!!!  I went back to the front desk gave them my players card and said never mind the letter. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I have received in 53 years.

I stayed for three nights in a North Tower Deluxe room on a smoking floor with a King Size bed, starting the day after St. Patrick's Day, and I have to say, I really enjoyed this hotel. 

My man and I are Total Rewards members, and we like to do a little gambling. We were originally slated to stay across the street to the north at Flamingo, but the guy on the phone was new or something and never actually entered our reservation... hence how we ended up at Bally's. The only problem we had the entire stay was at check-in when we were told we would have to pay a mandatory $18\/night resort fee, which would entitle us to the use of internet and the gym. (Neither of which we had any intention of using, by the way.) This is apparently a new policy. I relented and paid the ridiculous fee plus tax, but my man put up a bit of a fight because he was told over the phone that the fee would be waived for us. It took about four hours and them actually going back and listening to the phone call where he made the reservation... but we came back to the room that night to a voice message from the front desk saying that we were in fact correct - it had been waived - and we could pick up our cash deposit anytime. Interesting start to our stay, but I will say, it was resolved in a timely and complimentary manner.

The room itself was incredibly large, to the point where I thought there really should be more furniture in there to fill up the space. Perhaps a bigger couch and a fridge, guys? The room looked fairly updated and was quite clean, despite it being on a smoking floor. The smell was never really an issue either. The bathroom was nice, we never needed housekeeping, and my only complaint was that the toilet flushed TERRIBLY loud.

I really love the location of this hotel on the strip, and I also love that it's connected to Paris. This part of the strip is my favorite, because it is just steps away from Planet Hollywood, which is also a favorite place of ours for gambling, and houses my favorite restaurant, Koi. Bally's also has easy access to everything fun, including my favorite Vegas destination across the street: Caesar's Palace. It was a bit of a hike from the parking structure to our room, but I didn't mind the walk. We had a great time at the casino, winning and then ultimately losing all our money at Blackjack. Drink service was pretty good and consistent in the casino as well. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants here, and it was too cold to use the pool. Next time!

Had high hopes for this place. Booked from their website.  Got in on Friday late. Room was great.  Nice decor comfortable bed.. we weren't able to go to sleep  until 430 am. Right next door blazing till 4am was the Drai  outside dance floor at the Paris. Our room was looking right over it and all the bass and music was absorbed by our building. Absolutely impossible to sleep.  Called down to desk and we were told " Yes thats the problem we are so sorry?" No other rooms available.  So we gutted it out and slept till 1030 or do. Horrible night sleep.
In the morning we called and offered a King Master in the old tower away from the music. It was the 1980s...expected to see Robert Deniro knock on our door. When we spoke to desk agent she admitted it is a problem.  Gave us the room as at same price. No offer of comp, no discounts. Just sorry.
Bottom line DO NOT STAY HERE!

Safe broke and I'm waiting nearly an hour for someone to come open this piece of junk in the middle of the night. I was told I would be in a renovated non smoking room and they put me in an old smoking room! Asked that they open the sliding door to air it out and they said no... Turns out that's a lie and I ended up switching rooms. Within 48 hours they've asked to switch my room twice... This place totally sucks and I will never ever ever stay here again. And resort fee... What resort? I've stayed at motels with better customer service 

Update just showed up one hour later and didn't bring anything to open the safe .... 

She'll be back I'm told...

F the front desk manager. Michael told me  upon check in that I would get a complimentary upgrade and the only thing I'd owe upon checkout was the resort fees.i signed a paper stating that. Upon checkout I was charged 189$ a night for that up grade and that jerk off could care less. He said he talked to his boss and they couldn't do anything it! I'm filling a dispute with my credit card and,sending them the original one and only . They will not cheat me out of money. " Until we get the check in slip and talk to Michael the total stands" I left my phone number there never gonna call me back I know it for sure and I basically haveto cry to my credit card to get help because they couldn't even honor my original reservation. The complimentary upgrade was very nice of the front desk! Don't you think if I would have saw 680 some dollars on the estimated total charges that I would have,signed that paper or even took that room???? HELL NO! We (myself and family) spent over $15,000 in there casino in the 3 days we were there. I guarantee I'm never going to a total rewards casino again! Ever! 10 years and I'm cutting the cord. Done! 

DON'T TAKE AN UPGRADE AND GET CHARGED IN THE END. EVEN IF I DID RESPOND TO THE EMAIL by accident which I don't remember doing! I should have been informed that I'm  PAYING FOR AN UPGRADE UPON CHECK IN!. The paper I signed said about $98 or so for resort fees and that's it... funny how THEY CAN'T\/WON'T PRODUCE THAT PAPER WITH MY SIGNATURE ON IT AND ARE TRYING TO BONE ME!

We ordered a two bed room. They gave us a king one bed. We went to fix it. The charged us a few of $22.50 for a "room switch" and then another $23 for the "upgrade" which is a mandatory fee to use the gym and spa even though we were staying one night. Our rooms wall paper was stained and peeling by the fire sprinkler inside leaking. Two of the lamps didn't work. Just terrible all the way around. Never coming back here again.

I originally booked my stay in Vegas here at Ballys.  After check in I went to the room and I couldn't believe the bad odor of cigarette smoke.  I called the frond desk and they seemed put out that I wanted a different room.  After waiting two hours I told them that I was canceling my stay and decided to go to a different hotel Casino.

Was threatened to have my car towed because I stepped away for no more than two minutes to look for the valets. Had a 30 minute wait to check in. Despite what the website and signage tell you it costs $22 to use the gym. It's the year 2014 and WiFi costs $15 a day. Shampoo but no conditioner. Oh and when I walked into my room for the first time there was a blueberry in the bathroom sink. All in all Bally's made for a genuine WTF experience. With all the options in Vegas I say anywhere but here.

My husband and I recently stayed at Bally's for the first time. Like many of you I read through some of the reviews and well they left me feeling very apprehensive about our anticipated stay. Our first impression of Bally's was the friendly and very helpful and courteous valet and bell hop. Then we proceeded to checkin and there we were helped by Lorna. Lorna was amazing and helped ease my mind. Bally's let me reassure you that Lorna is a valuable and important employee. She is professional, knowledgeable, courteous, and a great listener. Our room was located in the jubilee tower which is in the most recently renovated rooms. The room far exceeded my expectation. The view was phenomenal and the room was very well serviced by housekeeping. The bed was fantastic helped provide a restful night's sleep. All in all we had a great experience and I would not hesitate to stay at Bally's again as matter of fact I just booked a 5 night stay. Thank you Bally's for providing us with a fantastic stay see you in March

We stayed in the North Tower (more updated area than the rest of the hotel) and got upgraded to a Junior Suite after a few glitches at the front desk. Room was clean and better than expected; although I would say that for a Suite, it was more comparative to a general room at the higher end hotels such as Palazzo\/Venetian or Aria. Room included a sofa, dining table, flat screen with bar area (which eventually the sink backed up, see below). Bathroom was decent and there was a vanity area for the ladies. 

Quality of towels in bathroom was minimal and for a suite, it would have been nice to have a robe and slippers, but we didn't get that. The shower and toiletries was basic. Overall, the room served its purpose.

One night we came back from a night out and noticed about 2 cups of black GUNK and GLOB in the bar sink. Gross. We were told it was caused from a backup in someone's else room. He picked up the nasty black glob and we waited for 30 minutes for housekeeping to come and clean it and got too tired to wait up afterwards. They were supposed to clean it up the next day but housekeeping missed it until we called and complained again.

Casino has a variety of slot themes including Michael Jackson, Elvis, Monopoly and more. Good variety of tables and the people are nice that work at hotel. Good and easy access to Paris hotel and the Rewards program works at multiple hotels.

Overall, compared to other places on the Strip, I wouldn't select this location as a first choice and would hesitate at selecting Bally's as a place to recommend to friends and family. However, I would give it an A-OK.

I recently came to Vegas and it was my first time staying here and I would have to say I was pretty impressed since it seems like everyone usually has some type of issue. First of all checking in was very quick (1 minute) just like all the other Caesar resorts. Second the room was very nice and clean. I had the jubilee room with a Strip View (Eiffel tower). Overall, I was satisfied with my 3 day stay.

Stayed here for a quick weekend trip to Vegas with some friends. This is probably one of the best locations so we figured we will stay here , and the price was too good to turn down compared to other hotels .  Our room was spacious, somewhat clean, but clearly outdated. Carpet and wallpaper had stains and marks on it, and I don't think the furniture such as the couch has been really cleaned because it had that old smell . Pillows was clearly old because you all feel all the broken fillings inside and it didn't quite fit the new pillow cases. Overall I would compare it to a decent best western, but again it's very inexpensive to stay here and its a great location on the strip.

I struggle writing this because 1 star is more than I would rate the service received here let me begin - Before you even check on you are ambushed by people on the hotel trying to sell you timeshare stay clear unless you want to loose $50 for nothing !!!! Service from reception anything you ask for WILL BE MADE as difficult as humanly possible for you !! Then if you are even thinking about having a wedding make sure your friends and family DONT SEND you wedding cards to the hotel because if they do they will charge you for accepting a piece of mail which has already had P&P paid !!! The maid has been only friendly staff member encountered during our stay ! Overall disappointed would be an understatement rude staff if you can't handle the number of guests you have reduce the number of rooms you are renting out !!

This is where me and my boyfriend stay during our annual Vegas trips.On our last trip in March of this year, the lady at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. She also told us Bally's does a FREE shuttle to the Rio and some other affiliated hotels. 

I didn't check out the pools, but Bally's guests also get free access to the Paris pool. I love how there's a small, casual food court (Johnny Rocket's, Sbarro, etc.), it's connected to the Paris hotel, it's pretty decently priced, and the rooms are clean and spacious. It's located in the PERFECT spot on the strip with a short walk to places like Carnaval Court, Caesars, and Planet Hollywood.

Rm 1825 great size room. Really liked the bathroom etc. Great place to stay. And prime location.  Best of several worlds stayn at this hotel. Big pool just a lil boring. No need to fight over where to sit. Well I guess it depends on what ur n the mood for. If u want to sun bath, read a book n relax then this would be a great pool;+)
I will definitely stay here again.
Btw this hotel is one of my top 3 hotels

Got robbed and management won't help. I'm fact they made us run in circles for two weeks after the incident just for them to tell us that they won't compensate us for any of our lost goods. 

Management would tell us to talk to security and secuity would tell us to talk to management. This went round and round for a while. There really wasn't much customer support or any sympathy from any of the staff. 

I would not stay here again. Plenty of better hotels to stay at where management might pretend to care if you were robbed. And if you are staying here for the discounted rates, check out Linq instead for comparable rates.

I love you but I don't. I have great memories here from last year when I came up with my friends but then again you just cheated me out of $40! Cruel Cruel Cruel.
The location is great and their rates are really affordable. The older tower has pretty outdated rooms so we always make sure to ask for an upgrade...even if we have to shell out an extra $25. They have a little Taco\/Mexican restaurant inside which I believe is open 24 hours. I've spent a lot of drunk hours munching on chips and salsa with my friends. The margaritas there are also strong...and big. I remember them coming in a fishbowl. Good times.
The casino itself is nothing special compared to the surrounding ones, but it holds a special place in my heart nonetheless.

Stayed here for a conference that was happening at the Paris hotel. Stayed only Friday night.  Parking  is $10\/day for self-park. Rooms were nicer than expected. We stayed in the Jubilee Tower. Spacious and clean. We had a view of the Eiffel tower and some of the Bellagio fountains which was cool. Shower was also spacious and great water pressure, hot water. Basic toiletries (soap, shampoo\/conditioner in one, facial soap) provided. Coffeemaker is a basic one, comes with packet creamer\/sugar, sweetener. Beds were comfortable enough, sheets were clean. Desk was large with it's own comfortable, funky-looking chair. Seating area was comfortable and a good hang out area--not just a couple of hard chairs at a table. Decor was sleek\/classic, kinda 1970s. Check-in was easy and quick. Check-out was also easy and quick. 
Convenient access to Paris and right out the door you can get quickly to a bunch of main interests on the strip, so basically great location for less cost than the surrounding hotels.

Cons: Wifi--bit tricky to use because the log-in confuses you as to whether you will end up paying extra beyond what was already charged for Wifi. Apparently others have this problem because it's the first thing that comes up on the recording when you call the front desk.
No info in the room on the amenities, so I had to call to ask about the gym. Pay heed: It's located INSIDE their spa which is past the food court and before the pool. I missed it the first time. Also bring a photo ID and make sure your name is on the reservation. You can do that on check-in. They allowed me entry even though I didn't meet that qualifications as a one-time grace because no one tells you what is expected. Even though I called to ask where the gym was. Probably would've been useful information to include.

Bellhop service was cool because they kept our bags for the entire day but the system is terrible if you're not already in the know. We waited in line for the desk and there was simultaneously a guy with a baggage trolley calling out, "next!" maybe 10 feet from the desk. We weren't sure if we went straight to the trolley or if we needed to check in at the desk to get a ticket or what the process was. My sister went to the desk to ask and received a vague and distracted reply so we just stood in line. When it was our turn, we went to the trolley when the guy called, "next!" and the guy told us we needed to wait in line. We told him we did. The entire exchange was awkward because we didn't know what the expectation was and I understand being rushed because of being busy, but this is a service business. You still have to do the job. The guy quickly gave me a ticket and put a sticker on one of our 3 bags. I asked if we didn't need stickers on all of the bags. He said, "oh. yeah" and carelessly put stickers on the other 2 but they didn't stick which he didn't notice and I had to bring to his attention. How would we have gotten our bags if I hadn't been paying attention?

The room was a great value at 80\/night. It was large and clean and relatively new feeling. The location is great right in the middle of the strip. They charge 10$ night for parking and food and drink prices are unreasonable compared to the room. A cocktail was $17 at the pool and were not talking a gourmet experience either. The pool was basic just a pool and lounge chairs.

This is just average. The drink service was poor and of the entire hr we were there no one asked if we wanted a drink. The people at the roulette tables were bland. The highlight for me was playing the digital roulette. That's probably the only reason I'll come here. Also, lots of machines were out of order. I expected more from this place.

I'll get straight to the point. The property is a bit older, a bit smoky inside the casino. However, the Property is located in the Heart of the strip, very convenient location with many activities in surrounding areas, shopping, bars, etc,.. Not a whole lot of selections on Table games or slots. Popcorn ceiling rooms. Hidden Sports Book and food court in the lower level. Easy access to Paris (next door) and bridges to other properties such as Bellagio and Cromwell which is the old Barbary Coast. Remodeled bathroom tiles. Large windows in the bedrooms. You get what you pay for with this one.

I didn't stay in the hotel part, but I spent some time in the casino.  I walked around for a little and got a lay of the land.  Played a few slots, which is basically a few wins than slowly winds to zeroing out what you put in.  Just a little time hanging out.  And time goes down.
Finally, it was time to play some table games.  Sat at a crowded blackjack table and lost six straight games.  Not a lot of face cards.  Best hand I made was a dealer 21.  Took the remaining chips I had were small and quickly put on a losing roulette spin.
Came back that night and found the tables were a little more open.  Played some roulette for a bit when I felt the spin was lucky.  Made back some of the money from the morning before we called it quits.  If you only lose a little, you did okay.  Had a great time.  Definitely, I would go there again.

Time for some new beds! The location is great but the hotel is below average. The rooms are dated but the beds are horrible. Seems like a bed I slept in when I was 4 years old and the springs were poking me in back and butt.

Bally's used to be a nice place to stay back in the day, especially since their rooms are typically larger than other Vegas hotels. My recent stay in January bumped this review down because its age is definitely showing. The only good thing going for them is the location: smack dab in the middle of the strip. 
Tip: Ask for the North Tower
Again, great location but so-so otherwise.  If you're like me, 3 or 4 days in Vegas is IT.  Saving $$ and staying at Bally's is not a bad idea.

What a horrible place to stay. We checked in went to our room and I took one look at the place and didn't even bother unpacking. The walls where so dirty holes in the furniture. The bed headboard look like it had blood stains. I was discussed all the money a hotel like this makes and they can't ever upkeep there rooms to keep there guest comfortable. So I complained and the manager moved us into another room and gave us a next day room upgrade to a sweet. The room he moved us in was a little cleaner but the lamps didn't work only 1 did. They had to send someone to fix it. The next day the sweet was no better it still looked pretty old fashion. Not impressed and this will be the last time we stay at this hotel.

Been to this hotel many years ago but don't remember well but the hotel was very nice & clean but I was really upset with the service! That needs a lot of improvement! I had a question and wasn't able to approach the desk because how packed it was and called several times from my room and never got through to someone! Beds were comfortable and enjoyed the two nights I stayed! Small fire alarm went off at 4am that woke us but we called and actually got an answer and they sent security to check and if it stopped ringing then there's probably nothing to worry about! Scared us a little bit but all was okay so I was fine with it! Most likes would stay there again!

Awesome hotel! We stayed Monday-Thursday in the Jubilee Tower. Our room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. We had an excellent view of the strip with the Eiffel Tower right outside our window and Belligio's water show across the street seen through our window also. It was a little noisy outside in the evening from  water show and club next door at Paris but not loud enough to bother us.  Starbucks right downstairs, centrally located on the strip with plenty of shopping nearby. CVS on the corner a plus with a fridge in our room. Can visit several other beautiful hotels all through covered walkways. Great hotel for the price.

i stayed here over Christmas with my family in a party of four. It's a good and decent hotel if you're looking for something on the strip with a lower budget. The location is definitely the best part of the hotel. We tried the $20 trick (actually I included $30 to see if we could get a bigger upgrade) and it kinda worked but the upgrade to a bigger room with a view was worth about $30 extra anyway. 

There are no real perks to the rooms, no microwave or fridge, the wifi only works on two devices so I'm not sure what the $32 per day resort fee is paying for, especially since the pool was closed when we were there. We had a late check in because of a missed flight, and they even tried to charge us a resort fee for the day before we checked in.

It's a pretty plain hotel, and being on the strip, everything inside the hotel is gonna be way more expensive than necessary. Ultimately I wouldn't recommend Bally's because the only benefit is basically the location, but the rooms were clean and spacious and for some people that's good enough.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We upgraded our room for the suite with a spa tub, which we really enjoyed. The room was very nice and and the location of the casino is perfect.  We didn't  like that you have to pay for parking (10.00 a Day) and a Resort Fee (~ 40.00 a day) . The wifi is extra also, which is included in the resort fee - we didn't know this. Would we stay here again? Probably not. There are nicer casinos that don't  have hidden fees.  In the end we paid just as much anyway.

I reserved a king size bedroom, at arrival, the lady at the check in pretty much told me I can't get a King size bedroom..she didn't really give me an explanation why....I ended up getting a queen size bedroom with a terrible view; probably the worst view at the Bally's hotel..room is pretty decent for the price..getting a hold of room service is terrible..I might not stay at Bally's again..my overall satisfaction experience at Bally's is OK I guess..also what I noticed is the customer service was very fake and forceful..

No complaint of this hotel! The room me and my God-Family got was a king sized bed, and a couch. The space was huge! We bought a twin sized blow up bed, and I swear, like 5 more can fit in that room. I thought it couldn't get any better! .. and it didn't. The bathroom was so small. :[ LOL. 

Love how its at the strip! LOVE the location!

Excellent value.
Yes, it is an older hotel, but service is always excellent!
Staff works hard at making your stay an excellent experience.

Not the worst hotel I've stayed in but kinda close.  I should have known better, after booking the room for $129\/night.  My husband said that you should never get a room cheaper than $200\/night in Vegas and I think he's right.

When we checked in here, we immediately noticed the...ahem...lack of class in the clientele.  My sinuses started acting up on our way up to our room.  Our room smelled of mold and the furniture looked like it hadn't been updated since the '70s.  The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling and there were stains in the carpet.  The bedding was very threadbare.  We tried to get internet access but they have this ridiculous system where you supposedly sign in with your credit card and agree to pay for it but then they refund you the money once you check out...yeah, sounded like a scam to us too.

We immediately walked across the street and booked a room at Bellagio.  Yes, it was more than 3 times as much as Bally's but well worth it.
Loved this hotel. The room was so nice!! And the strip is right outside from this place. Great views. I will definitely go back!!! Plus they have so much to offer inside the casino.

Bally's is pretty average.  It's not as flashy as the other casinos, and it's decor is a bit old school.  That being said, it's decent for the price.  Now that I've stayed at TI, however, I'd rather go there.

So I booked this hotel based on price and location.  For the price I paid, and for the location I got, I am satisfied with what I got. 

Bally's is an older hotel that could use some upgrading.  The casino is on the smaller side but Bally's is connected to the Paris hotel so it is nice to be able to walk back and forth.  Food selection within in Bally's in okay.. nothing great.  The rooms are a decent size but they were a bit icky for my taste.  My friend and I realized that there were M&Ms left on the floor from the previous occupants.  It was clear that the maids didn't bother to vacuum the carpet.  

We checked in on Thursday night so the line wasn't that long.  However, when we walked by the front desk on Friday night, the check in line was so long. But I think that the normal anywhere in Vegas.  The front desk staff was nice

This review is not based on a stay here at the hotel.
Came here for our annual conference. We had our banquet upstairs and it was the most blandest food I've ever tasted.  The woman refilling the chafing dish seemed annoyed that we were waiting for food, the waiters did not fill up your cups with water, my husband had to go find the water pitcher and bring it over to fill up my water. We had coffee cups and they served dessert with no coffee. I asked for coffee once I found a waiter and he disappeared! So I ate dessert with no coffee, went down the street and got McDonalds coffee. Sad....

Stayed here on a Thursday night to check it out, had the rest of my stay at a different hotel across the street 
So the check in was painless and fast, the room I was assigned had a really beautiful view of the strip (the only issue with that is you can hear everything loud and clear from outside) even on the 15th floor, at 1am still... rookie mistake. The hotel's location is awesome, close to so many options, from eating to gambling.. the pool was nice as well. Dealers that I sat down to play with, were fun and actually had personalities... not one to engage in much convo when playing, but it's always nice to interact with the ones that are pretty cool.
Video is the view from my room.
This place is great. Cheap rooms. Great location. Join the players club and they always send you free room offers. IMHO the best place to stay in Vegas for the money.
Worst hotel they have a lobby but not chair to seat not recommendable one star rating not good to spend your money
Not impressed. The hotel is aged, worn, dirty, and smells of smoke to a degree worse than the others visited.

The checking in was a breeze, the receptionist was kind and courteous. We had 3 rooms, six people with a handicap man. We were upgraded to Indigo Tower 21st floor with gorgeous view of Eiffel tower and across the hall, view of the strip and the High Rollers Wheel. Fantastic night view!
Clean, comfortable rooms and great beds, I did bring my mini coffee maker as I need my coffee first thing in the morning and most hotels at the strip do not have coffee makers in the room!

Bally's is an amicable, out-dated dive located in pretty prime real-estate on the Strip, flanked buy a bunch of other casinos within Caesar's Entertainment's family of  properties.  This is definitely the next one for the wrecking ball, but our stay was fine and this property offers a few different positives which would make me consider staying again.

First off- I stayed here this past weekend with several (male) college friends in our late 30s.  We're all married, shared rooms, and went to LV for a fantasy football draft, and got really cheap rates on rooms as our draft was taking place at another (more expensive) property on the same block.  We got one room comped, and a 2nd for $89\/night.  This property was perfect for us- cheap, and easy proximity to everything we needed- adequate restaurants, booze, etc.

If I was a young, single 20-something, looking for a 'scene'- this is not where I would stay.  The crowd was generally older (than me), the pool was mediocre at best- very expensive drinks, and more of an AARP crowd than one would expect.  The 20-something year-old belongs at Hard Rock, The Palm, or basically ANYWHERE else...

If I was going with my wife for a nice weekend together- I wouldn't stay here either- you can do better elsewhere and get a more elegant room- although our rooms were clean very adequate, albeit outdated...But I'd look at Wynn, The Hotel, or many other options before this.

In summary- the good things about Bally's are the cheap rooms, the proximity to other casinos- including the direct tunnel walkway to Paris- where we spent most of our time gambling, and the 24 hour Sbarros.  If any of these things are of interest to you, you should consider Bally's.  I may stay here again, but definitely not the top of my list in LV.
We stayed in a dog friendly room and it wasn't in the best condition. The room smelled a little like urine and it didn't feel like it was thoroughly cleaned.

Rooms are big, nice and clean and it's a good view of the strip.  No coffeemaker in the room but there's a couple of coffee stations just down near the elevators.  Parking was pretty easy to get into and not too far from the rooms.   Medium sized Casino but only the Poker room was very small so we went over to MGM or even Imperial Palace to play Hold 'em.   Good Central location.  Overall not a bad place but I wouldn't pay any premium to stay here.

I have to say for my "staycation" experience, it all went great. (staycation since me and my girlfriend only live down the streets).

We were comp 2 nights stay at Bally's, stayed in the new Jubilee Tower. The room was spacious and very clean. King size bed with two sinks in the bathroom, what was nice they were actually separate, one in the bathroom one outside. Water in the shower was amazing cold to hot in 2 seconds! Beds were comfy, and we each had 3 pillows so we didn't have to bother for more. The room service was super quick too as we needed more towels and shampoo. Overall I give the room a 5.

We ate at the Tequila Bar right after check in. Margaritas were pretty good, not too bad. I ordered the chicken potato tacos, good seasoning and not bad for the price. My girlfriend on the other hand ordered the Grande Nacho, this was our mistake. the plate was the size of a fourth of the table, don't get me wrong for $16 this  a steal and could feed 4 people easily, but we literally took it back to our room in two boxes after getting through a third of it. Overall i give them a 4 start for the portion sizes and price.

The next morning we ate at the Sidewalk Breakfast buffet, thank god! Great choice, only $11.99 a person, a lot of food choices as well. The biscuits and gravy were the best mixed with some potatoes and bacon, yumm! Even had desserts and DONUTS. 
Overall 4 start for the price and selection. 


The last place we ate at was for dinner, le burger brasserie. No wait, and it was happy hour, 2 thumbs up for that. Buy 1 get 1 free beers, no specials though on food. I got the French dip, very good size portion, fries do no come included. My gf got the hot dog sliders and were also a good portion especially for a starter entree. The beer was good the ladies were dressed kind of different then the theme portrayed, more clubbing if you ask me with corsets and color hair. A bit pricey. I give them a 3 star for the service and food, would be more but a little too pricey. 


And the best part of it all we played craps all night and were up over $200

I would really recommend Bally's if you want a centralized casino and don't mind just staying close to the strip and eating\/drinking for a couple of days.

Stayed here as a guest of a VIP guest, who was comped a room. 

We got an upgraded room, which met all our needs. The room was clean, spacious and comfy.

Very casual hotel. You don't get all the hoochies\/douches dressed up walking around the hotel. You also get the old(er) crowd at this casino. 

The smoke is disgusting, but pretty much that's all hotels in Vegas. 

Bonus that this hotel is on the strip.

Pros
- Price.  First I had a room comped then I went there and asked for an upgrade and they told me it was 75 a night for the executive suite.  That is 1600 sq feet for 75 a night i jumped all over that.  Got an attached room for an additional 50 a night and had more than enough sleeping for 7.  
- Gambling.  I cannot base this on wins or losses because that is dumb (although I did clean up more than 2 grand THANK YOU!) There are always open seats and a lot of the times my group could find empty tables so we could take over the whole table.  The dealers were relatively friendly and pleasant.
- Location.  I don't think you can be more centrally located.  Across the street from Caesars, connected to Paris, walking distance to harrahs, venetian, O'sheas (when you are hammered).  

Mehs (not a pro not a con)
- Crowd.  I liked the fact that there are less younger people there.  Despite being in my mid 20s when I gamble I like the quiet older crowd.  Ballys gave me a nice quiet environment to gamble in and still kept me walking distance from the loud crazy places like Venetian.  This is all on preference though, my group likes the crazy people so it would be a con for them.

Cons
- Food.  A weekend lived on sbarro's is not good for the stomach.
- Service.  Takes forever to get a drink.  The staff is not hot.  I feel like every waitress is about to say "yes sonny back in the day I used to be such a hot number you would've dropped your jaw".  Too many gray-haired ladies as waitress.  Nothing against the older people but they just should not be dressed up in skimpy outfits handing out drinks.  I also think one of them was deaf, not joking.

Overall
 It was perfect for my crowd.  Here is how I would describe Bally's.  If you are looking for a boys weekend out, you need a place to hang your hat.  You don't want to stay at Imperial Palace because that place gives you the heeby-jeebies (yea it does to me too), but you want to stay on the strip.  It's pointless to spend a lot of money on the room because you are going to be out till 5am and be plastered all weekend then Ballys it should be.  A step up from Imperial Palace but still not that high.  Paris is a hop skip and a jump away if you want to meet ladies.  I love it for boys weekends

There for a weekend in July.  Great atmosphere.  Rooms were great.  Pool was great!  Not as crowded as the other pool parties, but lets call it a "medium" pool party scene.  Great DJ with great music, clean, lots of space.  The crowd is a bit of everything, but this hotel caters to the mid 20s to mid 30s crowd, a fun atmosphere.  Watch out $15 for a drink at the pool.  Sneak in your own.  Close to everything and in the dead center of the strip.  Everything we could ask for.  A $20 cab ride to the airport.

My only complain is that in this day and age the entire building should have free wifi to guests, especially since people are coming in from out of the country and need to connect their cell phones.  Americans don't care because they have their smart phones with local data plans, but Canadians felt a bit disconnected.  We paid the daily resort fee of $20, and that included wifi in the room only and ONLY on 1 device.  Any extra devices were $13\/day.  I think that is ridiculous.  A minor detail that makes any hotel more tourist friendly in this digital age we live in.

This hotel was NOT cheap.  It was moderate and free wifi would have made it a better deal.  Given it's not the top hotel on the strip a bit more affordable rooms wouldn't hurt.  I would go back again without shopping around if they give me a better deal, but when I go back I will do price comparisons, because the price was a bit steep.

My husband and I stayed at Ballys from 12th-14th. Check in was good but there's an early check in fee of 20. or wait till 3 or 4:00? Great. Got in early. Room was good except couldn't crack the windows for fresh air, no control of the AC in room, no fan in bathroom. I was dying for cool airflow. Had to go outside for that, happy to! There was no coffee machine in the room which would be nice just to get a jump on the day. The craps tables where fun and most of the dealers where friendly. The ladies at the cash window where super friendly too. Need some info on where to get a great steak dinner so we went to the concierge. Michelle was her name. She said the stake in the BLT steak house (in their building) was "excellent" I asked for another place as I has JUST read the reviews on yelp and they weren't good. She seemed offended I would say such a thing.. (too bad, I wasn't rude about it..) We also asked about a busline that goes straight to Freemont St, she said there was no such bus. Only a city bus. We told her at check in there was such a bus that takes you there and we told her.. she didn't have a clue and the rudeness continued.  She was a rude dolt, not to mention she was sloppy. She didn't look professional and sure wasn't in her demeanor. Isn't a concierge supposed to have info  when asked questions like "Where's a good steak house and what bus takes us to Freemont St?" Ballys either train this person, Michelle the concierge, or kick her to the curb, She really sucks at her job and her rudeness needs to get shutdown.

My BF and I wanted a fridge in our room so we requested one. The lady that checked us in told us that we can upgrade to the Jubilee Tower for $11 with a fridge, rather than just keeping our room in the Indigo Tower as the fridge would be $15 extra. We upgraded and when I checked out, instead of the $11 extra per day, we were charged $40 extra per day instead. The lady that checked me out of the hotel didn't even care to resolve the issue with my bill in any way. She had an "oh well, sucks for you, now pay the bill" attitude. Don't listen to them about the Jubilee Tower, the rooms were okay and the view was mediocre at best. The elevators suck, you have to wait for at least five minutes before you get one, and then you will be lucky if that elevator is not crammed with people. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL, they lie about the billing to charge you for way more than you intended to spend. 

However, housekeeping was really good with cleaning our room and we could walk almost everywhere on the strip without driving. That was a plus considering pedestrians walked across the streets even when they should not have been.

I stayed at Ballys for my first trip to Vegas ever. At first I thought it wasn't too bad at all. We were in the middle of everything. We were able to walk to so many different places from our location which I loved. My major issue was the customer service. We came for a work trip and our office paid for the hotel, so they used the office credit card. Ballys did not inform us prior to our trip that we couldn't use the office card to pay for our reservation with out an authorization form being filled out. One of the girls had to use her card when we checked in which was very inconvenient. They said our manager (who was back in IL) had to complete a form and send it back. She went back and forth via email with someone from the hotel who told her she could email or fax the back. She emailed it, and the front desk refused the form because they said they are not allowed to have it emailed. EVEN THOUGH THE EMAIL FROM THE STAFF MEMBER (his name was Shaun) CLEARLY SAID SHE COULD EMAIL OR FAX THE FORM BACK. After faxing it three times to the number provided in the email AND by a staff member, the staff said they had not received it still. My manager finally had to get in touch with the hotel, and they gave her a completely different number to send the form in. It was taken care of in the end, but the hassle of getting it done was ridiculous. These are definitely things ppl should be informed of ahead of time.

I am very very happy with this hotel, clean rooms, friendly employees, not to many slot machines but that's ok. Price was great! Awesome size pool. Monorail located super super close and they just opened up and brand new shopping area right outside the hotel on the strip. Usually stay at the flamingo but this is my new go to place. Very happy!

I was pretty impressed with my stay at Bally's. We booked using the Hotel Tonight app, and my expectations were not high. One downside is that they share a parking lot with Paris. So if you self park you'll have a bit of a walk to the check-in desk. Checking in was the roughest part of the experience just because it took so long. We arrived at 10:45 pm and I didn't expect there to be a check-in line. I waited for about 40 minutes and everyone around me was becoming super grumpy. They did not have enough staff to check everyone in. There were only 2 people tending to the regular line, and 3 tending to the Platinum Member line. One I reached the counter though, the woman was super pleasant. She was able to quickly give me a room with 2 beds and add my friend's name to the room so that she could come pick up a key later.

They did a very good job with the remodel. I was surprised when I saw our room! It was nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was all new and clean. There was a good amount of floor space, 2 plush chairs (that someone can combine to sleep on), mirrored table, a long dresser, and desk. BONUS: the room comes with a mini fridge! Our room had a view of the new Linq. There is a cafe downstairs by the elevators if you need something quick to eat. Bally's name doesn't hold a glamorous connotation but once you're inside you will be surprised. Plus, it is right in the center of the strip. You can easily get to any other hotel by a short walk or cab ride. I felt that the price here was fair and I will stay here again when I am on one of my non-extravagant Vegas trips.

Just left the hotel. I had an easy check-in process since I checked in online before hand. We had a good room facing off strip but it did some view. The girl room was a nice size. I was in room 809. One of the biggest standard king sized rooms I have had. The only issue I had was the last day when the elevator to the strip went down and had to walk up the stairs. Then to go back down to the lobby was also out and had to wait for a crowed elevator.

Not the prettiest looking casino on the strip, but pretty cool. They have one of the only two Blackjack Double Attack Bust It tables in all of Vegas and the Spider-man game and it's connected to Paris, which is really nice. :D

Love that the parking is free and that it is connected to Paris! The Indigo tower was quiet and the room size was great. Super disappointed in the staff (it took over 30 minutes to get a working hair dryer). The room also does not have a mini fridge, a coffee maker and the toiletries were lacking - no conditioner, mouth wash or body wash. If you are a Total Rewards member you can check in on line and then walk to a much shorter line to get your key card (the rates are better than rack rates as well). However, I was supposed to get a text telling me my room was ready and I never got one.
Just hanging out in the pool area; great pool service! DJ played good music!

We got a really great deal on airfare and 4 nights at Bally's thru Expedia. The room was actually a 4 star room but I give them 3 stars for the condition of the room upon check in. See photos. There was a bloody spot on the duvet, there was a bloody handprint inside the bathroom door, there was blood spatter on the wall and mirror and more blood spatter on the wall by the bathroom door. Homicide? Domestic spat? Who knows? There was an inch of dust all over everything. There were many greasy hand and face prints all over the picture window. There were vomit chunks residing just under the sink drain cover but very visible. The was a used chunk of soap in the uncleaned shower. This took several calls and finally a trip to the always packed front desk to resolve. We checked in after 1 AM so we let it go the first night. Since nothing was done about any of it upon cleaning the next day, I went to the front desk.  The line was very long so I asked the Concierge to get me a manager. Her response was That's not my job go stand in line or use that phone over there. I tried the phone, and after about 12 selections from multiple menus I was told to go the mail and keys desk. Upon checking there WAS no such thing but I asked the porter to get me a manager. Guess what? Not his job either, go stand in line. So I stood in line. I got a manager who didn't even look at the photos. She said our room would be Deep Cleaned ASAP and refunded one night's $34 resort fee. After several more hours with no result, I flagged the housekeeper down outside our room (no English) and with hand gestures and taking her to each spot, she did the cleaning. The good things about the rooms are that there are no LOoooong hallways, all the elevators are centrally located. The ice machine was nearby and working. Bathrooms are marble and nice. Our room at least, had a great view of the strip. Beds were comfy with 3 pillows each. Lots of TV and movie channels. The pool is nice and there's no Nazi guarding it. You can just walk out there with your bags and beverages and enjoy it. Ballys is mid-strip which was very nice. Lots of nice food right outside the hotel.

Trying to stay at this hotel was a nightmare. The website is a useless mess of misinformation. They ask what time you would like to check in (I specified 10:00 a.m.) and even offer to let you check in online. The exact words of my confirmation email said, "Rather than waiting in line upon arrival at the hotel, start enjoying your trip sooner by picking up your room keys at an Express Check-In Kiosk located at the main registration desk." Nowhere on the website, my original reservation confirmation and receipt or the confirmation for my online check-in did it say that this early check-in not only carries an additional charge, but it is based on availability and was not guaranteed. So when I showed up, the check-in kiosk told me to expect an email when my room became available. I ended up waiting until the general check-in time at 4:00 p.m. before I finally got my room. Additionally, the customer service is utterly dreadful. The employees in the hotel itself have no idea what's going on and couldn't even point me to a sit-down breakfast cafe. I actually got directed to a buffet that I was eventually told hasn't existed in ten years. The multiple times I called I had to suffer through an automated phone service. The hotel registration team couldn't help me and 4 times I got a number that led me back to hotel registration before finally someone connected me to the front desk; only to be told the same thing I already knew. I will never book a room through or stay at a Harrah's property ever again.

Never again! The location is the only thing this hotel has going for it. Our online reservation guaranteed a non-smoking room with 2 queen beds. The front desk even confirmed this information when we checked in. When we entered the room we realized they actually assigned us a "smoking" room with one king size bed. How could this happen? All rooms were sold out and we were given a roll away bed and a $36 refund. Also when we entered the room it reeked of cigarettes and there were empty dishes left in the hall way outside the room. Do yourself a favor and pay a little more for a better hotel.

I have to agree that location is definitely the reason to stay here. When I got there unfortunately there were only smoking rooms left.  I had no idea that smoke can penetrate a room so deeply that it smells like smoke for days.  There's a lesson for ya kids - think what that means for your lungs!!

Anyhoo, the room was ok.  Some rust in the bathroom, the shower nozzle was beat down and the cable tv leaves something to be desired (I know, I know, it's Vegas, who's watching tv...ME).  The point is that you are center strip, close to everything, especially Paris, whose buffet was just wonderful.

I'm a member of their total rewards program, so get comped for free rooms and Bally's is always my first choice:

Ease of parking and light walking distance to casino\/room w\/ luggage, elevators are plentiful and quick.

South tower rooms have aged.
- no microwave, coffeemaker, or fridge

North tower rooms are nicer but also beginning to show age - love the triple sheeting on beds.
- Fridge is is some of the upgraded rooms, but std does not have

Internet access is reliable , wireless and wired, however a daily fee applies $14.  

Walking distance to Paris, Planet Hollywood w\/ ease.

Pool access is w\/ ease, large area to lay out and safe for kids (abundant low depth area for them to play within.  Pool area does not offer many shady options so be ready w\/ sunscreen during summer heat!

We chose to stay at Bally's because of it's location on the strip.
Upon arriving at the hotel, we asked about an upgrade, and for an additional $20 we got a Jacuzzi tub and a view of "The Linq".

The good:
Location on the strip can't be beat, right across from the Bellagio and connected to the Paris. Didn't feel like I had to walk too far to anything. Close to bus stop out in front. 

The room was nice and clean on a non smoking floor.

Spacious floor plan and comfortable bed.

Multiple sinks and great vanity area for a girl and her makeup, there is even a little stool to sit on. 


The not-so-good:
The tile in the bath area is ridiculously slippery when the slightest bit wet, and the shower temperature and pressure was poor. 

Whenever someone above or below you uses their shower, the loud sound of water wakes you up, as does the sirens on the street passing by multiple times a night. I, however, had a terrible head cold on my trip so I had trouble sleeping anyway.

The pool was closed and construction being done at the entrance.

I understand Vegas isn't cheap, but $3.50 for a bottle of water in the shop downstairs? Room service has a $20 minimum plus delivery fee - they wanted $15 for hot water for tea?! Luckily I didn't bother. 

No mini fridge - maybe only suites have them?

I know people don't come to Vegas to watch TV in their room, but since I had the aforementioned head cold, I had to come back to the room to rest and the channels are extremely limited. Mostly Vegas ads, and Japanese channels.


All in all, the location trumps the other issues and I would stay here again (next time with no cold!)
Our suite in the Jubilee tower was great! Big, quiet, spool and a big walk-in shower. Everything was clean and very up to date in a retro styled fashion sense kinda way... We really enjoyed our stay!

Very disappointed.  My flight on December 7, 2016, originally scheduled for 8:10 p.m., was seriously delayed, and I called Bally's to request very late arrival.  Was told that they will not hold my room beyond 2 a.m. Was shuttled from phone number to phone number:  702-967-4111 to 877-603-4390 5 times!  Kept saying they were "happy to help me," but what really counts in customer service is not whether the employee is happy, but whether the customer is happy. They told me to speak with the front desk, but nobody could connect me with them.  I did not want to land in Las Vegas without a hotel room, and have to hunt for another hotel and pay a second time, so I wound up just going home, losing the $420 I had paid for my JetBlue Getaways package.  I had saved for this trip for weeks. I had a super stressful work week was looking for a relaxing weekend, and got only more stress.  Would definitely not book at Bally's again!!!
