Bally's damn well better not charge my credit card the resort fee on top of the $420 I have already lost!  Do not expect any response from Bally's.

I stayed there on 3\/20 thru 3\/22 & was very impressed. I get compd roms so since I hadn't stayed here in a long time I decided on ballys. The room (I got upgraded at no cost to the north tower) was huge & had a side view of the strip, next to bills gambling hall. The bed was oh so comfortable, the bathroom & shower were nice. The water in the shower was strong (great after a long night) & felt great. It had a seperate dressing area also. Its not fancy like a bellagio or wynn, but even 4 those of u that pay 4 ur hotel room I definitely recommend ballys.  the room didn't have a flatscreen, but really who gives a sh&^ u can still watch tv. Besides ur in vegas, why would u be in ur room watching tv?  I don't agree with some ppl's postings of the beds being uncomfortable, I loved it & the pillows were great. I slept very soundly.  Its a short walk to the paris hotel & they have cute shops in their walkway over. They also have an awesome pizza place rt across frm the village buffet in paris. Its only $10 & u get 2 huge slices (artichoke & margherite were awesome) & a drink. Their staff is friendly too. I was greeted with a huge smile by april at the front desk. She was so sweet & offered some good info, even for a vegas pro like me. All in all I think this is my favorite place now to stay in vegas. Harrahs also has nice rooms by the way. Flamingo's is pretty small & the room I once stayed in (about 3 yrs ago) was pretty old. On a last note, because I was next to a noisy street, I did hear it but even that doesn't sway me frm giving it 5 stars ;-)
45+ minutes waiting on housekeeping to clean the huge ash stain and debris on my floor.  So glad I got a nonsmoking room.

Definitely the WORST hotel on the strip! If you want rude front desk people checking you in, wrong reservations, overflowing toilets, unmade beds and 5am wake up calls with construction workers drilling away outside your room...then this is the place to stay!! 

OVERALL WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE! I have been to Vegas 100s of times and never have I been so disgusted by the "customer service" or lack thereof. And to top it off, when I tried to complain, the manager Jose (who was so rude) gave us a measly comp at the cafe! What an INSULT! It took over 2.5 months to finally get a hold of another manager (Darryl) who ended up being even worse than Jose. 

After spending over $450 for 4 nights and enduring 2 unbearably loud mornings waking up  to pounding drilling noises, one of these managers should have adequately compensated us for ALL THE INCONVENIENCE!!!  The Caesars Acquisition Company (which owns Bally's, Harrah's, Planet Hollywood, Paris, Flamingo..etc) SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF THEMSELVES!!! At least learn how to train your management at Bally's to be a little accommodating!!!!

Corporate offices will definitely be hearing from me soon! Attached with a video clip of the horrendous construction noises!

Another great place to stay like that Excalibur one of our favorites we stayed here several times and like to each time there rooms are always clean check in and check out very easy would recommend this place thumbs up was here in October 2014 for four days .....
Will be staying at Caesars Palace or five days in March 2015 will leave review about it after the state

Terrible customer service!! My wife playing the $5 black jack machine and after she inserted $20 bill, we found out that machine is broken and would not even let us collect our money. We pushed the button for service and after about 20 minutes later, the tech showed up just yelling at us. She was troubleshooting and bet our money and scolded us that since the tech placed the bet, we will need to play. We told the tech from the beginning that we just want to withdraw our money. Customers should not be responsible for their mistakes!! We could her supervisor and got our money back but not coming back ever again.

Normally I would give this whole casino a four star rating as I've here before; however, this last visit was the worst and I will not be returning to this casino ever again! If I could give zero stars I would!  

While sitting at on one of the slot machines, my boyfriend and I were interrupted by a "diamond member" who wanted to play on my boyfriend's slot machine. I found it strange since he was getting ready to put money on it to play and there were clearly other open machines around us. I thought she was drunk or maybe this was her lucky machine, etc. I didn't want to upset this woman more then she clearly already was as she went off on my boyfriend when he refused to move. I told her she can play on mine since I was sitting next to him and not playing but she refused and demanded my boyfriend get off the machine so she can play that specific machine. Then she went on a rant at being a diamond guest and proceeded to make a scene. 

I have worked for the hospitality industry for around 12 years and understand how valuable your vip guests can be as we go above and beyond for our Platinum guests with Starwood.  However; we never discriminate guests because of status. I was shocked at how this Bally's employee by the name of Louse treated us! Louse was rude and humiliated us in front of everyone by asking us to leave because "she knew this particular diamond guest and she should be able to play on that machine". I have been to Vegas dozens of time and not once have I've ever been asked to leave just because someone else was throwing a tantrum on wanting to play on my machine! Not only did Louse discriminate us because we were not diamond guest but she called security and had us watched while boyfriend cashed out and left. Even the 2 security guards said that diamond guest was being ridiculous and that Lousie was in the wrong by asking us to leave. They actually apologize to us as we were leaving.  

Isn't everyones money good regardless of your status?! Apparently not at Ballys! Unless your a diamond guest, don't bother coming in to the casino to play. Do yourself a favor and spend your money on another casino that treats you better.

I stayed at Bally's throughout the years ( Past 15 years ). And I can tell you they are really starting to allow this place to go to shit! They need to totally remodel the rooms. The rooms  are dirty and worn, holes in the curtain, old damaged furniture (chips, stain, etc.)They have been used and abused over the years and it show. So, remodel this place or bring  the place down to the ground and rebuild !!!

Considering its location, right at the major intersection with Bellagio, Caesars Palace, Cromwell, it's the best bang for your buck as long as you're ok with not the lastest, modern chic decor.  Though I hear the Jubilee Tower is much nicer, but hey for $285 including tax, 3 nites, airfare direct from Vancouver, BC, I'm not complaining lol.

Not the most fancy lobby.

Too bad about the movator that's being put out of service temporarily while construction's going on, looks like a mall will be happening.

We made reservations weeks ago for 3 rooms together and we're told that we could get an early check in for $22. We left Los Angeles at 4am and arrived at the hotel at 11am after grabbing breakfast. We attempted to check in and were told that the early check in was not available. The attendant told us to return at 2pm and it would be available at no charge, so we did. We came back as instructed at 2pm and were told that housekeeping was still working on the room and that it would be another hour. So we haul our luggage back to the car again and wait. At 3pm we return once more and are now told that we will have to wait until 4pm because the room is still not ready. So we wait until 4pm, everyone is growing impatient..  And as you may have guessed, we were told that it would not be ready until 5pm when we returned at 4! Fed up, we asked for a supervisor and were instead greeted by another sarcastic attendant who was unsympathetic and did not attempt to resolve the issue. Finally another associate told us they had a room ready for us in a different tower with a different view and we took it because we had already been waiting for over FIVE hours to check in. A second room was made available for us in a separate building, and we were told we would still need to wait an hour for the third room. We got to our room and found human hair on the couch and bed. Here we are, writing this review while waiting for a call to tell us our third room is ready..  But as expected, an hour later it is still not available. We have wasted our entire day attempting to check in, dealing with rude staff, and being repeatedly disappointed by this place. Our party is being split up into three very distant locations, which will create another huge inconvenience for us for the rest of our trip. We will NEVER return here, nor can we recommend this poor establishment to anyone in good faith. Don't waste your money; save yourself the headache and RUN (don't walk) to any other hotel. A motel 8 would have been a better choice!!

Bally's is old people, the place has been around forever, of course it's not as new and shiny as Wynn, Cosmopolitan & Aria, but you're also not paying $300 per night either, so you get what you pay for, it's a room with a bed and bathroom, you're not in Vegas to stay in your room, you're in Vegas to gamble, drink and party!

The Good:
Price
Beds
Staff
Jubilee Tower

The Bad:
Cigarettes
Club Music
Construction

The Ugly:
None

All in all, it was a good value for the room, I would rather stay next door at Paris, but if they were booked, I would stay at Bally's again. The beds were super comfy.

I would never stay here again. We came back from a Saturday night out on the town, and the valet attendant notified us that "management" mandated that, at this point, valet was for "Diamond members only." Uh...I'm sorry, what? Last time I checked, you were charging me for an exhorbant  $28 "resort fee" per night. For what? Your closed pool? Your lack of amenities? You try to justify this by saying you provide WiFi. Newsflash: I can get over 2 gigabytes of extra data per month from my carrier for less than you're charging me to use your WiFi per night. So at the very least, this "resort fee" should be optional, especially if I can't even valet park my car. Get real, Bally's.  Your hotel is so subpar for hotels on the strip.  It's run down, outdated, your showers\/bathtubs don't drain efficiently, half of the lights in the room actually work, and I could feel the springs from the bed mattress in my back.  We should have just stayed put at The Hard Rock Hotel, where we paid half the price for a room and amenities 10x better than what we received at Bally's.  This place is a rip off, and with all of the other options in Vegas on the strip or very close to it, I would definitely suggest exploring those options because you will inevitably find a much better deal than this hole. And they will always valet park your car, no matter what, because they actually value you as a customer. Never coming here again. Ever. And you shouldn't either.

WORSE PLACE EVER! DONT STAY HERE!!! do not recommend to stay here at all! Tried it because our host booked us the celebrity suite it was nice, but customer service is horrible ! We are here today again hoping that they have a better service since , and that we were told we will have the suite again,  with our whole family with children and mom on oxygen and they gave us the wrong room we originally booked and the manager basically said "I don't care" yup! This is after driving for hours!!! He didn't even care if we have children or if my mom has her oxygen stuff! PLEASE DONT STAY HERE!!!!
4:13am- just called front desk to ask for rollaways and she was extremely rude! And saying I was cursing and stuff when I don't even curse and I wasn't even yelling! All I said was they need to show better customer service and should learn how to treat people well especially after they messed up our reservation then she hang up!!! Too  bad we have to wait longer to check-in to another hotel!!!! THEY DIDNT EVEN CARE IT'S CHRISTMAS !!!!!!

no this place isnt "top of the line" but id hafta say.. i love staying here.

its in the middle of the strip.. prices arent bad if you're staying with a big group and don't mind rooming together. (you know you get some bitchy ass friends that come along and "ugh i dont want to sleep on the floor" or "theres too many of us for one bathroom") STFU!! ITS VEGAS! its not like youre going to be in the room 247 GEEZ! 

the only rooms we get here are the NORTH tower grand suites. do it!

From check-in to check-out, me and my boyfriends stay was beyond horrible. The first room we had, the sheets were dirty with black stains on them, and the bathroom mirror was dirty. So we got stuck having to do a room change at 2:30am. The next room, the bathroom mirror was still dirty but we were too tired to complain about it. However, on the second night, throughout the night, we kept hearing this strange creaking noise in the room that didn't allow us to sleep. I was irritated because I had an important interview and was not well rested for the occasion. When my boyfriend took our concerns to the front desk about the noise, the front desk agent's exact words were "well I see your second room was comped for the night so I don't really know what you want me to do about it; you should've came down earlier and said something," (at 3am in the morning?!) EXTREMELY RUDE. This stay has been nothing but an inconvience and Bally's will NEVER get my business again. There's plenty of other top quality hotels that deserve my money. What a joke.

We originally had reservations at another hotel further down the Strip but opted for Bally's because if price and location.  It is in the middle of everything which makes it super convenient.  There is even a CVS next door.  

We arrived at 7:45 am and we weren't allowed to check in yet.  We were told to come back (at either 10 or 11) for early check in. There would be a fee associated with this.  There was hardly  a line when we came back.  Francis assisted us.  She was so kind and got us an awesome room.  Better than we could have hoped for.  

We had ample space, his and hers vanities and closets, and a jacuzzi bath tub.  We did stay in the older part of the hotel so there was nothing flashy or fancy.  Bally's is not the hotel for flashy.  If you want that I suggest the Aria where your room is automated via a tablet.  If you want awesome customer service, friendly casino dealers and a good room in a prime location, I suggest Bally's.

Review is for the Casino Bar near the stairway to the Buffet.

Sorry Lilly.  You're real cute and all, and I appreciate the offer, but I don't pay for sex. It's one of my rules.

I hope you and Zoe found a willing victim, though. Everyone's gotta get paid. Just not by me.

Your pal,
Dave

I am a current diamond rewards player.  I don't get to Vegas that often due to the distance, and my work travel schedule.

I happen to have a conference in Vegas and thought I might lever my status to have a larger private room to entertain clients in.

My company is paying my room rate for me, but I thought that I would check to see if I can upgrade the room given my Diamond Status.

The host on duty, Jack McKevitt, told me that I won too much money to receive any free upgrades.  I was appalled to hear this, since the only reason I would ever go to a casino would be to win money.  I dug deeper and said, " so if I lost more money, you would value me more as a player?"  His reply was, "Definitely."

I added, "Do you want all of your customers to know that you will not give commensurate comps if they win?" He said, "I didn't say that."

But, as you can tell, he essentially did say that.

We ended the call with him saying we were moving in circles, and he said he had to go.  However, I want you to know that I only asked for some way to lever my status during my conference attendance.

This was your opportunity to get me to love Bally's and Ceasars.  Instead, Jack McKekvitt has truly lost Ceasars and Bally's a client.

To throw icing on the cake, he told me that I have no play at his casino.  So, I assume my Diamond status really doesn't apply anywhere but at the Horseshoe Cincinnati (sold to Jack Casino this year) and Hammond Casino in a town that I rarely visit.  I guess Ceasars is not really 1 company taking care of it's customers.  It's many small to large casinos scattered across the US where you really need to play a lot at them all to benefit from a rewards status. At least that's my takeaway, courtesy of Jack McKevitt.

I'll be attending Bally's in October, but you won't see a nickle of my money inserted or played in your casino.

In the end here, it's called 'consultative approach.'  I get that my status may have limited reward capabilities.  But, instead of telling me what it doesn't do or afford me (and making me angry through insulting my winning status), try suggesting alternatives.

Sincerely, 

Kerry Depew

The room was a bit smaller than I'm used to staying in when I visit Vegas and the light kept shorting out in the bathroom but the girl at the help desk was able to talk me through resetting it.

I do wish there was a tub but other than that the hotel was nice and the beds were comfy. Our view was great and the pool was very relaxing.

This is absolutely without fail the worst hotel I have ever had the displeasure to stay in. DO NOT stay here. We were here for my mother's birthday and her room had black sludge coming out of the sink. It took 45 minutes of arguing with the manager, Melissa, to get a new room and to get the first night comped. When trying to check out they charged the wrong amounts to all different credit cards, some of which weren't even present as those parties didn't attend. This took over an hour to solve. When we asked for any help in making this right the manager, Marissa, absolutely refused to do anything. The rooms in the indigo tower are old and outdated, while they advertise the rooms in the jubilee tower which have been redone. This made our weekend stressful rather than the fun weekend promised by the hotel. Stay anywhere else, the cheap rates aren't worth the terrible rooms and awful service.

I went back in 2016. The room and common areas were cleaner and better maintained. It was generally a better experience overall than the previous business trip there. The staff was helpful and housekeeping did a much better job.

I have a long history with Bally's. Years ago when I first started going to Vegas, I stayed at Bally's, and for some reason they always upgraded my room. So it always made me a happy camper and so I kept going back. I have great memories of this place.

Fast forward - I recently stayed here in the Jubilee tower. Wow. What an upgrade in itself. The rooms have been updated and are now a bright red with some really cute accents. They have been modernized - gone is the dark blue (or overwhelming beige) of the other rooms and ushered in is bright red and dark brown. They are really put together nicely - a nice modern touch. I really liked this room. 

This time, the room looked to the north, so we could see the Flamingo next door, and the ever cool looking High Roller as they were testing the lights. Definitely a good view. 

I like Bally's because I really like the area of the strip it is in. There's a lot around and a lot going on - so it's the perfect location. The casino itself is so-so, but hey, can always walk to Paris, right?

Drawbacks: a couple - you can hear a lot even high up. So if you're wondering what that strange noise is that sounds like cannons - it is. It's the fountains at the Bellagio.

The second big drawback is the casino floor layout. Bringing my bags into the hotel, from the parking garage, there aren't many ramps, so to get to the Jubilee tower or even to the check in, you have to drag your bags up and down the stairs several times. Not fun. 

One other complaint - they have cheapened up and no longer have conditioner in the hotel room. Fortunately, I had brought my own, so I didn't call and ask if they had any, but I would hate to have to buy it if they didn't. Other than that, I can say my experience was quite pleasant.

I don't really understand why this place has a 3 star rating. I stayed here from 3\/13 -3\/15 and this place is more than decent. The check-in was ridiculous and took 40 minutes, and when checking out, nobody knew where a key drop box was and I had to run all around the casino only to run up to a clerk with no line, asked her if I can leave it with her and she said no but directed me to the little drop box . Besides that annoyance, I found it to be very clean, walking through the casino floors and throughout the hotel & room. The colors scheme and decor are nice, and the hotel itself doesn't wreak of smoke and old rug smell which I really appreciate. We had a classic room w\/a king and the the room was spacious! We had friends staying at the very expensive Aria and their room was crowded, small and our view was better! The location is great, right near the big hitters like the Bellagio and Caesars Palace. There's liquor stores so close for pre-gaming. Overall, this place is nice and deserves 4 stars. Would have been five but the WiFi is $15 for 1 day sucks, and so on and so forth. Brought my tablet, didn't use it.

There are three basic levels of Las Vegas hotel.  There are the cheap places like Excalibur, Tropicana, and Imperial Palace.  There are the nice places like Caesar's and TI.  And of course the luxury hotels like Wynn and Bellagio.  Bally's hits that perfect low-to-mid sweet spot.  

Nightly rates were only $10 higher than IP or Excalibur, but the overall experience was considerably better.  Naturally, the place isn't as nice as a newer hotel, and in some ways it really shows it's age, but only the most critical would consider it "run down."  The casino is well organized and easily navigated, but of course the real benefit of Bally's is that it is in the heart of the action.  Across the street from Caesars and Bellagio, connected to Paris, and a short walk to the Venetian, TI, Harrah's, or Mirage.  There's also a direct monorail stop if you prefer that, although from the center strip location I didn't really use it.

The rooms and furniture are clearly old-school.  The desk in my room was a little scratched up, the end table had some well-concealed 70's-era cigarette burns.  But it was all very functional and generally tasteful.  Bally's slogan is "Stay Classic", and they really play that up... although the place is very comfortable and modern, there is a distinct classic Vegas feel to the place.  It's a good classic feel, unlike the Tropicana or downtown where you feel like you're staying somewhere that Vegas had forgotten.

If you're looking for an affordable hotel on the strip, spend the extra couple of bucks and stay at Bally's.  I can't imagine staying anywhere else, at least until I manage to afford Caesar's or the Venetian.

AIR CONDITIONING DOES NOT WORK IN ROOMS. I ALSO HAD SEWAGE IN MY SINK
This hotel is 40yrs old looking like 80 yrs. My first room had black sewage creeping up the drain from the sink. They gave  me new room but the a.c. did get the room cool. I requested a new room but they said they would send someone to fix it. 2hr went by so I called again asking for a room with a.c.They said no we will get someone to fix it. I went to dinner. It was now 10pm with no AC. I finsly got a manager on the phone. He said that the notes on my room said my refrigerator was broke. Final they get a engineer up. He was nice but all he did was change a filter. The A.C. was still not cool enough to sleep. Do your self a favor and stay somewhere that is not understaffed, has A.C., and no sewage in sinks. Most of all the hotel has forgotten they are in the hospitality business. Not the gauge you for $ business and forget about you once you show up. In addition do not were your money on their pool coctails they are just gross. This hotel is just behind on the times.

With so many other reviews here already I'll keep mine short and sweet!

I love staying at Bally's. 

People complain about the smell of smoke (HELLLLOOOOO.... You are in LAS VEGAS... at a CASINO!!!!), how it's outdated, too far to walk, bad view, blah blah blah. 

As far as I'm concerned (mind you I have only stayed in the new tower), I think that the rooms are some of the cleanest hotel rooms I've seen in or out of Sin City. And the beds are very comfortable. And the hotel staff polite and helpful. The location on the strip really couldn't be anymore central. Everything you could need or want is just a stone's throw away. And for those opposed to walking very far, the monorail is connected to the hotel and the bus stops right out front... and again I will remind you that you are in Las Vegas... unless you bring a wheelchair\/scooter you will be walking. Don't like to walk? Don't go to Vegas

As for the casino... it's just eh in my opinion. Nothing special but nothing "wrong" with it either. It's just not my fav place to play.

Anyhow, I really enjoy staying here and will do so again soon.

Before I start this review I will let you know though I had been to Vegas before, but I had never stayed in a hotel. Living in LA this was my first time to plan a quick trip to Vegas for me and a friend from out of town.  Plus, I decided I would rather not spend a lot of money on a room because I didn't want to spend a lot of money for one night, but I did want to stay on the strip.  Plus, I went on a Sunday night in June.

First of all, Bally's isn't the nicest Hotel from the outside, but as soon as me and my friend pulled in the Valet guys were extremely helpful.  They took our luggage ad let me know that valet is free, but of course tipping is appreciated. Great for me!
Check-in was easy and didn't take much time at all. The inside of Bally's isn't fancy or anything that special, but it's nice and seemed clean.
We got to our room and it was huge and that was for the cheapest, basic room.  It was a little outdated, but the view was good.  We had a basic room, but we could see the Bellagio from our window.  The view made 2 country girls very happy.  The bathroom was huge also which we loved, but they could use a new shower head.  It didn't have good water pressure.
The casino and bar at Bally's were fine.  Nice bartenders.  We didn't do much gambling, but it didn't seem very different from the rest of the casinos.  Even though I like going to casinos they always seem a little tacky looking to me,  but I noticed they ALL look like this.  Its just a personal opinion.  I never ate at Bally's, but instead we ate at Paris the next day for lunch since they are connected.  
I loved the location of Bally's.  We were in walking distance of the better hotels and restaurants and I loved being across from the Bellagio.  We cabbed it a couple times, but we were in heels and wanted to check out the Palms that night a little off the strip. 
The pool at Bally's wasn't impressive at all.  Just a big pool and layout area, but I didn't go to layout, so it didn't matter to me.
So, basically I was really happy with my experience at Bally's. It gave me what I wanted for that 24 hours.  I might like to stay at a fancier place next time, but honestly I would stay at Bally's again because it's not like I"m hanging in my room a lot when in Vegas. 
Also, when we left the Valet guy helped me get back on the interstate.  Some of the people at Bally's looked miserable working there, but the parking staff was helpful and nice.

Booked room, then read reviews. So pleased that the reviews were so off!!! Check in was quick and the girl, I think her name was Jennifer, was so nice!! Jubilee room was spacious and up to date, with a great view of the strip.  Not sure what the other reviewers  expect, have fun and gamble on!!!

The hotel rooms are big, the bed was comfortable, the view from our room was perfect! Sure the hotel is a little outdated, but its vegas, if you are in the room, you are not doing vegas! 

The casino was nice, the food was good, the shops downstairs were surprising. The fact it is connected to Paris hotel is perfect. 

For the price, location on the strip, it will be hard to beat staying here. If you want to spend 3 times the cost for the exact same room at a more expensive hotel, go ahead. But if you need a place to crash after a fun and exciting time. Then stay here, it's worth saving your money for more exciting aspects of vegas.

My mom and I just got back from vacationing in Las Vegas.  We decided to take up a comp room offer at Bally's.  I am a platinum member (through their total rewards program) and my mom is a diamond member.  Because she is a diamond member, the room was free, and the resort fees are waived.  The resort fee includes Internet for 2 devices, use of the pool and fitness room (normally around $29\/day).

Well, when we checked out, the lady in the diamond registration room told us we owed them money for using their internet.  What?!  It's included in the resort fees (which are waived for diamond members).  She said no, the resort fees are waived so we have to pay for Internet.  Unbelievable.  So what if we wanted to use the fitness room or pool.  Would access be denied since the resort fees were waived?  Does not make sense.  Internet for 2 devices is included in the resort fees.  We should not have been charged for that.

Just the lady's attitude itself made me not want to stay there anymore.  We will definitely choose somewhere else next time.
I abolutely loved this hotel. Our stay was amazing, clean rooms and a great casino.  we will be getting out of town again soon and we will be going back.

The worst service I have ever received. I've had better service from a motel. 
When I checked in I did not realize what I was in for, the first night was great until I called for housekeeping. I requested to sleep in and then have housekeeping come later. I did not realize later means 7 hours later.  I called housekeeping to come clean my room at 12 pm they told me they would be there within an hour , when I returned to my room at 5pm I was shocked to see that it wasn't clean. I said alright let me just call again to ask what's going on. When I called I was connected to 6 different people each one transferring me to a new one.  When I finally got connected they told me that someone will be there asap. 40 minutes later nobody. After an hour I went to the front desk and asked for a manager who blew me off and said she will call the supervisor but can't guarantee any times because they are short staffed. Alright I went back to my room to get my keys and head out. I was surprised to see a maid cleaning. I knocked on the door which was open and said this is my room I need to get my keys from my safe. She said this isn't your room you need the key. I said I only have two keys I can give you my id and you can call my last name over the walkie. Oh no I don't have a walkie you have to go back downstairs and get your key. I went downstairs to get my room key and when I came back she said she called security. I thought you didn't have a walkie. What was the point to call security? Plus the fact that your telling me to go back downstairs without being accommodating to me, the hotel guest, is appalling. I went to go speak the manager again and was met with a rolling of the eyes and saying that we don't have enough employees and that we don't need to come complain again about the same thing. When I told her what happened this time she said she would comp our room 50 dollars for food and take off any other charges on the account. I said alright and went back to the room and was met with security who said they need to check my parties id and called them over the Walkie. And then when I said this issue is already resolved I don't need you to check my id when I just went downstairs and spoke with the manager, he then told me I don't appreciate the attitude and that I was rude to the maid and I shouldn't be so rude next time. Sorry, but who is the hotel guest here? I was the one treated rudely. Oh and on top of this when I checked out the room comps that I was promised were not applied to my account and the front desk staff said they can't do anything since the manager isn't coming in until later.

So I have mostly good things to say about Bally's.  The one bad thing: I wish they would invest in a better ventilation system, because the smoke hung in the air longer here than it did elsewhere, and always smelled kind of gross like cigarettes.  The other nicer casinos didn't have that problem.

Otherwise, I was pleasantly surprised.  The cashiers were really friendly, and the dealers were kind.  We were right smack in the middle of everything, which made for easier walking in heels, and our room was totally not what we expected.  It was huge, for one, and they didn't shirk on any amenities.  Cleaning service was great, too.  The Indigo Lounge doesn't require a super long wait, which is nice, because in Vegas, you feel like you're always waiting in line.

Bally's is somewhere in the middle on my go-to list of Las Vegas strip hotels. I've stayed here about 3 times (out of 100+ Vegas trips in my life). Each time, I had a pleasant stay, but I didn't spend much time at the hotel. This place is more for the comfort and location.

The parking structure is shared with Paris. Valet is much easier, but self-parking isn't bad. Parking was free before, but parking fees will soon be implemented. The last time I stayed here in July 2016, I used valet - fast and friendly, during both arrival & departure.

Check-in took long! It was about 2am, with maybe 3 guests in line and 2 front desk employees. The process was slow. When it was my turn, I was told that the 2-queen room I booked was not available as it was first come first serve. Since it was late, those rooms were all taken. That didn't make sense to me because I specifically booked it, so it should have been reserved for me. I asked if I get a partial refund, to which the employee responded no because it's the same price. I became upset. She asked if I really need a room with 2 beds, to which I responded yes. She gave me the option of a room with 2 beds, but it was a smoking room. Since I was only staying for less than 5 hours, I agreed.

When we arrived to our room, it seemed to be a newly updated or renovated room that was more spacious and had a mini, narrow balcony with a strip view. The smoking smell wasn't too bad and there was already a humidifier in our room, which made it convenient so we didn't have to call for one in the middle of the night. The bathroom was more spacious than I expected. Initially, my check-in experience wasn't good, but the employee did what she could to accommodate me, which I appreciated.

The price & value of this hotel is good. The location is central, directly across from Bellagio & the fountains. There is a bridge that leads to Bellagio and another that leads to Cromwell. There are some eateries here & the hotel connects to Paris, where you can find more restaurants and activities. Comfort level is pretty good as well. It's not the best hotel, not the worst, but more positive than negative. You won't find a huge party or young crowd here like you'll find at Flamingo or Planet Hollywood, but that's what makes this hotel more comfortable. You can go out and party, get rowdy, but come back to a quieter "home.

I like bally's...it's a great alternative to Paris...when you can just walk through the hallway and there you are!! the Cafe right by the escaltors that take you down...i love that place...great service and great food!...lots of fun games too

Stayed at Bally's for our most recent trip to Vegas.  They are located mid-strip, which makes it an ideal location for walking around and seeing most of the other hotels, without wearing yourself out completely.  Check-in took a bit of time, we waited for about 30 minutes in the line while two staff members tried to work through a line of about 25-30 people. When we were second in line to get checked-in they finally had one more staff member start checking others in.

The room was clean and had a decent view of the strip, and like most hotels on the strip it was a bit of a walk from the front door of the hotel to our room since the overall building is huge.

They have a variety of things that you can do within the hotel, aside from the obvious gambling.  They have several restaurants and it's a great feature that they are attached and have a walk-through to the Paris Hotel - which has tons of restaurants and shows of their own.

Check out was much easier than check-in since we just had to sign off on the rapid check out form and drop it in a box by the check-in area. 

Overall: B+
We would stay here again when we go back - no real complaints. Middle of the strip makes it super convenient.

Bally's is not the plce if you're looking for a luxurious hotel in Las Vegas strip. Bally's is a very good plce if you want to experience the luxury with the cheap price. The casino downstair is good, in fact, they are cheaper than the other In the area. The service in this hotel wasn't really good. And, I got a grand suite room without any fridge and any jug ! :(
Not the nicest or newest hotel on the strip, but its centrally located, the prices are always incredibly hard to beat, and the staff is always helpful and friendly.  I would stay here anytime!

If you've ever stayed at any hotel ever, then stay away from this place.  I travel weekly for work, and the front desk, bell desk, and door staff fail on every mark.  I received the absolute worst service I've ever experienced at a hotel.

The good: Really close to everything and there are people movers and escalators for lazy bums. Prices are generally lower than other nicer hotels in the area.

The bad: The new girl at the front desk totally screwed up our reservation and booked us in rooms that were already taken. Total check in time took over half an hour. We asked for two adjacent rooms so she gave us two consecutive numbered rooms but they ended up being across the hall. Then, come 3am that night, drunk people knock on our door to tell us that we are staying in their room. I tell them that it's our room, but they open the door with a key that management gave them. WONDERFUL! No apology from management when we told them what happened. I guess you get what you pay for. 

I may stay here again, but I seriously hope we have a better experience. I think this was just a mistake but management could have handled it better.

In a sea of glistening towers and dirtbag lodging, Bally's stands firmly in the middle, proud of its mediocrity. What other reason would this hotel be still standing? Because its attached to Paris? Seriously, I won't stay here again. While the location is key, there is something to be said for decent service, which Bally's just does not offer. From the gym ($22 for GUESTS), to room service (waits of more than an hour for a nasty quesadilla? Oh hell no), and the disgusting section that is the South Tower, with its Shining hallways and mildew scented rooms, its time for a FULL overhaul.  I spent a week here for a conference, and now I know better. If you have to do it, get a room in the North Tower, and spend most of your time in other hotels.

Got a room just as a staycation and get out of our normal routine. & since we've never stayed here before, why not? 

First I noticed that NONE of the people who work here or work in any shop here are friendly at all and exude the "I hate my job" attitude! from the food court to the coffee shop by the registration desk! RUDE! if you're going to have that kind of attitude, please get another job where the public does not have to deal with your ass!

We get to our room to start our night(6pm), my fiancé was hungry so we looked at the menu in the book, called to order, room service stops at 1pm! so we head down to maybe hit the pool up(it's still sunny, during spring break), couldn't do that either because it's closed! At this point, what is actually open? 

We get drinks and extra to bring to the room so we can I guess party in the room since everything is closed! We get to the room and there's no fridge!!! annoyingly, we pack enough ice from the machine to bring to our room and put in the sink. smh! 

to make matters worse, it's hotter in our room than it is in the hallway! our thermostat is set to the lowest temperature on the highest speed! what do we have to put this on? "POWER RANGER!" the night was so uncomfortable and such a waste of money.  

I would never recommend this place to anyone and never visit.

Came here for my 21st birthday, and they treated us pretty good. Upgraded our room for free, and we had already gotten a cheap rate for Memorial weekend. 

Our room was in the north tower (the nonhaunted tower =P) and had a good view of The Strip. A pretty nice room considering we didn't pay that much, although the bathroom creeped me out. Why? There was a huge mirror next to the toilet, so imagine watching yourself go. Weirdness.

The casino itself is kind of fun. I prefer Planet Hollywood since it's more lively, but the casino here is nice when you're tired and wanna squeeze in some last minute gambling before you crash. A little bit more old school and not as fun, but it definitely gets the job done.

HORRIBLE DO NOT STAY HERE! Terrible customer at check in they gave you NO instructions on the parking garage or the room!! and you have to go down an escalator with all of your luggage because they won't take it at drop off. After 2 HOURS for check in process we are finally in our room and it smells terrible like smoke and the guy next to us is yelling and you can hear every word! The phone does not work! DO NOT STAY HERE!Asking for a refund!! All the employees are horrible and stand around doing nothing!

So the outside of this place screams 80's party.  Once I got checked in I sacked out on the bed for a minute to assess my surroundings  -- Turquoise "shaggish" carpeting, old school floral bedding and...drum roll......mirrors on the ceiling!  This place had to be the pimpest suite in Vegas in '83, but times have changed a little.  

The staff was fantastic, the rates were very affordable and the casino is not bad.  They also do a very good job with larger conferences now that they team up with the Rio and 1\/2 a dozen other properties and have 1 company do it all.

This is NOT the place to see and be seen.  It's not quite Fremont St, but definitely far from Palms\/Venetian\/Bellagio.  If there is a remote chance you're going clubbin' stay elsewhere.  If you're chillin in Vegas on a budget this place is alright.

It was a nice trip down memory lane, but as I rolled away in a cab all I could think is bub-bye, you're going to have the same fate as the Tropicana.

Better than i thought it would be. Stayed here while traveling with work. Even got upgraded to a suite, all because i asked if there was any available. Great spot on the strip. Ideal for anyone on a low budget.

Did not  know what to expect since I purchased thoughPriceline. I looked at the reviews and did not have high hopes. However once I arrived those thoughts went out the window. The hotel was great and the staff very accommodating. Spacious rooms that did not smell of casino smoke, very clean.The hotel was located in the middle of the strip, nice surprise.

Back in the day this was my favorite place to stay. It's a great location and a quick walk to some of the best properties. Unfortunately it's getting run down and it doesn't seem they are making the effort to keep the place clean or inviting. 
Super Bowl weekend and they had some sort of water leak on one of the floors. Bally's solution was taping the area off and placing an empty garbage can under the leak for 16 hours, the smell got so bad we left and went to Bellagio. 
Maybe they're getting ready to blow this dump up?

This is not luxury BUT it's clean, amazing location and the price is right! We stayed here bc we gamble at www.totalrewards.com properties in the Chicagoland area which allows us to get comped in Vegas a few times per year.

Great customer service, the staff was very friendly and welcoming and what a great location in the heart of the Vegas Strip. The Monorail stops right at the casino which is very convenient too.. 

***BUT*** you get what you pay for.. Super thin walls, you can literally hear everything. We stayed here 3 nights & moved rooms twice due to obnoxious neighbors. The pillows are extremely uncomfortable so bring your own or forever hold your peace, & the AC while set at 65 never got the room below 75 which was a little rough but we managed.

If you're looking for R&R; look elsewhere, but if you want to rage your face off for cheap this is definitely the spot for you..

We stayed here for 2 nights between Christmas and New Years and we loved it. We checked in a bit late, around 7, and it was empty...very fast. The room was very spacious and clean. I read the other negative reviews that talked about how dirty this place was but we went for it because the room was so cheap on hotels.com. We found absolutely nothing wrong with our room. It was probably one of the cheaper rooms, being in the indigo tower, but it was big and roomy. The bathroom was modern and clean. The location of the hotel is perfect. You don't even need to ever leave. You have 2 giant casinos connected by a tunnel that's filled with stores and restaurants. We loved our stay and if we can find a deal in the future, we'll come back for sure!

We've been coming and staying at Bally's the past 13 years. I've been a big advocate given it's location on the strip, reasonable prices, and friendly staff. However, I doubt we will be staying at Bally's again given our last trip. Not only was the service lackluster - the staff seemed miserable, from everyone from the bartenders to the dealers - which made it the opposite of pleasurable for the guests. This is in contrast to past years, so have to assume there was a change in management. Additionally, they got rid of our favorite slot machines!!! (Willy Wonka, Batman & Robin, Gremlins, Monopoly - so we went to other casinos to find them.)  But the biggest reason is that, for the first time, I felt UNSAFE staying at Bally's. 3 times over the weekend I was approached\/harassed by strangers in the Bally's casino, in the early hours of the morning, while playing slot machines:

- Incident #1: approached by 2 black men, one on either side of me, while playing near the Buffalo slots at the wall. One was in his 20s and the other in his 40s. Initially, the younger man asked for a cigarette and thought was just being friendly. But then his partner joined and they were drilling me with questions, until eventually they asked if me or any of my friends wanted to buy drugs. After saying no thank you and them not leaving, I finally cashed my play and walked away. That said, the casino is not that big and I had no idea if they stuck around of not.

- Incident #2: approached by a man of middle-eastern descent in his late 30s\/early 40s by the slots on the upper level; I was playing the Picnic one. He sat down next to me and started asking if I was single. When I showed him my wedding ring, he would not leave and proceeded to ask if I wanted to leave with him. Disgusted, I got up and walked away, but again, he creepily hung around the slots so I just left.

- Incident #3: approached by a white man in his late 50s\/early 60s at the older slots over by the new Buffalo ones. He asked if I'd been having luck, I said no and went back to my game. He was very close to me\/up in my personal space, and said he saw someone win 100k on that machine that morning. I said great, without even looking at him. Then he said something strange like 'why don't you take your money and I'll show you.' I then aggressively said, "I'm not interested" and he finally walked away. I was shaken up, and scared he was going to follow me up to my room. My heart was beating so fast.  

In all 3 instances, security was NOWHERE to be found.  It's unfortunate that a place we used to love, and 
started\/ended our nights at, was drastically different this year. I've never before felt unsafe gambling on my own in Bally's, after my husband went upstairs to bed.  Not only will I never do that again in Bally's, but is doubtful we'll ever stay there again.

The location is good for it's central spot on the strip and walking distance for Paris, Bellagio, and Cosmopolitan.

We paid the extra $50 to get upgraded to a suite and were excited until we got to the room. Yea it was big, but it was just floor space between the bed and the TV. And the room itself looked really old and awkward with the railings separating the bedroom and the bathroom area.

While we were unpacking and exploring a little bit, we heard lots of noises from the next room in addition to doors banging shut. My bf called the front desk to ask to get moved to another room and after some waiting, negotiating, and checking, we got moved to the North Tower for a standard room on the Diamond floor. Sweet!

The room in this renovated tower was much much better than the old suite. It was smaller but overall it looked, and felt much more comfortable.

Get rooms in the North Tower for sure.

Price is great for the location. Our room was good, the hotel is convenient walking distance to a lot of places. The hotel is connected to Paris and the Bellagio fountains are right across the street. All the staff was wonderful, from the bellhops to checking in to booking my airport shuttle for me...everyone was super helpful and sweet to deal with, and get five stars. 

The negatives: No coffee maker (or fridge) in the room. You have to get room service or go down to the coffee shop across from check in for coffee. And even then a regular coffee or tea is $3.45. The room pretty much only comes with water glasses. There isn't even conditioner, just 'conditioning shampoo'. Not the same for us long-locked ladies. The bathroom is all in one - the sink, toilet, and tub are all behind one closed door. So if you are sharing a room make sure you don't mind sharing the bathroom as well. There is a casino, but it is pretty small, loud, and smoky. I would rather play elsewhere. There is a small gym but you have to walk through a mini strip mall in the basement to get there. That was weird. There is also a spa but we didn't go so I'm not sure how it is.

Overall, a great budget option right on the strip. Just don't expect any frills. And bring your own coffee maker or electric kettle.

got to do a survey here watching a new tv pilot and got paid for it. busy casino area, clean rooms, and they have deal or no deal machine. Middle of the strip and easy access to the monorail - what more could you ask for.

This is definitely a hotel losing its luster, but it offers good value for those who want to stay in the middle of the strip without breaking the bank. Though there is nothing of particular interest inside the casino, the rooms are clean and somewhat spacious. My only complaint would be that the sports book was closed during our visit so we had to walk to Paris anytime we wanted to place a sports bet, which is rather ridiculous.

It may not have a cool theme, exquisite decor, or a bunch of fancy restaurants...but if you're ballin' on a budge, you cannot beat Bally's in Vegas.  Granted a couple of years ago, this was probably no man's land on the Strip, but since City Center opened up, Bally's is in a prime spot as it is connected to Paris and a quick walk to Cosmo.  

Get a room in the North Tower as they have been refurbished and are nicer.  SEA Thai Experience downstairs is actually really good food, although pricey for what it is.  The tequila bar is open 24, great for stumbling in at 5 in the morning and getting $2 tacos!

Oh, and the gambling is cheap! $5 minimums! YES! 

Drawbacks...Sportsbook is on the lower level, well hidden. So is the pool and spa.  And not too many hotties walking around...cause its cheap!

Solid place though, and I would stay here again on the trips when I'm not looking to drop my savings on a room!

Love the central strip location and that they have self service kiosks to check in to avoid the long lines. The newer jubilee rooms are very nice but wish they would just update all the rooms already. Most of the Employees were very nice and helpful but there were a few bad apples that were amazingly rude. You can find great deals for total rewards properties so make sure you sign up for the rewards card.

For one of the cheaper mid-strip hotels, I was impressed.  I was expecting less.  The decor  is outdated, but the bathroom was all new looking.  The room was quite large, with a king size bed, two desks, a love seat, chair, coffee table, and nice flat-screen television.  I was on the 25th floor with a view of the strip and Bellagio fountains.  I do agree that the pillows sucked, and the air conditioner made some weird noises while it wasn't running, but I'd stay here again.

My husband and I decided to come to Vegas after a very long hiatus that included work stress and family stress. We would come to Vegas quite often in the past, but unfortunately this year has been so hectic, we were only able to do one trip thus far, We gamble a lot when in Vegas so we always get discounts offered to us by different hotels regularly. We decided to go with Ballys because its right in the center of the strip and you can't really go wrong with any Caesars Palace affiliated hotel right ? Wong !!!!!
This was an absolutely horrific experience. From the moment we checked in to the second we decided to leave I cannot express how utterly upset and disgusted I am with my experience at this hotel. 
First off, when we checked in and were walked up to our rooms by the bell hop, which we thought was nice, but as soon as we unlocked our room, it felt like we walked into a sauna. Our bell hop Immediately made the comment that he would adjust the temperature as he was feeling extremely hot as well ,but as soon as he looked at the thermostat he turned to me and my husband and said its set to 60 degrees. We tipped him and as soon as he left I turned the thermostat to the absolute lowest it would go, and it had the option to go into the high 40's.
  I after that I immediately started to unpack and get ready for the evening as we had reservations for dinner a few hours later. The shower head was not working properly as water was spraying everywhere. I unfortunately had to keep the water pressure very low which made my shower take much longer just to avoid making a mess in the entire bathroom with water being sprayed just about everywhere in every direction. 2 hours later our room was no where close to even feeling cool, let alone cold.  We contacted the front desk and told them we genuinely think  something is wrong with the Air Conditioning in our room, to which they said they would send up an engineer. We told them we were on a time crunch and we needed to leave to make our reservation to which they responded there was nothing they could no unless an engineer takes a look at the Air conditioning unit. We ended up having to wait for the engineer to come up , making us late for our reservation.  After the engineer was done with our room we had to immediately leave, but was hoping that our room would be nice and cool when we got back from the night. WRONG !!!! When we got back to our room it was still extremely warm. We called the front desk and told them that our  room was way too hot to spend the night in and we needed to switch rooms to which they responded they did not have any more rooms to switch us to for free but we had the option to upgrade to a suite for a charge. This is when I started getting very upset,  Not only are the employees here not being accommodating, but they are trying to charge us after they inconvenience us and not give us what we paid for. My husband and I decided there was very little we could do and then noticed that  it was past 1:30 am.  We decided to go to our friend's hotel room who was staying at the Aria and crash with him. The next day when we returned to our room it was still extremely hot and the air conditioner was set to the high 40's. At this point we knew we could not stand it any longer and called the front desk. My husband told them that we wanted to check out and we were going to call our credit card company and inform them that Ballys was trying to wrongfully charge us. This finally got the front desks attention. The said they would move us to another room free of charge, but alas that room was really not any better. The safe did not work and we did not want to walk around the strip with a large chunk of cash on us but there was nothing we could do. Then we noticed that the light in the bathroom did not work. We had to call the front desk another 3 times so we could get help getting the light fixed. Had we have had any clue what kind of house of horrors this hotel would end up being we would have paid the extra money and stayed anywhere else. Like I've said before, we have been to Vegas many times in the past and have never had such a horrific experience as we did at Ballys. This hotels executes UNETHICAL BUSINESS PRACITICES and I can honestly say it was the low point of our vacation. Knowing we had to sleep and wake up in that hotel, start and end the day in that hotel just ruined our trip. 
NEVER EVER AGAIN !

4.5 Stars 
I stay at Bally's for a week and got to say it was good. If you looking for a hotel on the strip that near everything and don't want to pay a arm or a leg for it then stay at Bally's. Services was excellent and everything was close by. When I got there I ask if I could get a two queen bed instead of one and they upgrade me to the North tower deluxe room it was spacious, nice, and clean, and updated. No extra charge. The only draw by at that time was there was no refrigerator or microwave, but hey it Vegas I was going to eat out most of the time anyways and my friend gave me her cooler to keep all the drinks cold. Anyways if you need a refrigerator it $10 a night if you wanted to know. I pay about $30 something a night, Sunday to Saturday. I had a promotion code I got off the Internet. Also on the second day the house keeping staff notice a little wet spot on the carpet and got this air blower in the room when I came back they left me a message to call the front desk. When I called they ask if I was ok if they upgrade me to the honeymoon suite with a jacuzzi  and the view of the strip and the dance fountain show. It was nice got to say Bally's is a good hotel if you looking for a nice clean place to sleep on the strip and the price is just right. It also connected to Paris and in walking distance to everything. There pool isn't the greatest pool thought, but I went to other pools but for the price and everything I think it great. Oh yeah the Wi fi isn't free you have to pay for it so that might be a draw back for some.

I gotta say it was nice room sucky part no renfriagtor or microwave! But that okay I did have fun time with my boyfriend n his friends when people were so sweet to use and had good time. Thank you bally (:

I'll probably never stay at Bally's again, but my stay wasn't terrible. I would recommend this hotel to smokers only.

I chose to stay here on the butt end of one of my trips to Vegas where the first half I rented out a fabulous 5 bed house for a girls trip surprise for my BFF and the last half I was attending a conference at the Las Vegas Convention Center. The conference had a special for Bally's and since I was alone and didn't need to leave the area (one of the girls rented a car for the first half of my trip when we had the house) Bally's seemed to be a reasonable choice. There's a monorail that stops at Bally's that takes you to the convention center. 

The check in line was horrendous! I stood in line for at least 40 minutes. My eyes got irritated from all the smoke in the air. When I got to the desk the agent was very pleasant, gave me a ticket to a free show at the hotel and hooked me up with a high floor with a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower right outside my window and the Bellagio fountains. I was in the newer Jubilee Tower. 

The room was clean and modern and I could see all the way down the strip and hear the music for the Bellagio fountain display as my nightly entertainment. Although my room was non smoking, the hotel is smoky that it didn't matter. I could smell smoke all the way down the halls and even a bit in the room. 

I didn't eat anything at Bally's, but I did eat at several of the places on the way to the monorail and in the connector mall area to Paris. All mediocre food. I have to say it is cool that you can get to Paris without going outside. 

Bally's is on the strip so it's easy to get everywhere from there.

I'm a bit spoiled since I've stayed at the Aria which is much newer and an experience all its own. Again, Bally's isn't bad, but I wouldn't stay there again due to the smoke.

***Bally's has a great location and a reasonable price (for The Strip); it is a nice enough hotel though it would not compete with the many fancy (as well as more expensive) hotels on The Strip***

Bally's is a respectable hotel located right in the heart of some of the biggest hotels in Las Vegas (Caesars Palace, Bellagio, Mirage, Paris, etc.).  The one advantage that Bally's has is that it is more reasonable when it comes to room rates.

While the room decor is your standard hotel room with no frills (some Las Vegas hotel rooms have character; not Bally's), the beds are comfortable, the linens are nice, and everything is clean.

The casino floor is decent.  They have a small number of gaming tables so they are often packed.

You are also conveniently located to the Monorail.

Worst experience ever!!! Rude receptionist! Not even apologetic that we waited for an hour to check in just to tell us in a rude manner that were not getting our reserved rooms. All their personnels were rude rude rude!!

This is the worst hotel in Las Vegas. There are a lot of better choices. 
Hotel and Casino staffs are disrespectful, and will judge you by your race or where you are coming from. I had a bad experience, so I do not think I would stay again.

COMPED ROOM

Last month I stayed at the Flamingo. A couple of weeks after I came back I checked my Total Rewards account. I noticed that I was eligible to comp a free room at Bally's. I wasn't planning to go back to Vegas anytime soon however I had to redeem my Asia Miles frequent flyer miles, which I earned 4 years ago when I went to South Africa for the World Cup, by the end of April. Because of those two factors I decided to go back to Vegas again. 

At Bally's I stayed for 4 free nights. I was very happy with my room at the Indigo Tower. The room was spacious compared to most standard rooms. I had a lot of space on the left side of the bed. On the left side of the bed was a couch and a small coffee table. This was an ideal room for a free vacation. The room was clean and there was no cockroaches as I've read from other reviews. This room felt I was the king. With all the amenities and the room free of charge (with the of the resort fees) why didn't I give a perfect 5 star rating? First even though the room was spacious the wall was close to the right side of the bed. The best hotel room I ever stayed at was the Roman Tower at Caesars Palace. That room was spacious but also was equally spaced on both sides of the bed; a wall wasn't closed to either side of the bed. Second like the Flamingo last month the swimming pool was closed. Since the season is late winter\/ early spring I wanted to relax and swim in the pool. Other than those two issues the room at the Indigo Tower at Bally's is a great room if you're eligible to comp it.

I'll probably never stay here again. Thankfully I was only there for one night. For a room being charged at 150 a night and staying in something that was maybe equal to a 75 a night room was disappointing. There was some weird liquid that was stained over the front door, one of the beds was extremely uncomfortable,  you could literally feel the springs sticking out of it. Almost reminded me of American Horror story hotel where the dead people hide in the mattresses.
The walls were falling apart, it looked like someone chewed on the corner of one. The room we were in could definitely use some TLC. Oh and we were on the 5th floor in the indigo tower. The only positive thing I will say is I liked being able to check in and out online to avoid lines.

Bally's is located smack dab in the middle of the Las Vegas strip! Location is key when staying here. Unfortunately, that's all the praise that i can give the casino. There is nothing spectacular about the casino other than a great location. 

I stayed here in comped room for the week. The rooms are comfortable. It was your average looking room, nothing special, but hey who stays in the room anyways? 

Overall, I have to give Bally's an average rating of 3 stars.

My best friend's mom is apparently quite the gambler so she was able to get us a free room for the weekend~!  Sweeet!!

I love the location of the hotel on the strip.  It's in the middle of everything.  The hotel itself is pretty clean.  However, it was a bit too cold for me.  I ended up catching a really bad cold after the Vegas trip.  I guess the whole hot weather-cold hotel did me over.  

There were a few empty blackjack tables...as we walked by, I took a look to see what the minimum bet was:  $10.  The floor manager urged us to play.  I told him I'd play if he changed the minimum bet to $5, and he did~!  That was kind of nice of him :)

Anyways, overall had a good stay.  I'd stay here again.

I wish they had more poker tables.  It's a bit cramped in their poker area...Lots of locals were actually playing.  However, they weren't that good :P

My old friend is a host here at Bally's - If you are a gambler and want VIP service ask for James Brattoli. He is a great and fun guy who definitely will take care of you.

We had booked a room through Expedia, but he made sure we got a nice view and upgraded us to VIP check in. He also helped up make a few restaurant reservations.

Bally's is not one of the higher end hotels on the strip, but it is clean, is centrally located and has nice views and a pretty pool area (James said the pool at the Paris hotel is better with afternoon sun, and as a Bally's customer you are welcome to use that too) I will say that the drinks at the pool are EXPENSIVE, one margarita was $14!

Shower pressure was not the best either, and we did have to call to have a lightbulb replaced in our bathroom. Beds were very comfortable.

Our room was 5628 - so that is the number'ish you need for a nice view of the high roller ride and the strip.

But for the price we paid - it was a fine deal.
Our south tower room had great view of the Strip and casino isn't so large that you get lost. Room was a bit tired and there are newer, cheaper options. Not bad.

Sadia, the front desk supervisor rocks! She spoke to me at length on the phone and came out to meet us after her shift! Lovely, professional and courteous, Bally's should be proud to employ her. Now on to the rest - it was very difficult to find exactly where the entrance was, however once we did we were quickly greeted by the charming bell hop and off we went. We were lucky enough not to have too long of a line and as I mentioned earlier her was greeted by the lovely Sadia. We stayed in the executive suite and boy was it sweet. Featuring a big beautiful Jacuzzi tub, my husband is 6 foot four and I am 5 foot seven and we both fit in it comfortably. The room was simply gorgeous. Every staff member, from the bellhop, to the vallet to the housekeeping, to the front desk were polite, engaged, and helpful.  If you thinking of going to the indigo lounge, you should see the yelp reviews. We found out that Bally does not manage this lounge, and unless they change management I would stay away and check out those reviews. One of our favorite things to do in Las Vegas is go to those little lounges with the live music and so that would be the only thing that would keep me from coming back to Bally's. We only stayed one night, but boy would have loved to stay longer. Our room was just lushes - Indigo Tower 1133!

I had an overall positive experience at Ballys. Booked my room through HotelTonight (make sure to download the app on your smartphone! A MUST for last minute easy hotel bookings) just the day before checking in; a great deal for $49 a night, making it only a total of $110 for two nights! 

Checking in was easy and fast. I wanted a one bed and non smoking room. My room was in the Jubilee Tower, which I believe is the newly reconstructed\/refurbished building. Our room was incredibly spacious, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and even the bathroom was roomy with great lighting. Our floor was also very quiet and you didn't hear too much of the hussle and bussle of the outside Vegas world. Complimentary WiFi, up to 2 devices a day, which worked really well!

My only complaint, however, is that our room  did smell like cigarettes! If not our room, it must have been the other guests room smoking or something. It was tolerable but that was the only part I didn't like about my stay. 

Bally's is in a great location, wedged between Paris\/Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops and Cromwell\/Flamingo and right across Caesars! I loved that I could comfortably walk around to high traffic areas of the strip without having to take too many cabs.
I would definitely stay at Bally's again. Keep it up!

Ballys use to claim "Ballys is Las Vegas."  If that's the case mediocrity and disorganization must be running rife though the city.  Actually stopped in, sat at a machine for 45mins before flagging drink server.  Took another 20mins for drink, which was the wrong one.

For our first time in Vegas we decided to go for the RCPM show over Labor Day weekend.  We booked our room late and everything was very expensive but Bally's had a very decent price so we went with them.  The room was spacious which we appreciated.  A nice large room, king sized bed and large bathroom.  Bed was not very comfortable and pillows were terrible.  All the staff we came in contact with were very nice and while I wouldn't be opposed to staying here again it wouldn't be my first choice. We liked that it was mid-strip but we just weren't wow-ed with anything.

**UPDATE**

Okay, after staying at the Alladin\/ Planet Hollywood I am going to beg Ballys to take us back!!!  I went back there my last day and everything was sunshine compared to the OTHER hotel. I will just have to be super sweet and bat my eyelashes and wink at the receptionist (whether guy or girl) and beg for the newer cleaner rooms next time we are there. My guy and I figured that the people at the OTHER HOTEL are so rude and arent ready to jump to keep you happy because they arent UNIONIZED. I am giving this hotel an upgrade to 4 stars. LUV YA BALLYS!!!! PS... They do have comfortable beds & room service is also good. 


This is one of the worst hotels. If you are the new side the rooms are a bit better. But still not up to par. We go there at least 3 times a year because of business and it sucks that the organization can only use this place. Most of the time the check in people are rude.

Let me start by saying that I am the type that likes to stay at cheap places when I travel so I can spend the money doing other things, and that's why I stayed at Bally's. I am not a hotel snob by any means. However, when I am paying to stay a hotel on the strip, I do expect better than a Howard Johnson, and I can say with all honesty that I have stayed at Ho Jo's that were far superior to this place. Little things like shampoo and conditioner and a bed that doesn't cave in the middle (and isn't a Murphy bed) would have been nice. Oh, and towels without stains on them would be nice also. I was also disappointed by the staff. The woman at the front desk was fairly miserable and didn't say more than 5 words to us upon check-in and then after checking out we realized the room was put under the wrong name, which was weird. When we realized our bed caved in the middle, we requested a new room (which I have never done before at any hotel, ever) and they told us they could switch us but the bed would be exactly the same. Ummm, ok, never mind then? They also told us we could switch to a suite which would cost $100 more a night, but if I was going to pay that much more, I would have just stayed at a nicer hotel. Another con is that it is a far walk to the pool. Usually when you get off the elevator on the pool floor of a hotel you are right there, but here you have to walk through the trenches of the basement. Be forewarned ladies (and some gents), and make sure to cover up because there is a long way to go while you while get lots of creepy stares by lots of creepy men.

But there are some pros I need to mention. The location is perfect, right in the middle of the strip and at one of the monorail stops. It has a walk through to Paris, which is where we ended up spending most of our time. Also, although the pool is a pain to get to, I liked the environment of the pool, at least on the weekdays while I was there. It was an older crowd and I know a lot of people wouldn't like that, but I liked that it was laid back and fairly quiet because I wanted to relax and not deal with a bunch of rowdy drunks making out all over the place. I understand this could be a pro or con depending on your personality.

Bottom line - I would not stay here again and probably would shell out a little extra next time I'm in Vegas.

While my stay at Ballys was nice, the checkout experience has been a nightmare. I was promised an email receipt of my bill the day I checked out. I didn't receive it. I then went to the website because you can't talk to anyone and requested a copy of my receipt and I still haven't received it, it's been 5 days. How difficult is it to give a client a receipt when you charge the credit card?

Where to begin....I love Vegas.  I've been there 3 times and stayed at Bally's once.  The truth is I continue to go back to gamble at Bally's....I've gone for the last 2 years during the first weekend of March Madness and it is crazy.  My boys took home between 5 of them about $10000 playing craps this time, I on the other hand lost.  They have two sports books, at least 6 craps tables, 8 roulettes tables, and plenty of blackjack.  The rooms are good, not great, the location is perfect right in the middle of the strip.  A very good time, I recommend everyone go.

As soon as we walked in the door we were hit by salesman trying to get us to attend a timeshare presentation. When we walked away the woman yelled and screamed at us. The line to check in was huge. We waited over an hour. Our first room was the basic room in the indigo tower. The carpets were stained and all the furniture banged up. The bed was horribly uncomfortable. The first morning we discovered that the toliet ran incessantly and water was backing up into the sink. Gross! My husband complained and they moved us to a deluxe room in the same tower. They warned us that it had no view. Fine with us. Second room had stained dirty carpets and banged up furniture as well. One of the lamps wouldn't turn off so we had to unplug it.  The toliet in this room was super loud, if one of us went to the bathroom in the middle of the night it would wake the other person up. I also found a huge ball of hair and gook under the vanity. Neither room had a fridge which sucked and the ice machine was a huge walk away. The wait for the elevators was ridiculous. Eight elevators grouped together and you wouldn't know which one was coming. You would hear a ding, no lights or anything. When the door opened you had to make a mad dash or the door would shut and it would leave. The wifi never worked for me so the resort fee got me nothing. One morning I was walking down the hall for ice and there was two maids cleaning different rooms. The first time I went by one maid was kicked back in a chair in a room loudly talking on her phone. One my way back to the room the two were loudly yelling down the hall at each other despite several rooms with do not disturb signs out. Very rude! The casino was nothing special and after seeing other hotels we were even more annoyed with ours. The ONLY good thing going for this place is the fact that it is right in the middle of things.

I booked seven rooms at Bally's in the South tower for a bunch of family members.  We later received email offer to upgrade to the North tower for $10 per night but we decided to stay put since it really wasn't a big deal to be in old rooms.  My sister and three of her (adult) kids all got rooms in the North tower within having to pay for an upgrade, they simply got lucky!  She loved her room.

I have to preface the review with, I am a VERY light sleeper and somewhat of an insomniac.  Anyway...first off, the room numbering system is bizarre.  Our rooms were 7033, 7036-7038 which I think is on the 20th floor, not sure.  The carpeting in the hallway is very old and stretched out so there are lumps along the way.  My brother got two connecting rooms for his son & family which overlooked Bills Gambling Hall and a portion of the Bellagio fountains.  The room my mom and I got was #7033, which had a view of the Paris hotel, pool and Eiffel tower.  We had a view of about 60% of the Bellagio fountains which was nice!  The rooms were thread worn with furniture of cheapo fake walnut from the 70's-80's.  The bed was a stiff but hey, the TV worked, the bathrooms were clean and there was plenty of hot water!  The bath products were Gilchrist & Soames of London but the box stated "Made in China", so don't know what's up with that. In any case the soap was very drying and the lotion was very thin.  Thank goodness we both brought our own bath products!  There were three lamps in the room.  One on the center bed-stand, one on the dresser which actually turned on with the hall light switch.  The one at the table near the window was dim, like 40\/60 watt bulb and could not be used for reading.  The bath room lighting was nice and bright but not comfortable to have to stand there to apply makeup.  The shower was great, nice a hot!  I actually asked housekeeping for three bath mats the first day and they did so only that day, I didn't want to keep asking so for the rest of the time I used two towels.  (I don't like standing on cold tile while at the sink or toilet)

Now, the bad part.  On Wednesday and Friday nights there is some sort of event under the Eiffel tower which I did not know about.  The music was SO incredibly loud until around 3:30 a.m.!!!!  Even with the a\/c fan and my sound machine on it's loudest I could clearly hear the music.  I could even feel the vibrations!  My brother, whose room was across the hall from ours said HE even heard the music and wondered where is was coming from because he couldn't see anything going on from his window!  So needless to say, I didn't fall asleep until around 4 a.m.  Plus the uncomfortable bed didn't help any since I tossed and turned, never being able to get comfortable!
