Overall, I liked that it had easy access to the Paris hotel.  I actually liked the casino and the staff was very nice and helpful.  I really didn't mind the old and ugly furnishings of the South tower, but the noise level in our particular room was unbelievable!  I wouldn't stay there again.

This review is based upon everything except for the hotel since I have never stayed at Bally's.  Overall the casino is nice, but no real theming to it.  The one thing I like is the sports bar that overlooks the sports book, kind of like a skybox.  Restaurant and dining options at Bally's are also good, but not great.

My major gripe is Bally's removing their iconic entrance with the wrap-around neon and the moving walkways to make room for shopping.  This is a real turn off for me, and don't think I'll be returning.

Wow.. I was thoroughly satisfied and pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed my stay at Ballys. 

First of all, we had a basic room for $40 a night. That is the cheapest I've ever paid for a nice hotel. This isn't going to be your fancy overpriced hotel, but honestly, for $40, it's worth it rather than paying $200+ a night. When you're in Vegas, you stay out most of the time. If you plan on staying indoors, I'm sure there are plenty of non casino hotels that are better for that kind of experience. 

Our bathroom was remodeled, study desk was a nice perk, and our sofa and bed were both petty and comfortable. Since it's connected to Paris and smack in the middle of the strip, le boyfriend and I had a lot of fun. 

We had up to $30 complimentary room service, which was delicious and service was great. We left our bags on our last day to go off and travel, which was really convenient. 

All in all, if you're planning a short stay in Vegas, or just want to save and get a hotel worth more than what you will pay, definitely stay at ballys. Thank you ballys for a great experience for my first time in Vegas.

Stayed here in a comped room. Nothing fancy but not bad at all. Especially for being free. The bed wasn't very comfortable  but the room was big and didn't smell smoky.  The maid was super nice and the location was perfect. We were able to go over to Paris and all the surrounding hotels very easily and I loved the location on the strip. I would stay here again. Especially if t was comped. The casino isn't great but not terrible.

The hotel is very nice and the rooms are very very nice. My only complaint is the shower water was NOT hot. It was lukewarm. I got hotter water out of the sink. Other than that we had a great visit. We'll be back.

It was a great casino, but we had a terrible experience with a cocktail waitress, which ruined our whole experience there. She was completely rude and went off on me because she felt I didn't tip her enough. I did. Her attitude was unacceptable and uncalled for. We went to management and explained what had happened. They were so sweet and completely understood how we felt.

This is the worst hotel.  45 minute check-in line.  Dirty carpet and stained sheets in room.  There was used soap and shampoo left in the shower.  Staff was not great.  Will not stay here again!  GROSS!

Bally's is right on the strip which is pretty great. The hotel room looks like it's from the seventies, but it's comfortable. It's very chilly in the rooms so pack a hoodie. In addition there are no microwaves or mini refrigerator and if you want one it's extra so just keep that in mind. There is a casino, food court and shops downstairs except it's expensive, everything is expensive anyways. Overall Bally's is an okay hotel, no problems but nothing exceptional about it.

We stayed here a few nights and the room was less than desirable.  The room was clean but the furniture was old.  I wonder if I paid extra for the 70's suite?!?!

On the other hand, the dealers in the casino where awesome.  Iris was one of our favorite Blackjack dealers, she made sure we were always well taken care of and she was great for advice when asked.  We love you Iris!!!!

Recently stayed here on 3\/11-3\/13\/2017, I had free room comps through my total rewards. I had never stayed at Ballys so I was excited to see what the hotel had to offer. The check in process was simple and there was no deposit which was awesome. Most properties charge a nightly deposit. We stayed in the indigo tower on the 20th floor and had an awesome view of the strip. The room was huge and very spacious the bathroom was spacious as well and there were plenty of mirrors for selfies...overall I had a good stay here and would deff be back. Housekeeping was helpful as well.

Friendly staff, clean rooms, AMAZING location and all for a pretty good price.  I agree with the other reviews.  I really don't think you can beat this location for this price.  We paid 45 for a thursday night and 89 for a friday.  Totally worth it.  We stayed in the North Tower which was pretty nice.  The bathrooms looked remodeled and what not.  I would definitely stay here again!

Convenient location, clean.

We stayed here for 2 nights for Columbus Day Weekend.  The wait in line took about 20-30 minutes to get checked-in (get there early on holiday weekends!).  We wanted a non-smoking room with a king-size bed, but I guess they were booked for the weekend so they only had a smoking king when we checked-in.  

Despite the smokey smell, our room was clean and very spacious.  The bathroom was huge and there were two sinks (one inside the bathroom, one right outside), which made it convenient when sharing with the bf. 

Located in the middle of the strip, Bally's is connected to Paris and right across from Bellagio (which is connected to Ceasar's Palace) which was pretty awesome.  

On another note, they have a kiosk right by the front desk that sells pastries and drinks.  I had the red velvet cupcake (about $4) and it was THE best red velvet cupcake I have ever had!  It was SUPER moist and huge!  The icing was a little too sweet, but overall it was the best red velvet cupcake I've ever had.  SOOOO GOOD!!!  

I'd stay here again.

Here are a few reasons I chose Ballys after MUCH thought -
Location Location Location
Price Price Price
No Resort Fees
Location Location Location

This place is attached to Paris, has a monorail stop, an average pool... a pool is a pool, you can't go wrong with a pool unless you're extremely picky (and yes, I know the type...)
The place might be a bit dated but it gets crowded.  We checked in on a Tuesday around 3:30 - got handed a pretty decent coupon book and an option to upgrade to a suite in the North Tower for $20 more per night.  I was told the North Tower was recently renovated but the South Tower had the better view...Really, how much time do you stay in your room in Vegas?  We saved some money, picked the South Tower and had a view of Paris, The Paris Pool, and the Bellagio fountain show.

Yes, the room might need some updating - the drawers in the furniture didn't all open, some of the outlets in the room didn't work, one of the lamps didn't work but the bathroom was big, the water pressure was great, and the beds were decent and I had 3 pillows on my queen size bed.  

If you're looking to not spend all kinds of money, or stupid resort fees at a hotel mid-strip, choose Ballys.

Cheap but centrally located on the Strip. Otherwise, disappointing, mostly for their fitness center. I was expecting The Best from Bally's, whose health clubs were the state of the art. Alas, cardio machines with no individual TV's and no sound??!! and purple weight machines Bally's appears to have picked up from a second-hand sale at Planet Fitness!??? Why so sucky a fitness center?? MAJOR FAIL!

The room was a torture chamber of antique, ugly furniture from 1983. I could not use the desk. Also played, "search for available plugs," a little game I've come to hate, and instantly dislike any establishment that makes me participate as the first thing I must do in the room in 2017. Bathroom shower curtain and fixtures were ancient, but matched the rest of the awful décor. Weird elevators: You hear one arrive, but unless you're standing in front of it, you must frantically search for the open door! Another stupid game?

In contrast, Check-In and Check-out was State of the Art: Very easy, automated, and efficient. I also liked the option of having room service or credit toward purchases charged to the room for hotel restaurants. As with everywhere in Vegas, I found service in the hotel and casino extremely friendly and professional.

Over all the casino, decor and experience deserves like 3.5 stars but I gave 4 because they put us in a huge suite for what seemed like no reason whatsoever. This room had a huge master bedroom with an attached master bathroom with a jacuzzi tub in the floor and 1 separate room for the toilet and 1 separate room for the bidet. It also had a full bar and 2 huge lounging areas. Overall a very good experience.

Recently stayed in Ballys for my friends 30th birthday.the hotel is located directly in the heart of Vegas.Lovely clean rooms close to all the nightlife and great restaurants etc.Walking distance to everywhere you need to go.
I would stay here again as the staff and hotel is just perfect.The pool is very clean and has a great atmosphere.I need to Mention TJ the concierge he was amazing at booking us a trip to Grand Canyon ,letting us know places to see and do.TJ is for sure a valued key employee of Ballys and because of his professionalism and amazing advice we thoroughly enjoyed our holiday.Thanks TJ

My biggest complaint would be of the Manager Darryl. Worthless! Our issue occurred during check in. My sister is a PD dialysis patient. What that consists of is manually performing 4-5 fill-and-drain exchanges of liquid medication per day. Medication for traveling long distance must be shipped on site. Prior to making reservations we made all the arrangements for having her medication shipped to Ballys. Everything was set, we called a couple times to ensure packages had arrived and were assured everything had been received. They even told us that they had received medication for dialysis patients in the past. When checking in we were told that the shipping department is open from 7AM-7PM (we arrived at 9PM) and they couldn't retrieve the packages since shipping dept was closed. We explained to the clerk that her medication could not wait until 7AM and that it would have been nice to know that the shipping department closed at a certain time. The clerk called her manager DARRYL to see if he could help. We then explained the whole situation to the manager, he proceeded to tell us that the shipping dept was closed and the actual department is located at Paris Casino right next door and that he could not do anything for us. I kept telling the manager that she needs her medication as soon as possible. We told him it can be life threatening if she waits too long without it. The manager with no regard proceeds to tell us that he cannot do anything about it and that she should have brought her own medication with her. We told him that her medication isn't a pill of some sort to simply throw in a bag, they are liquids that cannot be taken on a plane and must be shipped. The manager proceeded to argue with me back and forth as if he did not care nor tried to find a resolution. What kind of a manager argues with a customer!??? Especially when the circumstances are life threatening. Eventually the clerk that checked us in decided to give us the contact number for Paris Casino and told us to call them to see if they could help in anyway. We ended up walking over to Paris casino, explained the situation, with no hesitation their clerk called security over to retrieve the packages. Thank god! I could not believe how lazy, rude and unhelpful Bally's manager Darryl was!? DOUCHE BAG! Ruined the beginning of our trip. When all he had to do is make a call or walk over to Paris Casino. A**H*LE!

Rooms - We had 5 groups with us. The clerk was able to give us all rooms on the same floor which was convenient. 2\/5 rooms had great views of the LINQ's High Roller Ferris wheel. 4\/5 rooms had a wet carpet smell to it. We had to buy our own water to brush our teeth, the water had a nasty sewer smell to it. Wish they had a microwave. 

Does anyone know where I can call Ballys corporate office about their manager? 

Thanks
I paid to for a king bed got two queens instead and woke up killing a roach. I think this 1 star review sums it up.

If there was a rating less than 1 star, I'd choose that. It was a nightmare from the time we arrived in valet and they removed our bags from the car, until we walked out after being yelled at by the front desk woman when attempting to pay our balance and check out because their concierge advised us which line to stand in...apparently it was the wrong line. We will never stay here again and are advising everyone else we know, not to stay at Bally's Las Vegas.

I would've given 5 stars if the customer service was better. Guy who checked me in wasn't personable and didn't even say hello. When I asked if I could see an executive suite for future party planning, he got me the book to look at. I would have preferred to physically see it.
I called down later and a nice ladyRita was helpful in telling me the types a d how if I came down later she would show me two. I went down about4 hours later and asked for her and this other clerk gave me the third degree asking if I'm staying there as if I needed to in order to see a room.
So she goes to the back to tell Rita and comes back to say they were gone and I could check back tomorrow or she could show me the book. I thought that was odd and decided to look it up on you tube. 
The room I had in the north tower was huge for just me and the bathroom was nice but I think I'll be taking my business elsewhere for my party. a place of this reputation should give impeccable service.

I liked Bally's. I like the old timey Vegas decor, outdated but ultra clean, comfy beds, good TV, loved our view snd we were in the lovely pool everyday. 
I liked all the amenities of hotel, food, shops etc. It was hot, hot, hot while we were there and we didn't care to leave the hotel much anyway so this was perfect. 
It's very central, amazing location in fact, $20 cab ride to the airport, walk to Ceasar's\/Venetian\/Treasure Island etc.
I would def stay again.

Great rooms for a great price. They remodeled their Jubilee Rooms so it is more upscale and new. I came during July 4th and got rooms ranging from $35-50 a night. That is definitely a steal in Vegas. I always book through Total Rewards and get the best prices. It is a great casino to stay and gamble, plus it is right smack dab in the middle of the strip. Next to Paris and Planet Hollywood and walking distance from all major hotel and clubs. It is not luxurious but it has everything you need.
It was decent when my folks and I went there back in January 2001 as a teen(ager). I liked its colorful light tunnels. ;)

Wonderful place to stay for 2 days!! You can also connect to other hotels! Staying here is at a reasonable price too and not expensive at all right on the Las Vegas strip, which is easy access to every place you can think of!

Meh.

The room was comp'd, so I can't complain about something that costs $Free.99.

The location is great.  It's right in the center of the action with very easy access to Paris, the Flamingo, Planet Hollywood, the Bellagio and several places on the center of the strip.  It was nice to see the Bellagio water fountain show from our room.

The casino has a 24-hour bar\/ restaurant that serves $2 beer and margaritas all night.  Holla.  But beware of the nachos-- I saw 4 big grown ass men could NOT finish the plate!

Service was not so amazing.  Room-service platters were left out in the hall for more than 24 hours.  The hall became littered with glasses and napkins by Saturday.  

Our room was large, but 2 of the lamps didn't work and there was no vent in the bathroom.  These are small things, but show a bit of disregard for proper hotel etiquette.  It also DIDN'T HAVE A COFFEEPOT.  What the...?  Motel 6 gives you coffee.  This is something I didn't understand.

Overall, Bally's was fine enough, but it completely lacked any perks, whatsoever.  It made me feel like a redheaded stepchild on the Strip (no offense to my ginger brothers and sisters out there).

So I went into this casino for the first time in many years because my girlfriend had received show tickets to see Veronic.

The theater is old. When I went to sit in my seat, the chair reclined back so far I almost fell onto the floor. Not great for somebody with a bad back.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. Overall it's a vegas classic, even with the smoky odor, the drinks are good also. The gambling was ok, a lot of older machines which is nice to see.

upgraded, because they ran out of rooms where we were supposed to stay. we got a king suite room. it was really high up, and they let us stay for the next day also instead of going back to the smaller rooms. theres a great living room, dining room, and restroom. a small "kitchen", without a stove. in the room, is a 2 sofas, a nice comfy king bed, a rollaway bed when asked, 2 sinks, 1 stand up shower, 1 jacuzzi, a lot of tvs. wifi on point. customer service on point. close to everything. i dont think i can live at another hotel on the strip with my budget.

My husband and I stayed here 3 nights thanks to a "buy 1 night, get 2 nights" coupon, so the price was excellent.

The rooms were clean and comfortable, no complaints there.  The location is good, but the building appears shabby and dated next to it's neighbor, Paris.  

I suppose my biggest complain was the long haul from the parking garage to the rooms... through long corridor, down an escalator, through the Paris shopping plaza, through the heart of Bally's casino and finally to the bank of room elevators.  What a pain!

It's an OK hotel for a cheap rate... just don't expect to be awed like some of the bigger, fancy places.

Stayed here end of June.

Booked a Jubilee king room with a strip view. Specifically asked for a quiet room away from the elevator. I reminded person at check-in I wanted a quiet room. The room was not quiet by any means. You could hear the music from the nightclubs going until 4am. Went downstairs to complain. Turns out Jubilee rooms facing the strip or facing Cromwell are notorious for not being quiet rooms! Why wasn't I told at check-in?

So we switched from the Jubilee tower to the Indigo tower. Rooms are same size but not updated (or even very clean for that matter). Huge difference in quality and cleanliness. I refused to walk around the room in bare feet. The a\/c vent in the bathroom was caked in dust. Worse yet was that after the hassle of changing rooms and moving to much lesser quality room, we weren't given a credit or refund for downgrading the room. Staff didn't really care.

Extremely long walk to get to the monorail.

I've stayed at several hotels in Vegas. This ranks as the worst.

This was our first time staying at Bally's.  We chose it for our staycation based on location and price mainly.  We booked a king strip view room in the Jubilee tower.  We booked through Total Rewards website with no problem.  They emailed several times before our trip offering a discounted upgrade.  We didn't take it but it was a nice option.  The best part about booking directly through Caesars instead of a discount site was the online check in.  They send you a email in the morning you click a link, answer a few questions and you are checked in.  They text you when your room is ready and you go to a separate check in line to pick up your keys.  It was so easy and fast.  The room was nice.  No complaints there.  Much nicer than the room we had at the Flamingo a few months before.  Couldn't see the strip from our strip view room, just the side of the Cromwell.  That happens to us a lot.  Not sure why we keep booking strip view rooms.  Maybe someday we will get lucky.  There isn't much to do, see or eat at Bally's.  They are in the process of adding more restaurants and shops so hopefully this will improve in the future.  Luckily the location is great so you are not far from much better options.

This last trip to Vegas this past week marks about my 17th time there. Never in my widest dreams had it ever occurred to me to stay at Bally's. We have walked through the casino many a time, stayed at Paris at least twice (they are connected) but always thought maybe the rooms would be too small, too dated. I had an opportunity this past trip to take advantage of a complimentary room for 2 nights at Bally's. Why not? Tis true, you cannot beat the location and being central to the action is prime when you are only in town generally for a few days. You want to have access to the best shopping and the best restaurants right? I am glad my personal reservations did not get in the way of me booking this fab hotel. It was clean and more spacious than many a fancy-pants Vegas room I have stayed in. I was taken a bit aback by the line-up to check in but I have encountered that before at other locations so we kept our cool. The other downside like any other Vegas hotel\/casino is the cigarette smoke. In Bally's it hits you as soon as you walk in to the hotel but I think over the years, the ventilation system has improved, even if only slightly. Staff at the front desk was curt and to the point, did not care much about our reservation preference for a king bed and we ended up with 2 queens but hey - the place was busy and the room was free. We were lucky at the time of booking that the resort fee had not come into effect yet - now I believe one has to pay to stay, per day. (pool, use of phone etc like every other Vegas hotel)
The elevators were quick, the casino has a decent layout and there are dining choices but not too many for late-night. (run over to Paris and grab a slice of wood-fired pizza!)
The room itself as mentioned was spacious as was the washroom. Decent mattress, quiet neighbours and good water pressure in the shower made for a decent overall stay. When you check out in the AM, you can get a nice cup of coffee next to the reception for $4. (Yikes, but the room does not have a coffee maker at all which is a bit of a bummer and I almost took off another point for this)
We walked down to the pool one day which was open and had a nice, quiet atmosphere.
Free valet which was great as we had a rental car but be prepared to wait for your car. No call-ahead so in line you go and hope for the best. 
RIGHT on the strip. Not a lot of walking involved to get outside and be in the heart of it all.
I would have no problem staying here again even if the rooms were not comped. The value is there as long as you are not expecting 5 star treatment.

We just checked in. First, it took 40 mins to check in at 12am then when we got to the room the lights were burnt out and there was urine and pubic hair on the toilet. Completely unexceptable even for a one star motel. To see that in a suite of a hotel on the strip, I'm blown away.

Don't let the pictures fool you. More than half the hotel is dingy, smells like smoke and musk. The carpet is so worn down, the only good thing about is that your bags roll easily on it.

I stayed there Sep 17-20th 2015. Because the rooms were supposed to be comped, I thought I would get one of the newer rooms like the pictures on the internet. I even checked in wayyyyy early, about 9Am. I still got one of the older rooms that are from the 80's. 

The beds are not the softer, comfortable ones like most of the newer rooms in Vegas, they are the older spring type mattress' that give you a back ache when you wake up. Same with the pillows. 

But what is really shameful and disturbing is the daily $28 that Bally's charged for a complimentary room. this is supposed to be for a very weak and slow, 5MBP, internet connection, pool and workout room. The price does not allow you to go into the nicer spa and use the steam bath or sauna. This is ridiculous. I could not beleive how cheap this company is. They give you 1980's rooms. 2000's internet speed and a pool full of pee and charge you $28 for it. 

I sure hope Caesars Entertainment sells this property soon to someone that acutally cares about their guest. 

And one last thing. Don't even get me started at how bad the payouts are on Video Poker. Not only do they charge you over the top rates on daily resort fees, but they don't even want to play fair and give you a fair shot at a game where they already have a huge edge. 

Very weak and shameful.

Coming back from a trip from Colorado to California and was excited to see this hotel was dog friendly. I have two dogs, one being older and sometimes gets scared easily. Pulled into valet around 7:30ish on Jan 1st in front of the hotel to check in. The guy that took our luggage was great very friendly and I gave him a tip. Valet wasn't super busy. I went to go check in while my boyfriend was going to take  the dogs to do their business. Check in was ok, pretty slow but lady at the desk was very nice. Boyfriend comes in with dogs and was visibility upset. He told me that my older dog was scared to get out of the car and it took him awhile to get her out. Meanwhile the valet guys were telling him he needed to move faster and that this "wasn't a parking area". It was obvious that he was dealing with a scared geriatric dog. Then one of the guys  proceed to say to him "you better be giving us a nice tip taking up all this space. You know we live on tips right?" Again valet was not busy...they obviously had enough time to harass my boyfriend. Boyfriend didn't have any cash on him but said he would come back. One of the valet guys then proceeds to tell my boyfriend that he better come back with a good tip because the car we were driving was expensive. I went down to luggage desk and told the guy there, who was super nice what had happened and he went to get his manager Cal. Cal listened to what happened and said he would look into it. He was understanding and genuinely nice. However didn't offer any compensation for the harassment. Otherwise hotel is fine for the price, however harassing people for tips is unprofessional and we won't be staying at this hotel again.

Worst stay ever of my frequent trips to Las Vegas. I will NEVER stay at Ballys again.
People on casino floor were pleasant but everyone else we came into contact was either rude or provided horrible service and incorrect information. Rooms weren't even cleaned. BAD, BAD, BAD

Like Mary T said, this is the best place to stay when on a budget.  It's right in the middle of the Strip.  It doesn't have a "theme" like the majority of the other casinos, but if you want to stay somewhere that's decent, this place is it.  The rooms are clean and the front desk were really helpful.  I played the slots and the blackjack tables and did ok.  

If you're expecting the ultimate in entertainment and gambling, it's not here.  But if you want to go somewhere that is somewhat low-key (about as low-key as you can in Vegas), come here.

Needed to find a cheap place to stay so I could spend more $ in the casino :)  I went to the Harrah's website (Bally's is owned by them) and they were having an awesome 72 hour sale where I booked a room for $51.00 a night! I guess I accidentally clicked that I need a room with 2 beds, because when I went to ckeck in, they told me there were no more of those rooms available. Before I could even tell them that it wasn't going to be a problem, they offered to upgrade us to a suite at no extra charge! Of course we took the deal! The suites are pretty awesome for such an old hotel. Two separate full sized closets, two sinks, a separate toilet room and even a bidet! There was also a nice, large jacuzzi tub right in the middle of the room and it was cool to sit in there with a cocktail and look out on the strip. The casino was kinda boring, but the location of the hotel is so central, you can just walk to one of the better ones in 5 minutes. There are not many good food options here either, but the casino connects you to the shops at the Paris and they have everything in there. I would definitely come back and stay here again if the price was right!

Has a lot more to do outside now that the new outdoor mall is open. Many forget the shopping and food court down stairs. You can See shows here daily. Slots are the same as anywhere. Rooms are always changing. Parking is plenty and new lots added. Free to locals w DL. A few new places have been built on the property to hold larger venues. Parking for large or commercial vehicles is available in the back but do not attempt to park in the garage. Low ceilings and quite a steep hill. Over all it's nice for it being one of the oldest on the strip. 
Ask around about ghost stories from when there was a fire and many lives were lost years ago!!!

I was comp'd for hotel stay and received about $70 in gambling money to get us started.  The check in process was daunting.  Check in time is 4:00 pm and I would've expected that they would've had more front desk personnel ready to check in guests for Memorial Day weekend.  

Our room had an average sized area.  There wasn't a separate bathtub.  We did like how there was a separate area with large mirrors and a face bowl outside the bathroom.  There was a separate desk with high-speed internet that I think cost $12.99 for 24 hours.  There's also another WiFi mesh service that blankets some of the strip hotels.  I was able to get a WiFi signal but the speed was really slow.  I forgot to bring my router so I wouldn't need to be tethered.  

Bally's shares a parking garage with Paris Hotel.  The location also providesa walkway to walk over to Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, and another hotel.  One or two of the people moves were out of order.

I love that Bally's is located near everything I need in Vegas - Fat Tuesdays & shopping at Miracle Mile and Roulette Tables.  Well, the latter isn't so impressive, but the former is true.  I find that every time I go to Vegas, I end up inside Miracle Mile at least once.  It was nice to be so close to it without having to pay to be close to it. (Let's face it, Paris and PH are not the most cost effective places to stay.)

I stayed on the 23rd floor and had a great view of the strip. :] Our rooms were spacious, clean and we had fresh towels every day.  The hotel staff was accommodating, kind and very sweet to us.  What more could you ask for?

Overall, I'd be down to stay here again.  The rates are reasonable - especially for what you get, and the location is GREAT. :]

This hotel is unsafe and full of prostitutes. I stayed in this hotel last week and my wallet was stolen from a girl (who is most likely a prostitute) walking the halls of the hotel rooms. Bally's is one of the only hotels in Las Vegas that doesn't require a hotel room key to get into the elevators that go to the hotel rooms. ANYONE CAN GO TO THE HOTEL ROOMS. The security didn't do much and when I mentioned that they should have better security at the elevators, they basically said too bad. I wouldn't recommend staying here. It's very unsafe.
My husband and I stayed for two nights! Very very clean and reasonably priced. We are already planning another trip for February.

They do have nice agents when checking in. However the rooms are a bit on the OUTDATED side. The rooms are very dark\/gloomy. Not enough light. I swear the bulbs are about 40w. There were no outlets for us to use. We ended up having to sacrifice the couple of lamps in the room to charge our phones. Most motels nowadays have a plug in the lamp or a USB outlet. We found long black hair in 2 different locations in bathroom (none of us have long hair). The iron is not non stick and the plate was so badly scorched, it ruined my pants. The display in the elevator was out of service. It wouldn't be a big deal but if the elevator is packed w people going to different floors, it made it difficult to know what floor you're on.

We didn't expect too much paying $30 a night in the middle of the strip but we were really surprised!  We ordered a room in the south tower for $30 a night but they gave us a room in the north tower which I thought was more expensive.  I don't know if we got upgraded or not.  The room was big and clean.  The only complaint was that it was 30 minutes to check in at 8:00 pm on a Sunday.  I would definitely stay again! Great Deal!

Wow,  this place was filthy! We had stayed here yeas ago,  and it was very nice,  not anymore!  They refused to give us our money back, we were exhausted,  so we stayed one night.  Woke up in the morning,  took a shower,  got out and the sink started bubbling up,  it was gross filthy water!  We called the front desk,  grabbed or stuff,  and left.  They gave us our money back,  I think because I showed them pics I had taken.  We will NEVER stay there again!

For the price and location, this hotel can't really be beat. This is mid strip and near lots of other resorts, casinos, restaurants, and clubs. It is also connected to Paris, which has Chateau nightclub and several restaurants including Gordon Ramsay's steakhouse. The rooms were large, clean, and quiet. Our toilet wasn't working very well when we arrived, but they responded very quickly and fixed it. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. I didn't really like them always trying to stop me in order to "comp" me for a show or dinner I didn't want.

With the 116-117 degree heat wave during the July 4th weekend, I was glad we ended up Bally's.  It was central (indoor passageway to Paris and a quick skip and hop to Bellagio and Caesar's).  Our room in the South Tower was nothing to boast about, but it was huge and we did have a fine view of the Paris pool, the southern drag of the Strip, and the left half of the Bellagio fountains.  I did wish the pool was easier to access though.  It seemed like it was a mile away.  But overall, Bally's is a simple, reasonable, no nonsense place to stay.

The old bait and switch! Upon check in the front desk clerk asked if we would like to upgrade to a newly renovated suite with a soaking tub as displayed on the screen behind her at the desk, of course there would be an extra daily fee for this room but it was minimal. We say "yes please!" check in complete we proceed to our upgraded room... Enter the "suite" and find that it is the original room I had reserved and definitely not newly renovated as the wallpaper was peeling off the walls... I called back down to the front desk to confirm we were in the correct room and a different clerk apologized and said there were no upgraded rooms available and assured me there were no additional charges to my reservation. Returning home and checking my online banking I discovered extra fees charged to my card, called Bally's and explained the situation but the representative was unwilling to reverse the additional charges...
Hubby and I did not stay here but by the looks of their casino, location on the strip, and shops, it looks promising.

Unfortunately did not have a good experience here. The shower was always freezing cold even when I turned the knob all the way to hot. There was a huge black shoe print on the tub and after the cleaning service came there was popcorn pieces in the tub. Uhh no one staying in the room had any popcorn! 
The bed was queen size but so uncomfortable, it was one of those beds that pulls down from the wall... 
There were some nails sticking out from one of the chairs that my boyfriend cut himself with. Luckily it wasn't that bad. 

The room itself just didn't seem clean. 
Although the staff was really nice, they need to do some major upgrades to their rooms.

Go to Vegas often so I've been to several hotels. Ballys is a "fine" hotel if you just want to sleep somewhere. The crowd is a little - below par. Rooms have been redecorated, look somewhat art deco-ish. It's quite a walk to get to the pool- through the shopping strip. The pool is pretty simple - a little old looking. Actually, it was part kind of nice to be away from a "scene". Fine hotel to stay at if you want just a place to sleep.

Almost 4 years later and this review deserves an update!

I stayed at Bally's on business this past weekend, from Saturday to Monday. I knew I'd be in the Jubilee Tower, and that the rooms were updated, but the rooms ended up being GORGEOUS. Very much approve.

PRO's:
-Location on the Strip - you're right in the middle of everything. They now have their Grand Bazaar shops too, so you have some shops and restaurants right there - Wahlburgers is there and they're building a Giordano's, too. There's also a CVS right next door. 
-THE UPDATED ROOMS. These were super, super nice. They're just as large as the older rooms they used to have, but very shiny\/new. (small "con": there's only a shower, and no bathtub ... but it's a walk-in shower, so I can't really complain)
-The casino: Bally's to me has never really had a theme, except maybe "old-school Vegas," but I like that the casino isn't huge and is easily walkable. I will say I did more gambling at Paris next door than Bally's though, they had a larger slots selection.

CON's:
-Sounds strange to say this but ... price? My bill was about $400 for two nights, including their new fancyshmancy resort fee (anyone remember when it was just Mirage and places like that which had resort fees?), which I guess includes WiFi and ... other stuff? Pool privileges? Not sure. Last time I stayed at Bally's we paid like $230 for 4 nights, with tax, according to my review, which is about $55\/night. 
(granted, this was for two weekend nights, but still - it was about $200 per night including the resort fee)
-My room was the very last room at the end of a long hallway (room #6040) and it took FOREVER to walk back and forth. I did too much walking Sunday night so I literally limped back to Bally's, and then had that long hallway to walk down. Not fun. 

That being said, I was totally impressed by the renovations, so I would definitely stay here again.

I was really hoping to be able to write a great review of Bally's after my last, less than glowing one but unfortunately I can't. This trip I stayed in the Jubilee Tower in 5719. While all the elevators appeared to be working this time, the redecorated room was still very average. The carpet was clean but the walls in the bathroom needed washing. The corner of the bathroom behind the vanity actually had a pile of debris. There was a hole in the comforter on one bed. It was a annoying that there was only one electric outlet on the base of the lamp on the nightstand between the beds. They also added a power station on the desk area that had two plugs but everyone I know likes to have their phone charging next to the bed while they sleep. Two beds should equal two plugs!  Also, there was only one sink in the bathroom - FIRST WORLD PROBLEM - two beds should equal two sinks!
All of that pales in comparison to the noise issue. The first night, at about 1:15 am, we were woken up by 2 huge city trucks below our window. They had set up spotlights and seemed to be doing some very loud sewer work. I called the front desk to let them know this was disturbing us and Sheila told me that it usually lasts till 5 am and she could send up ear plugs. I can't use ear plugs so I had to just listen to the racket all night. I did talk to a manager, Lupe, who did make it right (read as - comped our "resort fee"). Then, on Wednesday night we got to listen to the loud music and partying from the  night club at Paris. That went until about 4:00 am. I WILL NOT be talked in to staying there again, no matter where my friends are staying.
My big suggestion, if you want to take advantage of the great location of Bally's, is to stay in the Indigo tower. The view from the Jubilee Tower isn't worth the noise. 
The staff is friendly and helpful and the WiFi is good. They have a fun downstairs area with shops and a food court. The walkway to Paris is helpful and has more shops and restaurants.

I use hotels in Vegas as nothing more than a place to crash every so often for a few hours at a time. With that knowledge in mind, the rooms were spacious, comfortable, and free of value-added mystery smells. That's pretty much all that's needed. Saving extra dollars on the room meant I had a few extra seconds of floor time to lose even more at the tables.

Views can vary from strip panorama to air conditioner - so you might want to ask for details or upgrade when you show up.

I have been a loyal guest of this hotel for the last 12 years. Unfortunately I will no longer frequent this property.  The rooms and public areas were very dirty. They changed the Indigo lounge & no longer have the band that provided much needed energy to spark the atmosphere. They took away the affordable buffet and replaced it with a Brunch that is $90 per person and the other main restaurant closes at 2pm. Although they seem to be making upgrades, they seem to be going for the over 70 crowd.  Time to say Bye-Bye Ballys and hello MGM.

It is 3 AM now. I have been awake for almost an hour do to a huge "vacuum" like sound that feels like is next to my ear. I called the front desk from my room phone and was on hold for about 30 mins. So I decided to call the hotel number with my cell the lady that answered explained that there is a truck outside degreasing a trap... Whatever that means... She could not help me so she sent my call to the front desk where... Guess what? I was put on hold again! Bally's customer service has been subpar... And their lack of consideration for their customer pretty evident. I would like to add something good to my review because I do feel bad leaving on a bad note, our room was clean and nice. Also, it is now 3:10 AM I am glad to say the noise has stopped and now I only hear the truck's engine and it's backing up beeping sounds ... That's good right?

Great place to wine, dine, stay and play.  I try to make it out to Vegas at least once every quarter.  Work hard, play hard.  The staff at the Bally's are hard to beat.  You can't beat the location.  Always comped.  Last time had the Celebrity Suite.  A little dated, but ran out of fingers and toes to count the number of tv's.   I loved the extra space, about 1400 square feet, overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  Nice room, nice property, nice casino tables.  Can't wait to get back to the old but always great Bally's.

Not sure what people expect when staying here, for what you pay it's an incredible value. The hotel is older and the casino is not exactly classy, but the rooms are clean, spacious, and very reasonable. We pulled off $40 a night in January when we came here and for where it is located on the strip, it can't be beat. Also was impressed with free parking in a garage. 

They have cheap tables ($5 minimum) during the day which is good if you just want to drink and kill some time. If you want to go out at night, they are close enough to all of the major night spots on the strip that you don't have to cab everywhere. I'd definitely recommend if you want to save your lodging money for other things in Vegas.

This place looks like it needs to be updated to be comparable to other standards hotels have now. However, they play host to The Price Is Right Live and that is a plus. The area the theater in is not the best place for a long line for future contestants to wrap around, and I feel they should adapt to that or figure a way to rope things around.

This place sucked balls. It was infested with bugs that fucked up my arm and my weekend. They didnt even up grade us fools down graded us and made it pretty clear they were not gonna do anything to make up for there dirty infested hotel. Also there taxi service attendant smashed my foot by not even noticing that my foot wasn't even in the cab yet idiots.
Worst room service I don't think. They clean the room ,  no slippers. No robs is there. Less than. One star

This is my first time here at this hotel. I must say I was quite impressed. 
My family and I arrived at 5 pm.  Line was a little  long for check  in but I was offered a check in via email or text message. Which served me well. This check in feature saved me time and hassle. We pick up keys at a different line for keys and Mail counter. No one was waiting there. 
I was checked in quick and easy given keys and given instructions as to where our room was. 
I assume we stayed at the north side. We had a slight view of the strip mostly view of the Bellagio n Paris.
The rooms were  modern, upgraded, roomy. 
Beds were so comfy. A\/C worked perfectly, especially since it was 110 degrees out there, (Yikes). Bathroom had only one sink but it was also upgraded with tile floors and marble counter tops. It even had a vanity mirror that slides right out, ( awesome ). 
Parking was a breeze. We found a parking space fairly  close on all 3 days we were there. 
Check out was a breeze, we stood in a short line at 11 am and we were at the front of the line in no time. I was given another opportunity to check out via email or text  but since we changed payment method we had to speak to a service rep. 
On our way out to the elevators there was a crowd of ppl also leaving  but since Ballys has multiple elevator arriving at about the same time we all were able to fit comfortably. 
Overall a great hotel. Love the quick Check in options and love our stay.
Oh and the pool. Was fun. Huge area, up to 12 ft deep plenty of chairs. DJ playing great music. 
I definitely will be back and stay here.

Do yourself a favor and do NOT stay at Bally's.  Where do I start.  The hotel is tired and looks it.  The rooms is dingy and smell.  The staff has given up too.  I had to wait an hour in line at the reception with only 2 desks open and 20 people or so in line.  Even the restaurants are a total downer.  The tequila bar & grill serves the worst margarita's and the food is abysmal at best.
Stayed here with friends for a wedding. This was our first time in Vegas. The hotel was average, nothing special. Location was great, central on strip. Probably won't stay here again.
Classic LV...SInatra...GAMA tradeshow.   I really like this hotel...nice rooms...great food places....good staff...on the Monorail line....central to the strip

I love this hotel because I somehow get complimentary upgrades a lot. I think it's my charm cause it can't be my good looks. LOL.

For the price, it's not a bad hotel with a solid location on the strip. Just make sure you request the North Tower (newer one). I stayed in the South Tower suite once and it was okay. The furniture was pretty old but the fact that I paid for a regular room and got a room 4 times the size with a bar, millions of couches, and a few TV's, I really could not complain.

Only 1 somewhat bad experience when I requested a non-smoking room and got a smoking room. Non-smoking should not be REQUEST. It should be standard. A king or 2 queen beds is a request. I can live with not sleeping with my girlfriend but I can't live with my face shoved in a pillow that smells like years of nicotine! But after a call downstairs, they moved me into the North Tower Executive Suite for a night free of charge. Holla! It had a mini work out room with a bike and those hand rails in case you want to be a ballerina I guess? 

Plus, the hotel connects to Paris so I don't have to walk outside. Yay!

Low limit tables for those looking to just gamble for "fun".

The best part about Bally's is the location.  They're right smack dab in the middle of it all.  The rooms are very comfortable with a lot of room to move around.  The bathrooms are also really nice.  The worst part about Bally's is the casino, which needs a little  upgrade, but I would not let that stop me from staying here.  If you're looking for a middle of the road priced hotel with clean rooms and a GREAT location, Bally's is the place.

We could not have had a more wonderful stay at Bally's! The price was very reasonable ($110\/night, or $150 when you add all taxes & fees), the location was perfect, the rooms were comfortable, and everyone there (guests & staff alike) were very friendly. I even had some luck in the casino (though I'm not a big gambler by any means - i'm much more into the nightlife - I just played a bit for fun). My only complaints are that the lines were long to check in and out, and the view from our room (539) totally sucked.

Nice enough.  Was here for my sisters wedding and could not afford the Paris so this hotel was great because it was connected to the Paris and could easily be accesses with out having to go outside

Obviously not as nice as the Paris but we upgraded to the junior suite which was  large and clean and nice.    Didn't get a view but we did have a balcony. The air conditioners is a bit lo loud though at night.    Great location.   Your within walking distance to the best hotels so we felt like we Were right in the hub of things.   All and all it was a nice stay

I love Bally's. SO many memories at this hotel. EDC, random nights of clubbing, birthdays, wild drunken adventures, and so much more! 

I love the Grand Suite. I've stayed at places like the Signature Suites at MGM and yes, the rooms are much nicer and modern looking there, but the Grand Suite here is HUGE. HUMONGOUS. CELEBRITY STATUS. So much floor space and an amazing view of Paris & the Bellagio fountains! If you're going with a group of college kids, this suite definitely beats trying to cram into the luxury suites elsewhere!

Only downside is that everything here is a little plain -- not so much of the glitzy Vegas glam you might find at the Cosmopolitan! This place is definitely CLEAN (don't be fooled by the Best Western-eqsue decor) but just in need of a little update.

Every time we walk from our room to get a cab we always get a few stares too. I always feel like one of the youngest ones here and this is definitely not the place for the "young & hip" scene! BUT the price is great & the location is AMAZING. Main exit gets you right on the strip & you're in total walking distance to Marquee!

Check your Total Rewards hotel rates right up until the night you're going to stay. The prices tend to drop just before, and if you call the hotel they can adjust the price for you!

Staff is super friendly. Make sure you tip! :)

AND FINALLY... If you come back from a night of clubbing with your friends, you MUST check out the Mexican restaurant (open 24\/7) nearby the casino and get the super nachos!!! They're so big I bet not even 3 drunk & hungry guys can finish them! Show your total rewards card and you get a discount!

Got an amazing deal the week before Labor Day weekend- $29 (plus annoying resort fee) through Hotels.com app. Our room had a queen sized Murphy bed. We didn't expect to have a Murphy bed, but it was comfy. Room was huuuuuuge. Bathroom was a good size. Good water pressure in the shower. 
Only thing is that the room didn't seem extremely clean. I mean, it was run down and the carpet definitely needs to be replaced and it could use a coat of paint, but the rooms being old doesn't mean it shouldn't be at the same cleanliness standards as a newer hotel. The carpet didn't look like it has been vacuumed and there were a few sticky areas. Good thing I always carry cleaning wipes with me and wipe down everything. 
I would stay again for the price, and carry my wipes with me. 
Check-in was a breeze with the automated tellers. And our most favorite steakhouse in Vegas, BLT, is in the same casino.

Heres the deal - stay in the new tower!  The towers  are very different from each other!

Positives:
Huge room - I mean we could have 6 people in there and not felt crowded.
The price is fantastic for the rooms you get (new tower).
Great location on the strip and close to the monorail :)
Connects to Paris.

Negatives:
If you dont know the difference you may end up in the old tower.
If you are all about the view of the strip, the new tower rooms dont have the best view.

I got a great deal and truly enjoyed my stay here.  Definitely on my list for repeat business.  Still working my way through all the strip hotels though.

We recently stayed at Ballys for two specific reasons. One being it was right in the middle of the strip and two it is pet friendly. I have to say I am pretty disappointed. There are a few things that I was told and that were stated in the website that just weren't true. It clearly states on the website that upon arrival there will be pet bowls and a pet treat to welcome our pet. We received none of those. To top it off the two people we asked about the area to walk our dog in could not give us any information. When we were able to find the area it was a very small and not clean area for the dog to relieve himself. 

The pet room we stayed in had a bad smell to it and wasnt cleaned properly. I would expect for the price we paid to stay there that the rooms would be properly maintained. I was just overall disappointed with the condition and cleanlinessof the room. It was run down and dated and it  wasn't as clean as it ahould be. 
I highly doubt I will ever be staying there again.

Received a call from Bally's, they were very sorry about  the misunderstanding that had happened regarding the room rate.  They were nice enough to refund me the difference and offer me an upgrade on my next stay.  It was very much appreciated that they did that. Most of these big hotels like that probably wouldn't care they lose one customer, that's not going to hurt their bottom line.  The fact that they took the time to call and make things right speaks volumes.

Wow! I must say I was very surprised at my stay here! We usually stay at Rio or Harrah's. The rooms were decent size and clean. I love how you don't hear the plumbing like in Harrah's. That is BIG PLUS for me! 

Location is great on the strip too!

I'll be staying here from now on instead of Harrah's. I'll go to Rio if we have a more people though!

Like a hidden gem............for Vegas hotels at least!

When I come to Vegas I come to eat and gamble. Hotel rooms are just for quick naps and showers. Bally's was offering me free rooms. How can I not say yes to that? They ended up upgrading my room to the jubilee tower free of charge because I am a platinum member. Yes All I do is gamble! Staff and dealers here are very friendly. Overall rooms were clean although when we first entered our non smoking room it smelled like someone just let a cigarette. Luckily I had a small bottle of freeze to take care of that. Bally's is conveniently located on the strip, which makes it convenient to any other casino.

This hotel is the pits. We stayed in the newly remodeled Jubilee tower and upgraded 2 x for 189 per night. The same quality room at the Excalibur is 39 per night only cleaner. Staff at Ballys was rude, the casino run down, very "old town Vegas". This  might have been quite the place when the rat pack was around but now it should be demolished. Pay a few extra bucks and stay at the Venetian, it's well worth it. I would not recommend this place, even as a pet hotel, which by the way allows pets. What a dump. This hotel I would rate at a minus if yelp would allow it but unfortunately you have to give at least 1 star to post.

We stopped into Bally's several times during our last visit to Las Vegas. Both times we were pleased with how easy it is to find what we are looking for on the casino floor. The sports book is large, and it's convenient to several restaurants.

I don't have many complaints about this place. The rooms in the south tower floor 7 and 8 were clean and nice. I switched the room after one night as there were people who were loud the entire night in the neighbor room. 
The pool is rather small, but the sauna area is pretty good for American standards.
Resort\/internet fee is 14$\/night. Staff has been friendly.
I had a breakfast coupon for 9$ in food per day. There are two food places I could use it at, which tend to be very busy in the morning. I called and asked, if they could prepare the food and I just come pick it up, but no everyone has to be in line for half an hour.
Valet worked smoothly. I lost my valet slip one time, but it was no big deal. I had to fill out a form and had my car within 20 min.
The location is great of course.
The gardein buffalo wings are so good. Highly recommend. A lot of options for vegetarians

No frig or coffee maker in the room. Had to pay $10 a day for parking even though we were paid hotel guest. What's even worse that every time we walked through the the casino, we were constantly solicited by it seems, staff members....? Never again. I'll stick with Harrahs.

I believe we stayed in the older part of the hotel but with that being said, the room was nothing to sneeze at!!

It was incredibly spacious with separate dressing area and bathroom within the room.

The room itself was clean and was maintained daily and the bedding was incredibly comfortable.

The hotel is centrally located on the strip and when called upon, the staff are friendly and helpful.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Ballys and would stay there again.

Bally's is one of the older hotels that I still enjoy very much. They have nice, clean, spacious rooms, a clean and fun casino and indoor access to the Paris Hotel and Casino next door. It is also one of the lesser expensive of the casinos for both gambling and rooms.

First hotel stay here at Bally's this past weekend was met with a surprisingly satisfied experience.   It was upon check-in that fears started to subside regarding regrets on not booking a "nicer" hotel like Caesar's for our monthly staycation.   

Diamond VIP valet service lane made parking quick and easy.   Diamond VIP check-in helped limit the time spent in line and in turn gave more time for relaxing.  I asked for the Jubilee tower specifically and we received a 2 queen-bed room with a view overlooking the Grand Bazaar Shoppes.   

The Jubilee towers were more recently renovated and provide much closer access to the Strip and the Bazaar shops where a plethora of stores and food stops await. 

The room itself was very spacious.   As a matter of fact, they may be bigger than the standard rooms at Caesars.   Basic amenities come included; refrigerator at no extra charge.   Sofa\/love seats, as well as a desk join the far side of the room and meet with a large sized window and curtains to give spectacular views of the LinQ ferris wheel and the Strip.  

The hotel itself is centered in the middle of the Strip.  A CVS is conveniently located adjacent to the hotel which makes last minute shopping for toiletries, cheap munchies, or even liquor a very simple task.   The hotel is also connected via inside walkway to Paris hotel to allow for even more dining and entertainment options. 

As you walk towards the back of the casino though, the age if the casino shows through past the glimmer of the lights and blaring casino sounds.    The Bally's spa is much outdated providing a very simplistic spa experience.   Walking to the sports book or the pool all the way to the back of the casino and one floor below the casino just seems more of a hassle than it need be.   If you make it that far, you will also find a limited food court with a subway, sbarro, johnny rockets, and an asian joint.  

Overall though, for a fraction of the price of other casinos nearby, you get a pretty good room and convenient access to anything you need to make your stay comfortable as possible.    Would I stay here again?   The answer is now a most definite yes.

I have been to Vegas so many times and have never stayed at such a horrible hotel. I booked my trip a month in advance and requested a refridgerator as I have a child and needed it for light snack etc. Upon arrival and check in they stated it was in the room but after lugging our things up to the room being 7 months pregnant, to my dismay there was no fridge.  I requested one be brought as was promised and they stated they didn't have anymore. After being on hold an hour waiting for the manager. She stated she would change my room to incorporate a fridge. I was a little irritated as it was already 12 and my son was very tired from the drive but got bell service to help me with my luggage and moved to the new room. It was suppose to be none smoking but it smelled of marijuana and cigarettes and they have the worst ventilation system of any hotel I have ever stayed at. I couldn't take changing rooms yet again and stayed like that for the next 3 days while my husband was on a business conference. Worst experience ever wish I had booked a different hotel. Only plus is it is close to everything on the strip..but I'd  rather walk then stay there again. If you don't mind cigarrette smoke it's a nice hotel.

Problems:

1. Made a reservation for 2 queen beds, and when we got there they said there weren't any more available, so we would have to stay in a room with 1 king and a roll-away. what??? what was the point of a reservation?!

2. Customer service sucks...there were only about 5 parties in front of us and it took 30-45 mins for us to even be able to check in with 5 people working the front desk (probably because everyone else was complaining about their own crappy situation)

3. Valet not available - i'm no stranger to doing valet at a hotel i'm not staying at but shouldn't you reserve at least a few for the actual guests staying here?

Perks:

1. the ONLY and most obvious one, location.


I know they say you get what you pay for, but i've stayed at the Flamingo for way cheaper and have gotten MUCH better service, even with the lines being long


Thank goodness for weekends with your friends where you can forget about your horrible hotel experience with BOOZE, and more BOOZE.

This review is just for the casino part of Bally's. Bally's is making improvements to the exterior and finally doing something about those useless "moving" walkways that never seem to move. The plans for it look really nice and I can't wait to go back and see the final product. The casino inside is the same as always. Nothing really stands out for me at this casino though and we probably just visit because we always stay near there and it's on the way to other casinos. The staff at the Total Rewards desk was very friendly when we redeemed some free play. I'm excited to see what the new renovations will bring!
Didn't stay here but all I can say is I absolutely love that gigantic slot machine with the lever. I'm so coming back just to do it again! Fun stuff.

In Las Vegas for a business trip. Stayed 3 nights at Bally's. 

Taxi drop off was located just off the hotel lobby. The lobby is spacious and overlooks the casino floor.

The check in process was smooth. The ambient sound was enough to drown out the guest complaining at the end of the counter. This lobby desk also features the Total Rewards service desk.

The room was easy to locate. Placed in the Jubilee tower, off the north end of the building. Fifty-seventh floor over looking the Bazaar and Flamingo Drive.

King bed, non-smoking room. Spacious room with nice sitting area. The space was clean and well-lit. Bathroom features a nice walk in shower and high-profile vanity. 

Room has a good view of Caesars Palace, The Cromwell and High Roller. The Bazaar shops and side of the tower are lit all night. Be sure to bring a hair clip to close the curtains snug to block out extra light. 

Only set back came each morning as the room next door was being maintenanced. Heavy banging and thuds as repairs were being made to the bathroom. Thankful I didn't need to sleep late. Service began at 8:30am promptly.

The staff were friendly. Crossed paths with a few housekeepers in the hotel. They looked directly at me and said hello. Asked how the stay is going. Besides the hotel lobby attendant, there were few other occurances when Bally's team members said hello.

Only positive is location..rooms old & smelled smoky, even though asked for non-smoking. Room was missing an iron & bathroom faucet had a broken handle. Rude check-in personnel & total rewards guy was no help & even ruder than check-in staff. So many other choices on strip, don't waste your money. Won't be back!

From the outside you might see a tired appearance of a once mighty hotel\/casino in the middle of the Las Vegas strip.

On the inside, you'll find a comfortable and reasonably priced resort.  I stayed here during a recent business trip in a renovated North Tower room.  It featured a flat screen TV, fridge, and a nice clean bathroom.  The bed was comfortable, the room temperature was comfortable, and I was very pleased with the accommodations.  From what I gather, the South Tower rooms, while cheaper, are not as nice as the North Tower rooms.  

Every morning while walking to the elevators the cleaning staff would great me with an unsolicited "Have a great day!" or a "Good morning!"  That's a nice touch.

For meals, you have a few options. A cheap breakfast on the strip can be hard to find.  At Bally's for about $15\/person you can get a solid breakfast buffet and a cup of coffee. Maybe it was because I was there for a convention, but expect lines if you're not there by 8AM.

I didn't really sample the rest of the restaurants, save for the Mexican place late on a Saturday night.  It was packed, and the service was a tad slow, but that was expected.  The food was reasonably priced, and while not stellar, satisfied my weary traveler empty stomach.

Bally's is a short walk to the monorail, and from there it's a short ride to the Convention Center or any other place on the strip you'd like to go.  Fares are reasonable and better than walking or driving.

Overall I was pleased with my stay, and I look forward to coming back.

the location was good and the rooms were cheap and big enough for 4 girls in vegas for a bachelorette party to sleep and get ready in.  basic and clean.  i got there at 1am on saturday  morning because my flight was delayed so i don't know if anyone tried to get an upgrade.  that would've been nice.

the sidewalk cafe for a snack late night was ok but the service was really slow.  the portions are big so if you aren't that hungry, you should try to share with someone.  i wasted a lot of food this weekend.

at night getting a cab or limo to other casinos was easy.  on sunday at noon, not so much.  maybe this wasn't typical but the line was long and it seemed like a cab came by every ten minutes instead of the long line just waiting for people the night before.
The non-smoking room smells like a smoking room. You need to purchase Tooth brush and tooth paste at the gift shop.

Don't judge a book by its cover. Well, this is the time that you should. Out of all the hotels on the strip, Balleys was not so extravagant. The rooms was not up to par. We were going to be given a mini fridge, but they said that they had none available, but if we wanted one, they would charge us for one up to $15 a day. WTF. When we asked the concierge,  he said that he had no information and we needed to get in line of the guest services. I'm sure he could have pulled up the account to see what we had with our room. The couch in the room had burn stains and noticed something on the bathroom walls...something hard and white. Not sure what it was, but imagination can run wild. The only good thing about the hotel is the cleaning woman. She made sure everything was cleaned and we had clean towels. She could have told us that clean towels are somewhere and to get it ourselves, but she did her job not like anyone else I did mention before. If you don't mind a 2 star hotel and  clean towels everyday this would be perfect. But just down the strip not even a block away, there are other hotels.......WAY BETTER.
I freaking loved staying here! Amazing view and wicked cheap, I paid $30 a night and it's right on flamingo Rd and Las Vegas Blvd! Amazing price and amazing location

This place is horrible. The casino was the smokiest of them all. It was seeped into the walls and carpet. The room was old and semi-clean, but most of the outlets didn't work fully. The only redeeming quality was the location. I would spend the extra money to stay at a nicer, less smokey resort

We've stayed at a bunch of hotels on the strip through the years from Imperial Palace to the Monte Carlo. Bally's is more on par with IP if not worse. Where do I start? Well, you get into your room and it's the most depressing 70s looking room with their teal\/blue couch. The room is spacious but nothing to look at. The mattress was so old and flat that it was probably bought in the 70s (ok, probably not but might as well) since it was not comfortable. .

Good luck in finding an outlet to charge your cell phone. I looked near the night stand but that would have been too easy and convenient.  No luck. I kept looking and looking and finally found ONE outlet.

If you want some nice peace and quiet, then don't bother coming here. The walls are paper thin. We heard our neighbors talking every day. Yeah, not fun. Oh, and don't forget the lovely yelling at night outside the window.  We were lucky that we were staying above the 10th floor so we didn't have to deal with construction but our friend was on the 5th floor and he got no sleep. He did get a room change and had his room comped but he looked like crap and ended up getting sick with no sleep and working. 

The casino was more annoying than entertaining. It's so small and cheesy that I wouldn't spend my money there but it's still filled with smokers so you'll be inhaling second hand smoke like being in a real casino. In summary,  there are too many other nice hotels on the strip for me to ever want to return here.

Bally's! 

Stayed here twice just cause my friend always gambles thousands, so they give him free or cheap ass rooms here when we come and an occasional free buffett.  Rooms are nice for one of the cheaper hotels in the middle of the strip that isn't ghetto like Flamingo, Imperial Palace, or Harrah's across the street. 

Friend saw Chris Tucker downstairs here gambling in the casino when we were here back in the July of 2007. 

The casino and shops\/restaurants downstairs connect to Paris.  The escalator walkways out front that lead you out to the strip with lights and water around. 

We once stole 2 cots from the room service room here when we had like 16 people staying in 2 different rooms.  Boo for them not being able to give us the 2 rooms right next to each other the first night, but at least they were on the same floor.

Stayed at Bally's for three nights in January. Self parking is shared for Paris and Bally's and was free earlier this year, but I guess every hotel charges now. Dodged that bullet; def a star just for that. Kind of a long walk from the parking lot (that's more towards Paris) to the front desk. Definitely a lot of places to dine and shop now that they've opened up that cute outdoor food court\/shopping area out front. Short walk to Drai's nightclub across the street at the Cromwell, so that's a plus for you party animals. 

Check-In:
Quick and easy. Staff at front desk was super friendly and efficient. I think they actually let us check in an hour earlier. A star for them. Thanks guys for the welcoming smiles. 

Room:
A bit outdated, but the room was clean and pretty spacious. We had a double queen, yet still had plenty of room in the corner near the window to add a twin sized cot for an extra guest. The cot was just as comfy as the beds in the room. Decent closet space and huge desk, but no refrigerator to keep leftovers in or anything. Big plus was the great view of the Linq high roller outside our window. Restroom was clean, water pressure was solid. Def a star for the view and comfy beds. 

Service:
Freakin' extra star for the amazing service we received from one of the bellmen. He brought us our extra cot about 15 min into us getting to our room. Tipped him a few bucks and chatted him up a bit; told him we were celebrating our anniversary and our cousin's 21st birthday. Next thing we know, we get a knock on the door and the same dude brings us a bottle of champagne to celebrate with. Now that's service. Can't remember his name, but I wouldn't post it anyway to get him in trouble cuz I'm not sure they're allowed to do that LOL. Eff it, the guy was amazing. He made our weekend. 

Only bummer was that the indoor food court downstairs was kind of a hike. I felt like I walked a mile trying to get late night drunk people food after the club lol. Easy checkout. Casino wasn't too giving though lol. Wish there were more tables to play on, specifically 3 card poker haha. 

Price was a little steep for the quality of the room, but it was booked last minute and our stay was a couple weeks after two major holidays (Christmas and NYE). Buuuut, I would definitely stay here again, especially when the rates are under $50 during slow season. Location is a sweet spot too since it's close to Bellagio and Caesars. Thanks, Bally's!

I was torn between what hotel to choose for my latest trip to Vegas and it had to be appropriate for my newly retried mother. This was my mom's first trip to Vegas and I wanted it to be memorable. I went back and forth about upgrading to the newer suites when I realized our room was on the "older and outdated" side. However, when my mom opened the door and was pleased with our room even the "ugly" parking lot view I sighed a huge sigh of relief. Now don't get me wrong, the room was old skool and outdated. Thankfully, it didn't smell old and stale. However, it was clean, spacious and had all of the basic necessities. We didn't see any stains or crazy things to request a room change. If you're looking for modern style, this room wasn't for you, lol. 

The staff in Ballys were very cool. The hotel\/casino is huge and attached to the Paris hotel\/casino which was gorgeous. I hit the jackpot for $70 on one of the 5 cent machines and stopped playing. My mom won and loss throughout our stay but she had a great time. I was happy that she felt safe and comfortable to go and come from our room to the casinos on her own, especially at night.

They have several restaurants to choose from, high end to fast food. They had a show that you could see but we already had tickets to another show.

I chose Ballys because of the location which was right in the middle of the strip. I didn't want my mom to have to walk too far back to our hotel. It didn't matter because she still said I walked her too much and she just wanted to gamble.

Overall unless you're on your honeymoon or just plan on spending more time in the room, I would pay extra for the upgrade. If you're just looking for a nice, clean and convenient place to sleep you can't go wrong with Ballys.

Last year I stayed in the newer tower and it was fine. This year, I was in the older tower (cheaper) and it showed it's age.

The rooms are large and clean. The ironing board was busted up, one lamp switch didn't work. The shower water pressure was very very low.

The walls betweens rooms are very thin and I was able to hear everything next door. Everything. She had a good time, it sounded like to me. 

Free wifi with good bandwidth. So-so restaurants. Fine place if you are staying couple of nights. Anything longer, go elsewhere.

Went to bar for a water. I ended up putting 25 to gamble with. Bartender would not leave till I started playing. I asked him why was he watching me. He said I needed to bet the max 3 times and he would leave. I said I was drinking water. He said I don't care. I told him I had been coming there for 15 years. He said so what I have been here 32 years. I have never been treated like this before and never been told I had to  play max 3 times before I would not be charged for water.  Wow Bally' s has really changed. I won't be going back.

These stars are for the mere fact that Bally's has two things. Star Wars Video slots which is a VERY HARD game to come by and they have it right next to Deal Or No Deal and Clue! Second, they have the best brunch in Vegas with their 'Sterling Brunch'. I have not stayed in Bally's in a very long time so I can't speak to their rooms but I want to start a trend and make the older hotels on the strip more popular...who's with me?

We stayed at the gorgeous Jubilee king suite that had an amazing view overlooking the strip and Eiffel Tower.  We were also able to hear and watch the Bellagio fountain show from our room which we didn't expect.  Everything about our stay was spectacular and will definitely be coming back to this hotel the next time we are in town!

I found out that Bally's recently renovated one of their buildings.  However, I suppose I was just unlucky to have been stuck in the older building that is not yet remodeled.  (Apparently, the newer part of Bally's is really nice!)

I'm going to talk about my experience in the older building...Talk about ghetto! This Vegas lodging would have been acceptable if it had been off the strip. The problem is, Bally's is located ON the strip. Therefore, I expect a bit of decency.  I'm not asking for anything extremely extravagant, but at least something better than your average motel!  

The carpet looks like it hasn't been replaced since the 80s and the furniture is older than a dresser from the 1970s (the type that's covered with fake wood laminate). The pillows were flat and the beds were not even covered with a comforter.  I would NOT sleep on that carpet that looks like it's infection-ridden.  I'm glad we only stayed in that room for one day!

As for the casino, I felt that there was a sleezy vibe to the entire place.  If you're going to Bally's make sure you get to stay in the newer building.

And, if it's your first time to Vegas, you can count on at least getting a good picture on their moving sidewalk\/people-mover complete with neon lights that faces Las Vegas Boulevard.

Fix your Parking machine. Better yet, get another parking machine from another company if it's going to have a malfunction. This happened to us already but THIS time were stuck for more than ONE hour. If you wanted to park at this property, avoid their parking lot because you will end up wasting your time in the parking lot STUCK, such an inconvenience.

Very nice hotel. Yes you have to park on the Paris side, and yes there connected, but its all good.. The actual hotel, is old, but rooms just got did over, so very nice.
Would i come back here again, yes...Good overall service.

Here's my very short, but hopefully helpful review:

The south tower is no good. We stayed here one of the four nights before we gave in, went down stairs to the lobby and upgraded to the North tower. The North tower was nice and has all the basics you need to get a restful night of sleep. 

Keep in mind that you shouldn't expect Bally's to look like the new Cosmo hotel or Aria, or any of the other big names in Vegas. Bally's is nice because the crowd is not as crazy, the location on the strip is great, and you get a good price for a room.  By staying here you can spend the money you saved on ... well... it's Vegas, you take your pick!

p.s. there are no hotel fees, but there is a $3 fee each day you use the hotel safe (lame, but true).
One of the last "old" hotel\/casino's on the strip.  I am frankly very surprised that they haven't demolished this place yet to put up a super duper hotel.
This used to be great but just like other aging properties it needs a serious refresh\/upgrade inside. Rooms were not bad but not great either. Still a great location though.

First time traveller to Vegas -stayed there from July 24-July 27.
