The hotel is nice, but old. They haven't done much in the last 5 years to keep up with other hotels in the strip. The location is good tho, smack in the middle of the strip. I hate the stench of cigarettes that slaps you in the face when you get down to the casino- which looks like it hasn't been redone in 50 years. If you're looking for affordable and mediocre then this could be the place for you.
I had to zip though this because of time I had to be at other places. But it seem to be about like the other casinos I like.

Excellent value, excellent location, excellent people.

The front-desk attendant who checked us in was super nice and helpful. HL at the Tequila bar was extremely kind and welcoming, had great recommendations, and really provided a lot of entertainment himself.

I don't know that there's a better place to stay in Vegas for the price.

I stayed in the South Tower bacause a training program that I was attending was located in the South Tower.   The room was ok, it was clean and we had a partial view of the Balliago fountain. There was no Shampoo, conditioner or lotion in the room, only a tiny bar of soap.   There is absolutley Nothing included with this room.  The internet was expensive $13.00 per day, the safe was $3.00 per day, which I found crazy. You have to pay money to keep your valuables from being stolen by their employees!  Crazy!   No breakfast and the cafe on the first floor was mediocer to say the least.   The hallway to the room was long dimly lit and dirty.  The casino was ok.  The restuarants were ok at best.  There are many places to stay in Vegas and I'll be finding some place else in the future.

Staying here for a week. The room is clean and the staff seem polite. The pillows are lumpy and the drain in the shower goes so slow my shower becomes a bath after a minute or two. There are no coffee pots or refrigerator anything in the room and you are limited to 2 devices for the free wifi.

The casino- the pay tables are lower than average and the drink service is spotty at best. I actually walk to Paris to gamble because I need a drink to gamble and losen up and couldn't get one here at Bally's.  

I will not gamble here and probably won't stay again. A 3 star room and 1 star casino for the price of a 4 star hotel. 2 stars overall.

Bally's was a nice place to stay.  Check-in was a breeze with the express check-in\/out.  This saved us from waiting in a huge line of about 50 people.  I believe there were 8 express check-in\/out machines and I was the only one using them.  The room was good sized.  The beds were comfortable.  The LCD TV was large and easy to use.  The bathroom was clean.  The downsides were the furniture was a little dated and some of the wallpaper was coming off the walls.  One of the big downsides is finding out that there is a $34 resort fee associated with staying at this hotel.  I will say using the express check-in\/out to check out was easy as well.  

I did not know that you could use your room key and your parking ticket as you leave the parking lot structure.  As you check in they will ask if you are using the parking garage and will tack on the $10 per day parking fee, this allows you to come and go multiple times without having to pay at the kiosk.  

Here you are close to the Paris with the Bellagio just across the street.  You are also close to many other attractions along the strip.

Not one to write reviews, but after 3 days of dealing with the unhelpful and at time condescending staff I had to chime in. Got more than a single star for a clean room. Otherwise it felt like a two star hotel with a mediocre casino. I'll cross this place of my list of future stays in Vegas.

No coffee in the room! Long lines for check in. Smoky, cheap lobby. Long walk to get from hotel to strip despite technically being on the strip.

This place lures you with "cheap" room rates and then nickel and dimes you. The coffee thing is over the top. No in-room coffee, and then coffee in the lobby costs $4 for cheap drip coffee. SCAM.

First time staying here.

Friendly service, good rates, clean rooms with good lighting and mirrors.

The bathtub was oversized as well (nothing fancy but wider then the norm so that was nice)

Slept like a baby!
Went for business. Great hotel. Easy to navigate throughout. Comfy amenities. Would stay again

Got a couple nights stay comped from Expedia, check in was ok, valet and bellman were pretty prompt- had the option to upgrade to a suite, pretty nice, tub in the middle of the huge double restroom- room was clean and tidy, the only downfall with our stay was if you want to self park, you have to use the garage that is on the other side of casino, which is located on the Paris- another thing was the pool, it was closed for the season, but if it was you have  to walk quite a ways to get to it, threw a small mall and sports book.-cool thing is it's pretty centrally located on the strip- walking distance to everything - may be back.

This is not a 5-star hotel by any stretch of the imagination, but it's a good value in a great location.

Parking: parking is free. You can self-park, or use the valet (free, but you should tip). The valet is fairly quick with an approximate 10 minute wait.

Room: nice size, average amenities and appearance. fairly comfortable beds with 3 pillows each. No refrigerator, safe (@ $3 per day), good A\/C, TV with local channels (optional PPV and adult movies). Bathrooms are a little dated and tired, but functional. Hairdryer included in bathroom. No coffeemaker, or snack\/honor bar. Can get adjoining rooms with interior doors that can be opened by the housekeeping staff, good for groups of friends, or families. Ice and vending machines are near the elevators.

Casino: Average, kind of old-school, lots of penny slots (yay!), cheap blackjack tables, lots of video poker, decent cocktails.

Bars\/Lounges: Couple of okay-ish cocktail lounges with a variety of music, go-go dancers. 

Restaurants: The Steakhouse was delicious. I had the filet mignon with Bearnaise sauce, steamed asparagus, and the lobster bisque. The filet was tender and juicy, and the bisque had huge lobster chunks the size of a quarter. Al Dente offers a prix-fixe menu @ $19.99, with an appetizer, entree, and dessert. For a few dollars more, you can have a glass of the house wine. I had the crab bisque (good but the crab was stringy), the lasagna (pretty good), and the lemon gelato (also good). You get fresh bread and a mixture of olive oil, pesto, fresh shredded parmesan cheese, and balsamic vinegar to eat it with. Frankly, that was the best part of the meal!

Shopping: There's a good selection of shops, "Satisfy My Soul", a shoe store, a $10 store with cheapie junk, a food court (I remember seeing a Sbarro, and a Haagen-Dazs  stand). Don't let the skin care lady sucker you into buying the eye serum. It works, but no thanks on the price tag of $160 (half-price, at that). A quick search on the iPhone around the corner found the same product on Ebay for $25.

Pool: The Blu Pool was a lot of fun. Sure, it's an older pool, the water is the temperature of bathwater, and it's crowded, but when it's 118 degrees outside, who cares. There's a DJ, decent house music, booty-shaking contests, and lots of eye candy for everyone. You can rent mister chairs or cabanas. Great drinks, and cocktail servers make the rounds. There's a pool shop (Splashes) right by the pool for swimwear, towels, sunscreen, bottled water, sodas, and juices, in case you forgot something.

My pedometer showed a 3\/4 mile walk from my room in the south tower to the pool, so be prepared for a lot of walking!

Location: Great location, with Bill's Casino on one side, and Paris on the other. FYI: you can enter Paris through the lobby in Bally's. Had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower, and part of the water ballet across the street at the Bellagio. Caesar's Palace is catty corner across the street. The skybridges and walkways make for a nice walk in the evening once the sun has gone down, with benches along the way in case you need a rest or want to people-watch for a while. 

Shows: "The Price is Right" is hosted by Dave Ruprecht (the host of "Supermarket Sweep"), and is pretty fun. $50 a pop, and no guarantee you will be picked, but who knows- you could be one of the lucky 50 people or so. One of the contestants won a Nissan Versa, so there ya go. 

"Jubilee" is the classic Vegas showgirl show. You can opt for the 7:30 PM show (tops on), or the later 10:30 PM show (topless). We opted for the later show. Eh, why not. The costumes are beautiful, I felt like I fell into an Erté dreamworld, the dance numbers are pretty cool- more old-fashioned than I thought it would be, but for theatre aficionados- it's worth the ticket price. Numbers from "Titanic" (very 'Gilbert & Sullivan'!), "Samson & Delilah", and a waltz to "Smoke Gets in Your Eyes", overall quite sedate, but entertaining. The entire show is not topless, just a few numbers are, which was fine with me. It isn't distracting, but I'm not into looking at boobs. 

Probably not the most family-friendly place for kids, but nothing objectionable really. Have fun!

First time staying at this hotel and definitely will stay here again. This hotel is connected right next to Paris and is right in the middle of the strip close to everything. It's right across the street from Bellagio. 

Pros
Close to everything
Free parking and free WiFi
Lots of restaurants to choose from right outside of the hotel
Foodcourt located inside hotel

Cons
Pillows and bed not comfortable
Long walk back to the hotel from parking garage

NOTE : If you want cheap buffet, I recommend going to Bistro buffet located inside Palm casino. It's only $6.99  for breakfast with card. If you want some breakfast but also want lunch, try going there between 10:40-10:55am ,that's the time they change from breakfast to lunch but will only charge you the breakfast price.

Kasha assisted me in check in. She was pleasant and hospitable. She took some extra time to answer many of my questions. Excellent service above-average rooms great location.

Krystal at the box office was also stellar. Cheers very pleasant and accommodating also answered many of the questions that I had. 

Service with a smile. This is why I come to Harrah's properties all the time.

This place does not deserve any stars. I am very disappointed with the service I received here. I have been coming here since I was a little girl and each time I come here it gets worse and worse.  The reason why I am so fed up with this place, is because my friends and I were stuck in the elevator for an hour, and when we were finally saved, the manager charged us for the maintenance and did not even bother to listen to us.  The security guy tried to tell us the cost was going to be 800 because it was a weekend. After we told him we were law students, all of a sudden the charges got dropped down to 325. Lets just say, we spoke to the lawyers we work for, and bally's is gonna regret treating us like this. OH and also.. After we checked the out, the elevator was broken again... But I don't see them charging anyone else.

Just because your hotel is old, it doesn't mean it has to look and feel old."

This was my thought during my first 24- hours staying at the Bally. I'll be here till Wednesday.  Granted, it is one of the older venues\/casinos on the Strip. However, can the carpet at least get upgraded? Also, may we have small refrigerators and a coffee pot with basic amenities? I guess I am taking it for granted that it seemed like a standard guest offering since I've always had that experience at many hotels I've stayed at.

On the positive side, the rooms are spacious. The shower flow is strong & drain works well. That's about it. Hooks for hanging wet bath towels are absent, to say the least. 

The Sports Book is spacious as well: lots of seats and tvs--yet, not as many as other casinos.

We had a good first night's stay, but the second night we were kept awake by an outdoor club just below our room. When I called the front desk to ask about how long the club would be open, the service rep said is would be open until 4 am Wednesday through the weekend. This was at 1 am, and my husband and I decided we couldn't deal with the noise, so we called back to request a room change. After leaving us on hold too long, we called again and the service rep stated that they did not have any rooms to substitute. So we booked another hotel and checked out at 2am. None of these circumstances were in the control of the staff, but both my husband and I were treated rudely by Bally's employees and were given different stories. When we finally spoke to a manager, he told us that the club would not continue the next night, which was not what we were told over the phone. He was still unable to change our room for that night (not because they were booked, but because of the type of room we were in), so we decided to check out anyway. He made it to seem that this was typical downtown noise, but I have stayed downtown and have not had this problem. We should have at least been notified when we checked in that an outdoor club would be in operation outside of our window during our stay.

Nice hotel, nice room. I rate it only 2 stars because the bed is rock hard! We upgraded our room to the North Tower because of all the bad reviews of the regular cheap rooms and you would figure this nice hotel in the middle of the strip would offer comfortable beds. By the end of our trip we were all sore from sleeping rather than all the walking we did.

The room setting was great for the price . But remember to take a small coffee maker and your own coffee or add $10 to the cost of your hotel each night . So after using all the promotion the minimum charge for each room is $60  and you think is a bargain but remember if you are a bargain shopper  you can stay in better hotels for $70 just as easy as you found the $60 bargain price.( look at the final charge that is resort charge plus room charge.)
The central heater\/ air condition also makes lots of noise. 
I asked for a coffee maker , the manager said only cheap hotels have coffee makers in their rooms!!!

The manager, Jose, has a terrible attitude. I cannot imagine who in their right mind would put a person with such negative energy as the manager of even a clown show. He refuses to accept responsibility for mistakes and just brushes any complaints off to the side.

As for the hotel, the decor is outdated, the walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors loud & clear. Except for that, it is a decent place to stay for the affordable rates. And you are right in the middle of the action on the strip.

the staff were professional and very helpful.  the rooms were spacious but average.  the beds were well, good for boin boin but does not provide any support for your back, AT ALL.  i would give it a 7 on cleanliness.  

i was soooo hungry one night after a show, i ordered room service.  i've been eating so healthy lately....no sodas....no chips....no chocolate....major cutbacks on my sugar intake (cuz i'm already naturally high)....and definitely no oily and fried shit.  so what does this healthy chica wanna eat at 1 a.m. in the morning?  a sampler, baby!  i've never been more excited about JUNK FOOD!  boy was i sorely disappointed!  instead of ordering something else, i decided to not waste food and eat as much as i could.  the potato skins were hella oily and smelled funny.  the ribs were like no ribs i've tasted before, soggy and tasteless.  the buffalo wings were just plain nasty, i had to doust it with ketchup to swallow and even then i only finished 2 out of the 4 pieces.  and the only thing that tasted half decent was the quesadilla - i ate TWO WHOLE pieces!  i can't speak for the other items on the menu but do yourself a favor and don't ever order the sampler!

i normally don't care which hotel i stay at because like seriously HOW MANY HOURS do you plan to stay in your rooms right?  you're either too busy stuffing your face, too busy shopping, too busy dancin', too busy gambling, too busy shopping (yes, i know i said that twice) or wayyyyy too busy checking out the butts and the boobs.  just admit it, there's nothing to be ashamed of.  it's a NORMAL thing to do when you're in vegas, really!!!!  heck i do it.    

BUT WHAT THE HELL IS WRONG WITH THOSE MEN passing out cards of naked woman with numbers on the back and making those smacking sounds with the cards??!!!!!!!!!!  i have collected 30 of these cards.  layla is my favorite.  

oh!  and we mustn't forget that there's the 0.000000000000000001 percent that just want to go to vegas and make hot steamy love like forever and like never leave their rooms.  hooray for you.  i'm happy that your man's manhood is like an energizin' thumpin' tamper.  no, i'm not the jealous type because really if i wanted a tamper, i can get one for real cheap at an auction.  

so if you're like me, bally's okay - just don't order the sampler.  but if you are like the woman who's got a hawt human tamper, then maybe bellagio, venetian or wynn is a better choice.  don't get me wrong, i enjoy staying at the luxury hotels too, but it depends more on the "purpose" of the visit   :)

All in all this a great casino to stay at if you're on a budget and want to be at an amazing location. It is located pretty much in the center of the main strip and the monorail stops here. It is also connected to the Paris for a little classier option for food and drinks. The pool is good, however, no outside drinks are permitted so either pay $15 a drink or sneak them in in a pool bag. The rooms were very clean and staff was very friendly and helpful. I would consider staying here again, however, if you are single there are other hotels that are suppose to be more single friendly. 

The breakfast buffet here is absolutely horrible!!! It makes you feel like you are at a holiday inn! I ate it once and never went back and never will. Check out the other hotels or just go to the Paris and get yourself a crepe and coffee. You'll be much better off. They lure you in with $11.99 and the food is not fresh and drinks are not included unless you drink water...coffee and juice is $2. I recommend going down to Fremont street with the monorail and Bus to the Golden Nugget. For $15 you get the most amazing breakfast buffet I've had, fresh omelette, fruit, bread, meat, drinks, and desserts. It's worth the trip down there and Fremont street is worth seeing at least once.

There is a bar and casino right across the street that advertises super cheap drinks. It's worth going there. You will get a good amount of people watching even though it looks shadey on the outside and loaded for $20.

Very happy with the huge room and quality. We were supposed to stay in the new side but during check in they said the night club gets loud and can be heard from the room. I said that won't work, so they upgraded us to the suit with a jacuzzi tub in the old side. So happy
One of the non-theme and lesser known hotels but still a very good standard and with a casino downstairs. right next door to the Eiffel Tower. great prices midweek.

My gf and I like to try a new hotel whenever we go to Vegas, but this past trip limited our options thanks to the massive real estate convention going on, which inflated average room prices two-to-threefold. As a result, we wound up picking Bally's because they had a great rate and my girl had stayed here once before and liked it. 

What we didn't know is that they're doing major renovations on the hotel street side facade. The escalator that leads down to the Strip is being torn up, making room for new shops and shit. This makes parking a bit of a headache, as you have to drive through a maze just to get into the main structure. But the good news is that it's easy to find a space near the elevators so you won't have to walk too far. 

The long walking comes once you hit the ground level, when you've got to walk through a concourse to Bally's since you're actually in Paris at the moment. Check-in was done at Vegas' usual slow standards. I found it annoying that the only king bed available was on the pet floor. If I book a king bed online, I should get a king bed on a normal floor. Luckily, this "pet floor" was quiet and clean. 

The rooms are pretty nice, maybe a bit antiquated. Furniture and fixtures looked like '90s relics, but it did feel comfortable. We had a decent view of the Strip from our side room, and the love seat by the window was easy to melt into. 

The pool is a major pain to reach. Take the elevator down to the ground floor, then navigate through their underground strip mall\/food court before finally reaching the towel bar. It's a big pool, and surprisingly deep, hitting 12' at the lowest point. We had no problem finding a couple of chairs. The pool bar was out of mint, so I was unable to enjoy a goddamn refreshing mojito, so I settled for a Shock Top. Bring plenty of cash if you're gonna drink here, because it ain't cheap. 

The hotel itself has few restaurants for a quick bite. We went out more often than we ate in, but the area between Bally's and Paris has a couple of food spots worth checking out. 

I can't say I'm in a rush to stay here again, but they did provide good service and a good room. Nothing blew me away, but then nothing turned me off so much I wouldn't come back. If you want mid-priced rooms in a good location (middle of the Strip), then this is the spot.

Two stars may be pushing it. This is my first review but I feel all you yelpers need to know.....

Holy crap!! 

First day: Paid extra for an EARLY (arrived at 11am) check in and was roomed at 3:45pm. Later, I was sucked into talking to one of those timeshare people while my husband went to the room to meet the bellman. I stand there for 10 minutes to find out we don't qualify (figures). Then I rush to my room. I stuck my key card into what I thought was MY room. Turns out it was an nice OLDER gentlemans room. I ran out of there and was running down the hall with housekeeping laughing at me. I went to the belldesk and asked for help. They sent me to the house phone to call my husband in the room. However, since the casino floor is so LOUD and also because I'm hearing impaired I could NOT hear the lady on the other end and she HUNG UP ON ME!!! I sat for a bit at a $5 machine and asked three employees for help with no luck, then went back to the belldesk. FINALLY someone to help!!! I told him the dilemma and he looking it up and wrote my room number down. Got to my room, and told my husband NEVER to leave me again at this hotel!!!!

Day 2: We went to talk to a manager, Jose upgraded us to a suite! We walked into this suite and let me tell you it was meant for people who are being "upgraded". The best suite in their offerings gave us the following; poopy smelling water, tile that kept falling out, a broken FIRE ALARM, plus broken handle bars in the hot tub. WOW!! SERIOUSLY?????

Day 3: We went to the pool (Nice!), and tried to order food. But since we moved to a new room they did not transfer our credit card info...... and we didn't know to bring any cash!! Denied!! And humiliated!!! WTH??? 

Day 4: A month prior we had reserved a limo through Bally's. Ricky picked us up from the Luxor and took us on an hour ride though Las Vegas! He dropped us off at Bally's and we paid him plus a 50% tip!!! He took it ALL and stuck the bill on our room!!! GRRRRR! 

Day 5: We are getting ready to leave and smooching, and housekeeping disregarded the sign AND WALKED IN ON US!!!! Ummmmm really??? 

The rooms are decent, Jubilee is AWESOME, but if you want any type of good service..... GO ELSEWHERE!!!!!

We went to Bally's to catch a 7pm show of Jubilee! This is not a review for the hotel rooms.

The casino was clean and there were a lot of options for video gambling (I don't play tables). 

Only downside was that it was tough to find a bathroom from the front enterance.

Booked a room on the website about 2 weeks prior.  Got to the hotel and came up to the room only to find a room with stains all over the wall paper and a pubic hair laying next to the bath towel. Went down to talk to the front desk only to be sent up to another "clean" room.  Well, we got up to the room only to find the walls are still pretty gross and thats likely why they keep the lights down so low.  On the walk up, the entire hallway.. including our room wreaked of marijuana smoke. We did not book a room in the smoking section of the hotel.  Room #3 moved AGAIN!  Enter into the room, wreaks of cigarette smoke and switch the light on only to find the light blinks on and off like it's trying to give you a seizure and kill you!  I would NOT recommend staying here!  I've now seen pretty much every crappy room they offer. There are plenty of other nice & affordable hotels on the strip that spend money on keeping their rooms enjoyable. I can't believe this is a Ceasar's location! You don't have to stay in an outdated dirty hotel room with poor customer service... it's Vegas, plenty of other places.

Walk through the door and a Bally's representative tells us they have a free welcome package for us, discounted show tickets... nice ... but now you have to sit through time share presentation. Get to the check-in desk only to find out the king size bed we reserved.... they don't have any left . Not a good start to our Anniversary trip.

We got a room in the north tower facing Flamingo Rd. Nice view, but boy was it noisy at night and morning - I believe it's right above an after party club.
We switched rooms to one facing the pool which was much quieter.
The rooms are big and the furniture is a bit dated. The shower is sub-par, low water pressure, but if you are expecting that you'll be fine. 
It's old but ok for the price. 
The pool is nice!

What attracted me to this hotel was the **NO resort fees** and the $20 rebate you can mail in after a 3-night stay lol.  So three nights here came to around $100.  Granted the weeknights are so cheap ($30ish for a deluxe room) but we stayed on Friday night too.

This is a good "average" hotel to stay at, they have everything you'd need for a comfortable stay.  However, there was no mini-fridge in the room.

Stay in the North Tower, if possible, because it's newly renovated.  

The conveyer belts to walk on at their entrance are sometimes on...not all the time.  I wish they were always on so we could save energy! Takes so much walking just to get to the rooms, but maybe that's the same with any other casino.

I like the $5 poker tables!!

For the price you pay to stay here, you get a lot of bang for your buck (before resort fees, of course). Bally's is situated right in the middle of the strip, across from the Bellagio fountains. We had a room in the renovated Jubilee Tower. The room was fantastic: comfortable bed, nicely designed bathroom, enough space to spread out and a partial view of the fountains. I deducted a star because of the parking situation (parking is actually shared with Paris Las Vegas so there is a very long walk to the hotel) and the pool hours that weren't clear...that may have actually been our fault but on the hotel website it shows the pool closes at 8 and the sign at the pool says 6. We missed out on the pool because of this.

Overall, great deal and I would stay here again.

This review is solely for my friend's wedding reception, which was great. 5 stars for the bartender, who if he judged me for alternating between manhattans and dirty martinis all night didn't let on, he just kept my glass full. They had lots of passed hors d'oeuvres at the start of the reception, and while I appreciated the variety, some were really great and others were just so-so. The lamb chops and the lobster wontons were stand-outs. Dinner was steak, and I think it was alright, but thanks to the martinis and manhattans, I don't remember many details about the dinner. There was karaoke at the reception, which was kind of awesome, only complaint is that the DJ was really cheesy, even compared to other wedding DJs.

In life you get what you pay for and Bally's is a true example of this...

We did get the room for $39 a night, excluding tax, but no resort fees. The first night we checked in because we didn't make it by 4 PM, they gave us a room with two queens instead of a king as we requested. Instead of honoring it, they kept trying to upcharge us to move to the north tower for $30 a night, but why would we pay an extra $30 when we only paid $39 in the first place?!

The front desk was extremely slow for check in and check out. They weren't very friendly and not accommodating at all. I guess part of the cheap rates is the service too. The rooms are outdated and it shows. The first one we checked into smelled like smoke on a non-smoking floor. Fortunately, the second night we did get a king room (no apologies from the front desk) which did smell better. 

It's the little things like the ventilation system and amenities that suck. Sure, the location may be good, but realize that even if something looks close in proximity, it's still far to walk! 

I realize I might b a bit of a hotel snob, but Bally's didn't cut it for me. I would never stay here again and you shouldn't either!

This review is just for my phone experience. 

I called to be connected to the Indigo lounge since there is no number listed on their Yelp. The lady I spoke with connected me to nothing because my phone call was automatically hung up. I called again & spoke to another woman who transferred me to the BEVERAGE DEPARTMENT! Which is not even front of the house! The lady from beverage gave me a number which I've been calling non stop & keeps saying all circuits are busy, try again later. Non of the women I spoke with who provided no name for me to mention were friendly or helpful.

My fiancé and I decided to stay here for our first visit to Las Vegas. We called a week in advance and told them we would have a late arrival. Then we called and confirmed they saw the late arrival and they said that's fine and someone would be there to check us in. Along our drive we ran into a few delays. So we called the hotel to let them know we would be even later but the customer service line said the office hours were closed.

Well, when we arrived they said our reservations were canceled! She asked if we had let them know ahead of time and said there wasn't a note of being a late check in. By this time we had been up for 24 hrs and they said no rooms would be available until MAYBE 10 or 11 am and check around then. We asked if they can call us but she whined and said only the manager can do it. So we asked to talk to the manager and she went back in the office then said they would call and took our number down. around 1045 no call so I called and the customer service lady said something along the lines of 'I see the notes here of late check in, let me figure out what happened and it shouldnt of been canceled in the first place.' She put me on hold for 15 mins and said a room was available and to go and check in but hurry! So at 1130 we finally got into our room. Worst hotel experience ever!!

The most HORRIBLE experience I have EVER had with a hotel!!!!!!!!! 

I WAS ROBBED of $500.00 CASH!!!!!  Straight out of my hotel room!  I plan on keeping my distance from Vegas period after the gut wrenching weekend I just had but 100% will NEVER stay at a Bally's, Paris or Harrah's casino again! 

#1: The self parking is HORRIBLE!! I think it took us 30 minutes to find parking.
#2: Our room did not have a working safe!
#3: The hotel does not have cameras in their hallways.
#4: Risk Management is closed on the weekends. So, if an incident should occur during a weekend you have to wait until Monday (or longer) to get any kind of answer.
#5: ABSOLUTELY NO SUPPORT from the hotel management!!  All they could offer me was "I'm sorry ma'am but you will have to wait until Monday for any answers."
#6: Security office Sosa seemed somewhat concerned and performed a Lock Interrogation.  I called Risk Management Monday morning and according to their "findings" nobody entered my room in the time I said my husband and I were gone.  LIIIIIIAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRRSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is all one big cover up to protect their sorry asses!!!  Simply put they don't want a law suit!! 

Well, I can do worse by telling EVERYBODY TO NEVER STAY AT SHITTY ASS BALLY'S!!!

Go to hell YOU STUPID HOTEL!!!!!!!

not a bad hotel option if you are on a budget BUT not as luxurious\/new as the other hotels in Las Vegas 

Can't complain since staff is nice & were helpful w\/ our complicated room situation! (we went to diamond member check-in even though we weren't members and they still helped us out!! So great in a stressful time)

didnt have a pool open during our stay... that was kind of lame.. I think it's temporary

NOTE: it's connected to the paris hotel

We stayed here for 4 nights.  This was our first time in Las Vegas, so we wanted to stay in the center of the action.  Bally's is great for this, the location is right across from the Bellagio fountains, and next to some of the larger resorts in Vegas.  The other reason we chose Bally's was the price, which was cheaper than almost any other resort in that area.  

Check-in was a bit of a pain.  After hours of traveling, the last thing we wanted to do was stand in line for another 30 minutes, but that's what awaited us when we got to the hotel.

We stayed in the Jubilee tower.  It was recently updated, so it feels new and current.  The room was a good size.  We had a nice large window so we got a good view of the north side.  There's probably a better view if you stay in a room facing the south side, which would include the faux-Eiffel Tower and Bellagio Fountains.  Everything in the room was fine.  The bed was nice and firm, sheets were comfortable, and overall was clean.  The bathroom has a nice big shower, which you'll love after spending a day under the Vegas sun, dodging tourists, half-naked street performers, and people shilling escort service cards.

Being from a state where smoking indoors in public places like restaurants and bars is banned, it was a bit of a shock walking into the casino and smelling all the smoke.  This is just the nature of the beast in Vegas, so there's not much we could have issue with, but it did seem like Bally's was a little more fragrant than the other casinos we walked through.  No smells once we got up to our room.   

We didn't gamble much, but there's definitely plenty of that available.  There's a range of food options, from cheap fast food to a steakhouse and Asian-inspired restaurant.  We didn't go to those, but did grab a sandwich from Nosh, which we found convenient.

The pool was fine.  It's heated, which we really liked.  The music was a bit annoying.  There's a to get drink from, and a few waitresses walking around taking drink orders.  No outside drinks are allowed.  

There's access to the tram directly from Bally's, which is nice if you want to explore parts of the strip that you don't want to walk to, or your legs start aching from the aforementioned dodging.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would probably stay here again if we were to visit Las Vegas in the future.

OK, we stayed here.  

Why?  

Because there was no room at Caesar's Palace.  (Why?  Who the **** knows!)

Why?  Because it's "kitty-corner" to Caesar's, where the group of family members were staying for combination 50th Birthday and Family Reunion Party.  

Yeah, but why here?  Damned if I know, the big party was at THE Hotel at the Mandalay Bay.  *shrug*

Smelly, stinky, filled with cigarette smoke not only on the casino floor (sort of to be expected), but also within our allegedly non-smoking, teeny, tiny room!  

The room itself?  I've stayed in rooms at Motel 6 that were less stinky and more comfortable.

The pool?  Closed.

The food?  P-u-u-u-l-l-l-e-e-e-e-e-z-e . . . we kept going elsewhere!  (Even the "sidewalk" cafe in Paris was better!)

When are they gonna tear THIS sucker down and put up something better?

I used to love this place and stayed here many times years ago.  It is pretty much run down at this point and in desperate need of a complete overhaul.  Caesars Entertainment should have done work on Ballys even before Bill's.  Bill's has that classic feel and Bally's is just stuck in an in between era.  Not worth making an extra trip to get here for any reason that I can see perhaps other than Jubilee or the Sterling brunch.

First time staying at Bally's and honestly some of the past reviews had me a little worried therefore had expectations set on low.  Booked for 5 nights from 10\/13 through 10\/17 and in the end, everything was much better expected.

Red-eye into LAS from HNL, got to Bally's around 9am, tried to check-in but was told no rooms available and to come back later closer to noon.  Came back around 1:30pm, about 10 people in front at check-in line but moved very quickly.  Front desk rep was wonderful (regret not getting her name), didn't do the $20 trick since didn't think was worth it (solo trip this time) but was asked if would like to upgrade to renovated room in South Tower for minimal fee ($30\/night I think....), took the offer since can check-in right away.

Got room #6439, king-bedded, (south) strip view including view of Paris and pool, full view of Eiffel Tower, Cosmo, and half of Bellagio fountain.  Room was new. clean with a contemporary feel, spacious, large comfy king bed, flat screen TV, in-room safe AND (DRUM ROLL........), a coffee maker with complimentary coffee, replenished daily...this I must say is a rarity on the strip, and beat the heck out of having to crawl down to the lobby and wait in line for coffee in the morning.  Although a hike to get to\/from elevators to #6439 (end of the hall), room was great, and very quiet.  Housekeeping was on par with daily services keeping room clean and linen fresh.

Casino was clean, pretty good selection of F&B outlets\/restaurants.  Didn't have time to try any though this visit since most of dining were off-property.

Overall, stay at Bally's was quite good and better than expected, excellent value considering the hotel's location on the strip, very convenience to either ends.  Staff encountered and services received through out stay (valet, Front Office, Total Rewards desk, casino, housekeeping...) were all wonderful.  Would definitely stay here again, and can't wait for the entire property to be renovated.

Small gripe....RESORT FEE.  Hate to see this on the bill, why can't they just build this into room rate if it's mandatory.  I guess can't be helped since all major hotels in LV are charging this or will be in near future.

To say we love Bally's is an understatement. 

We love staycations. LOVE them. Safer for everyone on the road because if we drink we aren't driving, and it has a perfect location in the middle of the strip. Also, NO RESORT FEE. That is a huge bonus considering Treasure Island has a $25 resort fee per day! Not going to happen!

We love staying on the strip in February because the prices are great and it is the month when we have almost always had success with receiving free upgrades in every hotel we've stayed in. Every time we have come to Bally's we have gotten an upgrade to either the South or North tower. One time we stayed in a regular room as well and it was still, just fine.

For my bachelorette party we stayed in a basic suite. Huge bed, wet bar, table and chair and a nice bathroom. Bed was comfy, everything was clean, nothing growing in the corner or bathrooms and no bed bugs. Score.

Not a big score? The pool. That's why one star disappeared. Horrible poo, not sexy at all l, old lounge chairs, and the only thing saving it was a nice bar that has my favorite drink at a reasonable price - Tyku Sake with club soda and a squeeze of lime. Delicious!

The next time I stayed at Bally's it was with my husband. Free upgrade (since we are local, a Total Rewards member and only staying for 1 night), extremely friendly service every time we checked in, and the suites are wonderful. Sure, they don't have a step down like The Venetian, but this is a slightly older casino and I could pay $150+ for a room at the Venetian or spend $37- for a suite at Bally's and use the extra money for electronic roulette, booze and the Goldfish slot machine. I have posted pictures of the executive suite on Yelp and the tub is very large and comfortable -  my husband and I fit comfortably in the spa tub (mind you, he is 6' 7"), and not going to lie, everyone looks a little better on the "her" side of the his and her bathroom because of their very flattering vanity lights! Just in case you need to, they have a bidet on one side and a toilet on the other small bathroom. Just in case.

Bally's is also connected to Paris which is perfect because we love Paris and Mon Ami Gabi! Just a quick walk over and we're there! No need to go outside and I love walking through the shopping area. For the price, the quality of the rooms is wonderful and the customer service at Bally's and Total Rewards in general is more than satisfactory. I love this place!

Had a great experience at Bally's. 

Although the hotel is quite antiquated from the outside, the rooms were extremely nice. We came with a group and had two rooms -- one was a huge, presidential sized suite and one a regular suite. Both were spacious and nice. The main suite was absolutely fabulous. Full kitchen, 60-inch TV, master w\/ king bed, huge jacuzzi tub and an amazing view to top it all off. 

To be honest we didnt deal with room or customer service much, but the maids were nice and helpful. 

Great location, too.

I stayed at Bally's for a bachelor party recently. The casino floor was decent enough so I expected the room to work out ok...I have never been more wrong in my life. I walk into the room and I immediately notice how dirty the carpet is. It's filthy with some burn marks sprinkled around. I set my suitcase down and get ready to lay on my bed, I see white stains on the bed throw, the small cover at the foot of the bed. I immediately knock it to the floor and never put it back on the bed until of course housekeeping does that each new day. I really wish they wouldn't have. Anyways, I slip on a pair of flip flops and move across the room to the desk where I begin to search for an outlet to plug my phone in. I push a faded chair out of my way and squat down low, careful not to touch the feculent carpet.  I plug my phone charger into an outlet surrounded by dust and stand back up. I pull the chair behind me, ready to plop down until a large white stain catches my eye. I pause, releasing my grip and survey the horrors that appear to have befallen this sad, unfortunate piece of furniture. It is absolutely disgusting. It looks like it has been used as a prop in an adult film since it's construction, which based on its retro stylings, I wager would be some time in the late 80's. For the rest of our stay I avoid that chair like it's the plague...which may actually be thriving in the carpet fibers below. 

Other issues include caramel-colored spatter on the walls that I'm sure taste nothing like a sweet treat. The floor of the bathroom was also quite filthy, again, flip flops pretty much 100% of the time. Also the shower curtain would never keep water in the tub so the floor would flood.

Parking lot to elevator is shared with Paris.  

Bally's is an older hotel and we got good deals, so after half of our friends left (we were at MGM) we decided to come here.  

* We were 3rd in line at check in and it took us close to 40 minutes just to get checked in. 

* As soon as we walked into the hotel room, everything looked neatly placed and clean.  First view of the room was pleasant until I lied down on their bed. I can smell really bad noticeable B.O from the blanket... what the heck?
...... it's either that they don't wash their sheets well or the housekeeping staff has really bad hygiene.  The housekeeper can also be a hardworking person who is having a hard life as well... so I will not mention the person's name who serviced this room, but I advice you guys to encourage your staff to at least wear deodorant. 

* The edge of the ceiling (by the door) had nasty reddish "who knows what" smeared all over it.  

* Walls are very thin.  We can hear our next door hotel neighbors... getting it on. 

* Shower water power is poor, but I appreciate the hot water comes out fast. 

I understand this place is older and cheaper, but I dont think anyone should get sheets smelling like crap and crap on their ceilings.

Prime location on the strip
Spa style tub
Complimentary chocolates
Bar and fridge
Bed to fit 4
Spacious living room area
Mini "gym"
Enough mirrors and space for 4 girls to use without fighting one another

I think I was pretty much set staying at Bally's

Mediocre to the max.... normally I stay at other establishments but thought I would give this one a try. Should have stuck with what I know. The restaurants all closed earlier than advertised by a few hours. The gym staff kicked us out of the gym early. Not by saying they were closing early,  but instead by a guy coming in turning the TV off and saying "we're closed gotta go" then knocking on the glass and saying sir over and over when he came in early to again close early.  This normally wouldn't be a big deal but added on top of the restaurant employee answering my inquiry to the hours of operation with "we're closed, bye" at 1 when the hours state open until 3am. The 24hr restaurant also being closed when they state 24hrs, and the Italian place in the food court not making anything to order but only serving the cold food because they were also closing early didn't add to a great experience. Room was decently clean but wouldn't call it clean. I get that in a city that sees many out of towners get drunk and raucous they might have developed a little callousness to others. But for someone staying in their establishment for the 1st time who was sober the short and curt manner of interaction wasn't a pleasant one. I was told should only stay in the Jubilee tower if I ever come back. Would I reccommend this place? If you have a tight budget and want to be on the strip and everything else is booked... only then. There are friendlier options.

Being the first time I went to Vegas with friends this hotel was amazing. getting upgraded to the celebrity suite was the icing on the cake. I was floored when i saw it. next time ill use the bike machine that is in there. the view and location were great and there is a little Mexican restaurant inside where u can get food anytime. Being linked to Paris was another perk and i suggest walking through Paris to get to Ballys. Will definitely go there again and a special thanks to the one who got the suite upgrade.

Would not stay here again.

The room you book will not likely be the room you get once you check in, especially if you check in after 8pm. You'll also wait in line to check in for quite some time because their check-in desk is always understaffed. Maybe something to do with the fact that the room access cards don't work properly--needed 4 cards for a 3 night stay--and given its size, that's a long walk at 3am when said card doesn't work. One of our group paid for an extra night because they needed to check in early (8am). Sorry, don't have that room either. We can give u less and not comp you anything because we're busy and don't need your custom. Busy and cheap is the visual I want you to think about before you book a room. This is Economy Drive. You can get better deals at other hotels close by, including Caesars, a sister hotel.

However, I do highly recommend you see the illusionist, Frederic da Silva at Bally's. He's awesome.

At first when it walk into Bally's you think omg why did I choose this hotel. It's not the newest hotel or the swankiest but any means but if you want a nice location and a good affordable place to stay on the strip this is where you come. 

Due to come booking errors I was able to get comped Saturday night and also upgraded to their Jubilee suite and total price for 3 nights was $240 even after tax and resort fees. Their resort fees are $28.00 a day fyi

The Jubilee suite was a very large room with lots of wasted space. There was 2 lounge couches a king side bed, a huge jacuzzi in room, 2 separate sinks, and separate makeup station and a pretty large shower with a seat inside it. We got the 17th floor facing Caesars and the Cromwell hotel. From the window you also have a great view of high roller ferris wheel. 

The room was clean and there wasn't any funny smells or stains on the towels or sheets. 

The only thing is if you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs because you can still hear the club music across the street, cars, and also the guest next door. 

Parking is shared with the Paris hotel and it's probably about a 5-6 minute walk from the guest elevators so not too bad. 

Make sure to book a room in the new Jubilee tower, I believe it was just redone last year. People say the indigo tower can be a bit outdated and dirty. 

Come back again? Probably but only if I can get a similar rate.

Two night three day stay here ! All the reviews say that the rooms are old and moldy and gross ! Which is FALSE ! We stayed in the indigo rooms which are the non remodeled rooms they are the dated rooms , but in my opinion it was very spacious and clean with a nice marble bathroom ! The hotel smelled great not smoky ! Had easy access to Paris Hotel and the strip ! I will definitely go back to ballys for the next visit ! The only downfall is everything the gift shops, food court, & Blu pool close super early considering its Vegas and they shouldn't close at 8 pm . The Blu pool and food court are down stairs and far from the escalators and elevators , it's a 5- 10 minutes walk . When we checked out they over charged us more then what we were quoted and the lady was persistent that she didn't over charge us ! Which she did we called Ballys when we got home and they said it was a over the phone booking fee $16 and some change but we were charged the fee twice over $30 , we called when we got home and were credited back. It's not 5 stars only cause of the walk to the pool and food court and that one rude lady but everyone else especially the bell hops were super nice and the room and pool are relaxing !

I got a deal from Harrahs to stay 2 nights free at 1 of there hotels.  I choose Ballys because I've stayed here before.  Here's something that they don't like to tell you that happens frequently.  I got my room broken into and jewelry stolen.  No, I didn't have it in the safe.  It was very, very realistic jewelry that was set in 14 ct. gold.  I had it in my suitcase under my clothes. Security came and I filled out a report, but do I expect anything to come of it?  NO.  The jewelry was about $450.  Will I go there again?  NO.   Also, even there coffee shop was awful

Great hotel and casino. The food court and outside shopping plaza are amazing!  I've stayed here for two years in a row and will probably stay there the next time I come to Vegas. The hotel carpets look a little worn in some areas, but the rooms themselves are everything you could want!

This place is not recommended unless you want a cheap place to stay. You get what you pay for. Place caters to older people. 50's ish. The rooms are very dated and have issues. We had a plumbing issue that was leaking through to the bottom floor.  We  got moved to another room. Which still sucks. No offer was made to upgrade us. Complete inconvience. Not a professional way to handle a situation like this. Even the maintenance person was rude. Knocks on the door early in the morning and checks the issue. Does not even apologize for the dam inconvience. Never ever again will I stay here!

We checked in Friday at 11pm. We were told by phone we would receive a renovated room which the front desk lady quickly told me they were sold out and I would not be getting the renovated room, so that was a good start to my trip. We walked into the room and there was a musky smell coming from it, there was a thick coat of dust around the air vent and it was just disgusting. I went down to the front desk because 1 of the 2 keys didn't work and I told them about the room. I was turned away again and told there was nothing they could do since they were sold out. The next day I contacted Hotels.com and told them about the situation, and told them I wanted a different hotel. They were willing to work with me but had to call Ballys to have the reservation for the next night cancelled which they would not allow me to cancel and get a refund. After 30 min on the phone I was told I had to go talk to the manager. That afternoon I spoke to Melissa and she was very understanding, they switched us to a upgraded room that was actually clean. We didn't need a renovated room, just wanted something clean at this point. She called 30 min later to make sure it was clean enough for us. The hotel itself is very outdated compared to hotels in the area. Looks like they haven't put much money into it. They are attached to the Paris so when you walk down the shops hallways its surprising you walk from outdated (Ballys) to beautiful (Paris). I understand everywhere in Vegas smells like smoke but this place just REEKES like old, dirty, and smoke. It is a savings to stay here and the location is decent but I would rather spend the extra 40 bucks a night for a cleaner hotel room. Aside from the front desk check in lady and the hotel itself, the staff was very kind and helpful with everything. We see a unauthorized charge on our card from the hotel for 17 bucks just pending don't know if it will go thru, or what its for. I suggest keeping a eye on your account while there so it can be handled on location.

Okay, this was a pretty good hotel...  Location is good...  Right in the middle of everything.  Rooms are fairly decent, and when you can get a good deal, even all the better...  Their rooms are clean and roomy, and their staff is hospitable... all the things you should be looking for when shopping for hotel rooms...

I was staying in Vegas for 4 days of poker.  They comped me 2 nights and I had to pay $200 for the last night, since I booked last minute and most of Vegas was sold out for Nascar.  So this seemed to be a good deal.

The room wasn't bad. The bed was a bit hard.  There was a floater in the toilet the first day, not to mention a pube on the seat.  The view was onto Flamingo Road, and the windows on the 9th floor were HORRIBLY FILTHY!

Somebody across the hall had room service before I arrived on Wedneday PM, and when I left the room Saturday, the tray was still out there in the hall.  So much for searching the floors for those room service trays.

I guess at the end of the day, not too bad.  I've experienced better though.  2 stars.

The hotel isn't terrible, but isn't great. The smell of smoke from the casino permeates through the whole building. There are definitely cleaner budget friendly places to stay in Vegas. If you plan to stay here, do the online (mail and key) check in! The lines are outrageous (waiting over 40 minutes to check in). The team members were frustrated by the lines and taking it out on guests. It's not a good way to start your time in Vegas!

Very nice and good size rooms.  

Casino is A-OK, nothing great to write about but not as run down as some others.  Mostly friendly workers and dealers, and pretty convenient.

Check in can be long, they don't seem to staff appropriately.  

All in all, a good place to stay and convenient in and out if you are doing things off the strip (like golf).

I have been to Vegas once or twice a year for about 20 years.    I tried Ballys this time because I took my adult kids and wanted two rooms.   This is the comp rooms that I could get.  I normally stay at Caesars.   The casino is VERY smokey and the rooms were dirty.   Then I had to spend all afternoon until like 4:30 for one of the rooms to be ready.   They called me and told me it was ready and went there for the second time and it was still not ready.  They said "who called you and told you it was ready ? REALLY? The front desk took a long time every time I had to go there which was a lot because I had to get new keys twice daily because they would stop working(they weren't by my phone ).    This was extremely annoying. I will never stay here again.

Ok, this is going to be long because I stayed here for 4 nights for business. This was the location of a conference and the recommended location for lodging. I can't complain too much since my company paid for lodging, food, and travel but I've stayed in MUCH better places in Vegas...

I checked in at 9pm and there was only 1 person behind the counter. they could have used a 2nd person (there were about 3 people in line). I was quickly checked in to a room on the 18th floor of the north tower (view of a parking lot). The room was better than expected. Everything seemed clean and the loveseat was perfect to curl up on to do some reading.

Here is some info regarding my stay-

Smoke- I asked for a non-smoking room, but the entire property stinks. I think the ventilation system needs to be renewed.

Air- Just because it's 106 outside doesn't mean they have to compensate by making it 46 inside. The AC was POWERFUL.

Food- Sidewalk Cafe- service SUCKED. Food was ok.
Room Service- I had breakfast 2x in my room. Food arrived quickly, was hot, and the portions were very nice. However, they don't pick the trays up and there was food left for almost 24 hours in the hallway...eck.
It's a hotel in Vegas, the food is expensive.

Customer Service- very poor. The employees did not look happy to be there. No one was smiling, no one wished you a good day as you walked by. They just didn't care, and they even didn't care who knew that they didn't care!

Pool- GROSS! I went out at 5pm to sit in a lounge chair, have a cocktail, and read a book...the bar closed at 5 (but the pool was open until 8- that makes no sense), the chairs were not comfortable and looked really dirty, and there were stupid kids splashing in the pool.
Fantastic location (of course!), great price, Clean, spacious rooms (we got a free upgrade to a North tower room), hospitable staff. Whats not to like about Ballys!

Didn't have a great experience at this hotel, the room was dated, used, and old fashioned. There is a burnt smelling odor in the rooms, the plumbing isn't very good, and the lighting is awful. The service was poor and the casino was marginal at best. I realize you get what it pay for in life and this is one of the cheaper options on the strip but I was not impressed at all. Some positives are the location is good and the price is low but that's about the most I can say about this place, won't be staying here ever again. If you are looking for a better cheaper option I prefer the Luxor or even the Linq to this hotel.

I stayed at Bally's last year and was very impressed with the rooms.  We paid only $125 a night and got more than any hotel room I have seen for that price.  We had 2 beds, a dining room table for 6 and 2 couches around the TV.  We also had a desk set up, ordered the wireless internet, but they never billed us the $10 bucks per day for it.

I was not overly impressed with the casino itself, but Harris was right across the street and thats where I spent most of my gambling time.

The places to eat in Bally's and Paris (which is next door but there is an indoor walk way connecting them), were very good though.  Didn't have any bad meals while there.

When you stay at harrahs and Ballys in Vegas, you need to know what to expect...it's not a 5 star luxury hotel! You're not at The hotel at Mandalay Bay or Bellagio. It's an average place with average rooms and average restaurants and pools. I stayed there numerous times because the rooms were free and some of the other Harrahs properties, like Ceasers, charged a fair amount each night. It's fine if you go into it knowing what to expect!

Oh man, did we score.

Our group wanted to rally at Paris-but having just done some major traveling, my boyfriend and I did not have the scratch to keep up with the crowd, so did the next best thing.

And we LOVED staying here! 

Conveniently located to everything, friendly staff at check in and check out, super clean and large plush rooms, and we could see the Bellagio fountain show from our window.

Our stay here could not have been better, and we will certainly consider this in our future visits to LV!

I'll admit, I was apprehensive about staying here. Sure, it's mid-strip, the price is right, and everyone says that Bally's has the largest rooms... but the Yelp reviews made me unsure of what to expect.

Well, let's just say I was pleasantly surprised! The front desk girl was super accommodating, and while we couldn't get an early check-in due to it being at capacity, we were given a room next door to our friends in the North Tower. Friendly, efficient staff. 

The room was clean, and I guess that's all I can say about that. I didn't really spend much time in there. I would say I'd stay here again, but after staying at Paris I might pass over Bally's for their sister hotel.

The best part of this place is the location. Actually it's the only thing it has going for it. I stayed in both towers. The south tower is dilapidated and stuck in the 60's. The north tower was renovated in the 90's and is starting to show it.  My 800 sq ft suite in the south tower was too spacious for the AC that had a locked thermostat. I wanted to lay the matress in front of the AC vent so I could sleep at night. The fridge that I requested couldn't keep a soda cold enough. I actually filled a clean trash bag with ice and used that instead. The carpet in the room and the hallway was coming loose. The shower smelled like decomposing iron. I thought it was the water itself but the sink and bathtub did not have the same smell. Once I threw a wet towel over the drain of the shower, the smell subsided. The room for the bidet (eew who would use one in a Vegas hotel anyway) had wallpaper purposely peeled back and there were holes in the wall. It looked like maintenance started to work on it but did not finish. There was a leak from the ceiling on the casino floor near the elevators of the south tower. How often does it rain in Vegas?  The moving walkways leading into Bally's never worked the entire week we stayed there.

We stayed her for 3 nights during a gaming conference and we arrived about an hour after check in time so there wasn't much of a wait. Some front desk staff could be a bit more welcoming and not so put off. The rooms were ok. There's peeling wall paper, the bathroom door looks like the bottom was flooded, the shower took 10 minutes to heat the water up and the beds are very stiff. It's adequate if your going to barely be in your room. The beverage staff is a bit rude at first until you start tipping then they get friendly. The people trying to get you to go to the time share presentation are very persistent and annoying as son as you walk in through the door, my advice is to walk through the gaming floor to avoid the rest of them.

Nice hotel much better since the renovation.  Still don't understand how you can get cheeper rooms online than calling the casino directly.  Makes no sense even when you tell them that hotel.com is $50 less a night.  

What was very strange is that room service is not open at night.
I'm pretty sure I stayed here once during the '08 campaign. Never understood why it's set so far back from the strip. Great location though.

The $20 Trick* is successful once again!

Everyone should make this their first gamble in Vegas.  A discrete greasing of the hotel check-in person could change your hotel experience pretty drastically.  By adding a folded up $20 bill between my credit card and id, my comped standard room magically turned into a comped junior suite!

The suite was generous in size, included separate bathroom sink areas, sunken living room, jacuzzi tub, a bidet, and a great view of the Paris Eiffel Tower.

I elected to skip the use of the bidet during my stay.

Bally's is old, but still in decent enough shape to stay on the cheap (or free).  It's location on the strip in relation to other spots makes walking to them totally doable.

*For more information about "The $20 Trick", please visit: http:\/\/www.fatwallet.com\/forums\/travel-discussion\/529706\/

Of the cheaper casinos on the Strip, Bally's has been the best I stayed at. Definitely a cut above LV Hilton, Excalibur, Luxor, Circus Circus, Stratosphere that I have stayed in recent years.

My room was super cheap with Priceline air\/hotel package. It was huge, like a studio apartment minus kitchen with a great queen bed, couch, 2 desks, big round table. I think it was in the North tower. Comfy towels. Super clean.

My only real complaint is high price for Internet access, though I found Ichiban restaurant on P level has free WiFi.

Free shuttle to Rio (10a-1a) was real handy as well. Rio has another shuttle to Harrah's so you can bounce that way to the other end of the Strip.

First time staying here and we had great customer service at check-in. Room was spacious; king size bed and a couch. Bally's is connected with the Paris Hotel so we had a variety of places to eat and attractions to see besides the gambling. Good location even though the hotel is not on the strip; close enough to walk to. Bring your walking shoes.

For this last experience I give Bally's a one star, for all others I would say two and half stars.  So we stayed at Bally's Jubilee towers from Sunday thru Thursday.  On Wednesday night we get a notice under the door that the water would be shut off from 10p to 6a.  I never knew having running water would be so important even at these hours.  Cant shower, cant flush the toilet, cant wash your hands... When we went down to see I we could move they said we should have requested earlier, wouldn't do anything for any of the guests and mind you there was a mob of guests who were pretty pissed off.  Didn't even offer anything or discount anything for this huge inconvenience.  Had I had known this would have happened, I would have rather left earlier and gone home.  We use to stay here frequently, but after this experience we will not be staying here again.

We just stayed at Bally's for the first time, and I was really pleasantly surprised!  The rooms are HUGE, and they are bright, clean and updated.   I think I have avoided staying here all these years because I imagined the rooms would be old, but I was wrong! 

The only negatives is that it looks a little run down from the outside, and none of the restaurants looked particularly appealing to me.  But since it is just a hop, skip and a jump away from Caesar's Palace, I would highly recommend staying here.   Viva Las Vegas!
This shit A1.  Except for y'all A.C . Y'all need to get on that Cuhz & do sumthin bout' them groggy Windows , clean em or sumthin'. View is lit .

My husband and I stayed here for our one yr anniversary. Was scared at first with all the bad reviews but our trip was good. It is an older Hotel but well maintained, if you want fancy and updated, I would say try somewhere else. Hotel is right on the strip so we walked everywhere and to everything, room was clean and nice. Employees were pleasant and friendly. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that there was no fridge or 79microwave in the rooms, so when we had left over food we always had t ok throw them away. Was a pleasant trip, would stay here again if necessary.

So the food isn't as pricey as I expected, the room is clean, and the one arm bandits don't make me feel stupid for losing my money in them.

On the flip side, the people in room 750 are shagging way too loud..to the point of interrupting my nap. I mean, more power to them, but maybe make the walls out of something more durable than paper.

Oh, and you have to pay for wifi PER DEVICE. Really? I can't use my iPad 2 and my laptop? outrage.

I stayed in the North Tower of Bally's Las Vegas for a ridiculous $27\/night over Labor Day weekend 2011 on the Las Vegas Strip. First, if you don't know, Bally's connects to neighboring upscale Paris and it is an easy walk between the two casinos. Restaurants, shops, gaming and upscale decor abounds. Traveling on my own for personal business, I didn't hit the cheap buffet or any of the shows. 

Check-in was easy with only a short wait. Service was helpful and quick, the room in the North Tower was clean, very nice and quiet (per my request, always ask for a quiet room location in Vegas), internet service was $12 for 24 hours. The AC worked, was not excessively loud, and the bathroom had strong water pressure. I did not eat room service or at the restaurant but I have no doubt it was excellent. (In fact, I've not had a bad meal in Vegas even at dive bars)

Ballys prime strip location offers easy access to the monorail service up and down the strip and on foot there is plenty to do right outside. I spent some time in nearby Miracle Mile Shops (a huge mall with shops, bars, clubs, etc., connected to Planet Hollywood) just a short walk away. 

The self parking garage (free) offers easy access to Paris and as mentioned a short walk to Ballys. In terms of gaming, the service was good, the floor was lively, well lit and clean, no odors, carpet looked fresh and not dingy. Overall, I was very pleased with Bally's and would stay there again. Recommended and ideal for active couples, families or traveling alone.

Worst Vegas hotel experience EVER!!

We decided to stay here for my friend's bachlorette. We had requested adjoined rooms. What we got, 2 rooms across from either, NOT adjoined. It took us 2 hours to fix the problem. 

The keys to the room SUCK. Any time it goes anywhere near your cell phone. It demagnetizes. I mean, COME ON! It's vegas, you bring your clutch, your phone your cash, your id. of course it's going to be near a phone! Each room must have gone through at least 8 keys. We've never had any problem with any of the other hotels.

Room service: Seriously?! 10 dollars for freaking hot water?! And it takes about an hour to get it. What do they have to do go to a well to pick it up?! 

Not a fan. NEVER staying there again.

Worst two nights ever. In Vegas to celebrate my husband's Bday joined by my sister and her husband. 
Our room  was ok but not cleaned well. Windows were so smeared with dirty handprints (very large area) disgusting to look out. Arrived at night so couldn't tell till next day. 

Loud construction jackhammers woke us up at 6 am  both mornings Worse was excruciating blasting of "techno rap" until 1 am. 
We downloaded a white noise machine to try to drown out the noise to no avail. Called the front desk -nothing they could do. 

I found out later they gave earplugs to my sister when she checked in so this is no fluke!!!

If you don't plan on sleeping, like blasting techno rap --- this is your place.

Last night we went to "Tony & Tina's Wedding" @ Bally's Casino. Man! I was totally blown away! We got there a little early and were seated with some other people. Some of the cast members came over and just started talking to us as if "we" were part of the "Wedding Party" Totally in Character, and never breaking until we left the show 2 1\/2 hours later! I should have been cautious when I saw a "very pregnant bridesmaid" coming down the escalator as we approached the ballroom! There was so much stuff going on in this play you could not keep up! Everything funny that could happen in a wedding, "happened"! Cussing, fighting, audience members being pulled into dance routines, drunkenness, way off the wall jokes & physical contact ..... etc etc etc! Tacky tacky tacky. It was great! All this and dinner too! I just have to go back, just  to see what I missed!

Got put in a room with 2 connecting rooms-one on each side.  The ONLY bed in the room was a Murphy bed (built into the wall) that was pulled out and had about 1\/4 of dust between the headboard and wall.  Not to mention the 35 minute wait to check in.  I tried calling to get another room but after 3 transfers later and still no luck, I gave up.  Bad choice.

Not bad. The location is five stars. The casino is nice and smoke-free. The rooms are plush and the service is not terrible. Balley's, you are alright with me.

My BFF took me to Bally's for a mini-spa holiday\/birthday present. Some girls have all the luck! Bally's often offers spa discounts for off-season stays. The BFF and I are fiercely fond of discounts and coupons! 

After parting ways with my dance crew in Vegas, sore, tired, (maybe a little hung over!) I meet my pal @ Bally's to wait in what looked like a multi-hour wait in line at check in. It is around noon on Sunday. 

"Self parking is 'shared' with Paris." says the pal with a hint of exasperation as we kick our bags another inch when the line inks forward. Meanwhile, the staff are busy performing a very official-looking pen count. 

Our deluxe, double-room is three left turns from the elevator on the seventh floor. The key works on the first try. Shocking right? 

Closet to the left, sparkly clean bathroom to the right, a table, chair and desk in the corner and a velvet bench awaits at the foot of each double bed. 

The room is nice and smells like soap. But cheap plastic shower curtain Bally's? Boy are you lucky that I am a bubble-bath girl! Mediocre bath products have me thanking my lucky stars that I brought my bath products from home. The towels are not soft but large enough. 

We spread out on our separate beds in excited anticipation of reading our coupon book courtesy of Balley's at check in. (I wasn't lying about the coupon thing!) Coupon book stinks. Five dollars off any purchase of fifty dollars @ the gift-shop? -NO one should buy these goods. Ten percent off Thai looked good. What kind of Thai restaurant charges $18 for Pad Thai? The kind that gives a ten percent off coupon. We did not love the coupon book. 

The pool is closed for the season in December but they offer the use of Paris for pool wants. We are pounced on every time we leave the room and offered a "free show" in Vegas from desperate time share sales persons. Run away when this happens! Your time in Vegas is worth more than what ever " free goods" they are giving you sunshine. 

The spa was... SO good. After dancing all night, my legs were never so happy as they were mid-deep tissue massage...... (insert ten minutes) Sorry, I was lost in happy thoughts for a minute there. 

This location is pretty fantastic if you like walking around in Paris which adjoins Balley's. Wonderful, if you want to watch the Bellagio water show across the street. Being within walking distance from my favorite old-timey diner in Vegas, Ellis Island, is also not a bad perk. 

Keep offering spa discounts Balley's and we will be back!

Hookers, unclean rooms, found a condom wrapper in the drawer, unflushed toilet, finger prints and someone was smoking in non smoking jubilee room. They gave us another room. even worse. The manager didn't seem to care so we left to and checked in to Planet Hollywood and we were so so happy! DON'T STAY AT BALLY'S IT'S DISGUSTING!. Not for families and not for you and your spouse!

Walking in the room to see mid covered pocket change on the bed, dryer sheets in the vents and soda cup lids on the floor didn't do much to make me think highly of Bally's. 

Beds are obviously old, room (especially bathroom) shows a lot of wear and it's a notch above Riviera... Which is being demolished soon if that helps you get what I mean. 

Concierge staff is nice, but overall I'll be back at Mandalay.

I stayed for a weekend Fri-Sun with three other friends in the Indigo Tower rooms. It was affordable, for about $440.00 in total. Great Location on the strip. We did not lose much time to get from one club to the other which was amazing! The room was clean and service was also kind and helpful. The food court downstairs is a great plus! I would definitely stay here again :)

Dirtiest hotel I've ever seen. DO NOT LIVE HERE.

I cannot believe, a hotel like this could even survive in Las Vegas. It's very unlikely for customers to give a good review.

Dirty stain on sofa, bed and closet. Broken table, drawer and light bulb. I don't know it's human hair or animal hair on the carpet either. And I don't know why there are so many doors in the room, someone want a party?????? Even in the afternoon you could hear there's a dog barking at the next door. 

I really don't like Ballys. Even the location cannot make up for the dirty situation. 

Ps: I lived in different hotels when I stayed in lasvegas, like Aria or wynn or the signature of MGM, so I do know what's good and what's bad. 

DO NOT LIVE IN THIS HOTEL.
2$ tacos at the restaurant next to the sidewalk cafe to soak up the daiquiris you have consumed.

I'm being nice with the 2 stars. This place is seriously a bucket of crap. Those who think this place is actually good need to have their brains examined. There are SO MANY other hotels on the strip, I don't understand why anyone would want to stay here. The only reason I stayed at Bally's was because my mother had a convention located in the hotel. We only stayed two nights until the convention was over and transferred to the New York New York (which is much better and happened to be cheaper) for the rest of our stay in Vegas.

To top it off, the staff was extremely rude. We were supposed to be placed in the newly renovated North tower, but all of the rooms were taken by the time we arrived. My mother was specifically told she'd be placed in the North tower because the convention was being held in that area. The lady at the front desk basically gave us a "too bad, so sad" look and rolled her eyes. We were placed in the South tower, which is awful. If for some misfortune you end up staying at Bally's, for the love of God, do not stay in the South Tower.

Booked our flights on Friday.
Booked the hotel on Saturday.
Left on Sunday.

Because of the last-minute nature and the desire to not spend a fortune, we decided to try Bally's since last time we stayed at the Paris.  

Location: Perfect
Check-in:  Fast!
Room: Dated. Musty-smelling but clean. Comfortable bed.
We didn't eat at any of the restaurants so I can't speak to those options.
Casino:  Typical

All in all, it was fine but we were barely there. :)

If I could give it a negative or an atomic bomb, I would.  Avoid this resort at all costs.   My husband and I make the trip for a week every year from Phoenix.  We have stayed at many Harrahs resorts but this must be the red headed stepchild resort.   Bad, bad, bad is this only thing I can say.   Do not stay in the Jubilee Tower unless you don't want to sleep at all.   It is across the street from the Drai beach resort on the roof of the Cromwell.   It is so loud the windows rattle and you can feel it in your teeth.   After waiting downstairs at 5 am they did move is to the older tower with broken lights and little air conditioning.   The waitresses were somewhat pleasant but the front desk and front desk managers were rude and abrupt.   They forget you are the customer and it feels like they really don't care.   Watch your bill closely as they will double charge you the resort fees "on accident" and then say they don't know what happened.   I will never stay here again and I would recommend you don't either.   Paris is nice but Ballys is the pits.
