After all of these years of going to Vegas and staying at Bally's, I NEVER knew it was connected to Paris through a relatively short and walkway, lined with shops and cafes. After learning this bit of information, I will always stay at Bally's. They are one of the most affordable hotels to stay at, and you're practically getting all of the benefits and elegance of staying at Paris as well. What a deal!!! 

P.S.
Please don't gamble at Bally's. In all of the years of staying at Bally's , I've NEVER won ANY money. If I had to say where the best place to gamble, I would have to say Harrah's. GREAT atmosphere and you'll always win your fair share.

This is no better then a motor lodge off the strip actually, they are probably cleaner and much nicer. 
Rooms were dirty, had a hole in the wall, the exit sign in the hall was broken and hanging as a hazard then add most of the staff is rude. I'm normally not one to complain as the memories were grander then the stay. But sheesh, be nice to people. Especially when it's your job. 
Standing at the top of the wheel chair ramp with my granddaughter in the stroller I was spoke to very rudely and told to MOVE! We were within the areas a child is allowed, especially in a stroller. Stay anywhere but here if you're looking for quality.

Yes, there is the resort fee unfortunately.  But this was a nice hotel.  I was surprised.  Bonuses are not one but two slushy bars. The front desk was super nice.  There was a wait to check in, but not long on a Tuesday.  I did see the lines get longer on the weekend.  The pillows were too soft. Carpet definitely needed replacement (in the Indigo tower-cheaper rooms but older).  But the location is great!  Being linked to the Paris was nice too. Paris has a great breakfast buffet.

We stayed in the Indigo tower. The bathroom was remodeled and the room was clean. I gave it three stars because we always put the do not disturb sign up because we don't want people in our room. While the sign was up our room phone rang and I didn't answer. Soon after the phone rang we had a quick knock on the door saying housekeeping and the housekeeper opened the door and looked a little shocked to see me there. I told her we didn't need anything. After she left I checked the messages on the room phone and it was from housekeeping asking if I needed anything. I find it very suspicious that we have do not disturb on our door and the lady calls and when there isn't an answer she enters the room. I wasn't sure of her intentions.

Ballys gets a bad rap I feel because of its older decor form the outside and it hasn't done much yet to renovate the interior either. But after staying at this establishment a few times, it's probably one of the best value for your money (next to Palazoo\/Venetian resorts)

Decided on a whim to stay Sunday, booked a regular room but the nice lady at the front desk plugged me
with a bigger room with a jacuzzi in the middle of it. Sadly no female friend to enjoy it with, just me my iPhone and a bottle of hard liquor.  The room itself was really nice but again what's up with half of these casinos not having a multimedia clock or system to connect your phone or music device to. It's hard to reach your turn up potential without loud fetty wap blasting. 

Again nothing to really write home about with the food choices here. But the staff here was friendly and accommodating. Checking in and out through the phone was a breeze and def will be back here.

Have stayed at Ballly's many times over the years and have always been happy with the rooms and this time especially - wanted to say how extra clean and wonderful the rooms were.  The staff is fantastic from valet to bell desk to front desk and we really enjoyed our stay and wish we would have stayed our entire time at Bally's instead of making the horrible mistake of spending the last three nights at the Golden Nugget.

For the price I really didn't expect much. It was super affordable and they get 2 stars for the free parking. 
Not only was this place run down ( duct tape on escalators and carpet just to start) but the service wasn't just bad- it was out right rude! 
After check out I left my bags at the bell desk- left a generous little tip with the first bell I delt with- when I picked up my bags I didn't see it worth tipping- they where literally behind the desk- it the the guy 2 seconds to grab them. When I said thanks he replied sarcastically with "oh I really appreciate your generosity."
All the staff was far from friendly- that wasn't the only interaction that left a bad taste in my mouth.
This place is do for a remodel. The casino has an older vibe but the restaurant and shop area between Ballys and Paris is pretty nice.

Consistency is why I like Ballys. I've stayed here many times and it's the same each time, meets expectations in cleanliness and convenience. It's a no frills hotel but centrally located on the strip. The poker room is small but you'll find good action there. And I never expect to pay for my stays here! The comps keep coming every month!

Time for a review update.  See my other review for details of the property which still apply.  Since my last review, they've moved the nightclub Drais to Bally's while they remodel the old "Bill's Gambling Hall" aka "Barbary Coast".  While it's not the same as when it was at the Barbary Coast, Drais is a fun place to go for afterhour partying.  Because of that, I'm bumping this place up a star to 4 Stars.

Return Factor - 85%

It's been a few years since I stayed at Bally's and I remember it being better.  There were two similar deals on hotels.com for Bally's and TI and I should have went with TI.  The only reason I chose Bally's was because it was closer to the conference.  Alright onto the room.  

There are two towers, South and North and the North tower is the nicer one and I stayed in the South Tower.  I asked if they could upgrade me but unfortunately they were unwilling to do so.  It was kind of a bummer because it was a weekday and I didn't think it would cost that much more to get an upgrade.

The room was old and it has a bit of an 80's feel down the hallway.  If you just need a room to sleep and don't care whether it's nice or not then this would be the right hotel since it's on the center strip.  If you do care about the decor of the room then I'd recommend staying at another place perhaps even next door in Paris.

It is convenient that the hotel is connected to Paris which I do like.

Alright so me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights! On a Saturday we checked in at about 2 pm. Everything went smooth we asked for a King bed got a room in the indigo towers, nice clean room, quiet the whole time. No complaints wish they had refrigerators but then again like WIFI that everyone is complaining about they obviously don't want you in your rooms playing on your phones or computers, bringing your own food they want you out on those floors spending that MONEY! Vegas doesn't get rich by giving free stuff away!!! But anyway the Casino sucked small & no winnings. Other than that staff was nice, security was friendly front desk just did there job, not going out of there way to be a smiling happy clown or anything but for the price and experience id recommend it to another!

It's ok, but it's not the best on the strip. The jubilee rooms are nice if you can actually get them. Customer service is really only so so compared with other casinos. Also, ask for a room not facing the Eiffel tower unless you want nightclub noise all night.

The Bally is a average type Hotel but since I think there has been upgrades and remodeling  going on (at least tot he jubilee tower rooms) it's quite affordable and can be a comfortable stay for the location and price. I would definitely look into Groupon for awesome deals like we did. The pool is average but the blu pool cafe is expensive, but what isn't in Vegas! I think we paid $30 for a corona and a margarita on the rocks. Either way we only  stayed for two nights and it was well worth it for the price and I will consider Ballys again for a quick getaway!

I've stayed at Bally's several times and I'm giving it two stars because I'm considering changing hotels next time. 

This hotel is right in the middle of the strip and is usually reasonably priced so that's why it's always been where we stay. However, the saying: "You get what you pay for" is starting to ring true. The hotel is starting to go downhill in that they aren't keeping it up as they should. 

The carpet in the hallway of the seventh floor where we stayed was heavily stained as though it had been that way for a while. Also, the hallways have begun to grow a strong undertone of the smell of mothballs as you walk through. The carpet in the room was starting to come up around the nightstand and there was even a strip missing. The bench at the end of the bed had buttons popped off and was covered in crumbs, or God knows what. The chair at the vanity also had dark stains on it that looked as though no one had even tried to get them out. In the bathroom the paint and wallpaper were peeling away in a very noticeable way.

We stayed at the Monte Carlo the last time we came, but came back to Bally's because Bally's does not charge your card upon checking in and hold a "deposit" that they will refund when you check out. I don't know yet if there are any other hotels that do or do not have this policy, but that is definitely something that Bally's has going for them.

Bally's isn't the worst hotel I've stayed at, but it can definitely afford to improve. Being that it is in the middle of the strip and has decent prices is definitely a good reason to stay here if your main concern is having a convenient place to stay while you're here visiting and you won't be spending too much time in your room. 

Personally I just didn't feel comfortable in a room that was obviously dirty. It left me thinking that if they couldn't bother to take care of the obvious then there were definitely deep cleaning issues that needed to be addressed.


#7\/100

We just spent four nights here @$84 a night .  We paid to be in the "updated" north tower...non smokers....only thing updated was the bathroom (which was very nice).  The carpet was filthy, stains throughout.  Having read previous reviews about bedbugs, we did check and found none.  The room itself was cleaned and vacuumed daily.  The location was ok however several homeless people seem to reside on the grounds, in fact going into the fountains at the front scooping up the coins.  The moving sidewalk never moved, nor did,the upstairs one. " temporarily broken" the sign said.  The buffet??  Hah!  We went there once for breakfast....without a doubt the worst offering ever.  Surly server.   The elevators are dirty as well as the urine smelled parkade.   This place is old, old, old and looks it, smells like it.  No wifi...unless big $$.Count us as "never to return" patrons.

First, let me say that I'm a bit grumpy about Las Vegas in general. But this is about the hotel at Bally's. We stayed in the Indigo tower. I'm assuming this hasn't been renovated recently. Not sure. It didn't look run down. But the features of the bathroom and the lack of convenient electrical outlets reminded me of bygone eras. The room was clean. But there was a scent of mildew, so I could tell there'd been water damage. The shower is a bathtub with a shower curtain. Ugh. They really need to install a proper shower. There is no fan in the bathroom, so the things you don't want in a bathroom linger. Humidity, smells, etc. The Air Conditioner BLASTS air loudly and forcefully into the room. It's very uncomfortable to have cold air blown over you periodically through the night. The bed was fairly comfortable, with the exception of the pillows which were like spongey balls. It was very difficult to sleep with my head bobbling around trying to stay on top of the pillow without sliding off. There were three pillows on the bed and all three were terrible. The outlets in the room were NOT located with the modern traveler in mind. I travel with a little power strip so we can plug in our phones near the bed. But if I hadn't had that thing, they would have been on the floor, far away from either bed because they didn't leave any accessible outlets near the bed. I had to move the bedside table and unplug the alarm clock in order to plug in the power strip. 

The elevators were clean and fast and quiet. Very good for a tall hotel. The hallways were clean, bright and wide. The vending machines were irritating. I had to go to four different floors to find one that would take $1 or $5 bills. I'm NOT going to put a credit card into a hotel vending machine. Ever. And a few of those said bills only and then wouldn't take them.

The housekeeping was competent although not very detailed. 

Checkin was a bit ridiculous. It shouldn't be that slow to check people in. Hell, you could do it with an automated system. If an airline can check you in on your phone in two minutes, surely a hotel could manage to do it in 5.

The food court has comfortable seating. The hotel signage is good. The staff seems friendly. I didn't eat at the restaurants, except for the food court. 

The price of wi-fi is outrageous considering you have to pay per device. It's not unreasonable that a couple might have two phones and a laptop or tablet. So that would be nearly $40 a day. That's unreasonable.

We stayed at Bally's 11\/27-12\/1, over the Thanksgiving holiday. Parking was free and easy to access. The women who checked us in was unhelpful and rude. Though we had several more interactions with the staff and they were nice. We stayed in a average room (not a remodeled one) but it was large and clean. We booked through the hotels website and had an average $55 a night rate with a $35 food and beverage credit (which could only be used at 4 places). For price and location of this hotel, I don't think you can really go wrong. It's perfectly placed on the strip which makes walking the thing all day long so much more manageable. Also, it's so close to all the really expensive hotels. We really didn't spend any time at Bally's expect for when when we were heading in for the night, which was all we needed it for.

Horrible experience at Bally's!  I checked in and back out of the hotel within one hour.  

I booked a room here as my continuing education conference was being held at Bally's.  I e-checked in online, however, when I arrived at the hotel and attempted to use the e-check in kiosk, I was informed my room wasn't ready; at 10:00 PM.  I had to get in a long line at regular check in and wait while they found a different room that was available.  Being exhausted from my flight, I really didn't appreciate this delay.

Once I got to my room, I was appalled at the condition and lack of cleanliness.  Lampshades were askew.  The carpet was filthy and worn.  The beds did not have proper comforters (I was told this is due to "hygiene" -- have never stayed in a hotel that withheld comforters from the beds).  My "nonsmoking room" reeked of stale cigarette smoke.  The room was freezing but there was no way to control the temperature from the room.  I called the front desk and they said they'd have to track down an engineer to send to the room and weren't sure when that would be.  I attempted to connect to WiFi, but that wasn't happening.  It took calling the front desk and being transferred three times, ultimately to an outsourced IT company to reach a connection.

I called the Bellagio across the street, who fortunately had rooms, and checked right out of Bally's.  I'm spending roughly $50 more per night there (at the AAA rate) and it's a night and day difference.

I have stayed at most of the Vegas strip hotels and here are my thoughts.

I think that this location was OK.  With hotels being built all around, it's getting much better.

The hotel is a bit small and seems to draw an older crowd.  There is really nothing special about this hotel and has really no big draw.  

This is a favorite hotel for business people for some reason.

TIP: If you decide to stay at this hotel, request to stay in the original tower vs. the newer one.  You will enjoy the bigger sized room for the same price.

What a wonderful stay!  Stayed for 6 nights and was very impressed overall with the cleanliness, service, and casino!  The valet was especially efficient given we used our car everyday, easy in and easy out.  Housekeeping was on point and overstocked all of our towels and supplies.  The 24 hour Subway and Sbarro is a bonus for anytime meals.  All around a perfect stay!

+ Cheap
+ Clean
+ Conveniently located to Paris, Bellagio, shops

- Toilet made horrible noise when being flushed
- Old hotel vibe and smokey smell

My 5th time being to vegas and decided to give the Ballys hotel a shot. Its location is pretty much in the center of the strip making it an easy access to shops, bars, casinos etc. Honestly I enjoyed my stay here! Rooms were clean and bigger than I expected them to be for booking a basic room. Had a nice view of the strip and a comfortable nights rest. Mainly booked this hotel because of its location. If you could care less about the room and are more caring about location, this is your spot. Def will be booking again in the near future, till next time vegas!

If we were just to talk location, I would give Ballys five stars. Its central to the Strip and walking distance to most of the newer and nicer hotels you'd want to check out. I liked how the room elevators were close to the entrances for easy access to taxis, valet, and shuttles. The moving walkway also takes you directly to the strip. Unlike some of the other hotels, I didn't feel like I was walking miles through some gigantic maze. Checking in and out was quick and relatively painless. Thumbs up.

We booked rooms in the older South Tower. The rooms were clean and spacious but definitely outdated in terms of not having adequate lighting, old bathroom fixtures, and tiny tube TV. There was also no bathroom exhaust fan to help defog mirrors after showering or air out a room after going number 2 (lol).

So on top of the the elevator issue . I get an email from the hotel telling me that all the money I spent for the  show tickets to one of their other casino is not valid and they won't be able to give the points for them . really not happy with them now and I never got a call back from anyone from the casino . I won't be back !

I came to Bally's this past week with a large group of people. It served us well with a decent clean room. Our tastes were varied and we managed to eat in two of the restaurants in the hotel.

 I loved the Tequila Bar's food prices. The cup of chilli was actually to big as it was served in a bowl. I felt that I wasted perfectly good food. It was delicious. I did not want that amount. The only issue was the bar across the way had loud music. When I want a conversation with someone, I want to hear them well.

 I went to the Sidewalk Cafe twice. Once for a late lunch. Once you are inside you enjoy the quiet atmosphere. The buffet is small but well worth it. I do not eat pasta so I chose a breakfast plate with fresh fruit and muffins. I brought four muffins to my room to share. The morning breakfast buffet was decent with a lot of the usual items. 
I was in the North Tower where the attention to detail of the housekeeping department was outstanding. 

There is smoking in the casino and as a non-smoker I notice it. 

We had a great luncheon served quickly and courteously. The rooms for the conference had cold water available. I loved that option.

It was easy to get around. Valet was excellent and very helpful.

I totally enjoyed my days at Bally's.

Well decided I would do another ballys review. I just stayed here june 27-july 4th 2013. I still love the hotel as much as I did before but there have been changes since my December review. 1.) All cet properties have resort fees now so though it sucks,...it's life. 2.) A whole new look to the food court now. 

I seriously was shocked when I saw the new food court. It was really cool looking, sbarros is back, nathans is back, and they added a johnny rockets. Really good look they got going on. The 6 months of construction were worth it lol. 

Still love the rooms at ballys. No other hotel on the strip can you get giant sized (almost suite like) rooms for a low price. Rooms always are well furnished and clean. Room service is fast and efficient. 

Casino is still tight as hell but we are on the las vegas strip mind you. Wanna win 50% of the time?....go to Reno or go to fremont street. I still think this casino has one of the better vibes on the strip. 

God I love those big ass red chairs they put in the corner of every ballys room.There have been times when I slept in those chairs.

If you're looking to stay at a central spot on the Strip without shelling out buko bucks, seriously consider Bally's. It's across from Bellagio and right next to Paris, and is within walking distance to all the other favorite spots (including the Forum Shops at Caesars). 

Just as Monica F. noted, the standard rooms are VERY spacious. The room was clean and looked pretty modern. Not sure when they updated this place, but it was looking good! The only downside to our room was that it was located at the very end of an unusually long hallway. This was not good when we were walking to our room - wincing in pain from our too high heels - from a long night of drinking and dancing. 

If I'm ballin' on a budget in Vegas again, I will seriously consider a return stay at Bally's. It's a wise spot for those looking to spend most of their time out and about, rather than holed up in the hotel's confines. You just need a spot to lie your head, right?

We checked in with no problem.  The guest services guy looked at my ID when I checked in and told him it was my wedding anniversary.  So,  guess what he did...gave me an upgraded room...A SUITE!!!!!! WOO-HOO!!!!! Not too bad for being a local resident and being NICE! we ordered room service and that was sooooo awesome.   I looooved my time at Bally's.

This review is for the new jubilee tower rooms they just opened up in September 2013. I was very impressed by the makeover. New beds, new decor. Totally redesigned bathroom. No tub just a larger shower. There's a refrigerator in the room  which I think is great especially if you come in summer. Ballys rooms are pretty large, at least 40% bigger than Paris. 

They also have a nice quiet factor, no thin walls. So you can get a good sleep. 
This is gonna be my new go to hotel in Vegas. They just need to remodel the casino.

This is a big tip, if u want a good night sleep then you need to make sure you don't get a room facing the Cromwell casino due to the drais after night club there the music is blaring in your room with the base thumping.  
I believe if you get a room that has odd number not even then your good but if you a room in the even number in the jubilee tower your gonna get a lot of music noise.  

Now the only draw back you won't get a room with a strip view but I prefer a good sound sleep over a great view who cares about the strip view bunch of lights and casinos. You want a view then go up the Eiffel Tower at Paris casino or stratosphere casino observation tower.

If I could give this hotel zero stars I would. First, the room service.  They don't serve dinner, lunch ends at 1, there's an hour wait and oh, they charge you $8 for delivery. The $15 burger ends up being cold and costing you $25.  Next is Valet.  They pick and chose who gets to enter, rude valet people, long waits and hotel guests don't have priority. Lastly, the check out. There are only two clerks working rush hour...who manages this poor excuse for a Vegas hotel?  Never again. I'll stick with Planet Hollywood next time I'm in town.

If I could give zero I would. Wanted to see Elton John and was told had to stay at one of their properties to go to the show. Total lie. Paid $228 for a room in the "New" Tower, LOUD!!! The disco  goes until 5am! I told the person at check in, need a quiet room, early meeting. Tried to get room service 45 minute wait. So no sleep, no food, this place SUCKS!!!!

Called manager at 4:20 am to complain........let's see.

In my quest to become Elite, I am drafting my first review on Yelp.  I will be helped by the trusty toy soldier my son gave me named Captain Clarence Checkin (aka Captain Chaos).  So here we go:

Pros:
Checking in was pretty straight forward. From the time I arrived to the time I was in my room took about 10 minutes. Granted,  I arrived 9pm on a Monday, but I was still happy with the fast check in. 

When I opened the door, I was impressed by the size of the room. By far, it was the biggest hotel room I've been in without upgrading. 
Although I was in the north tower,  I still had a decent view of the strip. Captain Chaos took a couple of pictures by the window with a sweet view of the Bellagio fountains. The bed was nice and the bathroom was adequate. 

Cons:
One thing I wasn't expecting was all the extra charges to stay here! When I checked in, I asked where the gym was located because I wanted to get some working out in ti maintain my masculine physique!  The front desk rep said "the gym is past the north towers and to use them requires an upgrade. "  Upgrade?!?! $22\/day. Wack!  But I was OK with the fee because I heard the gym was pretty sweet. So I asked the front desk to upgrade me because I wanted to work out after I finished checking in. "Sir, the gym hours are from 6am to 6pm."  Ha. What? Excuse me? ....... That's wack!  I understand that a lot of people go to Vegas to have fun and party, but Vegas is also known for conventions.  If someone attending a convention wants to work out, it is not going to happen if you stay at Bally's. But hey, the restaurants are open all night.   

The next issue was the room wifi. They actually charge $13 a day to use in room wifi. Wack!  I've been to smaller non-resort type hotels that not only offer free wifi, but give you breakfast as well!  But hey, I needed the wifi to access some files on my work's network. Btu the in room wifi has horrible connectivity!   I was constantly dealing with dropped signals and slow connection speed. Argh.

Finally,  the room itself had some issues. There wasn't enough outlets by the bed so I had to charge my phones and plug in my laptop across the room. Makes it hard to do work in bed without the lap top's battery dying. Next, the wallpaper was peeling off in several locations in the room. Seemed kind of strange considering Bally's is a resort hotel.  

All things considered,  Bally's room was average,  but the people who helped me were nice. The room rate was relatively low and you are right on the strip, so I think I would stay here again.  

Word

Bonsoir Ballys

IT'S been a while...When I arrive in your hotel it wasn't the sane...You where a Five Star..Not sure what..  Very smoky and customer service wasn't a pleasure at all....

Merci

This hotel is a good value for where it is on the strip. The rooms are clean and more than appropriate for the price. The casino is pretty smoky...even by Vegas standards. The food doesn't have much to offer in my opinion. I tried the breakfast and it wasn't great and wasn't bad. All in all, I will stay there again because of the price and location on the strip.

The pros are the spacious room, cleanliness, and great A\/C. Great because it worked well and wasn't noisy. 

The cons are the looooooooooooooooong walk from parking to lobby including the casino- this coming from someone who is in good shape and walks and runs regularly.  I don't wish to do such hikes after a 6 hour drive across the desert though.

Also the rooms don't have a fridge or microwave without a request and a $15 daily fee. And that's only for a fridge, no microwave.

Additionally there is no room service after 1:00pm! 

Also, on a personal preference note, apparently i no longer enjoy being right on the strip and I do not (never did, really) like casinos.  With that said, next time i'm in town for whatever reason, this time it was to see Iron Maiden, i will be staying off strip, probably at the Embassy Suites.

Had a wonderful Valentine's Day overnight and overall experience at Bally's. My July 10 check in went smoothly and I was delighted to receive a free upgrade. Both were Travelzoo deals. All was fun and games until it was about time to check out the next day.  At the very least, basic housekeeping expected at any hotel would be a clean toilet. Prior to checkout I lifted the toilet seat to ensure all was flushed as is my morning ritual at home and away. Common courtesy at our home is to use toilet tissue or Lysol wipes to remove any "debris" that may have splashed onto the seat. Pardon my disgusting mention but think it is relevant.  Imagine my horror when I discovered what must have been weeks worth of dried up\/ caked-on urine on the underside of that toilet seat. I was nauseated to think I had been sitting on that seat. How can housekeeping neglect to lift a toilet seat to simply run a scrub brush every time they clean a room? I have photos of the seat  that I snapped before leaving as I found this unbelievable, but they are gross and can't imagine YELP would want posted.
 I also phoned and spoke with a Housekeeping Manager and advised that I was checking out  but wanted him to be aware of the situation so that it did not traumatize another guest. At the urging of relatives, I did decide to email Caesars Customer Service today in the hope that all of their housekeeping staff is given a refresher course that lifting a toilet seat to clean after each guest is basic housekeeping 101.

Certain things were good but only mediocre at most. I was here five days before and after New Years. It's pretty obvious they do not treat their employees well and it comes through no matter how hard "they" try. I won't even go into the broken elevator fiasco here, which was the same for my October visit. Second rate hotel all the way.  Run down. Old broken-spirited employees, failing restaurant venues.

We were in the older south tower. After reading previous reviews I was nervous. However, the room was clean and rather large. The easy access to the fancier hotels was great! This is a great property if you plan on visiting as many casinos as possible. My only complaint is the huge turbines on top of the parking structures below my room. THEY WERE LOUD! Even after a night of drinking it was hard to get to sleep. Not sure if being on the strip side would've been more quiet!

WARNING: RIPOFF VENDOR IN BALLY'S HOTEL!!  I was there for the WSOP tournament in early March and at the bottom of the stairs to the room (across from the Nosh eatery) is a small kiosk\/vendor that sells poker chips, cards, games, etc. I purchased a pack of gold playing cards for $30 (originally $99, which he showed me on the computer). Well, THIS IS A TOTAL RIPOFF!!!  I found the exact same cards downtown for $5.99!!!  I bought a few packs there and went back to tell them and some smart-ass kid running the booth just smiled and told me to just buy them there and the price wasn't going to change. We priced other items downtown and found the same thing true for several items this kiosk was selling. Shame on you Bally's\/Ceasar's for allowing such a rude, disrespectful, and total ripoff vendor in your hotel.

Had a great time at Bally's this past weekend. 

First of all, Bally's location is great since it's smack dab in the middle of the strip. You're right across the street from Bellagio for those fountains, across the corner from Caesar's for Omnia, right next to Cromwell for Drai's, and only an intersection away from Planet Hollywood for some eating and shopping. You're also attached to Paris too but I don't know why people go there.

The casino was clean and smelled clean instead of like stale cigarettes. All the employees I came across were super friendly also. Miguel helped us check in and he hooked it up. I booked a Jubilee room and when we checked in around 9:30 PM on Friday, he apologized that there were none available except the handicap version. He offered a room change on Saturday morning for the 23rd floor. The views were pretty great in both rooms but of course the 23rd floor room's view was a lot better since it faced the rest of the strip in the southern direction. The handicap room was on the 6th floor and faced the LINQ ferris wheel. The handicap room was 1.5x the size of the regular room though and was right next to the elevator so both rooms were both great in their own ways. I wouldn't have minded if we were stuck in the disability room all weekend, especially when our feet were dying after the nightclubs. Just like the casino, the rooms seemed clean and well-kept. There is an iHome in the room but it only has a 30-pin connector (iPhone 4S and earlier) but luckily I had a 30-pin to lightning connector because who doesn't have an iPhone 5+ these days?

Parking was also easy. Self-parking is free and not super difficult to find as long as you're willing to drive up but be warned: the garage feels like a sauna and the elevators are not particularly easy to find. My friend and I wandered a lot more than we needed to the first time we parked. In my experience, it seems like most if not all the Total Rewards hotels say that valet is full except for Diamond and Platinum members but at least self-parking is still free unlike MLife hotels. When coming in from self-parking, make sure to turn right after the escalator instead of walking straight into Paris like I did.

Not really sure what there is to eat at Bally's since we never really looked for food here. We would just walk to PH or drive off the strip to eat. 

Overall, definitely a great value for your money.

Let's just get down to the nitty gritty of things.  Good and bad...

1)  Rooms are nice, large, and updated.  The downside is there is a lingering smoker and wet dog smell to the rooms.  

2) It's conveniently near the hub of the stripe.  The downside is there were misc. noises outside until the wee hours of the night (loud music, Bellegio's water show, people moving).  All can be heard on the 14th floor!!  I know I Know, who sleeps in sin city?!  Well, I do!

3) The casino has a nice collection of slots and offer good and cheaper minimum bets.  I like that a lot!

4) Were requested double beds and ended up with a single.  We had to go back downstairs to make the change.  It's inconvenient since time is taken away from our fun time!  

Tip:  be sure to double check with our receptionist on how many beds are in the room.

Recently, my boyfriend and I decided we would frolic around Vegas one weekend. In a hotel, we were looking for a conveniently located place that wouldn't break the bank. Bally's definitely did the trick.

The staff was extremely courteous on check-in, and we got a free upgrade to the remodeled North Tower, which was nice. The room was huge and beautiful, and the bed was quite comfortable. There was also a couch and a desk to use. It's kind of a shame we didn't spend more time in the room. 

As others have said, you can't beat the location. We were right in the middle of the strip, and it seemed that anything we wanted to see wasn't more than a short walk away. 

I dock a star only because the first night, whoever made the bed had put the sheet over the blanket, and that was kind of weird. Also, some of my hair got caught on the back of the hair dryer when I was using it one morning because the dryer didn't have the plastic safety thing on the back. I was careful the next day, so I didn't have a problem. 

The price worked out to about $95\/night, which I thought was a great deal. Keep Bally's in mind if you're looking for a quality hotel option on the strip.

Bally's gets a Vegas five stars for a non-five star hotel.

My family spent the week before Christmas at Bally's and once again the hotel surpassed my expectations.   The hotel location is just about the best on the strip.  The rooms are large and very comfortable.  I have stayed at just about all the hotels along the strip for business and pleasure - from all the high-end resorts to the desperately needing updated properties.  The high-ends are over-rated.  If you are properly experiencing Vegas, you should not be spending too much time in your room.  Bally's is not a luxury hotel and if the Wynn or Bellagio is your cup of tea, then it's not going to excite you in any way.  If a comfortable location that is convenient to all the fun is desired, then this is the way to go.   It's best bang for the buck in Las Vegas.

What can I say, It's Bally's. It's on the fucking strip, it's cheap and dammit it's not that bad. 

Whether you want to stay here or not depends on who you are. Are you a douchebag that pops his collar on his polo shirt and wants to hang out by the pool all day long? Then this isn't for you "bro." 

Are you a group of fellas trying to reenact every moment of The Hangover, the Caesars is across the street guys. 

Are you a stuck up chick trying to waste some of your daddy's money by shopping at the most expensive stores on earth? The shops at Crystals City Center are next to the Cosmopolitan and are a block south.

For the rest of us "out of towners" who are simply trying to save a buck and hoping to hit a jackpot with said dollar this is the place to go. It's not luxurious, it's not trendy, it's Vegas in it's classic form. I'm here to gamble and probably get drunk for cheap and Bally's caters to my needs.

My mom's an avid gambler and I stayed here for one night because the hotel gave her a  free room. Yippee! We upgraded for an extra $20 and that was so worth it. The room was clean and the staff are friendly and quick to respond to your requests. Would stay here again if Im not looking for luxury and just want a place to crash.

This is my second time staying here.  I can honestly say - you can find a better hotel, but you can't find it for cheaper or in a better location.  It's truly a package deal in staying at Bally's.

I got to stay here for 2 nights for only $40.  Of course, when I got to the check in desk, they asked me if I wanted to upgrade, which I did ($100 more total for a suite), which was worth it.  The room was much larger and had a much better view (Bellagio fountains).  The bathroom was about a third of the room, and had no door.  It was really odd, but it was nice.  There was a jacuzzi tub, shower, water closet, 2 sinks and a sit down mirror with circle bulbs (like a powder room or something).  

The room was really big (could've fit about 8 cots), the bed was comfortable (could've used some more pillows, looked odd with only 2 on there), and it felt clean (seriously, what hotel room is really clean).  The location is amazing, across from Bellagio\/Caesars, a short walk to CityCenter.

It isn't the glitziest place to stay (Encore, Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, etc), but it isn't the worst (Circus Circus, Stratosphere, etc).

We didn't stay here (Paris).... but we sure played here and won big every day on slots and LIVE KENO!  yes...LIVE KENO.....such a shame that casinos are so inept at who they hire (all those family ties, entourages, etc) - that none of them have a lick of business sense....like customer service \/ marketing....I can say that wasn't true at Bally's.....just a fun atmosphere to gamble and have fun, win, and escape for a few hours \/ days....

I've stayed at several different hotels along the strip, but right now, I'd have to say Bally's is my favorite. Not because it's glitzy and glamorous. But because it's practical as hell: Perfect location. Big, clean room. Good sized bathroom. Nice pool. Friendly staff. Great rates.

Look, I go to Vegas to spend my money on shows, shopping, gambling and wonderful food. If I can save some $ on the hotel room and still have a comfortable, quiet place to crash, then I consider that pretty awesome. 

Bally's will be the first place I look to book a room next time I go to Vegas.
We stayed here.. we were happy big spacious rooms... would def come back... good food good casino floors. Nice employees... u get discounts if you sign up for the member card

Pros: affordable , spacious rooms, and right in the center of the strip

Cons: outdated (all rooms in the south tower) , tube TVs, and customer service can vary.

This hotel was ok for the price we paid. I could have easily gotten a nicer room at planet Hollywood but since we had others traveling with us , I had to accommodate according to their budget. 

I booked a suite in the south tower with a guaranteed connecting room.

The woman checking us in told me that they DONT guarantee a connecting room. I specifically told her to check the notes because i wouldn't have booked with ballys if that was the case.

Long story short. Her attitude the whole time was condescending , rushed , and down right rude. She didn't even check if there were any available rooms in the north tower. She told me "nope, sorry " WITHOUT CHECKING. 

At that point I was pissed off at her attitude , took my room keys went to our room.  

In the end, I called and complained to the assistant manager about the rude customer service I received . Once I told him the name of the worker , the tone in his voice seemed like this person has had many complaints on her already. 

He kindly apologized and found 2 rooms in the north tower . And upgraded us for free. 

I even asked him if he could bring up the new room keys so I didn't have to go downstairs and see the rude worker.I probably would have rubbed it in her face that she would get disciplinary action taken towards her later, while i get to stay in the upgraded rooms! :)

Last minute trip with my little kids to Las Vegas, we decided to stay at Bally's for the cheap price plus it is located at the center of the strip. Did an express check-in in a kiosk at 330pm friday, keys & room# ready, it was COOL! We stayed at the Indigo King room, surprisingly the room is big, even the bathroom is big. Bally's is one of the old hotels in the strip.
Cleanliness, its ok. I just noticed at the back of the bed is dirty, saw a card from LYFT & some broken pieces of paper(forgot to take a picture for proof). 
Location, very good. Love the fact that it is connected to Paris Hotel which is one of my favorite hotel and just across Bellagio.

Stayed there for 2 nights.
 
Also did an express check-out in a kiosk & had my receipt send to my email instead which works for me coz I dont like lining-up to just check-in & out.

Planning to stay here again? Sure!

I did not stay at Bally's, but did mingle over to the casino from Paris.  The casino was a little older, but there were shops and places more affordable to eat than Paris.  Be sure to check out the Tequila Bar and Grill late night!

I stayed here for a bachelor party.  I've been here numerous times.  I love the location as it is within walking distance to all the hotels I like hanging at.  I like the fact that they gave me a fat discount because of a collective of my friends player points.  It isn't the newest hotel, but the rooms are clean and the staff were good.  I enjoyed their sportsbook.  Unfortunately, I was unable to do any dining over there nor have I ever dined over there.  That's a shame.  I would stay there again just for the price, but there are far superior hotels in Las Vegas.

This was my first time staying in this hotel. Usually, I stay in Circus Circus.


This hotel is quite small compared to the other hotels on the strips. It's located right at the center of the strips. The price per night is affordable (It was $30-31, after tax, per night for North Tower Deluxe room during my stay).


I really enjoyed my stay at Bally's because:
1. The price is affordable.
2. Bally's has a prime location (The center of the strips).
3. It's connected to Paris hotel, so it felt like I was staying in Paris hotel for a cheaper hotel price.
4. The floor-cleaning lady at the food court area and the receptionist at the front desk were friendly. 
5. The maid did excellent job in cleaning my room. She replaced my soap and towels every day and gave me extra soap.
6. The room is spacious and clean.
7. The bathroom is also clean and meets my standard.


I think I will stay here again when I go to Vegas next time.




Oh, the billing department sent the copy of hotel bill\/receipt to my email promptly, within 12-13 hours after I submitted the online form.

What a rip off!!! In addition to the unsanitary conditions of the room and the outdated decor what really ticked my off was the $28 "resort fee." First off, I was unaware Bally's was a resort.  It's a hotel\/casino! Secondly, when I reserved the room (for a work convention I might add) there was nothing about the fee nor was it mentioned when I checked in.  I even sighed a paper saying $54 was going to be charged to my card.  I stayed two nights of which one was paid for by my company.  Next day I log on to my bank account to see a $28 resort fee followed by another $82 fee which was my room plus another day of resort fee!  I called to question it and was treated like an idiot by Blanca, the women who took the call.  Very dishonest business practices. I will never stay there again...ever!  Good job Bally's you lost another customer!  You all should read your reviews...apparently I am not the only one unhappy with the service and dishonest business practices!

This is the first time I've stayed at Bally's in 3 years, and I must say they've done a great job at sprucing up the place. We had an option to stay in the new Jubilee tower, but that was a bit out of our price range, so we stayed in the North Tower. The room was beautiful, spacious, close to the elevators and the ice\/vending machines. What's more, we had a gorgeous view of Flamingo Blvd!  What really stuck out was that one night, we came back pretty late, and the valet was full, and only open to VIP card holders, but Alfred, the valet supervisor, gives standing orders to his guys that if there are children, or seniors, to go ahead and park the car.  Since our daughter was with us, they did so. Alfred, and the man who parked our car were so genuine and hospitable, I was thoroughly appreciative.

The pool was the same, but not bad...it definitely needs better\/louder music for a better vibe. I like that they have a smaller kid pool where the water is warmer. The ONE unique thing about this pool is that there is a parking structure to the west off the pool....once the afternoon sun drops below the top of that structure, "POOF" no more sun, the whole pool area is in the shade, which sucks in non-summer months, because it gets cold!! If you're a summer sun worshipper, that's a definite negative too...

They have a great food court, with a Johnny Rockets, Subway, and Nathan's hotdog place, and a couple other places.  Machines are good, and it's a decent size casino floor as far a Vegas casinos go. Normally a great atmosphere on Saturday night, and they even have live music in the lounge, which is always cool. The walkway over to Paris is also very convenient, and perfect for casino hopping without having to go outside.  Great place to stay...we'll be back!

DON'T stay here!! Worst place ever! Not professional and they won't own up to their mistakes!! They don't even deserve a star!

We booked a room and checked in through the kiosk. Came back and our key wasn't working, so we went to the front desk. Found out they cancelled our room because someone with the same last name checked into the hotel (Yeah, doesn't make sense to us either). We had to go through security to get our stuff out of the room and when trying to get someone to explain what's going on, they tried saying it was our credit card or Vegas.com (we've booked with Vegas.com many times before. They weren't the issue). Finally, a dumbass admitted the kiosks weren't working and they had been having problems with them (didn't even apologize to us). They then ask us if we still want to stay and that we'd be charged in the morning! No place to stay, so we then had to drive back to California (3 hrs.) at 1 am. 

They did the same thing to another guest while we were dealing with the front desk.



Some tips for your staff:
-Check IDs when people are checking in! I'm sure many people have the same last name don't just assume sliding the cards would work.

-Take the kiosks out if they've been an issue

- Should've compted us a room, not ask us to stay, but we'd get charged.

Pros:
-Location...On the strip
-Sports Book is very nice (seems out of place because its so nice)
-Rooms are okay...Old but well kept
-Good selection of games and their High Roller section is nice
-Valet was fast and helpful when I asked for directions to a Golf course
-Price is very good
-Beds are comfortable

Cons:
-Outdated
-Food selection isn't the best
-Elevator is located in a weird area that makes for long walk to the rooms especially if you have a suite

3.5 stars. No frills, unpretentious, prime location, and cheap! I would stay here again.

I stayed at Bally's during my most recent trip to Las Vegas. We booked 2 standard rooms with 2 queens in each room. Our rooms were in the South Tower, which I believe is the ghetto-er of the 2 (the other being the North Tower). This observation comes from not knowing where our room was and getting lost in the North Tower for a bit. The South Tower has older carpet, isn't as brightly lit, and might have smaller rooms since it has more rooms.

We finally got to our rooms. They were modest yet pretty spacious (pics). They didn't give us the mini fridge we requested, so we just made the best out of some ice buckets. One of our rooms was fine. It didn't have any weird smells, but had a slight cocoa smell. The other room smelled like Flintstone's vitamins...I kid you not. Also, the hair dryer in that room didn't even work and their sheets were not the cleanest feeling.

Room service was ok. It took 30 minutes to get a plate of appetizers to our room. The front desk, bellboy and the guy who flags down taxis were all very nice people.

Other than that, no complaints! Great view of the Strip from our rooms and being centrally located, you can get to pretty much anywhere. Thank God for the monorail and free shuttles to Rio, or else we would've been roasted by the sun.

Just finished my stay at Ballys and have to say, for a small casino right in the middle of the strip, it has to be the best place to stay without breaking your wallet. I stayed in the newly renovated Jubilee south tower, and got a king luxury looking at the flamingo. Wish I could've got the view of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. Only negative to the north side is the music playing in the brand new shopping plaza, also the guy playing and beating on buckets to make a buck. Although he's good, I just wish he'd shut the f*** up during rough morning hangovers. Oh well, my bad. 
     So the casino is not huge, but has all the games you would find in any. If you're not satisfied with its size, Paris is connected with restaurants and stores that lead you to a little bigger casino. That or Bellagio or ceasers across Las Vegas blv. Ballys has two restaurants hidden in south east corner of the casino. A steak joint called BLT Steak, and a Thai place called SEA. There's also a food court and small bagel\/sandwich shops. You'll also find three bars on the casino floor, although I think one is open later for entertainment. 
     I'd definitely stay here again, but my goal is to always stay some place different. Unless prices are through through the roof, then Ballys it is. Enjoy!

Ballys is brilliant. It has the friendliest dealers of anywhere we went. It's really affordable, especially mid week. The rooms were nice and all the staff were friendly. 

If you're doing Vegas and don't care about being 5* Ballys is the best bet!

Outstanding location, good value in room cost but the hotel and casino leave a little something to be desired. Its the perfect middle ground - average in every way - and would probably be a big hit if your an avid reader of Consumer Reports.

The location couldn't be better. The problem is that visiting the neighbors are the best part of staying at this hotel. Its got great neighbors to visit - Bellagio, Paris, Cromwell, and CP - all in the Harrahs family BTW with the exception of Bellagio... heck, maybe its all part of the plan with the recent Boyd\/Harrahs tax deferred Barbary\/Echelon exchange. 

There is a top rated club at CP, outstanding food options at Bellagio, a romantic view of the fountains at Eiffle Tower, and a killer pool party at the Cromwell. You could amuse yourself all day with just the neighbors here. With the pedestrian bridges there is no reason to ever move your car or take a Taxi anywhere.

Big things happening here at Ballys - new drug store tacked on the face of the property. One of the most awkward things of this hotel is that it is set so far back from the Strip. It had this strange long moving walkway like they have at airports. For people with low attention spans its a problem. They tried to remedy the issue with advertisements but I'm sure the property still failed at attracting as much Strip foot traffic as possible. 

Rooms are old and vary slightly depending on what tower your in. Good value - no frills in the standard rooms. The value of the rooms are so good I would actually compare a larger upgraded room to the base room at Bellagio. Price-wise that is the comparison you would have to make.

I have yet to eat the Sterling brunch. I have just watched the price for it skyrocket over the past 15 years. Maybe I haven't gone there yet to give me something to look forward to. I've got high hopes. They are known for their dancing show Jubilee. The ladies wear feathers and diamond crusted bikini dealies. Its a classy show - especially for Vegas standards. After a 34 year run would they really pull the plug on the resident show that is the only differentiating thing that sets Bally's apart from a Hilton Garden Inn down the road?!

I still do think something is missing from this hotel. I love Harrahs and am loyal to them and want this place to do well. My constructive criticism is that it is still missing that something something that appeals to ones emotions. No I didn't mean a drugstore slapped on the front. Perhaps a better logo like SLS, or a doorman on The Stip like Sir Francis Drake in San Francisco... Gosh, I'm not part of the marketing team here with a six figure salary - I shouldn't be asking these questions... But a leprechaun running around the casino floor might be more helpful than you could imagine. Maybe he could have a girlfriend too - re-hire one of the Jubilee! ladies or something.

This resort caters to traditional consumer values - but I think the kind of people that go off those values probably aren't in Vegas in the first place.

just stayed at bally's for my first time after purchasing a hotel\/airfare with free show tickets package from vegas.com. after reading some of the reviews here i was concerned we wouldnt like it but i have to say we really liked it there. its no Venetian but its better than the Imperial Palace or Excalibur for sure. they treated us great all the services we recieved at the hotel from bell desk to housekeeping to gaming was good. they even upgraded us to the Grand Suite which is XXL in size and has a jucuzzi tub for free for valentines day. the floor our room was on ( the diamond floor) and room we stayed in was modern updated and very nice. so perhaps some of the reviews here discussing 80's style etc, is for a standard room\/floor..i'm not sure. and the location on the strip is perfect!  if your use to staying at the Imperial palace or excalibur, harrahs ..places of that quality that then this is a great step up without breaking the bank :)

I call this Old Vegas meets New Recession.  An old Vegas showgirl with way too much makeup but not enough to hide the age.  What a disappointment.  Repairs like carpet stains, missing moldings, plumbing issues, etc. not being attended to due to budget cutbacks.  My buddies and I showed up to see the Final Four but the race & sports book was closed down just 2 days before the weekend???  What a crock.  If I want a cheap hotel on the strip I would have......wait a minute...this was a cheap hotel on the strip.  I just did not want it to look and act so cheap.  In a down economy, they should worry about making those who DO show up, feel special, not make them feel like don't matter.

I rate hotels in Las Vegas different from most hotels because when I stay at a hotel in Las Vegas I gamble there, I eat there, I'll usually go to the nightclub or lounge there and possibly shop there.  I might go to other establishments for anything I mentioned above but it's nice if I don't have to.
  The rooms here are nice.  They're pretty normal except it has a classy feel.  I believe it's the dark wood accents.
  The slot machines didn't pay out much here and the selection on the dollar slots are very limited.
  If you want to eat at one of the best brunches in Las Vegas, this is one.  It's not cheap but worth it.  Make sure you have reservations and make sure you bring your appetite.  Here when you get served water, it's Perrier, the champagne is Perrier Jouet..not the flower bottle but it's very nice.   Sure they have whole cracked lobster as does several places but here you'll get Sturgeon cavier, Chilean Sea Bass,    crab, lamb, an omelet station, etc.
   There's no club here and I don't remember any shopping either but don't quote me on that.

I am here at Bally's right now. I have been checked in since Monday night and I am due to check out tomorrow, 4\/13\/17. I am highly displeased w\/this hotel because their staff is HORRIBLE. It is just myself w\/my 9 & 10-year-old and I've been treated abhorrently since I arrived. I just called the front desk to share my grievances with whomever I could speak with, and in light of everything I shared with Anisha, she offered a $30 food & beverage credit.

Let me go back to Monday night: 
The bell man delivered my luggage to my room and after greeting him, I asked, "Do you have change for a $100? He already seemed annoyed when he arrived and he replied, "As long as it's not counterfeit. Is it counterfeit?" Taken aback, I responded: "I HOPE it's not counterfeit, I withdrew the money from YOUR ATM." The man smirked, walked past me and asked, "Is your phone broken? It shows you've been calling and then hanging up." I said "Yes! It does seem to be broken, I kept trying to call for my luggage, but there was no dial tone- only a weird noise could be heard, so I had to dial out from the other phone on the desk by the window." The man went over to the phone, appearing incredulous that the phone was not working and tried using it, but encountered the same problem. He said, "I guess you can just use the other phone.", and left. I thought to myself, 'did I seriously just tip him 10 bucks to insult me by implying I had counterfeit money?'

Next, Tuesday 4\/11\/17:
I took a shower and the shower was so clogged, I had soapy water to just around my shins, which was very unpleasant, unless you ENJOY a shower in a clogged tub. I had to call to report that I either wanted to change rooms or get the tub fixed, (on the desk phone, of course, since the main phone was not working). The person I spoke with sent someone to fix the tub while my children and I were out to dinner. You should not have to make maintenance calls while you're on vacation; especially when you pay at least $30 a night for a "resort fee" which covers your wi-fi and I-don't-know-what else.

Today, Wednesday 4\/12\/17:
I came back to Bally's after having dinner with my children and I pulled into the valet where we sat for a few minutes in my car, waiting for someone to approach us.  I was speaking with my child, who then gestured there was someone at the car.  The valet was standing next to my door with his arms crossed over his chest, looking irked- never mind the fact I sat and waited patiently for someone to come assist us. I explained that I am a guest at Bally's and needed to leave the car overnight. With the arms crossed over his chest, and no 'Hello', he replied, "Will you put the car in park?" How difficult would it have been to say Hello? I thought, 'Wow, why so rude?' It was very awkward. This was the final 'straw'; I took time off work to come to Bally's to enjoy Spring Break with my children, not to prepare myself with quick "come-backs" to smart remarks and attitudes at my, seemingly, every turn.

As I explained to Anisha, maybe one incident doesn't seem like a big deal, but with everything combined, it was too much. With tears of frustration I communicated that I was fine with a $30 food credit, as long as she could say she'd honestly be fine with it, were she in my shoes. She didn't care to respond to that, and for this reason, I will never return to Bally's ever again.

*Update: It is now 3:26 a.m. and I am now home after a 4-hour drive from Vegas. Disappointed by the offer of a $30 food and beverage credit, (which would get me as far as a sandwich and maybe a coke), after speaking with Anisha, I called the front desk once again and asked to speak w\/a supervisor. After speaking with a young man who said his supervisor offered no more than credit for 2 of the resort fees, I was finally transferred to said supervisor, who, when she finally provided her name it was, "just Michelle".  The following is a condensed version of my interaction with Michelle: 

When Michelle initially picked up the call her "greeting" was a brusque, "Yes? How can I help you.", without introducing herself or stating her name. I advised Michelle that how she answered was inappropriate and unprofessional as an assistant manager, especially in the public service sector- she was unfazed.  When I asked for her last name, to note who I spoke with in my letter to corporate, she said, "I'm not giving you my last name." (Nor that of her supervisor, "Fabian").  When I asked why, her nasty reply was, "Because- I'm just not."  Michelle stated my grievances "did not warrant" the removal of each resort fee, only two.  After I informed Michelle that I posted a Yelp review that detailed the poor treatment I experienced, e-mailed the corporate office with a copy of my Yelp review, and advised her I was leaving the hotel promptly and was going home; she was indifferent.  I ended the call, got my children out of bed, gathered our belongings and drove 4 hours back home.

As long as you get the newly refurbished (and beautifully decorated) Jubilee Tower, and you do not like snobby atmospheres like the Wynn, you will love Bally's.  Bally's is actually easy to get around in, unlike most of the other Vegas hotels.  I have had the best experience yet staying here, better than the 5 prior Vegas hotels I have stayed at.  Bally's is down to Earth and yet so cool at the same time.  The pool was beautiful and a great time (just wish they played the music a bit louder).  I was so proud to have stayed at Bally's!  (sidenote- no memorable food here though).

My husband and I decided to drive to Las Vegas this past summer with no reservations and just see what happened...sounds crazy, but worked out great thanks to Bally's! We decided on Bally's because we got a great deal for a junior suite, and the location of the hotel is wonderful. It's attached to Paris (literally) and is within walking distance to a lot of fun places on the strip. It is also a stop on the Las Vegas tram that takes you from one end of the strip to the other, so it was very easy to get to the Venetian one evening where we saw the Blue Man Group (highly recommend!) It might not have all the bells and whistles that some of the other hotels have, but we really enjoyed our stay at Bally's. Will definitely think of staying here on our next trip to Vegas!

Soon after arriving Bally's Vegas last Tuesday, I excitedly turned around while walking and SLAMMED my right eyebrow into a metal pole, which is inside the lobby and that my friend is posing next to in the photograph I will try to post after writing this review. She said my head snapped back as my glasses flew to the floor. We immediately told a nearby security guard what happened and asked him for an ice pack. He led us to a back room where I was asked how many quarters are in a dollar and a few other simple questions that I easily answered, and was given an ice pack. I had to fill out an incident report and then we left.

The rest of our evening was subdued as I felt a little off. We had dinner and then retired to our room and shut out the lights to sleep at 9:30.

I woke up at 3:00 AM to a screaming headache. At 4:30 AM we tried calling room service for water and Tylenol but the front desk said room service doesn't open until 6:00. I tried again after 6:00 but they said they only deliver food and to try security. I laid back down and tried to relax but eventually got up and showered. By this time my headache was only pounding, and I noticed that we had a vm message--from a hotel manager wondering how I was doing. I called him back and said I was not okay, but had a pounding headache and needed some water and Tylenol. He said he can't dispense medication but will send up an EMT. When the EMT arrived she looked around the room, told me where the nearest CVS store is located and said I could get some Tylenol there or in the liquor store in the lobby, and then she left.

Ultimately I charged two bottles of water and two doses of Tylenol to our room from the lobby liquor store. When we checked out, I suggested Bally's pay for the Tylenol charge but the front desk declined saying, "we're not authorized to adjust charges but you could contact Risk Management."

Customer service was sub-standard and superficial, so I'm quite sure I'll never stay at Bally's in Vegas again. I'd say they nickel and dime you to death with additional charges, but that would be an understatement since the additional charges are highly inflated. 

Also, the free "self-parking" was difficult to find (not sure we ever did) and blocks away in the Planet Hollywood garage, we were accosted not once but twice by slick sales people peddling future visits to Bally's, only two devices are allowed connection to their "free wifi," there's nothing good to watch on their televisions, though you can rent a movie for $17.99, and the smell of skunk weed permeated the hallways and wafted into our room on the "no smoking floor." Did I mention the view of Trump tower out of our window? ugh.

This hotel boasts online check in.  Apparently, that only works if you book at least one day prior to your stay.  I ended up waiting in a long line that was understaffed.  I'll go elsewhere next time.

Never, ever pay to upgrade your room. They will tell you your room will be nicer...and you will end up with an awful view, the previous occupant's shirt will be hanging in your closet, you won't get the bed(s) you asked for...and when you call to complain?  You will be told, rudely, that you can pretty much suck it.  I am REALLY mad and don't care who knows it.

Arrived at Bally's on May 22nd. I was shocked at the instant piranha attack by folks pushing real estate in the front door of the casino. I was not 5 feet inside the door when it happened. Hey, Vegas is all about hardcore capitalism, but I already paid for 3 nights. Let me check out the cleanliness of the hotel before I decide to go to a four hour meeting on buying a condo. Disclaimer: ALL of the big resorts are doing this, so I might be a bit harsh about this. 

Check-in was pretty quick, and I used the "twenty dollar trick" at the counter. A very nice woman knew the score and helped us upgrade to a deluxe room for free. Good clean room, nice couch and wonderful view of that gambling mecca Imperial Palace (hellhole). 

Location was excellent, attached to Paris and walkways to Bill's, Cesears and the Bellagio. It's in the heart o' the strip. 

The casino was a bit hoity-toity, but serviceable for table-gamers. Limits were $10 craps\/blackjack, but the dealers (played with about 10 21 dealers, numerous craps dealers) were a bit sterile. A smile would be nice once or twice, especially if they get a toke, but alas. 

Restaurants were a strong point as well as shopping. 

It was OK, but nothing that I would make a special visit to...unless I buy one of those condos.

I had mixed feelings about my stay here, but first the pros, literally:

The people at Sea & BLT Steak were awesome.  Everyone polite, respectful, cleanly dressed.  Both these restaurants are GREAT and I highly recommend them as the staff at both were awesome, accommodated my random dietary request without issue and made me feel welcome every time.

Otherwise for lodging experience, not as positive.  I am here for work, this does not cater to that.

I read reviews and was lucky enough NOT to ask for a newer room (which I frankly would have preferred, the bed was pretty rickety).  Those newer rooms in Jubilee happen to be across from Drai's which apparently has a roof top bar open till 4 or 6am or something.  Not good because I am here for work Wednesday-Saturday.

I was looking forward to a mellow workweek, the conference is IN this hotel, but this is NOT the hotel for you if are here for a those things.  SEVERAL reasons:

-  This must be the ONLY hotel on the planet with NO ROOM SERVICE AFTER 1PM.  Yes 1 P M.  Delivery from 6am - 1pm ONLY.  So no dinner in my room after a long day unless I go trek around with the tourists and throngs to bring it back.  Sad.

-  Gym closes at 6pm.  So if you are in a session until even 5, good luck getting a decent workout in unless you go at 6am, when it opens.

-  No COFFEE makers in the room.  Or fridges.  So I have to get up at the crack of dawn to try to make it to the gym and back to get ready for my room before 7:15 with NO IN ROOM COFFEE !!!  GAH !!!

One plus is they do have a SEA Thai restaurant, I went to the one in Brooklyn when I lived there and the food is good.  So I ate Thai for 4 days and they were nice enough to make a healthy steamed plate for me.

Anyway, I won't stay here again though the staff is friendly.

Horrible service. The toilet was not working and they couldn't fix it. So they were going to bring up new keys for me...2 hours later...and I'm still waiting. I'd go down to the front desk to get it myself, but I was told I would have to wait in line. Seriously...how many times can someone tell me they are sending someone up right now!

Went here for a girl's weekend and was looking for something middle of the road and cost-efficient but not off The Strip.

We got there early and had the option to pay $30 to check in early but there weren't any rooms available so we just dumped our bags with the bellhop (for free).

When we did get into the room, it wasn't great. Asked for non-smoking room and it was like a cave of cigarette smoke and there were burn holes on the sheets on the bed. Totally tacky and gross. We called down and got a new room fairly quickly and it was MUCH better.

THE GOOD
*Bed and pillows were fantastic!
*Room is huge, bathroom is huge, shower pressure is nice
*Location is really great--close to everything and there's a bus stop right in front
*The gym is FANTASTIC! Huge! Nice equipment! It's worth the $20
*The pool was really nice and fairly low-key. Still the party atmosphere but not totally douchey and it was never so crowded we couldn't get chairs. 
*Casino was small but it was nice and looked newly remodeled.

THE BAD
*The drinks at the pool are SUPER expensive and I don't think they actually put alcohol in them. WASTE OF MONEY
*The lady at the front desk was kind of rude when we were checking in but everyone else that worked there was super nice, so not sure where to rate this...

I would stay here again for an affordable weekend trip. If I was looking for something a little fancier, I'd probably stay somewhere else.

I find it funny that their motto is "Bally's: Stay Classic" - which is really a euphemism for "we're outdated but we don't care." True, Bally's can be thought of as "outdated" considering that it's surrounded by supercasinos Bellagio and Caesar's. Really though, it's a good, low-key option if you want to stay on the strip but want to avoid the major crowds. It isn't super theme-y, but it's still an awesome location because you have quick access to everything along Las Vegas Blvd. And you can stay here without breaking the bank. 

The room we had was spacious... hey, it fit 6 of us girls and all of our stuff comfortably. Only complaint would be the LONG walk from the elevator to our room. Not fun to do after a night out in heels. 

Bonus for Bally's being right across the street from the Victorian Room at Bill's (formerly Barbary Coast) which always satisfies my drunken munchies after a night out of drinking.

I've stayed at the Vegas Bally's twice now- and I have to say I was pleased both times.

We received a free upgrade this past time- and the rooms were a bit nicer.

The hotel is clean and the location is central.

No complaints.

I have been to Vegas many times and this is one of the hotels that my parents refuse to stay at. The reason was a bit superstition. It was basically due to the fire that happened in 1980 where 85 people was killed in the fire. The third biggest fire in US hotel history. That time the hotel was called MGM Grand. 

I have went inside for the slot machines and its basically the same as any other hotel. Its a bit run down. Service is ok here. There is not much to see. Its not like if you went to Venetian and its hotel and shopping paradise. This is strictly a gambling place.

Right now there is a Groupon deal for this hotel.

Not sure what rooms some of these other reviewers had, but I stayed on the 6th floor of the North Tower and was happy.  The large hallways showed a little age, but what you would expect for this price level.  My room was clean, large granite bathroom was clean, had loads of towels, and the room was a roomy 400 square feet (approx).  Free television.  

The nightly entertainment in the nightclub lounge was very good all nights I stayed, and there was always a dance party going.  Really good house cabernet wine.

Stayed in the North Tower more than once and I was equally happy each time.  Ballys is in a better location, and has larger, cleaner rooms for the standard 2 beds, than many of its price equivalent competitors.

This is the most mediocre hotel I've stayed in over the last 40 years coming to Vegas. From one check-in person on Saturday morning keeping 20 guests waiting in line.  The Bucca  restaurant hostess seating us for lunch and telling us it will be 15-20 minutes til a waitperson can get to us. ( there was one other table). 

Went to Paris for Buffet Breakfast.   There was a chunk of pineapple in my coffee cup. Waitress never apologized. Bagels not sliced on buffet. When I asked counter person to cut it she refused and told me to see a waitress. There were no tea spoons on table. Once again when asked a manager for spoon I was told to see waitress.  She gave us soup spoons. The first crepe my wife got was brittle. French toast on Buffett was burnt black. Line for omelette was ridiculous with one chef making one order at a time. 

Rooms are ok but not up to par. Very few outlets for 2017 traveler with technology and phone. Total attitude of management and staff is uncaring and aloof. And they have nothing to be aloof about. 

Bottom line. Go to hotel that charges 10% more and get 100% better experience.

It is 3:43 AM and the people next to us are smoking a ton of marijuana and making a ton of noise. We called Daniel and Blanca at the front desk twice and    were told they would give us a new room but didn't specify where. Not sure it it would have been closer to the street or near and elevator. Lousy customer service. Only one more night and will never stay at a ally's again... Spend the extra money and get a legitimate hotel...

Nice hotel..good room..great location..great connectivity with paris..cross it to cromwell and flamingo

Really enjoyed it..

no microwave or coffee machine why?

I'm from Las Vegas and wanted to have a small staycation. I had a lot of options and wanted something in the middle of the strip and close to everything. Parking was free because I was a Nevada resident but unfortunately they do charge after 24 hours. The check in line was long but not too bad, but unfortunately missed the pool that closed at 7pm.

I stayed in the basic rooms, indigo with a king bed non smoking. It was very impressed because the room was only $30 (weekday stay) not including the resort fee. 

Going back for my next staycation. Cannot wait... hopefully I can request the same room.

I stayed here for three days this past weekend.  I checked in with the $20 sandwich trick. Didn't work and the receptionist kept it. Lol unreal. Now for the room. Stayed in the jubilee tower. It smelled funny, the handle on the sink came off. Wall paper was peeling and there was what looked to be blood stains on the sheets. I only noticed when I woke the next morning and the sheets were untucked. When I complained to checkout with pictures to prove it the manager offered a 10% discount on an over $500 bill.  Hilarious, you think they would be more accommodating for something so severe. How bout a complimentary stay next time Mr Bosinger?  Is what I was hoping to hear. Not the case though. Needless to say I won't be staying at Bally's again. Oh I forgot to mention they kicked me out of the poker room and for saying fuck twice at the table, and tried to have me removed from the entire casino. What a joke!  Only when I told them that this is where I'm staying did they change their mind. One of the worst experiences I've had in Vegas and being from LA I frequent it often. I don't often write reviews but was compelled to do so here. Mostly because upon checkout when the manager told me a 10% discount was all she could do I threatened to write a yelp review and her response was "go ahead". Lol. That's some of the worst managerial customer service I've had the displeasure of. I'd rather stay somewhere else and get treated with respect than ever waste another minute at Bally's hotel. Thanks for reading and stay away from Bally's, you might catch Hep C from the bedsheets.

The crowd wasn't for the young and reckless but the beds were memorable bliss. Huge Cali King I just didn't want to leave, I could lay all day watching Fashion TV ordering room serivce. I liked it;s location on the strip too. It's a clean hotel not very stylish but I would just report any problems, the accomidations that I experienced were pleasant. I would only choose this place though if I wasn't planning on partying in a fun place I wanted to take pictures at.

Not t a bad hotel.  Rooms are a nice size with a nice little sitting area.  We didn't have a view from the room, but it was only used to sleep anyways.  Hotel is in a great location. Purchased room via Groupon which included 2 passes to Eiffel Tower.  When we arrived to hotel I still needed to pay for hotel tax. But overall still saved like 30$ due to included Eiffel Tower passes   Recommend!

Nothing special, but it's affordable, good gambling, connected to the Paris and has a central location to the strip. Walk over to Bill's Gambling Hall Saloon for a cheap breakfast.  Make sure you join Harrah's Rewards to get points for gambling and your hotel stay.
