Bally's is located on the Vegas strip, not on either extreme end, which is nice. There are a few things that stand out about this place. It's really inexpensive for a Vegas hotel! If you are just looking for basic accommodations because you really are not spending any time in your room at all... Bally's is perfect. The view is not wonderful but not horrible either. The look and feel of each room is bare and minimal. You wouldn't guess you were in Vegas if you just randomly woke up there. But then again, you could just save money by staying here and spending it on everything else that Vegas has to offer!

Definitely stepping up their game! Updating rooms, decent food options, gaming is fun, service is friendly, and it doesn't smell as smoke filled as it used to. Plus the easy access to the strip and other casinos is very convenient. Have to give them a five stars since we hit he fire bet twice playing craps during our trip!

We reserved a king non smoking room and when we arrived they said they had ran out.  I asked what the point in reserving a room when you don't get what you have reserved.  My boyfriend and I asked if there was any non smoking rooms available and they said only one with a queen.  Considering the fact that my boyfriend is a pretty large guy, we weren't going to be comfortable on a queen bed but took what we could get.  I was very unhappy since we were coming on vacation to be in a room that we did not reserve and weren't going to be comfortable in.  When asking if there was anything they can do they said that we can upgrade for almost $100 more.  It just didn't seem right.  Then when we finally agreed to the queen room we ended up being at the end of the hall and when we arrived i called down to let them know my boyfriend has a leg injury and this is very inconvenient.  we were told there was nothing we could do. Now onto the room...There was hair on the bed and the water in the shower was cold and wasn't hot all weekend.  We were so unhappy with the room and with the service. It's definitely not somewhere I would go again.

I stayed here last weekend for my first trip to Vegas. I was there during a huge convention weekend, so I was very satisfied with the reasonable price I got. By no means is this fancy or even "really nice" but it's a good value. The rooms were clean and the service we had was good. If I come back to Vegas again in the near future and am still on a budget (likely to be true for awhile since I'm young and one should get the most fun out of Vegas while they are still young), I'll return. The best perk is the very central location on the strip!
um...yuck. gross rooms that haven't been updated in about 35 years. Tables are icky. Chips are sticky.

24th floor with a partially obstructed view of the Bellagio fountains. NICE

About everything else average at best. The price\/location combo is its saving grace. Anytime I spent at the hotel not sleeping I walked over to Paris.

The check-out line on Sunday was ridiculous (it was for check ins too) so I did express check out . . .  sorry check-in people.

3 1\/2 stars.  When I arrived at Bally's for our weekend stay, my expectations were loooooow.  But I was pleasantly surprised.

We were a group of 11, and we ended up getting a Grand Suite with an adjoining room.  The suites aren't that much bigger, they just have a big bathroom with a jacuzzi tub in the middle.  But seeing as we were a group of girls, not really worth the extra amount we paid for the suite.  And I think the regular hotel rooms are bigger than a lot of rooms that I've stayed in.

We were informed that if we tried to use the shower, it would cut our hand.  So a maintenance man came up to fix it, and he told us about his favorite places to go in Vegas... All strip clubs.

This place has prime location, and the pool was fun.  It didn't have the glamour of a Bellagio or a Caesars, but we were always able to get lounge chairs, and there were cocktail girls who brought us drinks.  

In the casino, don't miss the party pit.  It's a set of tables where they play top 40 music from a boombox, and they give you mardi gras beads and other prizes if you get a blackjack.  I thought it was amusing.  All in all, not the glitziest place you'll ever stay, but I would definitely come back to Bally's.

This is a horrible place to stay.  The room we stayed in had stained floors, there was an earring that was left behind from some one else's stay in the room. Very dirty hotel, the lamps, the tv, everything was full of dust. The couch had nasty stains on it.    Don't stay here.

You know when airlines started taking away all the little things that you didn't realize were little things that you appreciated before. Well, Bally's is like those airlines that has taken away all those little things that you didn't totally appreciate before.

1. Room service is only served from 6am to 1pm. One o'clock. In the AFTERNOON. In LAS VEGAS!! WTF?!?!
2. Got back to the room at almost midnight my first night there and realized we were out of toothpaste. Most hotels, you can call the front desk and they'll send up a travel size tube of toothpaste. Not Bally's! My super-tired fiance, who'd been working a convention all day, had to go downstairs to purchase toothpaste. 
3. My fiance needed our last night there to be charged to his personal card since the other nights he stayed were going onto his company card to be expensed. The guy at check out made it seem like it was all taken care of but today, my fiance found out that they charged ALL the nights to his personal card. He's now been on the phone with them for 2 hours trying to get the issue resolved. 

This place should really just call itself a MOTEL.

We stayed here for the weekend. I ended up rooming with 4 people total including me with 2 queen sized beds. The rooms here are very nice and clean and spacious enough for 4 people. The bathrooms and shower were great too and the view from the room was pretty nice too, facing The Linq and its Ferris wheel. We all ended up staying here as a group and it was pretty cool to have some friends on the same floor so we could just go back and forth from room to room easily. I believe we kept our noise level fairly low too lol.

Having not stay here just passing through and checking the place out; going to the strip and heading to Sugar Factory.  I had to encounter a couple employees of this place and they employ the rudest and nasty attitude people ever.  So as an avid Vegas visitor I will not be staying here if this is any indicator on how they treat people.

Stayed in their upgraded updated room which was facing Drei's nightclub across the street.   The room was very nice...however we could hear the music at night and endless noise from the street during the day.   The windows must be old and there is no sound proof at all.  
The refrigerator literally froze my fruits that we bought for breakfast.  Hmm.   
And the casino doesn't have sex and the city game machines which was a bummer.

Stayed at Bally's for a long weekend with my husband. I'll admit, we knew it was not the best hotel to stay at but we wanted to spend more money gambling, and we figured that we would not be staying much in our room, so we thought it was a good choice. WRONG. DO NOT STAY HERE. The carpets in the hallways were stained, old, and there were empty glasses strewn about. The room was straight out of 1982 - the furniture was older than me, it was dirty, the mattresses were super old, hard, and flat, and the bathroom had crap sprayed all over the walls. The TV was something I once had 10 years ago. We also had a problem and the front desk was rude, and not helpful. Next time we visit Vegas, we will definitely spend another $200 and stay at a decent hotel. In conclusion, we were totally disgusted. 

The only positive thing about the hotel was that it was connected to Paris (where we mostly hung out), it was middle of the strip and we had a view of the Bellagio water show from our window. 

I also warn you: don't go out to Bally's casino late at night by yourself. My husband did and got robbed at gunpoint by several scumbags. 

My advice is to spend another couple of hundred and stay somewhere more updated and secure.

The reason I gave 5 stars was based on the front desk person. Her name was Lena. She greeted me with a smile and was incredibly pleasant and accommodating. She gives off a fantastic first impression. Almost every service employee could take a lesson from her.

The hotel is very well located. It is close to lots of places, including the High Roller. The rooms were good and the price was reasonable. The only complaint I have is the lay-out of the hotel and casino. It does not really flow. It took awhile to learn how to navigate. Everyone in my party felt the same. Overall, I would stay here again.

With the recent renovations, this is a worthy choice of a place to stay on "The Strip".  The hotel is at an excellent location, in the middle of the major casinos, hotel rates are very reasonable.  The rooms are clean and very roomy.  The views are great.

The front desk could be very busy, but with your Platinum or Diamond status, check in is no problem and moves very quickly.

Excellent and awful

Awful because I made a reservation for a king non smoking.  I then checked in online confirming the reservation.  I get to the hotel to be told that I paid for a room and they don't guarantee "preferences".  Booking and paying for a king room is not the same preference as wanting it on a certain floor...  I was told only smoking was available.  This is insane.  I don't know how they've been able to get away with this policy for so long.

Excellent because Jennifer gave me a king studio non smoking after seeing the frustration in my face and tone and probably grateful that I didn't escalate quickly :-).  The room was awesome.  Otherwise this review would have been a one star and maybe the BBB would have gotten involved.

Most confusing line for check-in ever. Lines shift around and the pre-checkin (mail, keys) line is 2x slower than regular check-in w same amount of people....

On new years eve, only 3 windows open (4 including platinum)....

Super disappointed already. 

Update: 46 min later (with only less than 15ppl) in front of me, I finally got to the desk and was told that there's actually no different between pre-check-in online vs regular. 

2. Bed sheet was dirty. 
3. Uncomfortable bedding and pillow
4. No toothpaste, brush, robe, slippers, fridge or anything for a $120+ room....
5. And toilet paper is rough as hell......

You get what you pay for, right? Ballys is in a great location on the strip and the price was reasonable. Plus it's connected to Paris so between the two hotels there are a lot of restaurants. The other two things I like about Ballys were SEA (amazing Thai restaurant) and the show (Jubilee) which we had 2 for 1 tickets for.

Here are my complaints- the toilet in our room ran nonstop, we actually rigged it so it would stop. There is no mini bar (wtf) and when we checked into the hotel we waited in line for a long time. At 4 or 5 p.m. on a Staurday please staff checkin accordingly. I have to admit that in 110 degrees after a 1 hour flight delay and a long shuttle line to get to the hotel (Ballys doesn't have an airport shuttle) I was NOT happy about another line.


Read more Las Vegas and Los Angeles Reviews on my blog- http:\/\/rescuelashelters.wordpress.com\/2011\/07\/06\/the-best-of-the-las-vegas-strip\/

Not the fanciest of hotels on the strip but here's the thing... When visiting Las Vegas and staying on the strip, you don't really spend much time in your room, so the fancier more expensive hotels are kind of a waste of money. Bally's is great! Puts you in the center of everything and you have incredible views of everything else from your room. I do recommend you request the jubilee tower as it is newer, renovated and nicer than the older indigo tower. I'm hoping they renovate the indigo tower so the entire place is nice. The hotel could use some better restaurants in it but the food court isn't bad. The pool could really use some updating but it's super fun either way. 

Also if you stay at bally's you have access to the other hotels associated with it which is great! Paris' pool is nicer. It has a more quiet vibe compared to bally's. 

Across from bally's is a cool nightclub called drai's. Highly recommend going there if you're looking for a fun night! Don't really recommend drai's after hours. 

If you meet Elvis, one of the supervisors at bally's you are lucky! He's wonderful and has incredible customer service skills! He really saved the day when we experienced some miscommunication at check in.

Review for casino only.

No matter where we end up staying, I always find myself having a great time sitting at the Rapid Roulette table by the lounge in the back of the casino. I always get fast service and enjoy the skilled cover bands that play at the lounge.

From that table you can easily walk over to the Paris and grab a slice of Pizza or hit the buffet. 

Bally's looks very outdated when you're coming into it from the strip, but once you're inside you'll enjoy yourself as it's fairly modern for an older casino. 

It's certainly no Wynn or Bellagio, but I always enjoy myself here.

Hmmm .... Actually I forget about this room.  Loved the ballys casino. It's got a good feel. Like the clubs here too.  But the room .... Forgetable.  This is the old Mgm grand where the fire happened!! Kinda cool if you dig Vegas history.

The person at the check in counter said she was giving me a recently refurbished room, but the heater in the room was broken.  I had to wear a jacket to bed.  The font desk line was about an hour long.  It was either waste another hour standing in line, or freeze in bed.  Both bad options.

PROS:

- Stayed in the North Tower of the hotel with a view of the north side of the strip.  $40 on a Saturday.  Pretty good.

- Near EVERYTHING we love in Vegas... very easy walking distance to everything.

- Parking was somewhat close (had to go through Paris), but easy.

- Room was renovated (we think?) and was more than adequate for our $40 one-night stay.

- Bed was comfortable and linens were seemingly clean.

- Bathroom was much larger than most "standard" hotel rooms on the strip.  And clean with lots of towels.

- Ballsy has one of my favorite casinos, and connected to Paris, which also has a great casino.

- Express check-out made it a whole lot easier.

- Widescreen TV (not HD), but still had all the channels we liked.



CONS:

- Check-in took FOREVER.

- On the way to Hotel Registration, was stopped by a guy trying to sell us on a hotel package.... we had just arrived and I was flu-ish and the last thing we needed was to be held up by a guy trying to sell us a bad deal.  PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE get get rid of this promotion... NO ONE WILL BUY IT!!!!

- Concierge says no restaurants in the hotel are open after midnight.  So when we returned to our room at 1pm and needed something eat -- whatever, as long as it's close -- our only option was heading to Paris or somewhere across the street.  Trudge, trudge, trudge.  And the cold air from the cold night was sobering.  (Ballys -- Your Sea website says they're open until 2am, but yet they closed at midnight.  Pffft.)

- Bottled water at the gift shop is $5.

- Wi-Fi is $14.  Cellular service on the iPad sucked.


All in all, I'd probably book again, but will bring some snacks with me in the future.

First time staying here  --  and I only came for a training class.  Location is awesome.  Service associated with my conference was awesome.  We had morning pastries, muffins and coffee.  We had a buffet style lunch that accommodated meat lovers and vegetarians which included water, sodas and dessert - all which was yummy!  In the afternoon we had chilled sodas.  A water cooler, ice and cups were provided throughout the day.  The front desk staff was very courteous, in person - not so much on the phone.  My reason for the three star drop mostly had to be for services associated with the room.  There was no coffee machine and associated accoutrements.  Room service is from 6am - 1pm ONLY!  Housekeeping did NOT remove my discarded food delivery leftovers until I personally put them in a trash bag.  AND when i did order coffee from room service, those items were also left behind for two days - even after I placed it outside the room on the floor, as I saw other people do.  And don't expect any service on the casino floor along the full length of the front entrance.  I know, it's Vegas and not to expect much when the drinks are free, but still --  using the service call button twice did not result in any wait staff to show up.  The room size was nice.  The view in the Indigo tower was good.  The pool felt like it was a mile away and you are forced to walk through their "mall" and being attacked endlessly by people trying to sell you skin care.  But, if you can tolerate all that, the price is right.

There isn't anything at this hotel that really stands out. The rooms are more affordable than some of the other hotels on the strip, but you get what you pay for. My wife was attending a conference here, so we didn't have a whole lot of say in where we stayed. The standard rooms have tons of popcorn ceiling texture, dated wallpaper and furniture, and the bathrooms are nothing special.

The casino isn't that great either, luckily Paris and Bally's are connected so you can just walk over to Paris for more choices on games and a better atmosphere.

All in all, it's a good enough place to stay if you want something cheaper, but you should walk to other places for your entertainment.

I had a very mediocre experience at Bally's. When we got to our room the room light wasn't working, then the shower wasn't working. Later, a technician and engineer came to fix each of these issues, but I'm unclear why we'd be placed in a room that was faulty. We attempted to go to the pool which is a hefty walk with my friend mom who's in a wheelchair to find out the pool was closed (before closing time) because of the wind. A big inconvenience and no notification prior. On the bright side, our housekeeper, Jose was phenomenal. You can access other hotels without leaving. Overall, is recommend it because it's reasonably priced and if you plan to be out all day and night.

I'm a big fan. Staff were super nice. Food a really good. Room service was quick, correct & not to hard on the wallet. I will be staying here again. It's the perfect location on the strip too. LOVED IT

We stayed here last week. Not bad. The room served its purpose. A place to sleep. However we did have poor customer service. We asked for extra blankets and they never came, the battery went out on our door lock, and the room was barely clean when we got there. There was trash from the previous guest, the mirrors were dirty, etc. The lighting in the room was  horrible it was so dark you could barely see to get ready. I expected a bit more for the price. Especially for housekeeping to clean up after the previous guest before we got there.

Worst hotel in the strip. They charge for literally EVERYTHING. If you reserve a smoking room make sure it's a SMOKING ROOM cause the maids will walk in your room without permission while you're sleeping and say it's not a smoking room and charge you $250. I will never stay here again.

I never usually go to Bally's and now I remember why. There was no service anywhere to be found. While sitting on the slot machine playing I was expecting at least 1 cocktail waitress to ask me if I wanted a drink. 30 mins past by still no waitress?.. I'm assuming its a weekend they are all busy but after 30 mins wouldn't you expect at least 1 cocktail waitress to come greet you and ask you if you wanted a drink. After waiting patiently after 30 mins has gone by I decided just to get up and go to another casino that would better serve our needs. I most likely would not go back to Bally's when I visit Vegas.

Yeah man, I am still not a fan of this place. I did not stay here but I do tend to stay at the NJ location as an overnight stay.
This to me is one of the few places I can't even win like $5 back or anything here.  Just bad news all around, I gave it a shot two years ago and no luck then either.
Now, I guess I face the day I will not be playing here anymore.  I am not saying this place is amateurish but I just did not see a giant ton of fun being had by any other people here.  I guess I just will be having fun at all the other spots.  No more MF'n excuses but yeah I am perfectly content to only come here again to possibly use the monorail station.  YEAH basically fuck this place.

*Fail number two was there were almost no waitress giving cocktails at 11:45 in the evening while playing the other night.  It was not even that busy and since I was playing for a bit, could've used another drink. My last rum and coke was almost empty.

*Location is nice, right on the strip and kind of in the middle of everything, right before you get to Cosmopolitan or Planet Hollywood area.

The beds are comfortable. 

They do not have free wifi which I find ridiculous with the amount you are paying. Barely any cable channels for those who can't go out and have fun. And you have to pay to keep your expensive gear safe.

I would definitely give this property a solid 3 1\/2 stars. It's pretty outdated in terms of building face and room interiors. The room is quite spacious, fantastic view of the cityscape and the bathroom has marble on the walls. The price is usually very reasonable to stay here and most all hotels in Vegas have the unavoidable resort fee. The pool has a tropical vibe and it's nearly 12ft deep! The one drawback is that they have no jacuzzi, but you have access to the other Ceasar's properties pools. Some are gratis and others require a nominal fee. I myself head over to the Paris Hotel since it's complimentary and they have two jacuzzis. There is definitely a long line at check in. There is a steam\/sauna which is all apart of your resort fee!
Bally's is known for their Sterling Brunch with free flowing champagne. The location is the winning attribute has it is located dead smack center with easy access to the monorail for the other hotel properties. Overall, I am definitely enjoying my stay and as long as you are not expecting total glam or a 4 star property then you will be pleasantly intrigued. You can also upgrade to the newer Jubilee rooms. This property also has one of the best showgirls show which is unfortunately the last of its kind!

If you're coming to Vegas, you should stay here. Here's why:
1) The price-to-quality ratio here is great. You're going to get a fantastic room, centrally located on the strip, for half the price of the surrounding hotels.
2) The location is also great. You can walk indoors to get you within a three minute outdoor walk to Planet Hollywood, the Bellagio, Paris, the Flamingo, and Cesar's Palace.
3) The customer service is excellent. The rooms don't have refrigerators but, if you want one, they'll bring one up. They give you twice the amount of towels as people in your room, and make the bed around when you leave your room.

The only downside: the casino is where people go to die. But if you're gambling in your own hotel, you're not doing Vegas correctly.

Chose this hotel based on location.  Check in was quick but I was early around 2 pm.  Dennis was very friendly.  upgraded me for ten dollars to the north tower.  I knew the south had a better view but the north is quieter.  Got a nice big room with a good view, not of the strip but it wasnt looking into a  wall.  Safe didnt work so I called ithe front desk.  They sent up a security officer and he couldnt fix it and it would be tomarrow so I called the desk and Rita upgraded me to a suite and was very apologetic.  I got an awesome room and I would have been happy just getting another standard room.  There is some evedince of this room being partied in but it is vegas.  Its very clean and has a coffe maker the other rooms dont.  Didnt have to wait long at all for the desk to correct the issues.  I wasnt bothered by anyone sellling time shares when I got here.  Awesome hotel, great location.

Best value for its huge room and very convinient location.  No wonder all rooms were sold out a week before I arrive.  The odor inside room was clean and no guests made loud noise.  They are priced really low but the quality of staff and guests are very well.  They don't have much ammenities, but it's Vegas! You don't need to stay at your own hotel.  I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who are looking for a decent hotel with the best value.

Bally's is ok.  Good enough if you are looking for an affordable place to stay.  The first room we had was nice and roomy, but we wanted two beds so we switched rooms. The second room was definitely not as big, it was pretty much standard hotel room fare and seemed outdated compared to many of the hotels in vegas now.  Personally, I would rather spend a little extra and stay at Caesar's (if you get on their mailing list, you can get some good deals).

I love the location of Bally's.

I also like the friendly people who work there. 

There was a bell woman by the name of Lisa who was outstanding. She was so friendly, and told us how to navigate our way through her hotel. My friend was in a wheelchair, so this was very helpful. She rented a wheelchair for about $10.00 a day for 4 days.

Our room was huge, comfortable, and clean. No smokey smell. Yes, it could have used a makeover, but we were still pleased for the value vs\/ the price. We paid about $78.67 a night, Sunday through Tuesday. We felt that the price was fair to good. We did not give any extra money to the front desk person, but we didn't care. How much time do you spend in your room, anyway?

The Buca di Beppo all you can eat breakfast, was a very good value for $15.99. I would suggest that you pick up a couple of gift cards from Costco for $79.00 for $100.00 worth of food. The gift cards work here.

There was a Thai restaurant (forgot the name) that was good, but the portions were surprisingly small for the price. My favorite dish was the dessert....a mango sticky rice. MMMM. Don't order the vegetables. They were cheap..mostly celery, carrots, and a little broccoli. 

There is a Starbucks at the corner in the front mini-mall, and a CVS in the next building to the left of the hotel, facing the main street. The CVS is expensive, but better to buy bottled water there than the hotel (a bottle of water costs between $4-5.00 in the hotel shops).

Overall, good visit at this hotel.

Bought the 5 nights for $200 deal and used two nights last week. Calling in for reservations was great. Super nice reservation clerk, very helpful. Checking in was a big disappointment. First off, three people at the front desk with a boatload of people in line. Not even a friendly "hello" from the guy at the desk. I went up, greeted him nicely told him my name to which he looked at me and said "Valid ID"...that was it...not even a thank you, enjoy your stay...person at the Total Rewards desk was just as pleasant as the last guy..apparently a bunch of disgruntled workers in Vegas these days...

Rooms were clean, but beds are uncomfortable and sheets feel like fine grit sandpaper. Valet also could not locate our car, even though we had not moved it for three days. Told us that it was not in the parking spot, but could not provide any explanation as to why.

Pool is small for a hotel this size, and water was cloudy. 

We still have three nights to use up. Hopefully our experience will be a better one.

Ugh, the beds in the Indigo Tower are horrible - it absorbs nothing and you feel everything when someone touches or moves around on any other part of the bed...like a waterbed. 

Self parking (free) was in a shared lot with Paris.  A bit of a hike but you do get a glimpse of the Paris shopping mall and Bally's casino floor. Valet was also available.  Check-in was as expected.  Long lines unless you had VIP status.  

As for the rest of the room, the "junior suite" we received was huge but lacked furniture.  It had 2 queens, a couple of desks, 2 random dining like chairs, and entertainment cabinet.  There was enough empty space for at least 2 more queen beds in the main area.  The pieces that were present looked old and a result of a cost conscious renovation.  The bathroom was on the smaller end but serviceable and not noteworthy.  Standard amenities were provided - shampoo, condition, and soap.   No lotion.

I had avoided Bally's based on the reviews but this recent trip to Las Vegas was just a 6 hour stopover so i didn't care to drop that much monies on a room that I would rarely see.  The casino was meh as well.  It has all the standard games and sportsbook but not a lot of energy.  Paris next door is a better option.

It definitely lived up to its reputation - cheap, basic rooms with a great location in the heart of the strip.  Personally would not stay there again - I would rather check out an offstrip option (less money and better rooms) and cab it in or drive and park in the free lots on the strip.

Love this hotel and casino. The rooms are older, but very clean and very large with flat screen tv's, granite counter tops. Also, guest of the hotel have full use of the Spa.  The men's portion of the spa has three hot tubs (hot, warm, and cold dipping pool), a wet sauna, a dry sauna, and a steam room. There is also an area male grooming and very nice showers. The restaurants are great and of course the casinos are fabulous.

We have been staying here for years... love the location... and how it's connected to the Paris... they have valet... eating places, coffee... a little convenience store... cvs is right outside... it's a small casino floor... but the rooms are bigger than most that I've stayed in at other hotels... staff is usually pretty friendly... it can get super busy at times... for checkins and checking out... I will say- this is a much older hotel... some of the things in the room could be in better condition... the jubilee rooms all have a refrigerator, but no tub...just a shower... and the indigo rooms have a tub, but no refrigerator... hard to choose for me... I like to have both a refrigerator and tub... but again, I love this hotel for the value, convenience, what it has to offer...

My room was a dump.  Peeling wall paper in the main room and bathroom.  At least tape or glue the wall paper down rather than having it separated away from the wall.  Paint peeled off of trim work long time ago. Bed height is about to your knees. One broken lamp and lightbulb missing in another .  After staying there for probably 6 times, this will be my last time.  Their prices are about the same as elsewhere.  Not worth it considering you gotta pay $30 resort fee and $12 parking fee daily.   I have pics of the dive room but not worth posting since they already have 1260 pics to wade through.   They claim they'll remodel at some point.

We love Bally's.

The first time I stayed here, in 2009 or '10, the Indigo rooms were the newer ones, and Jubilee were the old ones. Then they renovated the Jubilee side and now folks are complaining about the seediness of what was - not so long ago! - the "nice" side. The difficult part of reading online reviews is figuring out the review-writer's expectations, and whether they are similar to yours. I'm not a luxury sort of gal - I've never had that sort of money - so my expectations are for clean and decent, and that's exactly what I get at Bally's.

Rooms and bathrooms are large. There are annoying fees, but that's a Vegas thing. You come to Vegas, you deal with weird things like no coffee maker (they want you to leave the room) and no fridge, and sky high "resort" fees. It's part of the price of doing business. Since I know what to expect in Vegas, no complaints there.

Great experiences with check-in (even though I was directed to a spot by a name that should've been, like, on a sign somewhere so I could figure out where to go without asking three different people), and check out, which can now be done online. Every employee I interacted with was either just fine, or downright pleasant, including the friendly cleaning dude I exchanged "Merry Christmas'" with at 4:00 in the morning.

Our favorite casino game kept dying - it was out of service when we first arrived, to our disappointment (The Big Wheel - look for it! It's fun!). The next time we checked it was working! Then not working. Then working! And it stayed working, as far as I could tell, for the rest of our visit. Oh, we arrived Christmas eve, so even on this day, the repair folk are working their tushes off.

Drink service in the casino is okay. Not great, but perfectly okay. You have a better chance of being offered a drink if you're not on the slots.

Ventilation (poor) in the casino area is the worst thing about this hotel.

The webpage information about the fitness center is confusing. Your resort fee covers admission to the fitness center, which is inside\/behind the spa. However, they closed early on Christmas eve, without warning, and we didn't bother checking again, so we didn't get to try it out.

The folks in the room across from ours were super noisy, but we heard them only in the hallway. Once we went inside and closed our door, it was practically silent.

you can never complain about the main hotel\/casino chains on the strip unless you still go to Circus Circus. This place has a great location on the strip seeing that you dont pay as much as you would as Caesars or Belagio, but yet its across the street. So, never a complaint here.

This experience was better than the last couple times because they gave us a window that faced the monorail...which my son LOVED! (*kind of an understatement), but it kept him busy half the day which is good for us!

I love this place for the location and the front desk is always courteous professional and polite!

I booked a 5 night deal for $200 to be used anytime by the end of the year.  I figured this was a great deal since I could split my stay.  

So the first time I visited, the experience was not so bad.  However, I made several requests to be moved over to a different tower as my husband and I were travelling with family and my husbands brother and cousin were placed in the same tower.  Someone at the front desk said they moved us over to the same tower as our family for the next day which was great for us only to find out the next morning that we were going to be charged extra.  This would have been fine if it had been explained to us the night before.  

The next time I stayed to redeem the rest of the package I had purchased all was well, or so I thought.  When I was going to bed, I pulled back the covers only to find a red stain across the sheets.  Whether it was blood or lipstick, this shouldn't have happened.  Aren't the people in housekeeping paying attention?  I did take several picture and went down to the front desk to complain.  Only to be greeted by the rudest lady I have ever met.  I am very big on customer service and expect to be treated well.  After all, if this had been my hotel, I would want people to return.  

She sent housekeeping up to change our sheets after insisting that it was probably rust on the sheets.  (I'm not stupid I know what a little rust would look like)  The lady that changed our sheets was a hot mess.  she was dropping the pillows and blankets on the floor and was stepping all over it.  This bothered me terribly as I don't even do this at my own home.  Clean linens should never touch the ground.

So, I do have to admit, I was quite disappointed at this.  The location was great and the price was a steal.  But for poor treatment and a dirty room?  Worth it?  I'm not so sure.

I LOVED IT HERE! At check in they saw that it was my birthday and upgraded me to a suite for free! The staff was super friendly, rooms were clean, and they have free valet. The check out was super easy you just have to write your name and leave your key and put in a box near the front, which is great because it's really busy there and the last thing you want to do is wait in line just to check out. I will definitely be staying here again!

I do not care what people say this casino is awesome.

$5 crap tables? Yes please. Free drinks while you place the $5 crap tables? Double yes please. 

This casino is great if you do not want to spend a crap load of money to place a couple of games of Blackjack or craps AND the casino is on the strip so you do not have to go out of your way.

WARNING: They are doing some construction work so you have to walk a little ways to get the casino. 

Protip: place on the 6 and 8 on craps - pays out great. 
Double protip: straight bet on the ace-deuce at least once - I promise it will hit :)

Our room needs serious renovation.  The wallpaper were peeling off, the TV screen was not clear, looks like an analog.  We did not get the deluxe room that we reserved.  The location however is ideal.
Just checked in omg rude at front desk (lady) room filthy so disgusting. From the walls to carpet. Just gross.

Came to Ballys for my youngest boys 21st along with his two brothers. Came in around 5pm walked in and got our room. Got a room in the North Tower Room 2251. Excellent room and view of the Strip. Room was big for 4, as well as clean. Beds comfortable and restroom served its purpose. Staff was professional and helped out anyway they could. No problems at all. Would stay here again.

Pretty standard for an average Vegas hotel, except...

Could the staff have been ANY MORE DIFFICULT to work with?

Why is it so hard to give us the right room the first time?
Why is it so hard to give us the right room after you messed up the first time?
Why is it so hard to give us an upgrade from the first time, considering you made the mistake?
Why do we have to spend a good 10 minutes on the phone with front desk, getting transferred from person to person, only to be forced to ask to speak to a manager, in order for you to make things right?

I've never stayed at Bally's before, but I've stayed in Vegas a million and a half times, and I'd never had such difficulty in figuring out a room reservation.  What's strange is, we'd reserved everything in advance, and it was still difficult.  I've literally WALKED IN without reservations to random hotels in Vegas and had easier times getting a decent room.

Strange, I say.

Oh, and the casino is tiny but functional.

In the end, the room that we ended up with wasn't bad at all, except for the fact that we had a CRT tv.  What hotels in Vegas have CRT tvs nowadays?  Then again, it didn't really matter.  Who goes to Vegas to watch tv?

Last complaint...

Maybe it's the fact that the Harrah's chain hates me after the "incident" a few years ago.  Or maybe the chain has just gotten sheisty over the past few years.

Whatever the case, WHY IS HARRAH'S ENT. SO STINGY WITH THEIR COMP POINTS?!

We stayed here 2 nights from Wed till Fr. We arrived at 3 pm and decided to try check-in. It takes 3 minutes. The front desk man was not so pleasant but he gave us 23 floor and we were happy even with non-Strip view. The room was good, hairdryer, bathroom eminities and everything works. The only thing what we dont like the ventilation does not work in the room. We cant ope the window either. So at night my husband could not sleep with really heavy air. It was a little smoky. Actually I dont know how to explain what was that. Next day we called o assistance and describe our problem. They sent us a man with freshener in the hand. It was definitely wrong. So we called on more time to ask about technician. They said ok and we left our room about 6 pm. We back at 12 am and noticed nobody was here. So we called again. And they said engeneer will come to you. We ate and really was tired, wanted to relax and go to sleep. We asked don't come. That was a bad moment in my vacation because it makes me feel not important. They just forgot about us. 
NO FREE parking. 10$ on public parking.
Resort fee includes Wi-Fi for 2 devices and access to gym.
The Casino was inetersting but the glasses were dirty. 
In general vacation was good.

The view from our room was great- but this room had the trifecta of loud: the Eiffel Tower club, the Bellagio water fountain show, and thin walls. I wouldn't recommend the side of the hotel near Paris since it's SO loud. The location of the hotel is near the middle\/north side of the strip and is connected to Paris. The casino is smoky and wasn't pleasant to walk through or play in. The room service ends at 1 pm. The shower was flooding into the bathroom. Will not be coming back.

You know what? I am a fan. Yay. We scored another great Hotwire deal for two nights, then checked in with a teething 11-month old and a mother-in-law who wanted to see what the big deal was with Vegas before she went back to England. Minus one star for the painfully long check-in queue; I suggest they either put more reps at the counters, or have reps in the queue ready to hold luggage and whining children. Or your Starbucks, if you're single and get to sleep in and enjoy hot baths and food and have an entirely different Vegas experience damn you where did my life go.

The room was a two-queener with blah cable and a sprawling view of the roof, but spacious and very clean. We got a free fridge for our child's food, but it took three calls to get it up to our room. Still four stars, as I should have called ahead to request it. It also took three calls and three visits from housekeeping before we got the extra blankets we requested. They're also pretty firm on the 11am checkout time, but if you're nice and have children, or can borrow one from another family, they will give you until 11:30 to get to steppin. A $28 resort fee gets you "free" wi-fi, which is accessible by simply entering in the room number and the last name of the person who checked in. 

Good walking path through Paris to get to the Strip. On the other side, escalators (or elevators if you are pushing a stroller God help me) take you across and down to Bally's entrance, where Starbucks is waiting to save your life. Walgreens and the Miracle Mile shops are just two hotels over (just past Paris and Planet Hollywood). We usually do Excalibur for our contemporary room with the rollercoaster view (yes, I am that lame), but I have to say that I felt safer at Bally's, there were less children running around, and there was no cigarette toothpaste smell in the casino. You also get an Express Checkout option at the end of your stay (just grab a pen and a card and fill out the particulars). I would stay there again, this time sans child and in-laws, and in a room with a Strip view.

Ballys is one of the older hotels on the strip, but it has been nicely maintained. For an older hotel it's not that bad and reasonable priced in general. However, with that said, if you compare it to the Ventenian or even Mirage, it's not as good in my opinion. The fitness center was actually a little disappointing and the once famous Big Kitchen Buffet wasn't all that great (it used to be spot on for dinner).

One thing going for Ballys is location. It is smack in the middle of the strip which is great. If you truly just need a place to crash, Ballys is a good choice.

Stayed here for 3 nights after finding a great deal online. Checked in around 3am in the morning and the wonderful registration employee gave me an upgrade to the Jubilee Tower. The rooms are pretty great and have a nice red tone with a great view of part of the strip looking out st Linq and Ceasars Palace. The King room is spacious and the bathroom is more than I expected. 

The Blu Pool is peaceful and it was everything I could have asked for. Make sure you being your own sunscreen and pool needs because the store next to the pool has outrageous prices. 

Ballys is in a perfect location on the strip and shares the same lot as Paris hotel. We could hear and see the Ballagio water show and were very pleased at the cheap rate. 

I had no problems with the employees and because you are in the middle of the strip, walking to the Caesars Palace, Venetian, Aria, etc is easy.

Looking forward to coming again.

Just got back on business, and a little pleasure. 

Positive: large rooms, clean, and location! we were right off the strip which made it easy to wallk around and enjoy the sights.

Negative: Front desk service was lacking badly, although some of the other staff had excelllent customer service. There is no Wifi, so that sucked, and if you needed high speed you had to pay 14bucks! also the shower\/tub was clogged, and no coffee in the rooms. I had to pay almost 4 bucks for a cup of coffee in the lobby! 

Overall it was okay, but understand I am not taking into account any of the other amenities. I was there on business, I did not even have time to go to the pool, the restuarants, shops, or even gamble. (which I don't like to anyway) 

So, 2 stars. I guess if you just need a place to stay, take of business and leave, and enexpensive (i believe?) I don't know, my accommodations were paid for, so I can't really complain too much.

And the other reviews about hotel for 40 and over? I don't know? saw plenty of beautiful people have a great time.
thanks

Bally's saved my groupon weekend! I got a groupon deal for Rio Hotel (dont judge me its my 2nd time in vegas) I upgraded to a suite, upon check in Rio tells us they closed an entire section of hotel and were going to Bally's. Apparently Rio had some legionaries outbreak so we were glad we left. We checked into Bally's got an adorable little suite and a $50 dollar food credit. Everything was nice and clean, room service was great, and the gentleman at the front desk, his name was Elvis, was awesome. I love the paris section with all the restaurants we ate at a great sushi spot in there.

Terrible Caesar's Entertainment Property - Will Not Be Back

We just returned from a Birthday trip for my daughter... we had four rooms at Bally's. The two rooms that were in the "old tower" were entirely unacceptable. They were not only old and tired but filthy and in total disrepair. One room even had a bloody hand print on the wall! Dirty linens, stained carpets, marred furniture, stained bathroom amenities, the list is long. We went to the front desk to see about changing a room and were told they were totally sold out so no other rooms available. Then, when I offered a tip, the nice young lady said, "well I can probably find one but it will be an extra $75 per night". When I told her that was ridiculous, considering they were already paying $250 per night, she kindly reduced the upgrade fee to $40 per night. How funny that she miraculously found a room! Extortion just like the old Mob days!

We had our choice of two free rooms at any Caesar's property and chose Bally's only because it was less expensive for those who had to pay. We will never make that mistake again. You could not pay me to stay there again.

The gambling was the worst I've experienced in my 30 years of experience. I don't expect to get rich but a simple return once in a while would have been reasonable. I didn't believe the horrible gambler reviews online about this place buy now I understand and agree.

The only decent thing about this hotel is its location. However, there are so many better choices in the area and price range. One bright spot - A couple of the staff members were very nice, particularly the lady at the Diamond Desk.

Do yourself a favor... choose somewhere else! We couldn't have been more disappointed.
Wonderful hotel and Casino in Vegas! I went to this hotel in February : very good price for a beautiful place. The room was so lovely and the Casino amazing

Our stay was pretty good. Big room comfy bed. Only problem was the maid folded our old towels and hung them like new instead of giving us new ones. That's just nasty. We paid good money for a good stay. That put a damper on the stay but we still enjoyed the trip on a whole.

I am embarrassed to be even writing a review about this hotel because this would be admitting that I stayed here.  No joke, when we asked the cab to drop us off here, he said "are you sure?, you don't look like you would stay there."  I died a little after that comment.  In my defense, it was a last minute trip and we were only there for about 6 hours to see friends visiting for a wedding.  My other friend had booked it because it was the first hotel that came up on her search and the room, no joke, was $30. 

Anyways, back to my review....I think Bally's marketing team literally dropped off coupons for rooms at every trailer park in America.  I'm not judging but I kind of am.  As a woman, I honestly felt uncomfortable walking through this hotel at certain times because their patrons seem to also be residents of the local prison (just an assumption).  I have never in my life seen more flannel print since 1992.

In regards to the staff.  The bellman, valet, and housekeeping were all very sweet.  Everyone else we encountered just seemed lost.  When we ordered a coffee at the deli, the cashier looked at my friend like she had just requested she solve a statistic equation and she was about to pass out.  Took like 10 minutes for the coffee with no one else in line.

However, the room was surprisingly nice and large. Also, the location is great.  I guess I'm high maintenance so take my opinion for what it is and of course, you get what you pay for.

I stayed at Bally's in April 2010 when I went to Vegas with a group of friends and we had a fun and hassle-free experience.  We didn't actually stay at the hotel for very long (we were mostly out walking around other hotels in the day and nighttime as well) but it was a pretty decent experience.  It's not the best of hotels but it's definitely not the worst either.  There is nothing particularly memorable about Bally's but we were treated well and had a good stay.

I booked a room at Bally's Las Vegas for Friday Aug. 5th and the rate online showed $47 but when I booked the room it charged me $59. So I looked at the online rate again and it said $47. I called Bally's and the lady told me that the $47 rate is sold out but I told her it still showing $47 online. The lady would not help me at all even though it shows $47 but charges you $59 when you book the room. I will be filing a complaint with  the BBB about this practice and being a Platinum member will no longer stay at Bally's Las Vegas.
Great hotel!!! Stayed in North Tower and room was all that and more!! Clean big and just great!!! Won't ever stay anywhere else!

I'd stayed here for 5 nights, $70\/night, cant beat that. Looking from the outside is nothing fancy, but when I went in, it wowed me because it didnt appear as old as the way I imagined base on the reviews, everything was like brand new and shiny. The person who checked me in was alright, he seemed like in rush, didnt ask for my preference, except if i like smoking or non smoking room, he seemed busy typing without looking up, therefore I didnt want to bother him for asking anything, but he did give me a king size bed which I put a note when I reserved on line. It was such a hike to get to my room, but when I got there, it paid off, I booked for a classic room, but he gave me a deluxe one, nice, the room was spacious and been renovated, bathroom had marbles, was clean and bigger than in my house lol. Housekeeping did a great job, she cleaned every single day while i was there, gave extra towels without being asked, and paid attention to every details in the room. Oh one more thing I loved, my floor had an ice machine, you could get it for free, as much as you want, and as many times as you like, how cool was that? it's really helped when it's summer and hot after you go sightseeing under the sun for a whole day, not to mention mix it with your alcohol. 
Location was perfectly central, it connected through Paris without going outside, and Bellagio was across the street to see water fountain every night, as well as other hotels around. I would recommend this hotel if you're on budget, but want a nice & clean place.
Tip: text "Ballys" to 227466 to receive coupon through your phone.

Zero stars!  DO NOT STAY HERE unless u don't mind the sound of jack hammer and a debris being thrown down a trash shoot.  There's construction going on and they don't care if u are here to relax in your room or not.  This is the worst hotel experience we have ever been through.  I can't believe ownership expects paying customers to simply tolerate these conditions.  It's so bad this portion of the hotel shouldn't be open.  It's like living in a home during a complete demolition for a remodel.   

I would encourage the hotel leadership to at least walk the 24th floor to see what I mean.

Not bad, but there are many better choices on the strip.  
Pros: friendly staff, good location, large rooms.  
Cons: Rooms outdated. Few on-site amenities. Not very luxurious.  
Details:  I stayed here for the first time recently, 3 nights.  I was in the north tower (facing flamingo blvd) which I understand has been renovated while the south tower has not.  My room was very large and well furnished, but not opulent.  But it seemed to be a mile from elevators.  The guests seemed mostly mainstream Americans, not the young beautiful rich people you see at other places.  I called the hotel operator to be connected to concierge for help getting show tickets; operator told me there is no concierge; but I should look at the magazine in my room!  I could not believe it.  Maybe the operator was wrong, or maybe they really have no concierge.  Either way, thats a let down.  On the plus side, staff was exceptionally friendly.  Rita at front desk was cheerful and helpful even though I was probably the 500th drunk she'd had to deal with that night.  
I think I'd feel better if I'd gotten the room via some type of super web deal.  But for what I paid, expected better.

Bally's isn't a staple in Las Vegas. A little older than others but still very good. I was given a room in the Jubilee Tower and I was quite impressed. Relatively large room, King bed, view of the strip, the basic wifi was affordable. Right next door connected via a seamless passage is the Paris hotel. I went to the Indigo bar one night. Good music and the bartender was very friendly. An older over 40 crowd although I saw 1-2 younger people come in for a drink. Overall a good place

Sleeping arrangements for fifteen consisted of four rooms with two queens in each. 
That's room for eight, I know.
But we're all dudes in town for the NCAA March Madness Tournament and that means not everyone will be in their room sleeping at the same time. 
It works out. It does every year.
Except this year.

The little bitch at check-in informed us all they had were single beds and no connecting rooms. She said to guarantee sleeping arrangements, we needed to pay an additional fifteen dollars when booking. 
One problem.
Hotels.com doesn't have a guarantee feature for fifteen dollars, or any amount for that matter.

Fifteen adult males in four rooms with four beds. 
Even if I was gay, it still would have been a problem due to the man stench after day two, a blend of beer farts and that cheap shit perfume strippers wear.

If that wasn't bad enough, Bally's stuck us in rooms atop the Indigo Nightclub where those of us who did try to sleep couldn't, due to the rhythmic thumping from 2am to 8 am. Their after-hours party.

It gets better.
Bally's, in their infinite wisdom, knowing fully well Spring Break and March Madness occurred on the same weekend, booked a handicap convention for the same time.
The National Ataxia Foundation.
Fucking great.

A convention for people who are unable to walk, their only ambulatory device being either a walker or Rascal motorized scooter.

No sleep.
Trance, albums #1-7 burned into my brain.
Feeling bad about myself from cutting off Rascal drivers whenever the first available elevator opened. 
Who needs that shit.

The fifteen of us will take our business anywhere next year but Bally's.
Bally's, you suck horse balls.

Bally's is an older hotel and not nearly as flashy as the newer ones and not nearly as expensive. We stayed in the south tower and it was definately in need of some TLC and a little more elbow grease with the cleaning rag. The corners in the bathroom were very dirty and the carpet in the room looked like it could use a good cleaning as well. The furniture was chipped and ugly but the mattress was do-able. On the upside, the location was fantastic, the best in my opinion which is the reason I give it 4 stars. Views were incredible and the rest of the hotel really quite nice. For 32.00 a night it was a steal. For the location alone, I would definately stay there again. 

Room Tip: The 10.00 upgrade to the North tower which was recently remodeled might have been very worth it.

I have stayed in better hotels (Venetian, Mandalay, MGM, Rennaisance Marriott,Paris) but for the price of $50\/night , this is a GOOD DEAL!

 Bally's room is big. I think this have been updated, because the counters are already granite or stone. 

We always book Non smoking  and they do have floors for that.Our floor, 15th , was really  decent and clean (no foul smell).

Service at the check in was fast & efficient. ( I hate the most is the Mandalay Bay check in)

Location is excellent. It is at the center of everything.

Hl got some bad news I am A bartender at the tequila bar bad news everyone  our great little spot is closing February 2nd so come in have a good time while the fun last and prices are down a new place is taking over the tequila bar and the sidewalk cafe happy holidays come see HL or hot lips a bartender I'm going to miss you all but I go down too the casino bar as service so come by and see me after it closes February 2nd bday . If you'd like to text me 702 503 8706 send a photo and text me anytime let me know if you're coming into town so we can party

Okay so we get in at 1am after having our rooms reserved 2 months in advance, they tell us they don't have our room, that they only have a 1 king bed room and we'll be switched to our room tomorrow and that they will call us and then they comp our resort fee for one day.
The next day we go out to breakfast come back and still no phone call or anything, there was no shower curtain, dirty towels, only decorative pillows no real pillows, a huge stain on our wall that looked like someone threw something wet at the wall, outlet didn't work and one of our lamps didn't work, so I go downstairs and there's way to long of a line to get helped because they only had three employees at the desk, then I go upstairs and call and they said they had our room ready and gave us a food and drink comp (which for Vegas prices wasn't really worth anything) and that I have to go downstairs for the keys, so I do everything get to our room and we go to our room and guess what we only get a one bedroom hotel, dead bug on our window, stained curtains etc....so now my mom calls and then I have to go downstairs AGAIN for our new keys after they tried to tell us we had to wait another day for our room AGAIN and once they finally agreed to give us the room we reserved it took an hour to actually get the keys because they were so poorly staffed, and the new room is mediocre and small with a bad view after they said we'd even get a better view the next day. NEVER AGAIN.

:: ROOM REVIEW ONLY (KING BED) ::

We chose our stay at Bally's for our past weekend trip due to a pretty good Groupon deal. Room rates: weekend @  $79 & weekday @ $35.

We check-ed in after 7PM on a Friday night and the line was minimal. Our front-desk gal was friendly and we requested for the highest floor possible in the renovated Jubilee Tower. She gave us floor 65 :)  Our room view faced Caesars Palace, Bellagio, Flamingo, Drais, & LinQ.

The room was spacious. The bed did not disappoint. We napped for hours on Sat night & missed out on clubbing! :\  The bathroom was clean & comfortable.  Definitely call Housekeeping for a humidifier (generally available) for it'll really help with the dry air!

What I've noticed this time around that I didn't before was when you open the room lights it does take a little time to warm up & then it really lights up the room. At 1st, we were like the room looks so dim & thought it was for romantic room purposes :P


:: NOTES ::

1) Fridge is hidden in the dresser below the TV. You need to turn it on to get it working. Fridge does not come stocked with goodies. So it's great to bring your own & fill it up.

2) Bathroom amenities were minimal: 1 bath bar, 1 face bar, 1 shampoo\/conditioner & 1 lotion

3) Each day could be a different housekeeper cleaning your room -- so we tipped house keeping couple of dollars per day of our stay there. 

4) Valeting the car was much easier & quicker than self-parking. Not much wait time either (at most 10 min) when we went this past weekend. 

5) We didn't bother checking out at the front desk nor through the TV nor online. We just left our keys in the room & headed home. A day later I received my invoice via email.

Just stayed here from Sunday the 20th to Wednesday the 23rd and I absolutely loved it. We got our room upgraded which was super dope and it was only 100 a night after the resort fee so if you're a college student like me it's the way to go! My girl and I stayed at the Venetian back in January and I honestly like this better. Better location and they had 10 dollar min tables. Now you're not going to get the high end thrills and luxury of places like the Venetian or Aria but I'm barely in the room anyways. When I go to Vegas it's for the action not to sleep all day! Why not 5 stars? Well the pool is just OK, food options are very limited, and the bed could have been better if there was more than one blanket. Overall though it was extremely satisfying and worth way more than I had paid for it. Staff was friendly enough and I wouldn't hesitate to come back. If you're like me and prefer spending your money on the action then ballys is the place for you. Ps the housekeeping staff were really nice.

The only good two thing to staying at Ballys was that it was in the middle of the strip and close to what we were doing, and that the rooms were decently big.  Other than that the staff was rude and it was a dirty run down hotel!  I won't be staying at Ballys again!

Let 's start with the good: 1. My room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. 2. The hotel's location couldn't be better -- right at the corner of the Strip and Flamingo Rd. It's perfect.

Now, let's list some of the issues:

1. It took 25 minutes to check in, and I started at only number 3 in line. There were at least 15 positions at the check-in counter, but only 3 employees working.

2. The air conditioning in my room would not cool things off below 75 degrees.

3. The shower temperature varied between lukewarm and "meh," regardless of how high I turned the knob.

4. The drain in the tub was mostly blocked, leaving me standing in 5" of soapy water at the end of a quick shower.

5. The tub and bathroom floor had many long, black hairs on them. My hair is neither long nor black.

6. The TV is enclosed in a cabinet that will not allow you to view it from anywhere but on the bed. So much for watching a movie while you eat your room service dinner at the desk...

Overall, the negatives outweigh the positives. For the same price, I could stay at an off-strip, 2-star hotel and get the same treatment. Sorry, Bally's. I'm not impressed in the slightest.

I stayed in a no frills type of room but still had the comfort I wanted on vacation. The beds were super comfortable.

- On The Strip
- Can walk straight into the Paris Hotel without going outside 
- Pool access 

Can't really ask for more, for the price.

PROS: Moderately priced, standard amenities, convenient location on The Strip, connected to Paris.

CONS: VERY standard amenities, skimped on toiletries\/towels, idle employees during check-in chaos.

Would recommend to those not looking to spend a whole lot of money to be on The Strip.

-----

As the 3\/5 stars review suggests, there is not anything too special about this place. It is your standard hotel\/casino, neither a shit hole or a palace, that is conveniently located on The Strip: Across from Bellagio and Caesar's Palace, connected to Paris, and about a 5 minute walk to The Cromwell\/Drai's day club. Because of these things, you would not be paying for top-notch amenities or amazing rooms, your money is investing in the great location. Staying here allowed us to walk everywhere we needed to go, inebriated and not. 

In terms of the room, unless you are staying in a suite or in a newly renovated room, it is really just a place to sleep and sober up. The only complaints I have are that during the height of check-in on Friday, there were employees that seemed to just be standing around and talking to employees that were actually working and struggling, and that the rooms had the very minimal toiletries and towels. 

Not a GREAT place to stay, but it is a place to stay if you are looking to wreck havoc in Las Vegas and do not plan on staying in the room very much. If you are going to be in the room for some time, the TV's have TNT movies at least.

Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2015 #17 - #365

Classic.

Affordable.

Clean.

Friendly.


These words are what accurately describe Bally's Las Vegas (formally MGM Grand).  As always I had a comp room offer and didn't hesitate to book for our family trip because it was FREE! I'm more a mid roller and I'm glad to still receive free rooms from Ballys, Flamingo, Harrah's and Rio. It's great to see a part of Vegas history still alive on the Vegas strip now that Stardust and Frontier are gone. 

But anyways, the best thing about Bally's is the direct location on the strip right across from Bellagio where you can see the fountains from the Indigo and South Tower. Back in the day, Bally's in the 70's was the Bellagio of it's time and time sure did take a toll on this property. Let's be honest here, the rooms are alright, clean and cozy. The casino is plus because it's easy to maneuver compared to Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. Just a few second away is the Paris hotel connected to the Bally's casino, what a great way to keep your guests from lingering to their competitors. 

Their food options are great with a food court in the basement and a 24 hour cafe but that will soon be replaced with a hipper restaurant. Tables minimums are low and slots didn't pay as much compared to Paris. Getting comp rooms at Bally's is pretty easy if you gamble a few $$$ in their casino. As always, the hotel is nothing fancy and still has that 90's vibe to it with the retro furniture. Not a lot of outlets in the room to charge your electronics.

NO! NO! NO! I did not like my stay this past weekend. 
-First off the check in line is horrendous and there were only 3 people working for reg. check in and a line with 20 guest and I see other employees just not doing anything to help....
-Second, the room is connected to another room which the guest in that room kept trying to open the connected room to our room.
-NOW THE THING THAT UPSET ME THE MOST....was that I specifically put the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door, and yet the (house keeping )opened our room ..then saw that we were inside and said house keeping. WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON!!??? I specifically put the sign on the door and they still came in; then said sorry..... what if i wasn't in there, they would come in still? I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AND I DO NOT TRUST IT. 

BALLYS YOU NEED TO HAVE A HUGE CONFERENCE WITH YOUR EMPLOYEES AND SET THINGS STRAIGHT.

This place is the lowest of the low an example of a shit holes make that the perfect example of a shit hole. Bad enough that the place is run down from the oldest slot machines in Vegas to the crap furniture that's been around since Elvis Presley was born. Velvet sofas in the rooms, crappy pillows and if that's not bad enough every staff member I encountered or was forced to interact with was completely worthless and did not give a rats ass about customer service. Each one passed the buck like they didn't give a F*cK. Really these idiots are in the service business? And can receive tips? The worst dumbass of them all was Donnie the bartender who tried to charge me
$3 each for 2 8 oz bottles of water that they give out for free? $6 for 2 bottles of water I picked up on the way to my room 2 nites in a row for free now cost $6? Idiot. 

I complained to Chris Lowe Director of Operations who also didn't seem to care. This was the last straw for me. We checked out even though we had 5 more nights paid in advance. We moved to Encore where so far they are customer service oriented.

Bottom line u get what u pay for and the only good thing I can say about Ballys is there weren't any bed bugs!
mold in the bathtub, smell of mold. horrible place. I would rather stay in my car next time.

The check in line was long (about 30 mins) but figures since we did arrive at 4 pm. The line moved pretty quickly, thanks 24 oz beer :) Since we wanted adjoining rooms with our friend, the lady checking us in told us that adjoining rooms are 1 king bed adjoined to 2 queen beds. That option would not work for us, so we asked if we could at least be on the same floor as our friends. When our friends arrived, they were in the room right across from us!! Even better!

Stayed in the Jubilee tower (room 6515). AWESOME view of the strip by the way!!!  The rooms are very spacious, and clean! Beds are comfy and plush! No bathtub but the shower was very relaxing with the rainfall shower head. 

After the day club and eating Earls Sandwich, we decided to go back to the room for a quick nap. That quick nap lasted for 2-3 hours!!! We had a show to catch at 9, and we still had to get ready! Me, being dumb, plugged in a blow dryer while my friend was using one too. Before we knew it, the power to the restroom turned off along with some power in the room. I called housekeeping and within 10 minutes maintenance went to the generator outside the room and fixed the power inside the room. We thought the restroom would be fixed too so we didn't bother calling again. We got ready in our friends restroom across from us and headed to the show! When we came back, still no power in restroom. I called housekeeping again, and within 5 mins, maintenance came inside the room, poked something on the outlet and lights turned on! we felt stupid :(

Overall, an GREAT stay here at Bally's. Prime location in the middle of the strip. Will DEF stay here again in the future! :)

I also liked how you can select a time to check out via phone! Saved some time and didn't have to check out at front desk.

:( no free wifi!!

My review straddles a 2 and 3 - it works for Vegas if you're budgeting but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone other than for the opportunity to save $. The lobby smells heavily of cigarettes (more so than other hotels on the Strip). Employees are friendly (especially those helping you into taxis) and seem genuinely interested in your wellbeing and stay. Bally's is nicely straddled by Paris and Flamingo and in my opinion is right where you want to be on the Strip, destinations easy walking distance in both directions. No theme unlike other hotels. So...was it worth the $50 a night paid through Hotwire? Yes. :) But now having the exposure I will likely opt for a nicer hotel for a little more $.

I really love staying at Bally's. I stayed here for New Year's Eve. The Casino is smaller than most, which I think is great. You can always find a chair at one of your favorite slot games.  I have stayed in both the newly renovated tower and the older tower. Both rooms were clean, and spacious. I like that there are not lines for the elevators. The staff is friendly, Brystine (I believe was his name) the concierge was awesome, helped me out a lot by finding me different places and deals to celebrate my new years eve. My only complaint was when I stayed here in Sept last year, my room overlooked the Paris tower and the fountains.. I heard the night club outside quite a bit and you could hear the fountains. The second night I toned out the fountains.. but the night club was tough (only happened on Saturday night), I needed more drinks that night to fall asleep. I know it is not an expensive place to stay, for the price it is great! I did always have hot water for a shower, so that was a plus. 

I have stayed at Bally's, MGM, Mirage, Luxor, Quad, Monte Carlo, Flamingo and Mandalay Bay. This is my second favorite place to say, but 1st for those on a budget.

The pool is nothing spectacular, but with your room key you also get access to the Paris pool.

I have been to vegas three times prior to this visit. All three times I went for work and stayed at Mandalay Bay, Hilton and Paris and I had never had anything stolen. For the first time I went to vegas for a vacation and stayed at Ballys I had my charger stolen. I arrived at Bally on 5 Feb and departed on 9 Feb, 2015. On Saturday 7 Feb, my family and I left at 6.30am to take tour of Grand Canyon. As I was in a hurry I left my ipad charger behind the couch where I was charging the night before. I had brought two chargers with me the small charger for the iPhone and large charger for the Ipad. The large charger charges faster and I had just bought my ipad so the charger was pretty brand new. When I returned from my tour at Grand Canyon, I did not notice that my large charger was gone. I just used whatever charger that I could quickly grab. However on Sunday evening as I was packing my sister was trying to help me pack and picked up all the chargers in the room. I then realized I had two small chargers instead of one large and one small. I first searched all our rooms then our luggages and I asked my sister if her husband had brought another small charger and she said not this one. So I told her I didn't bring two small ones, I only brought one small and one large. That is not mine either. Also to note, all our small chargers have a green mark on it. The charger that was in my room had no mark on it and was dirty. I realized the cleaner who cleaned my room on Saturday had subtly swapped her small charger with my large charger. I informed house keeping straight away advising them of what happened. The scary part was they did not sound shocked nor surprised. They advised that they will follow this up and find out. The next day since I did not hear anything back from them, I called only to find out the person that worked on my room on Saturday is off. As a result, they could not reach her. The manager at the front desk asked me how much was my charger and he was going to compensate me, I told him I don't care about the money, I just want my charger back. I do not understand how Ballys staff all acted as if it was something that happens on a regular basis. the fact that there is a thief in their staff should be a cause for concern. I did report the case to Ballys security on site. They were very helpful and were going to look into it. I also spoke to another supervisor at Housekeeping and she advised that the person will lose their job and their insurance. As a result, I did not want to be responsible for someone to lose their job over a charger. However, I am writing this to let people know BEWARE. I Stayed on the 6th floor. the hotel is cheaper than others but only slightly. if you can afford $10 or more stay at Planet Hollywood or other better hotels like Paris, Treasure Island etc. Like I said I have been to Vegas three times prior to this and have never had any of my belongings stolen. I once even left my phone in the room at Mandalay Bay and it was still there when I came back. Hope this helps.

Not the worst hotel if stayed at not the best either. Room was rather old fashion the bed was hard. I did like that u can hook things up to the TV (i.e. Apple TV) s

The gambling and shopping is very plentiful so are the restaurants.

Location, location, location! Ballys isn't the trendiest hotel, but how interesting would the strip be if everything was a Wynn? I stayed in the "new" tower, which was nice, but I've heard the older ones have the better view. The best part about Ballys is the location. It's right across from Cesars and the Bellagio, connected to Paris and is a monorail stop. Ballys doesn't have a gimmik and doesn't have any notable restaurants or clubs and frankly, the pool is pretty blah. However, something about it is endearing and I would recommend staying there. Perfect if you don't want to take a cab everywhere.

I love Ballys! Very middle of the road hotel, with a perfect location and everything you could ask for. I tried the $20 trick here, was upgraded from Murphy Parlor to a King Jacuzzi Suite. Make sure to tip well here, you'll have a fabulous time.

My 11 year old daughter was stuck just last night in their elevator with her aunt for 2.5 hours.. 
Yes! 2.5 hours !! 
There is no reason why this should happen in any place. I understand that accidents happen but if an elevator goes down. You make sure people get out fast. It is not ok! The fire department should've been there right away! My daughter has asthma and after 2.5 whole hours! They were all losing air... She had to be harnessed and brought out! 
Management needs to step it and make sure the elevators are up to date and safe! It's the law! 
There is NO EXCUSE.. 2.5 hours is beyond any time limit of safe or ok.. She also had to watch a man pee in a cup during this time frame.. She's 11!! I don't blame him for having to using the restroom after that much time! They were without water and use of a restroom but she's 11!!! 
I can't even imagine how they all felt! I js know my kid will remember this for a very long time! 
Don't stay here just because it's cheap! It's not worth it. You might waste time being stuck in a small space with no air, water or food!

Would only want to stay here again if we are able to book a room in the newly renovated section (Jubilee Tower.) Apparently, we stayed here years ago, but I don't recall feeling particularly one way or the other. That indifference remains after our last stay, hence the 3 stars. 

The casual eateries are pretty shitty (Sidewalk Cafe, I'm talkin' to you), but the fancier joints (BLT Steak & Sea: the Thai Experience), which we didn't try, looked promising. 

Love, love, love the location -- connects with Paris & is spitting distance to the relatively newer attractions on the strip (the cromwell, the linq\/the quad, the cosmo.) 

Amenity I enjoyed most: being able to use Paris' & Planet Hollywood's pools, which are far superior to Bally's.

I recently stayed at Bally's for a conference. Bally's is one of the old properties on the strip that still allows people to smoke. So, even if you're staying in a non-smoking room you'll still be effected by the smoke. My allergies were out of control during my four night stay even when I was taking Benadryl and Claritin. When we first arrived, we got impatient waiting in the ridiculously long line at check-in, because we only moved two feet in twenty minutes so we finally used the kiosks to check-in. Apparently, that is the worst thing you can do. The kiosk just assigns you the first clean room and only takes your smoking vs. non-smoking preference into account, so we got a room with only a king bed instead of the two queen beds that we had reserved online. Of course, we were not made aware of this until we got to the room.
