So, we called customer service and after quite a bit of run around we were told we had to go back down to check-in to get another room. Luckily the line was shorter, so we didn't have to wait as long but it was still a major inconvenience. Although we were told on the phone that there were not two queen beds available. The guy at the check-in desk got us into one, so from that point on it became clear that whenever we didn't get the answer we liked from staff at this hotel we'd just ask someone else because we were pretty much guaranteed to get a different answer. The room we ended up getting wasn't a suite but it did have a lounge\/seating area and a random room that probably had a conference table in it at one point, but was empty when we were there so we ended up using it as a dance room. 

The conference facilities we used were in the Indigo Tower, however our room was in the Jubilee Tower. It's a good 5 to 10 minute walk to get between the towers, so we definitely got our steps in while here. The Jubilee Tower was renovated a couple years ago so it's a bit nicer than the Indigo Tower, however the rooms in the Indigo Tower are a bit bigger. Bally's also easily connects to Paris, so if you have a conference here you might want to stay there instead. Another thing to note - we could never seem to get the wifi to work even though we had paid the resort fee that included wifi.

Standard LV-Hotel. Ziemlich in die Jahre gekommen, aber das Zimmer war sauber. Der Casino-Bereich ist gut. Was weniger gut ist, ist der Food Court des Bally's im UG - überteuert und schlecht.

Was mich besonders ärgert ist, dass ich bis heute unsere Deposit-Zahlung hinterher laufen muss. Solche Geschichten trüben den Gesamteindruck nachhaltig...

pros:
- comfortable rooms, large, plenty of space for 4 people, clean, comfortable beds, friendly staff
- tequila bar & grill: seriously a random gem! $1 margaritas! decently sized considering its only a dollar, and strong with tequila! $1 tacos! $14 nachos that fit into 3 to go boxes!! great way to preparty and eat before going out on the town
- convieniently located in the center of the strip so its easy to access many of the other hotels with a short walk. gota work off the calories from all the buffet brunch you ate that morning
- pool was decent. not as amazing as the other hotels on the strip, but please consider that there is NO RESORT FEE!!

cons:
- no resort fee is great, but charging me $22 per person per day to use the spa\/gym?! are you out of your mind? my friends and i just had our own gym workout running up the hotel stairs
- we stayed there two nights, and for some reason our room never got cleaned by the staff. had to call housekeeping to change our sheets after we spilled some coffee on it and when the sweet chinese housekeeper saw that our room wasnt cleaned, she tidied up our bathroom in no time and gave us extra towels.

would DEFINITELY stay here again!!!

Staying here with 5 other people. 3 rooms, 15 room nights etc....lost the coupon book they give you at check-in. Gal at front desk,  Sosoo told me they cost a lot of money and she would not replace it. Go figure. Guess where we will not spend one dollar other than room and tax, Ballys.  I bet that will cost them a grand in lost revenue for the week. Blackjack or poker, not one penny will be dropped by our party. They'll never see this post, but it feels good to tell others about lousy customer service.

Just got back from a great stay at Bally's.  We originally had reservations at the Flamingo in what  we thought was an updated room.  Upon check in we were told it was not renovated at they would charge us $100 more to upgrade. Long story short, I called the Total Rewards hotline and got an immediate new reservation at Bally's.  We hauled our stuff over and walked right up to check in.  The gentleman at check in was very friendly.  He gave us a great room in the Jubilee tower facing toward Ceasars and Flamingo.  The room was very nicely remodeled.  We were pleasantly surprised and quite happy after the Flamingo issue.  The bed is so soft and comfortable!  Everyone we spoke with from the maids to the lady's at Nosh to the lady's at the redemption center were very friendly.  As someone else mentioned, the pool is very warm but that is to be expected in 115 degree weather.  Don't look for it to be refreshing.  Also the drinks were outrageously expensive at the pool.  We were shocked when our bill showed one normal size frozen margarita for $17.  Almost $70 for two drinks each.  Needless to say we did not go back to the pool to be ripped off on drinks and not feel refreshed.  All other prices were what you would expect for Las Vegas.  Overall a great stay.  No Bally's is not the fanciest place on the strip but it is a great centrally located place to stay if you are not all about glitz and glamour.

Last time we went there there was blood on the light switch...Obvoiusly tons of people have been in these rooms.  Another time we had to switch rooms because of the plumbing.  Just somewhere I didn't really want to stay at.

Great location. In the middle of strip with everything close by. 

Had a room in the north tower and it was nice and clean. Nothing fancy, but it was comfortable and I get what I paid for. I am very pleased. Would definitely book here again.

To be honest, i was expecting much less than i got!  I've stayed at 10 other hotels on the strip and i'd have to say that this one was the best deal overall.  The location just can't be beat for the price.  The hotel has a monorail station which we used often and being so close to the other hotels was really convenient.  The hotel itself was much nicer than i was expecting.  The rooms were very nice and clean and the beds were quite comfortable.  I was really surprised!  Much nicer than i thought.  Best hidden bargain on the strip.

It's true that the newly-renovated Jubilee Tower is very nice. And if that's the direction the rest of the hotel is headed, then this'll be a mighty fine hotel. 

But I'm not sure one tower of nice rooms is enough to outweigh all the bad:

-This was absolutely the longest check-in process of any hotel I've ever stayed in... EVER. We're talking over an hour waiting in line just to check in.

-The casino is majorly outdated and generally just looks very sad.

-The restaurants are pretty terrible as well. 

-The people all seemed nonchalant and uncaring. 

With all those negatives, my room was indeed shiny and new. I even had a beautiful view of Paris! And it all came at a really good price... so there's that.

This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had in Vegas from start to finish. I never write reviews but I have to! We try to check in express and of course that does not work. Keep in mind we're on a time limit because we have to make it to a concert.. So we have to wait in the longest line ever. At check in the lady did not explain anything to us she told us the room number and that was it. We had to figure out what floor. On our way to the room a lady stops us and asks if we've received our free vouchers that we were supposed to get at check in we hesitated because of our time limit but said no so she redirects us to a man that's sitting at a computer. As we walk up he starts in on how often do we come to Vegas and if we're interested in shows and gives us this whole spill my husband stopped home and said hey man can we come back were on a real short time limit. This jerk replied what are you unsure about? So my husband replied is it a problem that we come back after the concert? The guy gave me the dirtiest look and started ripping up the papers that he was writing down all our info on and then stared us down as we walked away.. Really??? Then the room seemed out dated, the spa for our suit dispersed musky water it was disgusting! Then at checkout we take our parking voucher to the front to have them validate it (since we paid an extra 40 fee for 'Resort fee' we assumed we got free parking) nope she stated that is only for Platinum members and we have to pay.. So on our way out we paid the stupid parking fee.. As we're leaving the parking lot the little gate lifts up and let's us drive thru, I didn't even hand them my ticket! So I really didn't have to pay that fee.. The when experience was horrible and I will never return!! The One star is giving this place too much credit

I been coming to Vegas for years. And been treated so good at other Caesars properties so well, but Bally's I don't know what's going on. I was down in the casino area and the supervisor that was working, was just horrible. Didn't have no personally, and it looked like he don't want to be there. I was there around 10pm and because of him I'm going to MGM. If you guys are 7 start or diamond we don't deserve to be treated that way. I can't remember he's name but he was a older guy of color.

I booked a room here for my birthday on 2\/10-2\/12. I booked the vacation through Groupon, for a jubilee room, and was excited to see what it was like since I saw a lot of good reviews and it's in such a good spot on the strip. We got into town kind of late because we were driving from San Jacinto, ca after we got off work. So we get there, I go to check in, and they say that they don't have my name in their system. She looked through all of the reservations and didn't see my name anywhere. So she looks to see the Groupon confirmation that I had and can see that I paid for the room and tells me to call Groupon, which of course did not have phone hours at that time so I had to online chat with a rep in India, which took forever. They never got back to me until the next morning. I don't know if it's groupons fault or Bally's fault, as I was told by Groupon that my information was in the computer incorrectly, but it was basically, sorry, too bad, you can book a room now for $170 a night (when we went to Vegas because we were supposed to get a room for $55 a night). But happy birthday to me, because Groupon contacted Bally's to see if they could do anything, and said the best they could do was give me my money back in 10 business days. Except not happy birthday to me. So thanks to Hotel Tonight, we got a room at the Hard Rock, AND they upgraded us to a suite at no cost, and were awesome. At least someone made an attempt to make my birthday a little special.

Bally's in pretty typical for a strip casino. They don't really have any big attractions, but they do have quite a few restaurants and shops. Unless your going here for a specific place to eat, there really isn't any reason to go here over anywhere else, except maybe their exceptional Sports Book.

Bally's has a large casino area with all of the usual table games and machines. Their odds aren't very good, but you can't really expect good odds on the strip. Local casinos usually are far better for gamblers.

They have three areas of shops and restaurants. One outside bordering Las Vegas Boulevard, one that connects to the back of their property and leads to the Sports Books, and another that connects them to the Paris. It's more than your usual casino provides for shops and places to eat.

They have a very large Sports Book that isn't connected to the main casino. It's really cool and has stadium style seating and would be a great place to watch a game. Of all the strip casinos, this is one of the best setups.

Bally's is a perfectly normal strip casino. There are better ones and worse ones, and if your a tourist this place should be fine, but for locals there isn't much to do here over a locals place.

I just went here a couple weeks ago and the bed in my room was AMAZING! so soft, so perfect...the only time in my life and in all my visits to Las Vegas that I didn't want to party, but rather stay in the room and just sleep the days away. Great view, fun games and the gambling staff was so polite. I love that it was connected to Paris, the only bummer was that we went the long way from the parking structure exit, otherwise, the parking was well placed as well. I think I am going to make this place my place moving forward.....really great prices too. Check for them on Groupon from time to time.

We got some super good deal online for 3 nights!  The location is great, because it's right in the middle of the strip!  So super close to all the clubs and you don't have to pay as much for taxi!  I paid about $8\/day, sharing the room with 4 other girls!  Pretty decent rooms!  A lot of mirrors!! which comes in really handy for girls when you're getting ready for the night!  We were in the north tower, which is the more newly remodeled side, but farther away from the strip...Also, indoor access to Paris.

Downsides Bally's does not have a decent food court!  It is like a pizza place and then a hotdog place... and then there is NO free wifi, which sucks!

Long lines to check in.  I had to request to speak to a manager.  I got am upgrade for free.  Hotel employees were catering to Platinum and Seven Stars Guests first.  I spend money like everyone else.  So they upgraded me from a basic room to the new Art Decco room with a view of the strip.  It's very nice.  Comfortable beds with a walk in shower.  You can hear the music coming from Drai's nightclub at the Cromwell.  The waiting time for the elevators is too long.  This hotel hosts many conventions.  Be prepared to wait everywhere.
Horrible customer service! Four people working the lobby to check in, line out the door. The kiosk to check in WORTHLESS. Never again!

Like others have said I would give it 31\/2 stars if I could but.....W were comped rooms and I was surprised how nice the room was.  It was very clean.  The style of the furniture was a poor choice.  The baby blue couch looked faded but it was not.  The blond wood furniture looks dated but it is new.  It was just poor choices.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The casino was very smokey and had a dated tired look to it.  The easy access to Paris was great.  The general location is good.  We got a big rain storm when we were there so we never at the pool.  I think overall this was a good experience.

Let's be frank. This old lug is run down. But wait, just like the sham wow guy, there's more! This place is the most decently priced hotel on the strip. It's also in the very middle smack dab of the strip and by the monorail stop. You will probably walk every where you go. You will also never regret staying here as it is the pivotal point of true strip. Free parking with the Paris chain and access to the pool, spa (more on that later) and near the bazaar of goods.

This is a pretty great location.  Located right in the middle of the Strip, next to Paris and near the In&Out.  The pool is pretty nice with a really large shallow end.  There is a nice food court down stairs with lots of choices.

But there is a monorail station right out the front door and lots of shuttles to other casinos.

rates were decent.  jubilee show was the best, but gone now.  pet area was dirty and not cleaned daily.  room wasn't very clean as per usual nowadays.  staff is friendly.  no room service after 1pm, really?  best restaurant is le cafe in paris. eat at battista's!

Okay, I looked Bally's up on Yelp because I was curious about what kind of reviews people were giving it. I was surprised to see so many low ratings! I think Bally's is great! Yes, it is an old hotel... there are stains on the carpet, the casino is small, it needs new paint, etc, etc. But for the price you're paying, Bally's is an excellent deal. The rooms are spacious, the hotel is right across the street from Caesar's, and right by Paris which in turn is right by my most favorite LV hotel, Bellagio. 

I must admit that the check-in lines are a b*tch sometimes because they take so long. However, the staff is always pleasant and accomodating. The last time I stayed at Bally's, I was given a free upgrade to a very large suite and this was during a holiday weekend. Bally's staff was more than happy to provide an extra bed and extra fridge at no extra cost. We prepartied in our suite with no complaints and headed off to Tao... and then to Lavo.. and then gambled. Yes, we are party animals... plus, who sleeps in Vegas?

If you're looking for clean carpets, shiny floors, younger crowds, and nice casinos, stay at Wynn, Venetian, Caesars, or Bellagio. But if you just need a comfortable, spacious room at a very affordable price and in a great location, then Bally's is your hotel.

now that Imperial Palace is the more expensive Quad (with the same slow ass elevators), Bally's was the next least expensive place on the strip for our weekend excursion. 

i was impressed! the staff at check in were super prompt and friendly to the wife. the elevators are fast. and our rooms were quiet....and very big! there was enough room for a small party in there. even a safe in the closet. the bathrooms are bright and roomy. only complaint was the shower...the water pressure was terrible and it was either freezing cold or scalding hot...never warm or pleasing. 

the towels are soft and absorbant and the beds are super comfy. the place is right on the strip and connected to Paris casino\/hotel so you can have your pick. there is a monorail stop in the back for easy access around the strip. a couple of fast food joints and fine dining options are an escalator ride below the casino. we saw posters for their Thai restaurant which looked delicious but did not try on this trip. 

Bally's is in a perfect spot on the strip. However....the moving walkways never moved. only good when you don't have to wear 6 inch heels. they didn't work the whole 4 days...maybe it's time to call a repair man.

great stay and look forward to another in the future!

Spent 4 days in Vegas last week and stayed at Bally's for the first time.  I have stayed at just about every casino on the strip throughout the last 15 years.  There are multiple casinos that are much better from a plush \/ fashionable perspective but Bally's will give you a good bang for the buck.

Pros:  
** Location, location, location - smack dab in the middle of everything
** Cheap good sized rooms
** Good gaming for those playing video poker (my wife hit 3 Royals in 4 days)
** Quick valet service

Negatives:
** There are areas of the North Tower that are dated and not in the best shape.  Our room (Grand Suite in the North Tower running along Flamingo Rd) has not seen an upgrade for years.  The other negative about these rooms is that the bathroom sink area is not far from the bed (no door separating the bathroom and bedroom areas).  If you are rooming with someone and plan to get up early while the other sleeps in, it is not going to happen in these rooms.  Just running the sink water will immediately wake up your mate.
** Restaurants are sparse and not at the upper end of the dining spectrum.  We went to Fin in the Mirage and Carnevinos in the Plazzo instead of dining at Ballys
** Casino itself is dated.  The carpeting is in much need of updating.
** Hotel hallway carpeting is disgusting - dirty, stained, just gross
** Workers are not personable.  I always found the maids, waiters and dealers very friendly at Caesars or Mirage.  Here, the staff seems to be very cold - never got a "good morning" from the maids as I left my room in the morning unless I initiated the greeting.

Bottom line - you get what you paid for.  If you enjoy a plush \/ fashionable casino and hotel, go to Caesars or Bellagio.  Want a cheap hotel without all of the frills at a great location, go to Bally's or Flamingo.

Loved the hotel room but the service sucks!! The lady who helped us check in was very rude! It was our first time trying this place out and will never stay there again just because of the service. Try SLS or Planet Hollywood. We've had pleasant stays there. The staff is very friendly :))
Ballys - dreary, depressing and dilapidated.  $30 resort fee is a nonsense.  Pays for Wifi and the worst pool in Nevada.  Clientele is a low rent  version of the bar scene from Star Wars. Stay away.

Cheap, old rooms, good location. They charge the resort fee (internet for 1 device, pool, gym) $29 per room even if you don't use it.

The poker room had some really nice dealers and pit bosses and the game seemed pretty friendly even at 2am. The rest of the casino seemed pretty sad and didn't seem nice until we wandered into Paris, which is connected to it.

Over priced for what you get.  I do expect some noise it is Vegas but our room was on the Paris side which is over a service alley which had constant beeping of fork lifts and delivery trucks all throughout the night.  The pool was underwhelming and is a really far walk from the newer tower.  Also on the side that faces Paris you get a lot of the club noise from the Eiffel Tower.  Most disappointing was that during our stay it rained 2 of the 3 days which isn't the hotels fault but having the pool closed when the sun finally did come out is.  I didn't want to use the pool but would have enjoyed sitting outside.....they wouldn't allow it.  I would stay elsewhere in Vegas with so many options.

Overall this is a great casino to stay in while in Vegas due to the fact it is on the strip and also in the middle of the stip.

This place always give me great deals (most times comp rooms). They are upgrading their rooms which is nice. 

This time, we got to stay on the Diamond floor...I guess it's just higher floors because the rooms does look the same as the regular rooms. They did offer us a mini fridge which was really nice to have in the room for our drinks.

I have yet to try their suite....hopefully one day soon :)

Bally's is good if you need to go to the convention center because it is right on the monorail.  It's $5 to the convention center and quick.

The hotel staff are not that helpful.  We got a $71 room rate and overall the quality reflected that.

The casino has quite a bit of smoke and their are not good restaurants to choose from.

If there on business and you want to save money this is a good bet.  But if you can afford more and you want higher quality there are many other options.

Stay dates - 10\/25\/2017 - 10\/29\/2017

Things have changed in the 10 years since I've been to Vegas...and not necessarily for the better.

We chose Bally's because of price & its proximity being pretty much in the center of the strip.

I was totally galled by the fact that they wanted an extra $30.00 to check in before their designated check-in time of 3:00pm, to a room which was already made up. Really?? Screw corporate America and their money-grabbing ways. The room was already to go, for god's sake! And I have to pay a premium for that?? Whether I had a choice to take it or leave it is not the point. It's just sheer CORPORATE GREED! It's like your cleaners telling you your clothes will be ready at 5:00 and you get there at 4:30. Your cleaning happens to be ready, but they will charge you an extra $10.00 for getting it early. 

Our room, in general was OK. We got a hot-tub room. Tub jets didn't work. What was even more amusing (sarcasm!) was that a sign on the tub said to press the black button to turn it on. Guess what? There was NO black button to press in the entire room. Just as well, because I bet the air jets have never been cleaned since its installation. (Just a hunch, mind you.) 

Since there was the large bath\/hot tub, there was a shower stall. A VERY TINY shower stall...and I mean TINY. They had a $1.00 shower head you might buy at the dollar store. ZERO water pressure. Took forever to rinse off soap & shampoo. The soap dish sloped downward, so soap would not stay on it. Yeah, I know these are dumb things to pick on. But geeze, a job worth doing...

Overall, the room was clean enough. However, all the "sculpturing" (? Sorry I don't know the different types of carpeting.) on the carpet was worn down smooth...except, of course, under the furniture. 

I did like that Hertz had on-site car rentals and returns. 

So, should I venture to Sin City ever again, Bally's will not be on my places-to-stay list. It's one of the older hotels, (It was originally the MGM, at which I stayed before the fire.) which I believe is getting beyond the point of meaningful updating.
Thought I lost my night clothes....found them somewhere else. Security was very responsive. Not wild about the manager.

Lots to do. Heart of Las Vegas. Need stronger smoke filters, walking in was rough.  Rooms are clean but in desperate need of updating.  Our suite was very dated, wallpaper peeling, hardware very discolored, plaster peeling, very dated furniture.  On the 21st floor there was no noise or smoke smell which was fantastic.  Views were stunning. Front desk was very helpful.

Ballys needs an upgrade for sure.
Still- given the location and the price (compared to surrounding hotels) its a bargain.
If you stay here don't look for frills, you wont get them as it is not a resort like many of the Strip hotels. ( although they do have a spa, pool etc, its just not going to suite the tastes of someone looking for a resort experience)

Bally's was the first hotel I stayed at in Vegas and it holds a special place in my heart. It's not the newest or the fanciest, but the rooms are big and clean and the location can't be beat. 

We stayed in the 23rd floor and I loved it. The room is big, ours had a king bed, couch, chair, and desk. The bathroom is also good sized. The towels were huge, which I love. None of that, doesn't-go-all-the-way-around me business. 

The location is great. In the heart of the strip, right across from the Bellagio and connected to Paris. I loved being connected to Paris. Walking through the "streets of Paris" was fun, and was great for easy access to food. Make sure you check out Hexx Chocolates! 

My only complaint would be the $39\/night "resort fee" we didn't know about ahead of time. We prepaid, and then got hit with the resort fee when we got here. (That happened when we stayed at the Bellagio too.)

Overall, I would definitely stay at Bally's again! It's a great value and a great experience.

We really enjoyed our stay at Bally's last weekend.  Their posted check in time is at 4pm.  We arrived at 11am.  I proceeded to check in and expected them to want to charge us for early check in but they didn't!  Check in was smooth and fast.  The room was HUGE.  And smelled nice.  The decor and furniture was a little outdated (hence the 4 stars instead of 5) but no biggie. We changed quick into swim gear and wanted to do a pool sesh.  After looking at the pictures of the Bally's pool area (looks a little out dated in pics) and realizing that Bally's and the neighboring hotel Paris are the same company, I called the front desk and asked if we could use the pool at Paris. They said yes no problem.  Paris and Bally's are connected so walking over to Paris was easy.  The pool area in Paris is awesome.  Checking out the next day was easy too.  I will def stay at Bally's again.

3 1\/2 stars - 4 stars.

Ended up booking a Vegas trip on a busy weekend (some basketball tournament), so everything that weekend from flight to hotels were extra pricey than usual. After going back and forth from Cosmo, PH, Aria, and all the other nice ones hoping that if we refreshed the site it would go down but sadly that did not happen haha so settled for Bally's. We picked Bally's since it was right on the strip.

First reaction to the outside seemed a bit outdated and a bit sad. Casino is quite spacious, but i'm not much of a gambler so can't say much in that department. A few cafes and restaurants inside. Located right on the strip next to Paris and PH hotel. My gf's and I walked to PH for Earl's Sandwiches and for their popular Miracle Mile Shops. 

Inside our room was a pleasant surprised. Bathroom was spacious and great mirror for us ladies to do our makeup :) or some would say put our face on haha. Room was pretty spacious, closet with mirrors. It was myself and 3 gf's and closet was still pretty spacious.  2 full\/queen beds. The bed was to my surprise real comfy! The pillows were like the pricey hotel pillows. Goose feather like that just sinks down. But not too low where you feel like the pillow is smothering you. The bed matteress itself was comfy and bouncy. And the blankets were soft and not like cheap hotel blankets. I think my favorite was the bed! especially after long nights or partying and drinking the bed is pretty important. Unless your pissed drunk then even the floor may seem like cloud 9 haha. Although I did miss the other nice hotels, but if your on a budget and would rather spend money on dining and shopping like us than check out Bally's! After all your barely in the room ;)

The main good point of this hotel is central location.  Other than that is is kind of lo luster.  I see this as overflow rooms for Paris or some of the other hotels.  The casino is good but nothing to write home about.  The cocktail service was good there.  I would rather go gambling at Paris or cross the lake across the street.  

There are no resort fees charged.  A resort fee being charged here would be like a resort fee at an Econo Lodge.  It costs 22 dollars a day to get into the spa.  Who would pay 22 just to work out?  Hours 6 to 6.  Oh and its $15 a day for the internet.  

My main complaint about this place is there is no information about the hotel in the rooms at all.  No information that you usually get in those hotel binders.  I was very displeased by this.  

The website says the pool is closed for the winter, but it does not say that you can use the one at Paris.  

I would stay here again, but only for the right price.

Spacious rooms at a bargain rate + cocktail waitresses that are faster than Olympic class sprinters + the guy throwing the dice at the craps table who helped me win $2100.00 in 45 minutes x 20 smiling laughing partying revelers around the craps table = 5 Fucking stars for Ballys. Thanks for bankrolling my next trip.

I've have stayed in Las Vegas many time but most recently at this casino and let tell you it's was nicest casino I've ever stayed at their new tower is really nice and clean the shower was really nice as well would definitely stay here again without hesitation unlike other casino in Las Vegas.

The review is for the craps table. We went to this hotel for the pool, we booked a cabana via groupon; while leaving the fun pool we stopped at a caps table and one of the side dealers were switched out. I said "yay they must have brought In the guy who's the got luck." This douchebags name was Pedro. So his response to me while I'm standing behind my husband was....are you ready for this....."take your top off!" Seriously!  my fast response was a very stern NO! It took a minute to register to my husband what this dude said. So loosing $200 we left and Pedro got a nice talking to by my husband and I'm sure his pit boss. I hope that jerk learned his lesson that you don't speak to women like that and lost his job.

3.5 stars. Older and not so hip Vegas Strip casino but super location centrally located across the street from Bellagio and Caesars and literally next to Paris and Planet Hollywood casinos. Could not have asked for a more convenient spot. 

Stayed here since we weren't planning to spend much time at the room or pool and we wanted a place that was centrally located and resaonably priced so we could spend more money on the tables. 

North Tower rooms are apparently newer and refurnished. We got put into the older South Tower. The room was very spacious but the decor and furnture looked definitely dated. However, we got a room on a high floor and had a fantastic  view of the Paris Eiffel Tower, the Bellagio water fountain, and the South part of the Vegas strip. 

Bottom line: Not the hippest casino around, but solid hotel experience, in a great location, and reasonably priced so we had more $$ for food, gambling, and other sin city fun.

Had a chance to stay here this pass weekend I must say it was your average hotel room. The beds were nice but the pillows were not to my liking the second night I used an extra blanket as a pillow. The decor was nice. I found the people trying to get you to do a time share seminar were a bit annoying. Bell service excellent also valet. I had lost my ticket they handle the situation with ease. The sandwich at Nosh were good.

My dad has diamond status here and I was able to get a comp room for my birthday.  Um, did someone say free?  Yes please, and thank you!  

Things I can't complain about since the room was free.  

1. $33 a day "resort fee" that includes "free wifi" for two devices

2.  No fridge

3.  No microwave

4.  Junk water pressure

However,  my room was very clean and I had an awesome view of the high roller carousel.   Parking was FREE but a small stroll through Paris Hotel to get there.  The view was pretty sweet.   

Rooms are pretty quiet unless someone in the hallway.   Someone stole our privacy hanger overnight so maid almost made it inside the room while I was sleeping.  

Hit rates on the slots downstairs were pretty low.   I lost money,  but I had fun.

I signed a slip at check-in for one price, noticed a different amount on my bank statement, & then was told there was another $55 charge as I was checking out. When I asked for an explanation, I was told that the original employee "did her math wrong." (Why that was my problem, I'm not entirely sure...) The room itself was okay, but had no refrigerator & smelled like a musky basement. On our last day, housekeeping never came and we went the entire day without toilet paper. TOILET PAPER!!! They did refund me resort fees for that day so I will give them that. Anyway, you are harassed daily by people trying to sell time shares & on the way out they do everything but kick you in the ass to get you out. The guy who put my bags into the cab told the driver "good luck" while sending us off. I slept in the room, but spent my days anywhere but in this hotel. Never again!

Not extraordinary. It has a bad vibe  to it. I  experienced better. 
Bad service, one employee was litterally screaming at us cuz of a misunderstanding! WHY NOT COME AT ME AND GIMME A SMACK WHILE UR AT IT, HUH? But we complained to the manager and gave us free admission to the Paris buffet and a free extra night! *Swerve*

PET OWNERS DON'T STAY HERE!!
We stayed at Ballys from 3-27-16 to 3-30-16. We travelled with our two dogs, so their pet friendly rooms are twice as much and are located on the 7th floor. Now that's not why I gave them only one star, it's because they really don't care about their customers who are traveling with their pets. After I went in to check in, the lady at the counter said that she can't check us in until they saw our dogs. So out to the car I went, only to bring our two dogs back in line....(after I already stood in line for about 30 minutes). We got checked in and I then took our dogs out to their so called "pet area". Well what a disgusting area this turned out to be. Full of dog shit and cigarette butts!!! Heck our dogs didn't even want to use this place. I had to tip toe around the piles of shit and after our dogs finally did their duties I took them back to our room. I then went to the front desk to complain about how disgusting their "pet area" was. I told them that this was indeed the work of some very "lazy" pet owners who don't pick up after their pets, but since this is their property and they charge twice as much for their "pet friendly" rooms that they still need to keep this area clean for the responsible pet owners. Well this went into deaf ears since the same piles of shit that I had to tip toe around on Sunday were still there on Wednesday morning when we checked out. I complained again at check out and they did refund some money, but that wasn't the point. So if you are a pet owner and your planning on going to Vegas with them I would steer clear of this place!!!!!

Older but clean casino area. I left a rather considerable tip and asked for extra towels and shampoo. Neither was left and the money was gone. Had to call down to house keeping for those items. Fitness room were less than adequate and the girl at the counter gave me grief bcz my name was not on the room but when I called ahead if the wife and I share the same last name he said it shouldn't be a problem. If I had a choice again, it wouldn't be my first to stay here.

Between RUDE WAITRESSES AND FINDING EMPTY SHELL CASINGS IN OUR ROOM....this hotel was HORRIBLE! We were there for about an hour before we ran into our first issue. The waitress that had been serving my boyfriend checked my ID & took my drink order. When the drinks arrived they were in TALLER glasses and it was a different waitress so we weren't sure if they were ours. My boyfriend was in the middle of a hand (like literally the dealer was asking him if he wanted to hit or stay) and the new waitress rudely interrupted, put her face in his face and said, "IS THIS YOUR DRINK SIR?" but in a nasty way. He said, "hold on" and she wasn't having any of that and rudely replied, "you're welcome" and slammed the glass down. EVERYONE and i mean EVERYONE  at the table was like "wtf is her problem".... she proceeds to then announce to everyone including the pit boss that he's had "one too many" even though she hasn't served him a single drink that night or interacted with him. It was his 3rd drink and he's 6'1" 260 lbs so not like he gets drunk easily. 

So after that snafu, (i had only been down stairs for 15 minutes at this point) I wanted to leave and go get something to eat. So as we're walking to the restaurant the same waitress chases me down to demand to see my I.D. I'm 23 mind you and have already had my ID checked by the waitress that took my order. This waitress takes my drink and puts it on a tray with dirty glasses (health code violation btw) and stares at my I.D. FOREVER! So my bf, already pissed about her earlier treatment calls her a grandma and says she's taking forever to read my i.d. She then WALKS OFF WITH MY DRINK, on that dirty tray, and says she's calling security to kick us out because he called her a granny....i mean really. As I mentioned earlier everyone at our table saw how rude she was and a complete stranger from the same table saw what was happening and VOLUNTEERED to speak to security and offer his testimony in our defense. So we speak to security who honestly looked annoyed that she called them over this. Then her manager Kate proceeds to say how "she doesn't deserve to be subjected to being called names i.e. grandma". But I like to say every action causes a reaction and her actions caused that reaction. As a server in Orlando I too deal with all different types of people and the Beverage Manager Kate didn't even want to hear the whole story she just came in there to defend her EXTREMELY RUDE WAITRESS, by saying she's been doing that for 16 years and she just went on break and that was her station (like we were supposed to know that was her station. Maybe if she had said "i'm taking over for so and so, or so and so was helping me out while i was on break" BUT SHE DIDN'T. We're supposed to be psychic I guess. )

The restaurant: Tequila y Taquerios (or whatever it was called) said they were open till 3. We went at 1:30 and the manager flat out refused to serve us food unless we wanted to take it to our room. The server\/bartenders were clearly pissed about it because it was money out of their pocket. apparently they are open till 3 to take your money but not seat you, because they bring their cleaning crew in at 1:30 so you can't eat there. Where i come from (orlando, universal city walk to be exact) as long as your taking food orders you're seating guests. WE close at 12 but will seat up to 12:15.

The room: We found and empty spence shell casing in a chair in our room. NEED I SAY MORE?! That means that bullet was shot at something...that's how Aaron Hernandez was caught, he left a shell casing in his rental car. JUST SAYING.  We called security but in Vegas their known to cover things up to keep the crime rate down so I doubt security turned it into the police. 

My boyfriend was a rated player in vegas for years and has been over 50 times and said this is THE WORST experience he's ever had in vegas. And as a server, I have to say shame on the Beverage Manager Kate, she had no idea what happened and came in attacking us right away. They have camera's all over that place right? Play the tape and its clear as day the server was in the wrong. Customer service in Vegas, well at Bally's anyway, is non-existent. They don't want to treat you like a valued guest, its more like "give us your money and gtf out" 

And really: $14.99 for crappy wi-fi....go to another hotel ppl. please.

North tower had good size rooms.  Pretty good value, was like 150 a guy for 3 nights, 2 in a rooms.  Casino was pretty small.  Good location to hit all the majors within short walking distance.  Didn't eat one bite here....the Paris breakfast buffet was awsome.  30 bucks w\/ bottomless champage.  Bottom line:  decent value, big rooms, great location.  But I would rather pay a few extra $ and stay at Planet Hollywood.
Stayed here for the first time a few days ago. Not bad of a price, location and hotel.
Rooms smelled like cigarettes.  Not my kind of crowd.....but location on the strip is very good.

We stayed here July 9, 2013 for one night. The reservation was made through a popular Internet travel site. The clerk couldn't find the reservation even when using the confirmation. He finally found it and sent us up to our room, which initially looked nice. We found a DIRTY q-tip in the bathroom trash, hair in the tub, and tons of hand prints all over the windows. While those aren't totally disgusting, it made us concerned about how well the rest of the room and bathroom had been cleaned or sanitized. We couldn't connect to the Internet that we pay for with the resort fee regardless of the combination of possible log-in names.  We called for assistance about places to eat in the hotel and "coupon" we were presented at checkin. The "coupon" was only an advertisement according to the guy who was off-site and had no clue about anything we were asking about restaurants, even though we called the 'restaurant' line on the room phone.  

The next morning, I tried turning on the TV but the remote didn't work, after playing with batteries for a bit, it worked. I tried to check out & low and behold, two other people's names appeared as the registered guests in my room and I was able to view their folios. We didn't know either of the people who were listed on the room. We couldn't check out on the tv and get a copy of the bill and didn't have time to wait in the checkout lines to get a copy. To top it off, while trying to nap before checking out, housekeeping ignored the 'do not disturb sign' and tried to enter without knocking.  Luckily the door was secured- but it startled us enough to get us up to leave.

Seeing how poorly this place is run and monitored, I would not return and advise people who care about cleanliness, responsibility, and hospitality to avoid Bally's.  Severely disappointed and disgusted when we think of the whole experience.

So, the saying goes: 'don't knock it, til you've tried it.' 

Well I always poo-pooed ballys because it was 'cheap'. Which is odd because I've stayed at the Luxor a number of times for the same reason. A friend bragged about his room rate so when I extended my stay, I switched from the Aria to Ballys. 

Certainly it has undergone a series of renovations recently; adding in an open shopping promenade to funnel people down towards the main entrance, what looks like a new sports book and food court downstairs (Johnny Rockets puts out tasty shakes and onion rings) and possibly room upgrades. 

Checkin \/out was a breeze. The rooms are very affordable, pretty standard, comfortable beds, towels were softer than the ones I had at the aria a few days before. 

Lower stakes tables on the casino floor. I won a little on craps but decided to leave it at the casino for future development projects. 

The lounge had attentive and friendly servers\/bartenders - but surprised at how few bars (at any casinos) serve any food.

I stayed at bally's thinking it would be nice and convenient, I even upgraded to a suite to make the best of my vacation but let me tell you it's the first and last time I will ever waste my money there, first and foremost the sheets felt like sandpaper so horrible and we all know we look forward to sleeping in a hotel, anyways on with my rant the restaurants are all nasty and beyond pricy oh and not to mention the resort fee is 40 dollars for what?!? Free wii fi smh and I had to pay 36 dollars to valet my car which you would think would be in those pricy resort fees not to mention my car is brand spanking new and it looked as if someone backed my car into something it came off for the most part still a little scratch. I could go on but I will leave it at that I will never waste my 300 dollars for two nights there Again.

We stopped by here to go on our tour (Pawn Stars , fantastic!). 

Bally is very old-style and seems a little run down. I mean, maybe they're doing renovations but it's not as vibrant or lively inside the casino as it is in some. The outside could also do with a paint job.

To make an assumption, I guess it wouldn't be quite as expensive as most of the other hotels and when you're staying in Vegas you probably want to be right on the strip so why not? A room is a room!

Absolutely loved this hotel! Must give them 5 stars for their service, look & feel, amazing rooms, and phenomenal views in their rooms. My boyfriend and I made our first (and now yearly) Vegas trip in July to a video game tournament (EVO) and got there a Thursday night and left Sunday. Now, I've read a few reviews about the check-in lines and I can't say whether this is a regular occurrence since close to 10K people came to this event, but we easily waited 30+ minutes to check-in the day before the event. Can't fault them here since it was a huge event held at Bally's and they offered discounted rooms for those who attended the event.

First is the room itself. Originally booked a small room with no extra amenities and after reading about the tip trick, I managed up the courage to try it. Between my ID and my credit card I sandwiched a $20 bill and asked sweetly "Do you have any complimentary upgrades?" Well, the answer was "Yes, and do you want a suite or the new building?" I answered "a suite", hoping that was the best option. The woman behind the counter took my 20 (very slyly) and didn't mention the upgrade again to the point that I almost thought she forgot. Don't get discouraged if this happens to you, they definitely heard you, they must not be able to talk too much about it. When we arrived at the room, I was ecstatic to find a hot tub, two vanities, a shower, a living room complete with couch and desk, and a King sized bed! And of course a great view of the new ferris wheel, the Flamingo and Caesar's. Let's just say I would've loved to see what we would've gotten for a $100 tip!

Second, the service. As mentioned the woman behind the counter was incredibly nice and helpful and the event held at the Bally's ballrooms would not have been possible with the dozens of workers helping everyday.

Now to the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. After an entire day out and about the wonderful city of Vegas, we decided to stay in one night. i wanted to use the hot tub and run a bubble bath. Called the front desk, and no bubble bath. :( Oh well, I improvised with some shampoo, and it smelled wonderful too. Well, room service and a hot custom-made bubble bath, I thought! I call the front desk again to ask for room service. There is none. Only for breakfast between some early hours in the morning. Nothing?? No room service at this raved about hotel, big name in Vegas? I was shocked. Well, how about a pizza then? Front desk has no name for pizza places..."We've got tons of restaurants downstairs." (That just means Mexican and Thai unless you want to walk further) And also, room service is supposed to be avoiding going out but I left that part out. Ended up grabbing take out from one of the restaurants and still got to enjoy half my vision for the night. So that was for the 4 star review. Otherwise would totally stay again!

Also, if you go - try that $20 tip trick!

I loved this hotel at first but then the valet guys pretty much ruined that for me... I didn't want to valet park anymore but was forced to because no spots were open in the other lot. So on my birthday we had one of my 3 friends wait for the car as we went to Starbucks which took us about 20 mins because it was really busy.. We came back to the valet area and waited quite a while and finally realized we were waiting a really long time... I looked at a text I had gotten when we were at the coffee shop to see how long we had actually been waiting and it was the better side of 45 minutes. We asked 3 times if we could go get our own car because it was freezing outside and we were trying to make the best of our last day... Then these 2 valet guys come riding up in our car... First of all why were there 2??? No one else's car had 2 workers in their car- and we were the very last people to be helped even though we waited longer and were there before most of the others... Then I spoke to a "supervisor" named Michael who told me I was a liar and that we were only waiting 20 minutes not 40... Are you serious? And when the 2 idiots brought the car up there was a dent in the side that wasn't there before we used their valet. The guy who was in the driver side has a red beard and looked somewhat like a leprechaun and made a smug comment at me saying "well it is valet and we are busy..." He really said that to me when there were no other customers but us because they helped us last!!! What a bunch of assholes... Seriously don't valet! Just park your car and walk the mile back because it's much faster and better to do it yourself.

When I first found out that we would be staying at Bally's, I was pretty indifferent since nothing about Bally's really stood out and made it appealing for me to stay at. However, I was quite surprised by the wonderful experience I had.

Per Yelper's reviews, I requested we got a room in the Jubilee Tower, which supposedly is the new, renovated rooms. They were more than happy to give us a room there and we had a nice view of Paris Hotel and could even see the Bellagio fountain\/show from across. The room itself is very clean. Bathroom is nice. Bed were comfy! There's a sofa if you happen to have extra people in your group.

Edward (Eddie), one of the bellhop guys, is so entertaining and funny.

I hear a lot of complaints about parking at Bally's but we always valeted our car and didn't have a problem. It is an extra plus that it's right there on the middle of the strip and close to everything! I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat.

This place needs some work. We recently stayed here and usually I like Bally's except this time around. We came in Vegas and it was pouring rain. To vallet your car is $18 per day now and $10 each day to self park. If you are a platinum card holder or higher then your fee is waived and you don't have to pay. They were short on staff and bell men or were very slow as we had to wait outside our car for about 5 minutes. Someone finally came with a bell hop and the guy was very rude. He made me help him with the bags and didn't say anything and ripped the ticket and gave it to me. He then moved behind our car with our stuff and stacked other people's luggage onto our luggage...we had stuff in our bags that were fragile...

We wait in a short line where the front desk lady is taking forever laughing with a couple. Took about 10 minutes and it wasn't busy. 

We checkin to our room which was very hard to find and we almost got lost. Our safe was dented in and our view was the above parking lot and a short piece of the strip which sucked. The gambling was pretty bad besides one night I did okay and got lucky on one machine. 

My sister had her 21st bday here in the suite and the suite was okay. It didn't come with a large trash can so we had to bring our own bags for a party. The pool table was abused by previous people. The sticks were all broken besides 2 of them. The carpet had blue chalk stains on it. The red pool table felt was off and bumpy. 2 of the far corner pockets were literally taped on together so when I would shoot the balls into them they would fly up and out of the table! The balcony doors were locked so we couldn't even go outside. There were matches and ash trays everywhere but I don't think you could smoke in there so we didn't...for 2k it was a waste of money because of the service and the actual place...

The waitresses ALL expect a tip every time you order a drink, even a water...it is not mandatory to tip. These women get payed hourly plus tips which is more than most of us make. Excuse me if I want 3 oz of water for "free" while I'm loosing $900 on a slot machine all night...

The restaurants in here were super overpriced. $20 for a burger, $20 nachos, $18 drinks....

When my sister and her friends wanted to have fun for her 21st on the card tables they were very rude to her and her friends. They would stare at her I.D. For about 5 minutes, put it down and deal the cards to others until they got them verified. That took a total of 30 minutes! When they complained to the pit boss they didn't do anything about it. The dealers were really rude and wouldn't let them order any drinks or go anywhere... when they finally said okay you girls can play they didn't want to anymore and they left...what a waste!

The pool really sucked here and was super far. The pool had no scenery except a tram on top we could look at. The sun wasn't out and there were more kids than adults here splashing around us and being rude. The parents didn't say anything of course because parents are terrible now a days and don't discipline there children and let them control THEM! 

We go to checkout and they charged me for the wifi even though I payed the entire weekend and the resort fees. It includes 2 devices. It's just my girlfriend and I staying here. When I called the front desk to ask about the $14.99 charge for wifi he tried to make it seem like there was a 3rd device. I told him it was literally me and her and that's it, we didn't even have any friends come to our room.... he made me wait and then waived the charges and they just charged me for the resort fees.

Finally, we go to leave and I got my parking ticket and the valet guy is getting my car after our weekend. I told him thank you and he just stood there staring at me with his hand out...again, it is NOT mandatory to tip especially when it is not $18 per day to park. Again I said thank you...and he still stood at me and said "Thank you," "Thank you" "yeah...I heard you I heard you...thank you thank you" VERY RUDELY and stared me down as he walked to the next car and drove off staring me down....like come on. I didn't have any money on me because we had lost and they already drained the living soul out of us and now we are getting it from a valet guy that again makes decent money. IT IS NOT MANDATORY!!!!  

Bally's, I am sorry but I am NOT Staying here again. Even the casino machines are very Tight! They didn't even have a buffet here or a night club.... 

Perris next time for sure!

I have never written a review this long, but I feel like I owe it to anyone thinking of staying at Bally's Las Vegas to give my experience. Bally's, by far, was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. A group of cousins\/girlfriends and I stayed in the Bally's Indigo tower for a 5-day getaway and I was blown away at the negative experience we had. Our first encounter was at the front desk. We checked in with Carrie, who didn't even give us a welcome greeting.  She acted like we were bothering her. I was trying to excite her by telling her how excited we were for being in Vegas the very first time.  She was not moved, very dry and her tone was negative to the point that I asked to see a manger. She went to the back (pretending to go to the back, but she could still be seen) and returned saying he was in a meeting and would be there for several hours. We continued our check in, enduring her bothered tone. After a few moments, I had to ask her if she was mad. Her response, "No, I'm not mad are you mad!" At this point, I just continued with the check-in process for fear of being stuck in a crappy room. She told us where our room would be located and I asked if we could get a room with a view of the strip. She told us we had to pay $50\/night for an upgrade. We declined. When we stepped foot in the room (#638), I was expecting to see a room similar to the ones we saw on their website...FAR FROM IT! I entered the room and the stench smacked me in the face. It smelled old, musty and like there was mildew. And the view...the air conditioning unit! The carpet was old and stained. The furniture was dusty and worn. I was appalled. I saw the housekeeper in the hall and asked her to step in our room. Terry was extremely pleasant when she came in. She listened and too could notice a stench in in our room. She advised that the Jubilee Tower was updated and suggested we try to upgrade their.  Terry offered to clean our room more (she used bleach), but advised that if we were unhappy with the room, we could call the housekeeping manger. Whelp, that didn't work. I called for the housekeeping manger and was told that I had to speak to the housekeeping supervisor. So in comes Ginger. When I explained to her that I was unhappy with room and the fact that it was hard to breathe due to the mildew smell, she was only focused on the fact that Terry sprayed used bleach in the room. She totally missed the fact that the room was in dire need of deep cleaning and updating. In the end, Ginger stated there was nothing she could do. The next day when we asked Terry for fresh washcloths and towels everyday she was more than happy to oblige. Sometime later, we overheard a conversation between Terry and Ginger whereby Ginger told Terry not to supply clean washcloths and towels, to only clean out room. Terry advised her that we specifically requested fresh washcloths every day, but Ginger was insistent and told her no. I felt bad for the interaction between Terry and her supervisor, Ginger. In any event, when Terry came into our room, a call had to be made to housekeeping to order fresh washcloths and towels. 

I endured the next few days in disgust. I woke up with a headache every day. I was convinced there was something wrong with the air quality in the room. In addition, the lobby of the hotel was always smoky. I expected to smell some because smoking is allowed in the casino; however, I did not expect it to be that bad. We visited many other hotels while there which also had smoking in their lobby casinos and unless you were standing right next to the smoker, you couldn't smell the smoke. Again, probably and air quality issue. 

In the lobby of our floor, I kept saying that it smelled like urine. Well, well well. Would you believe that a homeless male was sleeping on the couch of our lobby at night? The first night we saw him, we thought he was passed out drunk. Nope! The second night we saw him, we leaned in a little closer and noticed he was filthy, carrying a few dirty bags and reeked of urine!

Finally, the food choices at Bally's Indigo Tower were very basic. Johnny Rockets, Sbarro, some Chinese stuff, Subway, a buffet and steak place. We hiked it over to Paris Hotel (connected to Bally's, and very beautiful, might I add) to enjoy much better selections. 

I hate that I booked Bally's and will never do so again. My first visit to Vegas was not what I expected, but we made the most of it outside of Bally's. Terry, the housekeeper, made our hotel stay as pleasant as she could, doing whatever she could. Ginger, on the other hand, should be reprimanded for entering my cousin's room, unannounced, and running out once she noticed someone was inside. Never again Bally's...never again!

Bally's is a great hotel for the value. It's right in the middle of the strip, it's nice, it's cheap and they even just renovated many of the rooms! It's connected to Paris and is a very short walk. You don't even have to leave the hotel\/casino since they have a connecting hallway. Their casino is large and has a lot of different slots and games. There's also a quick service food court and a couple of small restaurants. They're not the best, but again, Paris is just a short walk away where they have plenty of delicious sit down restaurants as well as a great quick service food court.

Be aware that all the hotels on the strip charge a resort fee of about $20-$30\/night. It's just another way for the hotel to add on more fees but every hotel on the strip is doing that now so you can't really escape it.

The staff is really friendly here and I've never had a problem with anything when I've stayed. I've been here about four times and every time it's been great. It's my go-to hotel on the strip when I'm looking for a quick last minute trip to Vegas since it's affordable yet nice at the same time. Other hotels like the Quad, Luxor and Excalibur definitely aren't as nice and\/or have awful locations.

If you're trying to do Vegas on a budget but still want to be in a great location in a nice hotel, Bally's is definitely the spot for you!

Bally's was the first hotel I ever stayed in Las Vegas when I was old enough to gamble. Being conjoined with Paris meant that as you walked inside and down the escalator from the parking lot into the main halls you were invited by Parisian facades and spectacle that is Vegas; however, it is classy and doesn't try to overwhelm you with senses. Instead the show element melded with just enough sophistication to give you luxury that didn't over- or underwhelm you.

Casino Floor Deco - 4

I still find their styling and design so refreshing and classical without looking too dated. Like a fine, middle grade wine, this casino floor is aging well. The ceilings are still clean. The tables are in good condition and the dress code for the dealers is still a classic look of dress shirts and vests. It's no Cosmopolitan, and truly nothing anywhere in Vegas is, but this isn't a budget casino.

Hotel Room Deco - 3

Walking into the hotel room and you can start to see how the years have taken a toll. For the most part the rooms are standard and I mean that in the most general way. From the dark wood stain to the set up of the TV cabinet and bed tables there is nothing fancy about it. It's a basic setup and it works well. Some of the wallpaper in the bathroom has seen better days and the bathing supplies given complimentary isn't necessarily the greatest either but the rooms work. Enough to keep you comfortable and also keep you out to enjoy the rest of Vegas.

Price - 3

The pricing for Bally's in my opinion is very fair. Because they are more of a middle range casino their prices will usually range in the lower side compared to places like the Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, and The Linq (all located in the periphery of Bally's). With such a great location Bally's really is a great place to call home base yet still get to see all Vegas has to offer around it for a budget price.

Casino - 4

By no means is Bally's the largest casino floor but it is all placed and located even through a floor that can be seen easily from the lobby. It has every game you might want and some you don't. It is a place where you can find your friends easily if you get lost and not such an eyesore where you want to seek refuge outside as soon as possible. For the most part the dealers are quite pleasant and if you get onto the right table you might have a nice conversation if nothing else.

Conclusion

Bally's will always have a place in my heart because of the wonderment it brought me when I first arrived to Vegas. With the easy transport from Bally's to Paris and the eye candy in between it really is a great casino to stay for any frugal traveler looking for a good room with enough money remained to paint the town.

Recently stayed here and I'll have to say this is probably my favorite hotel. It's cheap and has great location! Not to mention the monorail stops here so I can get anywhere on the strip faster! (and avoid the scorching heat)

It's not as nice as the bigger hotels like Palazzo, but hey you pay for what you get. And this is the best bang for the buck for anyone looking for a cheap place to stay. I had booked a promo for the south classic room. Did the $20 sandwich trick upon checking in and was upgraded to the North tower deluxe room for free (aside from the tip). The clerk checking me in told me it was "VIP" and had a great view of the strip... which I found he lied because all I saw was Flamingo's pools and a part of Caesar's. But I didnt' really care coz all I needed was better rooms than the south tower classics.

Room is pretty clean and cozy. Mine had a flat screen tv (I was expecting a tube tv). So I was really content with my room. This will be my place to stay from now on for regular Vegas trips. Save the 5* hotels for special occasions.

I've always wondered why this hotel is called Bally's. My mom said it's name after the famous shoe brand, who knows? When my mom told me we were going here I thought she meant the gym! Anyways rooms are okay, location is great! It's in the middle of the strip and it's really near the Miracle Mile formerly aladin hotel. This is where you can find tons of shopping like urban outfitters, guess etc. Its one of the older hotels so you shouldn't expect much! My view was of a parking garage but hey it's vegas! You want to spend the least amount of time possible in your room!
